1.content:
It was close to noon in a small suburb inside the busy streets of Rome. There was a certain calm in the air, one that would make any alert person uneasy. Greg, in traditional western clothing, walked out into the open and gazed upon the ten story building they had targeted. There did not seem to be anything out of the ordinary, however, his instincts were telling him otherwise. Inside the target building was a man named Sykes, whom they needed information from, and they were not about to let that man get away.

"Keep a sharp eye out, everyone." he said, through his ear piece radio. "I have a nagging feeling that we are not the only people working this side of the street."

Nearby, Jon, a tall, well built man in a black business suit, raised a hand to an ear piece radio of his own, having heard the transmission. "What the hell?"

"Did you hear that, Jon?" came a woman's voice.

"I did, Crystal." replied Jon, radioing back. "It's coming over the static, their frequency must be overlapping our own."

"That means they must be real close."

"Rodger that. Keep your eyes out. I don't want any surprises. Sykes won't get away this time." he turned to a small girl, standing next to him, holding a sniper rifle in her arms. "Kayo, get ready."

The girl looked up at Jon with a blank look in her eyes. "Yes, Jon." she said.

On the roof of another building, Heather, in western clothing, sat crouched down in front of a number of small flat panel screens on a folding rack rising from an expensive violin case. Each screen showed a parts of the surrounding area and key rooms inside their target building through cameras on small, mechanical flies, built by Mech.

"I... I'm nervous, Greg." she said, her voice wavering.

"Why?" asked Greg. "What do you see?"

"There has been a large increase of suit activity in the area and there is a heavy smell of gun oil in the air. I'm afraid we are not the only people after Sykes."

"Remain calm and keep an eye on them. If they get too close to your location, move to your alternate spot."

"Rodger that."

Inside a small government car, Crystal, a slender, well dressed woman with Italian features, listened to the children talk, taking notes, then turned to her radio. "Confirmed. This group is also after Sykes. What are your orders?"

"We wait for them to make their move. If they are successful, we simply surround them and take Sykes off their hands. You know the routine."

"Rodger that."

Standing in a nearby alley, Tex, also in western clothing, rolled his eyes and touched his radio. "We tracked this guy for weeks." he said, irritably. "I say we go for it now! Besides, that worm is holding a small girl hostage! Who knows what he's doing to her in there!"

Inside a black, full sized van, Sam, also in western clothing, frowned. "Relax, Tex." he said into his radio. "You'll get your chance to bust a few heads soon enough."

"We have to consider the suits." added Greg. "We can not afford a battle on two fronts, not now."

"And if they are after Sykes as well?" radioed Heather.

Greg gnawed his jaws in decision. "Tex, I want you to crash the party inside the target building. Make as much noise as you can and take Sykes. I will follow behind, handle anyone you miss, and rescue the girl. Sam you're our transport out, be ready. Heather, do you have a physical visual of the girl?"

"Yes, Greg."

"Keep an eye on her, tranquilize anyone who gets too close, understood?"

"Yes, Greg."

"Let's do this!"

Taking a deep breath, I placed the book down with a dream like smile on my face. "If only super heroes really existed in this world." I said to myself. "I wish I were one, it would solve a lot of my problems."

Little did I know that my wish was about to come true.

Which character am I?...
1.title: The story begins

11.content:
My name is Clem Rodgers. My friends call me Chem, because I'm so good with science. Well, what friends I have, that is. I tend to spend a lot of time by myself.

My dad wishes I would be more social. He also wishes I were less interested in science, and follow him into law and politics. You've probably never heard of David Rodgers. He's more of a behind-the-scenes player.

About the only one who can pull me out of my science studies is Rhea. When Mom and Dad adopted her, I thought she was an intruder in my perfect little world. As she grew out of diapers, though, she became more inquisitive, and I recognized a kindred spirit. She likes to watch me with my chemistry set, and I like to show her what I can do with it.

Of course, this isn't about my solitary nature, or my conflict with my dad. This is about the time my whole world turned upside-down.



I woke up feeling... weird. That's the best way I can describe it. There was no one thing that stuck out. It was like everything was off where it should have been.

I trudged to the bathroom, trying to figure out what was wrong. Was I sick? Did I just not get enough sleep?

When I reached the bathroom mirror, I realized what was wrong. It was me.

My whole body was... I can't really describe it.

I didn't know exactly what I was seeing in the mirror, but I knew what it wasn't. It wasn't human.
11.title: Clem Rodgers

113.content:
Looking in the mirror, I saw that I had what only could be describes as dog like features. My cheeks were hanging down off my face like that of a bull dog, my canine teeth were larger than normal, and all of my senses seemed more keen than ever. This caused a light chuckle to escape my lips as I had dreamed about dogs during the night.

"I must still be dreaming." I thought with a sleepy smile. then I said, "Bow wow, what a face! I think I'd rather be a cute little girl than look like this!"

Then, that weird feeling I experienced when I woke up returned and I watched in surprise as my reflection quickly changed to that of a cute young girl. Now wide awake, I slowly looked down at myself and discovered that it was not just my reflection that had changed. I had somehow become a beautiful female version of myself with clothing to match! As I looked at the mirror, dumbfounded, I found that I was also beginning to shrink quickly, my clothing shrinking and changing with it!"

"What... What's happening to me!?" I screamed hoarsely, my voice rising in octaves.

Within seconds, the shrinking stopped and I found myself to be around five years old, Rhea's age... That was when I finally screamed at the top of my lungs.
113.title: I thought it was a dream.

1132.content:
At the sound of my new voice, Mom came running. Seeing what I had become, she said, "Rhea? What's wrong, baby?"

"I-I'm not Rhea, Mom," I said. "I'm Clem."

"Clem?" She looked down the hall, where Rhea's room was. She probably saw Rhea coming out, because she suddenly believed me. "how did this happen?"

"I don't know," I replied. "I'd been dreaming of dogs, and, when I woke up, I had the face of a dog. Then, I wished I looked like a cute little girl instead, and I turned into this. Mom, what's happening to me?"
1132.title: Mom came running in.

11321.content:
Mom took a deep breath, then said, "Focus on yourself, Clem, the way you should look. Clear your mind of anything else, just who you are."

I did as Mom suggested. Soon, I was rewarded by the sensation of swelling. I could feel my body growing to its proper proportions. I didn't let that break my concentration, though, and I stayed focused on the way I was supposed to look.

Finally, Mom said, "There. That should do it."

I opened my eyes and looked to the mirror. There I was, in my pajamas, just like any other morning. "Mom," I asked, "how'd you know what to do to fix me?"

She took another deep breath. "I suppose there's no sense keeping this from you any longer," she said. "Your father and I... we're not from here."

"When did you guys move here?"

"That's not it, Clem. We're not from this planet. We come from a race of shapeshifters."

"You... you mean we're... aliens?"

She nodded. "We were once the rulers of our planet, until a revolution sent us into exile on this world. Once we felt we understood the customs well enough, we assumed the Rodgers identities."

"A-and Rhea?"

"We wanted another child. However, I didn't feel up to being pregnant again. Perhaps it was just me, but I found the experience terribly uncomfortable, and your father didn't want to trade identities.

"Clem, listen to me. We don't want Rhea to know any of this. When she's your age, we'll tell her she's adopted, but she must never know that she's the only human in the house."
11321.title: Mom knows

113211.content:
I put the lid down on the toilet and sat down. "Mom, I've got so many questions... I don't know how to ask them all."

She nodded. "I understand. For now, let's just cover some things you'll need to know about our abilities.

"You'll need to stay away from fire. The damage from a burn can restrict your shapeshifting. You'd recover, but it could take weeks or months, depending on the severity of the burn.

"Extreme cold can slow the metamorphosis. The effect isn't lasting, but you'll want to be aware of the temperature."

I nodded. "Anything else?"

"You'll need to keep your focus, even at times when a teenage boy isn't accustomed to focusing. You saw how quickly you changed at just a thought. You can imagine what might happen when you're at school, if you were to fantasize about one of your classmates."

I nodded. I know she's way out of my league, but I'd recently started fantasizing about Caitlin Spencer. I could just picture that getting out of control.

"I'll let you get back to your routine," Mom said, and left the bathroom.
113211.title: About shapeshifting

1132111.content:
"So, I'm really an alien born on Earth." I mussed in my thoughts, sitting on my bed. "I wonder what my 'true' form looks like."

I quickly shook the thought off as I began to feel my body shift again. "No, I don't want to know!" I whispered. the shifting sensation stopped and I took a breath. "I have to be careful what I say and think aloud until I can get this down."

The task seemed enormous, considering the slightest stray thought seemed to start the transformation process. I knew that the only way I was going to master such a power was with practice but I really did not want to be caught as someone else with my little sister running about. Of course I knew that she was adopted but the thought of her being the only human being in the family caused a tear to come to my eye.

"Poor Rhea, how do you break something like this to her?" I asked myself, whispering. "It will devastate her to know she's the only one who... who..."

I fell into tears for her, wondering how she would take the news. Only, unknown to me, she was listening from the hall and had heard every word I had said to myself. She rose a hand to her mouth, coming to her own conclusions then walked into my room, crying. I turned white, seeing her enter and watched as she slowly closed the door.

Clem." she said, tearfully. "Please tell me the truth..."
1132111.title: In my bedroom

11321112.content:
"Did something happen to you? And to Mommy and Daddy?"

That caught me completely off guard. "Wh-what do you mean, sis?"

"If..." She took a breath. "If I show you something,... will you promise not to tell anybody?"

"Sure," I said. "But what could you show me, that would be so terrible?"

She began to lead me to her room. "You know my pictures, that Mommy puts on the 'frigerator, right?"

"Of course I do. We all love them."

Her little face turned serious. "I started making them that way in kindergarten. After I saw how other kids draw." She took another deep breath. "I found out I see things different."

"What do you mean?"

She pulled some papers out from under her bed. "These are my secret pictures," she said. "It's how I really see things."

I started looking through the drawings. They looked the same as the others, except for one unusual feature: All the people were surrounded by different colors. Judging by the expressions Rhea drew, these color fields seemed to reflect their emotional states.

Then, I found some drawings of us. mom, Dad, and I had color fields, too, but ours were multicolored, in shapes that didn't quite match our bodies.

I suddenly realized what was going on: Rhea could see auras. And, since we were aliens, our auras were different from those of Earth people.

"Clem," she said, struggling not to cry, "what does it mean? How come I'm the only one who sees like this?"
11321112.title: did something happen to you?

113211122.content:
I sighed before knelling down to her level. "In rare cases, a family can have very special abilities." I told her. "In your case, you can see a person's aura which is their life energy, emotions, and strength."

Rhea's eyes widened as her young mind struggling to understand. "Do you, mom and dad have a power too?" she asked.

"Yes, we do." I replied. "Only, because powers like ours are so very rare, we are not allowed to tell anyone about it."

"Oh." said Rhea, looking confused. "Why?"

I sighed, smiling. "People fear what they do not understand." I said. "Just as you feared what you could see, because you did not understand it."

"Oh." said Rhea, slowly catching on. "So, I can't tell anyone?"

I chuckled. "Not anyone outside of this house." I said. "Mom and dad will understand but others might not."

"What's your power?" asked Rhea.

"I'm not allowed to tell you yet." i replied with a sad look. "That's why I was crying earlier, I did not think you had a power of your own, at least not yet."

Rhea rolled her eyes. "Because I'm too little, right?"

I laughed, gently roughing up her hair with my hand. "Right."

Rhea giggled. "Maybe, if I show mom what I can see, she'll tell me."

"Maybe." I agreed. "Just don't tell her I said anything, I'll be grounded for sure."

"I won't." promised Rhea. "Thank you for telling me, big brother."

She gave me a light peck on the cheek then ran off, giggling while I shook my head. "She's so innocent." I thought.
113211122.title: A half truth is better than a lie.

1132111222.content:
I turned on the TV and started watching, for something to do. I couldn't really get into the shows, though, because I had to be mindful of my body changing again. Someday, I hoped, maintaining my shape would be second nature, and I could enjoy myself again.

As I was watching, Mom knocked on my door. "May I come in?"

"Sure."

She stepped in, and closed the door behind her. "I've just gotten off the phone with your father," she said. "It looks like we'll be having that talk with Rhea sooner than we expected, and we'll be covering more ground."

"What do you mean?" I asked, hoping to sound innocent.

She sighed. "It turns out that Rhea can see auras. And that our auras aren't like those of Earth people."

"Do... do you think she knows about us?"

She shhok her head. "Right now, she only knows that we're different, and that she's different from everyone else. Clem, we're going to need you to talk to her, to reassure her that nothing bad is going to happen, either because we're here, or because she knows about us. You've been close to her for the past three years. She'll trust you."

"I'll try," I said. "I'm still trying to understand this. Like, what are we like, as a people? What's our real shape? And why did you choose to come here?"
1132111222.title: Mom talks to me later.

11321112221.content:
Mom took a deep breath. "To answer your last question first, we came to this planet because it is so remote, and because it's so technologically backward. They've only traveled as far as their own moon. I suspect it's their devotion to sectarian strife that has held them back. In any case, it's a low-profile world, such that, if the rebels decide to hunt us down, they probably wouldn't give this planet a second look.

"As for our traits beyond shapeshifting, we have limited contact with other worlds. They seem not to trust beings who can alter their shape to look like any other race. What contact we make is usually just studying other races."

I nodded. "And what do we look like?"

"I must warn you, Clem," she said, "our true form is quite unlike any that you have seen." With that, she began to shift.

Mom's real shape was... I can't describe it. It had tentacles, and eyestalks, and I can't guess what all else. It came in colors I had never before seen in nature. And yet, despite her alien shape, I still knew her as Mom.

"This," she said, "is the true appearance of Xandorians."

"Xandorians?"

"Don't try to pronounce it in human form, Clem. You don't have enough tongues to capture all the complexities."

I nodded. "And we're the only aliens on this world?"

"As far as we know. As I said, this isn't exactly a hot spot for interstellar travel." She returned to the shape I had always known. "Any other questions?"

"What are the limits of our shapeshifting?"

"You can assume any shape you can imagine. I should warn you, though, that shapes considerably larger or shorter than your natural shape can be quite stressful to mimic. I wouldn't recommend assuming those shapes for an extended period."

"Thanks, Mom."

"You're welcome, Clem." With that, she left my room.
11321112221.title: Answers

113211122211.content:
After mom left my room, I walked over to Rhea's room and knocked on the door. "Come in." came her response.

I opened the door, walked in, and closed the door behind me. "I'm allowed to tell you everything I know." I said to her wonder and delight. "You still can't tell anyone else, though."

"I know." said Rhea, somewhat disappointed. "Mom said people who can see strange things are thought to be strange."

I chuckled at that. "Well, she's right." I replied. "You see, my gift is the ability to look like someone else."

"Someone... else?" asked Rhea, confused.

I nodded then changed into a female version of myself, with tight blue jeans and tube top. Rhea's jaw dropped, seeing the new me but giggled as I said, "I know I am pretty but please... do not stare."

"You are pretty as a girl." she said, still giggling. "Can you be a little girl?"

"Not without causing myself a lot of stress." I answered, remaining a girl. "I'm still trying to master this gift."

"Why can't I change myself into other people?" asked Rhea.

I changed myself back, sighing. "Just as other people look different, they have different gifts." I told her. "Mom and dad have a gift like mine, only far more powerful." I paused, thinking. "You're still very young, your power is still developing, who knows what gifts may blossom in the future."

Rhea looked at me for a moment. "Is there something you aren't telling me?" she asked.

I nodded. "There is." I replied, sadly. "Two things, actually. One, our family is from another world." I transformed into the being mom had showed me, only in my own size, then returned to normal. "Two, you were born on Earth."

Rhea teared up and I quickly hugged her. "It was a shock to me too but nothing will change the fact you are my sister and I won''t trade you for anything in the world." I said, holding her tight. "You are Rhea Rodgers."

"Were you born on another world?" asked Rhea. "What was it like?"

Knowing that Rhea had completely misunderstood what I was trying to say, I shook my head. "I don't know, I was born on this planet too." I said. "You were... (gulp) adopted. We don't know what happened to your birth parents."

Rhea's jaw dropped as tears began to fall. "I was... adopted?" she asked.

I slowly nodded. "Yeah, like I said, it was all a shock to me too."

Rhea looked at me for a moment, then...
113211122211.title: Talking to Rhea

1132111222112.content:
... sighed. "Y-you really think I'm as good as a real sister?"

"You are a real sister," I told her. "You were just born to somebody else, is all. It doesn't matter to me, or Mom and Dad, where you came from."

"Thanks." She kissed me on the cheek, then said, "Can you change into people for me, again?"

I figured that it might help to cheer her up, so I agreed. "Who would you like to see?"

i spent the next several minutes shifting shape into whoever Rhea asked me to be. Once her mood improved, she really let her imagination run wild.

After a while, I had to beg off. "This is wearing me out. I need to rest." Back in my usual shape, I sat down and asked, "Which was your favorite?"

"I liked Squirrel Girl," she replied. "But Tobi likes Spongebob."

"Who's Tobi?"

"My friend."

I wondered how this Tobi could have seen me. "I don't think I've met Tobi."

"She lives in my tummy."

"Oh." An imaginary friend, I thought. "Well, I'm pretty beat from all that changing, so I'm going to bed. Say good night to Tobi for me."

"G'night, Clem."
1132111222112.title: sighed.

11321112221121.content:
That night, I could not sleep, worried about Rhea. "I hope she takes all of this well." I whispered to myself. "It's hard to hear that your in a family of royal aliens but to hear that you were adopted." I sighed. "I should check up on her."

"She's fine." came a girl's voice in my head. "She's talking to her other mommy now."

"What!?" falling from my bed, I asked. I was on my feet in the next breath. "Who's there!?"

Not hearing a response, I charged from my room with my heart in my throat and burst into Rhea's room to find her sitting on her bed, talking to herself. She paused, seeing me run into the room. "Clem!?" she asked, startled. "What's wrong!?"

Seeing no one, I sighed. "A little bird told me you were talking to your 'other' mom." I explained. "Don't ask."

Rhea sighed, looking at her tummy. "Tobi, you didn't!" she accused. she paused as it listening. "Yeah, I know he's worried but did you have to tattle on me?"

"Rhea wanted to know if there was a way to talk to her other mommy." came the girl's voice in my head. "I didn't want to lie to her. My name is Tobi, I (giggle) live in her tummy."

"Who are you?" I demanded, thinking this time.

"My mommy tells me that she and I are like your mommy and daddy." replied Tobi. "Only from another place."

"An alien!?" I thought, startled. then I sighed. "You're an alien child."

"That is correct, Mr. Rodgers." came a more adult female voice. "I am Andromeda, Tobi is my daughter. I live inside her biological mother. However, she is yet unaware of my presence."

That became too much for me and I...
11321112221121.title: That night

113211122211212.content:
"Okay, exactly how did your daughter get inside my little sister?" falling into the 'protective brother' role, I demanded.

Andromeda giggled. "Easy, Mr. Rodgers." calmly, she said. "We are a symbiotic race, we live inside others, granting special abilities in exchange for 'room and board'. In Rhea's case, she has the ability to see what can not bee seen."

"A person's aura." thinking back, I said. "Not much of a power."

"Rhea is also very young." patiently, Andromeda reminded me. "So is Tobi as they were born together, both are just now discovering all they can do, which will grow with time."

"I don't know how my parents are going to react to this one." speaking out loud, I said. "Did you know my parents are from another world?"

"We know of them and their world." came Andromeda's reply. "Only, we have not yet... introduced ourselves to each other as both of our worlds were in turmoil."

"I was told about the turmoil on my parents' home world, what of yours?" curious, I asked.

"Our original hosts, on our world, became power hungry and began to see us as slaves to their bodies." with a hint of sadness, Andromeda explained. "We fled the planet after a brief revolution." she paused. "I'm sorry, I can not maintain this link much longer as it is very tiring. Have I answered your questions?"

Although I had a million questions, I decided it best not to push anything. "Yes, thank you." softly, I said. "Rest well."

With that, the voices fell silent and Rhea yawned. "Tobi is tired." rubbing her eyes, she said. "So am I."

"Then back to bed with you." urging Rhea under the covers, I said. "We'll talk about this more in the morning."

Rhea was quickly fast asleep. I watched her for a few moments, wondering what to do then returned to bed myself.
That morning...
113211122211212.title: demanded answers.

1132111222112122.content:
I decided it best not to put any more stress onto Rhea than needed and keep her 'imaginary' friend a secret from mom and dad for the time being until I could find a way to break it to them gently. "The intricate web we weave." whispering to myself, I said. "First, I learn that mom and dad are of a royal family from another world, making me an Earth born alien then I hear that Rhea was adopted." I chuckled, shaking my head and added, "On top of that, I learned last night that Rhea has an alien child inside of her whose mother is inside her birth mother."

It was a lot to process and I was uncertain what to do. "I have the power to become anyone and possibly anything." talking to myself, I said. "With practice, I'm surer I could do a lot of good for this town." then I shivered, remembering mom's first talk about my powers. "Mom that she and dad were forced from their world by some type of revolution. That means that they have enemies who could track them here."

I paused at the window and froze, seeing a black van, parked in front of our house. I have never seen it before but that was not what had set off the alarms in my head. The driver, a blurry man in a dark business suit was watching the house with a pair of binoculars! My mind went into overdrive, wondering who they were what they wanted. Apparently, he saw me staring back at him as he lowered his binoculars and turned away as the driver sent the van speeding away. As I watched the van leave, I felt a cold chill run down my spine. "They'll be back." shivering, I muttered. "When they do, I doubt they will be alone." I swallowed hard. "I better tell mom and dad."

With that, I ran into Rhea's room to find...
1132111222112122.title: I keep 'Tobi' a secret.

11321112221121222.content:
... she was sleeping peacefully, clutching her teddy bear. Sleep tight, sis, I thought, then headed for Mom and Dad's room.

Even asleep, Mom and Dad looked like normal people. I filed this information, since I never knew if or when it might be useful, then shook Dad awake. "Huh? Wha... Clem, what is it?"

"I saw somebody watching the house," I replied. I told him everything I'd just seen. By the time I finished, Mom was awake, as well. "Do you think it could be some enemies from before, come to get us?"

"Hard to say," Dad said. "I'd better call to have our security system beefed up, just in case."

Our security was pretty tight already, with Dad regularly holding drills to keep us all on our toes. Of course, if this was the action of hostile aliens, part of me wondered if even the best the security company could provide would be enough.
11321112221121222.title: She was sleeping peacefully.

113211122211212221.content:
That morning, I woke up feeling cold everywhere on my body. Being half awake, I did not take much notice and decided to take a hot shower to warm up. My thoughts were still on the black van I saw outside my house and the bad feeling I got seeing the man with the binoculars. "Maybe I can talk to Caitlin Spencer." thinking out loud, I said. "She must have a great security system in her house." sighing, I added, "If only she would notice me, I really like her."

I started the water and, once it was to a likable temperature, stepped in to a surprise that made me fully awake as I tried to wash my hair. I had no hair to wash, I was completely bald! "What the hell!?" screaming, I asked.

I jumped out of the shower and looked at the mirror in horror. I had no hair anywhere on my body, I looked just like a store mannequin, fresh out of the factory. Before I could rationally react, a wall shaking scream echoed from my throat. "Wha-What happened!?" I screamed, looking at myself. "How!? Why!?"

Then, an urgent knock came to my door and I heard a voice on the other side. "Clem, are you alright in there!?"

Who was it?
113211122211212221.title: Something is missing.

1132111222112122211.content:
Wrapping a towel around myself, I opened the door and let mom in before closing it again. "I'm bald mom!" distraught, I wailed to her. "I have no hair... anywhere!"

"You shape sifted for Rhea last night, didn't you." giggled mom.

"Well, yeah." confused, I replied. "What does that have to do with..."

"Your power has taken root." explaining, mom said, interrupting you. "Our human form is completely bald so we can more easily take on other forms." she showed me her bald form then changed it back to 'normal'. "You will learn how to keep hair on your head with a little practice and soon be able to hold it, even in your sleep."

"Until then, I might as well be a mannequin at the local mall." pouting, I said.

"They are hiring." teasing, mom replied. she then turned serious. "This is just a natural part of your development, call it a form of puberty."

"Alien puberty." muttering, I said. "Terrific."

Mom giggled. "It's not so bad, I'll help you learn how to make hair appear onto your body." hugging me, she said. "Take your shower then come down for breakfast. Having no hair is not the end of the world."

I sighed as mom left. "I can already hear Rhea laughing at me."
1132111222112122211.title: Alien puberty.

11321112221121222111.content:
I came down to breakfast a few minutes later to find dad and Rhea sitting at the table. Dad was talking on the telephone while sipping on a cup of coffee while Rhea was happily munching on her cold cereal until I entered. Dad looked up and smiled, knowing what I was going through while Rhea dropped her spoon in shock. "Clem! What happened!?" stunned, she asked. "You're bald!"

"Thank you, 'Captain Obvious'." sarcastically, I replied. "I'm apparently going through an alien puberty."

Rhea looked at me, lost. "Huh?"

Mom giggled. "When 'we' reach a certain age, we lose all our hair, dear." explaining, she said. "Your father and I have learned to make hair appear." she showed Rhea her bald form then changed back. "Now it's Clem's turn."

"Is that going to happen to me?" worried, Rhea asked.

Mom shook her head. "No, dear." giggling, she said. "Humans go through something else at that age but I'll talk to you about that when you get older."

"Always when I'm older." pouting, Rhea said.

Dad smiled while mom again giggled. "You will survive." she said. "Clem had to wait to learn many things as well."

Rhea sighed then turned to me and giggled. "You're going to need a wig, I have one from Halloween you can borrow, if you want."

"No thanks." smiling, I replied. "I don't want to have long blond hair."

"I will be helping him learn to grow his own hair, Rhea." smiling, she said. "Your offer is appreciated."

Rhea smiled then happily returned to eating her cereal. "I had a strange dream last night." she said, after finishing.

"Oh, you did?" asked dad, ending his call. "What about?"

Rhea took a breath. "It started with..."
11321112221121222111.title: Breakfast.

113211122211212221112.content:
"I dreamed I was a princess," she said, "like Cinderella. And I lived in a huge castle."

"Sounds good so far," Dad said. He had always called Rhea his "little princess".

"Only, I was scared," she continued, "'cause there were these men from another kingdom, and they wanted to take me away."

I started to get uncomfortable, because this sounded a lot like what happened last night, but I didn't show it.

"Did they get in?" Mom asked.

Rhea shook her head. "Also, there were these trolls, and they were looking for me, too."

"Well," Dad said, "maybe the trolls got into a fight with the men who wanted to take you away, and that solved both problems."

"Maybe." Rhea went back to eating breakfast.

I started to worry. If this dream was anything like what I'd seen, who were the men who wanted to take her away? And who were the trolls? Would they, as Dad suggested, fight each other? And what would happen to anyone caught in the crossfire?
113211122211212221112.title: A princess in a castle.

1132111222112122211121.content:
After breakfast, mom pulled me aside. "Growing hair is as easy as transforming your body." smiling, she said. "Just picture yourself the way you were before you lost your hair and it will come." she giggled. "Mind you, it will take some practice as seeing a girl with long hair may cause your hair to grow too."

"Let me guess, a hormonal response?" rolling my eyes, I asked.

Mom laughed. "No, lack of concentration but it does get easier with time." amused, she replied. "Once you are able to always picture yourself with hair, you will be able to hold it without effort but it does take practice so I suggest you wear a wig for a while."

You sighed, "Do you have one for me?" hopeful, I asked.

Mom nodded. "I made it out of the clippings when I gave you haircuts over the years." smiling, she replied. "Don't be too shocked, what do you think hair salons do with hair clippings, they sell them to wig manufacturers."

With that, mom escorted me to her bedroom and took a wig out of a box from her closet. "You only need to wear it until you are able to produce your own." handing it to me, she said. "You will also need fake eyelashes but don't worry, I've cut them down so they will look natural on a boy."

I nodded, understanding then asked, "What next?"

"You need to get to the mall and buy a few things for yourself." seriously, mom said. "Puberty for us can be rough. With no hair, your skin is going to be sensitive so you will need to get clothing of a lighter material than thick cotton such as silk or fine cotton."

I pouted, hearing that. "Any other surprises I should know about?" I asked.

Mom grinned. "They wouldn't be surprises if I told you."

"Great...."

Mom placed a light hand onto my cheek. "Keep your thoughts silent." looking at me, she said. "Your impulses will be getting stronger for a while as hormones begin to run rampant through you."

"I'll be at the mall, mom." sighing, I said. then I thought, "Caitlin will never date me, looking like this."

I had a big crush on Caitlin Spencer, the rich girl in town. It was not because of her money, we had plenty of our own to be considered very well off. It was because I saw something in her no one else seemed to notice, she had a good heart but it was fortified. I imagined myself scaling the walls and rescuing the fair maiden from her self imprisonment.

"Have fun, dear." said mom.
1132111222112122211121.title: Lessons in hair-growing

11321112221121222111211.content:
Just as I was about to walk out, mom took a hold of my arm. "Do you intend to go to the mall completely bald?" giggling, she asked. "Let me help you get ready first."

Blushing, I allowed mom to guide me to her vanity where she urged me to sit down. "Will this take too long?" blushing, I asked. "If I have to do this before school, I'll have to get up earlier just to get ready."

"Welcome to my world, dear." smiling, mom replied. "Girls and women need to prep and pamper before going out, this is but a taste of what we go through." she giggled. "Once you learn to control your power, you could try the life of a teenage girl too."

"Don't give Rhea any ideas." rolling my eyes, I said. "Boys have a rough time too."

"A discussion for another time." fitting the wig onto me, mom said. "I'll glue the first eyelash onto you but you'll need to do the other so you can learn how and do it yourself tomorrow."

Mom placed a tiny amount of glue onto the fake eyelash, cut down to fit a boy then secured it in the proper place then instructed me as I did the other, praying not to get any glue in my eye. Once that was done, mom handed me a recent news clipping. "What's this?" curious, I asked.

"Just recently, a brand of body wash named Plutonium was stripped from the shelves as it washed all the hair off people's bodies, making their skin as smooth as silk." looking amused, mom said. "It's your cover story for loosing all your hair."

"Thanks, mom." taking the news clipping, I said. "It's not going to tone down the teasing though."

"Let them tease you." lightly patting my head, mom said. "How often does a boy learn he's an Earth born alien?"

I smiled at that. "Can I go?"

"Sure, dear." allowing me up, mom said. "Have fun."

Twenty minutes later, I found myself at Our Founders Mall near the center of the city, rummaging through the men's clothing department, searching for items that were made of soft material. The clothing you were wearing felt like sandpaper against your skin, making you very uncomfortable. "Mom was not joking when she said my skin would be very sensitive during this... puberty." wincing, I whispered. "At least the wig I'm wearing is comfortable."

Unfortunately, I found nothing that was made of silk, satin, or fine cotton. Frustrated, I looked over at the women's section but cringed at the thought of wearing girls' clothing to school. Still, the clothing I had on was torture to my now sensitive skin. Finally, I decided to...
11321112221121222111211.title: At the mall.

113211122211212221112112.content:
"I have to find something that doesn't feel like sandpaper against my skin." feeling nervous, I whispered. "These clothes I'm wearing now are driving me crazy!"

Albeit reluctantly, I walked into the teen girls clothing department and began to look through the clothes when a young female sales clerk approached me. "May I help you find something?" politely, she asked.

"I've developed a... condition." sighing, I said, turning around. "This body wash called 'Plutonium' effected me."

The girl gasped, seeing my smooth legs, as I was wearing shorts, and gave me a sad nod. "One of our workers here was effected by that stuff too." wincing, she said. "Your skin has become real sensitive, I take it."

I nodded and the girl smiled. "You came to the right place." assuring me, she said. "My name is Tracy Flynn, we have a fine line of gender neutral clothing made from silk, satin, and fine cotton for people with sensitive skin." she glanced at my wig, wincing. "You washed your hair with that stuff too?"

I teared up, answering her question. "My coworker lost all her hair too." touching my hand, she said. "I think she's off today, otherwise, I'd introduce you to her."

Tracey then led me to another section of the girls clothing department and began pointing out a number of shirts, shorts, and briefs. "Believe it or not, these briefs are bough by boys and girls alike." blushing, she said. "The gender lines are more blurred than in our parent's day."

I nodded in agreement then took a few pairs, adding them to the cart. I avoided any feminine colors though as I then moved on to the shirts, shorts, and pants as Tracey helped me find the style I was looking for. During this time, I introduced myself and my hope to gain Caitlin Spencer's attention, even though I was now hairless for the time being. In all, we spent three hours, putting together a small wardrobe for me. "Thank you for your help, Tracey." smiling, I said. "I would have been shopping forever otherwise."

Tracey giggled. "It was my pleasure, Clem." smiling, she said. "Good luck with your crush."

I blushed at that then handed Tracey a hundred dollar bill from my wallet. "For your services." handing it to her, I said.

Tracey smiled, accepting the tip. "Thank you."

"Thank you." smiling, I replied.

I then walked towards the front of the store to purchase my selections. Unknown to me, Tracey sighed. "He and Cait would make such a great couple." with a dreamy smile, she said. getting an idea she chased after mew. "Hey, wait!"

"What's up?" turning to her, I asked.

"The store is looking for people to stand in as living mannequins." quickly, she whispered. "Its good pay and I can introduce you to that coworker I told you about."

"I only have eyes for Caitlin right now." slightly annoyed, I replied.

Then Tracey smiled and it hit me. "She's that coworker you told me about!?" shocked, I whispered.

Tracey nodded. "You just didn't hear it from me, okay." whispering, she said. "If you're interested in the job, come in the afternoon and take the 5:00 bus home, she normally rides that bus so to give her chauffeur a break."

With that, she left and a grin slowly began to form. "Maybe...." whispering, I said. "Maybe I have a chance."

That night, I made the call and arranged an interview at Macy's. The next day, I walked into Macy's and informed the customer service rep that I was there for my job interview. I was taken to a rear office where I waited for about five minutes before the manager I had spoken to over the phone, Mrs. Rachel Waite, walked in with a folder of paperwork and sat down across from me. "Good afternoon, Mr. Clem Rodgers." she said politely. "I'm curious as to why the boy of such a well off family is interested applying for a job with our company as a living mannequin."

"To help my broken self esteem." tearing up, I replied, removing my wig.

Rachel gasped, even though she saw it before. "What happened!?"

I took the newspaper clipping from my chest pocket and handed it to her. "A new body wash named 'Plutonium' was stripped from the shelves, leaving many people with all their body hair permanently removed." looking at Rachel, I said, sadly. "I used it and this was the result."

Rachel gently touched my head then pulled back, whispering, "Nearly flawless, just like..." she stopped talking.

"I- I'm sorry?" not hearing her, I asked.

"Your skin is nearly flawless." complimenting me, Rachel said. "Do you think you can stand perfectly still for four hours at a time, between breaks?"

"I'll give it my best try, ma'am." I replied. "Dad wants me to get a job to 'learn responsibility' and since my sister and I am currently being home schooled, I can think of no better job..." I chuckled, adding, "given my current condition."

Rachel giggled at my remark. "I think you will do nicely, Mr. Rodgers." she said. "We will start you out in the men's swim wear department."

I blushed slightly at that. "Swim wear?" I asked.

Rachel nodded. "What better place to rebuild your confidence than to have people stare at you, wearing noting but a fashionable pair of swim trunks?" she asked, smiling. "I could have placed you in the underwear section."

I smiled, my tension falling, seeing her humor, unaware she was thinking about placing me with another living mannequin in the women's department. "I accept your offer, ma'am." I said, offering my hand. "When do I start?"

"You start next week but I need written proof that you are being home schooled." she said, shaking my hand. "That will give you some time to prepare as I would like you to stand without your wig, to make you more like a true mannequin." pausing, releasing me, she added. "I just need you to fill out some paper work and then you will be free to go." she handed me the paperwork and quietly left the office.

"You got the job!?" after calling her, asked mom. "Congratulations!"

"Thanks mom." blushing, I said. "I told my boss I was being home schooled..."

I winced, expecting the riot act but I was surprised when mom sighed. "Well, its the truth, dear." with a sense of sadness, she said. "We can't risk allowing you and Rhea go to a public school, not with the possibility of our enemies searching for us." there was a pause. "Your dad and I had a fight over you getting that job so be thankful I won that argument for you."

"Thanks mom." seeing the bus coming, I said. "I'm getting on the bus now, I'll talk to you later, bye."

Looking at my watch, I frowned, seeing that it was only 4:00. "Oh well, I'm still nervous about talking to her." sighing, I thought. "Maybe I'll build more courage as a work in the men's clothing department."

With that, I stepped onto the bus....
113211122211212221112112.title: Revolation and a job.

1132111222112122211121121.content:
As I took a seat on the bus, I saw Caitlin Spencer boarding as well. I could only guess that she got off work early and was heading home as I was. "Holy cow, she's coming on the bus! How did this happen!?" panicking, I thought. "Calm down, Clem. It's not like she's going to talk to you."

To my surprise, Caitlin walked up to where I was sitting, and took an empty seat. "Hi, Clem."

My mind was racing as well as my heart only I remembered mom's friendly warning. "Keep your thoughts silent. Your impulses will be getting stronger for a while as hormones begin to run rampant through you."

"Hi, uh, hi," I sputtered. "What, uh what brings you here?"

"Heading home," Cait replied. "I picked up a job here, for after school and weekends. You?"

"Oh," I said, holding back my inner cheers. "I was just hanging out." I settled back into my seat, trying to keep silent so not to embarrass myself. Only I could not help think, "She talked to me! She actually talked to me!"

I was pleased that she talked to me and that, working in the same store may open the door for us to meet more often, I hid a smile, picturing us going out together. With us having the same condition, though mine was 'alien puberty', we might hit off... she might even let me kiss her. Still, would she admit to having such a condition and if she discovered mine, would she still like a guy who's a full bodied 'baldy'?

My thoughts were interrupted by the jolt of the bus moving forward and I sighed, wondering if I have a chance.

*Caitlin's point of view: http://www.writing.com/main/interact/ite...
1132111222112122211121121.title: Meeting Caitlin Spencer.

11321112221121222111211211.content:
When I got back home, Mom and Dad asked, "How'd it go?"

"Pretty good," I said. "There's a girl there with the same condition I'm supposed to have. They're thinking of putting us in a display together."

"Be careful, son," Dad cautioned. "With things the way they are, it might not be a good idea to get too involved."

"More realistically," Mom added, "you must remember to keep your focus. If your attention were to wander, it would reveal our secret, to her and to who knows how many others."

"I'll try, Mom," I assured them.

I went up to my room. As I walked in, I saw Rhea looking through some of my old pictures. "Can I help you?"

"Hi, Clem," she said. "Mom said it'd be okay if I looked at some of your things."

"Well, I suppose. Those are all pictures from when I was younger, some from before you were born."

She pointed to one picture. "How come your friend's dressed like a boy?"

I looked. It was a picture of me, Garth, and Gary. "No, we're all guys in that picture."

"Nuh-uh," she said, pointing at Gary. "She's a girl."

That took me by surprise. I still remembered the day when Gary told me he wanted to be called Alyssa from now on. I guess you could say I took it badly. We eventually returned to being able to say hi to each other, but I think I still half-suspected that it was just some kind of phase, that Gary would come by, after getting a haircut, and laugh about that crazy idea.

Rhea, though, with her special sight, looked at that picture, and saw the girl that Alyssa said she was at heart.

I felt even more uncomfortable about Mom's occasional suggestions that I give girlhood a try. Because I was an alien, I could do on a whim what Lyssa could only dream about.
11321112221121222111211211.title: Returning home.

113211122211212221112112111.content:
"His name is Gary." slightly shaken, I said. "A while ago, he told me he wanted to be called Alyssa from now on but he was definitely a boy then."

"He might have been a boy before," standing up, Rhea said. "but she's a girl now." she teared up. "Why don't you believe me, Clem?"

I sighed before placing a hand onto her shoulder. "I believe you." trying to be comforting, I said. "It's just that I can not see what you can see, its a talent only you have."

"I can prove she's a girl." stomping her foot, Rhea said. suddenly, a small stack of papers appeared in her hand and she offered them to me. "See for yourself, smarty pants!"

Gulping, I took the papers and quickly realized they were Alyssa's medical papers. "Rhea, how did you get these!?" startled, I demanded. "Don't you know its against the law to take other people's medical reports!"

"No one will know." pouting, Rhea said. "Tobi told me how to do it."

"Well you tell Tobi that its not okay to do that." sternly, I said. "I shouldn't be looking at these but I know you won't stop until I do."

Seeing Rhea starting to cry, I sighed and opened the file. Only I was completely stunned by what I had found inside. There was a report by Dr Sarah Hal that briefly described 'Alyssa's' slow transformation into a true girl with a confusing side report about an unusual gift involving incredible speed.

"In a swift and remarkable transformation, Gary 'Alyssa' Vance became a fully functional girl." reading part of the report, I said. "This included her first menstrual cycle, due to a curious ancestry that has also blessed her with a power of remarkable speed..."

I closed the file, turning pale then turned to Rhea, who was smiling. "I told you she was a girl." with a satisfied tone, she said. "Tobi wants me to put the papers back."

I handed Rhea the papers and they vanished from her hands before she slumped over into my arms. "Easy, Rhea!" concerned, I said. "Are you alright?"

"Why am I so tired?" confused, Rhea asked.

"Maybe because you';re not used to making things appear from elsewhere." guessing, I said. "I wouldn't do that again for a while."

"Are- Are you going to tell on me?" worried, Rhea asked.

"As long as you don't try anything new without me or mom and dad around." hugging her, I replied. "We don't want you making yourself sick."

Rhea then giggled, looking at me. "Mom said you can be a girl, if you wanted to." smiling, she said. "Why don't you try it for a while?"

I smiled, thinking I knew the answer. "I don't have any girls clothing to wear." shrugging, I said. "Otherwise, I'd give it a try, just for the experience."

A sly smile from Rhea told me that I had fallen into her trap. "Mom bought girls' clothes for the occasion." giggling, she replied. "I'll run and tell her you want to try being a girl."

"Hook, line, and sinker." shaking my head, I thought. "You are in no condition to run anywhere, sis." looking at her, I said. "You are going to bed for now."

"You're no (yawn) You're no fun, Clem." sleepily, Rhea protested.

"Later, okay?" picking her up, I said. "You've had a busy day."

With that, I put her to bed and watched her quickly fall asleep before leaving her to her rest. Later on, though, Rhea told mom, as she had said she would. Before I knew it, I found myself a teen girl, wearing a skirt and top as I took Rhea to the mall.
113211122211212221112112111.title: Continue

1132111222112122211121121112.content:
I felt very vulnerable and uncomfortable in my new form, walking through the mall. I could feel a draft on my new nether regions, which, to put it mildly, was a new experience. The light makeup on my face was still making me blush though it did take away any thoughts that Rhea may take me to a beauty salon. Rhea, of course, was loving the experience of having a big sister but she was also sensitive to my feelings.

"Are you okay, Dorothy?" using my female name, she asked. "I-If you really don't want to do this..."

"It's okay, Rhea." unaccustomed to my new voice, I said. "It's just very different from what I'm used to." I then smiled, adding, "Imagine yourself suddenly turned into a guy."

Rhea made a face. "Ewww!"

That made me giggle, surprising myself, as it was a delightful sound to my male mind. "I hope we don't bump into any guys I know ." worried, I thought. "I don't need anyone hitting on me."

"Maybe if we grab a snack first, you'll feel better." suggesting, Rhea said. "Being a girl is not bad. You get to wear pretty clothes, paint your face, wear sweet scents..."

I smiled at Rhea's innocent attempt to comfort me. "I promised to give being a girl a try and I am." kindly, I said. "It's just not who I am." I touched her shoulder. "Yes, a snack sounds good."

Rhea giggled then took me by the hand to drag me into the food court. I was smiling with her until I saw Caitlin on the far side of the court. I felt my heart race, wondering if she would recognize me. Only those thoughts were interrupted by the sounds of gun fire. Rhea and I both screamed to the sounds as the skylight shattered from the gun fire but I managed to keep my head and saw the shards of glass falling from the high ceiling. "Rhea, look out!" shouting, I cried.

I pulled my sister out of the way, just as the rain of glass came crashing down and quickly changed shape, not caring if anyone saw us as I was only thinking of Rhea's safety. My body shifted and contorted in a blur, making myself a box shape with Rhea screaming unheard inside. I could hear the people screaming around me as the gunfire continuing.

"Make it stop!" screaming, Rhea pleaded. "Dorothy, please!"

"You're safe, Rhea." my echoing voice assuring her, I said. "I won't let anything hurt you."

Suddenly, just as the gunfire started, it stopped and I heard Rhea whispering to herself. "Who are you?" quietly, she asked. "Why are you doing this?" she paused, as if to listen then she sternly said, "You leave the boy alone or I'll have my big sister come after you!"

"Who are you talking to?" curious, my voice asked.

"The boy with the guns out there has a mean voice in his head." frowning, Rhea said. "I told the voice to leave him alone or I'd have you go after him." she then proudly smiled. "That made it shut up... no one messes with my big sister."

Then, I heard the sound of something being dropped to the floor and took the chance to change back to my female human form to see the police drag the boy away. I sighed then turned to Rhea. "Good work, sis." smiling, I said.

Rhea blushed. "I just talked to the voice in his head." looking at me, she said. "Three other girls talked to the boy, he was hard to reach with that big meanie yelling at him to hurt everybody."

I turned to see Caitlin leaving with some kids I knew from school and breathed a sigh of relief, not knowing that my move had attracted some unwanted attention. "Well, that was exciting." joking, I said to Rhea. "Let's grab a snack, I really hungry right now."

"At least you're coming out of the box." smiling at me, Rhea said.

"Very funny, sis." giggling, I said.

Unknown to us, two men were watching us. "Who are they?" asked one. "We have no records of them."

"There are millions of people with unique abilities in this world." calmly, the other stated. "We have no chance of securing the children of the original group but we may be able to isolate these two."

With that, he took up a telephone and dialed a number. "Sir, we have located some raw talent..."

"Remain focused on your task." came a deep response. the line then went dead.
1132111222112122211121121112.title: Mall Madness.

choices: try to leave the mall now.
11321112221121222111211211121.content:
Rhea nor I were aware of the two men watching us but Rhea had a unique gift to see what others did not and urgently tugged on my skirt. "I got a bad feeling, Dorothy." shaking again, Rhea said. "We should get out here."

"I know you're scared, Rhea." shaking myself, I said. "I'm a little rattled too but its over, the boy surrendered peacefully and is now with the police."

"It's not that." shaking her head, Rhea said. "We should go... now, please."

I nodded and quickly lead Rhea out of the mall. I was not in the mood to argue with her and it did get me away from shopping for girls' clothing. "Think we should go home?" turning to Rhea, I asked.

Rhea sighed, seeing a limousine, speeding out of the parking lot. "I think we should have gone with them." frowning, she thought. then she said. "Yeah... we can shop tomorrow, its Saturday."

"With school starting on Monday." sighing, I said. "Okay, we'll head home."

As I reached for my cellphone to call for a ride home, Rhea screamed, "Look out!"

On instinct alone, I spun out of the way to avoid a blow from the butt of a gun to face two men in black business suits. My first thought was that they were my family's enemies from their home world but I managed to keep my head. It did not matter who they were, their intention was clear, top take Rhea and I by force. "Rhea, run!" screaming, I said.

Panicked, Rhea hesitated and I was forced to grab her arm, running instead of fighting. "I told you to run!" scolding her, I said, panting. "Listen to me every now and then!"

"I- I couldn't leave you!" wailing, Rhea said. "What if they hurt you!?"

"Forget it." quickly, I said. "We have to find a place to hide."

Getting an idea, I took a glace back to see the men far behind but taking pursuit and pushed Rhea towards a large mannequin display. "We're going to play a game with those idiots." pulling off my wig, I said. "Think you can hold perfectly still for a while?"

Uncertain, Rhea nodded and I had her stand between four mannequins while I quickly a spot near the front, holding a simple pose among other skirt wearing models. The men appeared shortly after with a small number of security guards who were questioning them as they ran. "What is the deal with these two kids, agent Foster?" asked one guard.

"They are runaways from an abusive home." quickly, the man, Foster replied. "They are hurt and confused, the young gunman spooked them and they ran from us."

"It is imperative that we find them quickly." said the other man. "We found them a good home, a strong family who is willing to take them in immediately."

"We'll find them, agent Tower." said another guard. "We'll have all the exits and entrances watched."

As the group moved on, I sighed within as Rhea began to sob silently. "This turned out to be a fun trip."

What am I to do?
11321112221121222111211211121.title: Forced on the run.

113211122211212221112112111211.content:
Once the group was out of sight, I carefully turned to Rhea and tried to force a smile. "We need to get out of here and tell mom and dad what happened." whispering, I said. "How do you feel like riding a pony?"

Rhea looked at me, her eyes dancing as she nodded. One transformation later, Rhea was screaming with delight as she rode on the back of a pony, me, as I raced down the main hall towards the exit. The two security guards, watching the doors, instinctively jumped out of the way as I ran through the large turn-style door and galloped down the side walk as fast I could carry my little sister. I had taken her almost all the way home before I was forced to stop and change back into my human form.

"That was interesting." nursing my back, I said. "I'm exhausted."

"That was fun!" giggling, Rhea said. she then became worried. "We're still a block away from home."

"I know but I couldn't be a pony anymore, it was starting to hurt." sighing, I said. "We'll have to walk the rest of the way."

Trying to ignore the pain in my back, I walked with Rhea as we slowly made our way home where mom was waiting for us, she looked deeply concerned. "Where have you two been!?" livid, she asked. "When I saw the news of a maniac kid shooting up the mall..."

"Someone tried to kidnap us, mom!" irritated, I snapped back. "We were lucky to get away from them!"

"It's true!" defending me, Rhea added. "Clem turned into a pony to get me away from them!"

Mom opened her mouth then closed it before ushering us inside. "I'll get an ice pack for your back." quickly, she said. "Then your father and I will want to hear every detail of what had happened."

Rhea began to sob again and I pulled her into a one armed hug. "It's going to be okay, sis." comforting her, I said.

"You don't see what I see." shivering, Rhea thought.

Unknown to me, inside her mind, she saw herself tied to a chair somewhere, feeling very much afraid. Seeing her shiver, I turned to the Teen Detectives magazines. "If only you guys really existed." sighing, I said.
113211122211212221112112111211.title: Pony ride.

1132111222112122211121121112111.content:
I began to flip through one of the stories, since I knew almost all the dialogue by heart. It was my favorite comic, after all.

As I glanced at the pages, one image caught my attention: A kid in trouble pulled a loose brick from the outside of the school gymnasium, inserted a note, and replaced the brick. This was the "blind post office", the preferred way for kids to contact the Problem Child Gang, since no adult would be caught asking a bunch of teenagers for help.

It struck me that the outside of the gym building at school had a loose brick, just like the one in the story. Could it be... ?

"Probably just a coincidence," I told myself. I mean, how many buildings have loose bricks?
1132111222112122211121121112111.title: A possible clue

11321112221121222111211211121111.content:
Although it was only a day since the incident at the mall, it felt like a week had passed. Rhea was still shaken so mom decided to start our homeschooling early to help get our minds off of it. "We start after lunch." said mom, firmly but kindly. "You and Rhea will spend three hours each night, learning everything you need to know."

"Three hours a night?" confused, I asked.

Mom smiled. "You forget we are not from around here." giggling, she said. "We have better ways of teaching."

I could not help smile to that only mom rose a finger, meaning she was not finished. "Your homeschooling with me only lasts three hours a night but you still need to spend four hours each week day on the computers." sternly, she said. "We do not want anyone becoming suspicious of us, do we?"

"No, we don't." sighing, I said. "May I take a walk?"

"Take Rhea with you." serious, mom said. "The moment either of you sense trouble, you get home immediately."

"We will." nodding, I promised.

"Where are we going, Clem?" curious, Rhea asked.

"The school." quickly, you replied. "I want to check something out."

"That's boring." whining, Rhea complained. "I want to ride a pony again."

I winced, my back was still hurting from the first time. "You can seriously injure yourself, pushing yourself beyond your physical limits." mom had warned. "Chose your shapes carefully."

"How about an older sister for a while instead?" trying to compromise, I asked.

Rhea nodded, her smile returning. "Can you be a little girl?"

"We'll see." sighing, I replied. "I need to see something at the school, its important."

"Okay." reluctantly, Rhea said. "I hope I get a little sister out of this."

We reached the school about five minutes later and I looked about to find no one around. "Come on, sis." urging her to move faster, I said. "It's over here somewhere."

"What are you looking for?" curious, Rhea asked.

"A loose brick on the gymnasium wall." searching the long wall, I replied. "Teen Detectives stories told of a loose brick where kids and teens left messages to The Problem Child Gang."

After a few tense minutes of searching, I found the loose brick and pulled it out to find an old motion detector inside that immediately began to flash when I removed the brick. "This is it!" shaking, I whispered. "The 'blind post office'!" ecstatic, I whispered, "They really exist!"

Still shaking, I took a folded piece of paper out of my pocket and placed it into the hole before replacing the brick and turning back to Rhea. "If they are still around, they will help us." smiling, I said.

"Who?" walking away from the school with me, Rhea asked.

"The Problem Child Gang." proudly, I replied. "They exist."

Rhea looked at me, confused but shrugged it off. "Okay. Can you be my sister now?"

"When we get home, squirt." smiling, I said. "I can't change out here."

Rhea giggled. "I have a great dress you can wear." with a shark like grin, she said.

"I'm sure you do." rolling my eyes, I said.

Then, Rhea grabbed my shirt as I spotted three men walking towards us. "Clem... who are they?" frightened she asked.

"No one I want to talk to, sis." backing away with her, I said. "Run!"

Unknown to me, miles away, Alyssa Vance, a young teenage girl, jumped as the television came to life on its own with a test page showing. The speakers blared the words, "Puerí Problementa!"

"Latin for Problem child." turning pale, she whispered. "What!?!"

"Someone has left a note in the 'blind post office'." staring at the screen, a young woman in a wheel chair said. "The call only goes out to the televisions with a special box Sam made of us." pausing, she added, "I'm surprised it still works after all these years."

"What do we do, mom?" asked Alyssa, uncertain.

The woman slowly shook her head. "I don't know." whispering, she replied. "It could be a trap."

Back to the school, I managed to keep the three men away from Rhea but I was slowly losing my strength. As the minutes passed, I began to lose hope that we would get away from our attackers. Then, as I was about to lose hope, help arrived. It was...
11321112221121222111211211121111.title: Homeschooling begins

113211122211212221112112111211112.content:
"What's going on?"

I didn't know what to expect, but seeing Garth and Grace wasn't it. "How'd you get here?"

"Long story," said another girl. "Who're these guys?"

"Don't know," I said between panting breaths. "They're after us. I... don't know how long... I can keep... "

"Not your problem anymore," the girl said. Grabbing Rhea, she said, "Hang on. Don't let go." The next thing I knew, the girl and Rhea were gone.

Meanwhile, Grace was fighting our pursuers with moves I recognized from watching wrestling. "Where'd she pick that up?" I wondered.

One of the men in suits managed to get close to me. "Tell your friend to stand down," he said to Garth. "This doesn't have to concern you."

"This does concern me," he replied. "This is my friend. And my sister's the least of your worries."

Suddenly, Garth began to grow, huge and muscular. When the man tried to raise a weapon, Garth pulled it out of his hand, crushing it in his grip.

"This just went beyond what we were told to expect," said the man. "Pick up brass!"

When he said this, he and the other two touched what looked like wristwatches, and disappeared in flashes of light. "Thanks," I said.

"Don't thank us yet," Grace said. "I'm betting we'll be seeing them again."

Then Rhea and the girl returned. "Sorry I missed the action," the girl said. "This little monkey demanded a ride."

"You must be Rhea," Grace said. "I'm Grace. This is Garth. And you've met Lyssa. We're friends of your brother's"

"How'd you guys find me?" I asked. "It's like you knew where I was the whole time."

"We had an idea where to look," Lyssa said. "Glad to see you again, Clem. It's been too long."

"My fault. I apologize. But how'd you know where I was?"

"The 'blind post office'. As you may have guessed, there really was a Problem Child Gang. They were our parents."

"I told you she was a girl." said Rhea, sticking out her tongue.

I turned to the girl, Lyssa, stunned. "G-Greg!?"
113211122211212221112112111211112.title: A small group of teenagers.

1132111222112122211121121112111121.content:
Lyssa turned red with anger, tears forming, when I said that.

"I saw your picture," Rhea said, obviously unaware of I social blunder, "Clem said you was a boy, 'cause you was dressed like one, but I knowed you was a girl."

"It's a long story," sighing, Grace said.

Then Garth roughly pulled me aside, looking right into my eyes. "Clem, you haven't hung out with Lyssa in a long time, and that's your business. But, if you want to hang out with us," - he said this part through clenched teeth - "you don't use the G-word in her presence!"

I swallowed hard, remembering how he had grown to the size of an Olympian a moment ago. "Sorry,... Lyssa," turning to her, I said. "I guess I forgot."

Lyssa and Garth both seemed to calm down somewhat. "Clem," Lyssa said, "what are we going to do with you?"

"I know!" Rhea said. "Make him be a girl, for the rest of the day!"

Lyssa chuckled. "It doesn't work that way, cutie-pie. I can't turn people into girls."

"But Clem can change!" Rhea insisted. "He can be a girl, or a pony. Or even SpongeBob Squarepants!"

"Just a minute," Grace said. "Rhea, you said you knew Lyssa was a girl from an old picture. How is that possible?"

"Rhea's got special vision," sighing, I replied. "Just by looking at you, she can tell how you're feeling. and, apparently, if you're in the wrong body."

Rhea nodded. "That's how I found out I was adopted. Mommy and Daddy are aliens, and Clem is like them. That's why he can change his shape."

Then, Mr Jones, the chief of police, came running up the hill. "I heard fighting," he said. "Thought I'd better... " He stopped talking when he saw Rhea and I.

"Dad," Garth said, "you remember Clem Rodgers. This is his kid sister, Rhea."

I shook Ted's hand. "Garth says you were part of the original Problem Child Gang. Guess you found my note."

Unbeknownst to us, we were being watched from the trees. One man spoke into a communicator. "Looks like we've got ourselves a new Problem Child Gang."

"Continue to observe," came the reply. "Will advise as necessary."
1132111222112122211121121112111121.title: Faux pas, social mistake.

11321112221121222111211211121111211.content:
"Make him be a girl for the day!" persisted Rhea. "He can change into anything, honest!"

"Something we need to know?" turning to Clem, dad asked.

"You're 'killing' me, sis!" sighing, I said. "We're supposed to keep that a secret! Mom will be furious!"

Rhea teared up. "But... you promised." her lip trembling, she said. "They can do stuff too, they won't tell on us."

"Yeah, Clem." seeing an opportunity for mischief, Lyssa said. "We won't tell on you, let's see your feminine side."

Grace, seeing Lyssa's mischievous look smiled as well. "If your bashful, we can turn around." teasing, she said. "You saw our secret, let's see yours."

"Enough." firmly, Ted said.

"It's okay, sir." blushing brightly, I said. "I used the 'G' word with Lyssa without thinking, I owe them at least this."

"Alright but quickly." looking about, Ted said. "I doubt you want your secret to become publicly known."

Rhea giggled as I blushed brightly before concentrating. Everyone watched wide eyed as my body shrank down to feminine proportions before my face and body changed to that of a teen girl. The silent shock turned to amused chuckling as Rhea pointed at me and my clothing shifted, changing into a skirt and tube top, showing off my new curvy mid drift. Unknown to the others, and to my relief, she remembered to summon the wig as well. "Much better." giggling, Rhea said. "Say hi to Jenny."

Everyone snickered as I blushed brightly. Rhea giggled but then moaned, stumbling backwards. Lyssa caught her. "Easy, little one." concerned, she said. "I'm guessing you're the one who changed Clem's clothing."

"She has some mental powers as well." shaking my head, I said. "Only she's a little too young to use them for very long, it takes a lot out of her."

"What about you?" looking at Clem, Garth asked. "Doesn't changing forms take a lot out of you?"

"Just when I change into something larger than myself." shrugging, I replied. "Still, I have to be careful as I am going through a form of puberty."

I winced that that last part. Garth saw that and asked, "What do you mean a 'form' of puberty?"

I sighed, removing my wig. "Alien puberty." near tears, I said. "Rhea wasn't joking when she said my parents are aliens, I am one too, just born on Earth."

"He's completely hairless... Just like Cait." whispering, Lyssa said.
11321112221121222111211211121111211.title: continue talking.

113211122211212221112112111211112111.content:
"Cait?" touching my head, I asked. "Cait's like this, too?"

Before anyone could respond, Garth seemed to start looking uncomfortable. "Anyone else feel that?" he asked.

"Feel what?" not suspecting anything, I asked.

Grace and Lyssa nodded. "Just like the mall," Grace said.

"Dad," Garth said, "I think we need to get out of here. And we need to get creative about how to get there."

"Understood," Ted said. "The police academy taught me everything I know about losing pursuers."

"Pursuers?" alarmed, I thought. "What are they..."

Then it hit me, a horrible feeling that we were being watched. I turned to Rhea and saw that she felt the same way but said nothing. As we got underway, we told Dad about the fight, and I told them about the note we had left, asking for their help. "What do you think, Chief?" once the story was told, Garth asked.

"It sounds like Rhea's caught the attention of the Agency," Ted said. "It's a quasi-governmental agency that recruits kids to do their dirty work."

"Weird," making a face, I said.

"When a 5-year-old girl points a sniper rifle at your head, 'weird' is one letter longer than any word going through your mind." He said this while staring at Rhea. I got the feeling that there must be something about her that made him uncomfortable, but he wasn't saying what.

"Like my dream," Rhea said. "I saw some men who wanted to take me away. And there was something much worse looking for me, too."

"That could be Sykes," Ted said. "Sykes and the Agency are out to destroy each other, and they don't care much about anyone caught in the crossfire." He turned his attention to me. "How are you explaining your, uh condition? I mean, when you're not changing shape."

"Mom found an article," I explained, 'about Plutonium beauty products causing hair loss. I tell people that I used the body wash."

"Interesting timing," Ted said. "I heard through the grapevine that Plutonium had just dodged a buyout attempt by Cain Chemical, right before that problem started. And Cain is one of Sykes's front companies."

"Could you guys do me a favor?" Rhea asked.

"Sure, boo," Lyssa said. "What is it?"

"If something bad happens to me, find my mommy. My real mommy, the one who borned me. Tell her I'm in trouble."

"Okay," I said. "How will we know when we find her?"

"Tobi says you'll know."

"Tobi's her symbiont," I explained. "That's where she gets her powers."
113211122211212221112112111211112111.title: Moving on.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111.content:
It was not long before we realized we were driving on the freeway, heading east. "Where are we going, dad?" turning to him, Garth asked. "I thought we were going to take Jenny and Rhea back to their homes."

"That would only lead those interested in Rhea to her doorstep." driving, a man named Geo said. "You may not have realized it but there is a black four door about three car lengths back, its been following us since we left the school."

Rhea gasped and turned to look out the back window of the van but Grace pulled her down as something hit the window, breaking a hole in the glass, causing her to scream. "Don't do that again." sternly, she said.

I turned to see what is was and gulped, seeing a tranquilizer dart. "They're trying to capture us!" shaken, I thought.

"Everyone down!" pushing Lyssa and Grace to the floor, Garth yelled. "Those maniacs are firing on us!"

Instinctively, I grabbed Rhea and, to the others surprise, quickly changed into a box, with Rhea inside. I could see everything that was going on and was impressed to see Garth using his own body to protect Lyssa and Grace, just as I was for Rhea. "Uncle Geo, get us out of here!" begging, Garth called to him.

"Give me the wheel!" moving to the front, Ted ordered. "You know what to do."

Geo nodded then got out of the driver's seat, still holding the wheel while dad took the seat before taking over and steered through traffic. "Everyone hang on." quickly walking towards the back, ordered Geo. "This is going to be a kick in the ass."

Curious, I watched as Geo opened a panel under the back window and turned a switch. Just above the rear bumper, a large panel opened, revealing what looked like a rocket booster. "Turbo turbine ready." turning to Ted, Geo said. "Kick it!"

I could not see what was happening up front but heard Ted let out an excited yell as we all felt the van suddenly pick up a lot of speed when the turbine fired. Ted, I imagine, turned the wheel with expert precision, moving through the traffic, leaving the back car in the dust. I saw the exchange of startled looks between Grace and Lyssa but smiled on the inside with them as we all rolled our eyes hearing Ted and Geo declare, "Problem Child!"

Minutes later, we arrived at...
1132111222112122211121121112111121111.title: Being chased.

11321112221121222111211211121111211111.content:
... the safe house. "Here's something you probably never thought you'd see," Ted told me. "The actual Problem Child Gang headquarters."

I hopped out, then helped Rhea out. "I can't wait to look around."

"Not unescorted, you won't,"Geo said. "As Garth can tell you, we've got this place pretty well booby-trapped."

Once we got inside, I called mom and dad to let them know where we were. I didn't mention the Agency goons who'd tried to capture us as I knew they would freak or worse, get angry.

Once that was through, Garth showed Rhea and I around. I was flipping out over everything, I began think part of it was because of hormones. "I can't believe I'm actually seeing this stuff in real life," in awe, I said. "How long does it take to get used to this?"

"You're asking me?" chuckling, Garth replied. "A month ago, everything seemed normal. Then, I started Hulking out, Lyssa changed into a girl and got super-speed, and I found out there are these alien symbionts. Oh, and I found out that my best friend is from another planet!"

"Actually, I'm from this one," blushing a little, I replied. "I was born here on Earth. It's my parents who are aliens. I didn't find that out until I started changing shape."

"My point being, in light of all that stuff, the idea that my folks used to be teen detectives is rather minor."

"I suppose." nodding, I said. I was silent for a while, then asked, "Does Lyssa know?"

"Know what?" curious, Garth asked.

"How you feel."

Garth smiled. "Oh. Yeah, we've talked about it. Is it that obvious?"

"Kinda. Who knows? If I stand a chance with Cait, maybe we can double-date."

"Dating's not on the radar, what with everything that's going on." serious, Garth said. "But maybe Lyssa can put in a good word for you."

That surprised me. "Cait listens to Lyssa?"

Garth nodded. "Especially since they found out they were cousins."
11321112221121222111211211121111211111.title: Problem Child headquarters.

113211122211212221112112111211112111111.content:
As I nervously fiddled with my bra, Garth asked, "How's it going, being a girl?"

"I can take it for the rest of the day," sighing, I replied. "But I'll be glad when I can be myself again. It's really giving me insight into what Lyssa was going through."

"And you said Rhea knew all that, before we told her?" curious, Garth asked.

"It's her symbiont." quickly, I replied. seeing that everyone was interested, I took a breath. "It started with her seeing auras; she can look at you and tell how you're feeling." I explained. "Only, when she looked at me or Mom or Dad, she'd see funny colors, in shapes that didn't match the forms we were wearing. That's how we wound up telling her about the adoption; mom was going to wait until she was around our age."

I paused, as Ted led Lyssa up the stairs towards what looked like living quarters. As strange as everything seemed, she was not repulsed at the fact my parents were aliens or that I was one myself. It made me realize how much of a friend she truly was and I wished I had been more of a friend when she needed me. "All that changes today." knotting my jaws, thought.

I sighed then turned back to Garth. "What freaked me out, though, was when she found this old picture of you, me, and Greg from when we were ten." continuing my story, I said. "She asked me why my friend was dressed like a boy. Remember, that was when Lyssa was Greg's little secret.
