There was nothing about the shot that said we were different from how we looked, yet Rhea could tell. Then, she used her symbiont to show me Lyssa's medical records, saying that she was changing into a real girl." She paused. "I can't believe how I reacted when she first told me. I don't know how she can forgive me for being such a rotten friend."

"It could have been worse," Garth replied. "If she wasn't a descendant of Iole, she'd still be a girl trapped in a boy's body. She used to cry about how long it was taking the hormones to work, thinking she'd be underdeveloped forever. I consoled her as best I could, not daring to tell her that I was falling for her."

Hearing that, I thought, "Maybe Cait will fall for me."
113211122211212221112112111211112111111.title: The grand tour.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
"Speaking of Lyssa," looking past Garth, I said. "It looks like your dad wants a private talk with her."

Garth turned turned to see Lyssa close the door to one of the bedrooms and shrugged. "Dad is a police officer to the last." lightly, he replied. "I have no doubt he'll be talking to all of us in private before long."

We made our way back into the library where Grace was keeping Rhea entertained and we all began to talk about how we had fist discovered our abilities when I noticed Lyssa stepping into the library, looking concerned. All of our concerns rose when she pulled out a cellphone and dialed a number. "What's up?" curious, I thought.

Then, upon finishing the call, Lyssa quietly called us all together as Geo and dad entered behind her. Garth was the first to reach her, worried something was wrong. I and the others were right behind him.

"Okay, Lyssa, what was so urgent that you needed to see all of us right away?" concerned, Grace asked. "You sounded super worried over the house intercom."

"Remember those goons who were after Clem and Rhea?" seeing Ted Jones shake his head, Lyssa asked. "Well, Mr Jones told me that the Agency was after Rhea's birth mother twenty years ago. My guess is they want Rhea and Clem for the same reasons, they both have a unique power they can use to their advantage."

I was stunned to say the least but i managed to ask, "How did they learn of Rhea or even me?"

"Rhea's mother got away from the Agency on our last mission." speaking up, dad said. "In that sense, I guess we gained a small victory." he shuddered slightly. "Bear in mind, though, these people are true monsters. I can only guess they had been tracking Rhea's birth mother and discovered her child in one of those searches."

"The van watching the house." thinking out loud, I said. "They must have been with this Agency."

My blood began to boil, knowing that such monsters were right outside my own home an I wished I had confronted them then when I had the chance. Only I dismissed the thought as quickly as it came. "No, I would not have lasted long." scolding myself, I thought. "Monsters like the Agency should not be faced alone."

"If that is the case, they had been watching you for a while, young man." serious, Ted said. "They were merely waiting for the right time to strike."

"No one is going to take you two anywhere if we have anything to say about it." serious, Gar said to Rhea and I.

"Wh- What about my- my birth mommy?" frightened, Rhea asked. "I do- don't want mo- monsters to g- get her!"

"Maybe mom and dad can find her." trying to calm my sister, I suggested. "They have... gifts of their own."

Rhea gave me a grateful smile only to have it suddenly turn to terror. "They found her!" her lips and hands quivering, she screamed. "The monsters are chasing her!"

Lyssa quickly knelt down and turned Rhea's head to face her. It broke all our hearts to see such a small child so very terrified. "Where is your birth mommy?" firmly, she asked. "Can you tell us where she is?"

"Hospital!" crying in hysterics, Rhea replied. "They're running from the hospital!"

"That's only five miles from here." startled, Geo said.

"Mount up!" pointing in the direction of the garage, dad ordered. "Grace, you drive. We will give advice through ear piece radios as we watch through the camera feeds!"

Within minutes, we were all given earpiece radios, exactly as they were described in the comic series and led to the garage where Grace moved to get into the family car. "Not that one, honey." moving to a tarp covered vehicle, Ted said. "This one."

I turned and gasped as Ted pulled off the tarp to reveal a modified, sleek black, van! "It's the Beast!" my mouth open in awe, I thought. "Just as it was described in the comic series!"

"The Beast!" an awe filled smile forming, Lyssa whispered. "You really had it!"

"This is the 1983 GMC Vandura G series, which Ted and I had modified." quite proudly, Geo said. "This bad boy as a 10 inch armored plated hull and armored glass windows. It carries a 2.7 liter supercharged V8 engine that delivers 300+hp and 400+ torque with a top sustained speed of 180 mph."

It was an incredible piece of machinery, a true work of art. I wondered if Mr Jones would later let me test drive it.

"We can talk cars later." scolding, Ted said. "Get moving!"

We all piled into the van and sped off, towards the hospital. Our first mission had begun and I considered myself honored to be riding with the new Problem Child Gang....
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: continue.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
"I hope she'll be okay with being left behind like that." wincing, Lyssa said as she turned to face the front. "It is her birth mother, after all."

I sighed with Garth, remembering seeing Rhea waving sadly as we pulled away from the mansion. Chief Jones thought it was too dangerous for such a young girl to get involved. It took some convincing but I think I got her to understand.

Then, Lyssa let out a low scream as I jumped, startled, finding Rhea suddenly standing in front of me! Garth turned to look back at us from the front passenger seat. Rhea looked painfully pale and she was shivering but her voice was determined. "I- I'm go-going with y-you, Jess." panting, she said. "S-She's my mo-mommy!"

"Rhea, are you crazy!" gripping her shoulders, I asked. "Look at yourself, you look like a ghost!" I let out a weary sigh, wondering what to do with her. "Please don't use your powers unless you really have to, you're going to hurt yourself!"

Rhea began to cry, having been yelled at by her brother/sister. "But... my mommy."

I shook my head, wanting to lecture Rhea but now was not the time. I decided to let it go and put her into an empty seat before fastening the seat belt. "Just make sure you stay behind us." firmly, I said.

We drove in the direction of the hospital, until Rhea said, "Stop!"

Grace stopped. "What is it?"

Rhea pointed at a gathering crowd. "There they are! Mommy and her boyfriend!"

I looked passed Gar, but all I could see was a small boy in a dress carrying a doll, being surrounded by some goons carrying weapons. "Rhea's mom or not," Garth said, "we can't let this go down."

We all piled out of the Beast and made for the group, Garth hulking up to weightlifter size.

We got to the group in time to hear the goons' leader say, "Kiss, Kiss, my dear."

"KISS THIS!" angrily, Garth roared. he landed a strong right hook into the man's jaw.

The guy sat up, after being thrown off his feet, rubbing his jaw. "Hello again, Garth. You caught me off guard, but not without resources." At that, the goons aimed their weapons at Garth.

I had to hold Rhea back as she wanted to charge in but we both paused as Lyssa said, "Think fast."

A gust of wind and a quick blur later, all of the men had been relieved of their weapons as they were now lying on the ground at Garth's feet while Lyssa smiled as if she had never moved. "Too slow."

"Nice move." impressed, I thought. "Maybe mom and dad can tell us more about the weapons they have once I get one to them to examine."

The leader's eyes narrowed. "You kids don't know what you're in the middle of. You need guidance."

"We've got guidance," Garth's eyes narrowing, he replied. "And it's you who doesn't know what he's doing. Drop this, before it gets dropped on you."

One of the goons said, "Looks like Blue team wasn't kidding. Your orders?"

"We've got all the information we need," the man said. "We can easily pick up Sarah and her fiance at our leisure. Ta-ta." With that, they all touched devices on their wrists, and they and their weapons disappeared. I felt like swearing but I paused as Rheas ran passed me, making a bee line to who she believed to be her biological mother.
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Arriving on the scene.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
The 'girl' sighed. "Looks like I owe you kids one."

"Our pleasure." returning to his normal form, Gar said. "Where's Sarah? You're dressed like a Sarah, but I don't think you are her."

"That would be me," the 'doll' said. "We'd present ourselves better, but we're short on the right size clothing just now."

Rhea stepped forward and carefully took the doll from the child. "Are... are you my mommy?"

"I am, sweetie," tears filling her tiny eyes, the 'doll' said. "You look okay."

"We'll need to save the reunion," the 'girl' said. "Hagen's right. He's got access to our personal information, and he can track us down whenever he feels like it. We're going to need someplace to lie low."

"I'd offer my parent's home but we have problems of our own." hiding a frown, I thought.

"We've got just the place," Gar said. "Hagen's got to master several puzzles before he can even think about getting in."

We ushered the cross dressed boy and the doll, in Rhea's careful hands into the van. Grace then drove us all back to the mansion. As we exited the van, Gar said, "Welcome to the clubhouse of the Problem Child Gang."

"Thanks again," the boy, who introduced himself as Todd said. "It's a lucky thing you kids showed up when you did."

"Nuh-uh," said Rhea, who was still carrying Sarah. "Andromeda told Tobi where to find you."

"Who's Andromeda?" curious, Gar asked. "And who's Tobi?"

"Andromeda," Sarah explained, "is an alien symbiont who lives inside me. Tobi is her offspring. And Rhea is a clone of me, created to save Tobi's life."

We were about to walk through the garage door, when it opened, revealing Ted's muscular form. "She's not coming in here!" he declared.

"But she's my mommy!" Rhea protested.

"Honey," Todd asked, "what is he talking about?"

"When I was Rhea's age," Sarah explained, "Dr. Hagen had me shadow the Problem Child Gang. Then, he wanted them dealt with."

Ted shook his head. "You have such a pretty way of describing shooting someone in the shoulder."

"It's not that I shot you in the shoulder. It's that I didn't shoot you in the head or heart."

"What?"

Sarah nodded. "Hagen ordered me to kill you, but I didn't want to. I deliberately shot you in the shoulder, instead. Then, I went into hiding, using the last name Barns. If it weren't for Cain Chemical, Hagen still wouldn't know where I was living."

Ted shook his head again. "Sykes again. These names just keep turning up, don't they?"
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: The club house.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
"Sykes?" confused, Todd asked. "Can someone fill me in here?"

Ted sighed, looking as if he were struggling to make a decision. "Alright, everyone inside." finally, he said. "We'll find you all some suitable clothing."

I breathed an inaudible sigh of relief. "At least he's letting them in." following the group, I thought. "Rhea is only five, it would be hard to explain Chief Jones' grudge against her real mom."

A few minutes later, Todd sat next to Sarah on a comfortable couch inside a spacious library. They were both the size of teenagers, wearing teen clothes. Looking at them, I guessed it was Ted's attempt to keep them under control. I could not be sure though, I did not see any adult clothing around so it might have been simply all they had. We all sat around them, explaining the events surrounding our brief encounter with Hagen and his men on the streets near the hospital. Fortunately, no one seemed too upset that Rhea decided to join us by teleporting in. Once we were done, we listened as Ted and Geo explained who Sykes was and how their group came to lock horns with the Agency. "We had thought that the Agency wanted us as part of their army of brainwashed soldiers." finishing his explanation, Ted said. "Apparently, we were wrong."

"The Agency had considered it but, with half your group was related to the most wealthy families on the planet, it was too much of a security risk." looking at Ted, Sarah said. "Believe me, Mr Jones, you will never know how lucky you and your team was." she teared up, adding, "They killed my family to claim me."

Trying to be of comfort, I placed a reassuring hand onto Sarah's shoulder. "They won't get you a second time, not if we can help it." smiling, I said. "Rhea is my adopted sister, I won't let anything happen to her birth mother."

"Jessica is really my brother, Clem, mommy." smiling, Rhea said. "He can change into almost anything." giggling, she added, "Even an older sister."

Sarah could not help giggle at that, making me blush. "Thank you for taking care of my little girl.. Jessica." giving me a light kiss on the cheek, she said. "Do you all have powers like this?"

"We do." seriously, Gar replied. "However, I think its more important that we focus the issue at hand... The Agency."

"I agree, we need to place all we know on the table now." equally as serious, Geo said. "We don't want to be caught off guard a second time."

"We know that Dr Hagen knows about all of us, perhaps even that Travis kid." speaking up, Lyssa said. "Only I'm guessing you didn't know him back then, Mr Jones."

Ted shook his head. "No, we didn't." with a hint of regret, Ted replied. "Had I known who Dr Hagen was, I would not have allowed him anywhere near my children." then a thought occurred to him. "He told us that he had removed the 'tumor' that caused Garth's body to build up, yet the symbiont..."

"Amara said that Hagen only took a piece of her, stunning her enough to return me to normal." after a pause, Gar said. "That can only mean..."

"He knows about the symbionts." his face turning white, dad said.

"Or, at least, he suspects." worried, I thought.
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: A realization.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
"We'll work out a plan of action against Hagen later," serious, Ted said. he turned to Sarah and Todd. "How about the kids show you around the place, since you'll be staying here until things calm down?"

"Sounds good to me," Sarah said.

"One moment, Garth." motioning with his finger, Ted said.

Gar walked over to Ted and, out of curiosity, I watched and listened as Ted whispered in Gar's ear. I did not expect to hear anything but, to my surprise, my hearing was better than I had thought.

"Just show her what she needs to see as a guest." I heard Ted whisper. "It's not that I do not trust her, it's because she was brainwashed." after a pause, he whispered, "Why would anyone say 'kiss kiss, my dear' in normal conversation?"

My eyes widened at that as Gar quickly nodded before he began to lead Sarah and Todd around the clubhouse with the rest of us following close behind.

"My mommy is beautiful." whispering, Rhea commented.

"Yes but so is your adopted mommy." whispering back, I replied. "You love her too, don't you."

"Of course I do." tearing up, Rhea whispered.

I saw that I was touching a nerve and decided to let it go for now.

"Bet you never thought you'd see the inside of this building," smiling, Grace said.

"Never," Sarah agreed. "I'll probably need another tour, I'm so distracted."

"It can be a lot to take in," holding Rhea's hand, I said.

"It's not just that. I was supposed to start teaching in a couple of days." sighing, Sarah said. "I'll have to come up with a believable explanation for my absence, since no one is going to ever believe I'm on the run from some shadowy government organization."

"Chief Jones will help you in any way he can," Lyssa replied. "My mom will help, too. She's got to drop off my aunt at a treatment center, then she wants to talk with my cousin. She should be by sometime after that."

I smiled at the thought of Cait Spencer coming to the clubhouse. "Maybe I can get the courage to tell her how I feel." dreamily, I thought.

"Someone has a crush." smiling, Rhea whispered.

I blushed at that but, fortunately, the group was focused on Sarah and Todd at the moment.

"Tell them thanks. Actually, though, I'm worried about how my absence will affect my homeroom class." with a grateful smile, Sarah said. "As a baptism of fire, I've been assigned mother-hen status to a group of kids who've been classified as problem children." after a pause, I explained, "They are a number of kids who aren't applying themselves well, a rich girl with an attitude problem, and a transgender student I'm supposed to keep my eye on in case of bullying. I don't know how they'll react if I'm not there; they might think I'm abandoning them."

"They'll be fine," reassuringly, Lyssa said, "don't worry."

"Thanks. You kids wouldn't be cruel to the transgender girl, would you?" asked Sarah. "You understand that she's going through a rough time?"

"I try to treat her well," Lyssa said, suppressing a chuckle. "She looks me in the eye when I brush my teeth."

Sarah's eyes just about popped out of her head. "Y-you're her? You-you look so feminine."

"Now it's my turn to thank you," she said, turning around to show her figure. "This past summer, I started turning into a complete girl."

"But how is that possible?"

"Long story. For now, let's just say that it runs in the family."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Touring the clubhouse.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
As we moved along, I noticed that Grace and Gar were purposely but discretely blocking Sarah and Todd's view of certain halls as we passed them. "Chief Jones must not fully trust them." sighing, I thought. "I can't blame him, Mrs Barns could still be brainwashed and not even know it."

Seeing her disappointed expression, Gar nodded and explained, "Dad wants you to know just enough to stay here for a while as a guest. It's not because you are not trustworthy, its because you were brainwashed."

"That was twenty years ago." sighing, Sarah argued. "I suffered countless nightmares from my year under their thumb, I still do but I managed to move on."

"Did you do anything to try to undo that brainwashing?" serious, Grace asked.

Looking surprised, Sarah slowly shook my head. "No... I never looked back after I fled from The Agency." tearing up a little, she said. "I was found, trembling in an empty alley, by a young couple who adopted me."

Grace sighed. "Unless you saw someone to break that brainwashing, you are still under their control." serious, she said. "All it takes is one code phrase from them, likely over a phone, and you are theirs again." pausing, she turned to us and muttered, "We better get Cait over here, fast."

"Cait?" confused, Sarah asked. "How many members does this new gang have?"

We all ignored her question as Gar suddenly grew to the size of an Olympian and took a strong hold of Sarah's arm. "Please do not take any offense to this." pulling Sarah along, he said. "We can not risk you turning on us."

With that, Gar half dragged, half carried a struggling Sarah into a spacious room with only one exit and gently pushed her inside while Grace pushed Todd in behind her before Gar shut the door and locked it tight. "I really hated to do that." muttering, he said. "She's as much a victim as anyone else."

*He did what he thought was right* timidly, Tobi's voice thought to me. *He's not a bad guy.*

"I know, Tobi." sighing, I thought to her. "It still sucks."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: A partial tour.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
Two hours later, Ted heard the front gate buzzer go off and hit the intercom. "Who is this?"

"Caitlin Spencer," calmly Cait's voice replied. "Aunt Sarah said I was expected?"

Ted sighed, relieved. "One moment." he released the intercom switch and turned to Lyssa. "Cait has arrived, she's at the front gate, Lyssa." firmly, he said. "You are the fastest, go let her in."

By the time Lyssa returned with Cait in tow, everyone was in the room where we were holding Sarah Barns and her husband, Todd. Both of them were still in the form of teenagers. "Ms. Barns," Lyssa said, "this is Cait."

"How do you do?" calmly, Cait asked.

Mrs Barns shrugged. "My life's turned upside-down and inside-out in the past week, but I'm holding together." looking shaken, she said. "Ted says you can help me unravel my past?"

"I can try." stepping in front of Sarah, Cait replied.

"How does that work?" curious, Sarah asked.

"Just relax, and trust me." her voice almost echoing, Cait replied.

Once the two made eye contact, both of their eyes fell half open as they stood, unmoving. "Cait must be in Mrs Barns' mind right now." watching, I thought.

"Their auras are hugging." whispering in awe, Rhea said to me.

I smiled at that then turned serious as I watched with the others. Minutes ticked by with the two unmoving as we could only watch, and hope. Then, Cait turned her head to the side. "Bad guys?" in a flat tone, she asked.

*No! No!* came Tobi's frightened voice.

I turned to Rhea and saw that she was just as startled and confused as I was. "What's wrong, Tobi?" concerned, I thought. "Talk to me."

Tobi did not answer, all I heard was her silently sobbing in my head, making Rhea tear up as well. "Something scared her good but what?"

Cait paused then rose her hands as if she were holding a rifle at Mrs Barns. "What's going on in her head?" curious, I thought.

"I- I'm trying to obey, Jon." apologetically, Cait said. "I want to obey but-"

"She must be getting caught in some memory." wondering what to do, I thought. "This could turn ugly."

I dared not voice my concern, fearful that I might interrupt the mental link at a bad time, but I stayed on guard as I saw Cait's hands begin to shake. She had an uncertain look on her face as if she were fighting conflicting emotions. "I- I must obey." stammering, she said. "Jon is my master, I am his slave."

"Clem, help her..." fearful, Rhea whispered.

I looked at Rhea, not knowing what to do. None of the others seemed to have heard Rhea's whispers and I began to wonder if I was hearing them in my head as she was too young to understand telepathy. I turned back to Cait as she spoke again, her hands still shaking. "Mommy... daddy...." tears forming, she whimpered. she then rose her hands, barely still as she blankly yelled, "I must defend Jon! Do not come closer!"

Gar turned to Ted, as if to look for advice then turned back to Cait as she once again quivered, crying. "Jon... did." slowly, tearfully, she said, as if answering a question.

"What's gotten into Cait?" concerned, Grace asked Gar. "She's acting more and more like she's reliving a painful memory in Sarah's mind."

Not wanting to panic anyone with my own fears, I turned to and shrugged. "You're asking me? You're the one with the supercharged brain."

*Look out!* came Tobi's warning. *Rhea, empty it!*

Confused, I was about to ask what Tobi was talking about when a handgun suddenly materialized into Cait's hand and she turned to Gar, leveling it at his left shoulder. Everyone in the room froze as a sad smile formed onto her face. With a glassy look in her eyes, Cait said, "I am sorry."

With that, she pulled the trigger...
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Cait arrives.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
The gun clicked and Cait pulled the trigger again. no result.

Turning red, Gar slapped the gun out of her hand. "What's gotten into you, Cait?" almost screaming, he asked.

"I... I must kill you, Ted," to my surprise, Cait said. "But the gun won't work, so I cannot. I must. I cannot. Must... Cannot... " she sighed before passing out where she sat.

"I think she got caught up in Mrs Barns brainwashing." wincing, Grace said.

"I'm forced to agree." sighing, Ted said. "Hagen obviously thought that someone would try to break her from their control and set a trap." he then produced two pairs of handcuffs and slapped them onto Cait's wrist before locking the other end onto the arm of the chair. He repeated the process with the other hand. "We'll see how she acts when she wakes up."

As he left the room with the others following, Rhea tugged on my shirt. I turned to her and immediately became very concerned as her face was very pale. "Clem... what- what should I d- do with these?" fearful, she asked.

Rhea opened her hand, revealing six bullets from the gun! "Shit!" turning white, I thought. "The gun was loaded!"

"Clem..." looking faint, Rhea asked. "What..."

She then passed out, the bullets falling to the floor. I caught her in my arms. "You did good, sis." trembling, I whispered. "You did real good." I then turned to find Ted Jones standing in the doorway alone.

"Everything alright?" concerned, he asked.

"The gun was loaded, sir." still shaking, I said. "Rhea emptied it with her powers just in time."

"What!?" turning white, Ted asked. he hurried over to find the bullets on the floor. "Armor piercing rounds." he turned to me, deadly serious. "Say nothing of this to anyone; make sure Rhea keeps this secret too. No good will come of this if the others knew this happened, is that understood, Clem?"

I quickly nodded then turned to Rhea, worried for her. "I'm going to have grey hairs before I turn thirty." muttering, I said.

"Will she be okay?" more softly, Ted asked.

I nodded. "She just needs some rest."

"Put her in one of the bedrooms to sleep." nodding back, Ted said. with that, he left the room.

I was told later that Cait was awake and I went up to check on her to meet Gar and the others. We could hear her talking to Lyssa.

"Are you awake?" concerned, Lyssa asked. "Are you okay?"

"I think so," in a pained voice. Cait replied. "I guess I did something stupid, huh?"

"You could call it that," walking past us, into the room, dad said. "Apparently, you wanted to kill me, and tried to kill Garth. Good thing the gun you teleported wasn't loaded."

"Good thing Rhea is still asleep." wincing, I thought. "She's too honest for her own good."

"You were right," sighing, Cait said. "Ms. Barns still has her programming. I took her back through her memories, and stumbled onto it. When I tried to undo it, I got trapped in the programming."

Ted nodded. "So we'll need to be careful around her. Rhea's not going to like that, but we can't take chances."

Finally, Gar spoke up, "Is she back to normal yet?"

"Still bald and telepathic," Cait called back, "but not homicidal. Is that close enough?"

Gar stepped into the room, relieved to see Cait acting normally again. "I'll take it." smiling slightly, he said.

The rest of us entered behind him, relieved that Cait was doing better. Only I was more worried than the others as I knew a second hesitation would have brought a much different scenario.

"Hagen was too clever for us," Ted explained. "Cait's attempt to undo Barns' programming got her into a trap. The feedback loop from her unloaded gun knocked her out and freed her."

"Try to be gentle with her, Chief," begging, Cait said. "She's as much a victim as you were."

"I'll try to remember that, Cait." nodding, Ted said. "Thank you for the attempt. What do you want to do now?"

"I'll go a few blocks away, and arrange for my driver to pick me up." with a rueful smile, Cait replied. "See you guys at school tomorrow."

"Sure you wouldn't rather spend the night here?" Grace asked.

Cait shook her head. "I've got some personal stuff to check up on. Sorry I couldn't be of more help."

Grace smiled. "You did what you could." sounding positive, she said. "And the old Caitlin Spencer wouldn't have done half as much for us. See you at school."

Ted unlocked the handcuffs. As Cait stood up and rubbed her wrists, Ted asked, "What was her trigger?"

"It was 'Kiss Kiss, my dear'," I replied. "Why?"

"I have an idea," was his answer. "I'll have the kids tell you about it tomorrow, if it works."

"Not even a hint?"

He smiled. "Let's just say Hagen wouldn't be the first person I've dealt with who turned out to be too clever for his own good."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: The gun is empty.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
I had changed back into Clem, worried for Rhea. As I watched her sleep in the bedroom Lyssa's mother had used, I did not notice Lyssa approaching with Cait in tow. "You two have the same secret." startling me, Lyssa said. "I think it will help you both to know it."

Before either Cait or I could react, Lyssa tore off my wig and, to my surprise, Cait's wig as well! Her head was as flawlessly bald as my own! I gasped in tune with Cait, seeing each other, before we both smiled. After a moment, I realized that I had an opportunity and quickly pulled a notepad and pen out of my pocket. I really wasn't thinking but reacting. I knew I would not have a chance if she did not have my phone number so I quickly wrote it down.

"Um... call me later?" offering the piece of paper, I asked.

Cait, also snapping out of her trance, shyly accepted the phone number and jotted down her own, offering it as well. "Um... you call me, okay? I have to go to work after school."

"The mall?" smiling, I asked.

"Yeah." blushing, Cait said. "I'm working as a living mannequin."

"So am I." to Cait's surprise, I replied. "A salesgirl named Tracy Flynn suggested that I apply."

"Were you interviewed by a Mrs. Rachel Waite?" looking at me, Cait asked.

"Yes, I was." nodding, I replied.

"Oh boy." smiling, Lyssa said. "You two are likely to end up on the same display."

Both Cait and I blushed at that as Lyssa gave us back our wigs.

As Cait later left, I wondered what Mr Jones had in mind to help Mrs Barns.

"What's the plan, dad?" after Cait was gone, Gar asked. "You saw the result of trying to fight the brainwashing."

"We don't fight the brainwashing, we use it." with a knowing smile, Ted replied. "like a scorpion stinging itself, we make the brainwashing cancel itself out."

"Interesting." raising an eyebrow, Geo said. "What do you propose?"

"We use the trigger phrase then command her to ignore that phrase completely before using the trigger word again to bring her back to herself." confident, Ted said. "Once that is done, the Agency will not be able to control her."

"Genius." impressed, I thought.

"Simple, yet brilliant." impressed, Geo said. "It's worth a try."

"I'll do it." offering, Ted said.

"No, Sarah Barns still has a standing order in her subconscious to kill you." firmly but kindly, Geo said. "I will do it." he then turned to Gar. "Garth, I will need you and your dad as back up in case something goes wrong."

Gar nodded, though he looked uncertain. "I'll do my best."

While Geo walked into the room where Sarah and Todd were being detained, I walked into a bedroom that was originally used by Lyssa's mother to find Rhea still asleep on the bed. "Rhea..." lightly shaking her, I said. "Rhea, wake up."

Rhea moaned slightly then opened her eyes. "Is it morning already?" sleepily, she said.

I smiled at her comment. "I'm very proud of you, Rhea." softly, I said. "You saved Gar from getting hurt, you are a hero."

Rhea opened her mouth to speak but I placed a finger onto her lips. "Don't tell anyone that there were bullets in that gun, okay?" quietly, I told her. "It would hurt your real mommy's feelings if she knew that."

"The bad guys want mommy back, don't they?" her lips trembling, she asked. "Please don't let them take her!"

"They won't get her with us around, I promise." touching her shoulder, I replied. "Want to go see her?"

Rhea eagerly nodded and I led her out of the room, down the hall where the others had gathered. "Did it work?" seeing Lyssa in the hall, I asked.

"It worked like a charm," smiling, Lyssa replied. "Chief Jones' hunch paid off."

"What hunch?" confused, Sarah asked.

"You had a trigger phrase," Geo explained, "which Hagen used to control you. Cait told us what it was, and we used it to shut down the mind-control system. Hagen won't be able to control you anymore."

"Is that why you told me to kiss you?" disturbed, Sarah asked.

Geo nodded. "That was your trigger. When I said it the first time, you went into a trance, ready for orders. If Hagen tries it again, he'll get a much different response from you."

Sarah nodded, looking relieved. "So I'm good to go?"

Ted smiled. "We'll let you see more of the place, but they're still looking for you at your apartment. By the way, somebody's waiting to see you."

Seeing the door open wide, Rhea rushed in with me following. "Hi, Mommy," giving Sarah a big hug, Rhea said.

"Hi, sweetheart," Sarah replied. she turned to me "Who's this?"

"My name's Clem," smiling, I said, "Rhea's brother. This is what I usually look like. Jessica was... something of a punishment. I called Lyssa by the wrong name."

"Tsk, tsk. You shouldn't have done that." shaking a finger, Sarah said.

"Yes, ma'am. Yesterday gave me some insight into what she went through all those years. It won't happen again."

"I like Jessica," Rhea said, pouting.

I chuckled. "I meant that I won't call Alyssa the wrong name again. Maybe sometimes, I'll let Jessica out to play."

"Yay!"

We all laughed, and Rhea told Sarah about the years since the Rodgers family adopted her. As we talked, we did not notice the others quietly leaving the room to give us a private moment with Sarah and her husband.
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Ted's idea.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
I later called home, getting mom who was understandably worried. "I'm fine, mom." still shaken by recent events, I said. "Rhea and I are at a... safe house with some friends from school. We're being watched over by the chief of police." it was the wrong thing to say and I wished I had worded it better.

"Why on Earth are you in a safe house!?" worried, mom asked. "I thought I told you and Rhea to come home the moment you saw trouble!"

"Rhea found her biological mother." bluntly, I replied. "She's in some trouble with the same people who were chasing after us in the mall."

"I see..." her voice shaking, mom said. "Can you give me any details?"

"Not over the telephone." sighing, I replied. "They are releasing us to you later this morning, we'll fill you in then."

"Very well, Clem." sighing, mom said. "Your father and I will want to hear every single detail, is that clear?"

"Yes, mom." quickly, I replied. "It is clear."

"We'll see you and Rhea tomorrow morning, then." said mom. with that, she ended the call.

I sighed as I placed the telephone receiver down. "She is so going to ground me." pouting, I muttered.

I was ripped from my thoughts when Cait's frantic voice echoed in my mind.

*There is going to be an attack at the school!* her panicked voice echoing, she called. *A gun man on a roof top, firing at all of us! We have to be ready!*

In the next breath, I heard Grace, Lyssa, and Garth screaming, "DAD!!"

I came out of my room to see Ted run up the stairs with Geo following. "What's wrong!?" concerned, he demanded.

We relayed Cait's message to him and he was about to grab his smartphone when a panicked scream was heard, it was Rhea and, knowing her abilities, I guessed she got the same vision as Cait. Lyssa was in Rhea's room in a heart beat with the rest of us quickly following to find Rhea siting on her bed. She was shaking, wide eyed, and terrified as she looked out into the distance, crying. "It's going to be okay, Rhea." as dad quickly walked off, dialing a number on his phone, Garth said. "My dad is the chief of police, he will stop this before it happens."

"What- What about the wolves?" still shaking. "Who will deal with them?"

Gar increased in size to the size of an Olympian and made a 'muscle' pose. "Who's afraid of the big bad wolf?" using a poor Arnold Schwarzenegger imitation, he asked. "I will pump him up!"

I knew that Gar was trying to cheer Rhea up so I decided to mimic his poses behind him to add to the humor. For a moment, Rhea looked at Car as if he was insane then giggled, seeing me behind him, making the same poses but with my significantly smaller body. The others soon followed and Gar turned to see me; I just smiled. "I couldn't resist."

Gar shook his head, smiling only that smile vanished when Ted walked back into the room. "Okay, everyone, listen up." sternly, he said. "I want all of you to act as if nothing is going on when you go to school but be ready for anything, understood!?"

Everyone nodded and got ready for school while Ted discretely took a hold of my arm. "I'll take you and Rhea home." quietly, he said. "Just tell your mom, Christina, that Tex says hi and she will understand."

I looked at Ted, stunned. "My mom was a member...?"

"No, she was not a member of the original group." motioning Rhea to follow, Ted replied. "She and her husband, David were unrelated street orphans twenty years ago; the two became our contacts as they seemed to have a knack of gaining information from the shady parts of the city." smiling, he added, "We called them Mr and Mrs Rogers to protect their identity and I guess it stuck when they later got married."

"They... They lived on the streets?" tearing up, Rhea asked.

"We did not know where they lived." sighing, Ted replied. "They were very secretive about that. However, they had since made a name for themselves, opening a law firm as they had unearthly experience dealing with the criminal element."

"I wonder...." smiling back, I thought.

With that, Ted led Rhea and I out of the house to his squad car.
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: preparing for school.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
I gasped as I saw the dashboard of Ted's squad car. "That doesn't look like the police cars they show on TV," I said.

Ted chuckled. "It's nothing like the cruisers any of my officers drive, either. This is my personal vehicle, customized by Megan's father. He was another member."

As Ted drove, I puzzled over everything I'd learned so far. The Problem Child Gang, the heroes of my favorite comic, were real. My friends were the children of the PCG. And my parents were involved in this, as well.

We arrived at our house. As we got out of the car, Mom came out to greet us. "Good to see you again," Ted said.

"Likewise," Mom replied. "How bad is it, Ted?"

"Hard to say. We may need to get the S.U.B. Station ready."

Mom nodded. "I've already pulled Clem and Rhea out of school. I'll be homeschooling them."

"From what Clem tells me, you'll be uniquely qualified." Ted left, and Mom brought us inside.

As soon as Mom shut the door, I asked, "Mom, how come you never told me the Problem Child Gang was real? Or that you were involved with them?"

"For the same reason we didn't reveal where we came from," she replied. "We were trying to make a home for ourselves, on a planet where the inhabitants had only gone as far as their own moon. It's quite a comedown from royalty, as you can imagine."

"So what happened?"

"We adopted the identities of young people, so nobody would be suspicious of our ignorance of the ways of this city. As we learned, we encountered certain persons who took great interest in the downtrodden."

"The Problem Child Gang," I said.

"Not just them, Clem. We encountered the criminal element, as well. There were many who sought only to exploit the weaknesses of others, and many others who regarded them with disdain." She sighed. "I won't go so far as to say I came to approve of the revolutionaries who drove us here, but I began to see their point."

"What did you do, Mommy?" Rhea asked.

"Your father and I began to study these criminals. When we saw that they trusted each other readily, we figured out a plan to bring them down. We would pose as members of the criminal fraternity, then relay what we learned to Ted and the others. They respected our privacy, and helped to conceal us where they could, passing us off as homeless when they told their detective friend about us."

"But what about the Agency?" I asked. "How much do they know?"

"Possibly more than they suspect. I can only say that, at the time, they figured out that someone was working on the fringes of the criminal element. If what you say about Rhea and her birth mother is true, they've begun tracking us through her."

That got Rhea scared. "Th-they're going to hurt me?"

Mom dropped to her knees to Rhea. "If they try, my little one, they will wish they hadn't," she said. "Your father and I can become creatures this world has never seen. Against us, they will learn what it is to be afraid for their lives."

Mom straightened up again. "For now, though, the two of you must learn more basic things. School is now in session."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: At home.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
Mom proved to be a strict but efficient teacher; she did not allow my focus to wander for a moment but her methods were fun and challenging. She incorporated our abilities into her lessons, showing us that everything she taught us was a very important tool to make our lives easier. I learned that, to grow hair, I had to know exactly what length to grow it too or I might make myself too hairy. "Good luck getting a date if you look like rug." smiling at me, she said.

Rhea giggled at that and mom turned to her. "You need to keep track of how much energy you put into using your powers, young lady." serious, she said. "A little power, used right, can go very far."

After nearly four hours with mom, she had us turn to a pair of computers where we spent another three hours completing lesson plans for the home school program. Thanks to mom's methods of teaching, it was almost too easy for Rhea and I, we finished the work in less than an hour. "Do not post that work yet." standing behind us, mom said. "Posting too soon will throw up red flags." she smiled. "Wait about an hour then post the work."

"What do we do till then, mommy?" curious, Rhea asked.

Mom smiled. "You continue to school with me." simply, she said.

Rhea and I both sighed but nodded as mom's lessons continued. When the school day finally came to a close, I looked at the time. "I have to go to work, mom." turning to her, I said.

"Okay, I'll drive you." smiling, mom said.

I smiled back, hoping to meet with Cait before we started work. After grabbing her keys, mom turned to me and smiled. "May I assume that Cait has finally taken notice of you?" looking at me, she asked.

"Am I that obvious?" blushing, I asked.

"I knew you had a crush on her for a while." patiently, mom replied. "That and I know that look in your eye, you took that job for more than some extra spending money."

"She and I share a... common trait." blushing more, I replied. "Only mine is due to 'puberty'."

Mom giggled. "You don't need to explain it, dear." kissing my forehead, she said. "Let's get you to work."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: The lessons begin

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
Mom dropped me off at the front entrance to the mall. "I'll ask to Cait drive me home when the work day is done, mom." getting out of the car, I said. "I need to do some shopping anyway."

"That's fine, dear." smiling, mom said. "Be safe, I'll see you tonight."

With that, she drove off and i walked into the Macy's entrance and reported to the office. "I'm here for my first day, ma'am." politely, I said. "Where would you like me to stand?"

"Good to see you, Clem." smiling, the manager said. "Place your belongings in one of the lockers in the crew room and I'll tell you what I want done with you."

After I placed my few belongings into a locker, I returned to the office to see Cait walking in. "I hope I'm not late, Clem." smiling, she said.

"You're right on time," said the manager. "Let me tell you what we're looking for from you. You'll be modeling our late fall looks. As you stand on the display, do not look at each other or touch each other. Remember, parents will be making the decisions on what to buy, and we want them to be able to see you as stand-ins for their own children."

"We understand." in unison, Cait and I replied.

As we stepped into our separate changing areas, I sighed. *I wish she hadn't said that.* slightly disappointed, I thought. *I'd like to tell Cait how I feel about her.*

*That's easier than you think, Clem.* echoing in my head, Cait's voice replied.

I gasped. *Y-you can read my mind?* thinking to her, asked.

*And look an hour into the future.* came Cait's reply. *And, for the record, I feel the same way about you.*

Moments later, we took our places at the display. *Cool.* remaining still, I thought. *We can have a conversation without anyone knowing.*

*I know,* mentally, Cait replied. *How do you like your hair?*

*It's okay, my mom made it for me.* thinking, I replied. *I wonder if it'd look better if I had a professional do it?*

*I'm going to my wig shop after work. If you want, you can tag along, maybe see if they have anything you like.*
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: At Macy's.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
I was enjoying myself, playing the role of a mannequin. Having Cait next to me was a definite bonus, it helped that I had some real company, someone who knew what I could do. We spent much of the work day in 'thoughtful' communication with the customers looking at us, none of them suspecting that we were real people.

Near the end of the work day, a disturbance caught my attention. Two teen boys were running through the store, pursued by a customer service representative. "Stop! Thieves!" she called.

*Should we do something?* curious, I thought.

*We can't,* ruefully, Cait replied. *We're supposed to be mannequins.* I heard her silently sigh. *I wish I could make them stop.*

Suddenly, I saw a distortion fly though the air, like heat radiating off a road in the desert. I was not sure where it came from but it hit the thieves, making them fall over as if they had been hit with a truck.

*Whoa,* surprised, I thought, *did you see that?*

*Yes, I saw.*

*Wonder what caused that?*

*I think... I think I did.*

This surprised me. *You didn't tell me you were telekinetic.*

*I'd never done anything like that before just now.*

I did not respond. Cait's new power seemed rather frightening but then I remembered mom's words when she talked to Rhea about the Agency. "Your father and I can become creatures this world has never seen. Against us, they will learn what it is to be afraid for their lives."

The possibility that I too could become such creatures frightened me as more. Once the work day ended, Cait and I decided to go shopping to ease our minds. We went to...
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: A surprise.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
The work day finally ended, and Cait and I put on our regular clothes again. "Who knew standing around doing nothing was so hard?" feeling stiff, I said.

"I know." tiredly, Cait replied. "C'mon, let's get our new hair."

When we got to the wig shop, we wound up with some clerk who seemed to know Cait from somewhere. From the sigh and impatient look she threw our way, I guessed it was not a pleasant meeting. "Hello," she said.

"Hello," patiently, Cait replied. "I'm thinking of getting a different hair color, maybe light brown. And my friend, here, would like something other than his homemade look."

"I'll see what I can find," she said. "Sir, why don't you have a look around, and see what interests you?"

Once the clerk left for the back room, Cait helped me shop for a wig that would suit me. I knew that Rhea would want 'Jenifer' to return every now and then so I looked at the wigs for girls as well as for boys. I spotted one that closely matched my hair color and thought, *Wonder how this would look on Jennifer?*

*Who's Jennifer?* asked Cait, in my head.

I jumped in surprise, momentarily forgetting that Cait could read minds. *I'm a shape-shifter.* thinking, I replied. *Rhea likes it when I turn into a big sister for her, and she's taken to calling me Jennifer when I do that.* blushing, I mentally added, *She wants me to be her a little more often.*

Cait smiled at that and I could only guess she was amused by the thought that Rhea had me neatly wrapped around her little finger. I was about to speak when the clerk returned. Cait pointed out a wig closer to Clem's hair and said, "I think I'd like one of those, too."

The clerk nodded and said, "Just let me see to your friend, and I can pick up both."

As she turned to me, I could sense she had ill givings towards Cait. I did not know why but I decided to let it go as she did not say anything rude. I got my new wig and we paid for our purchases. Once we were out of the store, Cait gave me the second wig she had picked out. "Jennifer should look lovely in this."

"Thanks." shyly taking it from her, I said. "So, what's next?"

"You can go home, if you like. I've got to go see Lyssa. She had a bad day today, and I want to see how she's doing."

"I'll go with you," serious, I replied. "For two years, when Lyssa needed a friend, I stayed away. If she needs some cheering up, I want to do my part."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: A wig shop.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
As we got into Cait's limo, I called Mom. "I'll be a little later," I told her. "My friend Lyssa needs some cheering up, she had a bad day today."

"Alright, Clem," she replied. "I don't recall meeting any friend of yours named Lyssa."

"She used to be Greg," I explained. "When she told me she wanted to be a girl, I didn't take it very well, and avoided her for two years. We're working on rebuilding our friendship. She's actually turned into a real girl, now."

"That's good to hear, Clem." I could almost hear the unspoken "About time, young man," "Tell Lyssa that I said hello, and that I'm glad that she got what she wanted. Goodbye."

As I hung up, I turned to Cait. "That sales clerk didn't seem to like you much."

She shifted. "I make her nervous, is all."

"How would you make her nervous? Does she think you own the store, and she'll be fired if she screws up?"

She swallowed. "Imagine that you didn't know what telepathy was, and a girl my age walked in and started arguing with nobody. What would you think?"

The implications sank in, and I gingerly touched her hand. "She thinks you're... ?"

Cait nodded, and took my hand. "And I can't tell her she's wrong, 'cause I don't know who she'd tell. We've got enough problems."

We arrived at Lyssa's house. Mrs. Vance opened the door for us. "Cait, good to see you. I like the new hair color." Turning to me, she said, "Clem, it's been a while."

I nodded. "Lyssa and I are working that out, ma'am. How is she?"

"Doing better. Garth was a big help for her. There have been a few more - "

Mrs. Vance was interrupted by her husband shouting, "Sam! Get down here this instant!"

I would have expected to see this Sam upstairs or something, so imagine my surprise to see a 2-year-old waddling on the ceiling. "I have fun," the kid replied. "I wike this."

"Sam," Cait said gently, "you don't look so good. How do you feel?"

Sam looked to her to reply, but started shaking his head instead.

"You'll feel better on the ground," Cait said, holding her arms under him. "Come down."

Sam floated down into Cait's arms. "You had too much blood going to your head," she explained to him. "It was making you dizzy. Don't do that again. You might get hurt, and we don't want that."

Cait placed Sam into Mrs. Vance's wheelchair, just as Lyssa came downstairs. "Hey, guys," she said. "Wow, Cait. With that new color, you look a lot like me."

Cait smiled. "That's why I picked it out. How you doing, cuz?"

"A lot better," she said, hugging Cait. Turning to me, she said, "I had quite a day today."

"So I hear," I replied. "What all happened?"

"Chief Jones and his men took down that guy who was going to shoot at us. Turns out he was Clarence Mayweather, one of the guys the original Problem Child Gang tangled with."

"We have quite the history," Mrs. Vance said. "He was the one who put me in this chair, trying to kill me."

"After that," Lyssa continued, "I got my first kiss from Garth."

"Congratulations," I said. "But you didn't get sent home because of a kiss."

Lyssa's expression turned serious. "A couple girls at school got jealous of all the attention I was getting, so they pulled my pants down in P.E. Don't worry, they've been punished."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Visiting Lyssa.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
"I'm glad to see you're doing alright," Cait said. "I asked Lilith to keep an eye on you, but I guess she ran into some problem."

Lyssa nodded. "She came over, too. She's a witch."

Cait frowned. "Lyssa, I asked for her help. Don't go bashing her."

"No, I'm serious. Lilith is an actual witch, and so is her mother. She used to be an associate of the original Problem Child Gang."

"So were my parents," I said. "Who was Lilith's mom in the stories?"

"Madame Vague."

"Small world," Cait said. "Was that blind post office thing on the level?"

"Yes, it was," Mrs. Vance replied. "Clem used it just the other day. When a message is left, we get a signal on our TVs."

Cait's eyes widened. "Wouldn't a text message be more discreet?"

"Probably. But cell phones couldn't do that yet, when we were out solving crimes."

"Maybe we should update that."

We talked for a few minutes more, until it got close to dinnertime, so we decided that we should get back to our own homes.

Cait's limo dropped me off at my house, but not before Cait and I shared our first kiss.
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Continue

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
I waited until Cait's limo was out of sight then walked down the path to my house when Mark Derringer, a known bully at my school emerged from behind a tree and roughly pushed me against it. "I haven't seen you at school lately, squirt." sneering, he said. "You're not trying to avoid me, are you."

"I have bigger fish to fry than you, Mark." darkly, I replied.

Mark was a tall and muscular boy with black hair and green eyes. Most just avoided him as he was a complete jerk, always picking on people smaller or younger than him. I was not scared of this musclebound buffoon, he was all talk. I was about to warn him off but I felt something strange. It was like you know something was not right but you do not know why.

"Back off my brother!" angrily approaching us, my younger sister, Alexandria said. "You don't want to make him mad, believe me!"

Mark, obviously not wanting to deal with two people at once, scarpered off.

"Are you all right, Clem?" turning to me Alexandria asked. I asked. then she whispered, "I don't know why you don't use those alien shape shifting powers of yours to make yourself a harder target for idiots like him."

I sighed as if I had explained this a thousand times. "Alexandria, you know very well why I don't." annoyed, I whispered back. "Using my powers in public is like throwing matches at a tank of gasoline." pausing, I asked, "Don't you think people might just notice if I change into a lion whenever I get jumped? Plus you are forgetting about mom and dad's enemies from 'out of town' and the Agency."

"I know, I know..." sighing herself, Alex said.

"Look, I wanted to smash him too." ruefully, I said. "Only, If you do, you only descend to his level." he then smiled. "Come on Alexandria, lets get back inside.

As we walked up the path to my house, the nagging feeling that something was not right still gnawed at me but I found it impossible to tell what was wrong. As we walked into the house, we were greeted by....
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Strange occurence.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
"What kept you?" Rhea demanded, as we entered. "We've had supper waiting!"

"Something came up," I answered. "Besides, it's not like you've been here alone."

Rhea then turned her attention to Alexandria. "Who are you? And why are you dressed like a girl?"

"Come on, Rhea," I told her, "you know full well she's a girl."

"Nuh-uh," Rhea insisted. "He's a boy. And he doesn't live here."

"Rhea," Alexandria said with a heavy sigh, "I've had enough of this foolishness. I'm your big sister, Alexandria."

Rhea stood there for a while, just staring at Alexandria. Then, suddenly, she reached out and placed her finger on Alexandria's forehead.

I heard Rhea's symbiont say, *See.*

Alexandria's eyes clouded over for a moment, then cleared. "Holy crap!" she said. "Where am I?"

All of a sudden, I realized that she wasn't my sister, after all. "You're in the Rodgers family house. How did you get here?"

"I don't know," she replied. "My-my name is Alexander Winters. I passed out, and woke up here, thinking I was your sister. How did this happen?"

"I have no idea," I told her... or, rather, him. "maybe Mom and Dad can figure this out. If they can't, I know some other people who can help us."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Rhea, tapping her foot.

choices: was killed last year; you're an orphan.
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
Rhea and I brought Alex to mom and dad where we told them what had happened. The two turned to each other curious then turned to us and a nervous Alex. "You have an extremely rare ability, young man." softly, mom said. "It is so rare that only one in two billion would have it."

"What- What do I have?" frightened, Alex asked. "Does it have to do with my black outs?"

Dad nodded. "It's directly linked to your blackouts, Alex." serious, dad said. "What you have is called Psychic Genealogic Fluidity or Psy-gen-flu."

"It sounds like a disease." wincing, Alex said.

"It could be seen as such or as a curse." gently, mom replied. "Basically, you are literally becoming a part of other families at random."

"Those families you merge with will see and treat you as one of their own with pictures of you, growing up, in their photo albums." serious, dad added. "It is a disorienting and maddening power, feel grateful you enter other families unaware otherwise, you would likely be half mad now."

Alex gulped. "Can it be controlled?" shivering, he asked. "I barely remember my own family."

"It is impossible to control without knowing what triggers the psychic connection with another family." looking at Alex, mom said.

"Clem was being picked on by another boy in our driveway before he ran from our house." after a thought, Rhea said. "Maybe seeing someone in trouble does it."

"That's it." giving Rhea an impressed look, dad said. "Feeling a deep sympathy or empathy for another has been known to trigger the psychic link."

"What about the black outs?" curious, I asked.

"Psy-gen-flu takes a huge amount of mental energy." serious, mom replied. "Alex most likely passes out due to the sheer effort his mind gives out."

"Excuse me but..." shaking, Alex asked. "... but how do you know all of this?"

Mom and dad both sighed. "Can you keep a secret?" with a deadly stare, dad asked. "Can you resist telling a single soul what we are about to share?"

"He won't tell anyone." placing a reassuring hand on Alex's hand, Rhea said. "He has a good aura."

"A good aura?" confused, Alex asked. "Who are you people?"

"Calm down." cooed mom with a slight smile. "We know of this condition because we have it as well."

"We found comfort in each other as we both had the same maddening power." taking mom's hand, dad said. "Can you imagine the odds of two people of this condition finding each other?"

"Not to mention the odds of a third person finding the other two." stunned, I added. "Why didn't you tell us?"

"We did, honey." with a rueful smile, mom said. "Remember us telling you how we used to live on the streets as kids?"

"They literally infiltrated the families of the criminal element." awestruck, I thought. "Unbelievable!"

"How did you finally control it?" tearing up, Alex asked.

"By discovering it was happening." serious, dad said. "Rhea gave you that realization through abilities of her own but I ask you keep that to yourself."

"Can you help me control it?" his lips trembling, Alex asked. "Please...?"

Mom pulled Alex into a hug where he silently broke down into tears. "This has been driving you mad." rocking Alex like a small child, mom said. then she softly added, "We will help you."

"The first order of business is to contact the boy's family." grabbing a telephone, dad said. "I can have the office track down his parents through his school records."

Hours later, Alex was talking with Rhea and I in the living room when mom and dad entered. "We found your family, Alex." flatly, dad said. "However..."

"However... what?" gulping, Alex asked.

Dad turned to mom who winced before she replied. "Honey, your family..."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Mom and Dad

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
Hours later, Alex was talking with Rhea and I in the living room when mom and dad entered. "We found your family, Alex." flatly, dad said. "However..."

"However... what?" gulping, Alex asked.

Dad turned to mom who winced before she replied, "Honey, your family... was completely unaware you were missing; they were unaware of who you are."

"What...!?" looking hurt, Alex asked. "They- They forgot about me!?"

"Alex, can you tell me when these blackouts started?" placing a hand onto his shoulder, dad asked.

"A few years ago." tears falling, Alex replied.

"That's not good." sighing, dad said. "My wife and I were lucky, we always managed to return to our families as we were aware of who we were but you kept losing your memory of your original family."

"How does that make his family forget about him?" worried, I asked.

"Alex has been jumping from family to family, returning to his normal life for only brief periods of time." patiently, dad replied. "Over the years, his psychic link to his original family corrupted and was lost, all memory, all evidence that he was once their son was forever erased from existence."

"This power is a curse!" crying, Alex wailed. "I'm an orphan!!"

"Can't he just use his power to be their son again?" curious, Rhea asked.

Mom sadly shook her head. "He could but it would not last very long." gently, she replied. "He would have to keep making himself a part of their family again and again for weeks to get them back." she sighed. "Unfortunately, because of how draining it is to the mind..."

"Any attempt to do so would kill him." turning pale, I said. "Damn, that sucks!"

"What am I going to do now!?" crying, Alex asked. "I- i have no where to go!"

"You could live with us." touching Alex's shoulder, mom said. "We can use our power to stabilize your own so you won't jump to another family."

"What do you say, Alex?" knelling in front of him, dad asked. "Want to be a Rogers?"

Alex responded by wrapping his arms around dad, crying uncontrollably on his shoulder. I exchanged smiles with Rhea as mom and dad then placed a gentle hand onto Alex's head. Only our smiles turned to looks of surprise as we felt a sudden rush as if the world itself had shifted slightly.

"What was that!?" startled, I asked.

"That was Alex permanently becoming a member of this family." catching his breath, dad said. "You will find the photo albums filled with pictures of him, growing up from birth."

Rhea looked hurt. "Why wasn't that done to..."

"We tried." gently, mom interrupted. "It did not work, likely due to your own power so we simply adopted you the regular way."

"All those within our little circle will know Alex was adopted." smiling, dad said. "However, to the world at large, he was born into this family."

I smiled at that but paused as a thought came to mind. "If he was 'born' into this family..."

mom and dad nodded. "He will discover this soon enough." smiling, mom said.

"Discover what?" curious, Alex asked.
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: A new brother.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
"You're changing," Rhea said.

Alex looked down, and saw his arms becoming tentacles. "What's happening to me?"

"Remember asking about my alien shape-shifting powers?" I said. "Now they're yours, too."

Alex looked at Mom, panic filling his eyes, including the new ones. "M-Mom?"

"It's alright, Alex," she told him. "Just calm down." She assumed her alien form. "Except for Rhea, we are Oltroxians. This is our natural form. If you calm yourself, you will be able to change back."

It took a while, but Alex did manage to calm down, and Mom guided him in returning to human form. When he did, he asked, "You guys are aliens?"

"Your mother and I are," Dad said. "You kids were born on this planet, so you're not technically aliens."

"We were the rulers of our world," Mom added, "until a revolution occurred. We were exiled to this planet, and we used our shape-shifting and reality-warping powers to fit in."

"You ever read the Problem Child Gang comics?" I chimed in. "They really existed, and Mom and Dad helped them."

Alex looked from one of us to another. "How much of this do the other kids at school know?"

"We're home-schooled," Rhea answered.

"We are now," I clarified, "but a lot of my friends from before are kids of the original Problem Child Gang, and they have powers of their own."

Alex sat down. "This is a lot to take in."

"And there's more coming," Mom said. "Oltroxian puberty is a little different from what humans go through."

I nodded, and took off my wig. "I'll take you to the wig shop tomorrow, after our lessons."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Alex starts to change.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
As I took Alex to his new room, I discovered how powerful changing reality was as my bedroom had already been rearranged to suit to boys as if it had always been that way. "No wonder mom and dad were both out of breath after they changed reality." stunned, I whispered. "The literally reshaped our entire world."

"Not exactly, Clem." kindly, mom said. "Those who do not know or have never heard of our family were unaffected as there is no need to. Your father and I only needed to change reality for ourselves and those who know this family."

"Why do I know Alex as adopted rather than a part of the family?" curious, I asked.

"Because we exempted you from that change, along with the other members of the Problem Child Gang." simply, mom replied. "The reason I did this is because there are a number of members who can see right through the reality change, such as Beth Vance, Lilith Nightshade, Caitlin Spencer..." I blushed at Cait's name and mom smiled. "The point is, we would have to explain the situation again and again to those in our little circle who can see through the reality change. It's easier to have them all see the truth and be told we changed reality to make Alex our son."

"That makes sense, I guess." shrugging, I said. I then turned to Alex. "Want to grab some pizza? I know you love that extra peperoni." I paused, surprised. "How did I know that?"

Mom laughed. "You are not completely unaffected by the reality change, dear." amused, she said. "You see, having 'grown up' with Alex, you would naturally know all of his likes and dislikes."

"This is deep." sighing, Alex said.

Mom nodded. "Just accept what you know and the rest will follow with ease." kindly, she said.

With that, she walked away as Alex sat onto a bed that had his name carved into the foot board. "At least I won't be jumping from family to family anymore." sadly, he said. "I just wish they could have done that with my real family." he sighed. "No offense... bro."

That got me thinking and I excused myself for a moment before walking to dad's study where I was surprised to find him waiting. "I guess you know what I'm about to ask." softly, I said.

Dad nodded. "We did not have the heart to tell Alex what really happened." sadly, he said. "We found his real parents but they were not alive."

My face turned completely pale. "What...."

"The hit was professional, we suspect the Agency was after him." almost whispering, dad said. "I have no doubt in my mind that they too have people who can see through local reality changes."

I gulped at that. "So you made him think they were still alive because..." I asked.

"The truth would have destroyed his spirit." serious, dad replied. "As such, your mom and I have just decided it would be in all of our best interests to join the other members underground as they will no doubt sense our reality shift and come searching for him."

"Underground?" startled, I asked.

"The Subterranean Urban Base station." patiently, dad replied. "It was only vaguely mentioned in the books a few times but not what or where it was."

"I see..." feeling sorry for Alex, I said. "When are we going?"

"Just as soon as everyone can get packed." serious, dad said. he placed a hand onto my shoulder, seeing me beginning to shake. "It will only be until we can deal with Sykes and the Agency once and for all."

"That could be years from now." tears falling, I said. "What of school, friends...?"

"You will be going to regular school as long as you stay on alert for trouble." smiling, dad replied. "Try not to worry, everything will work out, I promise."

With that, I walked back to my room to find mom talking to Rhea, she seemed upset. I guessed she did not like the idea of living underground. I sighed, knowing mom was better suited to talk to her than I and walked into my bedroom to tell Alex the news. He took it a lot better than I had feared and we began to pack. Minutes later, just as we were about to leave....
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Time to move.

choices: Call a member of the gqng.
Or send the gang a letter.
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
There was a knock at the door and dad looked out the window. He returned with a shocked expression.
"Boys, your going to need to run. Fin d the rest of the gang. Me and your mother will stall the Agency. Trust me it's for the best."
"How, how did they find us Clem?" I stood ignoring the question. Thinking what I would do now.
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: The Agency attacks.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
Alex made a noise, as if he'd been startled. I looked over at him, to see he now had a bald spot, and was holding a handful of what I knew was his hair. "My scalp itched," he explained. "I just scratched, like normal, but... "

I nodded. "I was asleep when my hair fell out. I'm sure Mom and Dad have a wig or two for you. They're homemade, so they'll look kind of rough, but they'll cover your head."

Nodding at one of my bundles, Alex asked, "What's with the girl's wig?"

"Sometimes, Rhea likes to pretend she has a big sister. Since I can change shape, I get to play Jessica for her. I'll bet Mom has a female identity picked out for you, too, so don't laugh too loudly at me."

Dad came up. "Ready, boys?" He saw Alex's hair. "Honey, Alex needs his wig."

"I had a hunch he would," came Mom's voice as she climbed the stairs. Walking up to Alex, she produced a hairbrush. "Don't fight me on this, Alex, we might as well get as much of this off as we can before we put your wig on."

Mom gave Alex a thorough brushing, removing about half the hair on his head. "The rest will come off in due time," Mom assured him. Then, she gave him his wig to put on. "I've received word from Ted. There are five families down below already, with more to come. Good thing the S.U.B. Station has so much room."

"S.U.B. Station?" Alex asked.

Dad nodded. "Subterranean Urban Base. It was always a fallback position for the Problem Child Gang. Now, it seems, it's time to fall back."

We all followed Dad to his den. It was the first time I'd ever been in that room, as Dad kept a strict rule about only going in if invited. Now, I could see the reason for such strictness, as he opened a secret door in his bookcase. As a kid, I would have played with that thing for hours, if I'd had the chance. "This way to the S.U.B. Station," he said. "This'll be our home until things are straightened out."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: Alex loses his hair.

1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.content:
The secret door led to an elevator, which we all boarded and rode down several levels underground. Upon reaching our destination, the doors opened and we all walked out onto a wide sidewalk next to a sheer drop down to a long run of subway tracks. "These tunnels, which run almost everywhere under the city, have been long abandoned and forgotten." calmly, dad explained. "There are no records anywhere of it ever existing, we made certain of that."

"You hope." frowning, I said.

Then, a towing man approached us with a small group following. I recognized many of them from school, they were my friends. I gave a shy smile as Mr Jones, the police chief took dad's hand and shook it. "Long time no see, David." shaking dad's hand, Ted said. "I just wish it was under better times." he then motioned to me. "I see you have added a new member to your family."

"This is Alex, our second born." surprising the group, dad said. "He has the same ability to change reality as Christina and I only he had no power over it."

"What do you mean?" concerned, Garth asked. "Was his power out of control?"

"He has the power to literally become an added member to any family with that family never aware he was an intruder as, to them, he was always one of them." serious, dad said. "My wife and I have the same power, we used it to infiltrate the criminal element when we helped the Problem Child Gang back in the day."

"Poor Alex was literally jumping from family to family, blacking out each time before entering and leaving." with a sad look, mom said. "He never had any memory of being a part of those families he visited but he remembered everything about them, not knowing why."

"That had to be maddening." wincing, Garth said.

"We managed to stabilize his power and changed reality so he was always and will always be our son." touching Alex's shoulder, dad said. he then sighed. "The reality holding him to his family had corrupted after years of constantly jumping around, they no longer know who he is."

"That's terrible!" stunned, Lilith said. she then paused. "Wait, why don't any of us know him as always being your son, Mr Rogers?"

"Because, with your powers, you or Beth, or Caitlin would have seen through the reality change and suspected Alex as an intruder." serious, dad said. "We exempted you and the others from the reality change so there will be no doubts that Alex is our son."

"Well, in that case, welcome to the substation, Alex." extending his hand, Garth said.

Alex smiled. "Thanks."
1132111222112122211121121112111121111111.title: In the S.U.B. Station

choices: I rush out to my sister's room
12.content:
I looked up at the clock and frowned, it was close to nine in the evening. Sumer vacation was almost over, I would be moving up to high school and, with any luck, lose my junior high title of being a 'problem child'. "I can't stand it when a kid is being knocked around and all the teachers do is watch." I said to myself. "Their job is not only to teach but help provide a safe environment for the students to learn." you sighed. "Someone has to stand up for the 'underdog'."

"A lot of kids look up to you for that, Gar." said dad, standing in the doorway of my bedroom. "I know a few teachers who think highly of you as well."

I turned to my dad, sighing. He was tall, very muscular, with short brown hair and brown eyes, like myself. At the age of 35, he was a captain in the Waterfront City police department, he knew how bad the streets and schools could get.

"Then why don't they step up?" I asked.

"They do, son." replied dad with a sigh. "Only they have to do so in a professional manner, they can't just step in and slap the aggressor silly as you do."

I shook my head. "Politely asking a bully to stop only works in fairy tales, dad." I stated. "I know, you told me a thousand times, I can't take the law into my own hands but you know me, I can't stand to see others suffer."

"That is a good quality, Garth." said dad, patiently. "I can see you as a fine police officer in the future but for now, please promise me... no more fights."

I knew that my dad was serious, he was tired of constantly getting calls from the school to be informed that I jumped into another skirmish on school property. "I promise there will be no fights, started by me." I said.

"We never accused you of starting the fights, Garth." said mom, stepping in. "You just can't seem to help trying to end them, we're afraid that one of the fights will involve a knife... or worse."

Mom was just as tall as dad but she was very petite with long flowing black hair and blue eyes. She had a figure most models would kill for and it annoyed me no end when my friends made verbal note of it.

"I can't just stand there and watch..." I said, tearing up.

"No more fights in school!" said dad, sternly. "I'm to the point that, when the phone rings, I'm going to hear that you had been stabbed or shot! How do you think your mom and I or your older sister, Grace would feel then!?" he shook his head. "I bust dirt bags on the streets every day! There are a few I would love to slap silly but I have to uphold the law, the same law you must follow!"

"Yes, sir." I said, softly.

Dad took a breath. "I know you want to help, son." he said. "But you are on a dangerous path right now, I do not want to be the one to bury you before it is my time."

"I understand." I said, crying slightly.

Dad, knowing that he was becoming overly harsh, walked away with mom soon following. "They don't understand me at all." I thought, turning of the light. "I only want to make them proud of me."

I slept uneasily that night, I kept feeling a tightness all over as if my own pajamas were trying to smother me. I woke up slightly in the middle of the night, hearing my bed and the floor underneath it moaning. At first, I thought it was someone trying to break into the house but I quickly drifted back to sleep, my dad's words echoing in my mind. "No more fights!"

I woke up the next morning, feeling refreshed and energetic. I could not believe how great I felt, despite the night I had and decided to take a shower. Dad had already left for work so it was just me, mom, and Grace. "Dad's only trying to protect me from harm." I thought. "I'll tell him that I'll try to break up fights without actually fighting."

Still half asleep, I turned on the water and disrobed to step into the shower. As I did, I caught a glimpse at myself in the mirror and thought I had seen dad. Looking closer, I discovered that the reflection was me!

Shocked, I screamed at the top of my lungs, shaking the room....
12.title: I wake up to a change.

122.content:
After I had finished screaming, I heard someone running to the bathroom door. It opened and I saw Grace hurry in to see me in my boxers. "Dad! What's wrong!?" she asked, startled and surprised. "I thought you had already left for work!"

"I know this sounds insane, sis but I'm not dad!" I told her, shaking. "I'm Garth!"
