Grace looked at me, unimpressed. "This is not funny, dad." she said. "You were really harsh with Garth last night, don't make fun of him, if he hears you..."

"You got to believe me, Grace!" I said, desperate. "I can prove I'm your brother, ask me anything!"

Grace rolled her eyes, thinking her father had lost his mind. "Okay, here is a question only my brother would know." she said, looking at me. "Who did I have a secret crush on when I was twelve years old?"

Knowing who my sister was talking about, I quickly replied, "Natalie Turner, who still lives next door. You and she have been secretly dating for the passed two weeks."

Grace's eyes widened before she gave me a warm hug. "Oh my gosh! It's really you, Garth!" she said, shocked as she released me. "What happened to you?"

"I.. I'm not sure." I replied. "I woke up like this, feeling more refreshed than I had been in a long while." I began to freak a little. "Sis, I'm scared, this doesn't normally happen to people!"

"Not over night, it doesn't." agreed Grace. she paused, wincing. "Have you been taking any..."

"You know I don't do drugs!" I said, annoyed. "Even then, nothing I heard of would do this over night!" I sighed, feeling guilty as Grace took a step back. "I'm sorry, I know you're just looking at all of the possibilities."

Grace sighed herself, shaking her head. "All of that extra muscle mass, growing so quickly must be sending your testosterone levels off the chart." she mussed. "I'd have yourself checked out at the hospital, if I were you, this could be the beginning of something worse."

"Or it could just be a freak hormone imbalance." you countered. "Let's just call the family doctor." I was not too keen on going to the hospital after the argument I had with dad the night before. "I guess I don't need to go to the gym today."

Grace shook her head. "This is nothing to take lightly, bro." she said, tearing up. "This could be life threatening." she then turned to the open bathroom door. "MOMMY!!"

Mom came running as Grace had not called her 'mommy' for years and never with such emotion. "What's going on!?!" she looked at me and screamed. "Ted!" she said surprised.

I began to cry as Grace shook her head. "That's not dad." she said. "It's Garth!"

Mom turned to me with the same unbelieving look Grace had, I knew I had to convince her fast. "Mom, you know I would never tell dad you had accidentally wrecked the other car last month." you said quietly. "He wouldn't believe me anyway."

Hearing my statement, Mom nearly fainted as I had taken the blame for wrecking the car. Grace's expression showed that she was stunned as well but she quickly recovered and gave mom a light shake. "Mom, whatever is happening to Garth could get worse, we have to get him to the hospital, now!"

Although mom was badly shaken, she ran for the phone. "Dad has the only working car." she said, picking up the receiver and frantically dialing. "Don't worry, Gar, I'll get you there!"

Who does mom call?
122.title: Grace rushes in.

choices: I had returned to dad's size.
1221.content:
Mom, not wasting any time, quickly dialed 9-1-1. At the emergency center, dad was doing a routine inspection when the call came through and he saw his home address on the computer as the emergency operator on the second ring.

"9-1-1, what is your emergency?" she asked.

"I need an ambulance at my address immediately!" said mom, frantically. "My son is having some sort of allergic reaction, his body is swelling horribly!"

Dad's face turned pale, seeing the address where the call was being made, then quickly put on a headset and keyed into the conversation as the operator replied.

"Please remain calm, ma'am." she said. "Is your son taking any insulin?"

"No, this has never happened before!" replied mom, now crying. "For the love of God, just send an ambulance NOW!"

"An ambulance is on the way, ma'am." assured the operator. "What is the boy's name?"

"He's my son, Garth Jones." replied dad. "My wife would not freak out like that unless it was a real emergency." he then took over the conversation. "Heather, it's Ted. Is Garth in any severe pain?"

"No, I.. I don't think so." mom answered. "I think he's just..." there was a pause followed by the sound of my screams. "Oh, God! Garth hang on!!" after that, the line went dead.

"Heather!?" yelled dad to the dial tone. "Heather!!"

He ripped the headset off of his head and ran out of the building to his squad car. His face was stained with his tears as floored the accelerator, his lights and sirens blaring. "Don't you die on me son!" he yelled, pulling out into the street. "Don't you dare die on me!"

Inside my house, I continued to scream in a panic as my body suddenly grew more, the floor cracking underneath me as I now looked more like a professional body builder from the Olympics. "Mom! Help me!" I yelled, panicking. "I feel like I'm going to explode!"

"That floor is going to give out any minute!" gasped Grace, backing out of the bathroom. "Garth, slowly walk towards me, get out of there before the floor breaks!"

"I... I can't move!" I yelled, crying. "Help me!!"

Just then, the floor gave way and I fell into the basement with Grace screaming my name. I hit the basement floor hard and let out a scream of my own as my body felt like it was literally on fire. Soon after, I heard the sound of sirens as the ambulance arrived, just after my dad had reached home. The last thing I heard before I lost consciousness was my dad calling out to me. "Hang on, Garth! We're here, we're here!"

Hours later, I woke up to find that...
1221.title: A growing emergency.

12213.content:
Regaining consciousness was a struggle for me as everything, inside and out was in torturous pain. It felt as if my body had been thrown into a giant blender and reduced to a pasty mess. I heard myself moan, which hurt my throat.

I think he's starting to come around." I hear one voice say.

"Already?" asked another, lower voice. "I guess you were right about him being tough."

I felt something cold touch my chest, causing me to moan again as even the slightest touch seemed to hurt me. "Sorry." said the low voice. "You are going to be very sensitive for a while." he paused then the cold object was lifted. "His heart rate has returned to normal, the worst is over."

I heard sighs of relief around me and then a 'beep beep beep' somewhere nearby. By this time, I was conscious enough to realize that it was a vitals monitoring machine which meant I was in the hospital. I tried to shift positions as I was very uncomfortable but it hurt too much to move and i moaned again. "He's starting to stir." I heard Grace say. "Garth, can you hear me, open your eyes."

I did my best to do so but the light of the room stabbed my eyes, causing another moan to escape my lips as I snapped them shut again. A moment later, I felt the lights dim and I made a second attempt. This time I was able to keep them open and my eyes soon focused to see my family looking over me, smiling with tear stained faces. "Welcome back to the world of the living, bro." said Grace.

"You gave us all a real scare, son." said dad. "How do you feel?"

I wanted to answer but it hurt to even moan. Still, I managed to quietly say two words. "All hurts."

Dad did not hear me and asked me to repeat it but mom cut him off. "He said everything hurts, Ted." she told him.

"You heard that from the other side of the bed?" asked dad, surprised.

Mom smiled. "When you work with children, sent to the ER for ten years like I have, you too will develop a good ear." she said. "I'm not surprised that everything hurts, he went from a size twelve to a size sixty and back in less than four hours." she managed a small grin. "Talk about a crash diet."

I weakly laughed at that but it came out sounding like a raspy cough, though I had a grin on my face. Seeing it, Grace smiled. "I'm glad that you can still laugh, bro." she said. "I know everything hurts so, for now, just listen." she turned to a person out of my line of sight. "Doctor Hagen..."

A man in hospital scrubs walked into my sight and looked me in the eye. "Yes, well you condition was caused by an unusual tumor that had grown onto your adrenal gland, causing it to constantly secrete both adrenaline and testosterone into your system." he explained. "Normally, such a condition would have killed a man in less than an hour but your body somehow adapted rather than falling into shock."

Hagen suddenly smiled as he took up a chair and continued to look me in the eye. "You see, we found evidence that your pituitary gland, responsible for bodily growth, had mysteriously gone into overdrive." he said, sounding enthused. "Also, we found evidence that your muscles had gone through intense hypertrophic adaptation..."

"You sound excited by all of this, doctor." said dad, unimpressed. "I'm more worried about the pain my son in right now."

"Of course, Mr. Jones." replied Hagen, standing up. "I will order another run of morphine immediately."

With that, he walked out of the room with mom following. "I'll make sure he gets it in quickly." she said, looking at me. "I'll be back as soon as I can."

Once she was gone, chasing after Hagen, dad shook his head. "You find a new medical mystery and the leading doctor is more worried about writing a paper about it than the patient who is suffering." he muttered. "Unbelievable!"

"I'll take first watch." offered Grace. "Mom is a wreck and you have to be back on duty in four hours, you should both go home and get some rest."

Dad shook his head. "I took my two weeks vacation early." he said. "But I will take mom home for some rest."

Twenty minutes later, I was injected with the morphine IV while mom and dad said their goodbyes, promising that Grace would stay with me. "We'll be back first thing tomorrow morning, honey." said mom."

"Take care, Garth." said dad. "We'll see you in a few hours."

With that said, they left the hospital for home to get some sleep.

"Gr... Grace?" I managed to say.

"Hush." said my sister, gently. "You need to rest."
12213.title: I had returned to normal.

122132.content:
I woke up several hours later with a low moan, still in pain, but I did not feel as bad as before. Grace, who was watching television at the moment, heard my moan and turned to me as I opened my eyes and saw her.

"Good evening, bro." she said with a smile. "Are you feeling any better?"

"Everything still hurts." I replied softly. "Just not as bad."

"At least you can talk better." said Grace. "You've been out cold for nearly ten hours, it's seven at night."

My eyes widened in surprise. "I slept the entire day!?"

Grace smiled. "Yep. I was scared that you had slipped into a coma for a while there." she paused. "Do you feel up to having something to eat, you haven't had anything since dinner last night."

"I'm not sure." I replied, wincing. "I don't know if anything will stay down."

"I could run across the street and get you one of those nutrient shakes." offered Grace. "You have to eat something, Garth, you need to build your strength."

I did not like the idea of Grace leaving me alone for any amount of time with that enthusiastic doctor Hagen running about but I was not about to admit it. "Maybe... Maybe I can try a hot bowl of chicken noodle soup." I said, trying to sit up. "The cafeteria should still be open."

"I'll give them a call." picking up the phone, Grace said.

She dialed the proper number and got the kitchen on the second ring. "This is Grace Jones in room 436." she said. "My brother, Garth finally woke up and he would like to order a bowl of chicken noodle soup." there was a pause before she then said, "I'll ask."

Grace turned to me. "Would you like some crackers with it?"

I winced. "Some white bread would be nice." I said, meekly. "Maybe some milk to wash it down."

My sister nodded then turned back to the phone. "He would like a few slices of white bread and a carton of white milk with his order, please." she said. "Me? Oh, I'll have the same, thank you."

After ending the call, she turned back to me and smiled as she found that I had managed to reach the bed controls and sat myself up. "It's good to see you sitting up after lying down all day." she told me. "You better try to get to the bathroom before your dinner gets here."

I looked at my sister, uncertain. I knew that she was right as it was try to get to the bathroom or have the nurses use some method to control it for me, which did not appeal to me at all. "I... I might need your help." I said.

"I'm right here, bro." said Grace, pulling the covers off of me. "I won't let you fall."

Slowly, painfully, I managed to slide off the bed and stand onto my own two feet. As I did, I gripped the bed rail and, without realizing it, I completely crushed the metal. Grace saw this and swallowed hard but she stayed right beside me, helping me to steady myself as I took my first step. I felt my knees shake as if I had never walked before. "I feel like a baby taking my first steps." i muttered, sourly. "This is so embarrassing."

"Your body nearly exploded due to a tumor on your adrenal gland, anyone else would have died from that, it's a miracle that you are even alive right now." said Grace, comforting me. "Look at yourself, your body returned to normal within two hours after the doctor removed the tumor. Such a shock to the body would have killed anyone else and here you are, ten short hours later, already walking to the bathroom."

I blushed brightly at that. "I didn't think about it that way." I said. "I guess I am very lucky."

Grace blushed as she pulled my drawers down and guided me down onto the toilet. "I'll give you some privacy." she said, after washing her hands. "Just call me when you are ready to go back to bed."

I nodded as Grace then left the bathroom and closed the door. Unknown to me, she looked at the bed rail and shivered. "What is happening to you, Garth?" she whispered.

Minutes later, I was back in bed, wondering why a section of my bed rail was wrapped in medical gauze. "It's for luck." Grace told me. she smiled then added, "It's a long story, bro."

I shrugged then turned as someone had knocked on my door...
122132.title: I learn that  I was lucky.

1221321.content:
"Room service." said a young woman entering the room with a food cart. "Hi, I'm Sarah. I heard that someone had finally woken up and is a little hungry."

"That's me." I said, shyly. "I'm not sure if anything will stay down, though. I'm still hurting pretty bad."

Grace giggled after turning to me. "Well I haven't seen you drool like that since mom last cooked her homemade pizza." she said, smiling. "Or are you finding the young Sarah here attractive?"

I blushed brightly at that as Sarah giggled with Grace. "I'm sure he's starving." said Sarah, pulling out a try with a number of covered dishes. "I'll get him his tray so he can start on his meal."

With that, Grace operated the bed controls, bringing me to a sitting position before pushing my bed try into place. "I want you to eat every last bite, Garth." she said in a motherly tone. "You need the nutrients if you are going to get better."

I smiled at that. "Yes, mom." I said.

"Don't you sass me, bro." warned Grace, with a smirk. "Mom and dad told me to make sure you eat."

I sighed, though still smiling, and lifted the cover off the main dish. The aroma that kissed my nostrils forced me to moan with a certain delight. Before I knew what was happening, I was hungrily (but politely) devouring the soup. As Grace worked on her own soup, she occasionally glanced over to me and giggled, seeing how hungry I really was.

"I think he's going to need another order of soup." she said.

Sarah, who was walking out the door whispered her reply. "There's twenty four hour take out restaurant just next door."

Grace nodded then quietly finished her meal as I did so about the same time. "I can't believe I'm still hungry." I said, hearing my groaning stomach. "That was a fairly good sized bowl."

"I'm not, those changes you went through must have burned an insane amount of calories." said Grace, looking at me. "Don't worry, as soon as mom comes to relieve me I'll run out and get you something else."

I smiled but it flattened as a thought came to me. "Um... Grace, what happened to all that extra mass I gained when I grew in size?" I asked her. "I mean, it couldn't have just vanished, it had to have gone somewhere."

Grace shook her head. "I'm not sure." she replied. "There was a lot of excitement in the ER while you were being treated, unconscious but you were back to normal when we were finally able to see you."

"Which means only that Dr Hagen can answer that question." I said, shuddering a little. "He seems too excited by my condition, if you can call it that."

"I'll talk to mom when she arrives." promised Grace. "Maybe she can get some answers for you."

Later on...
1221321.title: Dinner arrives.

choices: Garth uses his strength at home
Garth uses his strength at school
12213211.content:
I had been sitting back on my bed with Grace sitting on the chair next to me, watching a funny movie on TV, when both mom and dad walked in the room! That was a huge surprise!

“Hey there, champ!” dad said, as he walked in a slowly wandered over to the side of the bed, as he gently punched me in the shoulder. “I heard you gave mom and Grace quite a scare before she dialed 9-1-1 this morning!”

“Yeah… I guess…” I replied.

“On the other hand, I saw how huge you had become... some growth spurt, huh?” he laughed.

“Oh, yeah… Grace thought I was you!” I chuckled.

“Gar looked just like you, dad! When I walked into the bathroom, I thought you were standing there, brushing your teeth or something!” Grace added.

“Well, I’m happy to see that everything turned out okay…” dad said, just as the nurse walked in the room.

“Hello there, Mr. Jones! I came to check up on the vital signs before we could release you tonight…” Nurse Sarah said, as she walked up to the side of my bed. She dutifully took my temperature and my blood pressure. “Dr. Hagen would like you to come back on Thursday for some x-rays, alright? He just wants to make a follow-up appointment with you just to see that everything is okay!” she paused, then added, "It's amazing how quickly you healed up after you got a bite to eat... (giggle)... it must be the hospital food."

Everyone chuckled at that as mom followed nurse Sarah out into the hall to talk for a moment. Meanwhile, dad helped me gather all my clothes before I got out of the bed and took everything with me to the small bathroom where I quickly got dressed. A few minutes later, I was able to walk out of the hospital, along with my sister, my mother and my dad. What a relief! I couldn’t wait to get out of there!

It felt so good walking into my own bedroom about an hour later. I missed my computer, my X-box and my own bed! Not only that, but I was looking forward to taking a shower in my own bathroom again, and wearing my own clothes. The service in the hospital was great, but as the saying goes, “Home Sweet Home!”

A few minutes after I had gotten home, I noted that I had lost my watch. Grace and mom had helped carry my stuff into the house, and I figured that they may have dropped something when carrying stuff from the car to my bedroom. So, while wearing my shorts and a t-shirt, I quietly wandered out to the covered garage while the rest of the family was already fast asleep. I turned on the lights in the garage as I walked over to mom’s new Grand Cherokee SUV. I opened the passenger door and looked around, and I didn’t see my watch anywhere. Then, after I closed the door, I looked down and I spotted my plastic watch on the concrete floor, just under the front tire of the car.

As I walked over towards the front of the large SUV and bent down to retrieve the small watch, I held on to the front bumper of the vehicle. As I looked down, I noticed how easily I was making the large car rock sideways just by pushing gently against the bumper with my hand. That was strange. Didn’t a big SUV like a Jeep Grand Cherokee weigh something like over three-thousand pounds… or more?

I bent down and retrieved my watch, putting it around my right-wrist. But, before I turned around to walk away, I looked back at the SUV. The large vehicle just seemed very light. A thought had entered my mind to try something. For a moment, I thought the idea was very silly, but then again, why not? I noticed that the vehicle moved very easily, whenever I placed my hand against the side of it and even gave it a gentle push. It seemed as if it had become lighter to me. Could I even try to lift it, just for fun?

I walked to the front side of the Cherokee and I placed my hand under the bumper. Once I was certain I had a good, firm grip on the bottom part of the steel bumper, I flexed my arm just slightly in my attempt to lift up the front half of the car. To my big surprise, I was able to lift the SUV off the ground, high enough, so that both front tires were hanging suspended above the concrete floor of the garage!

“Wow!” I gasped, when I realized how easily I was capable of lifting the SUV.

I gently squatted down, allowing the front tires to touch the floor again. Then, I lowered myself all the way down, until the vehicle was resting back on the ground. I couldn’t believe it. Was it normal for a fourteen-year-old boy to have the strength to lift a SUV off the ground with one hand? I quickly turned around and switched off the lights before I walked back into my bedroom. I decided to keep this little experiment a secret for the time being. I didn’t tell anybody about this.
12213211.title: Mom arrives.

choices: Garth returns to school the following day
Garth tests his strength at the football field
122132111.content:
Just as I walked in my room, mom confronted me with another housework or yard work assignment, which was her usual thing to do on the days when I was home for a whole day.

“Honey, can you rake the lawn for me, sweetheart?” mom asked me with a big smile on her face.

“Aw mom… I just got home from the hospital and you’re already putting me to work!” I groaned.

“Don’t make a fuss, honey… And while you’re at it, try to get the baseballs and tennis balls out of the gutter, will you?” mom added, as she gently rubbed the palm of her hand over my chin. “I’ll make a big pasta and chili dinner for you, alright?”

“Great! I’m already hungry!” I sighed.

I walked out the door and as I headed out to the garage, I spotted all the leaves in the yard. I walked closer and exhaled, emptying my lungs as I was facing the lawn. I was surprised to see how the mighty gust of air which had escaped from my mouth had caused all the leaves to fly up and fly off to the corner!

“Wow! I didn’t blow that hard, did I?” I whispered to myself.

I took the rake in the garage and started gathering all the leaves that were scattered all over the lawn. Finally, when I had everything in one pile, I crammed all the leaves in the trash bag, which I left by the trash can. Then, I turned my attention to the gutters.

I wasn’t looking forward to getting the ladder out of the garage, and I was hoping there was a way I could just catch a glimpse of where the balls were, so I could fish them out of the gutter using the rake. I wondered if I could just jump high enough, so that I could see what was on the roof?

I took a few steps back and squatted down, before making my body leap straight up in the air. To my big surprise, I soared over fifteen feet into the air, before coming straight down on my feet again!

“Whoa! What the heck? I didn’t know I could jump that high!” I exclaimed.

I realized that if I could jump that high, I wouldn’t need a ladder to get on the roof. I could just leap from the ground to the roof!

I took a few steps back and then, with one mighty leap, and vaulted into the air, landing on the rooftop of my house!

“Darn! That was easy!” I chuckled, looking down from where I was standing. I must have leaped over twenty feet into the air! I wondered if I had broken any records by doing that.

I gathered the tennis balls and softballs which were stuck in the gutter, and I tossed them to the ground below. Then I used my mighty breath to blow the leaves and branches off the roof, before I easily leaped off the roof and landed with my feet on the ground below.

“Wow!” I laughed. If I can leap that high, I wonder how fast I can run.

Just for fun, I decided to go for a short jog. I was wearing my shorts and my tennis shoes, and nobody else was around to see me, and what my mom was concerned, I was still doing yard work, so this was a good time to have some fun with my newfound strength. I headed out the driveway and increased the speed, while going down the street and heading towards the main street. As I was running, I noticed that I was going faster and faster without even getting tired. In fact, it felt as if the muscles in my legs were actually up for the workout and liking it!

I was going faster and faster, almost passing the cars by! Fortunately, I was on a bike path, obscured by trees, so i really was not seen from the road. After a few minutes, as I came to an intersection, I realized that I needed to head back and cross the road. The red light was holding me back, and I had three lanes of traffic blocking me, so what to do? I did something crazy: I just leaped over the intersection! I figured that if I was strong enough to leap over a house, then I was strong enough to leap across an intersection as well. I vaulted over the street and landed on the other side, where the sidewalk was, so that I could run back. Again, fortunately, I was not seen as I momentarily looked back to find traffic was still flowing smoothly, no one had stopped.

When I finally made my way home, I hadn’t even broken out in a sweat and mom had no idea that I had gone for my 'light' jog down the street. The yard was all cleaned up and the gutter was cleared. Only now, I was absolutely starving!

"What a rush!" I whispered, happily. "That was incredible, I wonder what else I can do."

Upon walking in the door of the house, I reached down and noted that my quads and my calves were bulging with new layers of muscle. Wow… It was like these little workouts were just making me stronger!

Right now, I was happy that I was super strong. My biggest concern, however, was keeping this super strength a secret from my family, my friends, and my classmates in school. If that crazy doctor Hagen ever caught wind of it...
122132111.title: Garth uses his strength at home

1221321111.content:
The following morning, I was dressed, ready to go to my first day of high school. I was surprised to find that I was having a difficult time moving, as if I had pulled every muscle in my body. "I think I might have over did it the other day when I did the yard work." muttering, I said.

I shrugged it off and turned to leave my room only to find mom standing in the door of my room, blocking my advance. "Where do you think you are going, mister?" she asked.

Looking at mom, surprised, I replied, "Um... to school, where else?"

Mom shook her head and pointed at my bed. "One, school does not start for another two weeks." she said. "Second, as you put it, you just got out of the hospital so back to bed."

"You didn't seem this concerned when you had me do yard work yesterday." I grumbled lightly.

Mom sighed, looking guilty, then pointed down at my larger leg muscles. "That was before you suddenly gained muscle mass again, Garth." she said. "Grant you, its not nearly as bad as the first time but I'm scared that you might have a relapse if I push you, or worse, you push yourself." she paused. "Please go back to bed, dad and Grace have already given me the riot act for making you work yesterday."

I sighed, wanting to test my strength on at the school football field while no one was there. Only, I did not want to cause mom any trouble so I reluctantly nodded and changed back into my pajamas. "I feel just fine, mom." I told her, crawling into bed. "I just wanted to throw the ball around on the football field."

"We want our family physician, Dr. Stone, to give you a once over anyway." said mom, tucking me in. "He just got back from vacation, dad is on the phone with him now." she gave me a weak smile. "If he gives you a clean bill of health, you can go but not alone. I do not feel right with you having this... condition."

I winced at that. "Geez, mom, you make it sound like I have a disease or something."

"Garth, you went through something that would have normally killed any other man!" said mom. "You then literally healed overnight, even the wound from the emergency surgery to remove that tumor was gone!"

I swallowed hard. "Do you think I'm... still recovering?" I asked.

"I honestly don't know what to think, dear." replied mom, wearily. "Just promise me that you'll stay in bed until Dr. Stone has a look at you."

I sighed, feeling frustrated. "I promise mom." I said.

Mom smiled, looking relieved. "Thats a good lad." she said. "I'll be back in a few minutes with some breakfast, you just rest up until Dr. Stone can come see you."

With that, mom walked out of the room, turning off the lights and closing the door as she left. Once alone, you crossed your arms, frustrated. "This is fun." I whispered, sarcastically.

Then, a soft knock came to my door before it opened and in came...
1221321111.title: Garth tries to go to school.

12213211111.content:
"Hey, bro." she said. "Can I come in?"

"I guess." I replied, down hearted. "I'm not going anywhere for a while."

Grace frowned before taking a seat next to my bed. "We're just concerned about you, that's all." she told me. "When I found out mom had you rake the leaves and clean out the gutters, I went through the roof. We had to buy new pajamas for you."

"New pajamas?" I asked, confused.

Grace sighed and picked up my school shirt, all of the seams were torn out. "You are at least a size bigger than you were when you left the hospital." she said. "Doing that yard work caused your body to grow again, which is why dad went went through the roof and called Dr. Stone."

"You don't think that tumor has grown back already!?" I asked, somewhat alarmed.

"We don't know." replied Grace, tearing up. "The next time you explode like you did, you might not survive it." she began to sob a little. "You shouldn't have been released so soon but that Dr Hagen was getting too interested in you."

"You mean, you pushed for my release?" I asked.

"Dad pushed for your release as your body seemed to have healed completely." replied Grace, rubbing her tears. "But he then asked Dr Stone set up shop at the hospital in case you have a relapse of what had happened."

I wanted to tell Grace what I had discovered but I was not sure what it all meant myself. Then there was that Dr Hagen, so interested in my case. He was the last person I wanted to find out. Still I needed an ally, someone to help me.

"Grace, I don't want there to be any secrets between us." I said, finally. "But I want this to be just between you and me for now, okay?"

"Garth, you're scaring me." said Grace. "Don't do that."

"I'm scared too, sis." I said, honestly. "You see, since yesterday morning, I have been feeling as if I was going to jump out of my own skin. I think mom sensed that and gave me something to do." I shrugged, hiding my nervousness. "Maybe there's some left over testosterone and adrenaline in my system."

"Maybe." said Grace, nodding. "Only that would not explain how you had grown two full sizes in measurements."

"Did you inquire about what happened to the extra mass when I changed back to normal?" I asked.

"Dr. Hagen had no explanation for it." replied Grace. "He said it was yet another mystery surrounding your case."

I allowed my head to fall. "I see..."

Grace sighed then placed a hand onto my shoulder. "You are going to need a whole new wardrobe." she said, smiling. "What do you say to a mall trip with me and a few friends?" she paused, seeing my reluctance. "It will get you out of the house and allow you to show off your new buff look."

I blushed slightly at that. "Alright, I'm in but after I see Dr. Stone."
12213211111.title: Grace.

122132111111.content:
I was incredibly lucky. Dr. Stone was a busy doctor, but he would sometimes make house calls. You'd think he'd be worn out, but I'd heard a few mothers talk about how young he looked. "Hello, Garth," he said as he came into my room. "You look a little different from the last time I saw you."

"That's the problem," Mom said, over his shoulder. "A few days ago, he swelled to massive proportions. Now, I'm afraid it might be happening again."

Dr. Stone checked out my arms and legs. "Have you been ingesting anything unusual lately?"

"Not really," I replied.

"Not really? What does that mean?"

"Just... I'm a lot hungrier than I used to be. And I haven't... you know... gone to the bathroom since it happened."

"Have you tried increasing your fiber intake?"

"It's not that, Doc. It's like... I don't need to."

He turned to Mom. "Has he seen anyone else about this... occurence?"

"Just Dr. Hagen, at the hospital," Mom said. "We haven't been to see him since. He... made us all uncomfortable."

Dr. Stone nodded. "Well, Garth seems to be surviving. I'll tell you what. Come by my office Monday, and we'll do a complete workup. If anything happens before then come in sooner. Come see me, not Dr. Hagen." With that, he left.
122132111111.title: Dr. Stone arrives.

choices: Grace talks to mom back at home
Garth uses the weight bench in the gym
1221321111111.content:
Later on that afternoon, mom gave Grace her credit card so she could go with me to the mall to buy some bigger clothing. We decided to go to the large sports store, where they had some sweats on sale. I found the largest sweat pants and shirt and I walked over to the counter to pay for them when something caught my eye.

"Look at these cool new treadmills!" I said to my sister, as we walked past their latest models. I was only wearing shorts and sneakers and a tank top, so I decided to try out the treadmill just for fun.

I stepped on the machine and pressed the start button. As the belt below my feet began to move, I started walking. I quickly accelerated and turned the walk into a light jog. A few seconds later, I was running. I was going faster and faster. It felt awesome!

"Garth! Get off that thing!" Grace shouted. "You're still recovering from your illness!"

I quickly began to hit the brakes and started to slow down until the treadmill came to a complete stop. Then I hopped off and walked up to her, when it happened again!

I felt that weird tingle in my legs. It wasn't painful or anything, just weird. I let out a soft moan, which Grace noticed as my calves ballooned out from the back of my legs and grew to the size of melons! My skin was paper thin and veins started to pop out all over them! Next, my thighs began to swell, as they expanded sideways and thickened in every direction. Within seconds, my legs had become twice as thick as they were before, and they were absolutely bursting with muscle! I felt like I was walking on rocket boosters!

"Garth! Your legs! Look at you! You spent three minutes on the treadmill and your leg muscles just exploded!" Grace gasped. "We need to tell mom!"

Oh boy... At least, we may have figured out what had caused my muscles to blow up. I didn't mind it. I use my muscles all the time! So am I gonna be a Hulk from now on?
1221321111111.title: At the mall

12213211111111.content:
The second we got inside, Grace shouted, "Mom, we've got a situation!"

"What is it, dear?" she asked as she walked into the family room. Then, she saw me and my legs. "Oh, dear. What happened?"

"Garth got on a treadmill," Grace answered. "He only used it for three minutes, but this was the result!"

Mom thought for a few moments. "Okay," she finally said, "we'll need to call Dr. Stone. First, though, I have an idea."

"What?" I asked.

"If exercise builds your muscles," she explained, "perhaps a lack of exercise will shrink them. Until further notice, Garth, I want you to stay in bed. You can only go as far as the bathroom, if you need a shower, or if you finally need to use the toilet."

I didn't like the sound of that. "What am I supposed to do then?"

"Garth," she said, "I'm ordering you to get in bed, where you are to do nothing but watch TV and play video games. If you think this is a punishment, I'm sure none of your friends will see it that way."

She was right about that. I knew nobody else would hate the idea of doing nothing all day. But, while I was afraid of my body's newfound tendency to hulk out, I wished I could get at least a little exercise in.
12213211111111.title: Grace talks to mom back at home

122132111111112.content:
I was not as lucky as the last time, Dr. Stone was not able to make a house call for seven days but he agreed with mom that I should stay in bed and do nothing until he could come and see me again. With just a little over a week left of summer vacation, the last thing I wanted to do was stay in bed all day. I still felt as if I was going to literally jump out of my own skin and with my forced inactivity, that feeling was steadily increasing, driving me utterly mad.

"I'm going stir crazy!" I yelled, more to myself. "I need something to do!"

Then, a knock came to my door and dad walked in with a gentle look on his face. "Hey, sport." he said. "I heard you've been thrown into 'jail'." he chuckled.

"It feels like jail, dad." I replied wearily. "I'm going nuts, just lying around."

Dad nodded. "I spend several weeks in the hospital when I took a bullet in the back in my rookie years." he said. "The slug barely missed my spine but I was still unable to move for a good fourteen days, it was maddening."

"So you do know how I feel." I said, grateful. "How did you deal with it?"

Dad looked around as if he was about to do something he shouldn't then handed me a number of DVDs. "I watched a lot of science fiction and horror movies." he replied. "These are all rated R but I think what you are facing is nothing compared to the content of these classic flicks."

Curious, I looked at the titles then turned back to dad, amused. "These movies might have been rated R when you saw them, dad." I told him. "But they are nothing when pit against todays horror flicks." I took a hold of his hand. "Still, these are true classics, thanks, dad."

Dad smiled. "You're welcome, Garth." he said. "Maybe I'll come in and watch one with you tonight over supper."

"Sounds great, dad." I said, smiling.

Dad returned my smile then patted my shoulder as I released his hand. "We'll talk more later, son." he said. "I have a mountain of paperwork to do."

With that, he left. For nearly an hour afterwards, I was alone until mom came in with lunch on a tray with Grace right behind her. "Who are you feeling, Garth?" asked mom. "I made your favorite, PB & J on toast."

"I feel like I'm in jail." I replied, pouting. "It's summer vacation..."

Mom sighed. "I know this is hard on you, honey." she said. "We're trying to make you as comfortable as we can."

"I don't blame any of you." I said, honestly. "It's just that, well..."

"You're used to being a lot more active." said Grace.

I nodded. "Yeah."

Mom gave me a sympathetic smile then giggled as she spotted the DVDs. "I see dad loaned you his favorite classic movie collection." she said. "They might be old but they have great plots."

"You saw them too?" I asked, surprised.

"Who do you think watched them with him?" she asked. "We were just dating at the time." she blushed. "He proposed to me near the end of the horror/suspense movie, 'A night in nightmare maze', starring Pierce Hawk and Lady Jay Bee."

"That is a great movie." I said, smiling suddenly. "A man and woman find themselves prisoners of the local mob inside a hotel that had been converted into a sadistic death maze. They had until daylight to escape when a deadly nerve gas would be pumped into all of the rooms and halls."

"I don't care much for horror movies." stated Grace with a shiver.

I smiled. "This DVD has the bloopers reel included." I told her. "It really takes the edge off the move after you watch it."

Grace looked at me, curiously, then giggled. "I might watch it then, but after the blooper reel."

"Tonight, maybe?" I asked, hopefully.

Grace nodded. "Maybe."
122132111111112.title: Life in bed

choices: Garth goes to the gym and hulks out again
Garth goes to school and hulks out when bullied
1221321111111121.content:
Grace had finally left me alone in my bedroom as I lay there on my bed like a boy who had come down with the flu or something, even though I was perfectly healthy and fit. In fact, I was more than healthy, I was super strong! Even as I pulled up the covers of my bed, I saw my thick, muscular legs. I ran my hand over my quads and smiled as I felt my thick, hard legs. If only I knew how to make them shrink back to normal again…

As time went by, I started getting very bored. I heard raindrops falling on the roof of the house, indicating that a rainstorm was starting to pass over the area. Great… Now there really was no other reason to go outside anymore. So, I may as well just stay inside after all. Oh well… Normally, when the weather was bad, I would just crawl in bed and fall asleep. There was just something about the sound of rain. As the rain intensified and I saw flashes of lightning and I heard rumbles of thunder, I figured that I may as well try to get some sleep.

I turned to lie on my side and I clenched my pillow, before I glanced at the clock. It was about 4 in the afternoon, so what I was hearing was that typical afternoon thunderstorm. The next thing that happened was that I dozed off into a deep sleep…

When I opened my eyes, the first thing I noted was that it was dark everywhere. The window was open but it was also dark outside! Holy smoke! I glanced at my digital clock and I saw that it was about 8:30PM! Wow! I had been asleep for the past 4-and-a-half hours!

I walked over to the bathroom when I noticed something odd about my reflection in the mirror: My hugely muscular legs had returned to normal! That was it! Sleeping for a few hours had gotten rid of my hulking muscles! I didn’t have to stay locked up in my bedroom anymore! YAY!

“Mom! Mommmm!!” I cheered, as I rushed out of my room and ran into the living room. “Look! I’m normal again!”

Mom, Dad and Grace looked at me with sighs of relief.

“You’re back to normal! So what did you do?” Mom asked me.

“I fell asleep on my bed! I just took a nap and when I woke up… Those huge muscles were GONE!”

“Well we’ll just have to let the doctor know! Very good!” Mom said.

What a relief. At least now I had an idea of what would cause me to grow big and how to make my muscles shrink back… by sleeping!
1221321111111121.title: Garth makes an important discovery

12213211111111212.content:
Early the next day mom and dad reluctantly allowed me to got to school to throw around the football as long as I took Grace along to watch over me. I felt like a child, having to always have my older sister with me everywhere I went but I agreed as it got me out of the house for a few hours. As we walked with our back packs over our shoulders, Grace insisted that we take our time walking to the school to prevent any 'hulking out'. That annoyed me no end as I still felt as if I was on the mother of all sugar rushes.

"I know that this is killing you, Gar." said Grace as we finally reached Goliath High School. "Just try not to hulk out too much, the fewer people who know about you medical condition, the better."

The football field was outside the school gates and was free for anyone's use when school was out. I pulled my football out of my pack pack and lightly tossed it to Grace. Only lightly to me now was like a heavy throw to Grace and she grunted slightly, catching the ball. "Easy, bro." she scolded, rubbing her chest. "That hurt."

"I... I'm sorry." i said, blushing. "I did throw it lightly."

"I believe you, Gar." she said, tossing the ball back to me. "Try throwing it as if you were..." she then blushed. "...as if you were tossing it to a toddler."

I smiled at that but wiped it off my face when i saw she was being serious. "I'll try." I said.

I then very lightly tossed the ball, as if it were made of glass and Grace caught it with less effort this time. "Much better." she said. "It seems as if your natural strength is growing with each 'hulking' experience."

"It looks like we're starting to piece this puzzle together." I told her. "Hopefully, we'll get the whole picture soon."

Grace smiled. "One piece at a time." she said. "Let's see where this one fits."

I laughed at that. "With our luck, its a corner piece."

Grace laughed but but froze as she saw two boys walking onto the field, carrying baseball bats. "Gar, we have some bad company coming." she said.

I turned and inwardly moaned, seeing two of the school's biggest bullies walking towards Grace and me. They both worked for a local gang in the city, roughing up kids for money in a secret protection racket. Of course, no one could prove it, these boys were as slick as they came. The students they could not control out of fear, they paid off. Only two refused to back down, either way, me and Grace.

"It looks like cash time as come early." said one muscular boy. "What do you say we give them our new offer, Clyde?"

"I think they'll really like our new offer, Kyle." said Clyde with a smirk. "It's our new family policy."

"What are you two idiots blabbing about?" I asked, annoyed.

"It's simple really." said Kyle, grabbing Grace's hair. "You pay up or we make her life... uncomfortable."

Grace screamed as Kyle forcibly dragged her by the hair around the corner of the school, two steps away, out of my line of vision. I had no idea that she had a few surprises of her own for Kyle.

"Pay up or my associate will make your sister's face look like raw hamburger!"

My eyes narrowed with a primal sort of rage and I felt the tingling sensation growing again, only this time, it was everywhere and, at the time, I had no intention of stopping it. I felt my calves and hips grew at an alarming rate as my biceps and triceps grew with them, forcing Clyde to take a step back, his face turning an ashen white.

"Um.... Kyle..." he said, hoarsely.

I heard Grace screaming and thought she was in danger, little did I know she was giving Kyle the beating of his life with moves she had taught herself watching Kung-Fu movies. Seeing him being kicked to a pulp by Grace, Clyde knew he was on his own and turned back to me, shaking his head, terrified. Fortunately for me, I could smell marijuana on his breath and assumed that Kyle was high as well.

"I am having a very bad week ." I told Clyde, smiling slightly. "You would be wise not to anger me today."

"You got it." said Clyde, his voice high in fear. "No problem, we're out of here."

With that, he ran off and you turned the corner to find Grace giving him one last kick to the gut, sending him stumbling backwards, you caught him. "I think you are confusing us for someone else." I said, calmly.

Kyle took one look at me and ran off, screaming. As I watched him run off in a panic, I turned to Grace. "Are you okay?"

Grace nodded. "Just annoyed." she said. "What a bunch of jerks."

"You're fine then." I said with a sigh. "That's a relief."

I took in a cleansing breath and slowly let it out. As I did, another piece of the puzzle was found as Grace watched my muscles return to normal. "Gar, you returned to normal." she said. "That relaxing breath must have helped."

"I remembered a relaxation technique the school councilor tried to teach me last year. "I said, blushing slightly. "I guess it really does work." I then sighed, pulling out my cellphone. "We better report this."

The second I said that, Grace ripped out her own cellphone and started dialing. Who called dad first...?
12213211111111212.title: Bullies bring out the Goliath in me.

choices: I spot a kid getting bullied in school
I spot a kid getting picked on while walking down the street
122132111111112122.content:
I took my cell phone and immediately tried getting a hold of mom, but all I got was her voicemail. I knew that mom was either talking to someone else or she was busy doing something for work. Meanwhile, as I just hung up, since I hated leaving voicemail messages, I saw that Grace had better luck than me, and she was already involved with a conversation with dad.

“Dad? This is me! I’m at school with Gar! We were just tossing the football around when two thugs approached us and started threatening us near the back of the main building. Yeah… Well, Gar Hulked out again and scared them away! Yes, it was amazing! Well, they started pulling my hair and they wanted money, but they freaked when they saw Garth’s muscles blow up! No… They won’t tell anyone… They were completely stoned! You could smell the drugs from a mile away! Nobody else saw us! Yes, we’re alright… Garth is fine, his muscles returned to normal… Yes, we’re coming home right now… Okay, bye… Love you dad… Bye!”

I just stared at my sister for a moment.

“That took a lot of guts, you know? Telling dad everything that happened!” I said to her. “I’m so proud of you, sis!”

“Well, I feel much safer being around you, now that I know how strong you are! But, I feel better if we went home…” she replied.

“Alright…” I sighed.

I reached out and held her hand. I know it made her feel better. Then we walked home, brother and sister, hand-in-hand. I was going to protect her, and anybody else who was dear to me. I realized that now that I had this strength, that I was going to put it to use and protect those I love and care for.

I had a new purpose.
122132111111112122.title: Garce calls dad.

choices: Garth performs other heroics after school
Garth performs other heroics at night
1221321111111121222.content:
“Honey, can you run down to the convenience store and pick up a gallon of milk?” mom had asked me, just as I had taken my seat on the couch. I wanted to enjoy the basketball game on TV, but mom had other plans. She just loved giving me stuff to do whenever I just wanted to sit down and relax.

“Oh mommmm!” I whined. “I thought you just went grocery shopping!”

“I know honey, but I forgot to pick up a gallon of milk! Please…” mom pleaded.

I decided to put on my gray sweat pants and my gray sweater. That way, I could pull my hood over my head in case I didn’t want to be recognized. Not only that, but the pants were big and so was the sweater. I put them on, on purpose, in case I needed to… Hulk out.

I walked out the door and slowly made my way down the street to the main road which leads to the busy intersection where the convenience store was. Since it was quiet and there weren’t a lot of cars or people out, I decided to take a shortcut and cut across an alley between the tattoo parlor and an Italian restaurant. The alley was dark and quiet, and it only had a few trash cans and a large garbage bin there.

Suddenly, my quiet stroll was interrupted when at the end of the alley, I spotted three men. Two men were questioning a third guy. In fact, it almost looked like a robbery!

“Listen, man! I don’t have any money!”

“Hand over the cash, you twerp! Or you’ll be bleeding home tonight!”

“Leave me alone!”

The second man made a fist and punched the man, who was pushed up with his back against the wall, straight in his stomach.

“AAAAAOOOUUWWWW” the man cringed in pain.

I saw it all from a distance. These guys were robbing him. Anger flared up inside of me. My breathing increased. I hated what I saw. It pissed me off. My muscles… I felt it again. My muscles were inflating. I could feel it. The anger was causing it.

“HEY!” I shouted at the thugs.

The two men turned and stared at me.

I slowly walked closer to them, as one man held the third with his hand against his chest, pushing him against the brick wall.

The second man stepped away and turned towards me.

“Get lost, asshole!”

“No! You leave this man alone! NOW!” I shouted back.

I put my hood over my head. That way, nobody knew who I was. They couldn’t see my face.

The man walked over to me and made a fist. He swung his fist and struck me in my stomach. It hurt, but he didn’t hit me hard enough.

The pain made me angry. VERY angry. I wanted to kick him into next week but I found that my muscles would not respond, I was basically immobilized. "What the hell!?" frustrated, I thought.

Then it hit me, my powers had a 'safety switch', they would not work when I was furious or emotionally distraught. That was why I could not move to leave the bathroom when I panicked and why I could not move now. "I need to relax and fast." taking a deep breath, I thought. "Otherwise, I'm a sitting duck."

Fortunately, the relaxation technique I had learned worked. Seconds later, my muscles were on FIRE. They were burning as everything inflated with outrageous size and strength! Luckily, thanks to my over sized sweat pants and sweater, the thugs couldn’t tell.

“Arrrrrrggggg” I growled, as I felt my entire body fill up with amazing physical strength.

It was game over for the thugs. The most beautiful part was that they didn’t know it yet. I was keeping my muscles hidden. Nobody knew who I was. I was going to hit these guys like a freight train. A tornado is going to strike the alley and it had my name on it.

I grabbed the man’s arm and I hurled him through the air, making his body sail through the air until he landed into the large trash bin, a few yards away.

Then, I turned and walked towards the second thug, who was busy robbing the man against the wall. He let go of the man and turned towards me, pulling out his knife and aiming it at me as he tried to take a few swings at me. I was unarmed, of course, so I all I could do is try to evade his swipes. Then, I kicked the knife out of his hands with my shoe, making him drop it on the floor. When he tried to reach down to pick it up, I quickly made a fist and punched him in the jaw, sending him flying into the trash bags, which were piled up in the corner.

Meanwhile, the other man had climbed out of the garbage bin, and tried to attack me from behind. He snuck up on me, and wrapped his arm around my neck. He held me only for a few seconds, trying to put a choke hold on me, when I just used my upper body strength to lunge forward and to cause him to fly over me and to fall face down on the concrete before me. He fell down in a daze, giving me enough time to run over to the man who was about to get robbed.

“Are you alright?” I said to him.

Poor kid. He was just a teen. He was being robbed for just twenty Dollars.

“Get outta here! Go home!” I ordered him.

“Who… Who are you?” the teen asked me.

“I’m just a friend…” I replied. I felt like an unknown, masked vigilante who saved the kid’s skin that night. But, I wanted to remain anonymous, and I certainly didn’t feel like revealing my identity.

Just then, I head police sirens approaching the alley.

I turned around, and I leaped to the rooftop with one mighty leap. From the edge of the roof, I could spot the police cars below. The cops arrested the two thugs and they took the teen to the hospital for a checkup.

After the police cars had left, I leaped down from the roof and I finally made my way to the convenience store, where I bought the gallon of milk. I took the normal route home and I arrived at the house, to mom’s many questions to why it took me over an hour to buy a gallon of milk at the store which was only five minutes away from the house.

“I got held up… I just ran into some friends…” I lied. I wasn’t in the mood to explain.

Meanwhile, the teenager was explaining to the officers how some guy wearing gray sweats had easily overpowered his two assailants using amazing physical strength…
1221321111111121222.title: I spot a kid getting picked on while walking do...

12213211111111212222.content:
That night, I cringed slightly as the top story on the news was of a mysterious muscular man saving the life of a local teenager who described exactly what I was still wearing. Fortunately, only Grace was watching the news with me at the time and threw me an annoyed look.

"So, you ran into a few friends, huh?" she asked, sarcastically. "If mom and dad see this, they'll go through the roof."

I was about to answer when I heard mom scream from the garage. "Ted, get out of there, the jack is slipping!!"

My heart immediately went into my throat and I ran towards the garage. The thought of dad being crushed under the family SUV ran through my mind as my muscles reacted to my emotions, making me look like I did when I first changed that fateful day. Too worried about my dad, I charged right through the door, turning it into splinters and caught the bottom of the car just as the jack fell. Dad let out a startled scream, raising his arms in a vain defense as mom screamed as well.

"It's okay, dad." I said, quickly. "I got it."

Dad opened his eyes, sweat beading on his forehead, as he saw that I had hulked out and was now easily holding the entire side of the car up, away from him. An unsteady sigh of relief escaped his lips. "Thanks, son." he said, shaking. "You just saved your old man's life."

"You would have done the same." I said, quietly, blushing.

Dad rolled out from under the car and chuckled. "Within my power, I would have." he said. "Think you can hold the car up for a few more minutes?"

I smiled. "No problem, dad." I said.

"Thank you, Garth." said mom, finding her voice. "I don't know what I would do if I lost any of you."

"Well, we won't find out today." said dad, smiling. "Why don't you go and start on supper while Garth and I finish up fixing the breaks and changing out this flat, I need to have a talk with him anyway."

Mom, still shaken nodded then walked back into the house. Once she was gone, dad got to work on the car while I continued to hold it up. "I'm very proud of you, son." he said. "I heard of your efforts to save that kid on the police radio."

I cringed slightly. "You... you heard about that, huh?"

Dad chuckled slightly. "I head about it but I did not really know it was you until you just confessed." he said. "I did not become captain of the local police department by good looks alone, you know."

"I swallowed hard. "So what's my punishment?" I asked.

"I'm not going to punish you, Garth." said dad, serious as he continued to work. "I'm going to train you."

To say I was surprised was an understatement. "Train me for what?" I asked.

"Well first, discipline." replied dad, placing the fixed tire into place. "Before this, I was sacred that you would get hurt, now I'm scared that you are going to hurt someone else. Without control, your colossal strength is going to make you very dangerous."

Dad motioned me to slowly lower the car, which I did, finishing the repairs then took a moment to study my face, as if waiting for me to ask what was on my mind. "How are you going to help me find control?" I asked.

I was expecting dad to explain something drastic, like shipping me off to some ancient temple in the high mountains of the Himalayas but he caught me by surprise when he replied, "As of this Saturday, your ass belongs to me in my own style of police boot camp! For the next three weeks, your life will be a living hell as I mold your sorry civilian carcass into a fine tuned machine!"

I grinned as that was exactly what I wanted, a way to master my new found power. "But how will we do this without anyone, especially that creepy Dr Hagen finding out?" I asked.

"You let me worry about that, son." said dad with a smile. "I know you are going crazy, wanting to see how far your powers can take you but I want to keep this all on a controllable level, understand?"

I nodded. "Where do we start?"

"We start by agreeing not to tell mom or your sister." said dad. "Both of them will 'kill' me if they find out I'm doing this."

"I guess that makes sense." I said, wincing.

By this time, my muscles had returned to normal, now that I had discovered relaxing myself brought myself back to normal, and dad gave me a one armed hug. "Mom and Grace tend to overly worry, son." explained dad. "I promise I will tell them both when the time is right."

I managed a weak smile. "Okay, dad." I said. only I was not about to promise him anything along those lines, it did not seem right somehow.

Unknown to dad and I, while he went over his plans of how to start my training, Grace went to mom, looking very pale and concerned. "Mom, I need to talk to you." she said.

Mom turned to Grace and saw her concern. "What is it dear?" she asked. "Are you feeling ill?"

Grace began to cry. "Mom, I have a confession to make..."
12213211111111212222.title: Bonding with dad.

122132111111112122221.content:
"Two years ago, I privately went to see Dr. Stone." said Grace, tearfully. "I was having terrible headaches then, some so severe, I thought I was going to die."

Mom touched Grace on the cheek. "I knew you were having horrible headaches, dear." she said. "I had them too at that age but what did the doctor say?"

Grace began to shake. "He found that I had an 'unusual tumor'... inside the learning center of my brain." she replied as mom turned white. "He told me that I had less than a month to live." she paused, still shaking. "You can understand why I didn't tell anyone and asked Dr Stone to keep it quiet...."

"No, I don't understand." replied mom, sternly. "You should have told your father and I immediately!" she sighed, calming herself down. "Obviously, you survived... are you going through something like Garth is now?"

Grace slowly nodded. "In the first week alone, I went from a C average to an A plus student." she said. "In the past two years, keeping this a secret, I discovered that my brain absorbs information like a sponge and my body can duplicate any move I see..." she sighed. "In a nut shell, mom, I am the brain to Garth's brawn."

"You said that this all happened about two years ago?" asked mom. "When you were fourteen?"

Grace nodded, then turned pale herself. "Do you think that might be a connection?"

"It's more than just a coincidence that you develop a power at the age of fourteen then Garth does the same while he is fourteen as well." said mom. "I myself had horrible headaches at that age but I did not have any tumor...."

"Were you checked for one?" asked Grace.

Mom turned another shade of pale. "No... I wasn't." she replied. "I'll make an appointment with Dr Stone. In the mean time, I suggest we keep this to ourselves, for now. Both Garth and your dad have enough to worry about."

Grace nodded but, like me, she had no intention of keeping any secrets.

Later on that week...
122132111111112122221.title: continue mom and Grace.

1221321111111121222211.content:
Saturday afternoon, I was resting from my first training session with Dad. He was certainly doing his best to put me through my paces, then teaching me how best to use my strength. It wasn't easy. Once I hulked up, it took me two dozen eggs before I could hold one without crushing it.

Once the session was over, I relaxed my muscles away and washed up. Also, I finally went to the bathroom. It seemed to me like my body was using food more efficiently, so I didn't build up waste as quickly. I made a mental note to talk to Dr. Stone about it.

A knock came on my door. "Garth? It's Grace. Are you decent?"

"Sure. C'mon in." As she entered, I asked, "What's on your mind?"

She closed the door behind her and said, "I promised Mom I wouldn't tell you this. But it feels kind of weird, keeping this from you, since I know about you."

"Keeping what from me? What's going on?"

She sat down on the edge of my bed. "You're not the first person in this family to go through something like this."

"Come on, Grace. If someone else got super-strong, they'd have used it by now."

"It wasn't my strength that was affected."

"You?"

She nodded. "Remember two years ago, when I got those awful headaches? I went to Dr. Stone about them, and he found this tumor in my brain. He gave me a month to live. I was so scared, I couldn't bear to tell anybody."

"What happened," I asked, jokingly, "you couldn't pay, so he kept giving you more months?"

She shook her head. "I got better. A lot better. After that, my grades went through the roof. I can't remember the last time I got less than an A+.

"Also, I discovered that I can do just about anything I see done. That's how I got so good at martial arts, just by watching some movies."

"I'm impressed," I said. "It sounds like your tumor improved your brain, like mine improved my muscles."

"Exactly. I can even learn languages this way. I can already speak Spanish, French, and Japanese, just from the language tracks and subtitles on DVDs."

"Wow," I said. "All this time, I thought I was alone."

She shook her head. "You were never alone, little brother." We embraced.
1221321111111121222211.title: Grace and I talk.

12213211111111212222111.content:
That very same day, mom went to see Dr. Stone and asked to be scanned for any tumors. When asked if there was any place in particular, to narrow down the search, mom sighed. "Grace confessed to me about the tumor in her brain that was discovered when she was fourteen." she explained. "Now Garth has a tumor on his adrenaline gland while he is fourteen..."
her voice trailed off.

Dr Stone nodded. "I see." he said, softly. "I will run you through some tests, see what I can find."

"Thank you, doctor." said mom.

Mom was put through nearly countless tests and scans that day before Dr Stone sent her home, promising to call her when the results were in. Upon returning home, mom told dad that she had gone to the doctor for a check up and then did some window shopping to clear her head.

"I just hope my fear is unfounded." thought mom, going to bed that night.

The following morning, the telephone rang and mom answered quickly, so not to wake up dad. It was Dr Stone. "I fear that I have some bad news, Mrs. Jones." he said. "I did find an unusual tumor inside your body, exactly like the one Grace and Garth have"

"Where... Where is it?" asked mom, shaking.

There was a pause before Dr Stone sighed. "It's in your ovaries, which means its not a tumor, its a life form and it passed its children onto your own."

"A parasite!?" asked mom, alarmed.

"That's a crude way of putting it but yes, it is a parasite." replied Dr Stone. "It lives of of its host, giving super powers in return for 'room and board'."

"So, what... what is this parasite giving me?" asked mom.

"I wondered that myself... until I saw an older photo of you." said Dr. Stone. "I have always commented that you never seem to change, I don't know why you or I never noticed..."

Mom turned slightly pale. "What do you mean?" she asked.

"Look in the mirror, Heather." said Stone, seriously. "You have not aged a single day since you last suffered from those migraines nineteen years ago."

Mom gasped, the telephone falling from her shaking hand as she rushed out of bed to look at a mirror. She looked just as she did on her fourteenth birthday with the exception of a different hair and makeup style. "Oh my God..."
12213211111111212222111.title: Mom's visit to the doctor

122132111111112122221112.content:
Mom let out a scream to rattle the windows.

As Grace and I headed for their bedroom, Dad stirred from his sleep. "Huh? Wha'sa matter?"

"Ted," Mom said, "look at me."

He smiled, thinking he knew what to say. "You look fine, dear," he said. "You're as beautiful as the day we met."

"Exactly," she replied.

We got to the door and knocked. "Mom?" I asked. "Are you guys alright? What just happened?"

Mom picked up the phone, said, "I'll talk to you later, doctor," then hung up. Then, she opened the bedroom door. "Come in, kids. You might as well hear about this."

"I don't understand," Dad said. "What's wrong?"

"Ted," Mom said, "look at me. Look at yourself, then look at me. Look at the kids, then look at me."

I think I started to figure out what she was saying. Grace did, too, because she said, "Mom, you look like you're our age."

She nodded. "I haven't aged a day, all these years."

"Holy,..." Dad said, finally catching on. "How... how did this happen?"

"To explain that," Mom said, "we'll need to bring everything out in the open. Two years ago, Grace was diagnosed with a brain tumor, like Garth's. She kept it secret from us, thinking she would die in a month."

"What?" Dad said. "Wait a minute. Since she didn't die, what happened?"

"You know how Garth got a supercharged body from his tumor?" Grace said. "Well, I've got a supercharged brain. I've got total recall, I can do just about anything I see done, and I can learn languages in minutes. Mom, are you saying that this is all connected?"

Mom nodded. "They're not really tumors. They're organisms, living off you, giving you extraordinary abilities in return."

Dad asked, "Where did they come from?"

"The best answer I can give," Mom said, "is, from me. I have one of them, attached to one of my ovaries. It passed its young on to you kids. In return,... it's caused me to keep my youth." She looked back into the mirror. "I still can't get over it. I look like Garth's twin sister, not his mother."

"So," I asked, "where did yours come from?"
122132111111112122221112.title: Mom screams.

1221321111111121222211122.content:
"I have an idea." said mom, rubbing one arm. "It's just a theory, though."

Mom continued to rub her one arm with her hand, as Grace did when she was very upset or nervous about something. Looking at her expression, as she began to sob, I realized that she was thinking of a hurtful memory. "Mom, did something happen to you when you were... younger?" I asked.

Mom slowly nodded. "I... I was... I was..." she could not get herself to say it but the look on her face spoke volumes.

"Oh, god, mom!" whispered Grace, horrified. "You were raped, weren't you!?"

Mom began to cry freely as dad quickly pulled her into his arms, causing her to wail. "It was horrible! He was an older man, about forty years of age, begging for money on the street." she said, crying. "He smelled like he had not bathed in days so I gave him a twenty, trying to be nice! He... He and he grabbed me as I was walking away!"

"He attacked you, right on the street!?" I asked, terrified.

Mom shook her head. "He pulled me into a van and attacked me there." she said. "I only got away because I was kicking the inside of the van in morse code, S.O.S.!" she sobbed a little before adding, "The police came and pulled me away from him but... he managed to escape... no one has seen him since."

To hear that my mom was attacked, even though it was a long time ago, caused my muscles to grow in tune with my turbulant emotions. Knowing that the creep who did it was still out there made it worse, I badly wanted to get my hands on him. Unknown to me at the time, just as my muscles went into 'hulk' mode, Grace's mind went into super computer mode as she imagined every possible means to track down mom's attacker and deliver him some justice.

"Stand down, Garth." said dad, firmly. "That goes for you too, Grace. I will not have vigilantes in my family."

"It was twenty years ago, kids." said mom, rubbing her eyes. "Unless that man had the same... condition as me, he's no doubt in his late sixties by now. Besides, as I said... it's just a theory."

"The only way to confirm that theory is to find the man who attacked you twenty years ago." said Grace.

"You are talking about looking for a needle in a haystack, kids." said dad, shaking his head. "That man could be anywhere in the world, assuming he is still alive, and we only have a twenty old year old description to go by."

As I reluctantly brought myself down to normal size and Grace realized her mind, dad added, "Our primary concern is with these... creatures, we need to learn more about them."

"You're right, dad." I said. "Only... how?"

Then, all turned to Grace who sighed and said, "I'll try to...."
1221321111111121222211122.title: Mom's horrible secret.

12213211111111212222111221.content:
"Are you sure about this, Grace?" Dad asked. "You didn't tell us you could do that."

She shrugged. "I never tried." She put her index fingers on her temples, and rubbed in a circular motion. "I'm speaking to the creature living inside me. Will you speak to me?"

She tried for fifteen minutes, before shrugging again. "Okay, I guess I can't do that."

"We can figure out a few things," Mom said. "The doctor called it a parasite, but it seems more like a symbiote."

"A what?"

"Symbiote. It's a creature that has a mutually beneficial relationship with another organism. Like those birds that eat food from between the teeth of alligators. In this case, the creature gives us abilities our abilities."

"So," Grace asked, "what do we give them?"

Mom shrugged. "Maybe they need us to get around. Perhaps the environment is hazardous to them, without us to host them."

A voice inside Grace's head said, *A good guess.*

"Huh?"

We all turned to Grace.

She put her fingers back to her temples and asked, "Did you just speak to me?"

*Yes. My name is Attila.*
12213211111111212222111221.title: Establish mental contact.

choices: Garth has dinner, and his muscles suddenly grow
Garth goes outside in the middle of the night
122132111111112122221112211.content:
Grace had a shocked expression on her face, which suddenly turned to that of pleasure. “It spoke! It’s here! I heard it! It’s talking! It’s communicating!” she cheered.

“Grace! What are you talking about, honey?” asked mom, startled and a bit confused.

“I hear it, the symbiont, It’s speaking to me!” Grace said, while almost jumping up and down. “The symbiont is talking to me! I hear its voice!”

Grace was feeling like a little girl at Christmas time. Although she was not certain if it was her mind that reached the being or if it reached out to her, she was excited to have made first contact with, as far as she knew, could have been an alien being.

“Oh wow!” I said, seeing her excitement. “I’m wondering if I can hear mine then…”

“Well, you don’t have my mental powers, Garth." she said, wondering. "I'm not sure if I have any either but maybe … maybe I can help you…”

Grace walked up to me and stood right in front of me. She just looked me straight in the eye and concentrated. After a few moments, it appeared as if her efforts were unsuccessful. I was beginning to suspect that it was the symbiont that had contacted my sister.

“Hmm… Maybe if I touched you?” she said.

First, she touched my hand before she closed her eyes and tried again, her mind searching for a way to make a link work but all she heard was something like a whisper. After a few seconds, she opened them, and looked up at me.

“Well?”

“I hear something, but it’s very faint… Maybe I need to touch another part of your body. Let’s see… Your strength is in your muscles. How about I touch one of your muscles instead?” she pondered.

She reached out and gently placed her fingers on my right bicep before closing her eyes for the third time.

“Aha!” she said, almost immediately.

“What? Aha, what?” I asked her impatiently.

“I heard it! I heard something!” she said, as she closed her eyes and tried again. As soon as she closed her eyes, a wide grin appeared on her face.

“Well? What? Do you hear anything?” I asked her.

“It’s there! It lives inside of your muscles! All of them! Your muscles are a part of the symbiont! It likes making your muscles grow, too!” Grace said, while still keeping her hand on my bicep.

“What? The symbiont lives inside of my muscles? You mean… My muscles are ALIVE?” I gasped.

*Not quite.* I heard a voice say. only it was not in my mind, it was from inside my ears!

"What do you mean?" I asked. no response came so I touched my bicep as Grace did and repeated.

*Your sister has a more highly developed brain and can thus receive our telepathic signals more clearly.* replied my symbiont. *I live off your body but because I happened to anchored onto your adrenal gland, I 'pay rent' so to speak by enhancing your physical prowess.*

"So how do you communicate with me?" I asked.

*By using your muscles as a sort of phone line, I send focused vibrations through your muscles to your inner ear, where it translates them to my voice.* said my symbiont. *I can make you grow, if I so wished, your pectorals, biceps, and calves are all a part of you and thus, a part of me.*

Grace, who's mind was in tune to the symbiont's telepathic signals, heard the conversation and gasped. "The symbiont likes it when you hulk out!." she said. "It feeds off the extra mass when you return to normal! It also explains why you are always hungry!"

“That is a symbiotic relationship." said mom. "My question is, can the symbiont work Garth's muscles on its own or does he have full command?"

"Let's find out." said Grace. She tickled my chest, causing my pectorals increase dramatically!

“Whooaa!!!” I gasped as my pectorals doubled in size, pushing out forward until they became thick mounds of muscle.

“Looking strong there bro!” Grace giggled, as she took her hand off of my pectorals. "That was an unconscious reaction on the symbiont's part, Garth, it can make your muscles grow and shrink." she then smiled. "Only I suspect it will not make a habit of it."

*Correct.* replied my symbiont.

I looked at my pectorals, which were bulging with muscle to the point where it looked as if someone implanted two bricks into my chest.

“Unbelievable!” I smiled, as I ran my hand over my muscles. “So, you think I can control the size of my muscles by just talking to my symbiont?” Grace nodded and I added, "Please return me to normal size."

After a few seconds, my huge pectorals shrunk back to normal again.

“There, you just asked the symbiont to shrink your chest back to normal…” she giggled. “Cool, huh? Now, check this action out..”

Suddenly, I was overcome by an intense tingling in my legs, specifically in my calves on the back of my legs. And there it was: Both calves swelled until they were as large as melons!

“Wow! My calves are monsters!” I chuckled, as I looked down.

“I like your symbiont… It listens to me!” Grace smirked. "I do not have telepathy but these symbionts do and they are apparently able to pick up my thoughts."

“Yeah, well… These are MY muscles on MY body, so the symbiont had better listen to me too!” I added.

“It does… Just remember, big bro… I can make you bigger, or I can shrink your muscles back to normal!” Grace said with an mischievous grin. "So don't get too big for your britches."

“I’ll keep that in mind…” I sighed, just as my stomach started to rumbled.

That little demonstration of making my pectorals and my calves grow made me hungry again…
122132111111112122221112211.title: The creatures

1221321111111121222211122112.content:
I was having a rough time getting to sleep. Most of the family was playing host to life forms from who-knows-where. If I hadn't been hulking out, we'd never have suspected anything.

Thinking that maybe some fresh air might clear my head, I opened my bedroom window and climbed up onto the roof. I sat there for some time, looking at the stars.

Then, a thought occured to me. Touching my bicep, I asked, "Can you hear me?"

*I can,* came the response.

"Do you... know anything about where you come from?"

*I have learned from my parent.*

"Can you give me some idea? Like, is it from anywhere on Earth?"

*It is not.*

"Okay." That actually made sense; otherwise, more people would know about them. "If it's from somewhere in the sky, please show me." I leaned back and started looking around the sky.
