Once my eyes passed a certain spot, my right arm shot out, pointing.

I touched my right arm with my left hand. "That's your home?"

*That is the ancestral home of my race. My home is here, with you.*
1221321111111121222211122112.title: Late that night

12213211111111212222111221121.content:
"Do you know why you came here, to a world where the atmosphere is poisonous to you?" I asked.

*It is not your world's atmosphere, it's the toxins you humans are slowly poisoning your world with.* replied the symbiont. *From what I understand, we are what is left of a race of beings not much unlike yourselves.*

I turned my head confused. "What is left?" I thought. then, touching my bicep, I asked, "What do you mean?"

A giggle echoed in my ears. *You don't have to touch your muscle for me to hear you.* said the symbiont. *I can read your mind quite easily. I only must use your muscles as a 'phone line' because your mind is, forgive me, too primitive.*

"You said that you are what is left of a race of beings like us." you said, looking at the star the symbiont pointed out.

*Long story short, our race was arrogant, we tried to obtain immortality.* said the symbiont. *We succeeded but our current condition was the price. We now live inside one being after another for all eternity unless our host dies before we transfer out to another. Our off spring face the same near endless existence.*

"How do you transfer out?" you asked.

There was a pause before the symbiont replied, *Through sexual contact. Our mother was passed on to yours in an act of desperation as the man was dying. Your mother was not made pregnant by the rape, my mother took that burden by anchoring onto one of her ovaries and shared her immortality with her as penance for her sin, pushing the being to force sexual contact.*

I was stunned, angered, and confused. "Being...? That man you were in wasn't human!?" I asked.

*Correct.* replied the symbiont. *He was the beings we had merged with for our immortality only they used the powers the merging gave them to conquer worlds.* there was a pause. *We are here so to abandon them, hoping they do not find us...*

"There are more of you!?!" I asked, startled.

*There are more of us but... I do not know if they are here.* replied the symbiont. *By the way, my name is Amara; my mother is named Tana.*

"That's a pretty name, Amara." I said. then it hit me. "Wait a minute... you're a girl!?!"

*Yes, why?*
12213211111111212222111221121.title: Continue talking with the symbiont

122132111111112122221112211212.content:
I was puzzled. "How... how did your mother produce you? I mean, there wasn't a male of your species anywhere near Mom."

I heard another giggle. *We are all female,* Amara replied. *We do not need a male to reproduce.*

"So,... how do you reproduce?"

*We release our eggs,* she replied, "when the time is right. For you and your sister, that meant when your mother conceived. In our case, I would release my egg, and it would enter your partner's body. If the time was right, the child she conceived would also bear my young.*

"And... if the time wasn't right?"

*Perhaps the egg would attach itself to her body, and wait. Perhaps it might attempt to join with her.*

"So my girlfriend might end up hosting your child?"

*Exactly. Does this trouble you?*
122132111111112122221112211212.title: You become more curious.

1221321111111121222211122112122.content:
"Not too much," I said. "I mean, it's not like I'm dating anybody right now."

Amara sounded interested. *Tell me of this "dating".*

"Well, dating is when a guy and a girl really like each other, and they do stuff together."

*Ah. Like what your parents do?*

I cringed at the thought of my folks getting intimate.

*There is nothing wrong with it,* she said. *If they did not mate, you would not be here.*

I forgot she could read my mind. "I know that, but it feels weird to think of them like that."

*Ah. Let's change the subject, then. You said you weren't dating anybody. Why not?*

"Well, there is this one girl I kind of like. But she's going through a lot right now, and it feels too soon for me to ask her."

*Oh. So you feel that, if you give her more time, she would like you more?*

"Yeah."

*And she would date you?*

"If she wanted to."

*And she would mate with you?*

"I think you get the general idea."

*Do you feel better now, Garth?*

I thought about that. "Yeah. Yeah, I guess I do."

*Good. We should go back inside. We both need sleep.*

Even if I disagreed, I was too tired to argue. I went back to bed.
1221321111111121222211122112122.title: Not really

choices: Garth goes out that night again
12213211111111212222111221121221.content:
Wow, I must say, that I slept like a rock that night. Somehow, it completely intrigued me, knowing that I had a female alien creature living inside of me. I had to get used to the idea at first, but after awhile, I started to like it. I mean, what's better than having a girl living inside of you, with you, twenty-four hours a day? She knew me and she was a part of me. She was a part of my mind, my body, my arms, my legs, my torso, my chest, my muscles... everything! Not only that, but from this point forward, I always had someone to talk to! In a way, I felt like the luckiest guy on earth: I had a built-in girlfriend and she was mine forever and mine alone and she could never be with anybody else! As weird as it sounded, it was also very cool at the same time.

The bright sunlight was just beginning to shine through the opening between the curtains and the wall, lighting up my bedroom. I turned from laying on my left side, with my arm around my pillow, to laying flat on my back when I was greeted by a friendly female voice for the first time that morning.

*Good morning, Garth!*

"Hmm... Good morning... Amara..." I whispered while still feeling groggy.

*How are you feeling today?*

"I'll be better... Once... Once I'm fully awake..." I groaned.

*I sense that you're still feeling a bit sleepy. You're also a little congested. Maybe you should take something for that. And you're feeling a little thirsty. Your throat is dry. You need something to drink. Obviously, you need to have some breakfast as well.*

I opened my eyes when I heard her complete diagnosis of me and my feelings.

"Uhh... Yeah... You know everything I'm thinking and feeling?"

*Yes... I'm here to help you and to make sure your needs are being met!*

"Wow... Okay... I'm awake... Or, at least... I'm still waking up..."

*Do you need some help waking up? Some extra energy to face the morning and start your day?*

"S-sure...."

Suddenly, I felt my pectorals swell up and push outwards! My biceps became hard as rocks and tightened at the same time. My abs stiffened up as they hardened while my triceps, my calves and my thighs all inflated with bulging, rock-solid muscle. Amara was making me hulk out while I was still laying in bed!

"Uhhhhnnngg! Amara! Whoa! I'm awake! I'm up! I'm up!" I said, as I pulled the covers off me and leaped out of my bed and landed with my feet on the floor. Boy, was I pumped up! She certainly knew how to get me going in the morning!

With all my muscles bulging all over the place, I grabbed some clean clothes and ran into the shower. I figured that it was time to give my massive muscles a good bath anyway, thanks to Amara!
12213211111111212222111221121221.title: Next morning

122132111111112122221112211212211.content:
It was a good day. I spent most of it at home, just being with the family. After all of the excitement over the passed few days, mom decided it best we all unwind and spend a normal day. All in all, it was fun but as the day began to wind down, I felt the urge to go out and tackle more bad guys, if I could find some. Only dad had other plans.

"Garth, it doesn't take a super sleuth to figure out it was you who saved that man from the three thugs a few days ago." he said, sternly. "If you are going to continue to fight crime, you are going to learn to do it by the book." he took up a light jacket and grabbed his keys. "Let's go, son. I'm going to introduce you to law enforcement."

I sighed, knowing I was in for a lecture but nodded as I also knew he was only trying to help me out. "Okay, dad." I said.

Dad smiled, seeing my expression. "Relax, I know you mean well but the law applies to everyone." he said. "Let me tell you a few things you can do as a citizen to achieve your goal."

After telling mom and Grace we were going out for a ride, dad and I were off, just driving around town with him pointing out various buildings. "There I had to break up a fight between two neighbors." he said with a sigh. "They're both good people but one's son was dating the others daughter and they had a break up."

"One blamed the other for it happening." I said, guessing.

Dad nodded. "Correct." he said, smiling. "So I talked to the two kids and it turned out they were not breaking up, but talking about another couple across town, it was a misunderstanding."

"Oh brother!" I said, laughing. "That must have been embarrassing!"

"It was." replied dad, smiling. "The point is, you need to know the situation before you take any action."

"Gotcha, dad." I said, nodding.

Then, I noticed a car on the side of the road. "Hey, that's' Mrs Vance's car." I said.

Dad pulled to the side, behind the car then stepped out with me following. I watched for traffic as dad walked up to the driver's side window. "Having a little trouble, Mrs Vance?" he asked. "Could you use a hand?"

"That would be wonderful." said Mrs Vance (Sarah), smiling. she pulled a handle, popping the trunk. "The jack is not the best in the world, I'm afraid."

"That's okay." I said, smiling at her. "I think I can work with it."

I walked over to the back of the car and pulled out the spare tire. "Okay Amara." I whispered. "Are you ready for a little work out?"

"Of course." giggled Amara's voice.

As I walked to the side of the car, holding the spare tire, the rear passenger door opened and I saw Lyssa step out, holding a pair of thick work gloves. If it could, my jaw would have fallen to the ground. She was a complete knock out in that blue summer dress she was wearing. It accented her curves very well and with her raven hair and green eyes... I was blushing, I had to take a step back to keep myself from fainting at the sight of her beauty.

"Wow you're hot." I whispered. then, seeing her blush I quickly composed myself. "Um... nice dress, it accents your figure well."

Dad, coming up from behind, smacked me in the back of the head. "Behave yourself." he scolded, lightly.

Lyssa giggled. "Thank you for the compliment." she said, smiling. "I'm a real girl now... the whole enchilada."

This surprised me and I turned to dad to see him turn to her, surprised as well. It looked as if he wanted to ask her something and I had an idea what it was but he dismissed it and smiled politely. "Congratulations, Alyssa." he said, politely. "I know that was your dream, I'm glad it came true for you."

"Thank you, Mr. Jones." said Alyssa, smiling.

"Everyone sit tight." I said to Mrs Vance and Beth. "This won't take but a minute or two."

"There's no one around, son." said dad. "Let's do this."

Feeling my muscles quickly expanding under my sweat pants and shirt, I placed the spare tire down then easily lifted the front end of the car up before unscrewing the lug nuts with the other. I did not have the time to see Alyssa's reaction but I figured she would be surprised. After all, I was not able to do this at school.

"I'm sure they'll be questioning us about this later." I thought. "Oh well."

Within two minutes, the spare tire was on the car and the flat tire was in the trunk. "You're all set to go, Mrs. Vance." said dad, smiling. "I'm happy for your daughter." he then whispered something I did not hear.

Mrs Vance smiled. "I'll be sure to pass that along." she said.

"Thank you for your help, Garth." said Lyssa, blushing. "I really appreciate it."

She then gave me a quick kiss on the cheek, causing me to blush brightly. "You're.... welcome." I said, slowly, rubbing my cheek. "She kissed me, oh wow!"

Then, she quickly got back into the car as mom thanked dad again and was soon driving off as dad and I got back into their car. I was still rubbing my cheek. "I think someone has a crush on the young lady." said dad, smiling.

"Yeah." I said in a dreamy voice. "I guess I do." then a thought occurred to me and I began to panic. "Wait, we just revealed our secret to the Vance family!"

"Easy, son." said dad. "I know Mrs Vance. If there is one thing she excels at, its keeping secrets."

"Huh?" I asked, confused. "What's that supposed to mean?"

Dad laughed. "Let's just say you're not the first 'crime fighter' to come into town."
122132111111112122221112211212211.title: Double Surprise.

1221321111111121222211122112122112.content:
Dad and I drove for a while longer with him talking about various cases he had worked on, pointing out the dangers and challenges he had faced. "No one is invincible, son." said dad, turning the car towards home. "I learned that myself the hard way when I was a teenager, it nearly ended my life." sighing, he added, "Don't repeat my mistakes."

After a moment of silence, I asked, "Dad, were you the 'crime fighter' you told me about?"

Dad sighed. "I was one of them, son." he said. "I called myself Tex." with a frown, he added, "Our little exploits inspired that mystery book series you like so much."

"The Problem Child Gang." I whispered, smiling. "You were Tex the mighty?"

"I was him." said dad, sternly. "That was a lifetime ago." he shook his head. "The last book in the series was our last case before giving it up."

"Why did you give up a life like that?" I asked, stunned. "You had done so much to help others..."

"Didn't you listen to me!?" snapped dad, impatiently. "We all nearly got killed!" calming himself, he lightly gripped my shoulder. "I'm sorry, Garth." he said, more calmly. "I just don't want you to end up as I did, laying in a hospital bed, wondering if you are going to live to see the next day."

I gulped hard, hearing that. "The book left out that little detail." I said.

"Fiction and reality are two separate worlds, son." said dad. "Its best you learn that quick and keep your head in the reality you live in when you go 'crime fighting'."

"You- You're not going to stop me?" I asked, surprised.

"It's your life, Garth." said dad with a sad look. "I can only guide you and hope you listen to my teachings. If you look for trouble, that is all you will find, try looking for solutions instead."

"I'll do that." softly, I replied. "Dad... can you teach me?"

"Teach you how to what?" asked dad.

I sighed. "Can you teach me how to be a police officer?"

Dad smiled. "What do you think this talk was all about, son?" he asked. "As I said, if you are going to fight crime, you need to learn how to do it right."

We returned home about an hour before sunset and I walked up to my room, feeling closer to dad that I ever had before. Only I wondered who the other three characters in the story were, dad refused to tell me. I looked at my phone and thought of Lyssa. I could not get over how beautiful she looked. "I wonder if she really likes me." I thought.

Deciding to find out, I dialed her number. Three rings later, I got her mom. "Hello?"

"Mrs Vance?" I said. "This is Garth. Is Lyssa home?"

I heard Mrs Vance giggle slightly. "Sure, Garth, I'll page her." she said. "I see you'd been working out."

"It's a bit of a long story." blushing, I said.

"Then I'll not press you about it." said Sarah. "I'll get her to pick up."
1221321111111121222211122112122112.title: Dad's secret past.

12213211111111212222111221121221121.content:
I waited tensely until Lyssa answered. "Hello?"

"Hi, Lyssa, it's Garth." I said, smiling.

"Garth! How are you?"

"I'm okay. I was just wondering how you were doing after today." trying to build my nerve, I said.

"I'm fine. How did you get so strong?" replied Lyssa, sounding curious. "The car must have been over a ton, plus all the equipment Mom needed to drive."

Sighing, I said, "It's a long story, Lyssa, one I'm not sure you'd believe."

"Really?" said Lyssa, a giggle in her voice. "Let me say one word to you, Garth, one I haven't said in two years: Gary."

"I know that, Lyssa." I said, wearily. "It's just... well, the story's kinda out there." "Way out there."

"You want to be that way, huh?" asked Lyssa. I heard her open her window. "You've got a stopwatch?"

Her question threw me off guard. "Yeah, so?" I asked, wondering where she was going with this.

"Open your bedroom window," said Lyssa, "and time me."

Taking my stopwatch from my dresser, I asked, "Time you doing what?"

"Just say when you've started the watch."

I sighed, shaking my head. "This should be good." "Okay, go."

In less than a minute, Lyssa appeared in my window and it was on the second floor! To say I was surprised would have been understatement as Amara even commented, "Impressive."

"How... how'd you get here so fast?" still stunned, I managed to ask.

Lyssa smiled. "I ran. So, about your super-strength."
12213211111111212222111221121221121.title: Talkling to Lyssa.

122132111111112122221112211212211211.content:
For a moment, I did not answer her, I whispered to Amara, asking her if it was wise to tell her. "Your father gave his permission to use your power in front of Lyssa and her family." replied Amara, in my head. "Also, she showed that she has a gift as well, I see no harm."

I nodded then turned to Lyssa, serious. "Well, long story short, I have a little alien being,named Amara, living on my adrenal gland." I said. "She lives off of me and grants me incredible powers in return. For me, its super strength, endurance, and healing."

Lyssa looked at me, completely shocked but she seemed to believe my statement as she managed to ask, "How did... she get there?"

I chuckled. "My mom gave her to me and Grace." I said. "You see, Amara is the offspring of the alien mother inside my mom. Her alien lives on her ovaries and grants her immortality in return but she passed her young onto Grace and myself when we were conceived." I smiled, thinking about it. "Her alien lives in or on her brain, giving her a type of total recall. It's amazing what she can do."

Lyssa seemed more stunned than before but she snapped out of it as I said, "Your turn."

Well, you know I always wanted to be a girl, right?" asked Lyssa, beginning her story. I nodded. "Well, it seems as if I am related to a man who wanted the same thing and set adrift by his own townspeople. He was found by an Amazon woman tribe who heard his story and transformed him into a woman through what I can only guess as magical means." I smiled. "She was renamed Iole and had the power of incredible speed."

I looked at Lyssa, shocked but remained silent as she continued her story.

"I guess that gift of super speed was passed down onto me and, I guess upon reaching the proper age, I transformed into a real girl, gaining that power, just as Iole did centuries ago."

Lyssa's story left me stunned but smiling as I knew she always wanted to be a real girl and that I had a crush on the girl she was, wishing for the same thing for her so we could be together. "Thank you Iole." I thought.

"Do you think there might be others like us out there?" asked Lyssa, pulling me from my thoughts.

"I'm not sure." I replied. then I fell silent, as Amara said, "Our people have been running to Earth for centuries, it is possible that this Iole could have had or received a symbiont from the Amazon, they were advanced in their own right."

"What is it?" asked Alyssa, looking at me, concerned.

"Amara just told me that her kind have been coming to Earth for centuries." I said, still stunned. "It's possible that this Iole was a bearer of one of Amara's ancestors."

"Maybe..." said Lyssa with a questioning look. "I'll ask Beth, she seems to have powers similar to your sister, Grace."

"I'll ask Grace, maybe she can dig something up on her end." I said.

Lyssa and I talked for a few more minutes before her phone beeped, alerting her of a text message. After reading the message, she winced. "I got to go." she said. "Mom says it's time for dinner."

"Call me tomorrow." I said. "Maybe we can catch a movie or something before school starts."

Smiling, Lyssa replied, "That sounds great. I'll meet you at the mall, say 1:00?"

"I'll be there." I said.

With that, Lyssa ran out the window and I watched her run out of sight in less than a second. Letting out a whistle, I fell back onto my bed. "What a woman!" I breathed, happily. "I can't believe I'm going out on a date with her tomorrow!"

"If she doesn't get grounded." said dad, behind me.

I jumped, startled and stood up, facing her. "Dad! How long were you there!?"

"Long enough." replied dad, serious. "I can't punish you because I gave you permission to use your powers in front of Lyssa and that you did not go into too much detail." he roughed my hair up with his hand. "If she manages to escape getting grounded for sharing her secret, you can go out with her. If not, you are grounded too."

"What!?" I asked, stunned.

"It would not seem fair if she is grounded for sharing secrets and you are not, now is it?" asked dad. he then whispered, "Besides, it will make her feel better about the situation, if she is punished."
122132111111112122221112211212211211.title: sharing secrets.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111.content:
A few minutes later, Mom came up. "Ted told me you two had an interesting... what's that smell?"

I just noticed it, too. "I don't know."

Mom sniffed around my room, and found something in the carpet. "How did you get dog droppings up here?"

"Oh, man, Lyssa must have tracked them in."

"Lyssa? But I never saw her. How did she get in here?"

"She, uh, she ran. The way I get super-strong, she can run fast. Like, even up the wall."

"Up the wall?" She opened the window. "Yuck! She tracked it right up the wall!"

I shrugged "I, uh, guess she didn't notice it, at the speed she was going." I thought this might be a good time to change the subject. "By the way, she's a real girl, now. The thing that made her super-fast also changed her sex. You can ask Dad."

"He told me." Mom shook her head. "Garth, it's inappropriate to have a teenage girl in your room without me knowing."

"Dad was up here watching."

"Only by coincidence. When you have visitors, I expect to know when they're coming, and I expect them to enter and leave through the front door. I can't tolerate this, Garth. You're grounded for the next two weeks."

I sighed. This didn't look good for my crime-fighting career.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111.title: I am grounded.

12213211111111212222111221121221121111.content:
Early that morning, mom came to my room to find me awake, still pouting as I sat on my bed. She lightly knocked on the open door. "May I come in?" she asked.

I nodded but didn't speak and mom sighed before sitting next to me on the bed. "I want you to understand why you are being grounded, Garth." softly, she said. "You see, I too was in that story you read in Teen Detectives comic."

"You... were?" surprised, I asked. "Who were you?"

Mom gave me a sad look. "I was Hannah, the daughter of a hard nosed reporter." sighing, mom replied. "I constantly followed the group around, trying to get that one story to boost my dad's career." she giggled. "I drove your father crazy, always trying to get the big story for my dad... the exploits of the 'Problem Child Gang'."

"Only you always ended up getting caught and or in trouble." smiling a little, I said.

"Your father and his friends only wanted to help people, just as I did and just as you do now." gripping my shoulder, mom said. "You just need to understand that such a life is dangerous, you will earn enemies." tightening her grip, she added, "One of those enemies placed Mrs. Vance in a wheelchair for the rest of her life."

"I-I thought that was an accident." stunned, I said.

"So was dad's ramming the suspect's car during a high speed chase." grinning, mom said. "The man who hit Mrs Vance escaped from prison last week and he knows the people who put him in prison." she teared up slightly. "If you pick up on this, he or someone worse may come after you or Grace... do you really want to put this family at risk?"

I was crying at this point, though I tried to fight it. "No, mom." shaking my head, I replied. "Please don't cry."

"It was my fault the entire group was nearly killed that day." wiping her tears, she said. "I tried to catch this character named Sykes on my own with photographic evidence of his drug and gun running..." she sighed. "Don't follow this path, Garth, become a football player or a police officer, not a vigilantly."

With that, mom rose to her feet and slowly left my room, rubbing away her tears. It was not until she was gone that I noticed I had received a message that someone wanted to chat with me. I moved to my computer and clicked the mouse to find it was...
.
12213211111111212222111221121221121111.title: Next morning

122132111111112122221112211212211211111.content:
"Hi, Garth," she said. "How you doing?"

"Okay, I guess," I replied. "At least we can talk this way."

"I got some amazing news from my mom," she said. "You know that Problem Child Gang in Teen Detectives?"

"My mom just told me. Turns out she was Hannah, the girl they keep rescuing."

"Mom says one of the guys they put away is the one who put her in that damn chair."

I nodded, deciding not to mention the jailbreak. "Mom told me that, too. She wants me to be a football player instead of a vigilante."

"I got much the same lecture," she said. Then, with a grin, she added, "Only it gave me a completely different idea."

"What do you mean?"

I smiled. "I like it. Maybe I'll do the same thing."

122132111111112122221112211212211211111.title: Alyssa.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Clarence Mayweather made his way down the street, looking back every so often to amke sure he wasn't being followed. The clothes he was wearing weren't the best fit, but he knew they'd attract less attention than the prison-issue orange jumpsuit he'd had on. Satisfied that nobody was following him, he continued on his way.

The police, he knew, would be watching his ex-wife's house, certain that he'd come looking for his daughter. But he was just a little too clever for that. Sykes had set up a safehouse years before, and that was his destination. Arriving at the innocent-seeming house, he knocked.

A young woman in business attire answered. "Were you followed?"

"If I was," he replied, "I shook them."

She stepped aside to admit him. "Welcome, Mr. Mayweather."

As he stepped in, he asked, "Is Sykes in?"

"Mr. Sykes is in seclusion."

"Too good to say hi to an old friend, huh?"

"Suppose I had been there," came a familiar voice from somewhere, "and you had been followed. I'd be in quite the fix, wouldn't I?"

Mayweather looked around, and saw security cameras and wall-mounted speakers. "Good to hear from you, at least, Sykes. Ready to help me?"

"I am helping you, Mayweather, by giving you a place to rest your head and eat."

"You know what I mean. I want revenge on the people who put me away."

"I would advise against any action that doesn't involve you staying right where you are. That is, unless you're in a hurry to return to prison."

The woman dropped a sheaf of papers she'd been holding. As he helped her with them, he saw some of them. A few had the Cain Chemical letterhead. The one that caught his attention, however, was a list of names:

JONES, GRACE

JONES, GARTH

VANCE, BETHANY

VANCE, ALYSSA

CONNORS, MEGAN

TANNER, SUSAN

Mayweather recognized the last names as former members of the Problem Child Gang. These would be their children.

He sat in a chair, and began to plan.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Meanwhile...

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Mom and dad allowed me to go to the mall with Grace to meet up with Alyssa. She and I were only allowed there to get what we needed to clean the side of the house then return home. "Don't forget, you are grounded, young man." firmly but kindly, dad said. "Just get what you need." he smiled, seeing me pout. "It's not the end of the world. Once the side of the house is cleaned, you will be free to do what you want, just not alone until the two weeks are up."

"I know." sighing, I said. "Just, did mom have to call Grace my 'babysitter'?"

Dad chuckled. "She could have been more harsh and had you stay at home for the full two weeks." smiling, he replied. "It's better to be kept on a short leash than be locked up in the 'dog house'."

I nodded, knowing dad was right and we piled into the car with dad taking the wheel. "I have some errands to run so you have at least two hours to shop." looking at me, he said. "Just be ready to be picked up when I get back."

"We'll be ready." serious, Grace said.

The drive to the mall was uneventful and dad dropped us off at the main entrance. "Remember, two hours." looking out the window, he said. "If I have to come looking for you two, Grace, you will be grounded as well, understand?"

Grace quickly nodded and dd drove off. Once he was gone, Grace turned to me, smiling. "I overheard you talking to Alyssa when she visited you." excited, she said. "She's completely a girl now and has powers like ours but from odd genetic ancestry."

"That's what she said." trying to hide a blush I replied.

Grace smiled, eying me. "You have a crush on her, don't you?"

I blushed more deeply, causing Grace to giggle. "You do have a crush on her!" beaming, she said. "Did you ask her out when she visited you, splattering dog do-do onto the side of the house?"

"We- We have to start shopping." I said, my face inventing a new shade of red. "You don't want to get grounded too."

Grace squealed, falling into a giggling fit. "You asked her out!" walking into the mall, she yelled. "What did Alyssa say?"

"I said yes." replied a familiar voice.

Grace and I turned to find Alyssa, wearing a simple dress, blushing as brightly as I was. Standing beside her was her sister, Bethany, who giggled slightly.

"Alyssa, you look great!" taking her hand, Grace said. "I overheard your conversation with Garth, you're one hundred percent girl now, congratulations!"

"Thanks." still blushing, Alyssa said. "I'm really happy this way." she then pouted slightly. "Only I'm grounded... no dates until the side of Gar's house is cleaned up and no going anywhere alone until the two weeks is up."

Then an idea struck me. "We might still have that date as you will be with me and I'll be with you, we won't be going anywhere alone." smiling, I said. I then made a victory sign to Grace. "Loophole!"

Grace and Bethany looked at each other then shook their heads. "It won't work." they said in unison.

"It might." hopeful, Alyssa said. "We could try, the worst they'll say is no."

"Okay, we have two hours." said Bethany, looking at her watch. "It'll only take us a few minutes to get what we need so if you two lovebirds want to hang out somewhere, you have an hour." she smiled. "Meet us at the food court and don't be late, got it?"

Alyssa and I nodded and walked off, holding hands while Bethany and Grace watched us leave. "You had a talk with your dad too, huh?" smiling, Grace asked.

Bethany nodded, smiling. "Yep."

Grace giggled. "Come on, I'm dying to get myself a new dress for the homecoming prom."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Meeting at the mall.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
As our sisters went dress shopping, Lyssa and I decided to walk around the store. "How you doing?" I asked.

"Getting over my first period," she replied. "I'm almost sad to see it go, since I never expected to have one."

"Don't worry," I chuckled, "there's plenty more coming." Pausing, I added, "Of course, we'll need to be careful, when we do start dating. Periods mean you could get pregnant."

She nodded. "My ancestor had fourteen children in her lifetime. And, while I wouldn't mind a big family, I promised my folks I wouldn't wind up on those MTV reality shows."

As we walked along, I heard a familiar voice, but using an unfamiliar tone. "Hi, guys."

We turned. Behind us was Caitlin Spencer. "Caitlin?"

"That's me," she replied. It seemed strange, her being so friendly, since she'd always been so stuck-up. "What brings you to the store?"

"We... we had to pick up some things," Lyssa answered. Clearly, she was as puzzled by Caitlin's demeanor as I was. "What brings you here?"

"I'm on break from my job," she replied.

"Job?"

Caitlin nodded. "I'm a living mannequin in the swimwear department."

Lyssa's eyes about came out of her head, and she blushed. "That... that was you? Oh, wow, I'm so sorry about what we said."

Caitlin waved her hand dismissively. "I earned those remarks. Part of the reason I took the job was to change the way I've been acting all this time."

Lyssa was still puzzled. "When you were a mannequin, you were bald. How'd they hide your hair?"

She was silent at first, as if unsure how to respond. I'd never seen Caitlin Spencer doubt herself.

Finally, she said, "Like this," and pulled the wig off her head.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: A surprise encounter

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Lyssa gasped, stunned. She touched Caitlin's head gently as if it were made of glass. "Caitlin, what happened!?" tearing up, she asked. "Who or what did this to you!?"

I was stunned as well and I felt a need to bust up who ever did this but I remembered dad telling me to look for solutions rather than problems and touched her shoulder in support. "My father is the chief of police in this city." reminding her, I said. "If someone did something to you to cause this..."

Caitlin giggled. "I appreciate your support, guys." she said. "It was an accidental exposure to a rare plutonium that caused this but it goes deeper than that."

"What do you mean?" curious, Alyssa asked.

*Greetings, Garth and Amara.* said a voice in my head. *I am Amatra, an elder symbiont inside Caitlin.*

"Elder symbiont?" I asked out loud.

*Elder symbionts are of our kind who abandoned their hosts centuries before we did and fled Earth.* explained Amara in my thoughts. *Over time, they became one with this planet, as we will... eventually.*

"You have an alien inside of you, just like Garth." whispering, Lyssa said, hearing that. "But what is an elder symbiont?"

I relayed what Amara said to me then turned to Caitlin. "It seems we have something in common." I said. "Maybe we can get together later and talk about it in depth."

"I'd like that." said Caitlin, smiling. "How does tomorrow night sound?"

"That sounds good but... we're grounded." wincing, Alyssa said. "We're just here to buy a few things to clean a mess we made then we have to go home."

"Sorry to hear that." said Caitlin. "If there's anything I can do to help, let me know."

"The same for you." I replied. "We'll keep in touch."

With that, Caitlin put her wig back on and waved good bye as she walked towards a girl I recognized as Trish Wilson. She seemed very concerned about something and I was tempted to find out what but I also knew that time was against us in getting what we needed.

What should I do?
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Continue

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"Come on, Lyssa," I said, heading for Cait and Trish.

"We're not going to have much time for shopping," she replied.

"Look at Trish. Something's bothering her. Let's find out what."

We caught back up with Cait. "Hi, guys," Trish said.

"Hi. I noticed you looked upset. I thought maybe we could help."

She shook her head. "Not really." Turning to Cait, she said, "I went to see Brad. I... kinda had to tell him and his mom how I found out."

"It's okay," Cait replied. "I'm sure they won't blab. Besides, they'd have to explain how they found out, and I don't think Brad wants that out in the open. How's he doing?"

"The doctor says he's close." Close to what? I wondered.

"Would you like to be there for him?" When Trish nodded, Cait said, "Go ahead."

As Trish left, I said, "That didn't take as long as I'd thought. Guess we can still get some shopping in, before we have to be at the food court."

As soon as I mentioned the food court, Cait got this funny look. She just stood there, staring into space, her eyes dilated.

Lyssa waved her hand in front of Cait's face, then tried shaking her. "Cait?"

As suddenly as the spell came over her, it passed. As Cait began blinking again, she grabbed us both. "Come on."

"Where?"

"To the food court. They're about to have bigger problems than you two being late."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Forget shopping, Trish looks scared!

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
We got to the food court, and our journey happened to lead us to Grace and Beth. "You two got done early," Grace said. "Who's yo - Caitlin Spencer?"

"Hi," Cait said. "There's not much time. We - " The conversation was interrupted by a burst of gunfire punching out the skylight.

We all hit the deck. Risking a quick peek, I saw a boy about Grace's age, armed with several automatic weapons. I swallowed. I didn't know how much damage I could sustain from guns like those, and I knew that Lyssa couldn't outrun bullets. In any case, we had promised to keep our noses as clean as possible, and that meant not attracting attention by disarming the kid maniac.

"What's Cait doing?" Lyssa asked.

I looked. Cait was pressing her fingers to her temples. The expression on her face was as if she was trying to work out a math problem that wasn't worded properly.

Before I could ask, she grabbed Grace's forehead, like a pro wrestler putting the claw hold on an opponent. Grace's eyes flew wide, and she got the same expression that Cait had before we left for the food court. She next put the claw on Beth, who also spaced out. I couldn't figure out what was happening.

"Look," Lyssa said.

I looked. The boy was shaking his head, as if he was drowsy, but he was wide awake. We still didn't dare to move a muscle.

Finally, the boy put his guns on the ground and kicked them away. Mall security grabbed him, and he didn't resist as they took him away.

Cait released the girls, and I asked, "What just happened?"

"That boy was an undiagnosedschizophrenic," Grace explained. "The voices in his head were telling him to kill everybody here."

"I got a psychic vision," Cait added, "warning me of what was about to happen. I tried to reason with him, but I had trouble getting him to distinguish my 'voice' from all the others. So I needed Grace and Beth to help me."

"Y-you can do that?" Lyssa asked.

"For a few days now," Cait replied. "I found out what the people around me really thought about me, and I've been working to change that.

"Now," she added, "I've got a question for you: Do you guys really have these powers?"
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Trouble at the food court

choices: Dad arrived in a strange car.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
*We granted our hosts great power in exchange for 'room and board'.* came Amara's voice. *Elder symbionts do not do this unless necessary, as in your case, Caitlin.*

By the way Caitlin's eyes widened, I guessed that Amara had spoken to her mind. only, before I could react, she thought to me, *Are you ready, Garth?*

I looked around then smiled as I gave the mental impulse to 'hulk out' as I had phrased it and became the size of an Olympian weight lifter. Caitlin's expression turned to shock, looking at my new form, but she relaxed when I quickly returned to normal. "I can get a lot bigger, if I wanted." I said, blushing. "Only, I'm afraid of losing control."

"Same here." nodding, Caitlin said. "I don't want to hurt anyone with a 'bad thought'." she then turned to Grace. "I got a feel for yours and Beth's power when we connected, a type of super total recall, right?"

"Something like that." smiling, Grace replied. "Basically, I can learn anything in minutes rather than days and master anything in hours rather than years."

"I have something similar." agreeing, Beth added. she blushed. "So far, I seem to be able to find anything I am looking for and instantly know how to use it."

"That is impressive." said Caitlin, smiling. "What of you Alyssa?"

Lyssa smiled then seemed to vanish from sight. Caitlin looked around then jumped to find Lyssa standing right behind her. "Teleportation?"

"Sheer speed." sighing, Lyssa replied. "That's what got me into trouble, I tracked boulevard bon-bons up the side of Garth's house when I went to visit him."

Caitlin giggled slightly. "You went passed old man Crane's house, didn't you?"

Lyssa blinked. "How did you?" she shook her head, remembering Caitlin's power. "What does that have to do with what happened?"

"He's been illegally using his Saint Bearnard's droppings to fertilize his lawn." said Caitlin, wincing. "Its been seeping onto the sidewalks, giving anyone who walks or runs passed real dung covered shoes."

"Well that explains how it was tracked all the way home." said Lyssa.

Just then, Caitlin, Grace, and Beth looked around nervous. "We'd better get what we need and leave." her voice quivering slightly, Beth said.

"I'm calling off for the rest of the day." quickly, Caitlin said.

For a moment I was confused but it soon hit me. A nagging feeling my friends and I were being watched as Grace came close to me, worried. "All of us getting this feeling at the same time can't be a coincidence." fearful, she said. "My vote is to forget what we came for and leave."

"Security is tight, since that kid went on a mini rampage." I said. "Whoever we're sensing, they won't try anything now but I say we leave a s a group." I turned to Caitlin. "That means you too."

Caitlin nodded and pulled out her cellphone. "James, I need to be picked up." her voice fearful, she said. "I'm bring four friends along."

Unknown to all, two blurry men were watching them from a distance. "That's them, Butch." said one. "At least the kids of two of the original members."

Butch grunted. "They know we are here, Hank." he muttered. "That friend of theirs seems to have some type of mental radar, we will have to get imaginative to obtain our targets."

The two men watched as...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Continue

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
While Caitlin called her boss, telling him she was too shaken from the shooting to continue for the day, I called dad on my cellphone, he answered on the second ring. "We are watching a news report on a shooting at the mall, son." his voice shaking, he said. "Are you, Grace, and the Vance kids alright?"

"We're fine, dad." quickly, I replied. "Listen to me, we all have this feeling we're being watched and it has most of us unnerved so we're leaving the mall with Caitlin's security detail, she's bringing us home."

There was a sort pause before dad replied, "Smart move, Garth. I want to have a word with Miss Spencer anyway."

"Why? What's wrong?" I asked.

"I just got a report from Interpol." serious, dad replied. "The Agency has resurfaced."

I felt my heart jump into my throat as I remembered the Agency from the Teen Detectives magazines. They were and underground organization that used brainwashed children with unique talents to do their dirty work."

"They really existed!?" whispering, I asked.

"There is a lot of ugly truths to this world, Garth." said dad, sadly. "I suggest you stop talking and get home, fast."

With that, the line went dead and I felt a twinge of panic. "We better get moving." turning to the others, I said.

"Mom wants us to meet at your house, Garth." her voice quivering, Lyssa said. "She hung up after that." she teared up, looking worried. "Garth, I'm scared."

Caitlin, hearing this, turned back to her cell phone. "Security, I need a detail to protect Mr and Mrs Vance as I believe someone will use them to get to my father." she said in a serious tone. "Here is their address...."

With a security team being sent to check on Lyssa's family, you all headed to Caitlin's awaiting limousine to find...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: You all left the mall.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
... the driver, apparently James, opening the door for us. "Home, Miss?" he asked.

"No, my house," I replied, giving him the address.

Cait nodded, adding, "Evasive maneuvers."

As he closed the door behind us, he said, "Fasten your seat belts."

Once we were buckled in, Cait closed the partition between us and the driver. A moment later, the limo took off, faster than I would have imagined such a long car could go.

"Can we trust the driver?" I asked.

"For the most part," Cait assured us. "I haven't told him about my powers. But he's been working for my family for years. He was originally hired to keep an eye on my Aunt Liv."

"Aunt Liv?" Grace asked. "Why did she need to be watched?"

"From what little they tell me," Cait replied, "she was something of a black sheep in the family. Hung out with the wrong crowd, married beneath her, that sort of thing. Of course, we're old money, so those terms could mean anything."

As we drove along, Cait took off her wig to brush debris out of it. This surprised Grace and Beth, as they weren't with us when she did it before. "When did that happen?" Beth asked.

"A few days before I became telepathic. Brad and I got accidentally dosed with plutonium. I lost my hair and started reading minds. Brad... he's recovering, but it's taken him longer."

"Weird."

"Ironic, too," Cait said. "Plutonium was the brand name of the hair dye I used."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: nothing out of the ordinary.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Cait whipped out her smartphone. "Hola, Marisol," she said. "Yes, I know about what happened. At least I wasn't the first one to interrupt your novelas today." She chuckled. "I'm fine. Nobody got hurt, and the gunman is in custody. However, something else came up, and I'll be spending some time with some other kids my age. I'll be back by supper. Hasta luego."

After she hung up, she said, "Give me a few minutes," and closed her eyes. I couldn't tell if she was taking a nap, or maybe mentally contacting someone else.

I decided to take a cue from her, and called home again. "Hello," Dad answered.

"Hi, Dad. We're on the way. Caitlin Spencer ordered a security detail to Lyssa's house. We'll be home with her, Lyssa, and Beth in about ten minutes."

"Caitlin Spencer ordered it, huh?" He chuckled. "Your mother and I will be here, and Beth and Alyssa's parents are being escorted here too. Also, your cousin Susan might be paying a visit."

"Today? Not the best timing."

"Cheer up. She might have more in common with you guys than you know. Also, Dr. Stone would like to arrange a meeting between you and another patient. He says you and she have much the same condition, and thinks you could help her."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Calling home

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Once we got home, Cait told James, "Wait for Trish Wilson, and whoever is with her, at the hospital. Then bring them here. Evasive maneuvers." That confirmed for me that Cait had been in telepathic communication with someone else, probably Trish.

Dad opened the door for us. "Come on in," he said. "Beth, Lyssa, your parents are on their way here. Garth, Grace, your cousin, Susan is on the way with her parents as well. Caitlin, is there someone you'd like me to call?"

"James will be back later," she replied, "and Marisol knows where I am. My folks are away."

"I've got a question," Grace said. "Who was that woman who spoke to us, when we were linked?"

"That was Beatriz," Beth replied. "She's something of a spirit guide. Sometimes, when I'm looking for something, she gives me an idea of where to look."

"So why'd she call us her daughters?" Cait asked.

Beth shrugged. "Maybe we're related. Iole, Lyssa's and my distant ancestor, had 14 children, so there's bound to be a healthy representation of her in the gene pool."

"Makes sense," Grace replied. "I read that 1 in 200 people can trace their ancestry to Genghis Khan." She turned to Cait. "How much do you know about your Aunt Liv?"

"Not much," she answered. "I once had my lawyer try to track her down through her share of the inheritance, but she's hardly touched it. What could she be saving it for?"

"I gave some to an old friend," a familiar voice said. "The kids are going to college. And I had planned to pay for Lyssa's surgery, but it turned out she didn't need it."

We all turned. The Vances had arrived.

Cait was completely stunned. "You... You're Aunt Liv?"

"Sarah," she replied. "I never liked the name Liv."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: The meeting begins

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"We'll talk more inside." seriously, dad said. "There is much we need to discuss."

We all began to follow dad inside when another car arrived. Once it had parked by the road, A tall, slender man with sand brown hair and blue eyes stepped out. With him was an equally tall but muscular woman with long auburn hair and green eyes. I immediately recognized her as my aunt Amanda. Coming out of the back was a small girl with long brown hair and blue eyes, my cousin, Susan. "Are we late?" walking up to us, Susan's dad asked.

"Not at all, Geo." shaking his hand, Ted said. "Good to see you again."

"Likewise." releasing dad, Geo said.

Dad then hugged Amanda. "Thank you for coming over, sis." smiling, he said. "I just wish it was under much better circumstances." he sighed. "Any word from Steve?"

Amanda winced. "His daughter is in the hospital." sadly, she replied. "She's not well, from what I hear."

Dad shook his head, looking worried. "We'll have to hold the meeting without him then." wincing, he said. "Everyone inside, we have a lot of ground to cover and, I fear, very little time."

Once everyone was inside and sitting down, Caitlin turned to Sarah. "I know this is not the place but... why were you called the black sheep of the family?"

Sarah giggled slightly. "When I was your age, the Spencer family liked to play by their own rules." looking at her, she explained. "They did not care for the police or for lawyers unless it worked in their favor. That said, they wanted me to marry into the Tanner family, to increase the family's wealth." she motioned to Amanda then added, "Only my friend had eyes for Geo and I had eyes for Frank Vance... a lawyer who worked for the police department."

"I imagine your parents didn't take it well." wincing, Caitlin said.

Sarah shook her head. "My dad walked me down the aisle to give me away." sadly, she replied. "Only he did not stay for the reception." she sighed. "He and my mother accepted my husband but not until they were on their death bed, wanting to make peace before they left this world."

"That's cold." tearing up, Caitlin said. "I'm so sorry, aunt Sarah."

"It's not your fault, sweetie." said Sarah. "Believe me, my parents they deeply cared for my husband and I." she then smiled. "They wanted to make man who put me in this chair vanish of the face of the Earth. If Mr Jones had not gotten to him first, they would have made it happen."

"Let's get started." interrupting Caitlin's conversation, Geo said with a cold tone. "As you all know, most of us were members of the Problem Child Gang you kids like to read about. Our last mission was against a man named Sykes who we believed was the bottom of a drug and weapon running cartel." he sighed. "Unfortunately, he turned out to be just the opposite. He was a war monger drug lord, the top dog of the cartel."

My face and those of my friends paled, hearing that. "Was it this Sykes and his men who nearly killed you all?" almost whispering, I asked. "Or was it the Agency?"

"The Agency was after Sykes, just as we were." seriously dad replied. "Sykes knew they were there and that we were hunting him down. He blew the building he was held up in, just as he made his escape." he shook his head. "We barely escaped with our lives only to find the Agency became... interested in us."

"What do you mean interested in you?" shaking, Lyssa asked.

"As I explained earlier, we had our talents." looking at Lyssa, Sarah said. "The Agency was in the business of brainwashing children with such talents to use them, make them do their dirty work so to gain wealth and power."

"Not only were we forced to flee for our lives from an exploding building, we had to escape the clutches of an underground terrorist organization." tearing up, Geo said. "We thought we were invincible, we were not. We thought this was behind us... its been chasing us all along."

"You- You think this cartel or this Agency may have interest in us." as if reading Geo's mind, Caitlin said, turning pale.

Geo nodded. "That is why we are holding this meeting, my dear." he said. "The Agency has resurfaced and from what I have heard, many of you are already being watched by someone." he clinched a fist. "We can not take any chances or make any assumptions, we already made that mistake once."

Suddenly, Caitlin gasped, her lips trembling. "No... they're outside of my house!" hoarsely, she screamed. she threw her hands against her temples. "Marisol, you are in danger! RUN... NOW!!!!"

Before anyone could react...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Continue

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Everyone jumped as a woman appeared in the room, screaming. She had her hands raised, as if to defend herself then screamed again, finding herself somewhere else. "Ay dios mio!" shaking, she breathed.

"Es importante que tu te relajes." walking up to her unsteadily, Caitlin said. "Somos buenos amigos."

"Qué pasó, Caitlin!?" startled, Marisol asked.

"Someone, please... English." muttered dad, looking startled as well.

"It's okay, Marisol, you are safe." taking her hand, Caitlin said. "It looks like I got you here just in time." then she thought, "I feel so weak but I can't let her see that, she'll freak."

"What happened, child!?!" still shaking, Marisol asked. "I heard you scream I was in danger just as a number of men broke into the house!" she suppressed a sob. "They were right on top of me and then I found myself here!"

"We... We all have certain abilities, Marisol." urging her to sit down, Caitlin replied as she sat down herself. "Remember how I lost all my hair? Well, it also gave me powerful mental abilities, thanks to Amatra."

"Amatra?" confused, Marisol asked.

"Hola, Marisol." came a voice in her head. "Como Estas?" then her voice sternly echoed in Caitlin's head. "You nearly drained us both completely doing that... don't try it again."

Marisol began to shake more until dad cleared his throat. "Marisol is it?" he asked. she nodded. "I am Ted Jones, chief of police. There is an underground organization, known as The Agency, that forcibly makes use of such talented children like Caitlin Spencer and my children, Garth and Grace." he sighed. "It's a long story, which we will explain but in short, I believe those men were after Caitlin and they would have used you to get her."

"I- I see..." said Marisol. she turned to Caitlin. "You- You summoned me here?"

Looking very pale, Caitlin nodded. "You're like a mother to me." sounding weak, she said. "I- I couldn't let anyone hurt you. I... I..."

She then fainted, falling out of the chair, causing Marisol to panic. "Caitlin!"
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Marisol appeared, startled.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"What happened?" I asked, as we all rushed to Cait's side.

"I'd say that stunt surprised her as much as the rest of us," Mom replied. "And, from the look of things, it took a lot out of her." She checked her over. "Her pulse is getting stronger. I don't think she'll need medical attention. Just a reminder not to go bending the space-time continuum."

We carried her to the couch. Marisol got some cold water from the sink, and lightly splashed her face.

Slowly, Cait's eyes began to open. "Wh... wha... "

"You fainted, chica," Marisol replied. "Bringing me here was harder than you wanted to let on. I don't think you should do that again."

"You're not the only one," Cait replied. "My head is killing me. And I can't 'hear' your thoughts."

"Probably overstress," Beth suggested. "Give yourself a day or so before you try mind-reading again."

Marisol looked around at all of us. "You children all have these... powers?"

"Most of us," I said. "I can get big and super-strong."

"I've got total recall," Grace said, "and I can duplicate just about anything I see done."

"I've got super-speed," Lyssa said.

"I have a spirit guide," said Beth.

Susan stepped forward. "I've got powers from both my parents. You guys all thought Dad was just really good at sneaking in and hiding. It's more than that."

"What do you mean?" Dad asked.

Susan and Uncle Geo smiled... and disappeared.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: continue.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"Geo? Susan?" Dad ran to where they'd been standing, waving his arms through the space where they'd been. "Where'd you go?"

"We're right here, Ted," Uncle Geo replied. "We can turn invisible and intangible."

"Put your arms down, Uncle Ted," Susan added. "We can't come back, if you're occupying the space."

Dad stopped waving his arms, and they returned. "How'd you get to do this?"

"It's a family trait," Susan answered. "Right now, I can only do it for about 15 minutes. But I should get better at it."

"Any other problems, besides solid objects?"

"Bright light," said Geo. "Our eyelids go transparent, too, so we can't block out bright lights."

"Sue," I asked, "you said you got powers from both your parents. What did you mean?"

"I was a hanger-on of the Problem Child Gang," Aunt Amanda said. "The book calls me the Unknown Amazon."

"That's how you got so big? You can Hulk out, like I do?"

Amanda nodded. "Sue hasn't found her trigger yet. Otherwise, I'm sure she'd demonstrate."

"My trigger was exercise. When we're done with this, I'll let you use my equipment."

"Thanks, Garth," Sue said. "Of course, we haven't gotten to the weird part."

"Weird part?"

"You guys might find this hard to believe," she said. "It turns out, I was originally born a boy. I turned into a girl a few days later. That's how I inherited Dad's powers: They're passed from father to son."

"That's not so hard to believe," Lyssa said.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Susan's powers

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Then a firm knock at the front door caused everyone to jump. Dad hurried over top the door, motioning everyone to stay clear, as he brought his sidearm to bear. "Who is it!" firmly, he demanded.

"Steve Connors and company." replied Steve's voice. "Someone tried to take my daughter, Ted. I have one of her friends with me, we need to talk."

Dad cautiously opened the door and peered out before allowing a tall and muscular man with short sand blond hair and blue eyes to enter with Travis Greenway and Megan from school following behind. Travis was a tall and muscular boy with jet black hair and blue eyes. Megan was a shy petite girl with blond hair and green eyes. Both seemed white as a sheet and they staggered slightly as they entered. Mom gasped seeing them and ran forward with Marisol helping her.

"Easy, Megan." said mom, gently taking her arm. "You better sit down a bit, dear."

"I- I'm fine." said Travis, blushing slightly as Marisol took his hand.

"The hell you are, Chico." sternly Marisol said. "You look like a ghost, sit down and rest."

"I said I'm fine." stubbornly but politely, Travis said. "I just need to catch my breath."

I smiled then turned to see Caitlin and Grace smile as well. It did not take a mind reader to know Marisol was not going to put up with male pride. "Sit... down." with a firm tone, Marisol said.

Travis sat down, his expression softening. I guessed he was not used to anyone so forceful. "Yes, ma'am." he said.

"It's good to see you again, old friend." returning his sidearm to its holster, dad said. "Any idea who tried to kidnap your daughter and her friend?"

"They weren't professionals." quickly, Steve said. "I'm guessing they were sent by Sykes. he motioned to Megan and Travis. "These two are just now discovering their 'gifts'. Megan's gift left her a bit shaken, same with Travis."

"What can you do?" lying on the couch, Caitlin asked. "Mine is mental powers." she moaned. "Though I kind of over did it a few minutes ago."

"Megan can control machines and transform to some extent." motioning Megan to remain quiet, said Steve. "Travis has the ability to become an Anthro of various animals." pausing, he added, "I know you two have a voice of your own but you are both seriously drained from the kidnap attempt, rest all you can."

"Were they hurt?" asked Lyssa, concerned.

"Travis pushed himself to save Megan from being taken." with a grateful look, Steve said. "Megan did the same only it was from her powers going a bit nuts on her."

"Like mine did at the beginning, turning into a behemoth." shaken slightly, I said. "My power is super strength."

"Just like your dad." smiling, Steve said. then he turned serious. "We need a plan and time is something we don't have a lot of, we need to act, now."

What do you suggest?" asked mom.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Continue

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Before Sam could answer, there was another knock at the door. "Who could that be?" Dad asked. "We're all here." Drawing his sidearm again, he asked, "Who is it?"

"Tr-Trish Wilson, sir," came the reply. "Cait sent for us?"

We turned to Cait. "Something came up during the ride here," she said. "I sent my driver to pick them up."

Dad opened the door, and in came Trish, Brad, and an older lady, probably Brad's mom. Except Brad looked kind of funny, and it looked like he'd gotten dressed in a hurry. Then I noticed the hospital ID bracelet on his wrist, and remembered Cait had said he'd been recovering from plutonium exposure. "You guys OK?" I asked.

"Getting better," Brad replied. Even his voice was different. "I... had quite an experience in the hospital. Please don't ask me to describe it to you."

"What's going on?" Mom asked. "Why did you come here?"

"Cait told me she'd picked up something," Trish answered, "and I should grab Brad and his mom and get in her limo. Whatever it was, it had her freaked worse than the shooting."

We all turned to Cait again.

"I read Brad's doctor's mind," she explained. "He's connected to the Agency, and he wanted his hands on Brad and Trish. That's why I brought them here."

Dad shook his head. "Sykes, the Agency, and the kids of the Problem Child Gang. This is going to get a lot worse before it gets better."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: something else.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"We need to get everyone started on training the sooner the better." said Geo. "I know of such a place, the original group headquarters near the coast. It's only about twenty miles from here."

"I thought our headquarters were destroyed by the Agency days after we escaped Sykes' death trap in Rome." confused, mom said. "They completely burned the summer home mansion to the ground, trying to get to us."

"That was the sister mansion in England." countered Geo. "I'm talking about the original headquarters, here in the States, where we first starting training to hone our skills while not gallivanting around the world." he smiled. "It's old but its still standing and we can go there in a second's notice."

"The kids will still need individual training." worried, Sarah said. "Also, their skills are far more advanced than ours were."

"They will get individual training." said Geo. "You see, I had a feeling we had not seen the last of the Agency so I had an underground... err... vacation village constructed in a cave system for all of us to run to with our families, just in case."

"All of the training facilities we need are there?" asked dad.

Geo nodded. "It has everything we need to live and train for as long as it takes." serious, he said. "We can live there or commute there." he paused. "Its just an option."

"We'll commute there." said dad. "The Agency will know we're onto them if we all suddenly vanish. Still, we must be on our toes at all times, understood!?" everyone nodded and dad turned back to Geo. "I will check the mansion and training facility to ensure its safe and secure. We can take two along with us."

Who goes with Geo and dad?
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Training begins

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
The drive to the small mansion was a quiet one as Grace and I were worried about the others as they all returned home after the meeting. "They will be fine, son." assuring me, dad said. "Caitlin will be taking herself and her friends to their summer home on the edge of town."

"Alyssa and her family will be temporarily moved to my home with my family." glancing at me in the rear view, Geo added. "My house is like a fortress, they will be safe."

"What of Travis and Megan?" concerned, Grace asked.

Dad chuckled. "They are in good hands with Steve." smiling he said. "Not only was he a top notch driver, he was our gadget guy, he will keep them safe."

Minutes later, we arrived at the mansion and we all piled out to find the front doors boarded up with a notice that the property had been condemned posted. "I thought you kept this place up." confused, Grace said.

Dad smiled. "Look at the notice more carefully." pointing to the paper, he said. "See anything missing?"

I looked and smiled. "It's a blank notice." turning back to dad, I said. "There are no signatures, making it official."

"This place was built for training." guessing, Grace said. "So, the front door is the first puzzle lock, right?"

Geo nodded. "That's right, my dear." smiling, he said. "Now, Sarah was our puzzle cracker but we all had to be able to solve such puzzles to keep our minds sharp." pausing, he motioned to the door and said, "Who would like to try first?"

Grace and I turned to each other, uncertain....
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Garth and Grace.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Grace stepped up to the boarded up double door with dad and Geo both smiling as they watched her. "This brings back memories, Geo." whispering, dad said. "Remember when we first tackled this puzzle?"

Geo chuckled. "Yeah, we both ended up with a cracked bum and a bruised ego." amused, he whispered back. "I wonder how your daughter will fare."

Grace examined the boards then lightly pulled down on one, thinking there might be a secret lever somewhere to find that a piece of it moved. Dad and Geo continued to smile as Grace moved the piece of board back then moved it again, looking at the other boards before spotting the outline of a key, scratched into a board in the top left corner of the double doors. Seeing this, a smile formed across her face. "I think I got it." reaching for the board with the key, she said.

Grace pulled the board down and it moved with a metallic sound as if the board was hollow and something inside moved. "The key to the door is inside the boards." smiling, Grace said. "All I have to do is navigate it through the maze to the opening so to get it out."

"Very clever, Grace." smiling, dad said. "Only are you certain you have the right key?"

Grace paused, then turned to the doors to see an identical scratched outline of a key on the top right hand side as well. "Damn." frustrated, she whispered.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Grace goes first.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Grace examined the puzzle again, knowing that there would be times when her dad and his friends would need to enter in a hurry for any reason. "There has to be a quick way in." studying the puzzle, she thought. "What is it though?"

"Come on, sis." cheering her on, I said. "You can figure it out."

Grace turned to give me a quick smile then turned back to the puzzle and turned the top right board. Something metallic falling was heard and she then turned the board in the very center of the two doors, hoping it would be that simple. To her luck, both keys came tumbling down through the hollow wood maze and landed in the open hole for her to see.

"Good work, Grace." smiling, dad said. "Now which key do you use? There is only one working key hole."

Grace, being a fan of mystery movies, giggled as she shook her head. "Who are you kidding, dad?" she asked. "It's a double door so there would be two locks." she then moved the piece in the center back, revealing the second keyhole, and inserted both keys. "Too easy." she stated.

Only, as she inserted the second key, a click was heard and the floor boards she was standing on sprung up, throwing her like a rag doll. She screamed in surprise as she was hurled into the air but I was on my guard and managed to catch her. "Are you alright?" concerned, I asked.

"I'm fine." blushing brightly, grace replied. "I thought for certain I had the puzzle cracked."

"I tried to warn you, Grace." chuckling, dad said. "There is only one working key hole, the other triggers the trap."

"My turn." putting Grace down, I said. "I'm curious about this place."

"Let me reset the puzzle, to be fair." pausing, Geo said.

"No need." charging the door, I said. "Just gang way!"

Dad and Geo jumped aside as my muscles exploded in size on the run to the door. I thought for certain that I would turn the front door puzzle to splinters but, to my surprise, the doors gave way to my ramming speed with the boards intact and I ran straight into a trap door on the other side! I yelled out in surprise, hearing my dad and Geo laughing, as I fell down a twisting underground slide. Seeing water on the other end, I held my breath, jumping at the shock of splashing into cold water. Quickly, I swam to the surface to find myself in a pool inside the house. Unknown to me, dad and Geo were still laughing as the doors closed on their own, resetting the puzzle as dad handed a stunned Grace the two keys.

"Your brother is fine, sweetie." chuckling, dad said. "The doors are designed to give way to a hard push but you have to be mindful of the trap door on the other side." he winked. "Garth didn't ask about that."

Grace giggled. "Which key opens the door?"

"They both do." amused, Geo said. "The key hole on the right opened the door but since the puzzle had reset, I'd use the key hole on the left this time."

Grace nodded and placed a key into the left keyhole and turned it. The doors opened, revealing the entryway beyond and they three walked inside with the doors closing behind them. "I want to check up on Garth." concerned, Grace said.

"He's probably fuming by the indoor pool." smiling, dad said. "There are several doors there, all with their own clever little puzzles we use for training."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: No shortcuts in training.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
As dad had predicted, I was sitting at the edge of the indoor pool, fuming over my situation. I was shivering from both the ice cold water and from embarrassment. I looked around that the dozen doors around the pool and frowned, seeing that each had another puzzle lock on them. "I can't believe I fell for that!" annoyed, I said to myself. "It's the oldest fun house trick, I should have seen that coming!"

"If its any consolation, I fell for the same trap when I was your age." said Geo, emerging from one of the doors. "Only the pool was warm at the time."

I sighed but forgot my worries as I saw Grace wet and shivering as well. "What happened!?" standing up, I asked.

"I- I ha-had to sol-solve the puzzle lo- lock to get- get to yo- you." shivering, Grace replied.

"The puzzle lock also had a trap door only Grace was trapped inside a room under the floor that would only let her out and open the door if she can say 'open' in three languages, said only once via a recording." holding Grace, dad replied. "Only, the room fills with water as the timer does down to freak out the one cracking the puzzle."

"What!?" disturbed, I asked.

"It only goes as far as her hips, Garth." assuring me, dad said. "Still, the water is ice cold as the heaters had not been on in years." seeing my face harden, he quickly added, "The filtering system was left on, however, the water is clean."

"I- I'm okay." smiling, Grace said. "I go-got it on the- the first try."

"Any other surprises for us, dad?" annoyed, I asked.

Dad sighed. "I know you are annoyed with us, kids." smiling, he said. "Only now that we are inside, all the puzzle locks will be disabled so we can give you the grand tour."

"Maybe Garth would like to see his father's junk yard gym." looking at me, Geo said. "It's a crazy place to work out."

"Or maybe Grace would like to see her mom's library." smiling at me, dad said. "It's quite extensive."

"We still need to stay together." added Geo. "You two can decide where we go first."

Grace and I turned to each other, smiling....

Where do we go first?
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Meeting at the pool.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Albeit reluctantly, I agreed to go to the library first. As we stepped inside, however, I could not help be impressed as the collection was indeed extensive. The library seemed to take up a whole wing of the mansion, five floors of selves upon shelves of books. "Incredible." whispering, I said. "This is like..."

"The halls of knowledge." with awe in her voice, Grace said. "This is where aunt Sarah and uncle Geo went when they needed to research something new."

"Every book on every subject can be found here." smiling, uncle Geo said. "I have been keeping it up to date." blushing, he added, "I never liked not being prepared."

"Can we look around?" looking at dad, I asked.

"Go ahead." chuckling, dad said. "Expand your knowledge."

Grace and I smiled at each other and ran towards the one book that interested us the most. It was a huge book, about half the size of a door with the letters 'PCG' on the cover in large gold letters. "The Problem Child Gang mission log!" trembling, I whispered. "I've wanted to look at this since I read the first book!"

"It's all here." smiling, Grace said. "How they all first met, where they were when they decided to join forces, their first mission and...." she swallowed hard as dad closed the book.

"It also holds our last mission." seriously, he said. he then smiled, opening the book to a blank page. "It is only to be added to under a new chapter..."

"Passing the torch." my eyes bugging out, I read. "Dad, you're really going to let us...?"

"If the Agency thinks they are going to take my children without a fight, they have a serious wake up call coming." angry, dad said. "I don't like the idea of you and the others becoming vigilantes...." his voice trailed off.

"However, you do what you must to protect family." finishing the thought, uncle Geo said. "If the Agency wants the Problem Child Gang... they should watch what they wish for."

At the moment, a large television, mounted on a wall, came to life on its own. A test screen came up as a thunderous voice called out, "Puerí Problementa!"

"Latin for problem child." turning pale, Grace said. she turned to dad. "What does this mean!?"

"Someone has placed a note in the 'blind post office'." raising a single eyebrow, uncle Geo said. "It's a loose brick in the outside wall of the gymnasium of our old school."

"There's a motion detector there that sends a signal to us when it detects a note being placed in the slot." seeing our stunned looks, dad said. "Only televisions with a special box Steve made at the time receives the call. I'm surprised its still working after twenty years."

"I like to be prepared." smiling slightly, uncle Geo said. "The question is... what do we do?"

"I will help you, regardless what you decide, Garth." kindly, Amara's voice said.

"I will support your decision, Grace." kindly, Tamara's voice said.

Only, before we could utter a word, dad said...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Shadows of the Past.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"The car's outside," Dad said. "If you want to check it out, I'll drive you. You know, just in case it's a trap."

Now that we had a back-up plan, I felt a lot better. "I'm up for it."

"So am I," Grace said. "Let's see who wants to send a message."



As we drove through the neighborhood, the car was approached by a blur. "That can only be one person," Dad said. "Open the door, Garth."

I opened the door, just in time for Lyssa to grab it. "Hi, guys," she said. "You got the message, too?"

We nodded. Dad said, "You're checking it out, too?"

"Taking a quick look, anyway. I figured, if it's a trap, I can get away before it closes."

"Since we're headed that way," Dad suggested, "why don't you ride with us? You may need your speed later."

Lyssa didn't need to be asked twice, and slid next to me in the back seat.



We got to the school, and left the car to check things out. "Nobody's here, now," Dad said. "How about I check the 'blind post office', and you kids keep watch?"

"I see tracks," Grace said. "Looks like whoever was here took off in a hurry."

"Yeah," Lyssa agreed, "and they had company. Chief Jones, one set of footprints is small, like a little kid's."

"As Sherlock Holmes said, 'The game's afoot,'" Dad said. "Better check this out more closely. If it gets too hairy, try to lead them back here."

The three of us followed the tracks, not knowing what or who we were about to find.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Grace, the car's outside!

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Grace, Lyssa and I ran behind the school to see Clem Rodgers backing away from three men as he kept a little girl, I knew to be her little sister behind him. "Looks like we got her just in time." running closer, I said "Lyssa, we need to get the girl out of danger, fast."

"Fast is what I do." running with me, Lyssa said. "I got it covered."

"How did you get here?" asked Clem, seeing us join him against the three men.

"Long story." quickly, Lyssa said. "Who're these guys?"

"Don't know," between panting breaths, Clem said. "They're after us. I... don't know how long... I can keep... "

"Not your problem anymore," grabbing Rhea, Lyssa said. she turned to her. "Hang on. Don't let go."

With that, she was off in a blur, taking Rhea with her while Grace used a clothesline move on one of the men before pile driving the second. Watching her fight with wrestling moves, he muttered, "Where'd she pick that up?"

One of the men in suits managed to get close to Clem, glaring at me. "Tell your friend to stand down," snarling, he demanded. "This doesn't have to concern you."

"This does concern me," growling, I replied. "This is my friend. And my sister's the least of your worries." I quickly thought, "Let's give this punk a wake up call, Amara."

With an inward giggle, I felt myself growing to huge proportions, watching the seemingly shrinking man quickly turn pale before me. The man tried to raise a weapon only I pulled it out of his hand, crushing it in my grip. "I'll have to more careful, I could have crushed his hand." glaring at the man, I thought.
