"This just went beyond what we were told to expect," said the man. "Pick up brass!"

When he said this, he and the other two touched what looked like wristwatches, and disappeared in flashes of light. "Thanks," still panting, Clem said.

"Don't thank us yet," walking up to him, Grace said. "I'm betting we'll be seeing them again."

Then Lyssa returned with Rhea in her arms, giggling. "Sorry I missed the action," smiling, she said. "This little monkey demanded a ride."

"You must be Rhea," smiling, Grace said. "I'm Grace. This is Garth. And you've met Lyssa. We're friends of your brother's"

"How'd you guys find me?" still in shock, Clem asked. "It's like you knew where I was the whole time."

"We had an idea where to look," Lyssa said. "Glad to see you again, Clem. It's been too long."

"My fault. I apologize. But how'd you know where I was?"

"The 'blind post office'. As you may have guessed, there really was a Problem Child Gang. They were our parents."

"I told you she was a girl." sticking her tongue out, Rhea said.

Clem turned to Lyssa, stunned. "G-Greg!?"
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: The confrontation

choices: Continue with the Problem Child Gang
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Lyssa began to seethe when Clem said that.

"I seen your picture," Rhea said, seemingly unaware of Clem's faux pas. "Clem said you was a boy, 'cause you was dressed like one, but I knowed you was a girl."

"It's a long story," Grace said.

I pulled Clem aside. "Clem," I said, "you haven't hung out with Lyssa in a long time, and that's your business. But, if you want to hang out with us," - I said this part through clenched teeth - "you don't use the G-word in her presence!"

*Calm yourself, Garth,* Amara told me. *I don't think your friend meant any harm.*

Clem swallowed hard. "S-sorry,... Lyssa," he said. "I guess I forgot."

Lyssa and I both calmed down somewhat. "Clem," she said, "what are we going to do with you?"

"I know!" Rhea said. "Make him be a girl, for the rest of the day."

Lyssa chuckled. "It doesn't work that way, cutie-pie. I can't turn people into girls."

"But Clem can change!" Rhea insisted. "He can be a girl, or a pony. Or even SpongeBob Squarepants!"

"Just a minute," Grace said. "Rhea, you said you knew Lyssa was a girl from an old picture. How is that possible?"

"Rhea's got special vision," Clem sighed. "Just by looking at you, she can tell how you're feeling. and, apparently, if you're in the wrong body."

Rhea nodded. "That's how I found out I was adopted. Mommy and Daddy are aliens, and Clem is like them. That's why he can change his shape."

Dad came running up the hill. "I heard fighting," he said. "Thought I'd better... " He stopped talking when he saw Rhea.

"Dad," I said, "you remember Clem Rodgers. This is his kid sister, Rhea."

Clem shook Dad's hand. "Garth says you were part of the original Problem Child Gang. Guess you found my note."

Unbeknownst to us, we were being watched from the trees. One man spoke into a communicator. "Looks like we've got ourselves a new Problem Child Gang."

"Continue to observe," came the reply. "Will advise as necessary."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: continue.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"Make him be a girl for the day!" persisted Rhea. "He can change into anything, honest!"

"Something we need to know?" turning to Clem, dad asked.

"You're 'killing' me, sis!" sighing, Clem said. "We're supposed to keep that a secret! Mom will be furious!"

Rhea teared up. "But... you promised." her lip trembling, she said. "They can do stuff too, they won't tell on us."

"Yeah, Clem." seeing an opportunity for mischief, Lyssa said. "We won't tell on you, let's see your feminine side."

Grace, seeing Lyssa's mischievous look smiled as well. "If your bashful, we can turn around." teasing, she said. "You saw our secret, let's see yours."

"Enough." firmly, dad said.

"It's okay, sir." blushing brightly, Clem said. "I used the G word with Lyssa without thinking, I owe them at least this."

"Alright but quickly." looking about, dad said. "I doubt you want your secret to become publicly known."

Rhea giggled as Clem blushed brightly before concentrating. We all watched wide eyed as Clem's body shrank down to feminine proportions before his face and body changed to that of a teen girl. The silent shock turned to amused chuckling as Rhea pointed at her brother, or rather sister and her clothing shifted, changing into a skirt and tube top, showing off her curvy mid drift. Unknown to us, she remembered to summon the wig as well. "Much better." giggling, Rhea said. "Say hi to Jenny."

We all snickered as Jenny blushed brightly. Rhea giggled but then moaned, stumbling backwards. Lyssa caught her. "Easy, little one." concerned, she said. "I'm guessing you're the one who changed Clem's clothing."

"She has some mental powers as well." shaking her head, Jenny said. "Only she's a little too young to use them for very long, it takes a lot out of her."

"What about you?" looking at Clem, I asked. "Doesn't changing forms take a lot out of you?"

"Just when I change into something larger than myself." shrugging, Jenny replied. "Still, I have to be careful as I am going through a form of puberty."

I saw that she winced that that last part and asked, "What do you mean a 'form' of puberty?"

Jenny sighed and removed her wig. "Alien puberty." near tears, she said. "Rhea wasn't joking when she said my parents are aliens, I am one too, just born on Earth."

"He's completely hairless... Just like Cait." whispering, Lyssa said.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Continue with the Problem Child Gang

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"Cait?" Jenny's hand went to her head. "Cait's like this, too?"

Before anyone could respond, I started to feel a little... off. "Anyone else feel that?" I asked.

"Feel what?" Jenny asked.

Grace and Lyssa nodded. "Just like the mall," Grace said.

"Dad," I said, "I think we need to get out of here. And we need to get creative about how to get there."

"Understood," Dad said. "The police academy taught me everything I know about losing pursuers."



As we got underway, we told Dad about the fight, and Jenny told us about the note. "What do you think, Chief?"

"It sounds like Rhea's caught the attention of the Agency," Dad said. "It's a quasi-governmental agency that recruits kids to do their dirty work."

"Weird," she said.

"When a 5-year-old girl points a sniper rifle at your head, 'weird' is one letter longer than any word going through your mind." He said this while staring at Rhea. I got the feeling that there must be something about her that made him uncomfortable, but he wasn't saying what.

"Like my dream," Rhea said. "I saw some men who wanted to take me away. And there was something much worse looking for me, too."

"That could be Sykes," Dad said. "Sykes and the Agency are out to destroy each other, and they don't care much about anyone caught in the crossfire." He turned his attention to Jenny. "How are you explaining your, uh condition? I mean, when you're not changing shape."

"Mom found an article," Jenny explained, 'about Plutonium beauty products causing hair loss. I tell people that I used the body wash."

"Interesting timing," Dad said. "I heard through the grapevine that Plutonium had just dodged a buyout attempt by Cain Chemical, right before that problem started. And Cain is one of Sykes's front companies."

"Could you guys do me a favor?" Rhea asked.

"Sure, boo," Lyssa said. "What is it?"

"If something bad happens to me, find my mommy. My real mommy, the one who borned me. Tell her I'm in trouble."

"Okay," I said. "How will we know when we find her?"

"Tobi says you'll know."

"Tobi's her symbiont," Jenny explained. "That's where she gets her powers."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: continue.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
It was not long before we realized we were driving on the freeway, heading east. "Where are we going, dad?" turning to him, I asked. "I thought we were going to take Jenny and Rhea back to their homes."

"That would only lead those interested in Rhea to her doorstep." driving, uncle Geo said. "You may not have realized it but there is a black car about three car lengths back, its been following us since we left the school."

Rhea gasped and turned to look out the back window of the van but Grace pulled her down as something hit the window, breaking a hole in the glass, causing her to scream. "Don't do that again." sternly, she said.

I turned to see what is was and gulped, seeing a tranquilizer dart. "Everyone down!" pushing Lyssa and Grace to the floor, I yelled. "Those maniacs are firing on us!"

Jenny grabbed Rhea and, to my surprise, quickly changed into a box, with Rhea inside while I used my one body to protect Lyssa and Grace. "Uncle Geo, get us out of here!" begging, I called to him.

"Give me the wheel!" moving to the front, dad ordered. "You know what to do."

Uncle Geo nodded then got out of the driver's seat, still holding the wheel while dad took the seat before taking the wheel and steered through traffic. "Everyone hang on." walking towards the back, ordered uncle Geo. "This is going to be a kick in the ass."

Curious, I watched as uncle Geo opened a panel under the back window I had never seen before and turned a switch. Just above the rear bumper, a large panel opened, revealing what looked like a rocket booster. "Turbo turbine ready." turning to dad, uncle Geo said. "Kick it!"

I turned to the front to see dad hit a switch on the steering wheel before letting out an excited yell as we all felt the van suddenly pick up a lot of speed as the turbine fired. Dad turned the wheel with expert precision, moving through the traffic, leaving the back car in the dust. I exchanged startled looks with Grace and Lyssa but they turned to smiles as we rolled our eyes hearing dad and uncle Geo declare, "Problem Child!"

Minutes later, we arrived at...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Being Chased.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
... the safe house. "Here's something you probably never thought you'd see," Dad told Jenny. "The actual Problem Child Gang headquarters."

Jenny hopped out, then helped Rhea out. "I can't wait to look around."

"Not unescorted, you won't," Uncle Geo said. "As Garth can tell you, we've got this place pretty well booby-trapped."



Once we got inside, Jenny called her parents to let them know where they were. She didn't mention the Agency goons who'd tried to capture them. I guess she didn't want them to worry.

Once that was through, I showed her and Rhea around. Jenny just about flipped over everything. "I can't believe I'm actually seeing this stuff in real life," she said. "How long does it take to get used to this?"

"You're asking me?" I replied. "A month ago, everything seemed normal. Then, I started Hulking out, Lyssa changed into a girl and got super-speed, and I found out there are these alien symbionts. Oh, and I found out that my best friend is from another planet!"

"Actually, I'm from this one," she replied. "I was born here on Earth. It's my parents who are aliens. I didn't find that out until I started changing shape."

"My point being, in light of all that stuff, the idea that my folks used to be teen detectives is rather minor."

"I suppose." Jenny was silent for a while, then asked, "Does Lyssa know?"

"Know what?"

"How you feel."

"Oh. Yeah, we've talked about it. Is it that obvious?"

"Kinda. Who knows? If I stand a chance with Cait, maybe we can double-date."

"Dating's not on the radar, what with everything that's going on. But maybe Lyssa can put in a good word for you."

"Cait listens to Lyssa?"

"Especially since they found out they were cousins."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: PCG headquarters.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
As Jenny fiddled with her bra, I asked, "How's it going, being a girl?"

"I can take it for the rest of the day," she said. "But I'll be glad when I can be myself again. It's really giving me insight into what Lyssa was going through."

"And you said Rhea knew all that, before we told her?"

"It's her symbiont. It started with her seeing auras. She can look at you and tell how you're feeling. Only, when she looked at me or Mom or Dad, she'd see funny colors, in shapes that didn't match the forms we were wearing. That's how we wound up telling her about the adoption. Mom was going to wait until she was around our age.

"What freaked me out, though, was when she found this old picture of you, me, and Greg from when we were ten. She asked me why my friend was dressed like a boy. Remember, that was when Lyssa was Greg's little secret. There was nothing about the shot that said we were different from how we looked, yet Rhea could tell. Then, she used her symbiont to show me Lyssa's medical records, saying that she was changing into a real girl." She paused. "I can't believe how I reacted when she first told me. I don't know how she can forgive me for being such a rotten friend."

"It could have been worse," I said. "If she wasn't a descendant of Iole, she'd still be a girl trapped in a boy's body. She used to cry about how long it was taking the hormones to work, thinking she'd be underdeveloped forever. I consoled her as best I could, not daring to tell her that I was falling for her."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: More of the tour

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"Speaking of Lyssa," looking past me, Jess said. "It looks like your dad wants a private talk with her."

I turned to see Lyssa close the door to one of the bedrooms and shrugged. "Dad is a police officer to the last." lightly, I replied. "I have no doubt he'll be talking to all of us in private before long."

We made our way back into the library where Grace was keeping Rhea entertained and began to talk about how we had fist discovered our abilities when I noticed Lyssa stepping into the library, looking concerned. My own concern rose when she pulled out a cellphone and dialed a number. "I wonder what's going on." watching her, I thought.

Then, upon finishing the call, Lyssa quietly called us all together as Geo and dad entered behind her. I was the first to reach her, worried something was wrong.

"Okay, Lyssa, what was so urgent that you needed to see all of us right away?" concerned, Grace asked. "You sounded super worried over the house intercom."

"Remember those goons who were after Clem and Rhea?" seeing Ted Jones shake his head, Lyssa asked. "Well, Mr Jones told me that the Agency was after Rhea's birth mother twenty years ago. My guess is they want Rhea and Clem for the same reasons, they both have a unique power they can use to their advantage."

I was shocked, not noticing dad discretely nodding before Clem asked, "How did they learn of Rhea or even me?"

"Rhea's mother got away from the Agency on our last mission." speaking up, dad said. "In that sense, I guess we gained a small victory." he shuddered slightly. "Bear in mind, though, these people are true monsters. I can only guess they had been tracking Rhea's birth mother and discovered her child in one of those searches."

"The van watching the house." thinking out loud, Clem said. "They must have been with this Agency."

"If that is the case, they had been watching you for a while, young man." serious, dad said. "They were merely waiting for the right time to strike."

"No one is going to take you two anywhere if we have anything to say about it." serious, I said to Clem and Rhea.

"Wh- What about my- my birth mommy?" frightened, Rhea asked. "I do- don't want mo- monsters to g- get her!"

"Maybe mom and dad can find her." trying to calm her sister, Clem said. "They have... gifts of their own."

Rhea gave Clem a grateful smile only to have it suddenly turn to terror. "They found her!" her lips and hands quivering, she screamed. "The monsters are chasing her!"

Lyssa quickly knelt down and turned Rhea's head to face her. It broke all our hearts to see such a small child so very terrified. "Where is your birth mommy?" firmly, she asked. "Can you tell us where she is?"

"Hospital!" crying in hysterics, Rhea replied. "They're running from the hospital!"

"That's only five miles from here." startled, Geo said.

"Mount up!" pointing in the direction of the garage, dad ordered. "Grace, you drive. We will give advice through ear piece radios as we watch through the camera feeds!"

Within minutes, we were all given earpiece radios, exactly as they were described in the comic series and led to the garage where Grace moved to get into the family car. "Not that one, honey." moving to a tarp covered vehicle, dad said. "This one."

I turned and smiled, as pulled off the tarp to reveal a modified, sleek black, van! "It's the Beast!" impressed, I thought. "Just as it was described in the comic series!"


"The Beast!" an awe filled smile forming, Lyssa whispered. "You really had it!"

"This is the 1983 GMC Vandura G series, which Ted and I had modified." quite proudly, Geo said. "This bad boy as a 10 inch armored plated hull and armored glass windows. It carries a 2.7 liter supercharged V8 engine that delivers 300+hp and 400+ torque with a top sustained speed of 180 mph."

It was indeed an impressive machine that carried a lot of muscle, I just hoped Grace would be able to handle it.

"We can talk cars later." scolding, dad said. "Get moving!"

We all piled into the van and sped off, towards the hospital. Our first mission had begun....
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Your choice

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"I hope she'll be okay with being left behind like that." wincing, Lyssa said as she turned to face the front. "It is her birth mother, after all."

I sighed, remembering seeing Rhea waving sadly as we pulled out of the garage. Dad thought it was too dangerous for such a young girl to get involved, I had to agree.

Then, I heard Lyssa let out a low scream and turned from the front passenger seat to see Rhea standing in front of an equally startled Jessica. Rhea looked painfully pale and she was shivering but her voice was determined. "I- I'm go-going with y-you, Jess." panting, she said. "S-She's my mo-mommy!"

"Rhea, are you crazy!" gripping her shoulders, Jessica asked. "Look at yourself, you look like a ghost!" she sighed wearily. "Please don't use your powers unless you really have to, you're going to hurt yourself!"

Rhea began to cry, having been yelled at by her brother/sister. "But... my mommy."

Jessica shook her head and I felt a lecture coming. Fortunately, Jess just let it go and put her into an empty seat before fastening the seat belt. "Just make sure you stay behind us." she said.

We drove in the direction of the hospital, until Rhea said, "Stop!"

Grace stopped. "What is it?"

Rhea pointed at a gathering crowd. "There they are! Mommy and her boyfriend!"

I looked, but all I could see was a small boy in a dress carrying a doll, being surrounded by some goons carrying weapons. "Rhea's mom or not," I said, "we can't let this go down." We all piled out of the Beast and made for the group, Garth hulking up to weightlifter size.

We got to the group in time to hear the goons' leader say, "Kiss, Kiss, my dear."

I was not about to let anyone hurt a kid and let my fist fly! "KISS THIS!" I roared, punching the man in the jaw.

The guy sat up, after being thrown off his feet, rubbing his jaw. "Hello again, Garth. You caught me off guard, but not without resources." At that, the goons aimed their weapons at Garth.

I was about to order everyone behind me but Lyssa said, "Think fast."

A gust of wind and a quick blur later, all of the men had been relieved of their weapons as they were now lying on the ground at my feet while Lyssa smiled as if she had never moved. "Too slow."

"Good, we can examine these later and see what kind of tech we are up against." smiling slightly, I thought.

The leader's eyes narrowed. "You kids don't know what you're in the middle of. You need guidance."

"We've got guidance," my own eyes narrowing, I replied. "And it's you who doesn't know what he's doing. Drop this, before it gets dropped on you."

One of the goons said, "Looks like Blue team wasn't kidding. Your orders?"

"We've got all the information we need," the man said. "We can easily pick up Sarah and her fiance at our leisure. Ta-ta." With that, they all touched devices on their wrists, and they and their weapons disappeared. So much for analyzing them.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Arriving on the scene.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
The 'girl' sighed. "Looks like I owe you kids one."

"Our pleasure." returning to normal, I said. "Where's Sarah? You're dressed like a Sarah, but I don't think you are her."

"That would be me," the 'doll' said. "We'd present ourselves better, but we're short on the right size clothing just now."

Rhea stepped forward and carefully took the doll from the child. "Are... are you my mommy?"

"I am, sweetie," tears filling her tiny eyes, the 'doll' said. "You look okay."

"We'll need to save the reunion," the 'girl' said. "Hagen's right. He's got access to our personal information, and he can track us down whenever he feels like it. We're going to need someplace to lie low."

"We've got just the place," I said. "Hagen's got to master several puzzles before he can even think about getting in."

We ushered the cross dressed boy and the doll, in Rhea's careful hands into the van. Grace then drove us all back to the mansion. As we exited the van, I said, "Welcome to the clubhouse of the Problem Child Gang."

"Thanks again," the boy, who introduced himself as Todd said. "It's a lucky thing you kids showed up when you did."

"Nuh-uh," said Rhea, who was still carrying Sarah. "Andromeda told Tobi where to find you."

"Who's Andromeda?" curious, I asked. "And who's Tobi?"

"Andromeda," Sarah explained, "is an alien symbiont who lives inside me. Tobi is her offspring. And Rhea is a clone of me, created to save Tobi's life."

We were about to walk through the garage door, when it opened, revealing dad's muscular form. "She's not coming in here!" he declared.

"But she's my mommy!" Rhea protested.

"Honey," Todd asked, "what is he talking about?"

"When I was Rhea's age," Sarah explained, "Dr. Hagen had me shadow the Problem Child Gang. Then, he wanted them dealt with."

Dad shook his head. "You have such a pretty way of describing shooting someone in the shoulder."

"It's not that I shot you in the shoulder. It's that I didn't shoot you in the head or heart."

"What?"

Sarah nodded. "Hagen ordered me to kill you, but I didn't want to. I deliberately shot you in the shoulder, instead. Then, I went into hiding, using the last name Barns. If it weren't for Cain Chemical, Hagen still wouldn't know where I was living."

Dad shook his head again. "Sykes again. These names just keep turning up, don't they?"
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: The club house.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"Sykes?" confused, Todd asked. "Can someone fill me in here?"

Dad sighed, looking as if he were struggling to make a decision. "Alright, everyone inside." finally, he said. "We'll find you all some suitable clothing."

A few minutes later, Todd sat next to Sarah on a comfortable couch inside a spacious library. They were both the size of teenagers, wearing teen clothes. I assumed it was to keep them under control as I had seen adult clothing as well but I did not comment on it. We all sat around them, explaining the events surrounding our brief encounter with Hagen and his men on the streets near the hospital. In turn, we listened as dad and Geo explained who Sykes was and how their group came to lock horns with the Agency. "We had thought that the Agency wanted us as part of their army of brainwashed soldiers." finishing his explanation, dad said. "Apparently, we were wrong."

"The Agency had considered it but, with half your group was related to the most wealthy families on the planet, it was too much of a security risk." looking at dad, Sarah said. "Believe me, Mr Jones, you will never know how lucky you and your team was." I teared up, adding, "They killed my family to claim me."

Jess placed a reassuring hand onto Sarah's shoulder. "They won't get you a second time, not if we can help it." smiling, she said. "Rhea is my adopted sister, I won't let anything happen to her birth mother."

"Jessica is really my brother, Clem, mommy." smiling, Rhea said. "He can change into almost anything." giggling, she added, "Even an older sister."

Sarah could not help giggle at that as Jessica blushed. "Thank you for taking care of my little girl.. Jessica." pecking her on the cheek, Sarah said. "Do you all have powers like this?"

"We do." seriously, I replied. "However, I think its more important that we focus the issue at hand... The Agency."

"I agree, we need to place all we know on the table now." equally as serious, Geo said. "We don't want to be caught off guard a second time."

"We know that Dr Hagen knows about all of us, perhaps even that Travis kid." speaking up, Lyssa said. "Only I'm guessing you didn't know him back then, Mr Jones."

Ted shook his head. "No, we didn't." with a hint of regret, Ted replied. "Had I known who Dr Hagen was, I would not have allowed him anywhere near my children." then a thought occurred to him. "He told us that he had removed the 'tumor' that caused Garth's body to build up, yet the symbiont..."

*Hagen only removed a piece of me, Garth.* her voice in my head, Amara said. *It was just enough to stun me and return you to normal, I am actually everywhere inside of you.*

"Amara said that Hagen only took a piece of her, stunning her enough to return me to normal." after a pause, I said. "That can only mean..."

"He knows about the symbionts." his face turning white, dad said.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: A realization.

choices: a phone call and a strange message.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"We'll work out a plan of action against Hagen later," dad said. "How about the kids show you around the place, since you'll be staying here until things calm down?"

"Sounds good to me," Sarah said.

"One moment, Garth." said dad, motioning me to him.

I walked to dad and leaned to my ear. "Just show her what she needs to see as a guest." whispering, he said. "It's not that I do not trust her, it's because she was brainwashed." pausing, he asked, "Why would anyone say 'kiss kiss, my dear' in normal conversation?"

My eyes widened at than and I quickly nodded before I then began to lead Sarah and Todd around the clubhouse with Grace, Jessica, and Lyssa. Rhea, of course, tagged along.

"Bet you never thought you'd see the inside of this building," Grace said.

"Never," Sarah agreed. "I'll probably need another tour, I'm so distracted."

"It can be a lot to take in," Jessica said.

"It's not just that. I was supposed to start teaching in a couple of days." sighing, Sarah said. "I'll have to come up with a believable explanation for my absence, since no one is going to ever believe I'm on the run from some shadowy government organization."

"Chief Jones will help you in any way he can," Lyssa replied. "My mom will help, too. She's got to drop off my aunt at a treatment center, then she wants to talk with my cousin. She should be by sometime after that."

"Tell them thanks. Actually, though, I'm worried about how my absence will affect my homeroom class." with a grateful smile, Sarah said. "As a baptism of fire, I've been assigned mother-hen status to a group of kids who've been classified as problem children." after a pause, I explained, "They are a number of kids who aren't applying themselves well, a rich girl with an attitude problem, and a transgender student I'm supposed to keep my eye on in case of bullying. I don't know how they'll react if I'm not there; they might think I'm abandoning them."

"They'll be fine," reassuringly, Lyssa said, "don't worry."

"Thanks. You kids wouldn't be cruel to the transgender girl, would you?" asked Sarah. "You understand that she's going through a rough time?"

"I try to treat her well," Lyssa said, suppressing a chuckle. "She looks me in the eye when I brush my teeth."

Sarah's eyes just about popped out of her head. "Y-you're her? You-you look so feminine."

"Now it's my turn to thank you," she said, turning around to show her figure. "This past summer, I started turning into a complete girl."

"But how is that possible?"

"Long story. For now, let's just say that it runs in the family."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: touring the clubhouse.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
As we moved along, Grace and I purposely but discretely blocked Sarah and Todd's view of certain halls as we passed them; dad did not fully trust her. It was not because he thought her to be untrustworthy but because she had been brainwashed with no proof that it had ever been undone. Seeing her disappointed expression, I nodded and explained, "Dad wants you to know just enough to stay here for a while as a guest. It's not because you are not trustworthy, its because you were brainwashed."

"That was twenty years ago." sighing, Sarah argued. "I suffered countless nightmares from my year under their thumb, I still do but I managed to move on."

"Did you do anything to try to undo that brainwashing?" serious, Grace asked.

Looking surprised, Sarah slowly shook my head. "No... I never looked back after I fled from The Agency." tearing up a little, she said. "I was found, trembling in an empty alley, by a young couple who adopted me."

Grace sighed. "Unless you saw someone to break that brainwashing, you are still under their control." serious, she said. "All it takes is one code phrase from them, likely over a phone, and you are theirs again." pausing, she turned to us and muttered, "We better get Cait over here, fast."

"Cait?" confused, Sarah asked. "How many members does this new gang have?"

We all ignored her question as I suddenly grew to the size of an Olympian and took a strong hold of her arm. "Please do not take any offense to this." pulling Sarah along, I said. "We can not risk you turning on us."

With that, I half dragged, half carried a struggling Sarah into a spacious room with only one exit and gently pushed her inside while Grace pushed Todd in behind her before I shut the door and locked it tight. "I really hated to do that." muttering, I said. "She's as much a victim as anyone else."

*You did what you thought was best for the team, Garth* soothingly, Amara thought to me. *Perhaps Cait and Amatra can help her break free from the brainwashing.*

"One can only hope." sighing, I thought back.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: A partial tour.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Two hours later, dad heard the front gate buzzer go off and hit the intercom. "Who is this?"

"Caitlin Spencer," calmly Cait's voice replied. "Aunt Sarah said I was expected?"

Dad sighed, relieved. "One moment." he released the intercom switch and turned to Lyssa. "Cait has arrived, she's at the front gate, Lyssa." firmly, he said. "You are the fastest, go let her in."

By the time Lyssa returned with Cait in tow, everyone was in the room where we were holding Sarah Barns and her husband, Todd. Both of them were still in the form of teenagers. "Ms. Barns," Lyssa said, "this is Cait."

"How do you do?" calmly, Cait asked.

Mrs Barns shrugged. "My life's turned upside-down and inside-out in the past week, but I'm holding together." looking shaken, she said. "Ted says you can help me unravel my past?"

"I can try." stepping in front of Sarah, Cait replied.

"How does that work?" curious, Sarah asked.

"Just relax, and trust me." her voice almost echoing, Cait replied.

Once the two made eye contact, both of their eyes fell half open as they stood, unmoving. "Cait must be in Mrs Barns' mind right now." watching, I thought.

Minutes ticked by with the two unmoving as we could only watch, and hope. Then, Cait turned her head to the side. "Bad guys?" in a flat tone, she asked.

She paused then rose her hands as if she were holding a rifle at Mrs Barns. "What is she doing?" curious, I thought.

"I- I'm trying to obey, Jon." apologetically, Cait said. "I want to obey but-"

"This can't be good." worried, I thought. "Something might be trying to get into her head in return."

I did not voice my concern out loud, in fear of being wrong but I stayed on my guard as I then saw her hands beginning to shake, a look of uncertainty on her face. "I- I must obey." stammering, she said. "Jon is my master, I am his slave."

"This is not good." worried, I thought.

I was about to try to shake Cait out of the trance when she spoke again, her hands still shaking. "Mommy... daddy...." tears forming, she whimpered. she then rose her hands, barely still as she blankly yelled, "I must defend Jon! Do not come closer!"

Not knowing what to do, I turned to dad to see he was just as concerned before Cait once again, quivered, crying. "Jon... did." slowly, tearfully, she said, as if answering a question.

"What's gotten into Cait?" concerned, Grace asked me. "She's acting more and more like she's reliving a painful memory in Sarah's mind."

Not wanting to panic anyone with my own fears, I turned to and shrugged. "You're asking me? You're the one with the supercharged brain."

Suddenly, a handgun materialized into Cait's hand and she turned to me, leveling it at my left shoulder. Everyone in the room froze as a sad smile formed onto her face. With a glassy look in her eyes, Cait said, "I am sorry."

With that, she pulled the trigger...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Cait arrives.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
The gun clicked and Cait pulled the trigger again. no result.

Turning red, I slapped the gun out of her hand. "What's gotten into you, Cait?" almost screaming, I asked.

"I... I must kill you, Ted," to my surprise, Cait said. "But the gun won't work, so I cannot. I must. I cannot. Must... Cannot... " she sighed before passing out where she sat.

"I think she got caught up in Mrs Barns brainwashing." wincing, Grace said.

"I'm forced to agree." sighing, dad said. "Hagen obviously thought that someone would try to break her from their control and set a trap." he then produced two pairs of handcuffs and slapped them onto Cait's wrist before locking the other end onto the arm of the chair. He repeated the process with the other hand. "We'll see how she acts when she wakes up."

I was told later that Cait was awake and I went up to check on her to hear her talking to Lyssa.

"Are you awake?" concerned, Lyssa asked. "Are you okay?"

"I think so," in a pained voice. Cait replied. "I guess I did something stupid, huh?"

"You could call it that," walking past me, into the room, dad said. "Apparently, you wanted to kill me, and tried to kill Garth. Good thing the gun you teleported wasn't loaded."

"You were right," sighing, Cait said. "Ms. Barns still has her programming. I took her back through her memories, and stumbled onto it. When I tried to undo it, I got trapped in the programming."

He nodded. "So we'll need to be careful around her. Rhea's not going to like that, but we can't take chances."

Finally, I spoke up, "Is she back to normal yet?"

"Still bald and telepathic," Cait called back, "but not homicidal. Is that close enough?"

I stepped into the room, relieved to see Cait acting normally again. "I'll take it." smiling slightly, I said.

"Hagen was too clever for us," dad explained. "Cait's attempt to undo Barns' programming got her into a trap. The feedback loop from her unloaded gun knocked her out and freed her."

"Try to be gentle with her, Chief," begging, Cait said. "She's as much a victim as you were."

"I'll try to remember that, Cait." nodding, dad said. "Thank you for the attempt. What do you want to do now?"

"I'll go a few blocks away, and arrange for my driver to pick me up." with a rueful smile, Cait replied. "See you guys at school tomorrow."

"Sure you wouldn't rather spend the night here?" Grace asked.

Cait shook her head. "I've got some personal stuff to check up on. Sorry I couldn't be of more help."

Grace smiled. "You did what you could." sounding positive, she said. "And the old Caitlin Spencer wouldn't have done half as much for us. See you at school."

Dad unlocked the handcuffs. As Cait stood up and rubbed her wrists, dad asked, "What was her trigger?"

"It was 'Kiss Kiss, my dear'," I replied. "Why?"

"I have an idea," was his answer. "I'll have the kids tell you about it tomorrow, if it works."

"Not even a hint?"

He smiled. "Let's just say Hagen wouldn't be the first person I've dealt with who turned out to be too clever for his own good."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: The gun is empty.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"What's the plan, dad?" after Cait was gone, I asked. "You saw the result of trying to fight the brainwashing."

"We don't fight the brainwashing, we use it." with a knowing smile, dad replied. "like a scorpion stinging itself, we make the brainwashing cancel itself out."

"Interesting." raising an eyebrow, Geo said. "What do you propose?"

"We use the trigger phrase then command her to ignore that phrase completely before using the trigger word again to bring her back to herself." confident, dad said. "Once that is done, the Agency will not be able to control her."

"Simple, yet brilliant." impressed, Geo said. "It's worth a try."

"I'll do it." offering, dad said.

"No, Sarah Barns still has a standing order in her subconscious to kill you." firmly but kindly, Geo said. "I will do it." he then turned to me. "Garth, I will need you and your dad as back up in case something goes wrong."

I nodded, though I was uncertain. "I'll do my best."

With that, I followed dad and Geo up the stairs to the room we had locked Sarah and Todd Barns. Geo opened the door and entered, closing the door behind him as dad and I waited. Minutes past with nothing alarming being heard before dad knocked and peeked his head inside. "How'd it go?" he asked.

"It worked like a charm," Geo replied. "your hunch paid off."

"What hunch?" confused, Sarah asked.

"You had a trigger phrase," Geo explained, "which Hagen used to control you. Cait told us what it was, and we used it to shut down the mind-control system. Hagen won't be able to control you anymore."

"Is that why you told me to kiss you?" disturbed, Sarah asked.

Geo nodded. "That was your trigger. When I said it the first time, you went into a trance, ready for orders. If Hagen tries it again, he'll get a much different response from you."

Sarah nodded, looking relieved. "So I'm good to go?"

Dad smiled. "We'll let you see more of the place, but they're still looking for you at your apartment. By the way, somebody's waiting to see you."

He opened the door wider, and Rhea came in, accompanied by a teenage boy. "Hi, Mommy," she said, giving Sarah a big hug.

"Hi, sweetheart," Sarah replied. "Who's this?"

"My name's Clem," he said. "Rhea's brother. This is what I usually look like. Jessica was... something of a punishment. I called Lyssa by the wrong name."

"Tsk, tsk. You shouldn't have done that." shaking a finger, Sarah said.

"Yes, ma'am. Yesterday gave me some insight into what she went through all those years. It won't happen again."

"I like Jessica," Rhea said, pouting.

Clem chuckled. "I meant that I won't call Alyssa the wrong name again. Maybe sometimes, I'll let Jessica out to play."

"Yay!"

We all laughed, and Rhea told Sarah about the years since the Rodgers family adopted her. As she did, dad tapped my shoulder and pointed to the door. Getting the hint, we all walked out, allowing Sarah and her husband to have a private moment with their Rhea and Clem.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Dad's idea.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
The following day, dad called mom to bring her up to date on everything that had happened since we had left for the clubhouse for training. Not that we got much in, but we learned a lot unofficially became the new Problem Child Gang. Grace and I were in our own rooms, getting dressed when Cait's frantic voice echoed in our minds.

*There is going to be an attack at the school!* her panicked voice echoing, she called. *A gun man on a roof top, firing at all of us! We have to be ready!*

In the next breath, Grace, Lyssa, and I ran out of our rooms. "DAD!!" in unison, we screamed.

Dad was up the stairs in the next breath with Geo following. "What's wrong!?" concerned, he demanded.

We relayed Cait's message to him and he was about to grab his smartphone when a panicked scream was heard, it was Rhea and, seeing her abilities, I guessed she got the same vision as Cait. Lyssa was in Rhea's room in a heart beat with the rest of us quickly following to find Rhea siting on her bed. She was shaking, wide eyed, and terrified as she looked out into the distance, crying. "It's going to be okay, Rhea." as dad quickly walked off, dialing a number on his phone, I said. "My dad is the chief of police, he will stop this before it happens."

"What- What about the wolves?" still shaking. "Who will deal with them?"

Trying to make Rhea feel better, I increased in size to the size of an Olympian and made a 'muscle' pose. "Who's afraid of the big bad wolf?" using my best Arnold Schwarzenegger imitation, I asked. "I will pump him up!"

For a moment, Rhea looked at me as if I was insane then giggled, seeing Clem behind me, making the same poses but with his significantly smaller body. The other soon followed and I turned to see him smiling. "I couldn't resist." he said.

I shook my head and smiled only it vanished when dad walked back into the room. "Okay, everyone, listen up." sternly, he said. "I want all of you to act as if nothing is going on when you go to school but be ready for anything, understood!?"

We all nodded then got ready for school.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Preparing for school.

choices: Trying to make someone a harder target
No time to explain (a shot is fired)
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
I tried not to make it obvious that I was keeping a sharp look out for anything that looked like a threat as Natalie Turner, Grace's girlfriend, caught up with us at school. Natalie was Grace's height and just as fit with long auburn hair and wild green eyes. She gave Grace a loving kiss then looked at her crossly. "Where have you been the past couple of days!?" worried she asked. "It was as if you had suddenly dropped off the planet!"

"It's a long story, Nat." sighing, Grace said. "Garth was in the hospital.."

"Oh my gosh!" startled, Natalie said. "Garth, are you alright!?"

"I'm fine." focusing on my watch, I replied. "Just a little rattled, I guess."

Natalie frowned. "There is more to this." stepping in front of me, she said. "Garth, what happened to you?"

I sighed, turning to her. "It would take too long to explain everything." quickly, I replied. "Do you remember the Problem Child Gang mystery book series?"

Natalie nodded. "Yeah, Grace and I love to read them together." confused, she said. "What does that have to do with..."

Her jaw dropped as I increased to an adult size in front of her. "The characters in that book were based on real people; Tex the mighty was our dad, Natalie." returning to normal size, I said. "Grace and I... inherited those powers."

"Their enemies are real as well and we suspect they are after us." adding Grace. "We needed to train so to be better prepared when they make their big push." tearing up, Grace added, "Please don't think differently of me."

Natalie gave Grace a passionate kiss. "Never." touching her forehead onto Grace's. "I love you, no matter what."

Grace smiled, grateful and kissed her before breaking away and we continued walking towards school. On the way, I quickly explained the situation to Natalie and assured her that everything would be fine. Upon entering the schoolyard, we were met by Cait and Lyssa. "It's okay," seeing their worried looks, I said. "Dad's got a team in position."

"We'll just act like everything's normal," added Lyssa, "and the other kids won't have any reason to believe otherwise."

We were soon approached by a young boy I'd seen at the clubhouse. As he got closer, a knowledgeable smile formed onto Cait's face. "Hi, guys," the boy said.

cocking an eyebrow, Cait asked, "Aren't you a little old to be hanging out at the schoolyard?"

"How did... oh, yeah, Sarah told me about you," he said. "My name's Todd. I'm Sarah's fiance. We heard on the scanner that there was something going on here today, so I came to keep an eye on things. I figured a teenage boy wouldn't attract as much attention."

"Sarah Barns, our homeroom teacher this year." whispering carefully, I said to Natalie. "She and her husband have certain powers as well."

"Speaking of Sarah, how is she?" curious, Cait asked.

"She's fine," I said. "Once you were gone, they used the trigger phrase against itself. Hagen will never control her again."

Before another word could be said, Trish screamed.

When we looked to see why, we saw a pair of wolves, snarling and snapping at every student they approached. What Rhea had explained was coming to life, wolves at the school! "Then I heard Cait's voice in my head. *Garth,* she warned, *these wolves... They're human!*

"Get everybody inside," running towards the wolves, I said. "I'll handle this."

Knowing that few would notice in the chaos, I grew to Olympian size and scooped my arm under the first wolf to reach me and heaved it into the air. It was my intention to stun the animal by hitting it against the wall of the building only I missed and sent it loudly crashing through a window. A child like yelp reached my ears as Cait's voice again echoed in my ears. *Careful, Garth!* scolding, she thought to me. *They're human!*

"Give me a break, Cait." whispering, I said. "I didn't throw it that hard."

I jumped through the window to see a person lying where the wolf was supposed to be and gasped, surprised by who I had found. "Travis Greenway!?" stunned, I thought. "How did he get mixed up in all of this!?"

"What the hell do you think you're doing!?" annoyed, I asked.

Travis looked up at me, just as annoyed and replied...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: At school.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"Trying to save your neck," with a growl, Travis replied.

Sam came rushing in, jumping through the window as I did. "It's an emergency, Garth," quickly, he explained, as Megan joined us. "Clarence Mayweather is going to kill somebody."

Hearing that, I relaxed, realizing that they were trying to help by dispersing the crowd the fastest way possible, through fear and confusion. "It's okay, Mr. Connors. It's being taken care of." returning to normal size, I said.

"What?" confused, Sam asked. we all exited throught the window and looked up at Mayweather's perch, where he was now being taken into custody. "How'd that happen so quickly?"

"You can thank Cait," smiling, I explained. "She got a vision warning of the attack, and alerted us. At least, she alerted the kids she'd already made mental contact with. Once Dad heard about it, he got a team ready to take him down."

"Why didn't I hear about this?" upset, Sam asked. "And why would he send you kids to school, knowing what was about to happen?"

"Dad wanted him to think his plan was still going smoothly. And we only had an hour's warning. Dad couldn't contact everybody, and still draw up a counterstrike." serious, I explained.

Sam began to relax. "I guess that makes sense."

"You said Mayweather is the gunman?" looking at Sam, i asked.

Sam nodded. "We'd had run-ins with him as the Problem Child Gang. More recently, he tried to kill Sarah Vance, but only succeeded in putting her in a wheelchair."

I grinned at that. "Dad's been looking for him since he escaped. He may want to conduct that interrogation personally."

I looked about to see that everybody else had started to calm down, but then I heard another voice, saying, *Don't give him the chance. Run him down. Finish him off.*

Who?" whispering, I asked.

*It wasn't me.* concerned, Amara thought to me. *It came from somewhere else but I don't know where.*

Suddenly, I jumped as Lyssa appeared in front of me. She looked very concerned as she wrapped her arms around me. "Garth, I was so worried for you!" almost in tears, she said. "When I saw you go after that wolf, I... I..."

As suddenly as Lyssa appeared, I pulled her into a long, passionate kiss. Cheers from fellow students rose around us but I could only hear Lyssa's soft moan and see her eyes slowly close as she kissed me back. Fireworks went off in my mind as the kiss seemed to last forever. When we finally broke the kiss, Lyssa sighed, a dream like look forming on her face. "Never mind."

I chuckled and kissed her again, this time hearing the students cheer.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Trying to save your neck.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
I saw Cait go into a vacant room, with Lyssa following her. I guessed that they'd be talking about Lyssa's first kiss.

Morgan tapped me on the shoulder. "What's up, Garth? Lose a bet or something?"

I shrugged. "What're you talking about?"

"Dude," he said, "you just kissed the school he-she. On the mouth. Twice."

I smiled. "That's all changed, bro."

Morgan shook his head. "What? You're into guys, now?"

"She's not a guy. Something happened, and she changed this summer. She's no more a guy than you're a girl."

Jim, another friend of mine, came by just then. "You sure?"

"Come on, Jim," Morgan said. "There's no way he's telling the truth."

Jim shrugged. "I don't know, man. I have this cousin, and my family says she was born a boy, but they went to change the diaper one time, and he'd turned into a girl."

Morgan waved his hand. "I'll believe it when I see it."

We got to our homeroom, and I recognized Ms. Barns as the teacher. As more kids filed in, I caught a smile between her and Cait. I knew she was silently thanking her for her help.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Homeroom.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
The events of this morning became the main topic of conversation in class. My kiss with Alyssa Vance was on the top of the gossip list as she was still considered a he/she. "They're in for a surprise." smiling, I thought.

Next was an an anonymous tip someone had made to the school about a shooter. I was surprised by that but anyone who asked me about it, I explained that my dad got the tip as well and had it under control. Lastly was a news report that three wolves had escaped from Crater Zoo but were captured not far from the school. This surprised me as well but I guessed that Mr Connors had heard it on the radio and decided to use it to make us and the students harder targets.

"Weird, huh?" sitting next to me, Jim asked. "This town is certainly seeing a lot of action."

"Yeah, who would have thought." smiling, I said.

The day was moving smoothly until third period, physical education. Coach had us play dodge-ball tournament, to the annoyance of the class. Although my focus was on the game, I kept an eye on Alyssa and found it odd that the local goth girl, Lilith Nightshade, seemed bothered not to be on Alyssa's team.

Then Cassie, one of the 'popular girls' in school called for my attention. "Hey, Garth, check out your girlfriend!"

Just as I turned, she and Amber, a fellow 'popular girl', pulled Alyssa's shorts and panties down around her ankles.

My face turned red in tune with Alyssa's only mine was from anger. I knew I could throw have easily them both across the gym with one arm but violence was not the answer in this case. Fortunately, Jim and Morgan had jumped in front of me as Coach benched the two school bitches and escorted Alyssa to the locker rooms. "Easy, big guy!" thinking he was holding me back, Jim said. "They're not worth getting expelled over."

"Take a breath, calm down!" firmly, Morgan added. "Let the principal deal with them."

I watched helplessly as Coach led Alyssa, tears streaming down her face, out of the gym. I knew she was taking her to the principal's office, most likely to return shortly for Cassie and Amber. I again saw red when I saw the two trying to leave but paused as Amara's voice reached me. "Careful, Garth. silently, she warned. "I will not allow you to use your super strength out of anger."

"Thank you." grateful, I thought back.

I walked over to the two, ignoring Jim and Morgan's pleas to calm down and stared them in the eye. "Even you two should find it obvious that Alyssa is a girl." evenly, I said. "She is my girlfriend so back off." I turned to walk away but paused, adding, "As if either of you two losers had a chance to begin with."

I did not look back to see their expressions as I walked away but a sly smile from Lilith told it all, they were stunned. When Coach returned without Lyssa, she said, "Everybody, hit the showers." then she turned to Amber and Cassie and said, "You two are going straight to Principal Hendrick's office when you're through."

"Nice touch, telling them they did not have a chance, Garth." giving me a firm pat on the shoulder, Morgan said. "I saw and I believe, Alyssa is a very cute girl."

"She's mine." raising a playful fist, I said.

Morgan smiled. "Congrats, bro."

"Thanks."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Third class P.E.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
The rest of the day was hard for me as I was worried about Lyssa. She had a rough transition from boy to girl, a girl I was very much in love with. Fortunately, those two trouble makers Cassie and Amber, had been given a few days suspension for their little prank. Only, less than an hour later, Grace and I were called to the principal's office. "This is weird." muttering, Grace said. "What did we do?"

"I'm not sure." worried, I replied. "These past couple of days have been all weird."

Grace nodded in agreement but said nothing as we entered the principal's office. There, waiting for us with principal Hendrick was dad. "I'm sorry to pull you two from your classes, kids." flatly, he said. "I'm here on official business."

"What's wrong, dad?" looking frightened, Grace asked.

"I have been assigned to watch over a traumatized child who came to us, looking for help." seriously, dad replied. "We believe the boy had escaped from a certain terrorist group in Europe as he had a punched plane ticket from Berlin."

I gulped, noting that dad had emphasized 'us' meaning the PCG. "What does that have to do with us?" fearful, I asked.

"Until we can hide this boy in the system, I am not taking any chances." gripping my shoulder, dad said. he then turned to principal Hendrick. "I am pulling my kids out due to a threat against me and my family by the shooter who tried to attack the school this morning."

Grace gasped. "He escaped!?!"

"No, he did not escape." firmly but kindly, dad said. "Not on my watch."

This confused me more but then principal Hendrik spoke, "This is official business, kids." firmly, she said. "Please sign out and go with your father."

"What was that all about?" curious, I asked as dad led us to his squad car. "Were you really threatened by that jerk?"

Dad nodded. "Yes but I'm not worried about him." seriously, he replied. "That boy I mentioned had escaped from the Agency and he confirmed my worst fears." he took a breath as if to steady himself. "They are after you, all of the kids of the original members."

I gulped at that. "So, they're bringing the fight to us?" guessing, I asked.

"I'm not certain." getting into the driver's seat, dad replied. "I do know that the Agency is already pulling strings to get the boy back though the legal system."

"Is there any way to stop them?" alarmed, I asked.

"The boy is an orphan." turning back to look at Grace and I, dad said. "I had to push to adopt the kid to stop them from taking him back." he then smiled. "My team moved faster, you two have a new little brother."

"Really?" a smile forming, I asked. "What's his name?"

"When do we get to meet him?" smiling as well, Grace asked.

"We're going out to meet him just as soon as I pick up your mother." turning back to the front, dad said. "He has talents of his own so don't be too shy around him."

With that, dad drove away from the school with his lights flashing...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: After school.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
After swinging by the house to pick up mom, dad ordered us to all pile into the civilian car before dad drove towards the edge of town. Grace and I both noticed this and began to worry. "Um... dad, where are we going?" curious, I asked.

"We had a secret underground headquarters set up, which we intended to use if things got too dangerous." driving, dad began. "It is an old subway system project that the city abandoned years ago due to budget issues. The tunnels go everywhere under the city but no one remembers it even exists, they abandoned the project over fifty years ago."

"Is that where you are keeping our new brother, Tim?" curious, I asked. "This underground headquarters?"

Dad nodded. "When the Agency makes their move, and I believe they will, that is where we will be taking everyone." firmly, he said. "No one knows it exists and we removed all evidence of its existence from the city records to make sure of that so everyone would be safe."

"You stole them?" surprised, Grace asked.

"We... misplaced them." with a knowing smile, mom replied. "I believe they were 'accidentally' sold at a charity auction years ago."

"To who?" curious, I asked.

"Mr Geo Tanner." innocently, mom said.

Minutes later, we arrived at a dead end road where dad hit a garage opener. Curious, I looked out and watched, wide eyed as a part of the road slowly sank into the ground, forming a ramp.

"Cool." whispering, I said. "The graphic novels never mentioned anything about this."

He then drove down the ramp before it rose back into position, hiding the entrance. "That was originally the parking garage entrance, we just installed a door." calmly, dad said. "

Once Ted parked the car, we stepped out to see that the subway station had been modified from what was a subway station to a command center I had seen in many a action movie. "Welcome to the Subterranean Urban Base station." motioning to the many rooms on either side of a crudely paved road, mom said. "This is where we took Tim to hide and train with an old friend of ours."

"This way." walking ahead, dad said. "Let me introduce you to the newest member of our family."

We walked down the wide sidewalk between the road and the many offices to a small boy standing with a tall young woman who excused herself and left before we could reach her. "Who..." curious, I asked.

"Tim, this is our son, Garth and our daughter, Grace." motioning to us, dad said. he then motioned to the boy. "Kids, this is Tim, your new little brother."

Tears formed Tim's eyes "Little... brother?"

Mom knelled down, smiling. "The final adoption papers rushed through only an hour ago." looking at him, she said. "Welcome to the family... Tim Jones."

Tim jumped into mom's arms, crying. "Mommy!" whimpering, he whispered.

Mom giggled. "Its alright, Tim." stroking his hair, she said. "Let it out."

Once Tim had managed to compose himself, mom released him and dad pulled him into a hug as well. "No one can replace your biological father." holding him tight, he said. "Still, I am honored to call you my son."

Tim lost it again, crying into dad's arms. It was truly a touching sight. Grace and I exchanged smiles before I stepped up to him. "So you are Tim." smiling, I said. "Good to meet you."

Dad broke the hug and Tim took my hand, shaking it. I tried not to grip him too tight but I could see him wince when I shook his hand. "Sam-Same here." shyly, he replied. "I hope we can be good friends."

"Friends?" smiling, Grace asked. "Tim, you are family now, it goes beyond friendship; you are a part of us."

Tim blushed brightly at that to which Grace giggled and gave him a warm hug. "You will never be alone, I promise."

"The Agency... they- they..." frightened, he began.

Mom took him into another hug. "They know all about it, dear." cooing him, she said. "Don't worry."

I smiled then grew to Olympian proportions. "We are far from defenseless, little bro." my voice booming, I said. "Like dad, we have talents of our own."

Unknown to me, dad did the same behind me as Tim gaped at me. Only I guessed I had eased his mind as he then smiled at me. "We inherited abilities from our mom and dad through a symbiont." returning to normal, I said. "An alien creature, living inside our bodies which give us our power in exchange for 'room and board'."

"This is epic." whispering, Tim said. he then smiled. "I have a power of my own, want to see?"

Grace and I eagerly nodded and Tim pulled out a pen and pad before quickly drawing an image. Once done, he seemed to drag the image off the paper and onto himself before he transformed before our eyes into a tall female warrior with large breasts and powerful muscles in a tight body suit. "I am Amazona, Princess of Power!" in a strong female voice, the woman before us said.

Grace and I looked at Tim's new form with our jaws dropped as mom and dad merely shook their heads. Once the initial shock wore off, Grace giggled. "Um... your character is a bit much." clearly amused, she said.

"Yeah, you need to tone that character down a little." smiling, I agreed. "For one, err, Amazona is proportioned all wrong, she'll have a hard time standing straight, let alone fight anyone."

The costume I was now wearing began to rip and Grace quickly covered my eyes. "Please put the drawing back before we all get a show." firmly, she said.

Tim touched the paper pad and the woman returned to it, becoming a mere drawing again. In her place, Tim stood, looking slightly drained. "I just wanted to impress you." pouting, he said. "Please don't be mad..."

Again, Grace giggled. "We're not mad." roughing up his hair, she said. "It's just that Amazona character needs work."

"If you don't believe me, ask the others." smiling, I said. "You'll meet them later."

Later on, dad drove Grace and I back into town where I asked to go to Lyssa's house. "She had a bad day, dad."

"I know, the principal informed me." calmly, dad said. "I'll drop you off and pick you up later." he then frowned. "Just two things; no word about Tim for now, he is still in danger."

"Okay." worried about my new brother, I said. "The second thing?"

Dad smiled. "Stay in the common rooms, okay?"

I nodded, glad dad was allowing me to visit. "Yes, dad."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Meeting our new brother.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
As I walked up the path to the front door, I saw Beth walking up the street. Seeing me, she hurried over with a worried look on her face. "I heard your dad pulled you and Grace out of school early." concerned, she said. "What happened?"

"I'm not allowed to talk about it." wincing, I said. "Official police business."

Beth turned to dad who sighed. "You will learn of it soon enough." firmly but kindly, he said. "Right now, its on a need to know basis only." pausing, he said, "Tell Lyssa we're sorry for what happened at school today."

With that, dad pulled away, leaving me alone with Beth. "Please believe me, dad would not keep anything a secret unless there was a very good reason." kindly, I said. "There is a good reason, please don't mention this."

Although very curious, Beth nodded and changed the subject. "Thank you for coming for a visit, Gar." smiling, she said. "Dad told me Lyssa is a little shaken from today."

"I'll see if I can cheer her up." smiling, I said.

Beth then led me into the house, passing Tim who was putting Sam down for a nap. I then followed Beth to Alyssa's bedroom. "Hey, sis." walking into the room, Beth said. "I got your homework for the rest of the day. And I brought somebody with me."

Peeking in from behind her, I said, "Hi."

Lyssa's slight pout turned to a grateful smile as she looked at me. I did not have to be a mind reader to know that I had made her day a little better. Lyssa walked over to me and pulled me into a warm hug.

"Hello, Garth," walking up to me, Lyssa's dad, Tim said. "Your parents know you're here?"

I nodded but, not wanting to open the subject of my dad again, I stated, "Mom says it's okay, long as I stay in the common areas." I then turned back to Lyssa. "My folks say they're sorry about what happened today."

"I'm doing better," smiling, Lyssa said. she then whispered in my ear, "I had hoped that, when you saw me naked, we'd be the only ones in the room."

Minutes later, we had moved to the living room and began to talk about the events at school. As we were talking, Sam came over and got Lyssa's attention. "Di-di," he said as he pulled on her jeans.

"I can tell," Lyssa replied, her nose wrinkling from the smell.

I smiled as I guessed 'Di-di' was his word for diaper. Lyssa sighed then excused herself as she carried her little brother out of the room....
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: visiting Lyssa.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Shortly after Alyssa left to deal with Sam with Tim helping, a knock came to the door. "Who could that be?" walking to the door, Tim wondered aloud. He opened the door. "Yes?"

Curious, Beth and I looked to see that it was Lilith Nightshade, the school goth. I had defended her a few times from bullies who picked on her merely because she liked to dress differently.

"I'm Lilith," she replied, "a friend of your daughter's. I came to see how she's doing."

"I'm glad you care so much about her." with a kind tone, Tim said. " Come on in. She's got another friend visiting, too. She's helping me with Sam, but she'll be right back."

Lilith walked inside and turned to Beth and I. "I didn't expect you to drop by," Beth said. "What brings you here?"

"I wanted to see how Lyssa's doing," Lilith replied. "And I hoped I'd get some answers."

"Answers?" Lyssa said, as she joined us. "About what?"

"For a start, how did you change?" curious, Lilith asked. "I've never seen anything like it."

"It's a family trait," Lyssa replied. "The same thing happened to an ancestor of mine."

"Okay," raising an eyebrow, Lilith said, "but what about the rest of you? It seems like a lot of the kids at school, and at least one of the teachers, are more than they appear to be."

"And how do you know that?" Tim asked.

"Because there's more to me than meets the eye, too," simply, Lilith replied. "I know there's something different about you because I can smell it. I got a concussion from my father beating me when I was a kid, and my senses have been cranked to 11 ever since."

I'm not sure if Lilith was aware but she rose off the floor by a full inch. "What on Earth!?" surprised, I thought.

I opened my mouth to tell her but Lyssa clapped her hand over my mouth, motioning me to remain silent.

"And you expect us to take your word for this?" Tim continued.

"There is more," Lilith admitted. "I know it sounds crazy, but I woke up this morning lying on the ceiling over my bed."

"That would explain it," Tim said.

"Explain what?" curious, Lilith asked.

Lyssa took her hand away from my mouth and nodded. "Lilith," I said, "you're an inch off the floor."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Another visitor.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Lilith looked down, her eyes widening in panic. "So, I am." her voice quivering, she said. turning back to us, she asked, "Do you guys have any idea why?"

Beth stood up, giving Lilith a sympathetic look before touching her shoulder. "We'll help you find some answers, Lilith." gently, she said. "We were all scared, at first."

"I was changing back and forth from boy to girl for days before my gender stabilized." honestly, Lyssa said.

Lilith winced, I could tell she was hoping for more than a promise of help. Deciding to simply show her, I grew into seven foot muscle bound giant before her eyes, making her fearful for a moment. "I was in the hospital, paralyzed with pain for days before my condition stabilized." in a deep voice, I said. I then returned to normal size adding, "Mine is due to something passed on by my mother so you could call it genetic as well."

Lilith looked at me worried. "Please, if you know something..."

"Are you familiar with the graphic novel series, 'The Problem Child Gang'?" serious, Tim asked.

"Yes, it's my favorite book series." confused, Lilith replied. "What does that have to do with..."

"That series was based on a true story." interrupting her, Tim said. "My wife was a member of that gang; as was Garth's father and mother."

"They made real enemies, Lilith." chiming in, I added. "Now, they are after us."

"Th-That was all real!?" stunned, Lilith asked.

"Yes." serious, Tim replied. "If your parents were involved with this gang or its enemies, it is likely you will be a target as well so we need to get some answers and fast."

"I- I see...." shaking, Lilith said. "I'd better talk to my mother right away."

Just then, Sam waddled in and spotted Lilith, hovering an inch above the floor. "Hewwo." smiling, he said. "Who you?"

"Sam, this is Lilith, a friend from school." patiently, Lyssa said. "She came to see how I was doing after school."

"Wiwith?" turning back to Lilith, Sam asked. "You can fwy?"

Lilith blushed at that. "I dunno, kid." still shaken, she replied. "I really haven't tried."

Then, to everyone's surprise, Sam rose above the floor, hovering at eye level to me before he giggled. "It easy, Wiwith." smiling, he said. "Twy it."

"Great." frowning, Tim muttered. "I have a toddler who can fly."

Sam then touched my nose. "Tag!" giggling, he said. "You it!"

I smiled slightly, watching him waddle away, giggling. Only he was doing it in the air instead of on the floor. "He is going to be a handful when he gets older." I thought.

"Come here, you rascal." teasing, Lilith said. "I'm gonna get you..."

She began to playfully give chase, walking on the air, just as Sam was. She tried to move faster to catch him but yelled in surprise as she suddenly took off into flight and hit the ceiling with a heavy thud. "Ow!"

Lilith fell to the floor with a thud, looking more embarrassed than hurt. Sam came down to the floor, looking worried. "You okay, Wiwith?" pouting, he asked. "I sowwy."

"Yeah, I think so." ruefully, Lilith replied.

"I think we better give your mother a call." frowning, Tim said. he then turned to Sam. "No flying for now, okay?"

Sam pouted, tears flowing. "What I do?" hurt, he asked.

Lyssa sighed and took Sam into her arms as he began to cry. "He doesn't understand, dad." comforting her little brother, she said.

"We'll deal with that later." firmly, Tim said. "Right now we need to see to our guest."

He then handed Lilith a phone. "Call your mother... now."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: continue.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
We all watched and listened as Lilith called mom. "Mom, it's Lilith." after her mom answered, she said. "She's doing okay, but something major has come up." she took a deep breath. "Mom, I can fly."

There was a long pause and I could only imagine the reaction from Lilith's mother. Finally, she responded but I could not hear the other side of the conversation. "Yes, I can. And there's a whole lot more." Lilith said. "Could you come down here? And bring my Tarot?" she gave her the address.

As she hung up, I asked, "What's the Tarot for?"

"It'll give us a hint about what the future holds." patiently, Lilith replied. "The key is understanding what the cards really mean. I use the Legacy deck, since I feel the pictures help me interpret the messages."

"You really believe that stuff?" surprised, I asked.

"It works, Garth. Trust me on that." serious, Lilith said.

Beth asked, "You're not going to start telling us about long sea voyages and meeting tall, dark strangers, are you?"

"You've been seeing too many movies, Beth." with an amused grin, Lilith said. "You'll do as much work interpreting the messages as I will."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Lilith calls her mom.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Minutes later, a soft but firm knock was heard at the door and Sarah answered. As the door opened, I got a strong scent of an expensive perfume. We all turned to see a tall, slender young woman with long, raven black hair and green eyes; she was wearing a flattering black dress that complimented her figure well. She smiled at Sarah and knelled down to hug her as if she were an old friend. "They must know each other." watching, I thought. "I wonder from where."

"It's been too long, Madam Vague." releasing the woman, Sarah said. "I'm honored that you bring light to my home."

"The honor is mine, dear child." rising to her feet, Madame Vague said. "When Lilith told me the address, I knew it was your family and the family of your friends she was concerned for." she then teared up slightly. "I am truly sorry I was too late to save you from the wrath of Clarence Mayweather..."

"You saved me from bleeding to death on the side of the road, Madam Vague." tearing up with her, Sarah said. "I owe you my life, still today."

"Mom?" her voice shaking, Lilith asked. "You know Mrs Vance?"

"Why yes; I do." turning to her Madame Vague said. "She had called herself Heather 'Hawkeye' as a member of the Problem Child Gang, twenty years ago."

"But... you- you were just a- a kid then too." stammering, Lilith said. "Please mom, what is going on?"

Madame Vague smiled and casually walked over to her daughter. "The cards will explain everything, Lilith." showing her a Tarot card deck, she said. "Place your trust in the wisdom of the Mystics."

"Mom, those aren't my cards." confused and frightened, Lilith said.

"No, my dear." still smiling, she replied. "Your cards are in your hands." shocked, Lilith looked and saw that she was holding her Legacy deck then turned back to her mom as she said, "These are mine."

With that, she threw the cards into the air and they flew about with a fluttering sound as they shuffled themselves before lining up in the air as if they were being stacked onto a table. Once done, they were all shown face down, no matter which side you looked at, ready to be read and shown to all. Everyone's jaws dropped in shock as the Tarot cards fell from Lilith's hands. Sarah alone was smiling as Lilith's Tarot cards, like her mother's shuffled themselves in the air then lined themselves up before her. "Not the most graceful cast, my dear." amused, Madame Vague said. "Still, you are just beginning to learn."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Enter Madame Vague.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"Draw a card, Lilith Nightshade," Madame Vague said.

Lilith drew the topmost card on her deck, which proved to be the Tower. "A major event," she explained to the others. "It will shatter what has come before, to make room for something new."

Madame Vague nodded. "You are wondering about your new powers, and how I shuffled my deck in the air." softly, she said. "You have known for some time that you are not like the others. It is time that you learned your destiny." leaning in closer, she said, "Lilith Nightshade, you are a witch, like your mother before you."

Lilith looked as stunned as I felt. "A witch?" startled, I thought. "We're from all walks of life here!"

"A-A witch?" stammering, Lilith asked.

Madame Vague nodded again. "Our powers are not quite so grand as popular fiction would suggest." firmly but kindly, she said. "However, if enough of us were to gather, we could accomplish great things."

She turned her attention to Lyssa. "For instance, twelve witches once encountered a young man who, more than anything, wanted to be female. Can you guess what happened?"

Lyssa swallowed hard. "Th-they turned Iolaus into Iole?"

"Precisely." Madame Vague turned back to Lilith. "This morning, after you left for school, I dug out my Tarot, and drew the Judgement card. Do you know what that signifies?"

Lilith nodded. "There was a call that you should heed."

"Yes. Always trust in the cards, daughter. I disregarded their warnings once, when I was attracted to my first husband. As a penalty, I was denied my powers, until today. That is why I could not protect us from his wrath."

I asked, "Why does Mrs. Vance keep calling you Madame Vague?"

Madame Vague smiled. "Her expectations were formed by old movies, where the fortune teller could lay out exactly what was to come. When I could only say things like 'There is conflict coming,' or 'The current situation will change,' she started calling me Madame Vague, much as you would call someone who told you what you already knew Captain Obvious."

"About the cards," Lilith said. "Dad's always so secretive about his job, so I tried asking the cards what he does. Whenever I do, though, I keep drawing the Death card. What does it mean?"

As Lilith spoke, I saw her draw another card. It was the Moon card. I did not know what that specified but, from the look on Lilith's face, something was about to change. Being the son of a police officer has its advantages, I had learned to read people's faces, knowing what they were feeling, I could tell... Lilith was scared.

Madame Vague sighed. "If he ever learned about this, it would mean the death of us both." pausing, she said. taking a breath, she said, "Lilith, you drew the Death card because your father is dead. My first husband is not your father."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: she had Lilith read hers.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"Who- Who was my father?" almost afraid to know, Lilith asked.

"Your father was Dr Thomas Vague." gently, Madame Vague replied. "I found it fitting that Sarah called me 'Madam Vague' as, in a way, it honored his memory."

"Why don't you ever talk about him?" curious, Lilith asked. "I have a right to know..."

"It is a long story but I will try to explain." sadly, Madam Vague replied. she took a breath and turned a card, revealing the High Priestess. "Twenty years ago, I was an ordinary sixteen year old girl. I was looking forward to graduating high school and moving on to college. Only, two men stormed my house and tried to take me by force. I ran out of the house, not daring to look back but I knew they were on my tail."

"Who were they?" concerned, I asked.

"I don't know." shaking her head, Madame Vague said. "I managed to lose them just outside of Fallen Heroes Cemetery on the edge of town where I found a number of people in dark robes gathered around a fire among the tombstones."

"Creepy." shivering, Lyssa muttered.

"It turned out to be a coven of witches." said Madame Vague, softly. "A young woman among them approached me and smiled...."

"Welcome, Madeline Wallace." the woman said. "I have been expecting you."

Madeline, terrified and out of breath, took a step back. "Yo- You know who I am?"
