The woman smiled then threw a number of cards into the air. They shuffled on their own then lined themselves in the air. "The cards never lie." serious, she said. "My time in this world is coming to a close but your time is just beginning."

Madeline took another step back. "What do you want from me?" almost crying, she asked. "Has everyone gone crazy!?"

"You are in no danger, Madeline Wallace." said the other cloaked people. "Come...."

Madeline found herself slowly walking forward, though her mind screamed to run away. Once she was before them, staring into the camp fire, the young woman walked up and placed her hands onto Madeline's shoulders, staring into her eyes as the others formed a circle around them. They all began to chant with Madeline reciting it with them, though she had never heard it before. As they did, a light, glowing mist bellowed from the woman's mouth and entered Madeline's mouth, causing them both to glow with an eerie light. Madeline stared in horror as the woman became older and older before her eyes. Finally, the chanting stopped and the once young woman was not nothing more than dust, blowing in the light wind.

"What... happened?" trembling with terror, Madeline asked.

"Our sister has passed to the next realm." solemnly, one of the cloaked figures replied. "She had no children to pass her power onto so she has chosen and entrusted you to to be that daughter she never had."

"Her knowledge, her wisdom, and her power is now your own." added a second hooded figure. "Use your gifts wisely." she then smiled. "Welcome to the coven sisterhood."

Madame Vague wiped the tears from her eye. "I had lost my mother when I was young and watched a woman who had chosen me as a daughter she never had die before my eyes." emotionally, she said. "I had vowed make her proud."

"Woah..." awestruck, Lyssa whispered.

"Epic." impressed, I thought.

*There is much tragedy in her past* sadly, Amara said in my thoughts. *That makes her strong in character.*

Madame Vague nodded. "My first husband, Darren, and I fell in love quickly and did not consult the cards before marrying him." looking slightly ashamed, she said. "That brings us to Dr Thomas Vague." she paused to force a smile. "He was our family doctor and always defended me when he could."

"What happened, mom." taking in every word, Lilith asked.

"One night, Darren had beat me senseless and left to get even more drunk. I called Dr Vague and he came over to tend to my wounds." her smile vanishing, Madame Vague replied. "As he was treating me, Darren returned, found the two of us together, and went into a rage. He mortally wounded Dr Vague with his hunting knife." she cried freely. "That was when I had enough and used my magick on him. One punch sent him through the closed door, across the hall, and through the wall into the room beyond."

"That had to be some punch!" surprised, I thought.

"Mom... one punch!?" her eyes widening to saucers, Lilith asked. "That could have killed him..."

"I learned that magick can not kill." almost regretful, Madame Vague said. "Still, to this day, he fears me when I become angry." she sighed. "I then turned my attention onto Dr Vague and consulted the cards to find a way to save him."

"You didn't find a way, though." sadly, Lilith said.

"No, I didn't." shaking her head, Madam Vague replied. "But I did find a way to help him carry on."

"You made love to him as he died?" stunned, Lyssa asked.

"That's creepy..." shuddering, I thought.

"I honored his last request as a debt of honor, Lilith." sternly, Madame Vague replied. "He wanted... a family. I had intended to 'introduce' you to him once Darren's visitation rights were officially revoked next week, Lilith."

For a moment, Lilith did not respond as she, we all were still soaking everything in. Finally, a small smile slowly formed onto her face. "My dad sounds like an incredible man." dreamily, she whispered.

Madam Vague smiled. "He was." she then turned to Sarah. "The Agency may be after my daughter and I for my involvement with the Problem Child Gang twenty years ago."

"It's possible." admitted Sarah. "You did help us in your own mysterious ways."

"Want to join the new gang?" offering her hand to me, Lyssa asked.

Lilith turned to the cards, causing her to frown slightly, before she turned back to her. "Sure."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: continue.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
The following day, Grace and I were getting ready for school when I heard the phone ring. It really did not concern me until dad called us by our first, middle, and last names. "What did we do!?" stepping out of my room, I asked. "What's wrong!?"

"You and Grace have ten minutes to pack two bags, just what is necessary!" sternly, dad replied. "The Agency made the first move, we need to get everyone to a safe location!"

"Who was hit?" fearing Alyssa, I asked.

"MOVE!!" screaming, dad ordered.

Grace and I ran back into our rooms. I grabbed two over night suitcases and started to pack what I felt was necessary for a long stay away from home. Five minutes later, I had both suitcases filled with the very bare essentials and was walking out of my room with them. Grace met me in the hall with two suitcases of her own, looking worried. "What about Natalie?" whispering, she asked. "If the Agency knows that we're..."

"Call her when you get a private moment." whispering back, I said. "Tell her to go visit her uncle."

Grace looked at me confused. "She hates her uncle, you know that." softly, she said.

"Because her uncle is an overly protective survivalist fanatic." with a grin, I replied. "Who better to keep her safe until this all clears out?"

Grace sighed. "I guess you're right."

"Ah, you two are done early." appearing at the bottom of the stairs, dad said. "Your mother is finished packing as well, she is waiting for you in the spare car, it's fixed. She will drive you to the SUB station."

"What about you?" worried, I asked.

"I have to pick up Lilith and her mother.": serious, dad replied. "They were the target."

"Are they okay?" coming down the stairs, Grace asked.

"They handled the situation but this is only the beginning." quickly, dad said. "We'll talk more later, please just do as I say and go with your mother."

Although we were both worried, Grace and I walked to the garage where mom helped us load the suitcases into the car before we piled in and mom drove away from the house. "Don't worry, kids." sighing, she said. "It's just a house, home is where your head rests."

"You talk as if we may not be coming back here." worried, Grace said.

"Not for a while, at least." frowning, mom replied. "The Agency is as evil as they come, I'd rather be homeless than see them take either of you away as their prisoner."

We all fell silent after that as mom quickly drove out of town, towards the SUB station's secret entrance....
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: continue.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Mom took us to the SUB station through the secret entrance and parked the car before having us pile out with our suitcases. "The bedrooms are in the back, down the center hall, to the right." leading us, she said. The boys are on the right side of the hall, the girls are to the left."

I walked into an empty room near the middle of the hall and found a small bed, a dresser with a mirror, and a washroom on the other side. It was not much. "Home sweet home." sighing, I muttered. "I guess it could be worse, I mean this can be worked on."

"It's just temporary, Garth." standing behind me, mom said.

"Why can't we stay at the mansion headquarters?" curious, I asked.

Mom sighed. "It's not there anymore." sadly, she said.

Grace and I turned to her, startled. "What!?!" stunned, I asked.

"The mansion and its general location were mentioned several times in the graphic novels." tearing up, mom explained. "It was heavily fortified but not from a Napalm bomb." she held back a sob. "The mansion was engulfed in flames within seconds, just like the mansion in Europe. Had we been there...."

"Grace and I stared at mom, our jaws dropped then pulled her into a warm hug. "It's going to be okay." tearing up myself, I said. "It's just a building, they can rebuilt."

"Your father managed to salvage the mission log book and the 'Beast' van." composing herself, mom said. "The rest is just a memory." she sighed. "Why don't you go meet the others and, please, not a word of this until we can determine who was responsible."

Grace and I nodded then walked out of the hall to a spacious room, dominated by a large table surrounded by chairs. There we met up with Lilith, Alyssa, and Beth. "Are you alright?" Grace asked.

"Just surprised," Lilith replied, as Beth and Lyssa joined us. "Being jumped by Agency goons is no way to start the day."

"What happened?" came Cait's voice. When I turned to see her, I noticed that she was now wearing a light brown hair wig, it really showed the family resemblance.

"Lilith's place was attacked by the Agency," I explained.

"My house was attacked just a few days ago," Cait said. "I think the two might be connected."

"Everybody, keep your eyes open," Grace said. "If the two home invasions are part of a pattern, any of us could be next."

The following day, I went to school on edge. My friends had been attacked, the mansion headquarters had been burned to the ground with a Napalm bomb, and Travis and Megan have vanished without a trace without a word after school yesterday. I was not so certain it was a good idea to be at school.

The first few classes moved smoothly, though the teachers noticed I seemed rattled In geometry class, my teacher, Mrs. Dawkins walked up to my desk. "You seem unnerved, Mr Jones." concerned, she said. "Would you care to talk about it after class?"

My uncle's summer mansion burned to the ground yesterday." softly, I replied. "It was arson."

Mrs Dawkins eyes grew wide for a moment. "I see..." softly, she said. "I'm sure your father will find those responsible for the crime."

I nodded but did not respond as the bell had rung for lunch...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: At the SUB station

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
I was still shaken during lunch, not sure how to take in everything that had happened in the passed few weeks to myself as well as my family and friends. "If Sykes is responsible for destroying the mansion, it means that he's more powerful than ever but how?" frustrated, I thought. "If the Agency is responsible, it means they are close to making their big move on the rest of the team but when, where?"

Feeling helpless, a wave of blind rage overcame me and I threw my fist onto the lunch table. Upon doing it, I winced, feeling a throbbing pain in my hand. "What..." confused, I whispered.

*I can not allow you to use your powers out of blind rage.* whispering in my head, Amara reminded me. *You need to focus your anger so the innocent do not get hurt...*

"What's your problem?" looking at me, Morgan asked. "Something bugging you?"

"My- My family just adopted a little boy." thinking quickly, you said. "I learned this morning that he was abused before his parents... abandoned him."

"That's horrible!" moving closer to you Morgan said. "I can see why you're so worked up."

"Don't sweat it, man." smiling, Jim said. "If anyone can keep that kid safe, its you and your family."

I smiled at that. "Thanks guys." calming down, I said. "I just hope I can be a good brother to him."

"You're a good brother to a lot of kids in this school." proudly, Morgan said. "A lot of the underclassmen look up to you, see you as a hero as you stand up for them."

"I was seen as a hero before all this started." a certain calm falling over me, I thought. "I just never thought of it that way." I turned to another table and saw Alyssa talking to Lilith and her goth friends. "They see me as their leader, its time I started acting like one."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: At lunch.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Grace and I were met by mom immediately after school but instead of leading us outside, she led us to a door near the janitor's closet on the first floor. "What are we doing here?" curious, I asked.

Mom did not answer but pointed to a door that was marked, 'No Admittance'. To my surprise, she pulled out a key and unlocked the door before quickly ushering us though with her following, closing and locking the door behind her. "When the substation was built, we made this shortcut to the school to avoid being tardy after fighting crime." smiling, mom whispered. "Follow me."

With that, mom moved down the stairs to the basement boiler room where she pushed hard against one wall, revealing a secret door to yet another set of stairs. Upon moving through, mom pushed the secret door back into place and led us down the stairs to an underground road where a small car was waiting. "Incredible." whispering, Grace said. "Are there any other surprises you wish to share?"

Mom sighed. "There have been plenty of surprises all around." serious, she said. "When we were the Problem Child Gang, most of us had no one who would really miss us but now... we have everything to lose."

We traveled in silence until we reached the substation where Grace and I, to break the ice, brought Tim up to date on everything that had been happening. "So you guys are going to become the new Problem Child Gang?" after hearing us out, Tim asked. "That's so cool!"

"You can join us, Tim," serious, Grace said. "I can certainly see the advantages of having your power around, I'm not even sure of the true extent of your powers."

"So would I though he may take a personal stand in all of this." worried, I thought. "It might be wise to keep him 'backstage' for a while."

"To be honest, Grace," wincing, Tim said. "Neither am I, I know I can draw really fast, I know I can make drawings come to life, even things I haven't drawn, and if the pictures are based on real people, they mimic what those people are saying."

"What do you suspect you can do?" curious, Grace asked "If you don't believe that is the full extent of your powers, you must have an idea of what else you can do."

"He's scared and uncertain." wincing, I thought. "He'll freeze when things get hot without training."

Tim nodded "I've never tried drawing real people with powers and becoming them," he said "I'd like to experiment now that I know other people who have powers to test it on."

"Anything else you'd like to test?" asked Grace, interested now.

"I don't know how long I can maintain another form, if it takes any energy from me or anything, to be honest, I don't know that much about my powers at all," uncertain, Tim said "That's why I'm asking if I can become one of you, then perhaps I can see how long I can maintain it."

"Sure," said Grace "Who do you want to become?"
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: After school.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Tim drew an image of Grace with impressive speed. It was nothing I would have called 'super speed' but it was impressive none the less. Once done, he showed it to Grace for inspection. I guessed he wanted her approval before bringing what he drew 'came to life'.

"Looks good," nodding her approval, Grace said. "Go ahead."

Tim dragged Grace's picture off the paper and dropped it onto himself.

Immediately, he started to reform. He grew slightly, his hair falling passed his shoulders, which rounded slightly as his body took on the shape of my older sister. We did not have to wait long for the transformation to finish before we saw our 'new sister' a copy of Grace Jones.

"Great." grinning slightly, I said. "I'm the youngest again."

Grace rolled her eyes and Tim imitated her, earning a laugh from everyone, including me.

"We don't know yet if you have my powers," said Grace "We'll have to try a test to find that out."

What sort of test?" Tim asked, suspiciously.

Grace took on an offensive pose. "I've always wondered what it would be like to fight myself," smiling, she said. "I guess now I'm going to find out."

"This should be interesting." smiling, I thought.

The moment Tim faced the real Grace, I guessed that he knew it was not going to be an easy match. Even if he had her exact powers, which I doubted, she had more experience than him.

"Tim must know at least that much." whispering to myself, I said. "He'll likely fall onto his own fighting style to throw her off."

"You may make the first move." as they circled each other, Grace said. "Let's see what you can do."

Tim made the first move by throwing a high kick but Grace avoided it all too easily. I shook my head, knowing he was at a disadvantage from the start, not used to fighting as a girl. Grace took a swing at Tim, which he too dodged easily and swung back. "You're pretty good, sis." struggling to make a hit, he said.

"Back at you... sis." as if toying with 'her', Grace replied. "Only, I think we should raise the bar a little."

"With that said, she went at Tim with a barrage of kicks and swings, hitting 'her' with most of them. I shook my head, knowing that Tim was not going to last much longer. "Grace already has all of his moves down and knows how to get around them." ruefully, I thought. "Tim may look like her but 'she' can't fight like her."

Suddenly, as if in a desperation move, Tim went for 'her' notebook. Only Grace seemed to be onto him as she charged 'her'. "You won't get the chance to draw anything else." almost teasing, she said. "I'm too fast."

"Then heads up!" throwing the paper at her, Tim yelled.

The paper flew from Tim's notebook and, as if following her thoughts, wrapped themselves tightly around Grace until she looked like a paper wrapped mummy!

"That was unexpected." stunned, I whispered. "It looks as if Tim has a few aces up his sleeve after all."

Dad called the sparing match over, seeing Grace was unable to move and hurried to her only to see her tear herself free. "It seems as if Tim has a telekinetic power over paper, dad." blushing, she said. "We should look deeper into this."

"I agree." eying Tim, dad said.

"Am- Am I in trouble?" worried, Tim asked.

Dad smiled. "No but we should work on that new part of your power."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Grace.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"What were you thinking at the time you threw that paper at Grace?" as Tim returned to normal, dad asked.

"I just wanted to distract her so I could end the fight quickly." wincing, Tim replied.

"Well, it was certainly a distraction." ruefully, Grace said. "Suddenly finding myself mummified by paper scared the crap out of me!"

"Sorry." blushing, Tim said.

"No, No, it didn't hurt me." reassuring him, Grace said. "It just scared me and I was able to get out quickly once dad called the match over." she paused. "You're back to normal, did that take a lot out of you?"

"Not really." confused by the question, I said. "Why?"

Dad grunted. "Let's look at the tapes."

Curious, Tim followed dad as he led us all into a room further into the makeshift base. It had a lot of old electronic equipment but they all still worked. "Let's take a look at the sparring match a little more closely." queuing up a recording of the fight on a screen, dad said. "There seems to be more to your power than meets the eye, Tim."

With that, he played the video of Tim's transformation into Grace at a much slower pace. What we saw was a surprise to us all. As Tim dragged the image off the paper, the paper quickly followed, attaching itself to his very body! It surrounded and encased his body in an instant, forming a paper body over his own! Then, in a flash, various colors of ink colored everything in, creating a perfect likeness of Grace!

"Incredible!" whispering, dad said. "Here I thought it was some type of magical ability but it seems to be more of a psychic ability."

"Epic..." stunned, I thought. "My new brother has the coolest power."

"How does it explain the drawings I make being able to talk?" stunned, Tim asked.

Grace thought for a moment then asked Tim, "Have you ever worked on a character for so long, that it seemed to have a life of its own?"

"What do you mean?" confused, I asked.

"I think I get it." guessing, I thought. "Tim's powers give the characters he draws a life of their own, meaning they can almost think for themselves."

"You made those characters so you know how they would react to certain situations." jumping in, dad said. "When you are not certain of what to do, you ask yourself, what would this character or that character do?"

"And the character answers..." astounded, Tim said.

"You have a truly unique ability, Tim." smiling, I said. "Only becoming someone else only seems to work when it is a character you know well."

"I agree." nodding, dad said. "I would focus on summoning only what you know you can control."

After a thought, Tim asked, "Do you think I can control this without drawing?"

"So you can react more quickly?" asked Grace. Tim nodded. "Maybe, give it a try."

Tim turned to my large notebook, about the size of a small satchel, concentrating. Seconds later, paper flew from the notebook and quickly wrapped itself around Tim in a frenzy. It was a mere blur to me but, in a flash, Tim was wearing an impressive looking suit of armor, like in the medieval times.

"I did it!" looking him myself, Tim declared.

"This is only the tip of the iceberg, son." serious, dad said. "Its time for some serious training."

Without another word, dad led him out of the room, back to the main track and motioned him to stay as he continued on for a few steps. Suddenly, his muscles grew in size and he charged him. I was tempted to run out to his defense but Grace held me firm, shaking her head. Reluctantly, I turned back to the window where we watched Tim yell as dad let his fist fly. Tim rose rose his arms as if to shield himself but, in an instant, papers flew from a nearby table and a shield was formed in the blink of an eye, meeting dad's fist.

"He was holding way back on that swing." relieved, I said.

"Well, duh." giggling, Grace said. "You should know dad better than that. Come on."

"It's just as I thought, the paper reacts to your mind's need to defend yourself and others." smiling dad said.

Tim was surprised to find myself now holding the shield but even more surprised to find that a sword had been added, resting in a sheath at his side. "Did I do that?" almost whispering, he asked.

"You did." smiling, dad replied. "Though most of it was through reflex, you made that happen."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Learning to control paper.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
I had left the room, not wanting to crowd Tim as he trained with dad. Also, I felt bad, thinking dad would use full strength. I found myself pacing my bedroom, kicking myself. *Its a natural fear when someone suddenly charges a loved one.* assuring me, Amara said. *You have nothing to feel ashamed of.*

"Maybe you're right." feeling bad, I whispered. "Still, if I am going to be any kind of a good leader, I have to know not to judge so quickly."

Before any response could come from Amara, Grace came running in, calling my name. "Tim is asking for one of the graphic novels." quickly, she said. "Can you bring yours to the training area?"

I grabbed the graphic novel I had brought down with me and followed Grace back to Tim where I handed him the book. Immediately, he started flicking through the pages. I saw his eyes glaze over and shared a concerned look with Grace and dad. He stopped on a page with Sykes pictured on it. Sykes was young, fair skinned, with short brown hair and what looked like cat's eyes. He wore what looked like antique leather armor from the middle ages. It was a strange look but that did not make him any less dangerous. Tim looked at the picture for a moment then turned to us, his face becoming pale.

"Sykes has found you," his lips trembling, he said. "At least, he has a rough idea where you are, he's flying to Waterfront City at first light to attack the city."

"How much time do we have?" looking at him, dad asked.

Tim teared up as the picture had stopped moving. "I- I don't know." crying, he said. "I'm sorry."

"I'll call Alyssa," grabbing my cellphone, I said. "Grace, you call Cait, see if she has sensed this. Maybe she can give us more details as what Sykes has planned."

"Right." grabbing her own cellphone, Grace replied. "We'll have to coordinate this, Cait's communication with all of us by telepathy and Alyssa's speed will save us a lot of time." she turned to dad. "You might want to..."

"I'm already on it, sweetie." dialing a number on his cellphone, dad said. "We need to get the civilians off the streets for when this dirt bag makes his move." he paused. "This is the real deal, kids. Sykes is as dangerous as they come, pray what little training you got was enough."

"We will need disguises." suddenly, Grace said. "We already decided that, but we never got around to it."

"Don't worry about that." serious, dad said. "All of us had made costumes for you, similar to what we wore when we fought crime. It may not be your style but there are lives on the line, there is no time to pick and choose."

Just then, the pages in the graphic novel turned on their own until they reached the back of the book, showing a picture of the author, Aaron Flynn.

"Hello, lad." in a heavy Irish accent, the man said. "You look like you could use some help and a bit of luck."

Tim's eyes went wide. "How are you able to talk to me?" stunned, Tim asked.

I did not hear Tim talking to the book but I did see him staring into it. "What now?" worried, I thought. Curious, I placed my hand onto Tim's shoulder as I looked over his shoulder. You can imagine my surprise when I saw an image of Detective Flynn moving... and talking.

"There will be plenty of time to answer that later, lad." firmly but kindly, Flynn replied. "For now, tell your new pop to answer his phone."

The picture stopped moving and Tim turned to dad as he ended his call with the police station. "You might want to answer that." his voice quivering, he said.

Dad gave Tim a questionable look but jumped as his cellphone rang...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Something interrupts.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
I called Lyssa's cellphone but I could not get through. It worried me greatly and I was tempted to grab a car and go looking for her. I turned to Grace who sighed. "I can't get through, the line is busy." worried, she said.

Suddenly, dad's cellphone went off and we turned to him to listen. "Hello," answering the phone, dad said. he paused, listening. "Detective Flynn, I'm surprised to hear from you again, you'll excuse me for hurrying you, but Sykes is back, he's about to attack the city."

I did not hear the reply, but saw a shocked expression on Dad's face."What do you mean you already know?" annoyed, he asked "How could you know?"

Dad turned to Tim, his eyes widening as a muffled response came over the phone. but then he spoke again. "Get yourself and your family down to the SUB station," serious, he said. "We're getting everyone who needs to be protected down here, and if Sykes knows about you, your family might be a target."

Dad hung up the phone then turned to Tim. "How did you know my phone was about to ring?" curious, he asked him.

Tim held up the picture of Detective Flynn. "Apparently, your old police contact has similar powers to me, he contacted me through the graphic novel picture." softly, he replied.

"It's more than that, Tim," sighing, dad said. "Detective Flynn is your grandfather."

Grace and I turned to each other, stunned. "What!?!" we whispered.

Before anything further could be said, the pages of the graphic novel flipped around as if in a wind as Tim then looked into another picture. I do not know what he saw or heard but his face had turned another shade of pale, making me worry more. "I think Madam Vague is in trouble," I said "I just got a message from the graphic novels saying she was about to be attacked by the Agency."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Dad answers.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Dad jumped a second time as the telephone rang but he was quick to answer it. "Alyssa, we've been trying to get a hold of you." scolding, he said. "Are you alright?" a muffled response caused dad's face to turn red, I knew it was not good. "Is anyone injured?" another response and he sighed, looking relieved. "Stay where you are, I am on my way!"

"What happened!?" after dad ended the call, I asked.

"The Agency has struck again." running to the parking area, dad replied. "Don't worry, I'll bring them all here!"

Before I could say another word, dad was in his squad car, speeding down underground road towards town while all I could do was helplessly wait. "Lyssa..."

Twenty minutes later, Ted returned in the squad car with another car following. I was surprised to see Amber, looking shaken, stepping out of the car with Lilith. Deciding to find out, I walked towards them with Grace at my side and out new little brother, Tim between us. Mom came out from a hall and took the lead. I guessed that Lilith had used the moon card to get everyone underground in a hurry, which was why Amber seemed so shaken.

"It took me by surprise as well." urging Amber out of her mother's car, Lilith said. "Welcome to the Subterranean Urban Base station."

"It really existed!?" startled, Amber asked. "Does that mean..."

"Chief Jones was Tex the mighty." serious, Lilith replied. "All of it was real, including the Agency, who attacked you today."

"How did your mom know my mother?" still rattled, Amber asked. "Is there anything else I should know about?"

"Actually, there is." walking into their view, mom said.

Everyone turned to find her walking towards them with Grace and I following, leading our little brother, shyly staying between us.

"Blessed be, Mrs Jones and family." kindly, Lilith said. "Who is your new friend?"

Mom smiled. "Everyone, I'd like you to meet the newest member of our family." motioning to the small boy, she said. "This is Tim Jones, he was an orphan from Europe."

"I sense you were in the hands of the Agency." serious, Lilith said.

"He was but he was not brainwashed." cutting in, Cait said. "His mind is free."

"That and I have already met him." smiling, Vague said. "He has the strange power to make anything he draws come to life."

"Why didn't we meet him earlier?" confused, Lilith asked.

Tim gave a sheepish smile. I knew he was too shy to come out so I did not push him.

"Because, child," patiently, Vague replied, "he was too scared to come out."

"We convinced him you were all cool." placing a firm hand onto his shoulder, I chimed in. "These are my friends, little bro, you couldn't be in safer hands."

"Welcome to the S.U.B. Station, Tim," Lilith said, holding out a hand. "My name's Lilith."

"Hi," shaking her hand, Tim said. "If dad had said there were pretty girls like you here, I might have made my presence known sooner."

"Cool your jets, bro," Grace told him. "Lilith isn't into guys."

I stifled a chuckle as Tim blushed slightly but it fortunately went unheard.

"So, you can bring your drawings to life?" Lilith asked, brushing off the attempted flirting. "I can call up the figures from my Tarot cards. That sounds similar."

"Not exactly," smiling, Tim replied. "My drawings actually move on the page. And I can actually become them. Want a demonstration?"

We all nodded eagerly.

He opened his sketchbook and stopped on one page. "Say hello to... "

Having a good idea of how Tim's power worked better, I watched as dozens of pieces of paper surrounded and reformed Tim's body into a different form. In the blink of an eye, a tall woman appeared where Tim once stood. "... Amazona, Princess of Power!" finishing his line, the woman said."

I shook my head, remembering Tim's first character example. "Not much of an improvement." sighing, I thought. "Oh well..."

The Amazon Tim created was six feet tall, with breasts that looked like she was smuggling basketballs under her skin tight costume. Lilith snorted. "Yeah, you came up with that one."

"What do you mean?" confused, the 'woman' asked.

"If you try moving around off the printed page," Lilith explained, "those bazongas are going to be more of a hindrance than a help. They block your field of vision, they'll restrict your arm movement, and they'll make you fall over the second your back isn't straight."

"Told ya, Tim," Grace added.

I did well to hide my smile as I heard Madame Vague stifle a giggle. "Tim is a good kid." bemused, I thought. "But he needs serious help understanding girls."

The woman, Amazona, tried moving around, and quickly saw that we weren't joking. "I see your point, younglings," she said. "I am sure the artist sees it, too."

"Huh?"

"Tim doesn't just change physically," calmly, I explained. "The characters he creates come alive as he envisions them. So you're really talking to a character in a comic book."

Amazona touched the paper again, and a sheepish Tim stood before us. "Thanks for the advice," he said. "I'll definitely redesign her before I call on her again."

"You do that," Grace said. "And, please, stop making her costume rip in strategic places in battle."

I chuckled, again glad that no one heard it.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Dad's phone rings again.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Tim's lips trembled slightly, tears forming. I feared he was about to completely burst into tears but Lyssa was quick to respond. "There, there, Tim." cooing him, she said. "No one is mad at you."

"Not at all." roughing Tim's hair, Grace said. "Just give the female characters you make some dignity, okay?"

Tim sniffed at little but managed a smile. "O- Okay." he said.

"Good boy." smiling, Vague said. she turned to the others. "Lilith and I need to have a word with Amber before her mother arrives with her husband."

As Lilith and Madame Vague walked off to another room with Amber, Cait rose a hand to her head as if she suddenly got hit with a headache. "What's wrong?" concerned, Lyssa asked.

"I just got a vision." worried, Cait said. "It's my uncle Crecatous, dad's bother."

I did not know Cait's uncle, in fact, I knew very little about her and made it a note to have us all get to know each other better. I saw that Cait was very shaken as Lyssa asked, "What about him? Is he okay?"

Cait began to cry, something I don't think anyone has seen her do before. "They attacked his house...." tearfully, she said. "The Agency... they invaded his home, his kids are on the run." after a moment of looking into the distance, she suddenly announced, "I have to go."

With that, she vanished from sight. There was no way of knowing where she went and Lilith and Vague were busy talking with Amber. I turned to Beth to see if she could sense anything when Lyssa suddenly ran off as if the devil himself were chasing her. "Where is she going!?" worried, I asked.

I sighed, feeling helpless. "Some leader I am." pouting, I muttered. "I can't even keep my team together."

"Don't be so hard on yourself." said a voice with a heavy Irish accent.

I stumbled forward as a firm hand swatted me on the back. I turned to see an elderly but tall, muscular man in a twenties style gangster suit with a bollman hat and a long black jacket. Next to him was an elderly but tall and physically fit woman in similar attire. I recognized them immediately from the graphic novels.

"Detectives Aaron and Zena Flynn." almost in a whisper, I said. "The A-Z Detectives."

"Retired." kindly, Zena said. she turned to Tim. "We thought you were lost..."

Tim's lips trembled before he jumped into Zena's arms. "Grandma..." crying, he whimpered.

"I hear your father adopted Tim." taking my hand, Aaron said. "I'm glad to see he is in good hands."

"Forgive me but... how did you get here so fast?" confused, I asked.

"Let's just say I've had a bit more experience than Tim." smiling, Aaron replied. he paused, seeing dad rushing out of a room. "You better go see what's going on, lad. Take Tim with you."

I nodded and ran over to the others with Tim following. "We've got big trouble," dad said, as everyone quickly gathered around. he pointed to a flashing light. "We're getting a distress call from the Vance residence."

Amber groaned, and became a boy again. "Just what I didn't need."

"On the contrary," Vague said. "The strength of a Guardian will be needed."

"We'll probably need this, too," Tim added, bringing out a male character this time. "The name's Nightside."

"Alright, everyone," Vague said, as she took out her Tarot deck. "Focus on the Vance household."

We were surrounded by a bright light. A blink of an eye later, we were standing in the Vance living room, as a horde of Agents ran roughshod over the place. "Everyone, pick an opponent!" dad commanded.

As everyone scattered to take on one of the invading agents, dad and I tag teamed against two muscular men who each took a swing at us with a stun wand. Dad grew in physique while I did the same as well as in height before the now startled men. "This is not a game." firmly reminding myself, I thought. "This is real, no turning back.."

The two men attacked, one going after me and the other taking on dad. I dodged a swing from the stun wand then knocked it out of the man's hand before 'tapping' him in the stomach, causing the man to keel over, coughing. I grabbed the man by the belt then turned to dad, who had also had his opponent. We both exchanged a nod before I gave the man a heave, throwing him towards dad while he swung the man around, sending him flying towards me. The two men collided then fell into a heap onto the floor.

I turned to see two women, who I assumed were from Lilith's Tarot deck, slice two men's guns in half with their swords before a lion, a tiger, and a leopard appeared before them.

"Lyssa! Machine gun kick!" I heard Mr Vance yell.

I turned to see Mr Vance take Lyssa into his arms and swing her around while she kicked at high speed, knocking out a number of men who had surrounded them. "Nice." impressed, I thought.

I heard Tim yell and turned to see him, as 'Nightside' and the former Amber back to back fighting street style and winning. "Heads up, bro!" yelled Grace.

I ducked as Grace threw a punch into a man I did not see coming. "Thanks, sis." relieved, I said.

"Both eyes open, bro." firmly, Grace said. "Stay focused."

"Pick up brass!" called one of the Agents. They all activated devices on their wrists and disappeared, leaving only the ruined weapons.

"Everybody okay?" Lilith called.

"Looks that way," dad said. "Hey, we scored a bonus. When these guns were chopped, it must have damaged whatever lets them teleport. We can finally get a look at their tech."

"They sent someone disguised as me," Lyssa said, rubbing her hand. "Her problem was, she moved too slowly. A few dozen punches per second, and she didn't see them coming." Her attention turned to the former Amber. "Thanks for the help, Amber. Though it sounds funny calling you that at the moment."

"I suppose I'll think of something," he said. "I guess I'm finding out what life was like for you, huh? Sorry I was such a pain."

"Like they say, what doesn't kill me makes me stronger," Lyssa replied, as she gave Amber a hug. "Thanks again."

I stopped listening and turned to Tim as he returned to his normal form. "Nice work, Tim." smiling, I said. "You did great."

Tim blushed slightly. "Thanks."

"Attention, everyone," Ted called. "Given the current situation, we think it's best that we all relocate to the S.U.B. Station until things blow over."

"We've got the phone tree started," Mrs. Vance added. "So, for those of you already at the station, you're all going to have company."

Amber's cell phone rang, and he checked it. "Cassie," she said. "We usually get together about this time, but I'm not at my house. And if she went there, she's probably seen what a wreck it is."

"Let me talk to her," dad said. "Hello? Hello, Cassie, this is Chief Jones. Yes, we're aware of what happened at Amber's house. She and her family are safe, and they've been relocated. I'll see that she gets your call, and I'm sure that she'll return it as soon as possible. Just remember that she's going through a lot right now. More than you know. Alright. Goodbye." He returned Amber's phone to him.

"Thanks," Amber said. "Now I just have to figure out how to explain all this to her. When I change back, it won't be all the way. Who knows what I'll look or sound like?"

"Maybe start with texting," Lillith suggested. "Let her know as much as you're comfortable with. She will need to know what's happening to you, though. If you were to keep it secret from her, she'd want to know where her friend went, and where this guy came from."

I sighed. "I'm not sure if I'm cut out to be a leader." uncertain, I said.

"No leader is when they first start out." serious, Grace said. "Don't second guess yourself."

"Thanks, sis." managing a weak smile, I said. "I'd just be more comfortable if I had a second in command."

"None of you are in command right now." whispering to me, dad said. "The others turn to you because you are a strong leader. They turn to Grace for her wisdom, Beth for her insight, Cait for her view into the future and Lilith for her clairvoyance."

"We all rely on each other." catching on, Grace said.

"That is the strength of a team." serious, dad said. "When the time comes for one of you to take the lead, you will know what to do."

With that said, Vague gathered everyone around and drew the moon card....
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: continue.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Vague's Moon card brought us all back to the S.U.B. Station. "Where day go?" Sam asked.

"We're underground, sweetie," Mrs Vance replied. "We'll be here until things are brought somewhat back to normal."

"As normal as they get for us, anyway," Lilith added.

"No wike," Sam said.

"We're not here because we want to be, Sam," Lyssa told him. "We're here because being up there isn't very safe right now."

"Let's pick out where we'll be living until things die down," Mr. Vance said.

I wanted to go with Lyssa but I saw that Tim was looking a little pale so I went to him. "Everything okay?" softly, I asked him. "Did you get hurt?"

"I'm just tired." sighing, Tim said. "Changing forms with different abilities is hard to keep up."

"Then I suggest you stick with only one character." seriously, I said. "Pick the one you know the best so you can work with it easily."

Tim smiled. "That's good advice, thanks." he said.

I smiled as Grace touched my shoulder. "You are a good leader because you care." smiling, she said.

Moments later, I found that Lyssa and her family has chosen was at the opposite end of the station and guessed they did that so no one would have to be too near the smell of diapers.

The next group to arrive was Susan and her family. "Everybody OK?" uncle Geo asked.

"A few of us are shaken up," Lilith replied, taking the opportunity to hug Susan, "but nobody's hurt. From what I've seen, we've got plenty of space."

"We'll need it," Susan said. "You know that Asian girl who just started at our school?"

"Narrow face, close-set eyes, high cheekbones, doesn't talk to anybody?"

Susan nodded. "Her name's Mindy Saotome. Dad's done some checking, and he thinks she and I might be related. Apparently, her maternal grandmother and my paternal grandfather were brother and sister."

"Not the best circumstances for a family reunion," uncle Geo said, "but they'll have to do."

"I'll need to think of some way to explain this to Mel and Julie," Lilith said.

"Whatever brings them down here," Ted said. "It's a cinch the Agency will come after them, too."

Looking beyond us, Lilith asked, "Who's that?"

Dad looked. "Looks like the Rodgers family, and they've got somebody with them. Not to worry; we figured we'd need to accommodate a lot of people, and we've got the space."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: exudus to the substation.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"Long time no see, David." shaking Mr Rogers' hand, dad said. "I just wish it was under better times." he then motioned to the boy. "I see you have added a new member to your family."

"This is Alex, our second born." surprising everyone, Mr Rogers said. "He has the same ability to change reality as Christina and I only he had no power over it."

"What do you mean?" concerned, I asked. "Was his power out of control?"

"He has the power to literally become an added member to any family with that family never aware he was an intruder as, to them, he was always one of them." serious, Mr Rogers said. "My wife and I have the same power, we used it to infiltrate the criminal element when we helped the Problem Child Gang back in the day."

"Poor Alex was literally jumping from family to family, blacking out each time before entering and leaving." with a sad look, Mrs Rogers said. "He never had any memory of being a part of those families he visited but he remembered everything about them, now knowing why."

"That had to be maddening." wincing, I said.

"We managed to stabilize his power and changed reality so he was always and will always be our son." touching Alex's shoulder, Mr Rogers said. he then sighed. "The reality holding him to his family had corrupted after years of constantly jumping around, they no longer know who he is."

"That's terrible!" stunned, Lilith said. she then paused. "Wait, why don't any of us know him as always being your son, Mr Rogers?"

"Because, with your powers, you or Beth, or Caitlin would have seen through the reality change and suspected Alex as an intruder." serious, Mr Rogers said. "We exempted you and the others from the reality change so there will be no doubts that Alex is our son."

"Well, in that case, welcome to the substation, Alex." extending my hand, I said.

Alex smiled. "Thanks."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: continue.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"We should get everyone together." serious, I said. "We need to put everything we know on the table and try to get a better picture of what we are dealing with."

"Not now, tonight." firmly, dad said. "When we are able to gather freely."

"Why?" curious, I asked. "Where is everyone?"

"Susan Tanner is in another part of the station, finishing her training with her parents." serious, dad said. "They tell me they will be finished by tonight."

"Marisol is almost done unpacking." chiming in, Caitlin said. "Trish and Brad are helping her." she smiled, adding, "I have a feeling they are going to get back together."

Mom sighed. "Alyssa is watching over her brother, Sam while her parents consult Beth." softly, she said. "Her ability to communicate with spirits had increased in power, it has her a bit shaken."

"My mom and I might be able to help her with that." serious, Lilith said. "We'll talk to her later."

Dad nodded then turned to Alex. "Mr Rodgers needs to be brought up to speed so he understands what he may be facing in the near future." calmly, he said. "Sarah Barns will arrive after sunset, Madam Vague has agreed to escort her here."

"Don't forget about me." piping in, Tim said.

"Relax, lad." roughing up his hair, Flynn said. "No one is forgetting about you."

"We'll discuss what you saw in your sketch book with Madam Vague when she returns with Mrs Barns and her husband." firmly but kindly, dad said. he then turned to the others. "Damien, Anette, and Amadeus Johnson are getting themselves settled. We will be talking to them later."

"What of Travis and Megan?" worried, I asked.

"Travis Greenway and Megan Connors have gone missing." to everyone's concern, dad replied. "I have my best men looking into it but, from what we have so far, it looks like some government agency got wind of their abilities."

Hearing this, Lilith drew a card from her deck. Only, upon seeing what she had drawn, she turned pale before turning to her mother who sighed. "Heaven help them." she whispered.

"What is it?" turning to Lilith, I asked. "What card did you draw?"

"It's the Devil card." softly, Lilith said. "Travis and Megan are with some bad company."

"Caitlin, can you find them?" turning to her, I asked.

Caitlin placed a light hand onto her head while Madam Vague drew a card of her own. "They are safe, for the moment." after a pause, Caitlin replied. "Though I sense they feel threatened."

"They are with a new player." not revealing her drawn card, Madam Vague said. "Someone who follows a different set of rules."

We all turned to each other, concerned before dad sighed and said...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: News of the others.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"You do?" hopeful, I asked. "Where?"

"CHILD has them." ice in his voice, dad said.

"Who?" curious, Lilith asked.

"Central Headquarters of Intelligence, Logistics, and Defense." darkly, Flynn said. "They were originally founded to thwart a terrorist group known as the Hard Line who was hell bent upon stopping the United Europe movement before it gained real momentum."

"They approached us shortly after returning from Europe, still recovering from Sykes' trap and our battle with the Agency." serious, dad explained. "They wanted to recruit us and offered us a level of training we would never be able to achieve on our own."

"They gave me the same offer but I refused." sighing, Flynn added. "They kidnapped my grandson to try to persuade me but I fought back and he ended up in an orphanage."

"Until fate brought him back to you." sighing herself, Grace said. "What of his parents?"

Madam Vague drew a card and sadly shook her head. "Sorry, I do not know."

Lilith turned to her mother curious but Vague slowly shook her head, a tear forming, and Lilith sadly nodded before turning back to my father. "Do you think this CHILD is after to recruit them?"

"It's very possible." shaking his head, dad replied. "Unfortunately, this is a group who does not like to be turned down when they make an offer."

"What did they do when you refused them?" curious, I asked.

Dad drew a breath then slowly released it. "They let us go." simply, he said. "Only they vowed to be in touch with us and they have, for twenty years."

"What!?" alarmed, I asked.

"The van outside of the Rodgers' residence, the van Travis and Megan reported seeing outside of the hospital, the car following us on the freeway... all of them were from CHILD." annoyance in his voice, dad said. "They have been watching us for a very long time."

"Are they on our side or another villain we have to worry about?" concerned, Cait asked.

"They consider themselves the good guys but they will do whatever it takes to get the job done." serious, Flynn said. "They are dangerous but they are the enemy of our enemy."

"The enemy of my enemy is my friend." softly, Grace said. "Only with friends like that..."

"So far, they have only approached Travis and Megan." thoughtful, I said. "However, that does not mean they will stop there. If they are after the Agency, they will need someone who had experience dealing with them."

"Our parents..." turning pale, Grace said.

"Yeah, but they will also need able bodied people to do their fighting for them." serious, I said. "That's why they need us."

"What's your plan, Gar?" turning to me, dad asked.

I sighed then replied, "We will need to have a talk with these people..."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: I know where they are.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"It'll need to be a trade," I continued "They have something we want, we have something they want, although I'm afraid to say, it won't be easy to get Travis and Megan back, CHILD will want to keep them as leverage in case they ever need us again."

"So what do you suggest?" asked Tim "We don't even know how to find these people."

I thought for a moment. How could we get into contact with CHILD on our terms? "We let them find us." finally, I replied. "We will go out, just a small team in an 'ordinary' car."

"You are hoping, with this CHILD watching, they will go to you?" curious, dad asked.

"That's right only we will be waiting for them." firmly, I replied. I turned to Flynn. "Detective Flynn, you said that you had dealings with them before, so I'll need you to stay here on the camera feed and guide the away team as needed."

Flynn nodded. "I'll do my best." he said.

"What about me?" curious, Tim asked.

"Tim, you said you'd met their leader before and claimed you had nearly defeated him in combat." turning to him, I said. "If it comes to it, do you think you can do it again?"

"Maybe." wincing, Tim replied. "The character I used then was sort of out of control."

"A last resort then." sighing, I said. "We may need to count on you."

"I- I'll try." uncertain, Tim said.

I nodded at him then turned to Cait. "Cait, we'll need you on the away team; if we end up walking into a trap, you should be able to sense it in time for us to avoid any serious trouble."

"And you'll lead the away team?" raising an eyebrow, Grace asked. "Is that a good idea, if you think the Beast is too important to risk, why should you think that you would be any different?"

"If I am to be the leader of this team, I must be a part of any risky plan I put on the table." serious, I said. "From what dad and Detective Flynn are telling us, this CHILD is as dangerous as the Agency." I shook my head, "I will not ask anyone to go on a mission I am not willing to take on myself."

"You're becoming a better leader everyday, lad," said Flynn "Yer dad made a wise choice making you team leader and I will follow you."

"This plan is only a suggestion." firmly, I said "I'm pitching what I think the best course if action is, if anyone has an issue with any of this plan, or has a better way to approach this, I want you to speak up now and be heard. There are a lot of places this plan could go wrong, I'm covering them as best I can, but I would welcome any advice about how I could cover it better."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: on our terms.

choices: I obay dad and stay put.
I disobay and lead the team out.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
As if on cue, Mrs Vance rolled into the room with her husband pushing her along. "Delay whatever you are planning, all of you!" sharply, Sarah said. "My daughter, Beth has discovered new evidence that changes the game!"

"What did Beth find?" curious, I asked.

"An alien ship." panting, Beth replied. "It must have crashed here centuries ago."

"I always found it strange that, when we recovered something Sykes had stolen, he never went after it again, he targeted something else." serious, Sarah said. "What was also strange was that he repeatedly said he was after something out of this world."

"He's after the technology the ship offers." turning pale, I said. then I thought, "That's how he blew up the mansion headquarters; with alien weapons."

Lilith threw her cards into the air, waited for them to shuffle, then drew a card. "The tower." muttering, she said. she drew a second card. "The Earth." she drew a third and gulped. "Death..."

"Every decision we make from here on in will be critical." serious, Madam Vague said. "From what my daughter has read in the cards, this will change the world but not all will see its conclusion."

"I do not believe in fate." appearing in the room with his daughter, Susan, Geo said. "We forge our own destiny through the choices we make." he sighed. "However, yes, I agree every move will be critical and thus must be carefully planned."

"Where is Steve?" worried, Sarah asked. "He needs to know this too."

"He's with our daughter at CHILD headquarters." stepping up, Mrs Connors said. "He called me a few hours ago, tell me they had an interest in our daughter."

"Have you heard from him since then?" serious, I asked.

Mrs Connors teared up, shaking her head. "No and I'm worried." softly, she said.

I bit down onto my lip, thinking. "We'll have to change our strategy." finally, I said. "Beth, can you take us back to the spaceship you found?"

"I fell through the floor in the unfinished tunnel." shaken, Beth replied. "I was teleported back by Zen."

"Zen? Who is Zen?" curious, Geo asked.

"The ship's artificial intelligent computer." serious, Beth replied. "It led me to a teleportation unit that brought me back to the tunnel with mom and dad."

"A teleporter that could take us straight to CHILD." serious, I said.

"That might be like placing your hand into a hornets nest, Gar." warning me, dad said. "Those people do not like uninvited guests and they do not play games."

"One of us has to make the first move." serious, I countered. "I suggest a small away team go to CHILD and see what they want with us."

"How much information would you share with them?" raising an eyebrow, Geo asked. "Would you or those you select for this away team be able to hold their own under an interrogation?"

"I trust this CHILD about as far as I can kick them." ice in his tone, dad said. "They will use any means necessary to obtain their goals and, so long as the greater good is done, they do not care who gets hurt or killed in the process."

"I will go alone." darkly, I said. "Those who wish to join me may but understand the dangers involved." I turned to dad and frowned. "Its not my first choice to deal with them either but if Sykes has alien tech at his disposal, we are going to need some outside help to deal with him."

"Its happening all over again." sighing, dad said. he turned to Geo. "We may have to come out of retirement, old friend."

Geo nodded. "Indeed." serious, he said.

I heard voices and turned to find two boys and a girl entering the room. "They must be Cait's cousins, she mentioned." nodding at them, I thought. I then returned my focus to the conversation as detective Flynn spoke. "I will go with you, Gar." calmly, he said. "I cleaned Blitzkrieg's clock before, I can certainly do it again."

"I will go as well." firmly but kindly, Madam Vague said. "I have a lot of clout in many places, not to mention a few tricks up my sleeve, they will listen to me."

"I'll go with you." offering, Tim said. "They kidnapped me..."

"We are not going to them to start a pissing match." firmly but kindly, I said. "You stay here."

Then, Annette politely cleared her throat and we all turned to them. "Ah, Annette, Damien." motioning us closer, Cait said. "Meet the rest of the gang."

"These are two of the three you told us about?" calmly, I asked.

"Garth, these are my cousins, Annette, Damien, and Amadeus." introducing them, Cait said. "Annette and Damien both have the ability to grow and shrink but the trigger is a bit unusual." she then turned to Amadeus. "Their bother, Amadeus has the power to do anything as if he were trained to do so all his life, though he's a bit reckless."

"So I heard." nodding at them, I said. "I have super strength and endurance." I motioned to the others... "My sister, Grace, total recall; my brother, Tim, paper manipulation; Alyssa Vance, super speed; Bethany Vance, psychic spiritual guide... "

"I can sort of talk to ghosts." shrugging, Beth said. "Its complicated." she then giggled seeing a toddler boy walking passed above them. "Come down, you rascal!" the boy giggled as Beth pulled him down by his arms. "This is my brother, Sam. He has the power to fly but being only two..."

"I can imagine." giggling, Annette said.

I nodded then continued. "Clem Rodgers, shape shifting; Susan Tanner, ghost powers and ninja training; Lilith Nightshade, magical powers and mystic wisdom." motioning to the others, he said. "We have two other members but they are in the hands of CHILD.

"Travis Greenway, who is an Animancer and Megan Connors who is a Technomancer." turning to Annette, Cait said. "We suspect CHILD took them after the first day of school."

"Animancer... Technomancer?" confused, Damien asked.

"Who is this CHILD?" serious, Amadeus asked.

"An Animancer is a person who can shift shape into any form of animal, including Anthros like Minotaurs or Centaurs." serious, Cait replied. "A Technomancer has the psychic power over machines, making them work on their own within the limits of their design."

"Can she change into machines?" curious, Damien asked.

"Not without seriously injuring herself." wincing, Beth replied. "Even without that, her power is impressive, hence why we think CHILD wants them."

"I don't doubt it." stunned, Annette said. "We have quite an arsenal of power here." she winced, asking, "Are you planning a rescue mission?"

"Well, new evidence has us thinking that even our power may not be enough." softly, Ted Jones said. "The Agency has people under their control who have powers like our own, they are a greater threat now than when we faced then twenty years ago."

"What of Sykes?" curious, Amadeus asked. "Was he not the greatest adversary of the Problem Child Gang when they were active?"

Before anyone could answer, a number of alarms sounded, startling everyone in the room. "What was that?" startled, Beth asked.

Dad turned to a table and hit a button, causing a large screen television to rise from the floor. It came on, showing camera images all over the city. One showed a number of strange hovering platforms, moving into the center of the city. He hit another button, filling the screen with that image. What they saw was Sykes and a number of his followers on five strange floating platforms, firing what looked like sci-fi laser rifles at random buildings. Dad focused the camera image on a man on the lead platform before a low growl echoed from his throat. The man was tall with longish brown hair and piercing green eyes. He was wearing oddly ancient leather armor as he held a laser rifle of his own while holding the hilt of a sword at his side.

"Sykes!" anger in his voice, he said. "He's returned and he is attacking the city!"

"But why!?" angry as well, I asked. "What could he possibly gain by..."

"Bait." flatly, Geo said. "He's trying to draw us into the open."

"What- What are we going to do?" worried, Lyssa asked.

"We'll handle this." serious, dad said. "Its us he wants."

"Not alone, you're not!" firmly, I said. "We are the new Problem Child Gang."

"You are a bunch of kids with no real experience in taking down criminals!" snapping, dad countered. "All of you will stay here!" he then turned to Tim. "I need you, however, to come with me."

Tim gulped. "Me?" surprised, he asked.

Dad nodded. "I'll explain on the way to the surface." serious, he said. he then turned to the other parents and nodded before leaving the room with them following.

As I watched them leave, I realized I was facing my first real command decision....
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Sykes returns!

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
I was about to tell the team that we were going to stay put as dad ordered but an alarm went off and I ran out of the room to the security station down the hall. There was a small number of floating platforms landing near the road entrance to the SUB station. A small army of Sykes' men stepped off and began searching the area with strange devices. I knew that it would only be a matter of time before they discovered the entrance and invaded our new headquarters.

"Sykes destroyed the old headquarters." fuming, I muttered. "I'm not letting them destroy this one!"

I ran back into the meeting room and alerted the others of what was happening. "We need to get to the surface and stop them before they discover the entrance!" firmly, I ordered. "If they get in we will have no place to call headquarters, no place will be safe for us!"

"I agree." standing up, Amadeus said. "What do you have in mind?"

I turned to Lilith. "Can you teleport us all to the surface with your cards?" hopeful, I asked.

"I believe so." wincing, Lilith answered. "I really never tried."

"I can give your powers a boost." standing up, Caitlin offered.

Lilith smiled then turned back to me. "Yes, we can arrange that." she said. "What's the plan?"

"We need to take them by surprise." serious, I said. "Dad is right, we have no real experience; but there is no other choice, we have to fight them."

The others nodded and we all gathered around Lilith and Catlin before calling out, "Problem Child!"

With that, Lilith produced the sun card. There was a flash and we were on the surface, surrounding the small army of men...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: I disobay and lead the team out.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
The men jumped at our sudden arrival. This was the moment I needed to say something dramatic to set the scene but nothing came to mind. Fortunately, Lyssa chimed in. "You boys must be new in town."

The men produced automatic weapons in response to which Amadeus laughed. "What do you intend to do with those?"

That was when inspiration hit me and I turned to Amadeus. "Let's show these guys some friendly Waterfront City hospitality!"

As if on cue, Damien and Annette grew to the size of ten foot giants while Lyssa and Susan vanished; one in speed the other in ghost powers. Lilith drew a card while Caitlin lightly touched her left temple. Clem and Alex approached the men while undergoing a startling transformation. The now startled men raised their weapons to fire in defense.

Before a single shot was fired, the rifles swiftly vanished or were sliced in half by an invisible sword, causing the men to shout in fright. Damien and Annette made short work of the floating platforms, reducing them to smoldering wrecks on the side of the road. One of the men swung what was left of his rifle at Clem only to have it caught by a tentacle! Both Clem and Alex had become something out of a science fiction nightmare as they threw the men into the air left and right. Those they threw were sent flying at least ten feet up to come crashing down hard onto the road.

A knight in shining armor appeared before another group of men before a dozen or so more appeared along side of him. They rendered the startled men unconscious with a single blow of their metal clad fists despite the men having gotten a few shots out at them. I ran through the ranks of the men with Amadeus at my side, knocking them out left and right with a single blow.

Within minutes, the small army of men had been defeated and forced to surrender just as dad and his group returned from the city. Dad looked at our handiwork and sighed. At first, I thought we were in trouble until I saw the high hovering cameras above us. With a wave of her hand, Caitlin destroyed them all only we feared we had just given Sykes what he really wanted, what powers we had and how far along we were in using them.

Dad shook his head. "All of you need to be a lot more alert than this."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: A small victory reveals the war ahead.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Hours later, after the small army of mercenaries were placed into legal custody, we all met in the common room of the SUB Station. There, dad paced in front of us, looking worried. I felt I needed to speak up as I had become something of a leader. "We beat them, dad." Frowning, I said. "That, and we have a better idea what Sykes is after."

"You beat a scouting party." Flatly, dad countered. "Also, we have a better idea what everyone is after."

"You mean the Agency." Sighing, I said.

"Sykes, the Agency, and C.H.I.L.D." Sternly, dad said. "We were a thorn in all of their sides but for different reasons."

"Sykes was searching for alien technology." Thoughtful, Clem said. "Our town proved to be a honey hole for that and he was taking it piece by piece through seemingly unconnected crimes."

"There, he was using us." Angered, Geo stated. "Our interference allowed Sykes to get away with what he was really after without anyone ever realizing it." He shook his head. "All the while, we thought we were stopping him cold at every turn."

"The Agency was after the same technology." Frowning, Madame Vague said. "Only they were more direct in their approach. We saw them as hired mercenaries working for Sykes."

"We locked horns with them when they kidnapped Heather." Darkly, dad added. "It was the mission that nearly killed us all."

"C.H.I.L.D. wanted us." Chiming in, Sarah said. "They offered us jobs as young agents."

"We refused." Evenly, dad said. "They had been a thorn in our sides ever since."

I sighed, taking everything in. "We need a plan. Sykes has obviously returned to finish what he had started twenty years ago. Only he's far more powerful now."

"Nothing is obvious with Sykes." Sternly, dad said. "Normally, I would never agree to splitting up but there is too much ground to cover as a unified group." He looked about the room, gaining nods from all of the parents. "We will split up into family teams. Each team tackling a different mission."

"Once our missions are complete and successful, we will all converge upon the agency." Firmly, Geo added. "We will finish this as we should have all those years ago."

I turned to Lyssa who rewarded me with a weak smile. "You be careful." Eying her, I said.

Lyssa nodded. "You do the same."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Divide and conquer

choices: The streets, question old gang leaders.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Author's note: This is where the threads divide with each character taking on their own mission to finish what their parents had started and start a new era of crime fighting.

I became worried as all of the original members were pulling their children aside or to other rooms to have a private talk. Dad pulled Grace, Tim, and I aside as well. "Kids, everyone is making their big move at once after twenty years." Darkly, he said. "It has to be something huge to wait this long so we must be ready for anything."

"We all need to prepare for whatever they are planning." Thoughtful, Grace said. "Only there is too much ground to cover to deal with it as a group."

Dad nodded. "Exactly." Firmly, he said. "Therefore, we are dividing into groups of families to get more done at once."

"What is our mission, dad?" Curious, Tim asked.

Dad sighed. "Our mission is to shake down all of Sykes' informants, former lackeys, mercenaries still serving time, anyone who might have a clue as to what Sykes, the Agency, and even C.H.I.L.D. might be planning with that alien technology they are after."

"As chief of police, you can interrogate those in custody." Catching on, I said.

"Also, you and Grace can shake down those at large." Nodding, dad said.

"Tim and I can question the reporters who covered the crimes twenty years ago." Chiming in, mom stated. "Perhaps we can do some snooping of our own in their archives."

"Where do we start?" Curious, I asked.

Dad smiled. "We start with..."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Missions are handed out. (locked!)

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Before I could utter a word, I head the screech of breaks followed by dad's voice outside the main entrance! "Garth, Grace! Get in the car; NOW!"

We all rushed out through the front entrance of the mall to find dad outside a strange looking grey four door car. Right behind him, Alyssa's mom stopped with a strange car of her own; calling for her and Beth. "Hurry, kids!" Urgency in her voice, she screamed. "Run!"

We all ran for our parent's cars with Caitlin behind us! She breathed a sigh of relief seeing a black limousine with a tall dark figure holding the back door open. "Please, Miss Spencer!" Firmly, he urged, time is short!"

"Everyone knows where to go!" Firmly, Dad barked. "Move! Move! Move!"

Grace and I jumped into the back of the car as mom was in the front passenger seat. The second the doors slammed shut, dad threw the accelerator to the floor causing the car to scream away from the mall with Mrs Vance and the limo driver each taking a different route.

"What's going on, dad?!" Alarmed, I demanded.

"CHILD has caught up to us, kids!" Looking back at us, mom replied. "Only I fear they are not that interested in us anymore."

I gulped at that. In the graphic comic, CHILD, or Central Headquarters of Intelligence, Logistics, and Defense was a mysterious and powerful underground global organization that worked outside of the world's governments. Their goal was to maintain a 'balance' in the world with or without the world's blessings. They gained their funding through unknown and assumed dark means. Everything I read about them made me believe they were no better than the terrorists they fought.

"You think they are after Grace and I?!" Stunned, I asked.

"They are after all of you!" Angrily, dad said. "We're all meeting at a secure location to discuss our options but first, we need to lose our tail!"

You looked out the back windshield to find an ominous black four door car with tinted windows in hot pursuit of dad's car. I considered jumping out to somehow slow them down but dad had other plans. He pushed a button on the dash board which threw the steering wheel to the passenger side of the car with gas and break pedals emerging from the passenger side floor! " Heather, take the wheel!"

Mom screamed in surprise as she took the wheel and steered the car through the traffic. "Dad, what do you think you are doing?!" Alarmed, I demanded.

"I'm stepping out!" pushing another button, dad said.

The top of the car opened, like that of a convertible. Dad unbuckled his seat belt, throwing on a ski mask, before leaping from the car with surprising strength! It was like a slow motion scene in a movie. Dad's body quickly grew to a near impossible size and slammed his fist into the hood of the pursuing car! The vehicle stopped dead in its tracks with a sizable dent in the hood! The front tires were both blown out from the sheer strength of the single powerful blow! Mom slammed on the brakes, bringing the car to a halt in the break down lane. Dad then leaped away from the pursuing car and landed back in the front seat with his body back to normal size. Removing the ski mask, he winked at at a stunned Grace. "You're old man still has a few surprises up his sleeve."

"You really were Tex the mighty!" Shaken, Grace said.

Dad calmly pressed a button on the dash board, returning the wheel to the driver's side. "Believe me, kids." Frowning, he said. "I'll likely be feeling that in the morning."

"What do we do now, dad?" Worried, I asked. "Everyone on the freeway just saw you hulk out and turn a car into junk with one blow!"

Dad chuckled. "I'm the chief of police." Calmly, he said. "This will be chucked up as another 'strange incident' in the small city of Waterfront, New York."

Without another word, dad pulled away from the curb and sped off down the now clear freeway as he took up his police radio. "There has been an accident on the Forefather's Bridge!" Firmly, he reported. "A pile up has followed with reports of debris falling from a truck causing the accident!"

I turned to see a truck speeding ahead of us with various items falling from it and smiled. "Clever, dad." Impressed, I thought.

"Rodger, Chief Jones!" Came a male voice over the radio. "We have units dispatched and on the way!"

"I will be following a lead on the mall shooting!" Firmly, dad radioed back. "I will be in touch!"

"Rodger, chief!"

Dad then placed the radio back in the nook he took it from and pressed a button, closing the car top. "This is just the beginning, kids." Serious, he said. "Your favorite fantasy is now your new reality."

"Where are we going, mom?" Almost whispering, Grace asked.

Mom sighed. "We are going to all meet up at a place we called..."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Dad arrived in a strange car.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
Mom sighed. "We are going to all meet up at a place we called the clubhouse." Calmly, she said. "You kids, however, are going to be sent to a safe house where you will be staying out of this."

"What?!" Shocked, Grace and I asked in unison.

"This is our fight, kids." Serious, dad said. "We need to finish what we had started."

"We can help, dad!" Protesting, I said. "You saw how strong I can get!"

Dad sighed, shaking his head. "I'm not questioning that, son." Sadly, he said. "Still, you and Grace are everything to us, we can't risk losing you."

"Try to understand, kids." Softly, mom said. "You will get your chance to be heroes... just not in this fight."

"What are you going to do?" Worried, Grace asked. "We don't want to lose you either!"

"We are going to confront The Agency and get them to back off." Serious, mom said. "We managed to get them to leave us in peace once, we can do it again."

Dad and mom did not speak much after that as the car moved steadily out of the city towards the dense forests of New York state. The road was one I remembered from the graphic novels. It lead to Nowhere, a small addition to Waterfront that was abandoned after the builders discovered they were building the city addition on top of an abandoned coalmine. "Welcome to your home away from home, kids." Sporting a sly smile, dad said. "No one comes near this town since it was all falling into the mine."

I caught on to dad emphasizing the word 'was' and raised a single eyebrow. "Don't tell me this small town was your back up headquarters!" Surprised, you demanded.

Dad chuckled. "No, it was our primary headquarters." Smiling, dad said. He then threw mom a smile. "Did you really think everything in the graphic novel was completely accurate?"

"You and the others changed the story around for the graphic novels just in case you went back to fighting crime!" Catching on, Grace said. "You knew this might happen!"

"Yes but we did not count on you kids developing powers of your own." Serious, mom said. "The club house we are going to is a decoy to lure The Agency to us."

"We will have a better chance of controlling the situation that way." Serious, dad explained. "With any luck, you kids will be going back to school from spring break with all of this finally behind us for good."

Dad stopped the car at the entrance to the old coal mine and pressed another button on the dashboard. The boards blocking the entrance moved up like a garage door and dad drove the car in with the door closing behind the car. Beyond was a tunnel that lead downward in an easy slope but had several turns before reaching several floor below the town. There Grace and I looked out in wonder to find...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: Taken out of the line of fire.

1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
We all stepped out of the car to find an empty parking lot. There was not a single visible door. Grace and I followed mom and dad to the north wall where dad reached into a hole. I could hear the beep of buttons as dad hit in an eight digit code. A small section of the wall opened as dad pulled out a set of keys. "You each have your own code, kids." Serious, he said. "It's the month, day, and year you were born. You will also get your own key to get in when needed."

With that, dad shoved the key home and turned it. A soft click was heard before a larger section of the wall opened and we followed him through into the clubhouse.
