It was just as the comic depicted it. They were in a barren room with dozens of doors that lead into all directions. "Welcome to maze hall, kids." Smiling, mom said. "We call it this because..."

"You call it that because the clubhouse is literally a maze." Interrupting, Grace said. "If you don't know which direction to take, you could end up lost of hours." She smiled. "By then, the Problem Child Gang will know you are there and you will be caught."

Mom giggled. "Taken straight out of the graphic comic books." Bemused, she said. "The maze of halls is one of our last lines of defense."

"We will have time to tell you all about it later." Serious, dad said. "Follow us and don't lag behind."

Grace and I followed mom and dad through a small number of dark passageways before entering a well lit chamber Grace and I recognized immediately as we saw it pictured several times in the comic series.

"It's the war room!" In awe, I said.

The war room had flat smooth stone walls with two levels of computer stations against the far wall. There was a door in the middle of each level leading deeper into the lair. The wall to the left was covered with monitors with several doors below them leading further in. The wall to the right was covered by a huge machine I recognized as the team's super computer. In the center was a large round table with two dozen chairs resting around it. On the table was a map of Waterfront and its surrounding communities. As we walked further in, I turned to the wall behind us to find it lined with books and paperwork with staircases and walkways to get to all of the shelves.

"This was where the Problem Child Gang met to discus plans of action during any crisis." Smiling slightly, dad said. "We solved many crimes here."

"Most of our cases were against man who called himself 'The immortal thief'." Frowning, mom added. "We later learned that his real name was John Sykes."

"Here you two will be safe." Serious, dad said. "We will come get you when this is all over."

"Are you sure we can't change your mind?" Wincing, Grace asked.

"Sorry, kids." Sadly, mom replied. "This is our fight."

With that said, dad dropped a small ball onto the ground creating a blinding flash and a thick smoke. Grace and I coughed slightly, breathing it in. When the smoke cleared, mom and dad were gone. I ran to the door we came in from but there was no sight of them.

"We have to go after them!" Worried, Grace exclaimed. "They need us!"

"I agree but do you remember all the turns we made getting here through that maze?" Grimly, I countered.

Grace sighed, shaking her head. "What are we going to do, bro?"

After a moment of thought, I replied, "This was their base of operations. I say we get it running again."

"What will that do?" Curious, Grace asked.

"Recall the comic series, sis." Serious, I said. "Every member of the Problem Child Gang had a marker on them so the other members could find them fast."

Grace smiled. "So, if we can get this old equipment up and running again, we can find where they are!" Excited, she said. "Garth, you're a genius!"

"First, we have to get this equipment running." Looking around, I said. "I just don't know where to start."

Grace looked about then said. "We have power so I think we need to first..."
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: A secret lair.

choices: Forbid us to go into danger.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"I guessing the super computer runs pretty much everything in this place." Mussing, Grace said. "If we can get that up and running again, we may be able to access a map or something to find a means of transport."

"It's a start." Nodding, I said.

We moved to what we guessed were the main controls of the super computer which was really nothing more than several individual computers networked together into one large thinking machine. "This equipment is old but its still high tech." Impressed, Grace said. "Our parents must have had huge connections to piece something like this together."

"I agree." Studying the controls, I said. "Do you think you can get it rebooted?"

Grace cracked her knuckles and began to type on the keyboard. "It's a tricky system." Softly, she said. "Whoever programed it was an absolute genius." She smiled. "Fortunately, my term paper for this semester was on computer hacking so my research should give me an edge."

Within a few minutes, the computer began to hum and the dozens computer stations on the two levels activated in response. "Great work, sis!" Smiling, I said. "Let's see what the computers can tell us."

"I'm right behind you." Following, Grace said.

The two of us hurried over to the computer stations on the first level to find one hooked up to the security monitors throughout the clubhouse. I took the controls and flipped through the most recent scans to find mom and dad running out into the parking lot and quickly driving off. "We missed them!" Frustrated, Grace said. "Only where did they go? They said that not all of the facts in the graphic comic series were accurate so we can't completely rely on it."

I smiled slightly. "Perhaps they were not being accurate."

Grace looked at me, confused. "What do you mean?"

"Think about it, Grace." Turning to her, I said. "We know the graphic comic series from front to back, minus the last issue. The best way to detour us is to say that the info was not accurate."

"That's a stretch, bro." Wincing, Grace said. She then smiled, an impressed look on her face. "The comic series said the clubhouse was in the forests of New York State. It didn't say it was underground."

"I'm thinking the information is accurate, just not complete." Smiling, I said. "Dad told me to look for solutions, not problems."

Grace rubbed one arm as she did when she was nervous. "So what do we do?" Uncertain, she asked.

I hit a few buttons on the security controls and pointed to an image of a black van in a garage. "We won't help them finish what they started." Smiling, I said. "We'll help them pick up where they left off."

Grace's eyes widened slightly, seeing the van then slowly smiled. Only her smile vanished just at quickly. "We can't do this alone."

"You don't have to." Startling us, a familiar voice said.

We turned to find Alyssa and Beth enter with Sam in her arms. Behind them was Cait, Trish and Marisol. Our friends smiled at us but Marisol seemed confused. "What is this place, Caitlin?"

I stood up and approached her. "Welcome, Marisol." I said. "You are in the presence of the new Problem Child Gang."

"Some of the members, anyway." Smiling, Grace said.

Marisol turned from one person to another then...
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.title: reboot the super computer.

choices: Telling Marisol what we knew so far.
1221321111111121222211122112122112111112.content:
"The new Problem Child Gang?" Frowning, Marisol asked. "Do you even know what you are saying?"

"Marisol, my mom hired you to look after me and I am grateful for all of your work." Softly, Caitlin said.

"I am not just a nanny, chica!" Sternly, Marisol said. "I am an agent of the Federal Ministerial Police. It was a secret I buried deep for many years."

Caitlin's jaw dropped in surprise. "What..."

"The original Problem Child Gang got the attention of the entire world, Caitlin; including Mexico." Serious, Marisol explained. "Think about it, a group of children with unique skill sets exposed a powerful global terrorist organization that few really knew existed." She grunted. "On top of that, they crippled their base of operations."

"So you were highly recommended to my parents to keep an eye on them." Hurt, Caitlin said. "I see..."

"It goes much deeper than just that, Caitlin." Gently, Marisol said. "I took my job to look after you very seriously and I am grateful for you pushing to earn me my citizenship." She placed a reassuring hand onto Caitlin's shoulder. "The point is, you and the other kids, despite what skills you may think you have don't hold a candle to your parents."

"I contest that theory." Increasing my size, I said. "We are more skilled than you might realize."

Marisol's jaw dropped as she gazed upon me. "How..."

"It does not matter." Returning to normal size, I said. "We are going to help our parents with or without you... 'agent' Marisol of the Federal Ministerial Police."

Marisol frowned. "Just Marisol will do, thank you." Serious, she said. "My job is to keep Caitlin safe from harm, I have not failed in that task since the day she was born."

Caitlin took Marisol's hand. *Then join us.*

Marisol's eyes widened in shock. I was a bit surprised as well since I heard her voice in my head as well. Her powers were growing just as all of our powers were.

"You have telepathy, Caitlin?" Whispering, Marisol asked.

"We all have our own powers." Speaking up, Alyssa said. "Just like our parents before us."

"Become a part of the new Problem Child Gang." Stepping up, Beth said. "You can be our eyes and ears while we help our parents end this fight once and for all."

"We don't have the experience of our parents but I'm betting they didn't have any experience when they started either." Serious, I said. "However, with a federal agent guiding us from headquarters, we might have a chance."

"Pwease, Marisol." Looking at Marisol, Sam said.

Marisol sighed. "I'm going to get hell for this..." Whispering, she said. "Alright, if we are going to this, we need to first wait for the other members to arrive."

"They're already here." Pointing to the security screen, I said. "Still, we need a plan."

"Tell me what you know and we'll piece something together." Serious, Marisol said. "I have an idea what your parents are planning but there is more than one enemy at play here."

I nodded, knowing full well she was talking about. There was Sykes, the 'immortal thief', the terrorist group known as 'The Agency' and then there was the secret counter terrorist group known as 'CHILD'. All three of them had tangled with the original group so we may have to tangle with them as well.

"I'll lead the others here." Reaching the door in a blur, Lyssa said. "The sooner we get a plan together, the better!"

With that, she was gone. I turned to Grace who rewarded me with a quick smile. "We might get grounded for this." Serious, I said.

Marisol grunted. "If you don't get killed first."

I nodded, knowing that there was now no turning back. We were the new Problem Child Gang and we had our first mission, help our parents any way we could.

122132111111112122221112211212212.content:
It felt just great being in school, knowing that I could make myself bigger and stronger any time I wanted to. Not only that, but it was a great way to fend off any tough guys or thugs. On the other hand, I really didn’t want to draw too much attention to myself and become known as the dude with the growing muscles, either, so I decided to take a middle path and just make my muscles slightly larger than before, but not too large in order to cause any alarm in school. I looked like a guy who had made some trips to the gym, but I wasn’t ridiculously big either. I knew I could make my muscles grow much larger if I wanted to, and I was determined to do this only if it was absolutely necessary.

While walking down the hallway past my locker, I spotted all my friends from the science and computer class. I just wore my polo shirt and jeans, since I wasn’t in the mood to show off any of my muscles. There was no reason for that.

“Hey, Garth!” Jack said to me. He was one of the geeks in the computer lab. “How’s going, dude?”

“Oh, doing alright, man. Yourself?”

“You want to work out in the gym with me during P.E. class this afternoon? I think we’re all just lifting weights today!” he suggested.

“Oh, sure… I had no other plans and I really don’t have a spotter!” I shrugged.

“Well, you look like you’ve put on some muscle!” he said.

I didn’t think I looked that much bigger but obviously I had made my muscles big enough for other guys to notice.

“Sure, Jack. I’ll spot you!” I replied.

A few hours later, I walked into the gym at school and I changed into my shorts and tank top in the locker room. Then, I returned to the small weight room, where Jack was waiting for me. He got on the bench and added about fifty pounds to the bar, while I just stood at the end of the bench and looked down as he grabbed hold of the bar and pressed the bar up and down.

“Good job, mate! Seventy-five pounds is a good start!” I said.

“Yeah but I should go for more!” he said, as I took my turn.

I added another thirty pounds to the bar and I pressed a few reps of a hundred-and-five. Obviously, I wasn’t even straining to lift the bar or the weights.

“Darn, dude! You can lift way more than that!” Jack noted. “You’re not even breaking a sweat!”

Oh, man! Did I look like I was that strong? I didn’t want to make it seem that obvious that I could become stronger all the time. I looked over and realized that whenever I wanted to lift something heavy, my muscles would automatically grow bigger to accommodate the increased weight.

“Oh… Yeah… I guess I can lift more, huh?” I chuckled.

Jack added some plates to my bar, adding the total weight to 200 pounds!

I know I could lift that, and go up to 300, 400, or 500… What to do? What if Jack realizes that I’m a lot stronger that anybody else at school even knows? Do I have to tell him about my muscles?

122132111111112122222.content:
Dad got me in his car and we drove off to a really old part of town. In fact, this was the old, industrial part of town, in the poor neighborhood. This place actually gave me the creeps, on one hand, but on the other, I knew that I had nothing to be afraid of, knowing how strong I was capable of becoming once I allowed my muscles to hulk out.

“Aha! Here it is…” dad said, as he drove the old pickup truck into a dirty, dusty old lot where tons of old cars were parked side-by-side, next to an old abandoned brick building.

“Uhh, dad… What… What are we doing here?” I said nervously, as I got out of the car.

“You’re going to lift and move some old cars around, son!” he replied, as he walked over to the chain-linked fence. He pulled out a key and unlocked the padlock, which held the chain together, which was wrapped around the two metal ends of the steel doors.

“How… How did you find this place?”

“A friend of mine owns it… But he doesn’t do anything with it… So we can make as much noise as we want!” dad grinned.

I walked through the gate and stared at the rows of old, beaten-up cars. Every car had something broken or missing, and was no longer in condition to be driving on the road anymore. These cars were just saved for spare parts.

“Now, I want you to have some fun, Garth!” dad said with a smile on his face. “Remember how you used to love to play with those little toy matchbox cars when you were little?”

“Oh yeah… I had a ton of those!” I laughed. “I lined them up side-by-side and I would push them across the tiled floor in the living room all the time!”

“Well, son… It’s time to be a kid again! This time, you get to play with real cars! I want you to take these cars over here, and stack them up over on the other side of the scrapyard, over there!” dad said, as he pointed to the large empty area near the far corner of the property.

“You want me to carry all these cars?” I asked him.

“You can carry them, push them, or throw them… Whatever you like!” dad replied. “Treat them like toys!”

I rubbed my hands together as walked to the first row of cars. I squatted down besides an old Mustang and grabbed the bottom of the chassis and then the inside door with my other hand, lifting the side of the car easily. Right away, I felt my muscles bulging the moment I lifted the car off the ground. Then, I turned around and carried the car to the other side of the scrapyard, about seventy yards away, before setting the car down in the corner. I could already feel my biceps growing and my thighs and my calves getting bigger and harder.

I turned around and ran back to the row of old cars, using the muscles in my legs. Running made my muscles in my legs grow even more so, and I could feel my muscles burn. I lifted and carried a Thunderbird, then a Camaro, and then an old Dodge Ram truck. My pectorals were pushing even further out of my chest and my biceps were becoming absolutely enormous!

When it was time to get some more cars, I decided to be more efficient. I grabbed the old Pontiac and I stacked it on top of the old Volvo station wagon. Then, I just pushed the Volvo to the other side of the field, with the Pontiac resting on top of it! That made my thighs just burn like crazy, and my calves were screaming with power by the time I made it to the other side. In the meantime, my dad was just looking on as I was pushing cars around the lot like they were nothing more than toys!

I began to get even more adventurous as I started hurling cars through the air. I lifted the other Volkswagen Beetle and I just launched it through the air, watching it crash on the ground next to the other cars. This made my arms, my shoulders, my triceps and my biceps bulge even more, and I could feel the burning sensation in my arms every time I lifted a car and hurled it through the air! It felt wonderful hurling a large piece of metal through the air. What a feeling! I had never felt so strong in my entire life!

I still had a few cars to move and I was quickly becoming impatient. I wanted to get the job done, and I wanted to move as many cars as possible. So, I took a car and I lifted it and smashed it on top of another car, which was of about the same size and shape. Then, I took a third car, also a sedan, and I placed that one on top of the second car on the stack. Then, I crawled under the bottom car, and grabbed hold of the chassis, lifting up all three cars at the same time. I had never lifted so much weight at once in my life! It just felt amazing! I had no idea I could be so strong!

Not only could I feel the muscles in my arms burning like crazy, but I could feel my legs burning too as I walked across the yard carrying three cars over my shoulders. I could tell by the look on my father’s face that is must have been quite a sight!

Once I had finished moving all the old cars to the other side of the lot, I walked over to my dad. I was completely drenched in sweat and my shirt and shorts were soaked. Not only that, but my pectorals and biceps had grown so much, that they had torn my short in the front and at the sleeves. My shorts were also torn by the sides.

My dad just stood there, watching me with his arms folded in front of his chest. I could tell that he was pleased with what he saw.

“Good… Very good…” he said.

“So, what next?” I asked him.

“See that old abandoned brick building over there?” dad said, pointing to an old three-story building that had no windows and no doors. The building was completely empty and there was no paint and no plastering on the outside of the building.

“Yeah!”

“Go ahead and demolish it!”

I stared at dad with a surprised look on my face.

“Are you sure?” I asked him.

“Positive! My friend wants to use the property to store more cars and other things but you can save him the money of hiring a demolition crew!” dad explained.

I looked at the small building and decided that it couldn’t be too hard to demolish it. I figured I could try to lift the building up by the concrete foundation and then hoist it into the air, and I could drop it to the ground and watch it crumble.

I walked over to the building and I stepped over to the edge of the building. Then, I used my hands to dig into the ground, just by the edge of the building. I dug into the ground until I could feel the edge of the foundation. I reached down with my hands and I grabbed hold of the edge of the building’s foundation. Then, using every ounce of strength that I could muster, while standing at the corner of the building, I pulled up on the foundation, causing the corner of the building to come up from the ground!

“UUUUUURRRRRGGGHHHHH” I grunted out loud, as I literally lifted the entire corner of the building off the ground, exposing the underside of the foundation while tilting the building to one side. I then walked closer to the center of the building, lifting the foundation further from the ground, tipping it even further from the ground, until the building tipped over and crashed to the other side of the ground, crumbling to pieces.

“Whoohoo!” I cheered, as I watched the building break apart. I had actually demolished a building with my own, bare hands! What a feeling!

My adrenaline was running sky-high! My blood was pumping! My heart was racing! I was panting! But it was such a rush! My muscles were bigger than ever! I felt so strong, I felt like I could lift anything! At the same time, I felt like my muscles had grown to the maximum they could reach! I had maxed out! I couldn’t become any stronger than this! So what would happen to me now?

Suddenly, I was overcome by an intense tingling sensation all over my body. This was not just in my muscles, but everywhere!

“AAAARGGGHHH!” I moaned out loud.

Suddenly, I felt like I was having a massive growth spurt! My feet were expanding so fast, that I ripped out of my shoes. My legs were growing longer and bigger all at once, expanding in every direction! My torso was growing wider and deeper in proportion, while my hands and my arms were becoming longer and thicker while becoming more muscular at the same time. What was going on?

12213211111111212222211.content:
The next day, I woke up feeling great; the only thing was that I was hungry as a wolf. I ate two omelets and three pancakes along with four slices of toast. Boy that felt great!

I just watched some TV during the day and I worked on my reading list for school. I breezed through a few chapters of one of the books which I needed to read, and I worked on some math problems, before I took an afternoon nap. Needless to say, I was totally recharged by the time evening rolled around, and I had to get out of the house.

I decided to go to the gym that night. Just because there were fewer people in the gym, and nobody would be around to ask questions if they saw me hulking out after a few reps on the bench. I knew chances were I would hulk out quite easily, and I didn’t feel like explaining my condition to anybody in the gym, so I decided to go over there when nobody else would be around to observe my workout routine.

I walked in and dropped off my bag in the locker room. I changed into my shorts and tank top before hitting the weight room. Of course, lifting weights was a piece of cake for me, and I was done in no time at all. The heaviest weights were like plastic to me, and the highest settings on the machines didn’t even faze me one bit. Even when I added the heaviest weights to the bar, I was able to lift them with ease. I didn’t even break out in a sweat. I could feel my body and my muscles just getting stronger with every rep and with every lift. Needless to say, I was feeling totally pumped up by the time I left the gym late that night.

In fact, it was just past midnight by the time I walked out of there. I was wearing my gray sweat pants and my gray sweater with long sleeves and I pulled my hood over my head, covering my face, so that nobody was able to recognize me from a distance. I was just carrying my gym soft bag in my right hand, and I decided to take a different route home.

I wasn’t even feeling tired. In fact, I decided to take the long way home. I noticed that I didn’t need to sleep as much as I used to, and now that I was all pumped up, I figured I could spend a few hours on the street. I had my cell phone with me, just in case my parents needed to get a hold of me.

I decided to walk behind a small strip mall rather than walk along the main road, so that I wouldn’t be seen by any cops who would be funny and pull me over and ask me why I was out so late at night. As I was walking, I spotted one back door to a store, which was open. I thought that was kinda unusual, for a shop that was normally closed, at this weird hour of the night?

I walked up to the opened door and I quietly walked into the back of the store. From the signs posted against the wall, I noticed that this was the shipping store.

“Hello?” I said out loud.

I quietly walked further and saw someone shining a flashlight.

Then, I spotted somebody standing over the cash register, which was wide open as he was trying to crack open the safe, which was on the floor behind him.

“Hey! What’s going on?” I shouted.

Two men turned around, both dressed in black, and carrying flashlights. I noticed right away what the deal was. They were in the process of robbing the store!

The first man then swung his metal flashlight at my head, which I blocked using my arm. Then second guy took a bag with money and ran off, out the door behind me.

I grabbed the man with the flashlight by the arm, and hurled him against the wall of empty boxes behind me, causing all the boxes to fall on top of him. He was out for a moment, giving me time to run after the second robber.

As soon as I got outside, the robber had already reached a white van, which was parked outside the back door. He leaped in the van, closed the door, and started the engine. The engine roared to life, and the van’s lights turned on as the driver was about to run off, when I jumped right in front of him.

“Hold it right there!” I shouted, holding my arms before me.

Unfortunately, I heard the van’s engine go into first gear, as the van started to move forward. The van was heading straight towards me.

I had a few seconds to Hulk out. I concentrated on gaining as much muscle on my body as I could in the few seconds I had. Luckily, I had mastered this skill during the past few days, and I could feel my thighs, my biceps, my calves, and my pectorals fill out as my physical strength increased dramatically while my weight gained at the same time. I continued to gain strength while pushing the growth so fat, that my entire body continued to grow in height as well as in muscle. I quickly shot up, from 6 feet to 10 feet tall, in a few seconds. I was big and strong enough to stop an oncoming van with my bare hands!

“AAAAAAAAHHH!!!” the driver of the van screamed, as he saw me Hulk out and double in size right before his very eyes, at the same time as he tried to run me over with his large, white van. I can just imagine how that must have scared the living daylights out of him!

The front of the van slammed into my giant hands with a large thud, which pushed me back a little bit, but it didn’t faze me. As the rear wheels of van kept on spinning, I was able to lift the entire front side of the van into the air, using my superhuman strength, and I turned the van sideways and set it back on the ground, laying it on the right side, smashing the right mirror as I dropped the van on its side.

The loud sound of the van falling to the ground made enough noise that the police was called, and I heard sirens off in the distance.

As soon as I saw the red and blue lights coming, I leaped into the air, and landed on the rooftop of the building. Police officers, pulled out their guns, and they quickly arrested both men: The one in the van, and the other inside of the packaging store. Another robbery was foiled, thanks to a mysterious man dressed in sweats who possessed superhuman strength!

I just remained on the roof of the building, patiently waiting for the police to take the robbers away, before I leaped down from the building. Then, I grabbed my bag, which was in the store, and I continued walking around the neighborhood.

Nobody saw me and nobody knew who I was. I had already shrunk back to my normal height, but I decided to keep my muscles at an enlarged size, just in case something else came up.

The night was young and I wanted to be ready for anything else that might come my way that night!

12213211111111212222212.content:
The following day, I woke up feeling as if I had been run over by every car and truck in town. Every muscle ached, my head throbbed, and I felt nauseous. "What hit me?" I asked myself, heading to the shower. "I feel like crap!"

I walked into the bathroom and found it difficult to even push the door closed, which scared me. Upon finally closing and locking the door, I began to painfully take off my pajamas and winced as I heard my own bones cracking with nearly every movement and began to sob. "Have I lost this power already?" I thought, alarmed. "I was just starting to like it."

Still sobbing, I slowly took my shower, wincing as every movement seemed to hurt. "I better talk to mom about this." I said to myself. "It could be a sign of something worse."

Immediately after my shower, I stepped out and toweled dry, feeling slightly better then got dressed and walked out of the bathroom to search for mom. She was in the kitchen, washing the morning dishes. "Mom, I have a problem." I said.

Mom turned to me, concerned then gasped seeing how I was limping. "Oh, honey, sit down!" she said, pulling out a chair, which I gratefully accepted. "What did you and dad do yesterday afternoon!?"

I explained where dad took me, what he had me do, and the resulting transformation into a giant. "I felt as if I were literally invincible, mom." I said, finishing my tale. "Only, when I woke up this morning, I could barely lift a finger. Mom, what does it mean?"

Mom sighed. "I'd say you over exerted yourself, Garth." she replied. "Everything has a price. Do you remember how you felt after you 'hulked out' for the first time?"

I nodded, understanding mom's reasoning. "I thought I was over doing it." I said, lamely.

Mom tapped her foot for a moment. "Young man, you were having the time of your life moving those cars around and you know it." she said, lightly scolding. "I suggest you take it easy today, no hulking out, understand?"

"I sighed, giving mom a child like pout, causing her to giggle. "I haven't seen you pout like that since you were five." she said, smiling. "You will survive one day without using that power of yours, go find something relaxing to do."

With that, she returned to washing dishes and I walked out, feeling frustrated...

What am I to do?

122132111111112122222121.content:
“I can’t think of anything relaxing to do!” I said to mom, while she had just started to wash the dishes. Then it just struck me that I shouldn’t have said that. It was like inviting my mother to assign me work.

“Then go and spend the rest of the afternoon cleaning up your room!” she responded.

“Awww mom!” I groaned. “Now you’re making me work!”

“If you’re going to be home all day then you might as well be productive! Start by cleaning up your bedroom! Grab a trash bag out of the pantry and clean up all the junk that’s scattered all over your room!” she ordered.

“Mommmm!!!!”

“Get going! NOW!”

I stammered over to the kitchen pantry and pulled out a trash bag. From there, I marched over to my room, where I closed the bedroom door.

“GREAT! I want to relax and what do I get? More work!” I cried, as I walked over to the desk, where I had papers all over the place. I sat down and read through the loose notebook papers, deciding for each sheet whether or not I needed to keep it or if I could toss it in the trash bag.

Once I was done with all the papers on the desk, I turned towards the stack of papers piled up on the third shelf on the bookcase, next to a stack of comic books. I walked over to the tall bookcase and sat down right in front of it, grabbing the sheets of paper one by one. I would glance at a sheet of paper and I would decide right then and there whether I would ever look at it again or not. If I needed it, I would throw it in another pile, otherwise it would end up in the trash bag.

Once I was done with the papers, I came to the stack of comic books. I had a little bit of everything: Superman, The Flash, Captain America, Batman, Green Lantern, Archie, Justice League, Teen Titans, and then I came across one which really peaked my curiosity: The Hulk. Wow… I could feel so much in common with the big green muscle dude! He was huge and muscular and he had green hair. He would normally be an ordinary guy who grew into this huge, muscular guy when he was angry or provoked in the comic book. On the other hand, once he was back to normal again, he would be extremely exhausted and worn out from spending time as the Hulk. He would be physically drained and he needed a day to recover just from being the Hulk. I thought that was very interesting. Maybe that could explain a little bit why I was feeling so wiped out?

“Hmmm… Maybe I used a little too much muscle yesterday when I went to the scrap yard with dad!” I said out loud. “I should’ve taken it easier. Now I’m completely exhausted! Maybe I should just lie down!”

I took a few other comic books and I crawled in bed. It felt great, just lying in bed with just a dozen or so comic books, just like old times. And, you know what? I was only able to read another three more pages of the comic book before I completely dozed off, lying in my bed.

When I woke up, it was three hours later and I could tell by the look of the sun that was shining through the window that it was much later in the afternoon or early evening. I had slept for more than three hours! But, I felt like new again! I was refreshed and recharged, and I was feeling much, much better than before!
122132111111112122222121.title: Find something to do.

1221321111111121222221211.content:
Feeling better than ever, I changed into some baggy sweats and headed out to take a walk. Knowing that Amara would tell mom that I hulked out, I decided to keep myself 'normal' to humor her. "Maybe I could pay Alyssa Vance a visit." I said to myself. "She seemed down the last time I saw her."

*That sounds like a wonderful idea.* came Amara's voice. *I too sensed that he was saddened about something.*

"That's 'she', actually." I said. "Alyssa is on a mission to become female, I have come to accept her as such." I blushed slightly as a tiny smile touched my lips. "She looks good for a being born a boy."

*Ah, you have feelings for... 'her'?* asked Amara.

I blushed a little more. "Yeah, sort of." I replied. "I mean, I liked him as a guy. Only, now, as she becomes more and more feminine... I like her even more."

Making my decision, I walked four blocks to Alyssa's house and knocked on the door. Mr. Vance (Frank) answered a moment later, smiling as he saw me. "Garth!" he said, surprised. "It's been a while since you visited."

"Yeah, I've had a rough few days." I replied. "I fell through the bathroom floor, ended up in the hospital."

"Are you alright?" asked Frank, concerned.

"I'm better than ever." I replied, honestly with a smile. "I came over to see how Alyssa is doing." I gave Frank a look of genuine concern. "She seemed depressed the last time I saw her, I didn't the chance to talk to her."

Frank smiled. "Allow me to assure you that she's a lot happier now." he said. "Come on in, I'll call her for you."

A few minutes later, Alyssa and her sister, Beth came down the stairs with a look of surprise. Only they were not the only one who was surprised as I immediately noticed that Alyssa looked far more feminine than before. Seeing her, my eyes nearly popped out of my head. "She's... beautiful." I thought.

"Hi, Garth. How are you?" asked Alyssa, smiling.

"I'm, uh, pretty good," I said, my eyes still just about popping out of my head. "You look... different."

"In a good way, I hope." said Alyssa, smiling.

"Definitely." I thought. then replied, "Yeah, what happened?"

Alyssa smiled wider, as if unable to contain herself. "I'm changing." she said.

"Changing?" I asked, though I knew what she meant.

Alyssa nodded. "I'm turning into a real girl." she said, her eyes dancing. "I thought I'd have to wait 'til I was grown to have surgery, but my body's doing it for me."

"How... how did this happen?" I asked, stunned.

"I'm still piecing it all together." replied Alyssa, blushing. "Part of it is because of my ancestry, a boy had changed into a girl under strange circumstances ages ago and, well, I guess it's my turn now."

"That's kind of creepy and mysterious." I said, hiding a grin. "I like that."

Alyssa giggled then leaned her weight onto one foot, imitating my sister when she was annoyed. "A girl can't share all her secrets." she said, with a playful tone.

My smile broadened slightly. "You sound like my sister." I said. "I guess you really are becoming a girl." I chuckled, thinking how Grace would respond to the news. "I came over to see if your were okay but, from what I can see, you're doing just fine."

With that, I walked to the door, hoping to leave before I started to blush again. I then turned around, seeing Alyssa with her hand outstretched as if as if she wanted to stop me but quickly lowered it. That made me smile as I had done the same thing when she walked from me, all depressed, a little over a week ago.

"By the way, you really look cute." I said. "I'll see you at school."

I then saw myself out, closing the door behind me. Only, before I could even take my seventh step, I heard Alyssa and Beth scream then giggle loudly inside the house, causing me to wince. "Girls, tell them their cute and they go ballistic." I muttered. "Go figure..."

*Excuse me?* asked Amara in my ear with a playful tone.

I blushed at that. "Oh, sorry." I whispered.

Amara giggled. *So you really do like her.* she thought to me. *I sense that she is nearly completely female, whatever is driving her change, the final result will be permanent.*

"Just what she always wanted." I whispered, smiling. "I'm happy for her."

I then moved on to...
1221321111111121222221211.title: Garth goes for a walk outside

12213211111111212222212111.content:
I had some free time, so I went to the mall to hang out. As I walked around, I spotted a familiar face. "Hi, Trish," I said. She was walking around, in the company of a Latina lady about her mom's age.

"Hi, Garth," she replied. "Marisol, this is one of my friends from school, Garth Jones. Garth, this is Marisol Reyes."

"Pleased to meet you, Ms. Reyes."

"The same to you, Garth."

"How do you two know each other?"

"Marisol is Cait's housekeeper. Today, she's also acing as chauffeur."

"What's going on," I asked, half-joking, "is Cait buying the mall?"

"Actually," Trish said, "she's applying for a job."

My eyes just about popped out of my head. Caitlin Spencer looking for a job? Next, I'd probably hear that she was being nice to someone.

"I'll be staying with Cait for a while," Trish said. "I kinda got pregnant, and my mom kicked me out. Also, we're getting Marisol some new clothes. We want her to look and feel her best, when she takes her citizenship test."

I couldn't believe it. The Caitlin Spencer I knew had no respect for anyone who wasn't Caitlin Spencer. What brought this on?

Amara communicated with me. *Garth, can we leave?*

"I guess I'll let you get back to what you were doing," I said. "I hope Cait's job application goes well."

As I walked away, I asked Amara, *I guess that stuff about Cait surprised you, too?*

*Partly. More importantly, I sensed two symbionts somewhere nearby.*

*Whoa. Two more, like you?*

*Not exactly. These were not of my race. One was about our age, one was quite young, perhaps just a hatchling. I don't know much about them. I was afraid of what might happen if they found out about us.*

That threw me for a loop. Two different races of symbiotes on Earth? What else was going on?
12213211111111212222212111.title: The mall.

choices: Mom wants to show Grace something.
122132111111112122222121112.content:
I decided to go straight home, to tell the others about what I'd learned. Fortunately, Mom and Grace were both in the living room. "How was your day, Garth?" Mom asked.

"Something came up," I replied. "Amara sensed a couple of symbionts at the mall. Thing is, they weren't of the same race as ours."

"Whoa," Grace said, "there's other symbionts out there?"

"Apparently," Mom said. "Here, Garth, let Amara tell my symbiont what she's learned. Grace has been teaching me how to communicate with mine, so I'll be able to pass on anything we find out."

The three of us sat in silence, as our symbionts discussed what happened at the mall. Finally, Mom smiled. "It's an offshoot of our symbionts," she said. "The two races have been separated for untold millenia."

"How close are they to ours?" Grace asked.

"These other symbionts don't impart super-powers," Mom answered. "Instead, they act to protect their host organisms. You said that one was a hatchling?"

"That's what Amara told me," I said.

"And your friend is pregnant?"

"Yeah. You think there's a connection?"

"It could be a coincidence. But, if the hatchling is connected to your friend's baby, it'll look out for her, as well as her unborn child. What's more, her birth will be largely free of complications."

"Sounds like you had quite a day, Garth. Anything else going on?"

"Yeah," I said, "Alyssa's turning into a real girl."

"She what?"

"She says she's not sure how it's happening. All she knows is, she had an ancestor who went through the same thing."

Mom grinned. "Sounds like high school will be a big change for you and your friends, in more ways than one."

"So," Grace asked, "what's next?"

"Actually, Grace," Mom said, "I'd like your help with something."

"Name it."

"I was thinking that we'd go back to the mall tomorrow. The difference is, Grace, I'd like to borrow some of your clothes."

"My clothes? Why?"

Mom shrugged. "Since I'm still physically a teenage girl, I thought I'd try to pass for one. Just once, to see what happens."
122132111111112122222121112.title: Returning home

1221321111111121222221211121.content:
The next morning, Grace woke up early and met mom in the hall. Mom was wearing a pair of tight blue jeans and a tube top Grace had loaned her. Upon seeing her mom, Grace gave a low wolf whistle. "Wow, mom, you look great." she whispered. "You could easily pass as my younger sister."

"Thank you, dear." said mom, blushing slightly. "I think you had better call me Heather while we are out and introduce me as a visiting relative, if we bump into any of your friends."

Grace smiled then looked into my room, I was still sleeping in bed. "At least he doesn't snore." giggled Grace to mom's silent laughter. "Are we taking him with us?"

Mom shook her head, smiling. "Dad is taking him out training again today at an old rail station." she whispered. "Garth is going to have a blast, playing with real trains."

Grace smiled. "It looks like we're all going to have a lot of fun today." she said. "I have a full teen experience set up for you... Heather. First will be shopping for a small wardrobe for you, in case you want to do this again to hang out or something, then a full makeover, lunch... she paused, giggling "No health food, you'll look weird."

"Woah, settle down, young lady." said mom. "One thing at a time here."

"That's 'mom' talk, Heather." said Grace, shifting her weight onto one leg. "Teenagers multi-task."

"Okay, well, I have a thousand dollars we can spend." said mom. "Is that enough?"

Grace smiled. "How little you really know." she said. "Don't worry, I'll get you caught up. Maybe you can come to school with me for a few days, see what's changed since you graduated."

Mom blushed brightly at that, remembering the short skirts on the uniforms. "I'll think about it." she said.
1221321111111121222221211121.title: The next day (Undercover Mom)

12213211111111212222212111211.content:
Minutes later, Grace led mom into the mall where they walked to the teen girls clothing department and began to sift through the various styles. "Its hard to believe what they allow teenagers to get away with wearing in this day of age." shaking her head, mom said. "I'd be grounded if I bought styles like these."

"Welcome to the new millennium, Heather." giggling, Grace said. "Want some help picking out a few stylish outfits?"

"Not just yet." smiling, mom replied. "I think I can piece together some good fashions."

"We'll see." smiling back, Grace said. "I don't want you to embarrass yourself."

Mom grunted then continued to look through the clothing before picking out a pair of bell bottom jeans and a tie-dye T-shirt. "What do you think of this, Grace?" holding them up, she asked.

Grace looked and sighed. "Maybe twenty years ago, Heather." patiently, she said. "Let me pick something out for you."

She walked over to the rack but stopped as mom touched her hand. "What?" curious, Grace asked.

Gulping, mom pointed to a person walking their way. It was...
12213211111111212222212111211.title: continue Grace's POV.

choices: Mom leads Grace out of the mall.
122132111111112122222121112112.content:
Gulping, mom pointed to a person walking their way. It was a tall man in blue jeans and a black shirt with a brown jacket. The man's face seemed to have been carved from stone with cold calculating green eyes and short black hair. "That is John Stalker." Darkly, mom whispered. "I thought he died twenty years ago."

"Who is this Stalker fellow?" Worried, Grace asked.

Mom hushed her silent. "He's an assassin for hire." Quietly, mom explained. "Your father and I had several run ins with him when we were you age."

Grace's eyes widened in fear. "Why was he after you and dad?" Worried, she whispered. "What did you two do? Witness a mob hit or something?"

"It's complicated, dear." motioning Grace back, mom said. "I'll explain once we are safely away from him."

Grace felt a cold twinge of fear as the man, John Stalker came close to where they had hid themselves. She gulped seeing a gun in a holster under his jacket and prayed he would not see them. Mom gripped her shoulder as he passed them without a single glance. Once she was certain he was far enough away, mom released her grip and let out a sigh. "We need to get out of here."

"Why don't we just call dad?" Worried, Grace asked. "He is the chief of police."

"You don't understand, dear." Tearfully, mom said. "We barely defeated him the last time."

"Defeated him?" Taken back, Grace asked. "What were you and dad involved in?"

Mom sighed. "We were the Problem Child Gang."

Grace's jaw dropped as her eyes widened in total surprise. "What...?"
122132111111112122222121112112.title: A dark past rekindled.

choices: Grace calls you on her cellphone.
1221321111111121222221211121121.content:
"We meet again, Hannah." Starting Grace and mom, Stalker said. "You haven't changed a bit since the last time we met."

Grace gasped. Hannah was the name of the reporter's daughter who was always getting captured while trying to get the scoop on the Problem Child Gang in the graphic novels she loved to read. Only now she was living the story.

Mom urged Grace behind her. "I'm willing to wager you had not either." Ice in her voice, she countered.

"You did a number on the Agency before you went off the grid." Coldly, Stalker said. "However, I'm not here to settle any old scores; I got paid for my part."

"What do you want?" Annoyed, Grace demanded.

"You have a lovely daughter, Hannah." Smiling slightly, Stalker said. "Is she as... skilled as you were?"

Mom frowned. "I may not have been the most skilled back in the day but, as you can see, I literally have not changed in twenty years." Darkly, she countered. "Also, I'm not the push over I was twenty years ago... tell us what you want or get lost."

Both Grace and Stalker looked at mom in surprise only Stalker was quicker to recover. "So, you are immortal, just like Sykes." Bemused, he said. "I wondered how you managed to survive getting shot at so many times when you were snooping around."

"Get to the point, Stalker!" Impatient, mom snapped.

Stalker smiled. "Not in the mood to reminisce?" Calmly, he asked. He shrugged. "The point is simple, my dear. I was paid to find you and ask you to rise up once again."

Mom's eyes widened in surprise. "What?!"

"The Agency has returned, Hannah." Darkly, Stalker said. "Sykes has returned as well which means their rivalry will continue where it left off."

Mom suddenly grabbed Stalker, pulling his gun from its holster and tossing it aside before throwing him to the ground before he or Grace could react. "Who hired you?!" Angry, mom demanded. "What game are you trying to play?!"

Stalker twisted free from Mom's grasp and threw her to the ground with just as much swiftness. "This is not a game, as you thought it was in the past, little girl!" Serious, he replied. "This is as real as it gets! The Agency is out for revenge and they are more dangerous than before!"

Grace gasped seeing genuine fear in mom's eyes and decided she needed to act and fast.
1221321111111121222221211121121.title: A mystery gets deeper.

choices: Dad picks up mom and Grace.
12213211111111212222212111211211.content:
Grace was not about to stand by and watch her mother get attacked. She grabbed Stalker by the wrist and threw him off her with a martial arts move before sending him crashing to the floor. She wanted to say something to scare the man off as she was not entirely certain she could take on a professional assassin. She turned to her knowledge of the graphic novels in Teen Mystery magazine she loved to read.

"Take your little friend and go back to those who hired you." Darkly, Grace said. "Tell them that the Problem Child Gang is not for hire."

Stalker slowly rose to his feet. "So, the gang has new members then?" Eyeing mom, he demanded.

"My children have nothing to do with this." Standing up, mom said. "You stay away from them, from all of us; we gave it up a long time ago."

"It's not that simple, kid." Serious, Stalker replied. "You just can't walk away from something like this." He retrieved his gun and returned it to its holster. "Once you pick sides in a war, you have to see it through to its end."

"We beat them." Her voice quivering, mom argued.

"No, you just slowed them down." Gravely, Stalker countered. He sighed. "Look, I know you have no reason to trust me but you know that if you don't rise to face them, they will find you."

Mom sighed tearfully. "Meet us in Nomad's Park at the gazebo near the pond tomorrow at noon." Softly, she said. "I'll bring Tex."

"What about the others?" Curious, Stalker demanded.

Mom frowned. "You said it yourself, we have no reason to trust you." Darkly, she said. "Be there or we will find you."

Stalker nodded then quietly walked away as two security guards came running up. "What is going on here, ma'am?" Concerned, the first guard demanded. "Was that man attacking you?"

Mom shook her head. "It's nothing serious." Softly, she replied. "Just an old friend..."

After giving the security guards a believable story, mom escorted you out of the mall where she grabbed a cellphone only it was not a phone Grace had seen her use before. She dialed a number and counted the rings. After four rings, dad answered. "Tex, this is Hannah." Evenly, she said. "We have a problem; Johnny is back in town."
12213211111111212222212111211211.title: Meeting arrangement.

choices: You and Grace talk that night.
122132111111112122222121112112111.content:
Dad and I had just returned home from a workout in the old rail yard. I was tired but happy as dad had me pulling train cars, real train cars around to help me tone my newfound strength. What was strange was that I got the feeling dad wanted to join me in the workout. "That built up an appetite." Smiling, I said. "After a snack, I'll hit the shower."

Before I could enter the kitchen, I heard a strange ringtone. I turned to find dad retrieving a cellphone I did not know he had from his jacket pocket. He answered, "Talk to me." I watched as his face turned pale, listening to the one on the other line. I had never seen dad look so worried in my life, it was scary. After a minute, dad ended the call and turned to me, his face twisted with anger. "Your snack is going to have to wait, Garth." Serious, he said. "Get to the squad car, your mom and sister are in trouble."

Hearing that, my mind was immediately on full alert. I ran passed dad to the car with him right on my heels. We got into the car and sped towards the mall with sirens blaring. "What happened to mom and Grace?" Worried, I asked. "They aren't hurt, are they?"

"They better not be!" Anger clear in his voice, dad replied. He then muttered under his breath, "Why now, after all these years?"

Upon hearing that, I became even more worried. "Did something happen to you and her years ago?"

Dad sighed. "How far did you get into the Teen Mystery graphic novels?" Cryptically, he asked.

"Book eight, 'The Road to Rome'." Taken back, I replied. "It's the last book in the series. Why?"

What dad said next sent chills down my spine. "There is another series to that story... you are living it now, Garth, son of Tex."

My eyes bugged out of my head as dad then literally grew in size just as I did that first night that changed my life forever! Dad was now a giant compared to me with his clothing easily stretching to match his new Olympian form. "You were Tex the Mighty?!"

Dad nodded, a stern look on his face. "We thought we had put all of this behind us." Darkly, he said. "However, an old enemy has resurfaced." He forced a small grin. "I need your help, Garth; I'm getting too old for this."

I gulped, now realizing the real dangers mom and dad had and now still face. Only my concern for mom and Grace rose over that fear and I nodded, increasing my own size. "I'll do all I can, dad."

Within moments, we had reached the mall where mom and a shaken Grace were waiting. Grace's mouth dropped upon seeing dad step out of the squad car only he was not giving any one time for reactions. "Get in the car!" Firmly, he ordered. "I want a full report from you both before we get home!"
122132111111112122222121112112111.title: At home Garth's POV

1221321111111121222221211121121111.content:
(Garth's POV)

On the way home, mom and Grace took turns explaining what had happened. Dad listened in silence, only giving an occasional nod or grunt in response. Upon finishing their story, Dad very slowly shook his head. It was something he did when he was very annoyed or angry. "I thought we had taken them down once and for all." Angrily, he muttered. "We should have double backed; made certain they were through."

"We were lucky to get out of that last fight with our lives, Ted." Softly, mom reminded him. "None of us walked away from it unscathed."

"So now what?" Darkly, dad demanded. "Call the rest of the group and tell them that our long thought dead nightmare had returned?"

"I don't know." Forcefully, mom countered. "Still, do you think our children developing powers at the same age we did is just a coincidence?"

Dad sighed, his head slowly shaking back and forth. "I'll call Geo." Quietly, he said. "See if his kids have blossomed as well."

Later, inside my bedroom, I talked with Grace about the strange events of the afternoon. We both agreed that it was all surreal. One day, we discover we have incredible powers, just like in our favorite graphic novels and the next, we discover our parents were part of the teenage superhero group that inspired the stories. What made it all the more frightening was the fact that the stories were coming to life all around us.

"Watch what you wish for, I guess." Ruefully, I muttered.

"Do you think mom and dad will go to this meeting alone?" Worried, Grace asked. "I mean, we are not exactly what you might call 'trained professionals' but still..."

"I doubt they will want us involved." Serious, I said. "Only do you want to just sit back and wait for something to happen?"

Grace shook her head. "Hell no!"

"Then I think we should make a few phone calls of our own." Smiling, I said. "Dad always told us that he had a number of friends we could always turn to if we found serious trouble. Their kids all go to our school and are good friends of ours as well."

"Who should we call first then?": Curious, Grace asked.

I thought for a moment then decided to call...
1221321111111121222221211121121111.title: You and Grace talk that night.

12213211111111212222212111211211111.content:
Alyssa Vance was my girlfriend for the passed few weeks. She was tall and slender with shoulder length blond hair and blue eyes. Originally, she was Greg Vance; a boy who desperately wanted to be a girl. I did not meet her as Greg but as Alyssa. Well, I fell in love with that girl and when she confessed she was a actually boy on the path to become a girl, I was still in love. Grace was very supportive too as she was a lesbian and very much in love with Alyssa's sister, Beth. Well, fate played a hand in Alyssa's life and she slowly transformed into a real girl; something to do with a strange ancestry involving the Amazon women of the Brazilian rain forest. All that mattered to me was that she was a real girl and my girlfriend.

I was snapped from my thoughts as Alyssa answered her phone. "Hello, big guy." Kindly, she said. "What's on your mind?"

"Hey, tomboy." Smiling slightly, I replied. "I called on a rather serious matter."

"What's wrong?" Concerned, Alyssa asked.

I relayed everything that had happened to Alyssa then asked, "Have you gained any special powers or skills that might help us help our mom and dad?"

There was a short pause before Alyssa replied, "Yes, I gained a few super abilities along with my gender change. So did Beth. I have developed incredible speed and can heal real fast. Beth has gained some odd form of clairvoyance making her close to a super genius."

"Grace and I want to help mom and dad in case this meeting goes sour." Serious, I said. "Is there any way you can help us call all of our close friends and see if they had developed anything that might help us?"

"What if they have no powers?" Curious, Alyssa asked.

"Then tell them its for a fan fiction project." Smiling, I replied. "We're all huge fans of the same graphic novel series."

"True." Giggling, Alyssa said. "I'll make some calls and then call you back."

"Sounds good." Nodding, I said. "I'll talk to you again soon."

After ending the call, I considered who to call next.
12213211111111212222212111211211111.title: my girlfriend, Alyssa Vance.

122132111111112122222121112112111111.content:
Within a few short hours, Grace and I discovered that all of our closest friends had developed incredible abilities and that their parents were all a part of the original Problem Child gang depicted in the graphic novel we all loved to read. There were ten of us in all and we all agreed to meet each other at Nomad's Park near the pond at noon the following day to help our parents. Only we all also agreed to go in some form of subtle disguise so not to be easily recognized. After I ended the last call, I turned to Grace, concerned.

"This is unreal, sis." Rattled, I said. "Alyssa has super speed while her sister, Beth has a form of clairvoyance that gives her the wisdom of an ancient master." I sighed and added, "Her mother was Heather, the thinker, the strategist of the group."

"Megan Connors told me that she has what her dad had dubbed Telemechanics or the ability to communicate with and control machines. Her father was Sam the machine." Frowning, Grace said. "Susan Tanner told me she had the powers of a ghost. Her father was Greg the chemist, the leader of the original group."

I sighed at that. Megan was a my age of fourteen with shoulder length sand blond hair and green eyes. She was slender but well built and had a knack for mechanics. I wondered if her father had the same powers. It made sense as he always seemed to be able to make anything run perfect. Susan was also fourteen only she had mid-back angel blond hair and blue eyes. She had a doll like frame and features, making her appear very fragile. Only that was far from the truth; she was highly skilled at dodging anyone's advances and delivering good hits of her own. In the graphic novel, Greg seemed to be able to pop in from nowhere. Hearing of Susan's powers, it made a lot more sense; Greg materialized through a wall or simply became visible.

"Clem Rodgers told me that he has the power to transform into anyone or into almost anything." Serious, I explained. "Apparently, his parents are literally out of this world. His adopted sister, Rhea seems to have powerful mental abilities including seeing auras. Only he is reluctant to get her involved; she's only ten after all."

Grace nodded. Clem Rodgers was a strange kid. He was tall and well made with short black hair and brown eyes. He mostly kept to himself but he was very friendly to everyone. She recalled reading about an odd couple who would give inside information to the Problem Child Gang when they needed it and wondered if they were Clem's parents. Grace then thought of Rhea. She was a cute kid with mid-back auburn hair and hazel eyes. She remembered babysitting her a few times and noticed that she had a curious nature. Everything she looked at she did so as if she were making a serious study out of it.

"That leaves Caitlin Spencer and Lilith Nightshade." Serious, she said. "Caitlin was a rich, stuck up snob a while back but she has really changed lately. She has become kind and generous to almost a fault after losing all of her hair to some defective body wash." She sighed. "Anyway, she said she had developed incredible mental abilities including telepathy which was what lead her to realize what a complete pain she had been to everyone."

I grunted but didn't say anything. Caitlin was tall and slender and had long blond hair before the incident with the body wash. Her family was insanely rich. Alyssa was her cousin as Caitlin's mother and her mother were sisters. "Lilith, I heard has some kind of magic power." Wincing, I said. "Something to do with Tarot cards..."

Grace shrugged. "Lilith told me that she doesn't understand it all herself but the Tarot cards are basically the tools for her magic." Serious, she replied. "It's some kind of magical summoning power that allows her to make the images on the cards come to life." She sighed and added, "Her mother claimed to be able to use the cards to accurately guess the future. She had called herself Madam Vague."

I smiled, remembering Madam Vague from the graphic novel. She was a strange character, always hidden in the shadows who gave cryptic clues or warnings to the Problem Child Gang when they were close to danger or stuck on a case. Lilith was tall and slender with long raven hair and deep green eyes. She was a goth girl; always wearing dark makeup and nail polish, wearing mostly black all the time. Still, she was very kind and helpful to all who asked for it and a very good friend of mine. She was the first to stand up for Alyssa other than myself and the first to congratulate us on becoming a couple.

"We will have to come up with some form of disguise for ourselves." Softly, I said.

Grace giggled slightly. "I already have that covered." Bemused, she said. "I think you'll like what I picked out for you."

I could only roll my eyes. "We better get some sleep. Tomorrow is going to be interesting."
122132111111112122222121112112111111.title: continue.

choices: The other parents had the same plan.
1221321111111121222221211121121111112.content:
Fortunately, it was still summer vacation so Grace and I were left to our own devices as mom and dad left for the meeting in the park. I was right to assume they did not want us involved but I smelled a trap and I had a feeling so did my dad. Grace had somehow found dad's outfit from when he was fighting crime as a teenager. I found it strange that he had kept it all these years but I put it on as I found it ironic. The cargo pants and T-shirt fit perfectly as did the long cowboy style jacket. I buckled the special sheath into place across my chest and slid the famous iron rod staff into place. After getting into my own steel toe boots and dark shades, I gazed into a full length mirror. "I look just like Tex the mighty from the graphic novel." Whispering, I commented.

"How do I look?" Stepping up, Grace asked.

I turned to find Grace wearing loose fitting black pants, black shirt, a sleeveless black jacket, and knee high black boots. On her face was a light but cleverly applied mask of makeup that made her look like a living doll. "You look like something out of my nightmares." Smirking, I retorted.

Grace grunted, smiling herself. "Good. Caitlin should be here soon to take us all to the park."

Moments later, we stepped out just as a black van with tinted windows pulled up. I could hear the power of the engine as it came to a stop. The side door opened and we jumped in to find Megan at the wheel. She was wearing blue jeans, white T-shirt, blue jeans jacket, and hiking boots. She was not wearing anything that hid her face. "That's not much of a disguise." Wincing, I said.

Megan smiled as several pieces of metal and wiring quickly onto her body until she was completely covered, looking like a robot from a sci-fi horror movie. "Is this better?" Her voice sounding artificial, she asked.

"Wow..." Whispering, Grace muttered.

"We need to move." Urgently, Alyssa said.

I nodded as Grace closed the side door of the van. Alyssa was wearing a black spandex yoga body suit with tight blue jeans shorts, a bluejeans hooded jacket, expensive looking running shoes, soccer shin guards. under the hood, she wore a doll face masquerade mask. On her wrists were large metal bracelets which completed the look. Her sister, Beth was wearing loose fitting cargo pants with various pockets, a tank top shirt, and a black sleeveless jacket which also have several pockets. She wore hiking boots, finger-less gloves, and dark sunglasses. Around her waist was a utility belt with a number of pouches holding unknown objects.

I turned to the others to find Susan wearing black pants, a black shirt, and a long black jacket with a similar makeup mask Grace was wearing. Seeing my concerned look, she smiled before vanishing into thin air. A gasp escaped my lips before Susan reappeared, grinning at me. "Invisibility is the best disguise of all." Calmly, she said.

"And arrogance is the greatest weakness." Firmly, Beth countered. "Let's not be too proud of our powers; we are just getting started here."

"Quite right." Nodding, Clem said. "We are just going to back up our parents in case they are walking into a trap."

Clem did not look at all like himself. His skin was changing tone every few seconds and his eyes were constantly changing color along with that of his hair. Seeing my shock, he calmly stated, "I'm a shape-shifter; I can change anything about my appearance including my gender."

"I got that part." Frowning, I said. "It's what you said before... all of our parents are going to this meeting with Stalker?"

Clem nodded, a heavy frown on his face. "I had to bring Rhea along; she threatened to squeal if I didn't take her with us."

I turned to Rhea who was wearing a 'red riding-hood' costume with black tights, black tennis shoes, and a white mask over her eyes and button nose. She looked more cute than frightful; I could not help but smile a little. Rhea pouted in response. "Don't laugh." Defending herself, she demanded. "It's all I could think of."

"You look great, Rhea." Chiming in, Caitlin said.

Caitlin was wearing what looked like a horror story schoolgirl uniform. It was a black pleated skirt, a black blouse with a blood red vest and a long black hooded coat over it all with black shoes, black gloves, and what looked like a force field over her face, hiding its features. Rhea smiled at her comment. "You look good too."

"Focus, everyone." Serious, Lilith ordered. "We're here."

Lilith was wearing a blood red and black dress, a blood red bandana with a black eye mask and elbow length black gloves. I noticed she was also wearing black knee-high boots. With her Gothic makeup, she looked like something out of a nightmare. "Anyone have a plan?" Darkly, she demanded. "I have to admit, this came too quick for me to think of anything."

"We surround the area and observe." Serious, Beth said. "We stay in constant communication through Caitlin who we know has telepathy." She turned to Caitlin. "That said, you will need to stay in the van with Megan who will be our way out in case things go sour."

"I have to sit this out?" Insulted, Caitlin asked.

"Just until we can piece together a radio system for us to use." Comforting her, Beth said. "We will all be depending upon you to keep us all in contact; it just might save all of our lives."

Caitlin sighed. "Since you put it that way, you can count on me."

Beth nodded then turned to us. "If any of us see or sense a trap, call it out in your thoughts and we will move in and do what we can to stop the bad guys."

Everyone nodded in agreement as the van came to a stop and we piled out to take our positions around the gazebo near the pond.
1221321111111121222221211121121111112.title: putting on our disguises.

12213211111111212222212111211211111121.content:
The scene at Nomad's park was quiet and peaceful; just another sunny morning, so it seemed. Only I could sense a heavy tension in the air. It was not something I was born with or had gained through my new found powers; it was something I had learned by being in situations that had escalated all too quickly. I looked around from my position, casually leaning against one of the many trees near the meeting site and spotted mom and dad waiting outside the gazebo.

"Is everyone in position?" Nervous, I thought.

Everyone signaled that they were standing by near the meeting point. and I turned my attention back to the gazebo and spotted a black four door with tinted windows approaching the gazebo. What alerted me was that it was not slowing down. It was in fact speeding up! Fearing the worst, I made a mad dash to intercept the vehicle. My muscles swelled and hardened with each pounding blow of my feet as I raced to the street. I saw the rear window roll down with a man wearing dark sunglasses peering out with an assault rifle!

"It's a trap!" Sounding an alarm, I thought out. "Everyone move in!"

The man in the back of the black car opened fire, sending a hail of bullets at my parents! Dad was quick to respond and pulled mom behind the gazebo. I had no time to see if he or mom were safe, I was fully focused on stopping the car. I reached the street just as the car reached me and threw my fist down onto the hood as hard as I could. The force of the impact along with the speed of the car caused it to literally flip over me! It crashed onto the pavement on its wheels, the man in the back still holding the rifle.

"Drop your weapons!" Forcefully, I demanded. "I mean now!"

The man with the rifle came out and pointed his weapon at me. "I don't know who you are, kid but you are obviously strong." Grinning, the man said. "However, not even the real Tex the mighty could handle armor piercing rounds and I doubt you can either."

With that, he fired his weapon. At first, I thought that was it. One moment of hesitation had cost me my life just when I thought I was really going to be a hero. To my surprise and the man's horror, the bullets bounced off me, leaving nothing more than a light sting. It felt more like a hot shower than a hail of bullets. I quickly jumped in and grabbed the rifle from the man before breaking it in half over my knee. I didn't know why I did it; maybe I was angry that he tried to kill my parents. Still, it made the man turn pale white in horror as I tossed the remnants of the rifle aside, staring him down with a look of fury. "What are you?!"

I grabbed the man by the collar and easily lifted him off the ground as my muscular form made me a good seven feet tall. "Those bullets won't work on me!" Angrily, I stated. "I am Goliath!"

Suddenly, Caitlin's voice rang out in my head. "Gar! We have more company coming!" Urgently,she warned. "Four black four doors with armed men inside!"

I turned to see the cars coming down the street along with people fleeing in a panic due to the attempted hit. Turning back to the man I was holding, I saw that the car was speeding away even though it had all flat tires. I growled at the man i had then threw him at a nearby dumpster. The man let out a startled yell just before he hit the open lid and fell in with the lid closing on him.

"Everyone stay sharp!" Firmly, Beth thought out. "These guys are no doubt professionals; they know our parents must be in the area."

"Rodger that!" I thought back.

The four cars came to a screeching halt and four men in black business suits got out, each armed with automatic weapons. I was after the car I had originally stopped but I kept my eyes on the others, worried for their safety. Alyssa had taken on the first group, relieving them of the weapons in their hands in a blur. The men screamed in pain as the sheer speed of taking the guns must have broken at least one or more of their fingers. One moved to retrieve a sidearm from a holster at his side only to fall into convulsions as Alyssa kicked and punched him several hundred times in just a few seconds! Grace was at her side in a heart beat, using martial arts moves to assist. Within seconds, the first group was rendered unconscious.

"Isa and Angel here." Alyssa thought out. "The first group has been pacified."

The second group was firing in a blind panic as cars with no drivers surrounded them while a frightening looking robot, Susan, slowly walked towards them. The bullets bounced harmlessly off her metallic armor. Just as the first man had ran out of bullets and was forced to reload, Megan appeared out of nowhere and brought a katana blade down, literally cutting the rifle in half! The man screamed and turned but Megan had already vanished only to reappear behind him with a karate chop to the back of his neck, knocking him out. Susan simply threw a fist into the second man, instantly rendering him unconscious. The two then made swift work of the other two before tying them up.

"Mecha and Yurei here." Reporting in, Susan thought. "Second group is pacified."

I grinned at the two reports. Isa was what Alyssa's toddler brother called her with his lisp. Grace, although not quite an angel, the two words related to each other. Mecha fit Susan's powers well and Yurei was Japanese for ghost, which suited Megan's ghost like powers nicely. I then focused on the car I was chasing, hoping to catch it before the goons inside got away.

Unknown to me, Clem had confronted the third group with Rhea right behind him. At first, they laughed at Rheas in her cute red ridding hood costume but jumped back as an energy form of a six foot muscular woman appeared around her. They opened fire only to find their bullets literally bouncing off the energy form. Clem transformed into something out of a horror movie with tentacles and eye stalks, causing the men to scream. They trained their weapons on him but Clem was ready and grabbed the weapons out of their grasp before grabbing them with a powerful tentacle and throwing them against a building. Rhea, in her adult energy form made short work of the other two. As the two returned to their normal states, they exchanged a kind smile along with a quick high five.

"Morpheus and Amazon here." Clem reported. "Third group has been pacified."

I took a chance to look back at the park to see the fourth group making a run for their vehicle. Whatever plan they had was falling apart in seconds and they knew it. Lilith appeared in their path with a puff of smoke just before they reached the car. "Your destiny is about to change!" Darkly, she announced. "Drop your weapons before I draw my card!"

The four men hesitated which was all Lilith needed. She drew a card and tossed it at the group just as it began to glow. Instantly, to the shock of the four men, they were surrounded by a circular wall on all sides. To my perspective, a tall tower of stone had appeared where the men once stood. I felt the ground shake before the tower vanished, revealing the four men, all unharmed but unconscious on the sidewalk. "Soothsayer here." she reported. "The last group has been pacified."

"I'm still in pursuit of the lead vehicle!" Panting, I thought. "I need some assistance!"

Just as I had called for help in my thoughts, I heard a crash and saw that vehicle had stopped dead with smoke bellowing out of the destroyed front end. I stumbled to come to a stop to see dad standing in front of the car in his hulk mode. He did not look happy at all. "I have called for back up." Returning to his normal form, he said. "You and your group better get out of here before they arrive."

I quickly nodded as Beth's voice called out. "The police are en route to our position! Everyone back to the van, we're done here!"

We all swiftly returned to the van and sped off just as the first of many squad cars were arriving on the scene. I felt great knowing that we had saved my parents and possibly the parents of our friends as well. I don't know what came over us but, as we sped passed the first squad car, we all yelled out, "Problem Child!"

Early the next morning, dad called me to the dinning room where he ordered me to sit down along with Grace. We exchanged worried looks as we both knew we were in trouble or at least in for the lecture of our lives. Dad took a breath and said, "I do not know what possessed you and the others to do what you did but that can't be undone. However, there is one thing I must do..."

With that said, he...
12213211111111212222212111211211111121.title: The Problem Child Gang is reborn.

122132111111112122222121112112111111211.content:
Dad tossed the morning paper onto the table in front of Grace and I. Curious, we looked at the headline... 'Problem Child Gang Returns!'

"Congratulations, kids." Frustrated, dad said. "You made the headlines."

"Everyone who was at the park witnessed the attempted hit." Softly, mom added. "Some made videos of you and your friends taking on the would be assassins." She sighed, motioning to a laptop on the table. "They all went viral."

"The whole world now knows there is a new Problem Child Gang." Frowning, dad said. "That includes the Agency."

"We had a plan in place to deal with the situation." Scolding, mom said. "Why did you all have to jump in, try to be heroes?" She sighed, fighting tears. "There is no turning back for you now, any of you... we wanted to save you from that life."

"We wanted to save you." Hurt, I countered. "That is what family is all about."

"You are missing the point, son." Sadly, dad said. "We lived long, full lives; your lives are just getting started. Your mother and I would rather see us falling to our old enemies than to see you fall to them."

"Then let us face these enemies together." Firmly, Grace announced. "You barely defeated them before but now, you have back up... us."

"You knew they were coming for you, dad." Serious, I said. "What would have stopped them from coming after us next?" I turned to mom. "As you said, there is no turning back so we might as well prepare ourselves for the enemy's next move."

Mom and dad turned to each other, as if uncertain. Finally, mom gave a slow nod and dad sighed, turning back to Grace and I. "How were you and the others communicating?" Softly, he asked. "What radio signal did you use?"

"We were talking to each other through a member with telepathy." Honestly, you replied.

Dad grunted. "You will need a radio back up." Serious, he said. "If your enemies figure out you are using a telepath to talk to each other, they will target that member to hinder your efforts."
