"What are the names of your group?" Firmly, mom demanded. "Do they effectively hide the identity of the members?" She turned to Grace. "Also, I need to talk to you about your choice of mask, young lady."

"We have Goliath and Angel." Motioning to myself and Grace I said. "The super fast Isa, Mecha the telemechanic..."

"Telemechanic?" Confused, mom asked.

"The supernatural ability to talk to and control any machine." Serious, Grace said. "It's an extremely rare gift."

"We have Yurei the ghost warrior, Morpheus the shape-shifter, the little Amazon..."

"I saw that." Smiling slightly, mom commented. "A cute little girl in a red ridding hood costume suddenly becomes a powerful adult woman." She giggled slightly. "Talk about going from perfect innocence to holly shit..."

Grace and I chuckled at that then turned serious as dad spoke. "What of the other members?" Firmly, he demanded. "What do they call themselves?"

"Soothsayer, the magic wielder; Giri, the advanced; and Mystic, the clairvoyant." Serious, I said. "Mystic is our leader, for the moment."

"Why did you call this Giri the advanced?" Curious, mom asked.

"It's a bit hard to explain." Wincing, I said. "It's as if her mind is working at nearly full capacity."

"I see..." Sighing, mom said. "Also, why did you say Mystic is your leader for the moment?"

"Well, we really have not discussed who is in charge of the group yet." Wincing, Grace admitted.

"You will need to get that straightened out fast." Serious, dad said. "You don't want to fail a mission over petty arguments of who has the right to give the orders."

"I'll make a pot of tea." Sighing, mom said. "I can already see we have a lot to talk about."

Dad nodded. "Quite right."
122132111111112122222121112112111111211.title: Passing the torch.

1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.content:
"Why was Mystic named the leader for this first mission?" Serious, dad demanded.

"She seems to have the wisdom of her entire ancestry." Honestly, Grace replied. "At the moment, it seemed like a good idea to let her call the shots."

Mom came in with a pot of tea and poured everyone a cup. "I see..." Sitting down, she said. "It might be a good idea to keep her in charge but have a second in command in case something goes wrong and she is unable to lead."

"We had that issue on our third mission." Frowning, dad said. "Greg took a lucky shot which destroyed his radio; he could not contact any of us. Sam took command and we were able to return the stolen rare art pieces to the Ancestry Museum fully intact."

"That was book one; The strange heist." Smiling slightly, I said. "A string of unusual robberies within the wealthy community of Waterfront City." I frowned. "That was also when Heather was taken and held for ransom."

"Kidnapping Heather was what brought the Problem Child Gang together." Serious, dad said. "We were all close friends; we all knew each other had unique gifts."

"When they heard that Heather was taken, they jumped into action." Smiling slightly, mom said. She sighed, her smile vanishing. "Only it did not go as planned."

"We were easily beaten because we were not organized, not ready for any surprises." Frowning, dad said. "Oddly enough, they let us go with a warning. Taking Heather was a distraction to keep her family's army of security guards busy." He smiled. "They called us each a 'problem child'."

"Which became your battle cry every time you won a battle and left the scene." Grinning, I said.

Dad nodded. "That is exactly what you and your friends cried out as you left the scene yesterday in your black van." Sternly, dad scolded. "At least you had the brains to remove the license plates prior to arriving on the scene."

"We all made a number of mistakes while fighting crime, kids." Wearily, mom added. "We just don't want to see you repeat them but learn from them." She turned to Grace. "Speaking of mistakes, that make up can wash off, you need something better."

"What do you suggest?" Curious, Grace asked.

Mom smiled. "I have a variety of masks you can use which I modified from old Halloween costumes at various stores for a fair price." Bemused, she said. "I became quite good at disguising myself."

Dad chuckled. "Your mother was the daughter of a hard nosed reporter who had constantly followed our exploits." Ruefully, he said. "While he never even got close, she got the big scoops due to her uncanny ability to make herself blend in to any crowd."

"I eventually became a part of the gang, serving as an anonymous tipper to the media." Smiling, mom said. "It gave my dad a lot of major scoops, advancing his career, but it drove him crazy not knowing who the source was." She turned sad, adding, "He passed away last year, I never found the courage to tell him."

"That is another demon you will face, kids." Serious, dad said. "Not telling a soul that you are a member of the Problem Child Gang."

"Anyone who knows outside of your group will become a potential target." Softly, mom said. "That's why I never told my dad. He had been targeted many times, just to learn the secret source of his breaking news stories."

"Is there anything you can tell us that can help us on any future missions?" Hopeful, I asked.

Dad smiled slightly. "Oh, you will all be getting more advice than you will want to hear." Bemused, he said. "Right now, I think we should focus on..."
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.title: continue.

1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.content:
Mom left the room for a while, then came back with a box. "Let's see if any of these will work with your outfits."

Grace and I dug through them. "You've got a good eye, Mom," Grace said. "I think a lot of these will work as is. We'll get the others to make their own masks."

"We should also talk about code names," Dad said. "A couple of the ones your friends use need work."

"Which ones?"

"Well, Isa is awfully close to what sounds like a person's real name," he explained. "I've heard little Sam Vance call his sister Issa. We wouldn't want the bad guys coming after him in an effort to get to your speedster, would we?"

Mom nodded. "I think Velocity would be better. And your Morpheus might want to change his code name to Proteus. Morpheus was the god of sleep."

"I didn't know that last part," Grace said.

The phone rang. "I'll get it," Dad said.

While Dad talked on the phone, Mom continued. "You kids will also need a base of operations, so nobody follows Goliath and Angel back to this house."

"Any ideas?"

"We used an abandoned warehouse. Unfortunately, real estate expenses are too much for anyone to allow such a big space to be vacant. There's the SubStation, but that probably hasn't been cleaned in years."

"The SubStation?"

"It was originally constructed as part of a subway system, but they never connected it, and seemed to forget all about it. Maybe later, we'll show it to you."

Dad came back in, looking like he'd been punched in the gut. "Mrs. D passed away."

"Oh, no." Mom got up and hugged him.

Mrs. Dalrymple was an old lady who was maybe the best-known person in Waterfront. I've never heard anyone say anything bad about her, and she always seemed to be nice to everyone, even when kids accidentally threw baseballs or footballs through her windows.

"There was a girl named Melissa with her when she died," Dad said. "Either of you know her?"

I shook my head. "Maybe she goes to a different school."

"I've sometimes seen a blind girl walking either to her house or away from it," Grace said. "That might be her."

Dad sat down. "Mrs. D helped us out on some of our cases, whether she knew it or not. When her family makes the funeral arrangements, I will be there."
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.title: your disguises.

1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.content:
The funeral was two days later, on a Friday afternoon. Dad was there in his dress police uniform with mom and I along with Grace at his side. Dad and a few of my friends' parents stepped up and carried the casket to the grave site and lowered it into the ground. Alyssa's mother, who was wheelchair bound, sang a beautiful hymnal as the grave was covered with Earth and everyone witnessing the funeral left a single rose at the grave. I noticed that all of the adults were hit hard by Mrs D's death, dad especially. I saw him looking out at a young girl who was standing next to Zack Davenport, a new kid at school. I only knew her as Melissa, Zack's blind little sister.

"Is something wrong, dad?" Worried, I whispered.

Dad slowly shook his head. "I just have a gut feeling, Garth." Flatly, he said. "Mrs D had taken Zack's sister, Melissa, under her wing. She might have heard something or Mrs D might have told her something."

"Do you suspect foul play?" Wincing, Grace asked.

Again, dad slowly shook his head. "I owe Mrs D my life." Cryptically, he replied. "I have to at least look into the matter."

"Want some help?" Curious, I asked.

"The police are looking for you and your friends as it is." Serious, dad whispered. "Don't press your luck, not this early. Case two, book one; 'good cop, bad cop'."

I nodded at that but remained silent. The second case of the original problem child gang lead dad, who had called himself Tex, to be arrested and interrogated by a cop who was determined to pin the unusual robberies on him to close the case quickly. Tex escaped before his identity was revealed. Fortunately, he and his fellow members were not only able to prove their innocence but find enough evidence to prove the bad cop played a part of the string of thefts.

"You and Grace better head home with mom." Placing his hat on, dad said. "I have a duty and a promise to uphold."

Sadly, Grace and I followed mom back to the car as dad walked to his squad car. There was not a dry eye among the adults who had attended the funeral. All of them were the parents of the members of the new problem child gang. It was obvious that she had somehow helped the original gang back in the day. "I have a feeling that if there was foul play, dad and his friends will tear the city apart to find Mrs D's killer." Worried, I said.

Grace nodded. "Then lets find out what had happened." Serious, she said. "Carefully, of course."

"You two stay out of this one." Sternly, mom said. "It's very personal to your father and many others; let them deal with it."

Upon returning home, Grace and I talked regarding what to do next.
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.title: The funeral

1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.content:
Before either of us could speak, we heard a strange ringtone. It was the same ringtone I had heard on Dad's phone before I learned of his secret past. We listened and heard mom's voice. "Steve...?" Surprised, she asked. "Are you okay?"

I looked out into thew hall and found mom standing outside our room. She growled slightly, hearing the response of a man named Steve. "Hang on a minute!"

Mom entered my room with the cellphone in her hand. She had a cross look on her face. "What's wrong, mom?" Worried, I asked.

"You need to hear this." Sternly, mom said. She then turned to the phone. "You are on speaker, Tinker; repeat what you said to my children."

I turned to Grace, stunned. Tinker was among the youngest members of the old gang. He was a child prodigy when it came to building gadgets. He was the one who fitted the group with the toys they used on their cases. We turned to mom and listened.

"I thought we all agreed to keep our children out of this if Sykes or the Agency ever returned." Annoyed, Steve said. "I am a sketch artist for the police department now, among other things. One of the witnesses described your daughter, Grace to every detail! Care to explain?"

"I have no idea what you are talking about... officer Steve." Defiantly, I responded. "We were at the park that day but my sister and I were among the bystanders running away from the action."

"Do you have a witness to verify your claim?" Unimpressed, Steve demanded.

"Just watch the news footage." Simply, Grace countered. "The witness you spoke to obviously was frightened and confused." She smiled. "It was a rather alarming scene..."

"Don't get cute with me, kid!" Irritable, Steve snapped. "These people are not like the stereotype villains you see on Saturday morning cartoons! They will not hesitate to kill you... or worse!"

"You are scaring my sister, officer Steve!" Forceful, I snapped back. "Also, you are harassing the son and daughter of the chief of police! I certainly hope you have more proof than a vague sketch from a single panicked eyewitness!"

Mom gasped slightly as Steve paused on the other line. Only she released a breath when we all heard him chuckle. "Well played, young man." More softly, he said. "Still, we have a massive amount of damage control to do. I am not the only one working this case."

"What do you suggest?" Curious, mom asked.

"Personally, I would rather them lay low and allow this to blow over." Darkly, Steve replied. He let out a weary sigh. "However, if they are serious about becoming the new defenders of this small city, they are going to need training."

"What kind of training?" Raising an eyebrow, Grace demanded.

"You need more than a mask and an attitude to fight crime, young lady." Sternly, Steve explained. "I'm certain you believe you have wonderful powers. However, they don't mean shit if you can't use them to their fullest potential. Even then, there is a chance of meeting up with someone better or stronger or one who can outwit you."

"We are trying to better ourselves every day." Irritated, I stated.

Steve sighed. "Just remember that the police did not smile upon the efforts of the original gang; they will be less tolerant of the new gang." Sternly, he said. "It's their job to catch the bad guys! They do not like any vigilantes stepping on their toes or worse making them look like fools on their own turf!"

"They tried to kill our parents." Softly, Grace argued. "We will not stand idle..."

"Nor will the police department." Serious, Steve countered. "They will use everything at their disposal to figure out who you are." He again sighed. "You must use everything at your disposal to stay one step ahead."

With that, Steve ended the call. Mom placed the cellphone back in her jeans pocket. "We had to deal with this and many other issues." Darkly, mom said. "I can only pray you and the other kids know what you are getting yourselves into."
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.title: Damage control.

1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.content:
As if on cue, there was a heavy knock on the door. Mom answered to find a tall, muscular man in a police uniform with a long tan trench coat over it and a Homburg hat. "I apologize for coming over unannounced, Mrs Jones." Politely, the man said. "I am Detective Geo Tanner; I'm here to talk to your children, Garth and Grace."

Mom opened her mouth for a moment then stepped aside to allow him to enter. Upon closing the door, the man, Geo turned to Grace and I with a steel hard look. One I did not appreciate in the least so I spoke up. "We have already been questioned by our father, the chief of police and by a detective on the phone." Annoyed, I snapped. "this is beginning to feel like harassment!"

"Shut it, pipsqueak!" Forcefully, Geo thundered. "I don't have the time or the patience for an argument so just listen!"

The attitude I was being given by this Geo character was quickly making me angry but a touch of Grace's hand forced me to stand down. "You have our attention." Coldly, Grace said. "However, we do not appreciate your tone so make this good or get out."

"Let's cut straight to the chase, then." Sternly, he said. "I am a real private sector detective, but I use my occupation in the Waterfront City police department to clean up messes like this one. I was known as Greg, the leader of the original Problem Child Gang."

"What brings you here to us?" Still annoyed, I demanded. "We already got the riot act from dad."

"Nearly half of all those born in this city develop a special power by the time they reach their teenage years." Serious, Geo explained. "This caught the attention of the government shortly after the start of the cold war when they were searching for means to create a super soldier."

"I didn't know that." Taken back, Grace said.

"Nor did I." Worried, mom said. "Have you been holding out on us, Geo?"

Geo shook his head. "I had been using the resources of the police department since our last mission to find out why Sykes was so fixated on our little city." Honestly, he said. "He was after the source of all of these special powered kids so to make himself as close to all powerful as he could to over throw the Agency."

"Wait! If nearly half of all those born in this city develops special abilities..." Startled, I began.

"Some joined the problem child gang, others helped them while the rest kept their gifts a secret." Serious, Geo said. "Many moved out, fearing for their future children." He sighed. "The point is, we can't allow word of this to get out. It's not the police I fear, its the press."

"You are afraid that if news of a new problem child gang reaches the ears of the government they might reopen their investigation." Turning pale, Grace said. "What can we do?"

"Stay as many steps ahead of the police and the press as you can." Sternly, Geo replied. "Do not allow your 'growing fame' to get to your heads. Remain as much a mystery as you can; don't stick around after you stop the bad guys and don't waste your time on ordinary criminals unless there is no other choice."

"Work from the shadows and vanish as fast as we appear." Nodding, I said. "I think I get it."

"We thought we had it at first too." Darkly, Geo said. "Don't allow your emotions to drive your decisions; we have seen the press place themselves in serious danger just to drive us out into the open for an interview."

Grace and I winced at that before I asked, "Can we call upon any of you for advice or gain pointers from your experience?"

Geo smiled. "You can count on it." Kindly, he said. "Just don't repeat our mistakes."

With that said, he quietly left the house.
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.title: The truth behind the investigation.

choices: Grace and I visit Mrs D's home.
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.content:
Dad returned home, looking drained. "I need a drink." Wearily, he said.

Mom winced seeing dad walk straight to the fridge and pull out a half empty bottle of whiskey before pouring himself a full shot glass and taking it down. "What did you learn from the Davenports?" Cautiously, mom asked.

Dad placed the bottle back in the fridge. "I have a bad feeling that Mrs D has given Melissa her powers." Softly, he replied. "She is exhibiting the exact same abilities and she somehow figured out who I was as a teenager." He sighed heavily. "I can only guess that Mrs D knew her time was running short and passed the torch."

"What sort of powers did she have?" Curious, I asked. I winced. "Or is now a bad time to ask...?"

"Mrs D was the mysterious Miss Shadow." To my shock, mom explained. "She had powers that would amaze you."

"She was untouchable, unbeatable..." Sadly, dad added. "That and we all thought she would live forever as she was here when it all started."

Grace and I exchanged startled looks. "What?!"

"It's true." Sadly, mom said. "It began sometime in the early 1850s." She sighed. "The problem child gang is only one of the many groups who had fought to keep this city safe from criminals and government agencies."

"She had saved our lives more times than we could ever repay." Wiping away a few tears, dad said. "We all owe it to her to find out how she died and, if it was foul play, find the killer and make him pay."

I jumped as dad shattered the shot glass in his hand clenching a fist. This was indeed personal to him, to a lot of people in Waterfront City. I decided to help out any way I could. A quick nod from Grace told me she felt the same way.
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.title: Dad returns home.

1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.content:
Later, Grace and I discussed what to do next in private. "Melissa Davenport doesn't live too far from us." Serious, I said. "I think its best if we let her know someone is watching out for her other than the police."

"Do you think its wise to get involved?" Wincing, Grace said.

"I know this is personal for dad." Softly, I countered. "Still, as mom said, there is no turning back. If someone is after her, we need to make sure they don't get her."

Grace nodded and we set out to go talk to Melissa. We reached her house about ten minutes later and heard her talking in the back yard. "I think I like butterflies and rabbits." Happily, Melissa said.

Grace called over the fence. "Hello?"

Melissa's mother responded, "Can I help you?"

"Grace and Garth Jones," Kindly, Grace called. "We heard there was a girl here, who was with Mrs. D when... " Her voice trailed off.

"That's right," Calmly, Melissa said, "I was."

I cleared my throat and called, "Um, we were thinking that, maybe, you might want to talk about it?"

Melissa's mom unlatched the gate, allowing us into their backyard. "Alright, the three of you can talk, if you want. I'll just run in and get you kids something to drink."

I nodded. "Thanks, ma'am,"

As soon as Mrs Davenport closed the door behind her, Grace said, under her breath, "Puer quaestio."

Melissa gasped, looking at me then turned to Grace wide eyed. "You are members of the new problem child gang." Whispering, she said. "Exactly what is it that you want from me?"

"Miss Shadow was a valuable ally to the original problem child gang." Quietly, I replied. "From what I heard from my mentor, you possess similar powers."

"We have reason to suspect Miss Shadow was your mentor." Kindly, Grace added. "We are hoping you might be willing to help us in the future."

"You are not asking me to join?" Surprised, I asked.

I shook my head, knowing well of dad's warning of no turning back. "We ask no one to follow us." Serious, I said. "Those who join us do so under their own free will and at their own peril."

"What we do is dangerous and the authorities frown upon such actions from anyone." Softly, Grace explained. "However, there is a real threat to this city and we believe it can use all the help it can get."

I then handed Melissa a card with a number on it. "If you decide you wish to help us in our fight or find you need our help, call us at any time; day or night." Kindly, he said. "Puer quaestio."

Grace and I paused, seeing the door open again with Mrs Davenport coming back out. I had a feeling Grace knew she was coming. I had learned to sense someone coming through painful experience growing up dealing with bullies. Melissa seemed to sense her as well and did not bat an eye as Grace quickly changed the subject of the conversation.

"We are very sorry for your loss, Melissa." Sadly, Grace said. "She was a dear friend of our father; she had helped him out of a few jams when he was around our age."

"He mentioned that." Nodding, Melissa replied.

"I see you three are getting along well." Smiling, Mrs Davenport said as she approached. "Melissa will be going to your school once summer vacation is over."

"Zack told us all about it." Politely, I said. "He's already informing everyone that he would be protecting her from any type of bullying."

Mrs Davenport giggled at that. "Zack has always been protective of her." Smiling, she said. "Although I'm certain it drives Melissa crazy at times, he does mean well."

After several minutes of normal conversation, Grace and I said our farewells and left in good spirits. "So what now?" After we were safely away, Grace asked.

I frowned. "Now we search for clues." Serious, I replied.

"Where, exactly?" Worried, Grace asked.
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.title: Grace and I visit Melissa.

choices: Another riot act from our parents.
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.content:
"Why there?" Curious, Grace asked. "I'm sure dad already combed through the crime scene with a fine toothed comb."

"Dad's attention is divided between his attempted assassination and Miss Shadow's untimely death." serious, I replied. "I want to know exactly who those goons were and who they work for."

Curious, Grace followed me on her own motor bike and we moved on to Nomad's Park where we stopped at the gazebo. "What are we looking for?" Dismounting, she asked.

"A radio, an ear piece, a bullet shell, anything that will give us a hint of a clue." Serious, I replied. "Those goons were not well organized... I'm thinking it was more of a fishing expedition to see who they were up against."

"You don't think this was a hit?" Surprised, Grace asked.

"You gave that gun for hire, John Stalker a taste of what you can do." Calmly, I replied. "My guess is that it whetted his curiosity."

With that said, I began my search. I began around the gazebo, looking for gun shells and found a few scattered in the grass. Upon picking them up, I moved on to where the car had landed after striking the hood. I found an ear piece that had fallen out of one of the attacker's ears. "We can have Mysteria look these over and see what kind of reading she can get off of them."

"Knowing your opponent is a good start." Startling us, an elderly voice said. "Only you must understand that your opponent has the same goal."

I whipped around to find an elderly woman in dark cloaks standing right next to me! "Where- Where did you come from?!" Worried, I demanded.

The elderly woman shook her head. "The more important question is where are you going from here?" Cryptically, she asked.

"Madame Vague..." Sighing, Grace said. "I had a feeling we would meet."

"Your instincts are strong but not focused, Miss Jones." Scolding, Madame Vague said. She turned to me. "Also, foresight is 20/20..." She motioned to the security cameras all around us. "Be grateful I know how to mask the movements of others. Otherwise, your opponents will know one Garth and Grace Jones have an interest in the scene of the crime.."
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.title: Nomad's Park

1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.content:
"I take it you know these opponents." Frowning, I said.

"I knew them." Softly, Madame Vague replied. "A lot can and does change over twenty years." she paused. "Let us finish this conversation elsewhere."

Before Grace or I could respond, we found ourselves in the sitting room in a house somewhere. We both jumped then relaxed slightly upon seeing Lilith Nightshade enter with a serving try holding a number of cups and a pitcher. "Welcome, guys." Softly, she said. "I hope you are ready for some serious strangeness."

"If you think what you had seen so far is seriously strange, buckle up." Serious, Madame Vague said. "You kids have barely scratched the surface of the neck deep shit you had stepped into."

"What can you tell us, Madame Vague?" Politely, Grace asked. "Anything you can give us would be helpful... we just want to help."

"So did your parents." Softly, madame Vague countered. "Only, like your parents, you are diving in without any knowledge of who you are butting heads with."

I sighed, my frustration showing. "Time is likely against us, Madame Vague." Serious, I said. "Please tell us what we need to know."

Madame Vague smiled slightly. "You have your father's temper though I am pleased to see that you have slightly stronger reigns on it."

"You were testing me...?" Taken aback, I demanded.

"Partially." Patiently, Madame Vague replied. "It is important to know those you are helping as much as those you are fighting."

"Who exactly are we facing and may be facing later?" More calmly, I demanded.

"Those who made the hit were merely hired thugs, of no consequence to those who hired them." Calmly, madame Vague replied. "Ask your father, all of them suffered from an acute memory loss of the last forty eight hours before and after the hit."

"Then we are up against C.H.I.L.D." Frowning, I said. "That is if the graphic novel truly reflects real life."

"The Central Headquarters of Intelligence, Logistics and Defense does exist." Darkly, Madame Vague replied. "They are an organization bent upon reshaping the world to their image and under their control."

"They were in a dispute with The Agency." thoughtful, Grace said. "the problem child gang got mixed up in it all with their fight against Sykes, the immortal thief."

"You know the graphic novel well but there were many points taken out of it." Darkly, Madame vague said. "CHILD and the Agency had been at odds for years as they have similar goals but vastly different approaches to achieve them and no wish to share power with anyone."

"How did the problem child gang come into play?" Curious, Grace asked.

"At first, they viewed as nothing more than a minor nuisance as they were fixated upon Sykes, a long time enemy to their cause."

"He was a good guy...?" Wincing, I asked.

"He had his own agenda and the Agency was in his way." Frowning, Madame Vague replied. "Sykes led the problem child gang to believe the Agency was his employer and their attention was shifted onto them."

"Thus they got pulled into the fray." Sighing, I said. "Just as we did."

Madame Vague nodded. "With your eyes wide open..."
1221321111111121222221211121121111112111.title: A talk with Madame Vague.

choices: Call mom and tell her everything. She should bring me some clothes.
I discover I can fly! I escape through the window and return home.
122132112.content:
I spent the rest of the day playing videogames and watching TV. My recently discovered superstrength seemed to disappear in the next hours as I could not lift the SUV anymore. I decided to forget it, maybe it was just some secondary effects of my strange transformation.
Mom decided that I was already completely healed and I could go to school again next day. I thought I would be able to enjoy some more days at home and skip school, but maybe mom was right after all.

So next day I went to school. Everything seemed to go alright... until the P.E. class. I started to feel a bit weird during the warm up exercises. I felt how every part of my body were tingling, but I was not feeling any pain fortunately.

"Mr. Richards... I'm not feeling very well." I said to my teacher.

"Yes, I already noticed it..." he seemed to notice something weird on me too, "Go to the restroom if you need it."

Immediately, I entered the school building. The tingling seemed to stop slowly when I was inside, but I wasn't sure about what was happening. I started running faster to the restroom, I had a very bad feeling...

I stopped. My body felt that weird tingling again. Suddenly, everything started to shrink. Or at least that was what I thought in that moment, but quickly I discovered that my body was growing again. There was no pain this time, so I decided to run even faster to the restroom. Everyone was in class in that moment, so I was safe because no one saw me. In that moment I was like a little kid turning into the Hulk.

I was very near... In less than ten seconds, I reached the restroom door. I put my hand on the knob, but before I could open the door I heard a loud sound. I broke the knob with my hand! I was very scared. Did my superstrength return? I left a hole in the door and I wasn't going to be safe inside if anyone near there noticed the broken door. I couldn't stay there, so I went to the teachers' restroom. I knew I wasn't allowed to enter there, but I remembered it was the only restroom door that could be locked from inside. I opened the door softly, trying not to break it again. I entered and locked the door. I was safe.

I walked scared to the mirror, I was not sure what I was going to see. I opened the eyes and saw something incredible. I was huge. All my body was big, I looked bigger than dad who was very muscular. I was bigger than him with no doubt. My body was full of muscle and maybe had a bit of fat, like a weightlifter somehow. Not only that, but I also looked older, like a 25 years old or something like that. My clothes were completely ruined, but fortunately my boxers were still intact (they looked very tight but curiously I didn't feel any pain).

Suddenly I heard a sound. Someone was trying to open the door.

"O... Occupied!" I said. Wow! My voice also sounded like an adult.

"It's... It's going to take a while..." I said. I was smiling in that moment, I liked my new voice!

"I'll go upstairs then, sorry." a female voice sounded behind the door. I heard some footsteps, the woman left.

I took off all what was left of my clothes. They were useless now. I stared again at the mirror. I couldn't resist to do some poses.
122132112.title: Garth uses his strength at school

13.content:
My name is Megan Connors, but most of my friends call me Mech, because I'm so good with electronics. I'm also fairly athletic, so my friends and teachers wish I would join one of our teams. This is the story of how I learned that was completely out of the question.



"I'm more than a little concerned," Dr. Stone said.

For over a week, I'd been burning up with the worst fever imaginable. Nobody could figure it out. There wasn't anything going around, and no antibiotics would help. Finally, my fever broke, and my doctor was giving me the once-over.

"What's the matter, doctor?" my mom asked. "Megan's fever is down, and she says she feels much better."

"So it would seem," he replied. "However, her blood and tissue samples show an abnormally high mineral content. I'd like to find out the cause."

"Mineral content?"

He nodded. "There are high levels of iron and copper in her system. With your permission, I'd like to take her to the hospital for further tests. Besides, if her fever returns, she could be monitored."

I shook my head. "I feel better than ever. I don't want to go to any hospital."

"At least," he said, "if anything happens, let me know."

"Absolutely," Mom said. With that, we left.


That night, I had some pretty strange dreams. I dreamed I was inside a computer program. I dreamed I could see in the dark. I even dreamed I was seeing heat images.

When I woke up, it felt like something was off. Not as bad as when I was sick, but I definitely felt strange.

After my shower, I felt a little better. When I went to brush my teeth, though, I froze.

My teeth were steel.
13.title: Megan Connors

choices: Ask mom to answer the door.
Ask mom to answer the phone.
131.content:
An ear piercing scream resonated from my throat as I began to shake, terrified by what I had seen. I had no way of knowing then that my scream was not only heard throughout the house but through every radio, television, cell phone, and computer that was on within a hundred yard radius of my house!

"What... What happened to me!?!" I screamed, my teeth gleaming in the light of the bathroom. "My teeth are... are..."

Just then, a knock came to the bathroom door, followed by mom's voice. "Honey, are you okay in there?"

Before I could answer, I heard a frantic knock on the front door, followed by the house phone, mom's cell, and my cell ringing all at the same time. "What's going on!?!" I yelled, covering my ears. "Mom, I'm scared!"

I had never broken down in such a way before but my throbbing headache was coming back with a vengeance as the knocks on the door and the rings on the phones seemed to become more urgent. Shaking with fear, confusion, and pain, I decided to...
131.title: Scream

1311.content:
Shaking, I answered my cellphone as I heard mom walking towards the front door. "He-Hello?" sobbing, I said.

"Megan! It's John, next door!" concerned, a male voice said. "Are you alright? My cell rang and I answered, hearing you screaming something about your teeth!"

I began to cry harder, feeling very frightened and confused. "John, please help me!" begging, I wailed. "I know its crazy but my teeth are covered in some kind of metal." my head pounding worse, I muttered, "It hurts... It hurts..."

"Don't do anything, Megan!" firmly, John replied. "I am on my way to you now!"

Unknown to me, mom answered the door to find my other neighbor, Doctor Hagen with a medical bag in his hand and a concerned look on his face. Dr Hagen was a not a very young man, early forties, but he looked as if he were in his mid twenties. He was handsome with his light brown hair, blue eyes, and fairly muscular figure. "You're timing is perfect, Max." with a relieved look, mom said. "Something is wrong with Megan, she's screaming something about her teeth." she teared up a little, adding, "I've never heard her this hysterical before."

"I'll take a look at her." stepping in, Max said. "Actually, I thought I heard her screaming on my computer. I recognized her voice and figured her scream was echoing thought my window so I came over immediately."

Mom's cellphone and house phone were still ringing so she excused herself and ran to the phone while Max saw himself up while John came running in behind him. "Megan called me, hysterical!" breathing heavily, he said. "Something about her teeth being covered in metal!"

"I'm on my way up to see her now, Mr Moore." calmly, Max said. "You can assist by helping me to calm Megan down, I can still hear her screaming."

John nodded and ran up the stairs to find me sitting on the floor, hugging my knees. I was terrified, watching every electronic device running on their own as if they were reacting to my growing panic. The lights were flashing in Morse code, signaling S.O.S. while the electric razor was buzzing wildly on the floor, pointing itself to Max and John the second they entered. while the vacuum cleaner in the hall was going crazy. John tried to get to me to calm me down but the electric razor chewed a pies of his tennis shoe, startling him and he took a step back.

"Megan, I think everything is reacting to your fear." said Max, calmly. "Try to relax yourself so we can have a look at you and see what is causing all of this."

I barely heard Max as the pounding in my head was relentless and the sound of everything going off at once was causing me to panic. "Help me!" I muttered, not knowing everyone in the area was hearing me. "Someone help me!"

John, seeing no other way, kicked the electric razor, sending it out the window. It triggered the home security system to sound alarms all over the house but it allowed John to get to me. He quickly knelled down and pulled me into a warm hug, gently rocking me. "I'm here, Megan." cooing, he said. "I'm right here, calm down. I won't let anything hurt you."

Finally snapping out of my fear induced trance, I realized John was there and returned his embrace, sobbing. "John, I'm so scared!" I wailed. "What's happening to me!?"

"That's what we're going to find out." said Max, slowly approaching me. "Right now, however, I need to sedate you so you will stay calm, is that fine with you?"

I turned to John, uncertain. He nodded and I agreed. Max prepared a syringe from his bag then injected me with a sedative once it was ready. Less than a minute later, I was unconscious and all of the electronic equipment fell silent.

"This is creepy, doc." shaken, John said. "What do you make of it?"

"You know I can't discuss that with you without her mother's written permission, young man." serious, Max replied. "Once I examine her, I will give my report to her mother and she will decide weather or not to tell you."

With that, Max pulled out his cellphone and dialed a number. "This is Dr Max Hagen, i need an ambulance at this address immediately...."

Hours later, I woke up...
1311.title: Answer my cellphone.

13111.content:
While I was unconscious, I had a strange dream. I saw myself in the middle of a city, surrounded by a number of vehicles of all types. Their engines purred at me, creating a bizarre but calming scene, I felt safe. When I eventually woke up from the sedative, I heard the beep beep beep of a vitals signs monitor. As my eyes fluttered open, I saw my mom looking at me with a tear stained face. "The entire neighborhood is worried about you, honey." softly, she said. "Somehow, your screams carried nearly a hundred yards in all directions." pausing, she asked, "How are you feeling?"

"I'm tired, I'm hurting, and I'm hungry." wincing, I replied. "What happened to me, mom?"

"The doctors ran more tests than I could count while you were passed out." looking worried, mom replied. "They found a few things out place but its beyond me." she turned to another person in the room. "Dr Hagen..."

Max came into view and sat down on the other side of the bed. "Yes, well we found that your body has been producing a massive amounts of minerals." looking curiously excited, Max said. "You have been getting gall stones, kidney stones, bone spurs..." he paused, seeing me becoming alarmed. "Normally, such an unlikely scenario would kill a grown man within days but your body is somehow making use of this bizarre condition."

"You- You're scaring me, doctor." trembling, I said. "Wha-What are you-you getting at?"

Max sighed. "Your body is taking all those minerals to strengthen your entire body." looking at me, he said. "Right now, your teeth are as hard as titanium steel!"

To say I was shocked would have been an understatement. "Do you know how my voice carried so far?" still fearful, I asked. "Do you have any idea why all the machines in my house went crazy?"

"That is were it gets interesting." his excitement returning. "We have no idea. However I believe it has to do with a tumor we found at the base of your brain."

"A tumor!?" shocked, mom asked. "Can you remove it!?"

Max shook his head. "It's too close to the vital parts of her brain to safely remove." seriously, he replied. "The good news is that I believe it is that tumor that is making all of this happen."

"What makes you think that?" thinking Dr Hagen was mad, I asked. "Have you seen this before?"

"A young man came into this hospital about a week ago." smiling, Max said. "I can not tell you his name but he had grown from five feet and four inches to eight feet and ten inches in less than five minutes!"

"Oh my." stunned, mom said. "Is he still alive?"

Max nodded. "He changed back within an hour of losing consciousness." still smiling, he replied. "The point is, he had the same curious tumor your daughter has within her." he pushed his chair closer, not noticing a camera following his movements. "I was pulled off of the case by his family doctor. I know I am not your family doctor either but I am hoping you and your mother will allow me to study your condition further."

I did not like the idea of being poked and prodded like some science experiment and turned to mom, uncertain who shrugged her shoulders. "We really don't have a family doctor at this time." wincing, she said. "We're waiting for a call back from a Dr Stone to see if he will take Megan on as a new client."

"At least allow me to try to get as many answers as I can before you leave the hospital." pleading, Max said. "I promise I'll be as gentle as I can."

Sighing, I said...
13111.title: In the hospital.

131112.content:
"I think you for your assistance, Dr Hagen." said a young man entering the room. "However, I have already been asked to be their family physician and I have agreed." he gave Max a smile. "Excuse me, doctor/patient confidentiality, I must ask you to leave the room."

"As you wish it, Thomas." said Max, disappointed. "I will remain on standby, just in case."

"You do fine work, Max." supportive, Thomas said. "I will share what I find relevant with you, as always."

Max walked away, mumbling, unaware that a security camera in the room followed his every move until he was gone while you turned to Thomas. "Dr Hagen seems to think its a tumor on my brain." you said, shaking.

Thomas nodded. "It seems to be a growing trend." he replied, looking at the test results. "I can not discuss my other patients with you but I have seen this before."

"Max told us of a boy who grew into a giant in less than five minutes." you said, worried. "Is he one of your patients?"

"He told you that?" asked Thomas. he sighed. "He shouldn't have, the chief of police issued a gag order on the boy's case, he could get arrested it gets back to him. I'd forget you heard of it."

"What about my daughter?" asked mom, concerned. "I'm more worried about her."

"From the test results I have here, I'd say that the tumor has activated a part of your brain only one is a billion people ever gain access to naturally." said Thomas, calmly. "So little is known about the human brain, anything is possible."

"What do you mean!?" I asked frightened. "Will this tumor hurt me!?"

"Somehow I doubt it." replied Thomas, softly. "All I can say is that its not a normal tumor. I said, I have seen this before, not that I completely understood it." he paused. I'll see if I can persuade another person who is going through this to talk to you, they would be able to explain it better, I think."

"Thank you, doctor." said mom, with a hint of relief. "That would be helpful."

Just then, an image flashed before my eyes, causing me to gasp. I saw Travis Greenway, a friend since kindergarten, running through a hall with a look of concern on his face. I turned to the door, just as he entered, breathing heavily.

"I heard you were in trouble." he said, between breaths. "Are you okay?"

"I'm not sure." I replied, teary eyed. "They found a tumor on my brain."

Travis turned pale but froze as he heard or thought he heard a voice in his head. *Fear not, wild one, she is safe.*
131112.title: nothing, Dr Stone arrives.

choices: Dr Hagen makes a phone call.
1311121.content:
"Could I please have a word with you in private, Mrs Connors?" looking at mom, Thomas asked. "It concerns this person Dr Hagen told you about."

Mom nodded then left the room with the doctor as I began to cry, worried and frightened about what was to become of me. Only, I froze as a feminine voice echoed in my mind. *Fear not, Megan.* she said. *You are well.*

My eyes widened, my breath quickening. What surprised me more was that Travis heard it as well as he looked about the room, startled. "Who are you?" looking around, he demanded. "Show yourself."

"Um... Travis, who are you talking to?" my voice shaking, I asked.

*He is talking to me, little one.* replied a voice in my head. *I am the 'tumor' attached to your brain.*

My eyes widened as my breath began to quicken. "What!?" I thought.

"Okay, why are you inside her?" turning to me, Travis asked. "Are you the one doing these things to her?"

*I am Zoe, a... symbiont. We provide certain abilities in return for 'room and board'.* replied the feminine voice. *The headaches are an unfortunate side effect of awakening mental powers.*

"So, what ability did you give me?" uncertain, I asked.

*I understand your fear.* said Zoe. *I have no control over what powers you receive but it seems you have the ability to control machines as your initial screams were heard on every electronic device for several yards around your house.*

"What of my teeth being metal?" curious, I asked.

*I do not know." flatly, Zoe replied. *Sorry, I'm tired and I must rest.*

With that, Zoe's voice fell silent and I turned to Travis, shaking. "Travis, I'm scared." sobbing, I said.

Travis pulled me into a warm hug as I quietly sobbed on his shoulder, confused and shaken. "Don't worry, Megan." whispering, he said. "I will find you some answers."

Minutes later...
1311121.title: The voice.

13111212.content:
It took a moment for me to compose myself but I managed to stop my tears only to become frightened again as Travis suddenly broke the hug and walked over to the door as if he had heard something out in the hall. I wanted to see what he saw but nothing came. "Maybe I'm trying to hard." I thought.

I turned back to Travis and saw him near the door, open just a crack, listening. Then, he eased the door closed and turned to me, looking worried. "Travis....Travis what's wrong?" feeling very frightened, I asked.

Then a sharp image filled my mind, causing me to gasp. I saw a mysterious black van, idling in the parking lot and I caught a glimpse of a blurry man in a suit, looking at me with a pair of binoculars! "Travis...there's a black van outside watching us." startled, I announced.

Travis cautiously walked to the window and peeked out the corner. As I watched him, shaking, I saw his face move slightly, as if it had slightly changed somehow. Only, as he turned back to me, his face looked normal so i shrugged it off as my imagination.

"Megan...your right" turning back to me, Travis said. "How did you know?"

"I have control of machines, right?" I asked. "Well, when I just thought of the outside I could suddenly see the hospital parking lot. It must have been the security camera. But what do we do? What did you hear?"

"It seems as if this 'good' Dr Hagen has an agenda of his own." looking at me Travis replied. "Also, the guys in the black van are watching this room with binoculars."

I began to shake more as I had seen that as well. "What- what do they want with us?" frightened, I asked.

"I'd say Hagen wants you for your ability to control machines." guessing, Travis replied. "I don't know if those guys in the van are working with that quack or with someone else but I do know that you're vulnerable here alone." he knotted his jaws in decision. "I'm staying here with you, just in case either one tries something."

"Travis, are you sure?" looking concerned, I asked. "They might come after you too."

"I have a few surprises of my own." smiling, Travis said. "Don't worry, I won't let you out of my sight, I promise."

I blushed slightly, a small grin forming onto my face. "Thanks, Travis."

Travis blushed with me, though I knew he tried to hide it. "You're welcome."

Fortunately, before things got too uncomfortable, mom and Dr Stone returned to the room and I shouted, "There's someone watching this room!"

Thomas ran to the window and looked out to see the black van before it casually pulled away, out of the parking lot, before he turned back to me. "Whoever they were, they're gone now." he said.

"Just in case, I'd like to stay with Megan tonight." offering, Travis said. "She and I have been friends since kindergarten."

"That's fine with me, so long as you mom doesn't mind ." smiling, mom replied. "I'd feel safer, knowing a strong guy like you was with her."

Travis blushed more at that, making him look really cute. I fought the urge to giggle. "Thank you." he said. "I'll call my mom now."

With that, he pulled out his cell phone...
13111212.title: Being Watched.

131112121.content:
I listened, curious and was surprised to hear the entire conversation between Travis and his mom...

"Hello?"

"Hi mom."

"Travis dear! How is your little girlfriend?"

"MOM! She is not my girlfriend!"

"But you said you had a crush on this girl..."

"Mom...I have a crush on her. That doesn't mean she likes me back."

"Okay dear, whatever you say. Now, why are you calling?"

"Megan is getting some unwanted attention from this weird doctor and these men in a black van. I'm telling you that I'm staying over to watch over her." There was a dead silence on the other line. I was worried, "Mom...?"

"Travis...oh yes....it's fine honey. I have to go now, bye!"

The call ended before he could say goodbye. "Something must have spooked his mom." I thought.

Travis put his cellphone away and turned. Mom and I both looked at him, worried. Although mom had only heard part of the conversation, I heard it all. I think he realized we suspected something was wrong. He blushed and quickly left the room. "I think he really likes you." teasing, mom said.

"Mom, really?" I asked. "Now is not the time to play cupid, okay?"

Minutes later, Dr. Stone entered the room with a team of nurses rolling in another patient bed. "I said I didn't need to be 'admitted'," timidly, Travis said, "Dr Stone insisted, though."

"If Megan is being watched, as you two described, Travis will likely be watched as well." said Stone. "I will be contacting your mother tonight and alert her of the situation."

Later, finally, alone, I turned to the camera. "Please turn off." I thought.

To my surprise, the camera obeyed, the recoding light going off immediately. "I think we can talk now. I want to tell you what happened when you heard, or rather, read my screams on my chat page." I said, turning to Travis. "I had just woken up from a rough night, having a splitting headache, and saw that my teeth were covered in metal."

"That's a scary wake up call." wincing, Travis said.

I nodded. "I screamed, terrified, then became more frightened as every phone in the house started ringing and someone began to pound onto the front door. I did not know then that my screams were echoing over every electronic device within a hundred yards of my home."

Travis winced again. "I'd be terrified in that situation too."

We then began to tell each other about our lives only I sensed that Travis was holding something back, something that was troubling him. He seemed relieved that I was able to turn off the camera. I didn't tell him but it was creeping me out seeing it follow my every move. Nightfall soon came and Travis became exhausted and was soon asleep. As I watched him sleep, I turned to the camera. "Please help me look after my friend." I whispered.

Hours later, in the middle of the night, I woke up to hear Travis crying in his sleep, tossing and turning as if to escape an unknown threat. I became worried when I saw the tears in his eyes and the pain on his face. Then I saw it, his hands had become more like paws and on his head... were a pair of cat ears!

"Travis...Travis!" I called, lightly shaking him. "Travis wake up!"

Travis opened his eyes and saw me. "Travis...what happened to you?" concerned, I asked.

Travis looked at his hands, or rather, paws then reached up to his head and felt his new ears. With an expression of fear, he grabbed a mirror and looked into it, he was an anthro-cat. Crying, he dropped the mirror and pushed me away as if he feared his own reflection. I watched him quickly hide behind the bed in the corner. I was clear to me that he was in panic. "So... he has a power of his own." I thought. "Just like me, he fears it."

"Travis...who did this to you...?" I asked, drawing closer to him.

"My parents...my parents sort of...made me..." not looking at me, Travis stammered, crying.

"Made...you...?" I asked, startled.

Travis shook his head. "I don't want to explain it...you would only..."

I sighed and I approached him, making my footfalls heard so not to frighten him more. "What would I do...?" I asked with concern.

"You would think I'm a freak." replied Travis, shaking. "I'm nothing but a freak..."

"Travis....you feel like an alien...like me..." I said, trying to be comforting.

Travis turned around, slightly surprised. I guess he was surprised more by the fact that I was not running away or screaming, rather, I was staying and moving closer to him. "But Megan...I don't think your a freak." he said.

"Nor do I." smiling, I replied. I began to scratch his head, between his new cat like ears. "You look cute."

Travis seemed to calm right down. In fact, he seemed to really enjoy my scratching. He leaned his head closer to me as a small purr escaped his lips.

"He's just like a big kitten." I thought, giggling.

Travis, hearing me giggle, covered his mouth and pulled his head back. "I didn't mean to do that!" he said quickly.

"Admit it Travis" I said with a smirk, "You enjoyed it."

Travis blushed before he nodded, admitting that he did enjoy it. We stood up together and he gave me a warm hug.

"Thanks Megan...I should have told you earlier." he said.

"His furry body... so warm..." realizing what I was thinking, I blushed brightly as I felt his tail starting to wrap around my leg. "Oh... wow..."

My senses were exploding and I think Travis noticed it as he quickly changed back to his human form. When we broke the hug, I felt a bit sad, almost robbed. Without thinking, I said, "Aw....did you have to change back so soon? You looked so cute! Could you change back for me... please?"
131112121.title: Travis talks with his mom.

1311121212.content:
Before Travis could respond, I felt a rush move through me and I screamed seeing my hand seemingly melt into a silver colored metal. The 'melting' quickly ran down my arm, taking the rest of my body. Panicked, I began to hyperventilate, feeling my entire body turning numb.

Okay, I'm changing! I'm changing!" panicked, Travis said. "Calm down!"

As Travis quickly returned to his cat like form, I took up the mirror Travis had dropped to find that I had become like a featureless mannequin, fresh from the factory. Only, before I could react, I started to change again. Pointed ears formed onto my head as my face formed cat like features and a tail grew from my lower back and my hands took on a more paw like form before the 'liquid' receded back into my pours. Within seconds, a stunned cat like girl was staring back at me in the mirror. Other than feeling exhausted, I seemed to be perfectly fine.

"What... happened?" touching my new face, I asked.

I turned to Travis to find him back in his cat like form, looking at me with a surprised look on his face. Finally, he smiled at me, blushing. "You look cute, Megan." looking at me, he said.

"Not bad yourself, Travis." blushing at his compliment, I said. "But how did this happen?"

"I think I can explain." entering the room, a man's voice said.

I turned to see my dad. He was a tall and muscular 33 year old man with short sand blond hair and blue eyes. "Daddy!" running to him, I yelled, crying. "Do you know what's happening to me?"

Dad nodded before turning to Travis. "I can see you too are unique, Mr. Greenway." looking at him, he said. "You may stay but I urge you to keep what you hear silent."

"What am I, dad?" near the verge of tears, I asked.

Dad knelled down to my level, smiling. "You got one power from me, the other from your mother." looking into my eyes, he explained. "Remember that series you like so much in Teen Detectives magazine?"

I nodded, remaining silent, not knowing where dad was going with his explanation. He chuckled, giving Travis a knowing smile. "I was Sam, the ace driver of the Problem Child Gang."

If my eyes had widened any further, they would have popped out of my head. "What!?!"

Dad smiled, turning to Travis. "Your mother was Crystal, our mysterious informant." looking at him, he said. "We did not know she was an unwilling worker for the Agency but we always considered her a member of the team."

"How did I get these powers, dad?" confused, I asked. "I don't remember reading about you having... this."

"Simple." turning back to me, dad said. he changed into the liquid metal form I had become earlier. "I'm an alien."

Both mine and Travis' jaws dropped as I returned to my normal form and fainted.
1311121212.title: I change instead!

13111212121.content:
I don't remember being placed onto the bed but I was awakened by the sound of an animal growling. I opened my eyes, startled to see four men enter the dark room. I froze, terrified as three of them had guns and the fourth had a long needle on a syringe! The four men froze as well, hearing the growl, I hoped was coming from Travis.

"What is that, a growl?" asked one man, curious.

"There isn't any animals in here...is there?" asked the second.

"It sounds like a wolf..." remarked the third.

"NO MAN! Don't say that! I'm terrified of wolves..." stated the fourth, shaking slightly.

"Keep it together, you morons." snapped the one who seemed to be the leader. "It's just the pipes."

Then, I saw Travis charge from the closet, ripping the door off its hinges in a wolf like form. He pounced onto the one holding the needle, knocking it out of his grasp. I winced, hearing the man's rip crack under the blow as he passed out from the wind being knocked out of him. Before the others could react, Travis jumped up onto his two feet and quickly punched out the other two then pinned the fourth, the leader, against the wall, forcing him to drop his weapon. Growling in his face, he demanded, "Who sent you?!"

The man spat in Travis' face, "There's my answer, fleabag!"

"Big mistake." wincing, I thought.

Travis wiped the spit away from his face and then bared his teeth. He loudly roared in his face, snapping his teeth an inch from his eyes. The sound sent chills down my spine, making me very much afraid. Only it apparently had the same effect on the man as Travis then easily lifted him off the floor with one hand.

"Listen and listen good... human." he growled, "You tell your boss that Megan Connors is off limits." with a wolf like growl, he added, "LEAVE THE GIRL ALONE!"

He then threw him away from out of the room like a rag doll. His body flew out the door, slamming into the outside hall, cracking the wall. By this time, I was sitting up and I watched the man slide to the floor unconscious just as Travis let out a wolf like howl. It was a haunting howl, making me want to run for my very life but I reminded myself that Travis most likely saved my life. He then turned to find me awake. I was sitting on the bed, against the wall, shivering. I was scared of him, due to his display of power, but I was more frightened of the men who tried to take me away.

"It's still me inside, Megan." assuring me, he said. "I would never hurt you."

"I was afraid of the men... not you." still shaking, I replied.

Then, Travis paused, his ears twitching as he were listening to something. Suddenly, he quickly took me into his arms and held me tight. "We need to go, now!" frantic, he said.

Running to the open window, he jumped through. As we fell, he became human again, for a second, then changed into a human like eagle. He held onto me with his talon like feet, being very gentle, and landed on the sidewalk after carefully dropping me. Once he was back in human form again, I gasped inside, seeing how very pale he appeared.

"That shape-shifting must take a lot out of him." I thought. "Maybe that's why I feel so weak too."

Then, a gray, futuristic looking car pulled up. The doors automatically opened and Mr. Connors voice echoed from within. "Megan, Travis, get in!"
13111212121.title: kidnap attempt!

131112121211.content:
I sat nervously in the passenger seat while Travis took the driver's side. We both let out a yelp as the seat belts crossed over us on their own before the car took off on its own. I was tempted to hang on to the door but hesitated. Dad's laughter echoed through the radio speakers. "You're not touching any part of me, sweetie." amused, he said. "This is the family car, I simply added my own essence to it."

"You're possessing the car?" morbidly impressed, Travis asked. "Nice."

"That's a crude way of putting it, Travis." chuckling, dad said. "As accurate as any, I guess." he then turned serious as the car screamed around a corner. "Listen you two, things are heating up faster than I had feared. Sykes is back in town and the Agency has resurfaced."

I gasped. "That organization existed!?" stunned, I asked.

"Everything in that story existed, Megan." flatly, dad replied. "I'm guessing those who tried to kidnap you were hired thugs from Sykes or someone else. Most likely to test your powers, search for weaknesses."

"What makes you think it wasn't this agency?" curious, Travis asked.

"If it was the Agency, both of you would be unconscious, bound and gagged, on your way to parts unknown." seriously, Sam replied. "They are ruthless professionals in the field of espionage and assassination."

I gulped at that. "What are we to do?" frightened, I asked.

"The original members of the gang are holding a meeting." the car speeding onto the freeway, dad replied. "With a little luck, we'll get there before it ends and we can formulate a plan." he paused. "Travis, you and I need to have a serious talk about your power."

"What about my power?" turning to the radio, Travis asked. "I saved Megan's life back there!"

"I am grateful for that, believe me." quickly, dad replied. "Look at your face in the mirror, though. You are white as a sheet and you were not changed for all that long."

I became worried for Travis, noticing how pale he seemed. "What's wrong with him, dad?" fearful, I asked.

"Like you, Travis is just discovering his power, honey." gently, dad replied. "You both need to learn how to control it so you do not push yourselves beyond your normal limits." pausing, he added, "Megan, I would not shape shift too often."

"Why?" curious, I asked.

"The human body is not designed for it and you are half human." morbidly serious, dad replied. "Each time you change, you risk injuring yourself. After you you fainted, I did a quick scan with a med-wand, an alien device."

"What did you find?" nervous, I asked.

"You had pulled every muscle and tendon in your body." darkly, dad replied. "I's refrain from changing shapes unless absolutely necessary, young lady."

"What are you suggesting we do?" curious, Travis asked.

"I can offer you a learning tool, used by my people to learn control." kindly, dad replied. "However, it was not built with humans in mind so it may 'misfire' from time to time, giving you a form you do not have in mind."

With that, the middle compartment opened and an odd bracelet rose from within.

"It may appear simple in design but, I assure you, it is more complex than you can imagine." seriously, dad said. "Travis, I urge you to trust me and wear the bracelet. Still, as it was not designed for humans, I will not force you."

I watched, uncertain as Travis made his decision...
131112121211.title: continue.

1311121212112.content:
Travis looked at the strange device, pondering. "What about Megan?" curious, he asked.

"I have one for her but its too dangerous for her to use that power too often." kindly, dad replied. "This is just in case we do not meet again."

"Are you sure it doesn't come in a necklace?" joking, Travis asked.

Dad chuckled, "I realize a bracelet may be a bit 'girly' but I assure you it is helpful."

I smiled at that then watched as Travis took the device. Only I was surprised when he put it into his pocket instead of putting it on. "Thanks for the device, Mr. Connors." politely, he said. "But I will not use it just yet. I think I will see how training on my own goes first."

"Understandable... but just promise me you will not lose it." firmly, dad said. "If the Agency gets that device and learns from it, they could produce a device that would allow them to control your forms."

Travis nodded. "I promise."

With that the car suddenly stopped. "We're here, get out" dad demanded.

Travis and I got out at the same time and met on the sidewalk. We took notice to the front of the car and saw a silver liquid-like substance flow out of the grill. It flowed into a puddle that started to rise. As it rose, features like arms and legs appeared. Then, his head along with clothing features appeared as well. Lastly, the silver color drained from his body. The puddle formed into Megan's father.

"That is so cool!" smiling, Travis said.

"Yes, I got a lot of that the first time" he replied. "But... Travis, do you have any other clothes?"

Travis was confused for a second but looked down. His shirt and shorts were still clinging to his body, but they were in shreds. Most of his upper body was revealed, showing a surprisingly amount of muscle. He turned from me, catching me staring at his muscular frame. I guess it was to hide the fact he was blushing.

"Sorry, but no" he replied, "I left my pack at home."

Suddenly, I grabbed his arm, "Don't worry Travis, you look fine to me."

He blushed at that while we headed to the door. Dad knocked then waited for a reply.
1311121212112.title: He politely declines.

13111212121121.content:
"Who is it?!" a loud from voice yelled.

"Sam Connors and company." replied dad. "Someone tried to take my daughter, Ted. I have one of her friends with me, we need to talk."

The door opened and we stepped in. I was surprised by the amount of people inside. There was Garth and Grace, Alyssa, Caitlin was even there! I wondered why they had invited Caitlin Spencer but I decided it best not to mention it. Two adults approached us, the one who approached Travis seemed to be Mexican in ethnicity.

The woman who walked up to me gently grasped my arm. "Easy, Megan" she said, "You better sit down a bit, dear."

"I-I'm fine" trying to sound confident, Travis said.

"Typical boy." sighing, I thought. "Always trying to play the tough guy."

"The hell you are, Chico" the woman with Travis said, sternly. "You look like a ghost, sit down and rest."

"I said I'm fine. I just need to catch my breath." defensively, Travis said.

Only the woman was not hearing it from him and firmly said, "Sit... down."

I've never met someone who was so firm. Also, the expression on her face told all she was not in the mood to play. "Y-Yes ma'am." sheepishly, Travis said.

"It's good to see you again, old friend" said the man I recognized as police chief Ted Jones. "Any idea who tried to kidnap your daughter and her friend?"

"They weren't professionals" dad said quickly, "I'm guessing they were sent by Sykes." dad motioned towards Travis and I. "These two are just now discovering their 'gifts'. Megan's gift left her a bit shaken, same with Travis."

"What can you do?" Caitlin asked lying on the couch. "Mine is mental powers. Though I kind of over did it a few minutes ago." I noticed her wince and wondered if that is what I had done when I freaked out in the beginning.

"Megan can control machines and transform to some extent... you know why." dad said motioning me to remain quiet. "Travis has the ability to become any animal, including Anthros and mythological creatures." he then sighed, turning to us. "I know you two have a voice of your own but you are both seriously drained from the kidnap attempt, rest all you can as you will be training very soon."

"Were they hurt?" asked Lyssa, concerned.

"Travis pushed himself to save Megan from being taken. Megan did the same only it was from her powers going a bit nuts on her."

"Like mine did at the beginning, turning into a behemoth." Garth said slightly shaken. "My power is super strength."

"Just like your father." dad said smiling. then he turned serious, "We need a plan and time is something we don't have a lot of, we need to act, now."

What do you suggest?" asked a woman.
13111212121121.title: A meeting.

131112121211211.content:
"To bring you two up to speed, I'll repeat what I said to the others before you arrived." seriously, Geo said. He took a breath. "As you all know, most of us were members of the Problem Child Gang you two like to read about. Our last mission was against a man named Sykes who we believed was the bottom of a drug and weapon running cartel." Geo sighed. "Unfortunately, he turned out to be just the opposite. He was a war monger drug lord, the top dog of the cartel."

My face and Travis' paled, hearing that. "Was it this Sykes who caused you to stop crime fighting?" whispering, I asked. "Or was it the Agency?"

"The Agency was after Sykes, just as we were." seriously Ted replied. "Sykes knew they were there and that we were hunting him down. He blew the building he was held up in, just as he made his escape." he shook his head. "We barely escaped with our lives only to find the Agency became... interested in us."

"What do you mean?" shaking, I asked.

"As I explained earlier, we had our talents." looking at us, dad said. "The Agency brainwashed kids with talents, like your own, to use them, make them do their dirty work."

"Not only were we forced to flee for our lives from an exploding building, we had to escape the clutches of an underground terrorist organization." tearing up, Geo said. "We thought we were invincible, we were not. We thought this was behind us... its been chasing us all along."

Everyone managed to stay calm we were able to learn most of everyone's name. "We need to get everyone started on training the sooner the better" said Geo. "I know of such a place, the original group headquarters near the coast. It's only about twenty miles from here."

"I thought our headquarters were destroyed by the Agency days after we escaped Sykes' death trap in Rome" confused, Sarah said. "They completely burned the summer home mansion to the ground, trying to get to us."

"That was the sister mansion in England" countered Geo. "I'm talking about the original headquarters, here in the States, where we first starting training to hone our skills while not gallivanting around the world. It's old but its still standing and we can go there in a second's notice."

"The kids will still need individual training" Sarah said worried. "Also, their skills are far more advanced than ours were."

"They will get individual training. You see, I had a feeling we had not seen the last of the Agency so I had an underground... err... vacation village constructed in a cave system for all of us to run to with our families, just in case."

Creepy... wincing, I thought.

"All of the training facilities we need are there?" asked a Ted.

Geo nodded, "It has everything we need to live and train for as long as it takes. We can live there or commute there. Its just an option."

"We'll commute there" said Ted. "The Agency will know we're onto them if we all suddenly vanish. Still, we must be on our toes at all times, understood!?" Everyone nodded and he turned back to Geo, "I will check the mansion and training facility to ensure its safe and secure. We can take two along with us."

I was both glad and sad that we were splitting up. I was happy because if one of us gets caught, the others can be notified. I was sad because I may never see Travis again.


Does Megan and Travis stay together?
131112121211211.title: continue.

1311121212112111.content:
After the meeting, dad took Travis by the arm and pulled him aside with me following. "You, your mother, and father will be staying with my family, I already called my wife, she is on her way to pick them up." firmly, dad said. "Our house is a fortress and its security system is... 'chuckle'... out of this world."

"Drool, dad, really drool." rolling my eyes, I thought. then I asked, "Really, dad?"

"Jokes aside, you also need training, both of you." turning serious, dad said. "Travis, you are far too slow in your animal transformations which makes you vulnerable. Megan, your ability to control machines is wild, unfocused, you need to work on that and fast."

I tried to ask how but Steve was already pushing us out of Mr Jones' house to the car. "I will drive you all the normal way to conserve energy." opening the driver's side door, he said. "Get in, we have little time."

Uncertain, I stepped into the back seat as Travis did the same. We blushed, meeting each other as dad chuckled. "Normally, you fight over sitting up front, Megan." buckling himself in, he said. "Interesting..."

I smiled, blushing with Travis. "Someone has to warn him who he is up against." teasing, I said.

Dad laughed as he started the engine and pulled away from the Jones residence. "Your training will start in the rumble room at the house." looking at Travis through the rear view, he said. "It's sort of like an arena where I privately train." he smiled, adding, "I am anxious to see what you two have on the ball."

Minutes later, we arrived home where dad immediately escorted us to his 'rumble room'. It was large with heavily padded walls, floor, and ceiling. Inside, I saw mom waiting for us with Mr and Mrs. Greenway.

"Anna, could you please escort our guests to the observation room?" politely, dad asked. "This training could get intense and I don't want anyone getting injured."

Mom nodded and led Mr and Mrs Greenway out.

Once the door closed with a soft click, Travis turned only to scream, seeing dad coming at him, his form quickly changing to that of a humanoid bear. Travis rose his arms to defend himself. I did the same only I was poised to jump between him and dad, not knowing my hands were glowing. Suddenly, dad stopped his advancement, a smile on his face as he chuckled. “Yeah, that’s going to scare a bear away.” Sarcastically, he said.

I struggled not to giggle, in spite of myself, as Travis blushed brightly. Then, dad said, “You need to learn how to think on your feet, young man.” He then pointed to me, my hands still raised; glowing. “Follow my daughter’s example.”

“I-Is this mom’s power?” seeing my hands glow for the first time, I asked.

“Your mother is a descendant of a legendary tribe of Amazon Women who possessed incredible strength, speed, and agility." returning to his human form, dad replied. “She did not gain those abilities but she has a certain worldly clairvoyance, allowing her to learn virtually anything very quickly. However, those Amazonian traits seemed to have trickled down to you, giving you short bursts of speed." he smiled. "Look at your hands, they are not glowing, they are creating heat from vibrating at high velocity; you could leave a person a very nasty burn by merely touching him right now.”

I gasped and focused on relaxing myself, eventually getting my hands to stop vibrating. “Dad, I could have hurt you.” Tearing up, I said. “I- I’m so sorry.”

Dad chuckled. “You forget my power, Megan.” smiling, he said. “You would not have harmed me in the slightest as I can withstand a lot more than you might think.” turning serious, he said, "Strange, but that power seems to only be focused in your hands."

"It's an Amazonian fighting technique." came mom's voice through a speaker. we all looked up to see mom and Mr and Mrs Greenway watching us through an observation window.

"What are you saying, mom?" curious, I asked.

"You are part alien, thus the ability to become living metal and shape shift for a short time." smiling, mom replied. "Then, you have a power from me, allowing you short bursts of speed." she sighed. "However, your true unique power seems to be a psychic link with machines, 'communicating' with them in a way."

*I have no control over what powers you develop.* reminded the voice of Zoe. Just as your mother's symbiont, Beta can not. I can only guess that the two powers together, made something truly unique.*

*Mom has a symbiont in her too?* surprised, I thought. *Why haven't I heard from her?*

*She speaks only when she feels the need is there.* serious, Zoe replied. *We usually always remain silent unless out host is in peril, your mother can handle herself.*

Dad smiled then turned back to Travis. “Shall we continue with your training?”

Travis nodded. “I’ll be ready for you this time.” confident, he said.

Dad laughed. “Will you now?” amused, he asked. “We’ll see…”

Before another move could be made, a television in the room turned itself on, revealing a test screen as a voice declared, 'Pueri Problementa!'

“Problem child in Latin.” Surprised, Travis said. “What does it mean?”

“It means someone has placed a note in the ‘blind post office’.” surprised as well, dad replied. “I’m surprised it’s still working after all this time.”

“It could be a trap.” serious, I mussed. “I mean, who would use the ‘blind post office’? Most people believe the group is just a legend.” then I thought, "A legend we are now living."

“That and the kidnap attempt earlier.” frowning, dad said. “You two are not ready to jump into anything right now.” he shook his head. “Forget you saw that.”

“But dad…” softly, I protested.
