“You are not ready, Megan!” sternly, dad said. “You both just discovered your powers and barely have a grasp as to how to control them!” he sighed. “Besides, if anything happens to either of you, I will never hear the end of it from either of your mothers. Let’s continue.”

“I can handle myself, sir.” with a sigh, Travis said.

“I promise you are not ready, young man.” firmly, dad said.

With that, he changed into a humanoid wolf before charging me. This time, Travis had his guard up and quickly changed to that of a humanoid wolf to match him. Only dad changed into a humanoid bear in a heartbeat and threw him like a rag doll into one of the padded walls. Travis moaned as I rushed over to him. I watched as his body reverted back to human before he looked up to to see dad standing over him.

“Did I make my point?” returning to human form, dad asked. “You must be focused at all times, in all situations if you want to stay alive, Travis. I learned this the hard way and it almost cost me my life. I will not allow you two to make the same mistake.” he then threw me a 'you too' look.

"So... what do we do?" uncertain, Travis asked.

Dad sighed. "We keep training." softly, he said. "Relax. You'll get your chance to bust a few bad guys soon enough."
1311121212112111.title: Yes, training begins.

13111212121121111.content:
I watched Travis stand up, ready to fight again. I knew he was in pain but I also knew that he believed he needed this. Dad did not move, he instead motioned to the next room, the door opening on its own. He walked out, but he stopped just before to motion us to follow him. "A thought came to me" turning to Travis, he said. "Your transformations seem very limited. You could have changed into something else to defeat me, but you went as a wolf."

Travis blushed. "Yeah..." he replied, "That was one of the ones I remember..."

"Exactly. I think that before we start training, and you decide to go out on your own, I believe that we should expand your Anthro profile to increase your capabilities."

Walking into the next room, we found a large indoor pool. I was confused to see a small control panel against the wall where there was not one the other day. Travis eyed the pool, surprised by its size.

Dad chuckled, seeing his expression. "It can be made larger as well as deeper."

He hit a button on the control panel and I watched, shocked, as the pool widened. "How can you build this stuff?"

"We're aliens Megan...this would be something easy." smiling, dad replied. "But the Greenways helped us with it."

Before another word could be said, dad snapped a spherical weight onto Travis' leg. He paused to look down at it before dad shoved him into the pool.

I screamed Travis' name before turning to dad, angry. "How could you!?!"

"He's fine, Megan." lightly, dad said. "Don't panic."

I turned back to the pool and watched the bubbles on the surface but got scared as they stopped. I was about to dive in after him when he suddenly broke the surface and climbed out, glaring at dad who gave me a 'I told you' look before I ran to him and pulled him into a warm hug. "Travis! When I saw the last air bubble, I thought...." my voice trailed off when I suddenly noticed that he had gills on the sides of his neck. "What..."

Travis felt his neck then turned to dad who seemed only slightly shocked. "Travis, could you always change parts of your body?" softly, he asked.

"I had these gills the first day." shaking his head, Travis replied. "I guess they just showed up because I needed them."

Dad was quiet for a while, making Travis and I concerned, even scared. "Megan take Travis on a tour of the house." smiling again, he said. "Take the rest of the day to relax, I have...an errand to run..."

The way dad said that worried me even more but I knew he had our best interests in mind and grabbed a towel to dry off a bit before turning to Travis. "So what should we do?" I asked.

"Why don't you pick?" suggested Travis.

I pondered for a bit before smiling. "I would like to..."
13111212121121111.title: continue.

choices: I stop before it goes too far.
131112121211211111.content:
"Well...you got to test out your powers...now I want to try mine." determined, I said.

Travis smiled and allowed me to lead him by the hand through my house. We needed to stop a few times to navigate through the maze of hallways and rooms but we soon reached the house gym. I smiled, seeing Travis' reaction to how big our house was. We walked into the large gym where I pointed out a properly sized indoor track. I smiled and ran over to it. "Come on Travis!"

Travis smiled, shifting his form into an Anthro cheetah before walking up onto the track. We both stood ready to run. "Are you sure you want to race me?" he asked, "I ran miles without even trying!"

"I am sure" focusing, I replied. "3...2...1...GO!"

I raced forward, trying not to let on that I was struggling as speed was really not my thing. Surprisingly, I was half way around the track before Travis caught up with me. Seeing him, I dug deep and I saw a slight glow before I punched into high speed and won the race in a heart beat! Although I felt like passing out, I still cheered, happy that I had won the race and hoped it would get Travis to train harder. Travis had fallen under the wake of my sudden burst of speed but he got up and ran over to me, blushing slightly. "I told you I would win!" happily, I said.

Travis sighed. "Yeah...you did..."

I looked at him, worried. "Hey, shouldn't you change back? Remember how your body was drained?"

"Well if I'm going to get used to changing, I should at least remain in a form for a while. Besides..." he bent down a bit so his face met mine, "I thought you liked me as an animal."

I giggled at that then began to scratch his head between his cat like ears. Travis instantly relaxed and began to purr. This made me giggle even more. "Different species...same result." I continued to scratch him between the ears, not knowing that I was getting him aroused. Had I know I was having that effect on him, I would have stopped a lot sooner but some lessons are learned the hard way....
131112121211211111.title: go for a run.

1311121212112111111.content:
I kept scratching between Travis' ears, knowing he was enjoying this but I did not imagine I was turning him on with it. "Megan...I think..." purring, he muttered.

I interrupted him by scratching under his chin, I did not realize that he was trying to warn me. His purrs grew loud, making me laugh but my laughter died in my throat as he suddenly growled at me. I had not expected that but I felt slightly relieved when he rubbed his head against mine, as if wanting more. I did not know exactly what it meant so I didn't do anything about it until Travis then advanced his entire cat like body towards me. "What is he trying to do!?" startled, I thought.

I pushed him away, saying, "Okay Travis, that's..."

Travis growled at me again, more deeply this time, startling me. "What's gotten into him!?" worried, I thought. "He's acting more like an animal than a man."

I looked into his eyes and began to slowly back away, seeing only animalistic lust, he was no longer thinking but moving on instinct alone! His growls became deeper as he fell onto all fours, approaching me with, I believed, all intentions to make love. I now regretted petting and scratching him in the first place as I had apparently sent him the wrong signals. "Travis please...it's me..." backing away, I pleaded.

Travis roared as if to silence me then pounced onto me in a way to force himself onto me. I feared getting raped by him, something he would greatly regret later as he was obviously not in his right mind. He took a quick swipe with his paw, tearing my tank top apart, revealing my bra underneath. I looked at him in fear, knowing I would have to stop him. "Travis..." fearful, I warned. "I-I don't want t-to hurt you..."

Travis swiped at me again, this time making a set of deep wounds into my shoulder. I let out a low scream of pain and, through instinct alone, threw my fist into him again and again, not knowing I was hitting him over a hundred times a second, sending him into convulsions. I only stopped when he stopped moving and slipped into unconscious. He was still in anthro form but no longer a threat to me.

No sooner I pushed Travis off of me, dad ran into the room and immediately examined my wounds; they were not serious but enough to make dad worry. "Megan! Are you okay?!"

I didn't answer him, my mind was on Travis who had just attacked me, falling victim to the instincts of the animals he becomes. I teared up, looking at the deep bruises on his shoulder and realized that I must have caused them. "I guess we're even." shaking, I thought.
1311121212112111111.title: Travis goes ferrel.

13111212121121111111.content:
Dad took out some strange device from his shirt pocket and waved it over my bloody shoulder and the bleeding stopped immediately, along with the pain. He then took a clean cloth from another pocket and wiped away the blood, revealing scars rather than gashes. "Better?" softly, he asked.

"Better." nodding, I said. "Thank you." I then turned to Travis. "I believe he fell victim to the instincts of the animal he had become. It's not all his fault, I gave him mixed signals by scratching his ears and chin."

"Perhaps." sighing, dad said. "Still, he needs a good scare or rather a good scar to remind him of his place when around my little girl."

"Don't hurt him." tearing up, I begged. "Please..."

Suddenly, Travis jolted up and turned to me, looking worried. His worry turned to horror as he saw the scars on my shoulder. my bloody shoulder. Then, I saw the scars. I....I did those...

I couldn't get myself to answer as I was worried what my father was about to do to him. Once Travis took notice of him, I could tell he was worried as well. Any father would be furious if someone attacked their daughter, regardless of the situation behind it. I watched in horror as dad flexed his hand before long steel claws grew from his fingernails. Before either I or Travis could react to this, dad slashed part of his face and dug deep wounds into his chest! Travis yelled out in pain before returning to his human form. Dad then quickly waved the same strange device over the wounds, healing them instantly. I do not think Travis noticed but, like myself, he was left with the scars from the attack. This sent a slight feeling of relief through me as dad showed compassion by sparing him from any lasting pain or suffering.

He then looked him in the eye, anger clear on his face. "If you can't control yourself, find another girlfriend!" growling, dad said. "Let those scars on your chest be a reminder!"

He walked away right after that and I ran to him, worried for him. Only he turned away from me as if frightened of me, or rather, my father. This hurt me more than the slash to my shoulder but I stayed near him.. I loved him.

"Megan...I-I'm dangerous..." tearfully, Travis said. "You're not safe around me..."

He stood up, trying to get away from me but I quickly moved to face him. "Travis, your not dangerous..." softly, I said. "Your just..."

"No, Megan, listen! I made scars on your shoulder! And that was all from an ear scratch!" tears falling, Travis cried. He shifted quickly back into a cheetah, turning from me. "I know we weren't dating, but we can't be together if this is what's going to happen."

He then ran out of the room, sobbing. This broke my heart but it also filled my mind with resolve. I started to run after him but stopped to find dad standing in my way. "Consider carefully what you might face if you go after him, Megan." calmly, he said. "You got hurt once, I do not wish you to get hurt again."

"Travis has a power that is hard to control. dad," patiently, I said, "just like me."

"I can teach you how to control your power, Megan." looking at me, dad said.

"You can teach Travis too." annoyed, I fired back. "I love him dad!"

Dad and I both fell silent to that as I had just confessed my feelings for him. I stared at dad, blushing but, to my surprise, he slowly nodded. "If you feel that way, go after him." softly, he said. "However, I will not tolerate any further loss of control, he must learn to hold back his animal instincts."

With that, he stepped aside and I ran out to search for him. It did not take long as I was able to see through the 'eyes' of the security cameras throughout the house. I reached the room he was hiding in and the door instantly unlocked for me, allowing me to enter.

"I locked the door for a reason..." coldly, Travis said.

"Yeah, but these are electronic locks." smiling, I replied.

I took a few steps closer then stopped, remembering dad's words before I searched for him. "What's wrong...?" softly, Travis asked. "Afraid I will attack again...?"

"No, I'm afraid dad will attack you again." darkly, I thought. "Travis..."

"Megan...just...just..." Travis started to cry again.

That was when I knelt down and wrapped my arms around him. Travis managed to turn, "Megan...what are you...?" his words froze in his mouth as I smiled at him.

"Travis listen to me" kindly, I said. "You are not a monster. You may be dangerous, but you are not a monster. You are a sweet boy that will protect me from everything. There will be a few scrapes and bruises along the way, but that is what makes a relationship strong. I...I like you...and I don't want to lose you."

I then began to cry myself, frustrated that I could not speak how I truly felt. Soon, Travis cried with me, returning the hug. I loved him with all my heart and I hoped he felt the same way, though I sensed he was just as reluctant to confess...
13111212121121111111.title: An eye for an eye, scar for a scar.

choices: Skip to first day of school.
131112121211211111111.content:
Suddenly, a deep growl filled the room and I shot a look at Travis who blushed. "Wasn't entirely me..." looking embarrassed, he said. "That was...my stomach..."

I giggled, feeling relieved. "Well then Splice, time to eat..."

I helped Travis up before we walked out of the room. On the way to the kitchen Travis fingered his eye and I saw that dad had nicked his eye lid when he scratched him. Fortunately, it was completely healed as well. As soon as we entered the kitchen we both froze, seeing dad there. He turned, seeing me beside Travis but did not make any moves, he just looked at us. Travis, as if to appease any anger, quickly shifted from that to a wolf, going into human form for a second first. Again, dad just stood there, staring at him. "Why are you in anthro form?" he asked.

Travis gulped, nervous, but stood his ground. "Uh...I figured that...uh...if I stay like this from time to time, my body could be used to it. And I figured I might as well try to unlock a new form too..."

Dad smiled, surprising me. "Smart move." he said.

Travis let out a loud sigh of relief but froze when he heard dad was not finished. "But since we're telling each other things, I need to tell you two something. Just because your here and on the team doesn't mean you won't leave your normal lives. You two have school tomorrow."

"WHAT?!" we both shouted.

"Dad! It was never mentioned in the comics about you guys still going to school!" protesting, I said.

"Do you think it would have been a good comic if it did?" bemused, dad asked. I huffed, admitting defeat as dad then said, "You two better rest up today..."

"Could you at least show us how to work this kitchen?" Travis asked.

Dad smiled.
131112121211211111111.title: A return to normal life.

1311121212112111111111.content:
The following morning, mom gave me a quick kiss before dad escorted us out into the car. "I want you all to promise me not to use your gifts in public." serious, dad said as he buckled his seat belt. "We all used disguises and false names to hide our identity, you two have nothing yet."

"I give you my word, sir." nodding, Travis said.

"I promise, daddy." serious, I said.

Dad nodded and started the car before driving out towards the school. Only, as the school came into view, he slammed on the breaks, startling us both. Before either of us could say a word, dad sharply ordered, "Megan... binoculars, NOW!!"

Frightened by dad's sudden urgency, I obeyed immediately and got the small binoculars out of the glove box and handed them to him who brought them to his eyes, looking out the windshield. A moment later, a deep growl emitted from deep in his throat, making both Travis and I shiver. "That's Clarence Mayweather on that roof top!" anger in his voice, dad said. "He's the bastard who put Sarah Vance into a wheelchair!" he growled again, adding, "He has a rifle in his hands!"

Both Travis and I gasped, wondering if there was anything we could do to help. Then dad turned to us both sharply. "We need to make whoever he is targeting harder to zero in on." quickly, he said. "Travis, Megan, follow my lead!"

Travis and I nodded and scrambled out of the car before we all followed dad as he changed into a wolf. Travis followed suit with me right behind only I was having a hard time keeping my form together. Although I was dad's daughter, shift shaping was not my strong suit, it hurt to keep any form for too long. Still, we needed to provide a distraction so I followed Travis and dad as we charged the students, growling and howling at their heels. The students screamed and scattered in all directions as we ran about at random, trying to disperse the crowd. "This is getting harder by the second." gasping for air, I thought. "I'd better find a hiding place so I can change back and fast."

I did not see the drama that unfolded between Garth Jones and Travis as I found myself unable to move for a short time after becoming human again. "No more changing shapes for me." panting, I muttered. "It takes too much out of me." I turned to find that I had hidden behind a vending machine. "I could use a snack, maybe a chocolate bar."

The machine responded by dropping a chocolate bar into the vending tray and I slowly accepted it. "Thank you, kind machine." smiling, I said.

There were advantages to being able to 'talk' to machines....
1311121212112111111111.title: Skip to first day of school.

13111212121121111111111.content:
After I quickly ate the candy bar, I thanked the vending machine again and hurried across the street to the school to find that one of the windows on the first floor was completely shattered. At first, I thought that the gunman we saw had shot it out. Seeing Dad jump through the window, I feared someone might have gotten hurt and hurried over to see Travis standing face to face with Garth Jones. Both had impatient looks on their faces. "Garth Jones, the defender of the underdog." shaking my head, I muttered. "He must have gone after the 'big bad wolf' only to find out it was Travis."

"It's an emergency, Garth," as I stepped through the window, dad explained. "Clarence Mayweather is going to kill somebody."

I expected Garth to react but I surprised to see him relax, returning to normal size. "It's okay, Mr. Connors." taking a breath, he said. "It's being taken care of."

"What?" surprised, dad asked. we all turned to look at Mayweather's perch, where he was now being taken into custody. "How'd that happen so quickly?"

"You can thank Cait," Garth explained. "She got a vision warning of the attack, and alerted us. At least, she alerted the kids she'd already made mental contact with. Once Dad heard about it, he got a team ready to take him down."

Dad was still upset. "Why didn't I hear about this? And why would he send you kids to school, knowing what was going to happen?"

"Dad wanted him to think his plan was still going smoothly." calmly, Gar replied. "And we only had an hour's warning. Dad couldn't contact everybody, and still draw up a counterstrike."

Dad began to advisably relax. "I guess that makes sense."

"You said Mayweather is the gunman?" curious, Gar asked.

Dad nodded. "We'd had run-ins with him as the Problem Child Gang. More recently, he tried to kill Sarah Vance, but only succeeded in putting her in a wheelchair."

Gar grinned. "Dad's been looking for him since he escaped. He may want to conduct that interrogation personally."

Everybody else started to calm down, but I heard another voice, saying, Don't give him the chance. Run him down. Finish him off.

I shivered slightly, hearing the voice and wondered where it was coming from. "Something tells me this is just the beginning." worried, I thought.

With that, I walked into the school with the other students and I reported to my homeroom. I found it ironic that all the other kids involved in the new Problem Child Gang were there only I did not see Travis, making me worry...
13111212121121111111111.title: Entering homeroom.

131112121211211111111111.content:
To my great relief, Travis walked in and took his seat next to mine just before the bell rang. "You're cutting it a little close, did something happen?" whispering, I asked.

"Just a quick talk with my dad." lightly, Travis whispered. "I'll tell you all about it later."

"You dad was here?" surprised, I asked.

The conversation ended as our homeroom teacher, Mrs. Barns stood up to face the class. "Good morning, class," politely, she said. "My name is Ms. Barns. I'll be your homeroom teacher this year. This will be my first teaching position, so I'm starting out much like you are. My hope is that I will help you to grow into the best people you can be, and that this experience will make me a better teacher in the years ahead."

"It's been an experience even before school." ruefully, I thought. "I loved reading about the adventures of the Problem Child Gang but I never dreamed I'd be living them."

I discretely looked about the room and saw that my friends, the kids of the original gang, all seemed as worried and nervous as I was and began to wonder what was in store for us in the future...
131112121211211111111111.title: continue.

1311121212112111111111111.content:
Shortly after leaving homeroom, I was confronted by an upperclassmen student who handed me a request slip from the office. "Two guys from some federal agency want to talk to you about something." with a concerned look, he said. "Something about them spells trouble, be careful."

I nodded then pulled out my cellphone and dialed a number. "Daddy, we might have trouble." I said. I explained the situation and dad promised to be at the school within five minutes.

I took my time
to walk down to the office, hoping to buy dad enough time to reach the school before something happened. When I finally walked in, I immediately noticed two tall, well built men in black suits with black jackets over them and dark sunglasses covering their eyes. Alarms went off in my mind as I suspected they might be from the Agency. Reacting to those emotions, the cameras in the room all turned to our direction while every piece of equipment, copiers, the PA mic, everything electronic turned on.

"Good morning, Miss Connors." politely, the first man said with a slight nod. "I am special agent Turner and this is special agent Stonewall." the two briefly flashed a badge for me to see. "I'm sure you are wondering why we have asked to see you but rest assured you are not in any legal trouble."

"Exactly why are you here to see me?" nervous, I asked.

"I understand you are nervous." discretely eying the room, Stonewall said. "I would be too in your position. However, we would rather discuss this in private. There is an empty room right across the hall and we have been given permission to use it for our talk."

I knew that the room across the hall was bare, except for a few tables and chairs. There were no cameras or any piece of electronic equipment, no way to call for help if I fall into trouble. "I'm not going anywhere with anyone who does not properly identify who they are and who the represent." firmly, I replied. "You claim to be special agents with flashy badges but are you FBI? CIA... the Agency?"

Turner sighed. "We work for an American government organization that works hand in hand with both the FBI and CIA." patiently, he said. "We would like to talk to you about your father."

"Why not talk to me in person, rather than harass my daughter?" entering the room, dad asked. "What business do you have with her?"

"There are a number of people who are interested in her, shall we say, unique skills, Mr Connors." looking at dad, Stonewall said. "Did you seriously think you could keep those gifts of hers hidden forever?"

Curious and worried looks were forming on the secretary and principal's faces as dad's face slowly turned red with impatience. Dad was well known in town for his many connections. "You will write a hall pass for my daughter to return to her studies." sternly, dad said to the office secretary. "I will be having a talk with these two gentlemen outside."

"It would be best if we discuss this in the room across the hall." patiently, Turner said. "While there is still time to talk."

"Daddy..." fearful, I said.

"Very well." an icy anger in his voice, dad said. "We'll talk in the room across the hall."

Dad ushered me out of the room then opened the door. "After you, gentlemen."

The men walked inside the room and dad...
1311121212112111111111111.title: An unexpected visit.

13111212121121111111111112.content:
"Stay here." firmly, dad said. "I'll only be a minute."

With that, dad walked into the room and closed the door, pulling down a shade so I could not see what was going on. I tried to listen, curious of what was going on but I heard nothing. One minute passed, then two, then three before the door finally opened and dad walked out, looking somewhat pale. "Sweetie, we are going to have to go with these gentlemen." softly, he said. "It seems that Sykes has acquired a number of alien technology."

"What!?" shocked, I whispered. "How? When?"

"I don't know, Megan." touching my shoulder, dad replied. "Regardless, if this is true, we are ill equipped to deal with such a threat."

"What makes them think they would fair any better?" eying the two agents, I asked.

"We would not fair any better." honestly, Turner replied. "We need each other to deal with this." pausing, he added, "The original group opened the government's eyes to a threat we did not see. Let us work together to stop them once and for all."

I turned to dad, worried. "Are you sure about this, dad?" wincing, I asked.

"We were nearly killed the last time we locked horns with both Sykes and the Agency." serious, dad replied. "If Sykes did get his hands on alien tech, we are going to need all the help we can get."

Albeit reluctantly, I nodded. "Alright, I'll go with you but be warned," sternly, I said, "I am never alone."

"Then you and our commander will have a lot in common." cryptically, Stonewall replied. the then pulled a two way radio from his jacket. "We have convinced Miss Connors; any luck with Mr. Greenway?"

"Negative." came a disappointed reply. "However, if he sees Megan leaving with you, he may follow."

"Understood." with a nod, Stonewall said. "We are leaving with Miss Connors and her father now."

"You- You are going to use me to trap Travis!?" stunned, I asked.

"I doubt any trap will hold your friend for long." serious, Turner replied. "He is reluctant; perhaps because our associates used a tactic he did not take kindly to." he shrugged. "We are only hoping he will follow so he can see with his own eyes what we are trying to accomplish."

I sighed, hearing that. "Okay..." ice in my voice, I said. "Only, if this is a trick or a trap, my boyfriend and I will make you regret it."

Turner nodded. "I have no doubt you will." he said.
13111212121121111111111112.title: followed them inside alone.

131112121211211111111111121.content:
"Just one precaution." quickly, dad said. "Honey, this won't hurt a bit."

Before I could react, dad turned himself into his 'liquid metal' form and surrounded my body like a second skin! At first, I was startled, even disturbed, knowing that my dad was literally all over me. Then, I heard his voice in my head. "I am surrounding you in the form of living energy." telepathically, he said. "My body is not physically touching you in any way, shape, or form."

Hearing that made me feel a little better but I was still worried as the two men each took hold of one of my wrists and escorted me towards the exit. If either of them were to suddenly try anything, dad could get hurt. What was worse, we walked right into Travis' path. I threw him a pleading look, hoping he would not jump into 'hero' mode, making things hard for him. Only, he seemed to take my look as a call for help and quickly jumped into our path. "Stop right there!" with a growl in his voice, Travis commanded. "Where are you taking my girlfriend!?"

I opened my mouth to speak but Stonewall gave my wrist a slight twist. It was not enough to hurt me but more than enough to get my attention. "Say nothing, Miss Connors." quickly, he warned.

"This does not concern you, kid." sternly, Turner said. "Step aside."

"Not happening!" fangs growing into place, Travis growled. "Let her go... NOW!"

"We don't have time for this." flatly, Stonewall said.

With that, he nodded to Turner who quickly drew a strange gun like device and fired it at Travis before he could react. A flash of light hit Travis, throwing him off his feet and through the exit door, throwing it clean off its hinges! I screamed his name, worried that he was seriously hurt. Seconds later, as Turner and Stonewall dragged me out, cars were racing towards the school from all directions. They were reacting to my fear and anger, rushing to my aid.

"Calm yourself, Miss Connors." firmly, Turner said. "The weapon we used is nonlethal, your boyfriend is only stunned, he will be fine."

Reluctantly, I mentally gave the stand down command and the cars that were racing to the school came to a halt in the streets. Only their engines were still running, I was not born a fool. Once the cars had stopped, Turner and Stonewall half dragged and half carried me towards a strange helicopter that did not seem to make any noise. They forced me inside then buckled me up before Turner gave the pilot the command to take off immediately. As the helicopter rose off the ground, I looked out the window at Travis. I cried, fearful for him as he staggered to his feet. He looked up and caught my eye before the helicopter turned and flew away from the school. "He's going to give chase." turning to Turner, I said. "You might not be glad he did."

Turner responded with a smile and nothing more, making me nervous. "Dad, I'm scared." I thought.

"You are in no danger with me at your side." came dad's telepathic response.

Then, a streak of fire shot across the left side of the helicopter before I saw something that turned my blood cold with fear. It was a human like dragon, straight out of Anime comics! As it circled to throw a stream of fire from its mouth on our right side, I knew who that dragon was. "Travis..."

"He's trying to force us down, sir!" a twinge of fear in his voice, the pilot said. "What are your orders?"

"The boy just wants to get his hands on us." calmly, Turner said. "Climb up into the clouds, we'll take him straight to the Singularity."

"The what!?" startled, I asked.

"Our base of operations, Miss Connors." simply, Stonewall replied.

Fearful, the pilot quickly climbed as he was ordered. I looked forward, trying to see where we were going, but gasped in surprise as we cleared the clouds. Ahead of us was what could only be described as a massive flying wing! The ship looked to be the size of two Nimitz class aircraft carriers, fused together in a 'V' formation, with twin control towers in the middle where the two halves met! As we climbed higher, over the ship, I looked out the window next to me to see that the engines were in a huge, triangular shaped piece that filled the space between the two wings. It was an impressive, if not, intimidating sight that sent a chill down my spine. "Is- Is that the Singularity?" turning to Stonewall, I asked.

Stonewall nodded. "Miss Connors, welcome to CHILD." firmly but kindly, he said. "We are the Central Headquarters of Intelligence, Logistics, and Defense."

"Singularity, this is Kilo India Delta." radioing the ship, the pilot said. "We have two invites on board and a hostile friendly in tow. We are requesting permission to land."

"Kilo India Delta, you have permission to land." came a firm feminine voice. "We will be ready to receive your two invites and hostile friendly."

"Rodger that, Singularity." replied the pilot. "Be aware the hostile friendly is a shape shifter. Repeat, the hostile friendly is a shape shifter."

"Understood." came the feminine voice. "You are clear to land on pad three."

As I saw the helicopter drawing closer to the ship, I became more and more worried. "If this was indeed a trap, how would we be able to escape....

As I was happily munching on the candy bar, I walked to the front of the school to enter the main doors when I heard a single shot ring out before an intense pain resonated from my left shoulder. Angry horns sounded around me and I could see the intersection cameras turning as if to find the shooter as a payphone on the corner dropped its receiver and the numbers 911 pressed themselves.

"The machines are trying to help me." my vision blurring, I thought. "Its as if they see me as one of their own, a part of their family...."

I tried to form a rueful smile but my body felt heavy, I could barely move a muscle. That was when I felt someone touch my wrist. "Megan..."

"Travis...?" weak, I thought. "Is that you...?"

I could not find the strength to respond but I could hear soft music playing from car radios, the machines were trying to keep me awake until an ambulance could arrive. Unknown to me, an ambulance was on the way with two very confused paramedics wondering how their vehicle was driving itself with lights and sirens blaring before it came to a screeching halt in front of the school where the two saw me laying on the sidewalk, covered in blood.....

I hate blood tests. All evening I had to stick around and deal with them shoving needles in me and cramming medical supplies in my mouth. I hate that feeling. I was tired after everything was said and done. They even took an X-ray. The doctors seemed to be puzzled and I started to doubt that my teeth even did change. I heard the sound of footsteps running past the door of the room I was in. I stood from my bed, The hospital gown I was wearing felt awkard, I definitely wouldn't get used to being in a hospital. I walked over to the door in my room. and looked out the small window, the nurses often use to monitor their patients. A girl a few years younger than me ran through the hall.

It didn't look like anyone was following her. I opened the door and followed after her. I turned the corner where I had seen her run "Hey" I called to her as I saw her continuing to run. She looked behind her and stopped. I quickly jogged over to where she was. "What are you running from?" I gave the girl a quick nod in understanding "Show me where." the girl gave me a quick nod and began to walk back in the direction of which we came. 14.content:
My name is Susan Tanner. My friends call me Sleuth, because I'm always trying to figure out what's going on. My teachers call me "problem child," for the same reason. One day, something happened to me that I'm still trying to figure out.

It was a couple weeks before school started. I woke up and headed for the shower, like I did every morning before. Certainly, I had no idea anything strange was about to happen. I was really enjoying the shower, until three things caught my attention.

The first strange thing was that I was suddenly looking into the showerhead. I tried to close my eyes, before any soap got in, but I just couldn't. Then, I realized: My eyes were already closed. I could see through my eyelids!

As I was wrapping my head around that, I realized something else was amiss. Even though I was standing under the showerhead, I couldn't feel the water.

I looked down to see where the water was going, and the third weird thing hit me. I couldn't see myself. I knew I was standing there, but there was no sign of my body. In fact, the water from the shower was going through me. As if I wasn't even there.
14.title: Susan Tanner

142.content:
Maybe it was because I was not yet fully awake and I thought I was dreaming or it was because of my curious nature, either way, I was not frightened enough to scream out loud. Instead a low yelp escaped my lips and I touched my side to see if I was still there. To my relief, I could feel my own body with my hands but, apparently, nothing else could.

"Have I suddenly died?" I thought, trying to reason things out. "Am I a ghost?"

I slapped myself, it stung and I could hear the slap and then I could feel the water again. Looking down, I saw my naked body once more and breathed a half hearted sigh of relief as i felt myself shaking. "I wonder what happened?" I whispered.

After finishing my shower, I began to towel myself dry and found I was falling into a bit of a trance. When one does the same routine every morning, it becomes almost automatic and can can do it in one's sleep. That was the type of trace I was falling into and, suddenly, my body was gone again! Only this time, I could feel the towel against me. Curious, I whipped the towel so that a piece of it my hand was not touching would hit me, it went through me as if I was not there.

"It seems only objects I am directly touching can touch me." I mussed. "Interesting but how did this happen?"

Still more curious than afraid, I decided to try slapping myself again to make myself solid so I could get dressed and try to reason everything out on paper. SLAP! I became visible again but made a mental note to find a less painful way to 'break the spell' making me like a ghost.

"Curiouser and Curiouser." I said, getting dressed. "Welcome to Wonderland, Susan."

Finally out of the shower, I retreated to my bedroom and sat behind my desk before grabbing a pen and began to collect my thoughts about the strange incident. I had surmised that my... condition was triggered by a mild trance like state and 'deactivated' by coming out of that trance. However, it was beyond my ability to even speculate what had caused it in the first place as it was the first time this had ever happened.

I decided that the best place to start was with my grandma's diaries. She used to write things down obsessively, until a stroke left her paralyzed. If there had been anything like what I was going through, it would be there.

I skimmed through a few volumes, looking for any mention of sudden disappearances or weird goings-on. Sadly, the only disappearances I could find had routine explanations, elopements and the like. If there was someone like me before, it didn't seem to be on that side of the family.

"Susan." I heard my mother calling. "Come on down here." I put Grandma's diaries aside and headed down.

Mom and Dad were waiting for me. "What's up?" I asked.

"We have an important announcement," Dad said.

Mom nodded. "We'll be keeping it secret for another couple months, but we'll tell you, now." The two of them joined hands, and Mom said, "I'm pregnant."

"Congratulations," I said, hugging them both.

As I looked at my mother, my vision seemed to go blurry for a moment. Then, I saw something unbelievable.

It seemed like I was looking through Mom. Her clothes and skin seemed to disappear, like I had done in the shower, except she didn't vanish completely. I realized I was looking into her womb, and I saw... two tiny shapes.

Mom and Dad didn't say she was having twins. Did they know yet? Could the doctor determine that, at this point?

First, I start disappearing. Then, I start seeing through things. Would I be able to control these newfound abilities?

That night, in the family room, I was sitting alone with the events of the day weighing heavily upon my mind when I spotted something I had not noticed before. It was a thick, old and faded book on the large book shelf that grandpa had kept his documented works as a private investigator. It was grandpa's passion to solve crimes that inspired you to do the same.

"I don't think I've seen this book before." I mussed, pulling it from the shelf. "I remembered always seeing a space..." I then froze, my heart beginning to race. "There was always a space here... an invisible book?"

At first, as I looked at the cover, it seemed blank but then words slowly began to appear as I, unknown to me, began to disappear from view. The book had the title, 'Journey into the unseen'. I was too wrapped up with finding this book that I had not taken notice that I was invisible and read the first page, it was addressed to me...

'To my dearest granddaughter, if you are reading this, it means that I have finally passed on to the next world but do not grieve, I have lived a long and happy life. Also, I am now free to tell you who you truly are..'

I teared up, not wanting to think that my grandfather was gone but I continued to read as what he had written down must have been important to only tell me after his passing. That and I was curious by what he had meant 'who I truly am.

'By now, you have discovered that you have the ability to vanish like a ghost. This power is usually only passed on to the first born son but, for some reason, fate had chosen you, the first born daughter, to have the power instead. You have the ability to phase slightly out of existence, giving you the powers of a ghost. Everything is carefully explained inside this book I have placed some of my own power into so only you may see it. Use your new power wisely... -All of my love, always, grandpa....'

"So, I have a power that is normally passed on from father to son." I whispered. "Is that why dad rarely talks to me, because he wanted a son?"

I began to cry at the thought until I heard dad's voice reply, "That's not it at all, Susan..."

142132.content:
"Your grandpa was certain you'd inherit the power," Dad said, "but I wasn't so sure. It's only been passed down from father to son, in the past. There was no sense showing you something that you'd never be able to do."

I wiped the tears from my eyes. "And... you're sure now?"

"I got a clue," he said, "when you reached for the 'empty' spot on the bookshelf. And, of course, you're invisible, now."

"I am?" I looked down. Sure enough, there I wasn't. "Holy cow! How do I stop this?"

"If you'll notice, sweetheart, there's a slight tingle at the base of your skull."

He wasn't kidding when he said it was slight. If he hadn't called it to my attention, I never would have noticed it. "Is that what turns me into a ghost?"

"Exactly," he said. "Concentrate on turning it off."

I had nothing to lose by trying. I imagined squeezing the source of the tingle. Sure enough, it stopped, and I came back into view. "This is going to be so cool." I turned my attention back to the book. "Everything about my powers is in here?"

"Everything my dad could figure out," Dad said. "Have you discovered 'X-ray' vision yet?"

"I think so," I said. "Is Mom having twins?"

"That's the way it looks to me," he replied. "Of course, we can't tell her about this."

"Why not?"

"Modern science hasn't yet reached the point where they can determine if a woman is carrying twins in her first month. If we told her, she'd tell her OB/GYN, and that would lead to us being examined."

"This is so amazing," I said. "I can't wait to try out my powers."

"Have at it," Dad said. "Just be careful not to overdo it. It's like a muscle. As you use it, you'll be able to use it more, but overuse will tire you out. Grandpa's book can help you, and I'll be able to answer any other questions you have."

I excitedly brought the book to my room, thinking about what I could now do. I could become invisible. I could pass through solid objects. I could see through them, too.

Once I got the hang of this, I'd be able to figure out whatever I wanted.

14213212.content:
Stepping out of my room, I saw Dad walking past the stairs. "Daddy? Could you come up here for a minute?"

"Sure, honey," he replied. He climbed the stairs, then followed me to my room. "What's on your mind? Having trouble with Grampa's handwriting?"

"Not so far," I said. I showed him Mom's letter to me. "What's she talking about?"

He looked over the letter. "Well, there's a story about the female line of your ancestors," he said. "It always sounded far-fetched to me."

I cocked an eyebrow. "More far-fetched than turning invisible, walking through walls, and seeing through things?"

"When you read the story," he said, "you'll understand what I mean."

"Okay, but what about not following in your footsteps? Doesn't she want me being a detective, like you?"

"In a manner of speaking." He picked up my back issues of Teen Detective. "You know these kids?"

"The Problem Child Gang? They're the whole reason the book sells."

He handed me the comics. "Suppose I told you those comics are based on real people? Specifically, on people who live in this neighborhood?"

"You're kidding."

"I'm not," he said. "In fact, I was one of them."

I looked from the comic to Dad. "You were part of the real Problem Child Gang?"

He nodded. "I specialized in infiltration and espionage. Of course, the others just thought I was just very good at sneaking in and hiding. They didn't know what I could really do."

"So why doesn't Mom want me doing that? I could just let any attack that came go right through me."

"You could," Dad explained, "but your mother couldn't. And, even if the twins gain our powers, it'll be years before they'd come to the surface. In that time, they'd be as vulnerable as anyone else.

"That's why your mother's warning you away from what I did. We made real enemies, the Problem Child Gang did. And some of them wouldn't mind taking revenge, if not on us, then on our families.

"So, promise your mother and me: While you can still play with your powers around the house, as far as the rest of the world is concerned, you're just a regular big sister. Okay?"

"Okay," I said.

I decided I wanted to know all the facts before I toy with my new found power. I wanted to know what this unknown second power was and hear the story behind it as I did not find anything unusual in grandma's diaries. "You... You were a part of the Problem Child Gang as well!?" stunned, I asked.

"Heather was out to buy film for her camera and she spotted two known drug dealers, loading a van." beginning the story, mom said. "She decided to take photographic evidence of their stash and the van's license plate before radioing the rest of the group."

What should I do?
