(*Credit to BeeJay who wrote most of this chapter in another thread*)

Mom smiled then lit a candle near her bed. "Stare into the flame." gently, she instructed. "Notice how it dances upon the wick, moving with each gentle breeze, never the same shape but always bright...."

As I listened to mom, staring at the candle flame, I found myself falling into some sort of trance. Only before I could do anything to try to shake out of it, a dream entered my mind...

"Ho, sisters!"

The crew of the Amazonian fishing boat all responded to the lookout's cry. They took positions, expecting nothing, ready for anything.

It could have been anything, from a shark to an enemy vessel. What it was, however, was a raft, ill-suited for a voyage as long as was needed for it to reach this far. The Amazons approached the raft, and, peering over their own ship's rail, studied the raft.

On the raft was a young boy, burned by the sun, weak from hunger and thirst. Strangely, he was clad in the robes of a female. Why should a man dress as a woman? Moved by empathy and curiosity, they brought the boy onto their boat. Back on their island, the Amazons began nursing him back to health.

When he had recovered enough to speak, the Amazon queen herself went to speak to him. "Greetings, young traveler," she said. "I am Antiope, Queen of the Amazons. Who are you?"

The boy bowed his head. "I am Iolaus, Your Majesty."

"Well met, Iolaus. We found you adrift on the sea, and in a woman's robes. How came you into such dire straits, and why were you dressed so?"

"I... I scarce can explain myself, Your Majesty."

"Please, Iolaus, try."

"I... I like to wear such things. I know not why."

"Interesting. What put you on that raft?"

"The people of my city. My... dress offended them greatly. Some of them wanted to kill me outright."

"What stayed their hand?"

"They feared that the gods might think me an offering. If that happened, the gods would discover my true nature, and might be angered."

"Fear not, Iolaus. I have given the command that you are not to be harmed. I will direct my people to see if there is a way that we might help you."

When Iolaus could walk again, he was brought to the temple. There, he was bound to the altar, as the Amazon priestesses performed a strange ritual over him. Finally, the chief priestess unbound Iolaus, and led the traveler out of the temple.

All the Amazons, even Queen Antiope, were stunned. Iolaus was now a young woman.

"Sisters," cried the chief priestess, "I give you Iole, our new sister." And so Iole became known as the Twice-Named.

As Iole settled into life as an Amazon, it became clear that she had found favor with the gods. She could run faster than the eye could follow. She could outdistance any prey she chose. And, in the heat of battle, she could pluck an arrow in flight, as easily as fruit from a tree.

In time, she bore fourteen daughters and sons. When the time came for her to go to the Elysian Fields, at the end of her life, all the Amazons mourned her passing.

As I came out of the trance, mom blew out the candle. "You were originally born a boy named Stan." looking at me, mom explained. "Hence, the powers that were passed from father to son became yours." she sighed, adding, "Only due to reasons still unknown, you slowly became a girl shortly after you were born and I renamed you Susan."

"So I was named twice, just like Iole." whispering, I said. "Do I have great speed, like Iole?"

What does mom say?

(*Credit to BeeJay who wrote most this chapter in another thread.*)
1421321221.title: I give her my word.

14213212212.content:
Mom giggled as she suddenly grew before my eyes, moving from a five foot woman to a seven foot Amazon! I stared at her new giant, muscular form in wonder. Mom looked at her once loose clothing now straining against her new form, smiling. "This is my power, yours will reveal itself in due time." she said. "I can't hold this form as long as I used to but, with practice, your power will be just as great."

"Can I try?" I asked, my eyes dancing again. "Is there any trick to it?"

"Your second power will come to you when the time is right." mom said, returning to her normal form. "Such great power is not a toy and brings much responsibility as I learned the hard way myself."

"How so?" I asked, curious.

Mom sighed. "That rock I threw on our first case, placed that man into a coma for several days, a 'minor' detail the author of the visual novel left out." she replied to my horror. "I could have easily killed him, had I hit his head rather than his jaw."

"You didn't know your own strength." I said, stunned.

"Nor will you, when your powers surface." said mom. "It was my protective nature that triggered my power to come, you too will have a trigger and I urge you to be very careful when that happens as it could be anything, even anger."

"I'll be careful." fearful, I promised.

"I hope so, dear." looking at me seriously, mom said. "All of us went through our lives with our parents gone most of the time, learning our lessons through painful experience." she then hugged me, tearing up. "Your dad and I want to be here for you when you need it but you must meet us half way, okay?"

I hugged mom back, having a better idea why mom was so protective. "Okay."

As we broke the hug, I sighed, imagining how lonely mom must have felt as a kid and teenager before....
14213212212.title: Your power will come when the time is right.

142132122122.content:
Before mom could answer, dad walked into the room, looking worried. "Amanda, your brother just called." in a serious tone, he said. "The Agency has resurfaced."

Mom turned pale. "They're back?" fear in her voice, she asked. "It's been nearly twenty years..."

"They could have been strictly working underground after our encounter with them." pausing, dad said. "Ted wants us to meet him at his house to hold a meeting." he then eyed me. "Apparently, all of our kids have developed some type of skill or power. The Agency may try to recruit them."

Now it was my turn to go pale. "No way am I working for them." shaking my head, I declared. "If they are anything like the books describe..."

"They won't be asking you to join, young lady." serious, dad said. "I know this from experience. The best course of action is to be ready when or if they come for us, you, or both."

"I slowly nodded, understanding the seriousness of the situation. "When are we going to uncle Ted's house?" I asked.

Dad held up his car keys. "Now."
142132122122.title: dad entered the room.

1421321221221.content:
"Should we have our security team go with us?" nervous, I asked. "We are dealing with a dangerous organization."

"Too obvious." shaking his head, dad said. "We need to look as one of 'the help' if we are to slip passed anyone who might be watching the house."

"That means you and I will be wearing maid uniforms." giggling, mom said.

"There's no time, honey." quickly, dad said. "We need to get moving now."

With that said, we all piled into one of our cars and left the mansion with dad driving and mom on the telephone, talking with someone. She looked worried but I decided not to ask. Uncle Ted, who was the chief of police, lived on the other side of town in a quiet neighborhood. As we arrived, it looked as if everyone was already heading into the house. They paused, seeing us pull up to the curb and we all jumped out to join them. "Are we late?" walking up to uncle Ted, dad asked.

"Not at all, Geo." shaking his hand, Ted said. "Good to see you again."

"Likewise." releasing dad, Geo said.

Ted then hugged mom. "Thank you for coming over, sis." smiling, he said. "I just wish it was under much better circumstances." he sighed. "Any word from Steve?"

Mom winced. "His daughter is in the hospital." sadly, she replied. "She's not well, from what I hear."

Ted shook his head, looking worried. "We'll have to hold the meeting without him then." wincing, he said. "Everyone inside, we have a lot of ground to cover and, I fear, very little time."

Once everyone was inside and sitting down, a girl, I recognized as Caitlin Spencer, turned to Sarah. "I know this is not the place but... why were you called the black sheep of the family?"

Sarah giggled slightly. "When I was your age, the Spencer family liked to play by their own rules." looking at her, she explained. "They did not care for the police or for lawyers unless it worked in their favor. That said, they wanted me to marry into the Tanner family, to increase the family's wealth." she motioned to mom then added, "Only my friend had eyes for Geo and I had eyes for Frank Vance... a lawyer who worked for the police department."

"I imagine your parents didn't take it well." wincing, Caitlin said.

Sarah shook her head. "My dad walked me down the aisle to give me away." sadly, she replied. "Only he did not stay for the reception." she sighed. "He and my mother accepted my husband but not until they were on their death bed, wanting to make peace before they left this world."

"That's cold." tearing up, Caitlin said. "I'm so sorry, aunt Sarah."

"It's not your fault, sweetie." said Sarah. "Believe me, my parents they deeply cared for my husband and I." she then smiled. "They wanted to make man who put me in this chair vanish of the face of the Earth. If Mr Jones had not gotten to him first, they would have made it happen."

"Let's get started." interrupting Caitlin's conversation, dad said with a cold tone. "As you all know, most of us were members of the Problem Child Gang you kids like to read about. Our last mission was against a man named Sykes who we believed was the bottom of a drug and weapon running cartel." he sighed. "Unfortunately, he turned out to be just the opposite. He was a war monger drug lord, the top dog of the cartel."

My face and those of my friends paled, hearing that. "Was it this Sykes and his men who nearly killed you all?" almost whispering, asked Garth. "Or was it the Agency?"

"The Agency was after Sykes, just as we were." seriously Ted replied. "Sykes knew they were there and that we were hunting him down. He blew the building he was held up in, just as he made his escape." he shook his head. "We barely escaped with our lives only to find the Agency became... interested in us."

"What do you mean interested in you?" shaking, Lyssa asked.

"As I explained earlier, we had our talents." looking at Lyssa, Sarah said. "The Agency was in the business of brainwashing children with such talents to use them, make them do their dirty work so to gain wealth and power."

"Not only were we forced to flee for our lives from an exploding building, we had to escape the clutches of an underground terrorist organization." tearing up, dad said. "We thought we were invincible, we were not. We thought this was behind us... its been chasing us all along."

"You- You think this cartel or this Agency may have interest in us." as if reading dad's mind, Caitlin said, turning pale.

Dad nodded. "That is why we are holding this meeting, my dear." he said. "The Agency has resurfaced and from what I have heard from Ted, many of you are already being watched by someone." he clinched a fist. "We can not take any chances or make any assumptions, we already made that mistake once."

Suddenly, Caitlin gasped, her lips trembling. "No... they're outside of my house!" hoarsely, she screamed. she threw her hands against her temples. "Marisol, you are in danger! RUN... NOW!!!!"
1421321221221.title: arriving at uncle Ted's house.

14213212212211.content:
Everyone jumped as Marisol appeared in the room, screaming. She had her hands raised, as if to defend herself then screamed again, finding herself somewhere else. "Ay dios mio!" shaking, she breathed.

"Es importante que tu te relajes." walking up to her unsteadily, Cait said. "Somos buenos amigos."

"Qué pasó, Caitlin!?" startled, Marisol asked.

"Someone, please... English." muttered uncle Ted, looking startled as well.

"It's okay, Marisol, you are safe." taking her hand, Cait said. "It looks like I got you here just in time." then I thought, "I feel so weak but I can't let her see that, she'll freak."

"She must have somehow teleported her here." startled, I thought. "It must have taken a lot out of her, though, she really looks pale and she's unsteady on her feet."

"What happened, child!?!" still shaking, Marisol asked. "I heard you scream I was in danger just as a number of men broke into the house!" she suppressed a sob. "They were right on top of me and then I found myself here!"

"We... We all have certain abilities, Marisol." urging her to sit down, Cait replied as she sat down with her. "Remember how I lost all my hair? Well, it also gave me powerful mental abilities, thanks to Amatra."

"Amatra?" confused, Marisol asked.

She paused, as if she were hearing something, then began to shake more until uncle Ted cleared his throat, catching her attention. "Marisol is it?" he asked. she nodded. "I am Ted Jones, chief of police. There is an underground organization, known as The Agency, that forcibly makes use of such talented children like Caitlin Spencer and my children, Garth and Grace." he sighed. "It's a long story, which we will explain but in short, I believe those men were after Caitlin and they would have used you to get her."

"That's pretty much how dad explained it." feeling a chill, I thought. "It's scary to think how many people they might have kidnapped and brainwashed over the years."

"I- I see..." said Marisol. she turned to Caitlin. "You- You summoned me here?"

Looking very pale, Cait nodded. "You're like a mother to me." barely standing, Cait said. "I- I couldn't let anyone hurt you. I... I..."

Suddenly, Cait collapsed and slumped out of her seat, onto the floor. Marisol was on her feet in an instant. "Caitlin!"

As I watched Marisol fuss over Caitlin, mom's words echoed in my mind. "Such great power is not a toy and brings much responsibility as I learned the hard way myself."
14213212212211.title: Unexpected guest.

142132122122111.content:
"What happened?" all rushing to Cait's side, Garth asked.

"I'd say that stunt surprised her as much as the rest of us," aunt Sarah replied. "And, from the look of things, it took a lot out of her." She checked Cait over. "Her pulse is getting stronger. I don't think she'll need medical attention. Just a reminder not to go bending the space-time continuum."

We carried her to the couch. Marisol got some cold water from the sink, and lightly splashed her face.

Slowly, Cait's eyes began to open. "Wh... wha... "

"You fainted, chica," Marisol replied. "Bringing me here was harder than you wanted to let on. I don't think you should do that again."

"You're not the only one," Cait replied. "My head is killing me. And I can't 'hear' your thoughts."

"Probably overstress," Beth suggested. "Give yourself a day or so before you try mind-reading again."

Marisol looked around at all of us. "You children all have these... powers?"

"Most of us," Garth said. "I can get big and super-strong."

"I've got total recall," Grace said, "and I can duplicate just about anything I see done."

"I've got super-speed," Lyssa said.

"I have a spirit guide," said Beth.

That was when I stepped forward. "I've got powers from both my parents. You guys all thought Dad was just really good at sneaking in and hiding. It's more than that."

"What do you mean?" uncle Ted asked.

Dad and I smiled... and disappeared.

"Geo? Susan?" uncle Ted ran to where were, waving his arms through the space where we were still standing and still smiling as we had surprised everyone. "Where'd you go?"

"We're right here, Ted," dad replied. "We can turn invisible and intangible."

"Put your arms down, Uncle Ted," turning serious, I added. "We can't come back, if you're occupying the space."

Uncle Ted stopped waving his arms, and we returned. "How'd you get to do this?"

"It's a family trait," shrugging, I answered. "Right now, I can only do it for about 15 minutes. But I should get better at it."

"Any other problems, besides solid objects?"

"Bright light," serious, dad said. "Our eyelids go transparent, too, so we can't block out bright lights."

"Sue," curious, Garth asked, "you said you got powers from both your parents. What did you mean?"

"I was a hanger-on of the Problem Child Gang," mom said. "The book calls me the Unknown Amazon."

"That's how you got so big? You can Hulk out, like I do?" smiling, Garth said.

Mom nodded. "Sue hasn't discovered her power from me yet. Otherwise, I'm sure she'd demonstrate."

"My trigger was exercise. When we're done with this, I'll let you use my equipment." said Garth.

"Thanks, Garth," I said. "Of course, we haven't gotten to the weird part."

"Weird part?"

"You guys might find this hard to believe," blushing, I said. "It turns out, I was originally born a boy. I turned into a girl a few days later. That's how I inherited Dad's powers: They're passed from father to son."

"That's not so hard to believe," Lyssa said.
142132122122111.title: A display of my power.

1421321221221111.content:
Before Sam could answer, there was another knock at the door. "Who could that be?" Ted asked. "We're all here." Drawing his sidearm again, he asked, "Who is it?"

"Tr-Trish Wilson, sir," came the reply. "Cait sent for us?"

We turned to Cait. "Something came up during the ride here," she said. "I sent my driver to pick them up."

Ted opened the door, and in came Trish, Brad, and an older lady, probably Brad's mom. Except Brad looked kind of funny, and it looked like he'd gotten dressed in a hurry. Then I noticed the hospital ID bracelet on his wrist, and remembered Cait had said he'd been recovering from plutonium exposure from that recalled body wash.
"You guys OK?" concerned, Garth asked.

"Getting better," Brad replied. Even his voice was different. "I... had quite an experience in the hospital. Please don't ask me to describe it to you."

"What's going on?" Heather asked. "Why did you come here?"

"Cait told me she'd picked up something," Trish answered, "and I should grab Brad and his mom and get in her limo. Whatever it was, it had her freaked worse than the shooting."

We all turned to Cait again.

"I read Brad's doctor's mind," she explained. "He's connected to the Agency, and he wanted his hands on Brad and Trish. That's why I brought them here."

Ted shook his head. "Sykes, the Agency, and the kids of the Problem Child Gang. This is going to get a lot worse before it gets better."

"We need to get everyone started on training the sooner the better." said dad. "I know of such a place, the original group headquarters near the coast. It's only about twenty miles from here."

"I thought our headquarters were destroyed by the Agency days after we escaped Sykes' death trap in Rome." confused, Heather said. "They completely burned the summer home mansion to the ground, trying to get to us."

"That was the sister mansion in England." countered dad. "I'm talking about the original headquarters, here in the States, where we first starting training to hone our skills while not gallivanting around the world." he smiled. "It's old but its still standing and we can go there in a second's notice."

"The kids will still need individual training." worried, Sarah said. "Also, their skills are far more advanced than ours were."

"They will get individual training." said dad. "You see, I had a feeling we had not seen the last of the Agency so I had an underground... err... vacation village constructed in a cave system for all of us to run to with our families, just in case."

"That's a bit creepy." wincing, I thought.

"All of the training facilities we need are there?" asked Ted.

Dad nodded. "It has everything we need to live and train for as long as it takes." serious, he said. "We can live there or commute there." he paused. "Its just an option."

"We'll commute there." said dad. "The Agency will know we're onto them if we all suddenly vanish. Still, we must be on our toes at all times, understood!?" everyone nodded and dad turned back to dad. "I will check the mansion and training facility to ensure its safe and secure. We can take two along with us."

"That's our cue, honey." whispering, mom said. "We need to get back, to train."

I nodded and I took mom's hand. To my surprise, she vanished with me the two of us causally walked out of the house, though the wall. "That was weird but fun." as we became visible, I said. "Where will we be starting?"

"At home, reading that book grandpa left you." serious, mom replied. "After that, the real work begins. I'm going to make an Amazon warrior out of you and later, dad will make you a Kage Yurei like him and his father before him."

"I know what an Amazon is but what's a Kage Yurei?" confused, I asked.

"Japanese for 'ghost shadow'." frowning, mom replied. "Our family was part of an elite ninja clan." she then smiled. "Your father will explain more when its his turn to train you. Right now, its my turn."

I could not find the words to say so I merely nodded as dad ushered me into the car. Minutes later, I took up the book and began to read...
1421321221221111.title: another visitor.

14213212212211111.content:
Where I had found the envelope, containing mom's letter to me, I found the first chapter in grandpa's book. It explained the origin of the family's power. It read...

'Centuries ago, The Tanner family, then known as the Yoru family of Japan, was a part of an elite Ninja group known as the Kage Yurei, or 'ghost shadows'. There were five members, each of them were blessed with a powerful Eien ni (forever) Jiujitsu that would be passed from father to son without need for training as it was magically placed into their very being (DNA). Each had the ability to become like ghosts with all the powers that came with that form, defending the secrets and riches of the ruling dynasty.'

"So dad's power is magical in origin as well as mom's." mussing, I whispered. "That's interesting." I paused, noticing that the book was typed but grandpa's notes were hand written before realizing that he somehow sensed I would have the power after it was written. His note stated,

'Dearest granddaughter, the Kage Yurei were both feared and respected. I had defended many a Japanese lord, earning many rewards for my heroics. However, no job is perfect and I found a reason to leave it all behind. I fell in love with an American woman.'

"Grandma." fighting my tears, I whispered. "She was quite a woman, never backing down from anyone or anything."

Sighing, I continued to read...

'The one who had created the Eien ni Jiujitsu never produced a son so its secret died with him. Those who were blessed with the Jiujitsu passed its power to their first born son and they continued to protect the secrets and riches of each dynasty. However, that all changed when fate eventually hit each family with a first born daughter, ending their service in the Kage Yurei, with the exception of one. The Yoru family carried the burden alone until, in 1932, the first born son, Neo Yoru suddenly fled to America with an outsider woman and changed their name to Tanner to avoid those who would to hunt them down to be killed or returned to Japan. The Tanner family started a new life in America, using their Eien ni Jiujitsu to make a difference in the world around them.'

"Hence dad became a member of the Problem Child Gang." smiling, I whispered. "What a legacy!"

I began to daydream, visualizing dad fighting crime with his powers but quickly pulled myself out of it and finished reading the page...

'Then fate struck the Tanner family as the first born son, due to his wife's bizarre Amazonian ancestry, changed into a girl, gaining a new power. However, the Eien ni Jiujitsu remained within her. It is only a matter of time before one power wins over the other....'

"That is creepy." shivering slightly, I said. "I have two powers but I'll lose one of them in the end." I gulped, not liking the thought of disappointing mom or dad. "The only question is, which one will win out?"
14213212212211111.title: Origin of the Tanner family.

choices: Mom makes a pitch for me to keep her powers
142132122122111111.content:
I found dad sitting in the basement, examining a pair of sheathed daggers. Upon seeing me, he smiled and told me to focus my eyes. Although I found it a strange request, I did and suddenly found that the room had weapons stored on every wall, every shelf, it was a literal arsenal of hand to hand weapons from Morning stars, to katana swords, there were weapons from every corner of the world!

"Dad?" stunned, I asked. "What is all this stuff?"

"I see you've read about our history." serious, dad said. "This room was always like this, you just haven't been able to see it, you now know that one of your powers will become dominant."

"Yeah." feeling a little guilty, I said. "I figured it best to focus on your side of the family.

"You have nothing to feel ashamed about." sensing my feelings, dad said. "I've been talking with your mother and we agree that it would be best if you kept my powers." he then stood up to face me. "Thus, I will now train you in the art of Ein ni Jiujitsu. You will become the first female Kage Yurei."

"Do you think, once you train me, my powers from mom will really become dormant?" worried, I asked.

"Yes, but you need not worry about mom feeling any disappointment." soothingly, dad replied. "Just because the powers from her are dormant does not mean they are lost." he paused then added, "The choice is yours, it'll affect your life."

I sighed, wondering what to do then replied, "If you think it's best, I accept. When do we begin training?"
142132122122111111.title: I talk to dad.

1421321221221111111.content:
"The weapons you see around you are ghost weapons, charged with an energy that makes them invisible to all but those who know how to detect them." serious, dad said. "They can only be seen by others while they are in your hand but, in ghost form, they are just as invisible as you." he then pointed to a specific shelf of weapons near where I was standing. "Be very careful about which weapon you choose first; once chosen, it will be bonded to you."

"Which one is yours?" curious, I asked dad.

"I am bonded to this," said dad, holding up a long scythe-like weapon with a blade at each side. "But I've trained with every one of the weapons here, they all have a specific purpose and a hidden power, all helpful to the Ein ni Jiujitsu fighting style that made the Kage Yurei much feared and respected."

"Will I learn how to use all these weapons?" feeling slightly overwhelmed, I asked.

"You will be trained in the use of many weapons, which you will find useful in battle." calmly, dad replied. "However, you will be trained the most with your bonded weapon." he then pointed to the shelf and firmly demanded, "Make your choice, Susan."

I looked at the weapons on the shelf, examining each weapon carefully. This was a big decision, and I did not want to rush it.
1421321221221111111.title: Training Begins

14213212212211111112.content: I saw a pair of what I knew to be katanas
14213212212211111112.title: Choose a different weapon

142132122122111111122.content: I saw two fork-shaped swords with the central point much longer. Shall I choose this weapon?
142132122122111111122.title: choose a different weapon

choices: I try to fly (I succeed and land on the opposite side of the branch to Dad)
I try to fly (I fail, fall and injure myself)
1421321221221111111221.content:
I picked up the two blades, examining them. After a moment, I smiled. "These feel right."

"I see you have chosen to bond with the Sai." smiling, dad said. "Excellent choice. As I said, these weapons have a hidden power; the middle piece can grow, making your Sai a Katana, when summoned."

My eyes widened in shock. "Are you serious?" surprised, I asked.

Dad smiled. "Come, I have an area set up for your training."

He led me out into the garden before unsheathing his Katana sword where he slashed it in a circle around us. There was a flash of light and, when it diminished, a gasp escaped my lips. We were now in a vast forest somewhere away from home! "How..." turning to him, I asked.

"All right," said Dad, sheathing his sword, "the first rule about being a ninja, see but don't be seen." saying that, he vanished into thin air, but continued to as speak. "To be able to see everything, you must look without seeing,"

I felt a blow to the back of my knees, forcing me down onto them. "I could use some of grandpa's wisdom." blushing, I thought. then I remembered I line from a movie... 'your eyes can deceive you, don't trust them.'

I questioned if this was the best place to use such a reference but it fit my situation perfectly. I closed my eyes, spinning the Sais in my hands. I sensed rather than saw dad's position and turned, thrusting one of the points at that location. I knew I had missed when dad chuckled.

"Very good, Susan." softly, he said. "You've just discovered that sixth sense and used it to your advantage. Only this is just the start, let's take it up a notch."

Dad became visible then jumped, vanishing again, as he flew up into the trees. As I watched him, I couldn't help thinking that he looked like a genie as his feet and legs did not seem to turn visible before he jumped. I had never flown before, other than in a plane, so I waited until dad landed on a narrow branch stretching between two trees before I attempted to do as he did.
1421321221221111111221.title: choose this weapon

14213212212211111112212.content:
I turned into my incorporeal (ghost) form and tried to fly with just my torso visible but, ten feet up, I heard a noise and lost my concentration. I immediately became completely visible and fell to the ground. More embarrassed than hurt, I tried to get up but stopped, feeling a sharp pain in my ankle. Dad was beside me in the next breath, examining the ankle I had been massaging.

"You're fine, Susan." calmly, he said. "It's just a twisted ankle, you can get up." he then chuckled. "You need to learn how to jump into the trees before you can fly, there are no shortcuts to training."

I stood up slowly; my ankle didn't really hurt too badly. I simply put on a show, making it seem worse than it was for dad's benefit and to place him off guard. When I saw him re-sheath one of his katanas, to be better able to help me stand, I shifted my weight and jumped. I somersaulted in the air and landed on a low hanging branch, stabbing down at Dad's head. He somersaulted backwards in turn, then jumped onto the other end of the branch I was standing on.

"Not very sporting of you, Susan." frowning, he said. "I would expect that from a villain, not a hero as you are inspiring to become." I winced, thinking I had made a wrong decision but smiled as dad added, "Still, the element of surprise is very important, just choose your moments wisely."

Dad was in a precarious position on the edge of the branch, while my position was more secure. I spun my sais in my hand and held them in a battle pose, ready to fight.
14213212212211111112212.title: I try to fly (I fail, fall and injure myself)

choices: skip to the end of training.
142132122122111111122121.content:
I charged dad with my sais, hoping to force him to jump back to the ground. I had no experience fighting in a tree, I needed him where I could face him on equal terms. Only, to my surprise, dad simply changed into a ghostly but visible form! I could not stop myself and ran right through him, falling to the ground. Fortunately, I landed square on my feet this time but I still blushed, hearing dad laughing from the tree branch.

"Never underestimate your opponent, Susan!" turning serious, he scolded. "If I were an enemy, you would have been seriously injured or killed right now... look to your left."

I looked and gulped, seeing one of dad's katanas standing at an angle with half the blade embedded deep in the dirt. Had it hit me, the blade would have ran clear through me. I turned back to see dad standing next to me, his face slightly softer. "This is not a game, Susan." serious, he said. "This fighting style was created to kill people but I turned it around so it would defend life." he pulled the sword out of the ground. "Even the sharpest of sword is useless unless you know how to use both sides of the blade."

With that, he cleaned the blade and sheathed it before pointing to the tree. "When you can stand on the edge of the first branch without falling off, we will continue."

"How is doing that going to help me?" curious, I asked.

Dad smiled. "Does walking on water sound cool to you?" to my surprise, he asked. "A ghost fighter must be able to fight anywhere at any time. On the surface of a lake, on the weakest of branches.... anywhere." he then surprised me again by stepping up and stood on the tips of a tall patch of grass. "A ghost shadow can stand as if weightless but still carry enough force to throw an opponent; all the powers of a ghost, that is the Eien ni Jiujitsu."

With that, he stepped off the grass patch and walked to a stump where he sat down, watching me, waiting for me to train...
142132122122111111122121.title: I make the first move

1421321221221111111221212.content:
It seemed like days before the training finally ended and dad slashed the air with his katana again, opening a rift, and led me through into the garden. There, I saw mom, waiting for us. "Aw, honey, you look exhausted." seeing me, she said. "Would you like a cup of tea?"

"I'm just fine, thank you." grumbling, dad said.

Mom giggled. "I know you are dear." smiling, mom replied. "Why don't you rest up before lunch and I'll get Susan something to help her unwind."

Dad half smiled, grumbling under his breath as he walked off. "How long were we gone?" curious, I asked. "The days seemed to meld together while I was training."

"You were only gone an hour, Susan." to my surprise, mom replied. "I do not understand much about your father's secret ninja order but I do know that there is a lot of magic in it, I would not question any of it."

I nodded, knowing it was well beyond me and followed mom into the kitchen where she prepared me a cup of herbal tea. "Well, my training is done so... what's next?" curious, I asked.

Mom laughed. "Oh, it's far from over, honey." sitting down with a cup of her own, she said. "You may not be gaining my gifts but you will get getting training from me."

"What kind of training?" sipping on my tea, I asked.

"Capoeira." with a smile, mom replied. "It's a Brazilian form of martial arts that looks much like a dance but it is a surprisingly effective fighting style." she paused, seeing my confused look. "Having more than one style of fighting under your belt will prove very useful, Susan."

As the sun set, later that day, mom began to teach me the Capoeira fighting style. Although I had already gained martial arts training, with the ability to become invisible, mom proved to be a very worthy opponent. She could sense where I was by literally hearing my heartbeat! "How can you hear that!?" after she had thrown me a third time, I asked.

"By tuning out all other sounds, you can train your ears to hear even the faint beating of your opponent's heart and, thus, find him in the darkest room." serious, mom replied. "This form of martial arts has been handed down from mother to daughter for generations." she smiled. "Your father could never sneak up on me, he trained you... good luck."

I sighed, knowing that mom's training was not going to be any easier. "Okay, let's con..." I stopped in mis sentence, hearing a rustling outside. "Did you hear that?"

Mom discretely glanced out the widow and smiled. "It looks like Lilith Nightshade and her mom have decided to pay us a visit." grabbing as towel, she said. "Let's take a break to greet them."

I smiled then vanished from sight....
1421321221221111111221212.title: One training ends, another begins.

14213212212211111112212121.content:
Mom placed the towel over her shoulders before we moved quickly, without a sound, out the side yard and moved to the back where we found both Madame Vague and Lilith still talking. "Welcome, Madam Vague." startling them, mom said. "You usually always get the drop on me."

The two turned, surprised, to see mom standing before them and smiled. "It's good to see you are finally learning, Amanda." smiling back, Madame Vague. "My daughter has discovered her path, I'm guiding her."

"Hey, Lilith." startling my friend, I said. "What's up?"

Lilith turned around but saw no one there. "Sue?" looking around, she asked.

"Oops..." blushing, I thought. "I'm still invisible." I appeared in front of her, smiling. "My parents have the coolest ancestry." I said.

"So do mine." smiling back Lilith said. she rose above the ground, hovering there for a moment, then came back down. "I just became a member of the new Problem Child Gang."

"That is incredible!" hugging her, I said. "Welcome to the group!"

"You too!?" surprised, Lilith asked.

Without warning, I gave Lilith a soft but loving kiss on the lips, causing her to blush. "I share your feelings, Lilith Nightshade but we have to keep this a secret." whispering into her ear, I said. "Father would not understand." then I said, "Dad will be honored to hear you have joined our group."

This caused Lilith to smile, tearing up slightly, before she asked, "Who else is in our group."

"Practically all of the 'problem' kids in our homeroom." smiling, I replied. giggling, I added, "That includes our homeroom teacher."

Why don't we continue this inside?" kindly, mom said. "Welcome to our home, Lilith."

"Thank you, Mrs. Tanner," politely, Lilith said as walked inside. "I'm a little surprised to see you working up a sweat like that. Most women in your condition prefer to take things easy."

Mom and I turned to Lilith, surprised. "You know that I'm pregnant?" looking at her, she asked.

Lilith tapped her nose. "I can smell the changes in your hormones."

"Ah. Well, we're trying to keep it a secret for two more months." blushing, mom said. "So, please don't spread it beyond these walls."

"No one will hear it from me." serious, Lilith replied. she then turned to me. "So, what other powers are in our group?" she asked. "I know that Garth can make himself muscular, and you saw some of my magick."

"I can turn invisible and intangible," serious, I replied. "Mom says I've probably inherited her Amazon muscles, but I haven't found the trigger yet."

"It'll come, dear," gently, mom said.

"Lyssa has super-speed," turning back to Lilith, I said. "I heard that Clem inherited some powers from his parents, but it left him as bald as those kids who used Plutonium products. And you know Megan Conners and Travis Greenway? They can change themselves into other things. They were those wolves who prowled around the schoolyard this morning."

"Why would they do that?" taken back, lilith asked.

"They spotted some guy on a roof across from the schoolyard, getting ready to shoot some kids." frowning, I replied. "Fortunately, the rest of us knew about it already, so the police were ready to take him down before he could fire a shot."

Lilith's eyes grew wide at the news of a foiled school shooting. "How did you find out?"

"From Cait. She's got telepathy, and she can see a little bit into the future."

"Probably not as far as your Tarot cards," with a knowledgeable nod, mom added, "but she can see with greater clarity."

"We've got quite the group," looking impressed, Lilith said. "How about our homeroom teacher? You said she was a part of this, too?"

"She's got a history with the original PCG," sadly, I explained. "When she was just a little kid, the Agency kidnapped her and turned her into this pint-sized assassin. But she broke free of them. Since then, she can make herself bigger or smaller."

"Well," Madame Vague said, "it was good seeing you again, Amanda, but I should probably get Lilith back in bed. We wouldn't want her to be bleary-eyed on her second day of school."

She and Lilith went back outside and, after a goodbye hug from mom (and a loving hug and kiss from me), they flew back home.
14213212212211111112212121.title: A talk with Lilith.

142132122122111111122121212.content:
"Is this really necessary?" Mum had left me standing in a room, holding my sais. The room was dark, but that did not matter at this time as my vision was impaired by a black band. For an answer, mum tripped me to the ground. I landed hard, grunting in pain as my face smacked into the ground.
"Does that answer your question?" asked Mum, a tone of humour in her voice "You aren't concentrating hard enough, if you are impaired from losing just one sense, how will you be able to fight properly when you are impaired on multiple senses?"
I didn't answer. The question had been rhetorical, but I knew what she said was true, so I took several deep breaths, trying to find a calm center. As I became calm, I heard two heartbeats, one much weaker than the other. I could hear both Mum's heartbeat and the babies. I sensed Mum moving in. As she was about to punch, I aught her arm.
"I heard the baby," I said "You're right, this will be useful in the future."
"All right," said Mum "Time to...
142132122122111111122121212.title: That night...

1421321221221111111221212121.content:
Before beginning again, Mum put a pair of ear muffs over my ears. Now I was unable to hear anything or see anything. I wasn't sure what I was supposed to be doing to detect my mother's position. Before I could work it out, I felt a blow to my left side, forcing me onto one knee. I still couldn't hear or see anything and my other senses were doing nothing to compensate for the disadvantage. Suddenly, I smelt it. An almost imperceptible smell of my mother's perfume. I opened my mouth slightly and tasted the strawberries from the kitchen. This allowed me to get my bearings. I took a fighting stance and got ready to fight. Now I was at least going to be able to fight back. I sensed Mum coming in towards me and jumped, turning in the air and kicking Mum away.
I removed my blindfold, afraid that I had hurt her, but saw her picking herself up, relatively unharmed.
1421321221221111111221212121.title: Take away a further senss

1421321221221111111222.content: A long, stand-alone weapon with an openable compartment on one end. I recognised the weapon as a bo. It was so long that I wouldn't be surprised if there was a second weapon inside it. Sure enough, when I opened the compartment, there was a long chain with a ring on one end and a knife on the other. I recognised this weapon too. It was the kyoketsu-shogei.

145.content:
This is a brief summary of the main characters in this thread. More may be added as the story continues.

Susan Tanner
14 years old
5'4'' 118 lbs.
Tall and slender with a well- toned body; long sand blond hair and blue eyes.

Susan is a kind, caring, and curious young lady who loves a good mystery and is very good at finding clues to solve them. She is the daughter of the wealthy technology tycoon, Geo Tanner. Susan was considered a 'problem child' due to the fact she blew the whistle on a teacher who was purposely failing students merely because their parents were her old classmates. Although the teacher was in the wrong, other teachers felt threatened by her curious nature. She discovers that she has the ability to become completely invisible and intangible when in a trance like state. While investigating this, she learned that her grandfather and father also had this power, a gift passed on from father to son. This intrigued her more and she soon discovered that she was born a boy but, due to a genetic condition in her mother's ancestry, she changed into a girl while still in infancy. Susan's grandfather left her a book, explaining how her power works and who to use it wisely.

Geo Tanner
36 years old
5'10'' 175lbs.
Tall, well built with short black hair and brown eyes.
Geo is a wealthy technology tycoon and the owner and operator of Tanner Tech Enterprises. He is a serious man when it comes to business but a warm and loving person when it comes to his family. He is patient but firm and will use his wealth and technology to protect what he holds dear to his heart. He gained a power from his father to become invisible and intangible while in a trance like state and has aided his father in his exploits to better the world.

In the main thread, Geo's father was originally of the Yoru family of Japan. They had changed their name to Tanner to avoid persecution as Geo's father, Hero Yoru was part of an elite Ninja group known as the Kage Yurei, ('ghost shadows') Each member of this group was blessed with a powerful Eien ni (forever) Jiujitsu that would be passed from father to son without need for training as it was magically placed into their very being (DNA). Each had the ability to become like ghosts with all the powers that came with that form, defending the secrets and riches of the ruling dynasty.'
As time passed, Hero became the last surviving member only he fell in love with an American woman and left Japan behind to start a new life. The Eien ni Jiujitsu was passed on to Geo who, in turn, passed it on to his son Sam who became his daughter, Susan. (See Susan Tanner above)

In the main thread, Geo was the leader of a group known as the Problem Child Gang. This group consisted of four main members, each with unique skills or gifts. Together, with other members adding to their numbers, they worked to fight crime in Waterfront City like many a super team in the comic books they had read. Sadly, the entire group was nearly killed on their last mission, forcing them to give up crime fighting. Now, twenty years later, Geo's daughter gains the powers of a ghost and he fears a repeat of history as fate forces the Problem Child Gang to emerge once more.

Amanda Tanner
36 years old
5’9’’ 136lbs.
Tall and muscular with long sand blond hair and blue eyes.
Amanda is a kind and patient woman who loves being a stay at home mother to her daughter, Susan. She works with the maids and butlers inside her mansion home as well as organizes charities to keep herself busy. She has sharp senses and reflexes and is well versed in self-defense. Her maiden name is Jones, she is Ted Jones older sister (See Ted Jones under chapter one ‘Garth Jones’)
In the main thread, she had the ability to transform into a seven foot muscular woman; she called herself Anna, the unknown Amazon while following and protecting her little brother as he lead The Problem Child Gang. This group consisted of four main members, each with unique skills or gifts. Together, with other members adding to their numbers, they worked to fight crime in Waterfront City like many a super team in the comic books they had read. Sadly, the entire group was nearly killed on their last mission, forcing them to give up crime fighting. Now, twenty years later, Amanda’s daughter has developed a powerful gift of her own, making her fearing a repeat of history. She and her husband (see above) reveal their past and try to detour her from making the same mistakes they did as fate calls for the Problem Child Gang to rise again.
145.title: Character Pofiles.

choices: An occurence at the wig shop
151.content:
My name is Caitlin Spencer. My folks are practically rich, and, growing up, I never wanted for anything. Seriously, I never knew what it was like not to get what I wanted. As a result, I guess, I developed an attitude that there must be something wrong with those less fortunate. I hardly gave anybody the time of day at school, just my boyfriend, Brad, and my best friend, Trish.

What happened to change my outlook? Simple. I turned into a freak.



"It's called alopecia," Dr. Stone said.

Three days before, I noticed my hairbrush was picking up way more hairs than before. A quick check of my scalp confirmed that I now had a few bald spots. I quickly made an appointment to see what was wrong.

In the three days between then and my appointment, I lost all my hair. I had stuck on false eyelashes, drew on new eyebrows, and threw a scarf over my head, hoping nobody I knew would see me like this. "So what's causing it?" I asked. "And how soon can we undo it? School starts in, like, a week, I can't let anybody see me like this!"

"Have you been under any stress recently?"

"Of course I'm under stress! I've lost all my hair!"

"Before that, I mean," he said. "There seems to be nothing wrong with you, physically, that would cause such rapid hair loss. Since you don't go playing around with radiation, that would seem to leave stress as the cause. So, I ask again: Have you been under any stress recently?"

I shook my head. "My folks are out of town, but that's nothing new. They left me the credit cards, and Marisol drives me wherever I need to go. I've got a great boyfriend. I've really got nothing to be stressed about. At least, I didn't, until all this started."

"Well," Dr. Stone said, "unless we can find a physical cause, I'm afraid there's not much I can do. The only treatment is cosmetic: There's a discreet shop, where you can obtain wigs and false eyebrows. I can send you there. Hopefully, your hair will grow back. If it does, call me."

As I turned to leave, I heard Dr. Stone say, "I think I'll have tuna for lunch."

"Whatever you want," I said. I didn't really care what he wanted to eat.

"Pardon?"

I turned to face him again. "I thought you said something?"

He shook his head. "Nobody said anything, until you said, "Whatever you want.'"

That puzzled me. Sure, it was strange that he told me he wanted tuna. But it was just as strange that he would deny something so innocuous.
151.title: Caitlin Spencer.

1511.content:
I had Marisol drive me to the shop Dr. Stone recommended.

"Hello," the sales lady said. "How can I help you?"

I loosened my head scarf enough that she could see my situation. "I need a wig," I said, "and false eyebrows."

"Let's see if we can help you," she replied. "What was your color, before?"

"Platinum blonde," I replied.

Then, I heard Marisol's voice say, "It says 'Plutonium' on the bottle."

I turned back at her. "Excuse me?"

"I didn't say anything," she said.

"Miss," the saleslady said, "nobody said anything."

I turned back to the saleslady, and something truly weird happened. Without moving her lips at all, she said, *Hoo boy, this girl's off her meds.*

She checked on her computer, and said, "You're in luck. We have a set in stock. Wait here, and I'll bring it out."

*Hopefully,* she thought, *before the Styrofoam heads start giving her orders.*

As she left, I turned my attention to Marisol. I guess I've always thought of her as a second mother, since she's done most of the work raising me.

So it was a surprise when I caught her thinking, *That girl's been spoiled rotten since she was five. It's about time something took her down a peg.*

That was when I realized... I was reading her thoughts. Not just hers, but those of anyone around me. And it was painting a picture of me that I didn't recognize.

I tried on the wig, and it looked good, almost my usual style. I bought the gear with Mom's credit card, and we went home.
1511.title: An occurence at the wig shop

choices: Blow up in his face (and his head)
15112.content:
Once I got home, I washed off the drawn-on eyebrows, and applied the false eyebrows. "There," I said, smiling at the result. "Now I look enough like I used to, I could face people again."

As if on cue, Marisol called up, "Caitlin, Bradley is here." Then, I caught her thinking, *What you see in this boy is beyond me.*

I would definitely have to learn how to shut this thing off. I couldn't get used to hearing people's thoughts all the time.

Once I got downstairs, Brad hugged and kissed me. "Good to see you, Cait," he said.

"You, too," I replied. "What brings you here?"

"I have the day off," he said. "I figured you wouldn't be busy, So, I thought, maybe the two of us could go up to your room, and... ?"

I didn't need to read his mind to know what he was thinking. However, I wasn't comfortable thinking about sex just yet, even before I went hairless. "Brad," I said, "you know I want our first time to be special. And not having anything else to do doesn't qualify as 'special'."

"Okay," he said, "I understand."

Then, I caught him thinking, *I'll just go over and bang Trish, like always.*

I blinked at that.

He quickly followed it with, *You don't have a clue in your empty little head, do you?*
15112.title: A revelation

151121.content:
To say I was angry and feeling betrayed would have been an understatement but, as my dad had always told me, why get mad when you can get even. I smiled at him sweetly and asked, "How is Trish liking your bang jobs?"

Brad looked at me stunned to which I giggled. "I tend to watch over those I love so they don't get hurt." I explained. "I know all about your little love affair on the side." I then giggled. "I really don't mind, I can get a new boyfriend any day of the week, if I wanted. The question is, does Trish know about me and what will she do to you if she found out?"

Brad turned pale as I heard him think, *She'd kill me and have her big brother play kick the can with what's left.*

"I'm guessing she'd kill you and have her older brother kick around what's left when she's done."I told him, not wanting to repeat his exact thoughts. "You see, I may seem like a spoiled rotten brat but I really do care. To avoid real trouble later, I suggest you decide who you want to be with."

Brad remained silent but I heard him think, *I've always been so careful, who did she have following me!?*

"Oh, just so you know." I said, smiling teasingly. "You need to keep in mind that my dad runs a multi-billion dollar research company that includes spy satellites and miniature camera technology. If I were less of a girl, well, use your imagination."

With that, I walked away from him, knowing that I had really scared him without losing my temper. As I walked away from him, I also realized what some people had thought about me and decided that I should at least try to make some peace with those closest to me. The only question was who?
151121.title: Remain calm

1511211.content:
I decided that the easiest would be Marisol, since she lives with us. I headed downstairs to see her. I found her in the kitchen, getting a start on dinner while watching her novelas. "Marisol?" I asked. "C-can I talk to you for a second?"

*Right in the middle of my stories,* she thought. "What is it, child?" she asked.

"I... I don't know if I've ever told you," I said, "but I'm really grateful for all you've done for me. I've come to think of you as like a second mother to me. After all, you've been there for me, even when my folks spend all their time out of town."

"That is my job, Caitlin," she said, adding in her thoughts, *while your parents do God knows what.*

I started to tear up. "I... I've come to realize that... maybe I've been taking too many things for granted. But I don't want to take you for granted, Marisol."

As she stood there, saying nothing, thinking nothing, I hugged her. "Thank you, Marisol. I love you."

We stood there for a while, just hugging. I could tell that Marisol loved me, too. How strange it suddenly seemed, that I was closer emotionally to someone my parents considered the hired help than I was to my own flesh and blood.

I broke off the hug, and left Marisol to return to fixing dinner. Another time, I promised myself, I'd help her. For now, I wanted to think of how many people I'd wronged with my insensitivity, and figure out how best to make things right.
1511211.title: Marisol.

15112112.content:
I hadn't gotten far in my soul-searching, when Trish paid a visit. "How you doing, Cait?" she asked.

At that moment, I felt so alone. I realized that, apart from Marisol, I'd been closest to Trish. Perhaps i could trust her with my secret? "Trish," I asked, "can I let you in on the biggest secret of your life?"

"Of course, Cait," she replied. "We grew up together. You could always tell me everything."

I took a deep breath. "Well, for a start, you know I used to dye my hair, right?"

"Of course. But what do you mean, you used to?"

"I... kinda don't need to, anymore." I lifted the wig from my head.

"Cait!" She gingerly touched my scalp, as if afraid she might damage it. "What happened? Did the chemicals in that 'Plutonium' stuff do this to you? If they did, you could sue them."

"I don't think that's what happened."

"How come?"

"That's the main part of the secret." I decided to try something. Locking eyes with her, I tried to send the thought, *Can you 'hear' me?*

Her eyes widened. "How... how did you do that?"

I shrugged. "I just found out that I can read minds. You're the first one I tried sharing my own thoughts with."

"You... you can read minds? What are you findig out?"

"For a start," I answered, "I've found out that i've been kind of a jerk. If I ever treated you like that, Trish, I apologize."

"No need," she said. "What else?"

I paused. "You know your boyfriend, Brad?"

"How did you... oh, wait, you can read minds. Of course. What about him?"

"He's been two-timing. While he's been sleeping with you,... he and I have been dating."

"What?"

"We never did anything physical," I said. "When I first found out what he was up to, I wondered if you were in on it. But his thoughts told me that you were being played, just like me."

"Cait," she said, "if I'd known, for a second, that he was seeing you, I never would've given him a second look. I want you to know that."

"I do, Trish. I don't need to read your mind to know that." The two of us embraced.

As we hugged, I saw something amazing. It was like I was there, but I wasn't.

I was looking inside Trish's bathroom. Trish was there. She was holding a pregnancy test.

I couldn't see the results. But, if her deer-in-the headlights expression was any clue, I could guess what it said.

My mind snapped back to the present, and I reeled. Telepathy, and now seeing the future. What do I do with this?
15112112.title: A visit from Trish

151121121.content:
I looked at Trish for the longest time, tears forming as I did not know how to tell her that I sense she was about discover she was pregnant. She returned my gaze, becoming more and more concerned. "Cait, you... you're scaring me." she said. "What's going through your head right now?"

I sighed then placed a light hand onto her shoulder. "Trish, I have a feeling that your life is about to change in a big way." I said, gently. "If I am right, I give you my word that I will help you all I can."

Trish looked at me as if I was losing my mind then turned pale, fearing a number of possibilities as she began to sob. "Cait, please tell me what you see." she said. "You are really scaring me right now."

I gave Trish a guilty look, tearing up myself. "I'd take a pregnancy test if I were you." I told her. "I can sense two minds within you and I doubt you have two brains...."

Trish turned white with horror and began to cry hysterically. I tried to pull her into a hug but she pushed me away, becoming irrational. "No!! You're lying!" she screamed. "You have to be lying!!"

With that, she ran off, crying. I winced, wondering what could have caused her to react like that and thought of Brian and heard his thoughts from where ever he was at the time, *It's best I dump them both before I get one of them pregnant, I'm too good looking to be weighed down by some useless girl...*

My blood began to boil as I then understood why Trish was so upset, Brian had dumped her, not realizing that she was already carrying his child. "She is going to be devastated!" I thought. "What can I do?"

What does Caitlin do?
151121121.title: Tell Trish

1511211212.content:
I decided it would be best if I let Trish find her own way for a bit. I knew what was scaring her, and my presence wouldn't change what was coming.

About an hour later, Trish called my cell phone. When I answered, she asked, "How... how did you know?"

"When we were hugging," I replied, "I got a vision. I saw you in your bathroom, looking at a pregnancy test. I couldn't see the results, but your face looked like your voice sounds."

"Cait," she said, "I can't take care of a baby on my own. What am I going to do?"

"I promised you I'd help you, in any way you wanted. That still goes."

"You... you said you sensed its mind... what's it like?"

"You ever hear one of those weird radio stations where they just beep at you? It's kind of like that. It's not conscious, but the brain is starting to form. Kind of like baby steps, but with the brain."

"Cait," she said, "I'm scared. While I was waiting for the test, Brad texted me that he was breaking up with me. Now what am I going to do?"

"If you want," I said, "the two of us can go and confront Brad, let him know that what he was most scared of has happened. Or we can just hang out for a while. Marisol always makes plenty of food, so I'm sure she won't mind if I have you over."

She was silent for so long, I wondered if we'd gotten disconnected. Then, she said,...
1511211212.title: Give Trish some space

15112112121.content:
With a small amount of concentration, I knew exactly where to find Brad and summoned my body guard, a tall and very powerful man named Jon McGrath. "Mistress, you rang?" he asked.

I immediately heard his thoughts, *I was so close to getting tickets to the big wrestling match tonight! Arrgh!*

"John, I will get you front row seats to the big wrestling match tonight if you can help me with one small problem." I said, firmly. "My boy friend as been two timing on me with my best friend, she did not know."

John nodded, though I knew he was cheering inside, anxious to get the tickets he was after. *Front row seats!? Those are near impossible to get! She must really want me to rough this kid up. or at least give him a good scare.* I heard him think before he asked, "What do want me to do with young Brad?"

I smiled. "Just make sure he doesn't do anything stupid while I confront him." I replied. "He got Trish pregnant, she got the results just before he text her, saying that he was dumping her."

*That insensitive jerk!* came Jon's thoughts. "He will make no move against you or your friend, my dear." he said. "Shall I drive you to his location, I have a GPS signal on him, there is no where he can hide."

"Let's go." I said.

Ten minutes later, you and Trish were sitting down with Brad at the food court inside Our Founders Mall with Jon watching him like a hawk. "What is this all about?" asked Brad. "I dumped you both, get over it."

*They just can't let me go.* I heard him think. *What a bunch of love deprived losers!*

I turned red at that thought, tempted to hit him with something but I decided to give him a chance to take responsibility and accept his child. "Brad, there is something important you must know." I said.

Trish took a breath and added, "I'm pregnant."

Brad's eyes bugged out as the look of horror was clear on his face. *Oh, crap!* then he composed himself, clearing this throat. *Think fast, you idiot!* I heard him think to himself. *There has to be a way out of this mess!*

Finally, he sighed. "I highly doubt you are carrying my baby." he said to her despair. "If you can cheat on your best friend, what makes me believe you never cheated on me with someone else?"

Trish began to cry. "You are the only one I slept with." she said, honestly. "No one else."

I knew that she was telling the truth and I also knew that Brad was in sheer desperate panic. "You're a liar!" he screamed. "You got banged by some other guy and now you're trying to throw it all on me!? You are on your own!"

With that, he rose to leave. John moved to stop him but you motioned him to let him go while Trish cried into her hands. "I hope you feel everything she does you son of a bitch!" I thought, not knowing that anger was increasing the power behind my ability. "A pregnancy of your own should serve you some justice quite well."

Then, I felt a rush through your head before Brad stumbled slightly then threw up where he stood, clutching his stomach, moaning. As I watched him stumble away, i wondered if i had actually given him a phantom pregnancy.

Later that day...
15112112121.title: Meet Brad

151121121211.content:
As Jon drove us back to Trish's house, I whipped out my cell. "What are you doing?" Trish asked.

"I promised Jon I'd get him front-row tickets for the wrestling show tonight," I replied. "A bottomless credit card has its advantages."

"I wish I could agree," she said. "My folks are uber-strict. I wish they were as cool as your parents."

"They're not cool," I replied. "Marisol has done most of my parenting. Sometimes, I wonder if they'd even notice if I'd gotten pregnant." It was true. As long as I didn't mess up the house, or damage any of the furniture or artwork, they didn't give a second thought to what I was up to.

Once we got in the front door, I found out what Trish meant by "uber-strict". Her mom greeted us, brandishing the pregnancy test as if it were evidence in a murder trial. "What is this, young lady?"

"I'm pregnant," Trish said. "The guy was dating my friend behind my back, and now he wants nothing to do with either of us."

"How could you?" her mom exploded. "How could you do this to us?" I'll give her this much, she wasn't really lying. Her thoughts were about how having an unwed pregnant teen would make them look to their friends.

"To me," Trish said. "I did it to me. Unless you're the one who's going to have this baby, it's not happening to you."
151121121211.title: Caitlin takes Trish home.

1511211212112.content:
That didn't soothe her mom's mood any. "Your father is an important man in this town, young lady," she said. "How is it going to look, having an unwed mother under our roof?"

"I can't think about what your stupid friends think," Trish said. "I've got enough to worry about."

"Really? How about where you're going to be sleeping? Because you certainly won't be doing that here!"

Trish looked like she'd just been punched in the gut. "M-Mom?"

"Collect your things," she said, "and get out of my house."

I walked with Trish to her room. "It's okay, Trish," I told her. "You can stay at my house, until this blows over. I'll smooth it over with my folks."

As we reached her bedroom door, her brother, Matt, came over to us. "What's the yelling about?"

"Mom just kicked me out."

"What? Why?"

"I... I'm pregnant."

I nodded. "Brad knocked her up, and dumped her."

"What?" I heard him thinking, *Tell me where he is. I know a guy who can get me access to a boiler. Even if they figure out I'm involved, they'll never find the body.*

"We'll handle it, Matt," I said. "Right now, Trish will be staying at my house. Help us move her things?"

"Absolutely."

We picked up some of Trish's clothes, and brought them over to my house. "Drop Matt off at his house," I told Jon. "Then, you can enjoy the show."

"Thank you, ma'am," he said, thinking, *I hope I get to see that punk, Sterling Fortune, get his butt kicked.*
1511211212112.title: Trish's mom throws her out

15112112121121.content:
Upon walking into my mansion home with Trish and two large boxes, we were immediately greeted by Marisol who looked at us with deep concern. "What happened, Caitlin?" she asked.

With genuine tears forming, I replied, "My boyfriend got my friend pregnant, then dumped her! Now her own mom kicked her out of her house, she has no place to go, Marisol!"

Marisol sighed and I heard her think, *She's finally finding her heart...* then she turned to Trish. "Don't you worry about a thing, my dear." she said. "We'll get you set up into a nice room and help you through this."

Trish dropped her box of belongings and hugged Marisol tightly. "Thank you, ma'am!" she wailed, crying. "I promise I'll earn my keep, I'll help with the chores and everything!"

"We'll both help with the chores." I said, surprising Marisol. "It might be fun."

*I'm going to faint!* I heard Marisol think. *She's like a completely different person.*

"Trish needs my support, Marisol." I said, turning to her. "I know that I was a jerk in the past but... recent events have caused to to stop and think about what is really important." I smiled. "Friendship."

Marisol smiled. *She's finally growing up* I heard her think. *I'm so proud of her..*

"I'm going to make you proud of me, Marisol." I said, as if to guess her thoughts. "It's past time I grow up."

Marisol nodded then picked up the box that Trish had dropped. "Come, girls." she said. "I'll help you get settled in and then you can both help me with the afternoon dishes."

Trish and I both smiled. "Yes, ma'am."

I tried not to giggle as I then heard Marisol think, *I could get used to this.*
15112112121121.title: Setting up Trish's new room

151121121211211.content:
Sweeping and mopping three rooms left me panting. Two things kept me going: I didn't want to make Trish work harder, on account of her pregnancy, and I felt like a jerk for just letting Marisol take care of it all these years.

"How are you holding up?" Trish asked, as she joined me in my impromptu break.

"Okay, I guess," I replied. "I had no idea housework involved so much... work." I examined my hands. "What's with these rough spots?"

Trish checked them out. "Those are calluses," she explained. "It means you've been working."

I had been horrified at the calluses. Knowing they came from work, though, somehow made me feel better about them. They weren't just given to me, after all. I had earned them.

Trish pulled me out of my thoughts. "What do you think I should do?"

"About what?"

"The baby," she said, one hand on her belly. "I know there's no way I can be a mom, but I'm not sure I want to... "

I didn't need to read her mind to know what she meant. "What about giving it up for adoption? You'd know it had a good home. Maybe they'd even let you visit, if you wanted."

She hugged me. "You're such a good friend, Cait. If I didn't have you, I'd probably be trying to find a place to live, cursing the day Brad was born."

Suddenly, I got another psychic vision. I saw Brad, in his bathroom. He had his shirt off, and was staring in the mirror, at his strangely swollen nipples.

He was puzzled by the swelling, but I recognized it. I had seen it myself, when my breasts started to grow.

"Um... I'm not sure how to say this." I told Trish. "But I think I goofed."

Trish looked at me, startled. "Don't scare me, Caitlin, what do you mean you goofed!?" she asked, knowing about my powers. "What happened, what did you do?"

I was not sure if I could share what I could see but I did not want there to be any secrets between Trish and myself, I needed an ally and I was not going to keep her as one by keeping anything from her. "See for yourself." I said, touching her head. "It's Brad.... do you see him?"

I knew Trish could see what I could by the way her eyes widened. "He's growing... breasts?" she asked, almost whispering, "How is that possible?"

"When Brad walked away from us after confronting him, I sort of wished he could feel what you are going through." I said, blushing brightly. "The second I wished that, he stumbled for a second, then threw up where he stood."

Trish took in a gasp as she then saw Brad running to the toilet before throwing up, looking miserable. "How can a boy be, I mean who could you have made him... pregnant?" she asked, horrified.

"I don't think its pregnancy, not really." I replied, shaking my head. "I think I just forced a psychological and physical condition onto him known as a phantom or sympathetic pregnancy."

Trish giggled, her mood improving as she watched Brad, still confused and startled by his 'illness'. "I say its more of a pathetic pregnancy." she said, smiling. "It suits him."

"I not so sure." you said, worried. "I don't know how strong my powers are or what they are really capable of..."

Seeing my concern, Trish took a step away, breaking the link between us. At first, I thought she was going to be angry but, to my surprise, she smiled. "Why don't we keep an eye on him for a while, using your powers." she suggested. "If anything goes seriously wrong, we can get him to a hospital or try to undo what you had done."

I released a breath, not realizing that I had been holding it since Trish took a step away from me. "That sounds good, Trish, we'll do that." I said. "Maybe this experience will teach Brad a lesson."

"Maybe." agreed Trish. "Can I see Brad again?"

I smiled and lightly touched her head again, revealing Brad, still in his bathroom. We both giggled as we saw him still staring at his swollen nipples. *It's only the beginning, handsome.* I heard Trish think.

"He is so going to freak out as the week progresses." I thought to her.

Trish blushed, remembering that I could read minds, then giggled with me until...

... I had to break the link.

"I can't," I said. "Maybe it's the housework, or maybe I'm just getting used to my... abilities, but I'm too beat to keep this up."

"All of it. Like I said, I look different." I removed my false eyelashes, then began to disrobe. "You want the first shower?"

She didn't say anything. She just watched as I took off my clothes.

Once I was naked, I grabbed my bath things and threw on my bathrobe. Before I tied it shut, I turned to face Trish. "You okay?"

At first, I thought Trish was going to scream, judging by the way she was looking at me but then, I heard her thoughts. *Oh... my... god! She looks like a doll...* Then, without another thought, she suddenly kissed me on the cheek and pulled me into a warm hug. I don't know why but it caused me to break down and I began to sob onto her shoulders while she cried with me.

Then, I heard Trish's thoughts coming in clearly. *She would look cute with tattooed eyebrows.*

I shook my head. "I know that Macy's department store, is hiring people to serve as 'living displays' but is it for me?"

Trish gave me another kiss on the cheek. "Give it some thought while you shower up." she said. "We can tell Marisol that you had got yourself a job."

Trish and I sat down to dinner. As Marisol began walking away, I said, "Marisol, why don't you sit with us?"

She demurred. "That's alright, Caitlin, I really couldn't." She thought, *If the Spencers thought I'd overstepped my bounds, I'd lose my green card before I left the house.*

"If it upsets you so much," I said, "I won't ask again. I just wanted to ask you about some things, and I thought it'd be easier if we ate together."

Trying not to laugh, I said, "I'm willing to try."

She shrugged. "If that's what you want to do, then you should try it. Did... you have any other questions?"

"Yes, I do," I said. "What would you think about me having eyebrows tattooed on?"

That shocked her. "I don't know, child," she said. "It's my understanding, though, that you would need your parents' permission for such a thing." Her thoughts continued, *And they'd give you permission to join a brothel before they'd let you get a tattoo.*

As I started getting ready for bed, I heard a knock on my door. "You still up?" Trish asked.

"Sure," I replied. "Come on in."

Trish came in, in her nightgown. "I'm still getting used to the layout," she said. "If I have to live here until the baby's born, I could get used to this." She took one of my pillows, and stuffed it up her nightgown, making her belly look bigger. "What do you think? Is it me?"

"You'll get through this just fine," I told her.

"You okay? You seem a little... distant."

"I was thinking. You know that one guy who decided he wanted to be a girl?"

"You mean Alyssa?" Trish was always good with names. Plus, I had never bothered to memorize it.

"Yeah, Alyssa. I used to think that Alyssa was just some freak gaming the system, figuring out a way to get into the girls' locker room.

"With all that's happened to me lately, though, I've started to reconsider. Maybe she's just trying to do what she can, and her own body isn't cooperating. I've got to find a way to make it up to her."

"I know her, Cait. Just treat her like one of the girls. That's all she wants."

"Maybe." I changed the subject. "Want to see how Brad's doing, one last time before bed?"

"Sure."

I touched Trish's head, then reached out to Brad's mind. Soon, we were seeing through his eyes.

Brad must have felt a little better, as he was fixing himself a snack. He had just finished dishing himself a bowl of ice cream, and he opened the refrigerator.

He started reaching for the chocolate syrup, but he stopped when he spotted something else. Without hesitation, he grabbed a jar of relish and began to pour it onto the ice cream.

I broke off contact. "I do not need to see the rest of that."

"Cravings," Trish said. She pulled my pillow back out of her nightgown. "Thanks, Cait. I'll let you go to bed, now."

"Where are you going?"

"Believe it or not," she said, "that made me hungry." With a smile, she closed the door behind her.
