Early the next morning, I got up before Marisol came to wake me and took a shower. I did my best to get myself clean as Marisol usually always bathed me. "I can't believe how lazy I had been before this... change." I thought, embarrassed. "Well, that all changes today, I am going to make Marisol proud of me."

Then I thought about what I had heard from Marisol's mind. It was a shock to me that, after all these years, my family had not pushed to make her a citizen. As I toweled myself dry and placed on an even coat of baby powder to the inside my panties, so to ensure freshness, I decided to make that happen for her. I grabbed my cellphone from the sink counter and dialed a number.

"Hank, this is Caitlin." I said sternly. "Why has Marisol not been made a citizen yet?"

The response I received shocked me. "Because your parents wanted her to stay, watching you for as long as possible."

I turned red, angry with my parents for doing such a thing but instead of lashing out with my mind, I leaned towards defiance. "I do not care what my parents instructed, you are my lawyer, under my pay!!, you will do I as say!!"

"Yes, ma'am." came an immediate response.

"You will push the paperwork to make Marisol Martino Sanchez a citizen of this nation! Make it happen by the end of this week or start typing your resume!"

With that said, I smacked my cellphone shut just before i heard Marisol's thoughts. This caused me to swallow hard as I sensed she was right outside the bathroom door, she had heard everything I had said...

*She's pushing to make me a citizen.* I heard her think. *At long last, I going to be a citizen!*

Then, I heard her starting to cry and I opened the door, still looking pale. "I... I just found out from my lawyer what mom and dad had been doing to you, Marisol." I said, crying myself. "It's not right... so I'm fixing it."

Marisol cried freely as she gave me a warm hug. *Now I know I've been raising her right.* I heard her think. *She's doing what feels is right to her heart, not her wallet.*

"Um... Marisol, could you help me apply for this job?" I asked. "I'm a little nervous."

Marisol smiled, looking at the way I had dressed for the interview. "Well, first you need to understand that, to an employer, you need them not the other way around as they can hire anyone so a good first impression is needed."

"That makes sense." I said. "Am I dressed right to make that good impression?"

Marisol giggled. *At least she's trying.* "A mini skirt and tank top will get a boy's attention but not that of an employer." she said, smiling. "Come with me, I have a few outfits that might work."

I followed Marisol to her bedroom where she opened her closet to reveal a small wardrobe of clothing. "You have so little clothing." I said, raising a hand to my mouth. "Why?"

Marisol shrugged. "I rarely get out so..."

Tearing up again, I made a decision and took Marisol by the hand, surprising her. "You are like a mother to me, Marisol, my real mom and dad have been totally unfair to you." I paused, smiling at her. "It's time I make them pay up."

Marisol turned white, pulling away from me. "Caitlin, I could get fired over this...."

I shook my head. "Not after my lawyer reminds them that they can get sued for everything they own by denying your right to citizenship after all these years." I said, confidently. "Can we say P.R. nightmare?"

Marisol grinned, tears forming once again. "In that case, I wouldn't mind some new clothes...."

I giggled and again took Marisol's hand. "Let's get Trish and make this a girls day out!"

"Well, all of a sudden, yesterday, I started throwing up, and my... my nipples swelled up on me. And, today, I woke up like this." He lifted his shirt. What had been swollen nipples were now small but definite breasts.

The doctor made noises as he examined Brad's breasts. "Has the nausea continued?"

Brad's mother asked, "What's the matter with my boy?"

"Well," the doctor said, "it's not very common, but I've seen a condition like this. However, I've never seen it in a boy so young."

He experiences morning sickness, he starts putting on weight around the midsection, he may even find himself lactating."

Brad gulped.

"Good afternoon, miss Spencer." she said politely. "I'm curious as to why a girl who is worth twenty billion dollars is interested applying for a job with our company as a living mannequin."

"To help my self esteem." I replied, removing my wig.

Rachel gasped. "What happened to you?"

"I am not entirely certain." I replied, honestly. "A few days ago, I woke up to find I had lost all of my hair, including my eyebrows and eyelashes." I sighed. "I am hoping that by playing the role as a mannequin, I can get used to people staring at me and rebuild my self confidence."

Rachel gently touched my forehead then pulled back. "Your skin is nearly flawless." she complimented. "Do you think you can stand perfectly still for four hours at a time, between breaks?"

"I'll give it my best shot, ma'am." I replied. "I really want a shot at this job."

Rachel sighed and I heard her think, *The poor girl, I'd be still freaking if that happened to me.* "I think you will do nicely, Miss Spencer." she said. "We will start you out in the women's swim wear department."

I blushed slightly at that. "Swim wear?" I asked.

Rachel nodded. "What better place to rebuild your confidence than to have people stare at you, wearing noting but a fashionable bikini?" she asked, smiling. "I could have placed you in the lingerie department."

I was feeling slightly nervous but smiled, my tension falling, as I heard her think, *If she can stand perfectly still, no one would even guess she was really alive.*

"I accept your offer, ma'am." I said, offering my hand. "When do I start?"

*That's a brave girl.* I heard Rachel think. "You start Monday of next week." she said, shaking my hand. "That will give you some time to prepare as I would like you to stand without your wig, to make you more like a true mannequin." she released me then added, "I just need you to fill out some paper work and then you will be free to go." she then handed me the paperwork and quietly left the office.

"You got the job!?" asked Trish, excited. "That's great, congratulations!"

"Thanks, Trish." I replied. "I will be standing in the women's swim wear department without my wig and painted eyebrows and eyelashes to make me look more like a true mannequin."

"Well, it could have been worse." said Marisol, smiling. "They could have placed you in the lingerie department."

I smiled back at her. "That's what Rachel said." I giggled. "I'm hoping that this job will help my self esteem and, by helping with the chores on the weekends, give you at least one day off a week, Marisol."

*That would be wonderful.* I heard Marisol think. "If you think you can handle it." she said.

I laughed. "I'll give it my best shot." I replied.

Meanwhile, inside Brad's house, Brad looked at himself in the mirror with a sense of concern. "I haven't needed to shave it the past three days." he said to himself. "My skin never felt smoother, I wonder what's up..."

"And no telling what all I have to avoid doing."

151121121211211122211211112.title: The girls return home.

1511211212112111222112111122.content:
I saw Brad, with a belly of a three month pregnant woman, using a razor blade to cut open his wrist as tears flowed down his face. The color completely ran from my skin as I immediately called out with my mind, "Brad, stop!"

The image changed, I saw Brad no longer cutting his wrist but standing in his bedroom, looking about frightened and confused. "Who... who's there?" he asked.

Instead of answering with my mind, I grabbed my cellphone and dialed his house number. Three rings later, I got his mom. "Hello?"

"Ms Hawk, this is Caitlin."

"Oh, hi, Caitlin." said Cyndi. "How are you doing?"

"I'm fine but please listen, this is an emergency." I said.

"I'm listening." replied Cyndi, her voice showing concern.

"I had used a body wash called 'Plutonium' which, ironically was found to have plutonium in it." I said, quickly. "It caused all of my hair to fall out, all of it."

"Oh, my..." said Cyndi. "Any other effects?"

"This product was yanked off the shelves but doctors have no idea what effects it may carry." serious, I replied. "But you need to know... Brad had used the same body wash. I only found out about this recently as I had my private investigators look into my major hair loss."

"Brad was exposed to radiation from a body wash!?" startled Cyndi asked. then she gasped, hearing Brad yell in his room. "Thank you for the heads up, Caitlin, I have to go!"

With that, she hung up....
1511211212112111222112111122.title: Someone contemplating suicide

15112112121121112221121111221.content:
Cyndi ran up the stairs to Brad's room to find that his belly had expanded considerably, making him look as if he were three months pregnant. There were tears in his eyes as he was holding a razor blade in his hand. "Brad, stop!" Cyndi screamed.

"I... I can't be pregnant, mom!" cried Brad, clearly distraught. "I'm a boy!"

"It's an illness, honey." said Cyndi, thinking quickly. "Caused by exposure to some new plutonium they had placed into that new body wash; Caitlin just called, giving me the heads up." she paused, not wanting to scare him with what I had told her. We will have the doctor look into it when he runs his next series of tests."

Brad looked at his mom, uncertain but eventually surrendered the razor blade. Cyndi placed it aside then pulled her son into a warm hug, causing him to explode into tears. "It'll be okay, Brad." said Cyndi, rocking him. "We'll get through this..."

Meanwhile, inside my bedroom, I released a breath, relieved that Brad was not going to kill himself but I wondered if telling his mom about the plutonium or of my hair loss was a wise decision. "At least he's still alive." I thought. "I'd hate to discover that my power had caused someone's death."

As I allowed Brad's mind go, I sensed something inside of him that caused me to turn pale as a chill ran down my spine. There was a presence. "Oh my God!" I whispered, shaking. "Could I have actually made Brad pregnant!?!"

Then, as I looked into Brad's mind again...
15112112121121112221121111221.title: A plausible explanation.

151121121211211122211211112211.content:
*Not exactly.*

I blinked. *Who is this?*

*My name is Zamora. Don't be afraid. I've been helping you teach Brad a lesson.*

*I'm confused,* I replied. *How did you get there? And how are you helping?*

*I've been sharing Brad's body since his birth,* came the reply. *I was quite irritated by his behavior with you and Trish. When I caught your thought about him experiencing pregnancy, I decided to make it happen.*

*You... live in people's bodies?*

*Correct. My people share the bodies of selected humans. When Brad was conceived, I, as an egg, entered the developing fetus.*

*So, why didn't you make him act differently? Or at least leave him for another host body?*

*We cannot influence people's behavior. As for finding another host, our separation would kill him. As deplorable as he has been, his behavior doesn't warrant death.*

*Are there any other beings like yourself?*

*Yes. Trish carries one of my young in her unborn child. And I detect the thought patterns of another of my race, quite near yours.*

I gulped. *How... how near?*

Another voice answered, *Right here, inside you.*
151121121211211122211211112211.title: A voice said, 'Not quite'.

1511211212112111222112111122111.content:
I nearly fainted, realizing that I was not, nor ever, alone. *Who are you people?*

*Remain calm, Caitlin.* replied the voice. *I am Amatra. Like Zamora, I live within you, usually undetected as a guardian and a silent guide.*

*Are you the one who gave me my mental powers?* I asked or rather thought.

*No, I did not do this, not directly.* replied Amatra. *I shielded you from the rare plutonium would have otherwise killed us both. It was the combination of the radiation and my mental shield that had forever changed your body and mind.*

*Unfortunately, my efforts to save Brian were not as successful.* said Zamora with a sad tone to her voice. *I did save his life but some radiation got through and it is slowly poisoning us.* she giggled. *I am correcting the problem, teaching him a lesson in the process.*

I smiled as all of the pieces were finally beginning to fall into place. *So, this pregnancy is really you repairing his body?* I asked.

*Correct.* replied Zamora. *The morning sickness is his body ridding itself of any contaminated nutrients, the food cravings is the replacement of those lost nutrients.*

*What of the breast development and swollen pregnant belly?* I asked.

*What would develop fully into the female uterus is present in men as a vestigial organ hanging off the prostate gland.* replied Zamora. *In females, the uterus filters out most ailments that would normally be transferred to the fetus...*

*You gave Brad a uterus!?* you thought, giggling.

*For the soul purpose of filtering out the radiation that is currently poisoning us.* replied Zamora. *I could have done this less dramatically but he needs to learn a lesson in trifling with a woman's heart.*

*Do you have any other questions, Caitlin?* asked Amatra. *This conversation is quickly draining us.*

Realizing you had been keeping the link up longer than intended, you quickly thought back, *Just one more question, where do you all come from?*

How does Amatra respond?
1511211212112111222112111122111.title: Continue

choices: Tell Trish only part of the story
15112112121121112221121111221111.content:
*It is too complicated to explain now,* Amatra said. *Perhaps another time. I must rest, now.*

*Alright,* I sent. *I'll let the two of you go. Take care of Brad, Zamora.*

*I will,* she replied. *By the end of this process, Brad will be healthy, and he will know exactly what Trish is going through.*

I was relieved to know that Brad would be alright. Then, some thoughts struck me.

First, I would need to dispose of the clothes I'd been wearing when I was dosed with the plutonium. Since they'd been sitting in my hamper, that meant I'd have to get rid of the rest of the clothes in the hamper, too, as well as the hamper itself. The last thing I wanted was for Trish or Marisol to get a dose of the stuff. I would have to find out the proper method of disposal.

Second, I knew Trish would want to know about Brad, as well. However, telling her the truth would mean telling her that her baby was carrying the egg of one of the creatures. I had no idea how she might react to the news. I'd overextended my psychic powers for the day, so I'd get no warnings from the future.

I curled up in bed, hoping the right way would come to me in my sleep.
15112112121121112221121111221111.title: Too long to explain now.

151121121211211122211211112211111.content:
I felt as though Trish had been kept in the dark about too many things for too long and deserved to know the truth so I walked over to her room and knocked on the open door. "May I come in, we need to talk."

"Sure." said Trish, sitting on her bed.

I walked in and sat down next to her. "This is going to seem very strange but I need you to know that it is the truth." I told her, seriously. "My powers did not come from just that new plutonium I had my men dispose of this morning."

Trish gave me an uncertain look. "Where else did they come from?" she asked.

"I have an... err... entity, living inside of me." I explained. "It's telepathic, I spoke to it."

Trish's eyes widened as she was not sure what to think. "It... spoke to you?" she asked.

"It protected me from the radiation and acidic properties of the new plutonium but, in the process, 'upgraded' my brain to levels that matched its own." I said. "The only draw back was the loss of all of my hair but that's better than dying."

"Well, yeah." said Trish, confused and disturbed. "What else did it say?"

You know that Brian was exposed to the same plutonium, right?" I asked. Trish nodded. "Well, there is an entity inside of him as well but, it took my suggestion and had activated a vestigial uterus to filter out the radiation." I giggled. "In doing this, Brad is experiencing all the symptoms of pregnancy."

I went on to explain the symptoms and what was actually happening to Brad. After hearing it, Trish laughed. "So, this entity, inside Brad, is teaching him a lesson while saving his life." she said. "That's karma for you."

I laughed as well but quickly became serious. "Here is the last part of what I was told." I said. "There is another entity, inside of you."

"There's one in me?" asked Trish, surprised.

I nodded. "More specifically, inside your unborn child." I said. "Brad passed it on."

Trish paled but I quickly pulled her into a hug. "These entities saved my life, they will keep your child safe as well."

"I... I don't know what to think about all this." said Trish. "It's a bit much."

"It's a bit much for me too." I said, honestly. "I have a million questions for this entity but, so far, the answers I get raise even more questions." I then smiled. "I'll talk to it again in the morning, let you talk to it yourself."

Trish nodded. "Okay."
151121121211211122211211112211111.title: Tell Trish the whole thing

1511211212112111222112111122111111.content:
The following morning, my first day of work at Macy's, I got up early and showered before getting dressed. Once I was ready, I checked the clock and found I had an hour before I had to be at work so I walked to Trish's room to find the door open and her already dressed. "didn't you sleep at all?" I asked, worried.

"I slept." said Trish, looking drained. "But I kept getting woken up by the sounds of a baby crying and cooing in my head." she yawned. "I think the stress is starting to get to me."

*It's not the stress* came Amara's voice.

Trish jumped, looking about. "Who said that!?" she asked, knowing it was not your thought voice.

*I am Amara, the sentinel that lives within Caitlin.* replied Amara, calmly. *The sentinel within your unborn child is named Tamera, all sentinels are female. What you were hearing was Tamera learning to talk, through your mental connection to her, a connection that will help you keep your daughter safe.*

Trish sighed. "Well, at least I now know what to shop for." she said.

Amara giggled. *We came from another world, one that is no longer there.* she said. *Very long story short, the women are the intellectuals, the males are the brawn. Our spacecraft crash landed on your planet centuries ago, all the men died to preserve ours but their efforts were not enough.*

"What happened?" asked Trish.

*In a desperate effort to survive, we each basically reduced ourselves to living energy and teleported ourselves into random people throughout the globe.* replied Amara. *Our species lives up to ten thousand years or more but we are not immortal, our lives are directly linked to our host so we reproduce with them.*

"In return for their 'room and board', they provide wisdom and protection to their host." I added.

Trish nodded, looking more relaxed. "I do not fear you." she said. "I was just concerned about my child."

*Your daughter is safe and will be kept that way.* said Amara. *I must rest now, good day.*

I turned to Trish and smiled. "At least now you know your baby will come out healthy."

Trish smiled. "That takes a lot of worry off my shoulders." she said, honestly. "We better get you to work."

Thirty minutes later, I was standing on a display mount, frozen in a casual pose, wearing a bikini swim suit. Through self training, I no longer blushed, thinking about the fact I was standing in front of people in a store wearing a bikini as it was my job to be a living mannequin. "This is actually fun." I thought to myself. "The things that people think in this town."

One boy, no older than twelve, walked passed with his older sister and looked up at me. I heard the girl's thoughts and nearly laughed but I remained perfectly still and silent. "If Jason makes one more joke about girls' clothes, I swear he'll be wearing them!"

As the hours passed, I gained much practice in shutting out all thoughts, focusing on one person's thoughts, and just allowing all thoughts to pour in without giving me a headache. Then, just before my lunch break, I saw Alyssa Vance walk into the lingerie department with her older sister, Beth and their mom. I innerly winced, knowing her mom was confined to a wheel chair due to a car accident. I discretely looked within her and was pleased to find she was healthy but sad that I could nothing to help her regain her mobility to walk again.

As I watched them, I noticed that Alyssa, formerly, Gary, looked far more feminine than the last time I saw him/her and my curiosity rose. Still, I focused on keeping their thoughts out of my mind for the moment and I listened to them talk about swimsuits. Suddenly, Beth turned to me and nudged Alyssa.

"Hey, Lyssa, check this out." said Beth.

Alyssa walked over from the swimsuits she was looking at and looked at me as well for a moment before blurting out, "Holy cow! It looks like Cait Spenser!"

"Except she's got hair," Beth said.

Alyssa nodded. "And she keeps her nose higher in the air." she added.

It took all I had to stop myself from wincing as I had teased Alyssa in the past but then, she surprised me..

"Come on, girls," lectured their mom. "I thought I raised you two better than to say mean things about people, behind their backs."

As they stopped, I saw a dream like smile form on Alyssa's facer as I heard her think, *I wonder what Cait would say, if she knew I had finally turned into a real girl?*

Hearing that thought, my curiosity got the best of me and I looked inside of her. I was stunned to find that she was indeed a real, true girl! Somehow, she had actually managed to completely change her gender. I inwardly smiled, very happy for her. Wanting to make up for, at least, some teasing, I thought back, *Congratulations.*

Alyssa stopped in her tracks and looked around. Seeing no one, she left to pay for her selections. It was not for another hour before I was finally allowed to clock out for lunch. "So, how is your first day? asked my manage, Mr. Erwin.

"It was... educational." I replied, to his confusion.

The rest of the day went smoothly and I returned home.
1511211212112111222112111122111111.title: The next morning.

15112112121121112221121111221111112.content:
"I'm as amazed by this as you are, Brad," his doctor said.

"You couldn't be," he replied. He now looked to be about five months along. Other changes troubled him more. His cheekbones were more pronounced, and his lips were fuller. His eyes were changing color, from green to brown. His hair was getting longer and darker, as well.

"If your 'condition' keeps proceeding at this rate," the doctor continued, "it looks like you'll be full-term by the end of the weekend."

"Who knows?" his mom added. "Maybe you can go back to school, right on schedule."

"Assuming I want to." Brad flinched as his voice cracked. Would his voice get higher, too, to match the rest of his changes?

"All I can say for sure," said the doctor, "is that whatever's happening to Brad looks like pregnancy. However, ultrasound shows that there is no fetus. I can't say what's caused his condition, or the accompanying transformation. We'll keep him here, under observation, until this process completes itself."

His mother and doctor left the room. Brad got out of bed, and walked over to the bathroom mirror. Looking at his changing face, he saw a distinct resemblance to Trish. Trish, he thought, what did you do to me? How?
15112112121121112221121111221111112.title: Brad sees the doctor again.

151121121211211122211211112211111121.content:
I had decided to give Marisol extra time to study for her citizenship exam, and took the bus home.

I'd gotten pretty good at screening out other people's thoughts, but I was still surprised when I caught what Clem Rodgers was thinking. *Holy cow, she's coming on the bus! How did this happen? Calm down, Clem. It's not like she's going to talk to you.*

I couldn't resist seeing how he'd react, so I walked up to where he was sitting, and took an empty seat. "Hi, Clem."

"Hi, uh, hi," he sputtered. "What, uh what brings you here?"

"Heading home," I replied. "I picked up a job here, for after school and weekends. You?"

"Oh," he said, "I was just hanging out." As he settled back in his seat, he thought, *She talked to me! She actually talked to me!"

Maybe it was because I'd been so hung up on Brad, but I'd never realized that Clem had a crush on me. Now that I had that knowledge, I started looking at him differently. He was kind of cute, in his own way. With Brad out of my life, maybe Clem would be a better fit for me... ?

I imagined the two of us going out together. Maybe we'd hit it off, and he'd kiss me as he saw me to the door. Maybe we'd go out to eat, or to a movie. Then, however, I pictured him running his hand through my wig, and accidentally pulling it off. Would he still like a girl who's head-to-toe bald as a cueball?

Clem's point of view: http://www.writing.com/main/interact/ite...
151121121211211122211211112211111121.title: Meeting Clem Rodgers.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211.content:
After dinner, Trish and I went up to my room, as usual. "So," she asked, "how was your first day at work?"

"I found out a couple things," I said. "Things you wouldn't believe."

She looked at me skeptically. "Stranger than my best friend reading minds and predicting the future?"

"Okay, maybe some of it isn't that strange. But still. For one thing, you know that transgender kid, Alyssa Vance?"

"Yeah?"

"She's turned into a real girl. I mean, head to toe."

Trish's shock was pretty obvious. Even if I hadn't been able to read her mind, I could have picked up on it. "How'd that happen?"

"I didn't delve that far," I replied. "All I know right now is, she's as female as we are."

"I know you and she didn't get along well, but I'm glad for her. However it happened, she's got her lifelong dream, in a better way than she could have done it otherwise."

"I'm glad for her, too. I heard her and her sister talking about me before, and I realized what a jerk I've been. No more of that for me. I even sent a mental congratulations to her."

Trish shook her head. "That had to come as a surprise. Okay, what else?"

"I saw Clem Rodgers on the bus home, and found out he has a crush on me."

"I suspected as much. I wanted to find out for sure before I said anything about it. What do you think?"

"I'm not sure. He's a great guy, but I don't know how he'd react, if he found out about me."

"Like you said, he's a great guy. Give him the benefit of the doubt, before you write him off."

"Maybe. On the other hand, I just broke up with Brad. Maybe it's best that I take some time, get my head on straight before I think about another guy."

We talked a while longer, until we went to bed.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211.title: At home, talking with Trish

15112112121121112221121111221111112111.content:
The next morning, as I was getting dressed, there was a knock on my door. "You up, Cait?" Trish asked.

"Yup," I replied. "Just getting ready for my second day at work."

Trish stepped in. "If you weren't too busy," she said, "I thought maybe we could check in on Brad, see how he's doing?"

I nodded. "It's been a while since we've looked in on him. I wonder how he's coping, myself."

We sat on my bed. I placed my fingertips on Trish's forehead, and "tuned in" to Brad's thoughts.

We soon saw what appeared to be a very pregnant woman, with large breasts and an even bigger belly. "Are you sure this is Brad?"

The figure groped under its belly, and felt distinctly masculine genitals. "That's Brad, alright."

With great effort, Brad succeeded in bringing his unfamiliar bulk to a sitting position. Then, groaning, he stood and headed for the bathroom.

We didn't really have any expectations about Brad's appearance, but it was still a shock when he reached a mirror. "That's... that's me," Trish said, looking at Brad's reflection. "His symbiont turned him into me."

"I like her sense of irony," I replied, as I broke off. "If you were to drop by, I don't think he could deny your relationship anymore."

"I think I should pay him a visit. "Any suggestions about how much I should tell him?"

"I trust you, Trish. Go with your heart."
15112112121121112221121111221111112111.title: Next morning

151121121211211122211211112211111121111.content:
"Welcome back, Cait," Mr. Erwin said, as I came in. "Ready for another day?"

"As ready as ever, Mr. Erwin," I replied. I was really starting to enjoy working, even if most people wouldn't regard standing still as work.

"You've got an hour before we need you," he said. "Why don't you walk around for a while? If you see something you like, feel free to take advantage of our employee discount."



I was walking along when I got a message from Amarta. *I guess we're still coming to this planet.*

*What do you mean?*

*I'm detecting the thoughts of a young member of my species. This one hasn't yet learned how not to give its host powers.*

*We're not in any danger, are we?*

*Doubtful. This one's host is walking with a human of some interest.* I could almost detect a gasp. *It's one of your friends from yesterday.*

I looked around, and saw Alyssa walking with a boy. *I think I know him,* I thought. *Garth... something or other.*

*Jones. He is the host I spoke of.*

I figured that, since we both had symbionts, we might as well become friends, so I called out, "Hi, guys."
151121121211211122211211112211111121111.title: At work

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Garth and Lyssa turned to me, curious. "Caitlin?" asked Garth, recognizing me.

"That's me," I replied, sensing they found it strange that I was being so friendly. I knew they saw me as stuck up before, I intended to change that reputation. "What brings you to the store?"

"We... we had to pick up some things," Lyssa answered, looking puzzled as Garth. "What brings you here?"

"I'm on break from my job," I replied.

"Job?" asked Lyssa, surprised.

I nodded. "I'm a living mannequin in the swimwear department."

Lyssa's eyes about came out of her head, and she blushed. "That... that was you? Oh, wow, I'm so sorry about what we said."

I waved her hand dismissively. "I earned those remarks. Part of the reason I took the job was to change the way I've been acting all this time."

Lyssa was still puzzled. "When you were a mannequin, you were bald. How'd they hide your hair?"

I was silent at first, unsure how to respond. Then Amatra spoke. *Their hearts are pure, you can show them.*

Finally, I said, "Like this," and pulled the wig off my head.

Lyssa gasped, stunned. She touched my head gently as if it were made of glass. "Caitlin, what happened!?" tearing up, she asked. "Who or what did this to you!?"

I sensed Garth was stunned as well and I felt comfort in the fact he felt a need to bust up who ever did this. He held down his urges though and touched my shoulder in support. "My father is the chief of police in this city." he told me. "If someone did something to you to cause this..."

I giggled. "I appreciate your support, guys." I said. "It was an accidental exposure to a rare plutonium that caused this but it goes deeper than that."

"What do you mean?" curious, Alyssa asked.

Then I heard Amatra's voice echo in Garth's head. *Greetings, Garth and Amara. I am Amatra, an elder symbiont inside Caitlin.*

"Elder symbiont?" I asked out loud.

*Elder symbionts are of our kind who abandoned their hosts centuries before we did and fled Earth.* I heard a voice in Garth explain. I assumed it was Amara. *Over time, they became one with this planet, as we will... eventually.*

"You have an alien inside of you, just like Garth." whispering, Lyssa said, hearing that. "But what is an elder symbiont?"

Garth relayed what Amara said to me then turned to Caitlin. "It seems we have something in common." he said. "Maybe we can get together later and talk about it in depth."

"I'd like that." I said, smiling. "How does tomorrow night sound?"

"That sounds good but... we're grounded." wincing, Alyssa said. "We're just here to buy a few things to clean a mess we made then we have to go home."

"Sorry to hear that." I said. "If there's anything I can do to help, let me know."

"The same for you." replied Garth. "We'll keep in touch."

With that, I put my wig back on and waved good bye as I walked towards Trish, I sensed approaching with a mind full of worry. As I approached her, I sensed Garth and Lyssa feeling concerned for her as well....
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Continue

choices: Trish returns to Brad (just in time)
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
As I got closer to Trish, I overheard Garth talking to Lyssa, talking about how upset Trish looked. Accordingly, I sent her a quick thought. *Be careful what you say. We've got friends approaching, and I don't want to embarrass Brad too much.*

Trish nodded, recognizing Garth and Lyssa. "Hi, guys," she said.

"Hi," Garth replied. "I noticed you looked upset. I thought maybe we could help."

Trish shook her head. "Not really." Then, turning to mee, she said, "I went to see Brad. I... kinda had to tell him and his mom how I found out."

I nodded. I should have expected as much. We'd have to explain how we knew eventually. "It's okay," I assured her. "I'm sure they won't blab. Besides, they'd have to explain how they found out, and I don't think Brad wants that out in the open."

I could sense Garth and Lyssa's confusion about our conversation. I could just imagine how they'd react if they found out that Brad was, at that moment, in a hospital bed, looking like a much more pregnant Trish. "How's he doing?"

"The doctor says he's close."

I didn't need to be a mind-reader to detect Trish's concern. "Would you like to be there for him?" When she nodded, I said, "Go ahead."

As Trish walked away to be with Brad, Garth said, That didn't take as long as I'd thought. Guess we can still get some shopping in, before we have to be at the food court."

As soon as Garth mentioned the food court, I got a psychic vision, the most terrifying one I'd received so far. I saw the food court in shambles, littered with the bodies of the freshly killed. In the center of the destruction was a young boy, armed with several assault rifles.

Suddenly, I felt Lyssa shaking me, and heard her calling, "Cait?"

As I blinked, Amarta said to me, *There is still time to act. Perhaps these two, or someone close to them, can help us.*

I grabbed them both by the hand. "Come on."

"Where?"

"To the food court. They're about to have bigger problems than you two being late."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: continue.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
As we arrived at the food court, we encountered Grace and Beth. "You two got done early," Grace said. "Who's yo - Caitlin Spencer?" I caught her thinking, *What's the Snoot doing hanging out with the likes of us?*

With the situation so desperate, I brushed it off. "Hi," I said. "There's not much time. We-"

A burst of gunfire took out the skylight, interrupting the conversation.

We all grabbed what cover we could under the tables. I reached out for the mind of the gunman, and received, *Now what/Kill them/Kill them all/You must kill them*

I tried to contact him telepathically. *Who are you? Why are you doing this?*

The response came, *I'm Jeremy/Ignore her/Silence her/Kill her/Find her and kill her*

I had never encountered a mind like this. It seemed as if he was listening to voices, but who besides me could be talking to him?

I needed help to figure this out. Remembering how well Grace did in school, I grabbed her head, to let her in on what was happening.

Grace's eyes flew wide as she began hearing Jeremy's thoughts. *What's going on? Why is this happening?*

*It's a long story,* I replied. *We can hear his thoughts, but I'm having trouble understanding him. Can you help?*

Grace tried, but we kept getting the voices telling Jeremy to kill us.

Then, I remembered that Beth did well in school, too. I'd never tried linking four minds before, but I had nothing to lose by trying, so I grabbed her, too.

At first, we had no better luck. Then, an unexpected voice came through. *The voices he hears are not true, daughters. There is something wrong inside his brain, and it is producing the voices he hears telling him to kill.*

Beth seemed to recognize and trust the voice, so she "spoke" to Jeremy. *Jeremy, you're not well. There's something wrong with you, and it's producing the voices telling you to kill.*

Jeremy responded, *They say they'll go away once I do this/Shut up/Stop talking to her/Kill her*

*They won't. They're inside your mind, and they'll just keep telling you to do things like these, over and over. If you surrender, the authorities can give you medication to help you, and stop the voices.*

For a while, Jeremy just stood there, with the voices constantly telling him to kill. I realized I could understand why he had done this. If I constantly heard voices drowning out my own thoughts, telling me to kill, I might think about it, too.

Finally, Jeremy placed his guns on the ground, and kicked them away. Grace, Beth, and I breathed the same sigh of relief.

As mall security took control of the situation, I released my grip on the girls. Garth asked, "What just happened?"
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Trouble at the food court

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
"That boy was an undiagnosed schizophrenic," Grace explained. "The voices in his head were telling him to kill everybody here."

"I got a psychic vision," I added, "warning me of what was about to happen. I tried to reason with him, but I had trouble getting him to distinguish my 'voice' from all the others. So I needed Grace and Beth to help me."

"Y-you can do that?" Lyssa asked.

"For a few days now," I replied. "I found out what the people around me really thought about me, and I've been working to change that.

"Now," I said, looking at the others, "I've got a question for you: Do you guys really have these powers?"

*We granted our hosts great power in exchange for 'room and board'.* calmly, said an unfamiliar voice in my mind. *Elder symbionts do not do this unless necessary, as in your case, Caitlin.*

My eyes widened as I somehow knew the voice came from Garth and I heard the voice again, speaking in Garth's mind now. *Are you ready, Garth?*

Garth smiled then suddenly grew in size to that of an Olympian weight lifter. My surprised expression turned to shock, looking at his new form, but I relaxed when I quickly returned to normal. "I can get a lot bigger, if I wanted." he said, blushing. "Only, I'm afraid of losing control."

"Same here." nodding, I said. "I don't want to hurt anyone with a 'bad thought'." I then turned to Grace. "I got a feel of yours and Beth's power when we connected, a type of super total recall, right?"

"Something like that." smiling, Grace replied. "Basically, I can learn anything in minutes rather than days and master anything in hours rather than years."

"I have something similar." agreeing, Beth added. she blushed. "So far, I seem to be able to find anything I am looking for and instantly know how to use it."

"That is impressive." I said, smiling. "What of you Alyssa?"

Lyssa smiled then seemed to vanish from sight. Startled, I looked around then jumped to find Lyssa standing right behind me. "Teleportation?"

"Sheer speed." sighing, Lyssa replied. "That's what got me into trouble, I tracked boulevard bon-bons up the side of Garth's house when I went to visit him."

I giggled slightly, hearing that. "You went passed old man Crane's house, didn't you?"

Lyssa blinked. "How did you?" she shook her head, remembering my power to read minds. "What does that have to do with what happened?"

"He's been illegally using his Saint Bearnard's droppings to fertilize his lawn." I explained, wincing. "Its been seeping onto the sidewalks, giving anyone who walks or runs passed real dung covered shoes."

"Well that explains how it was tracked all the way home." said Lyssa.

Just then, I looked around, nervous before seeing that Grace and Beth were doing the same. We were being watched and what was worse, I could not pin point where they were. "We'd better get what we need and leave." her voice quivering slightly, Beth said.

"I'm calling off for the rest of the day." quickly, I said.

For a moment Garth seemed confused but it soon hit him. A nagging feeling we were all being watched by someone, hiding somewhere. Grace came close to Garth, worried. "All of us getting this feeling at the same time can't be a coincidence." fearful, she said. "My vote is to forget what we came for and leave."

"Security is tight, since that kid went on a mini rampage." serious, Garth said. "Whoever we're sensing, they won't try anything now but I say we leave as a group." he then turned to me. "That means you too."

I nodded then pulled out my cellphone. "James, I need to be picked up." my voice fearful, I said. "I'm bringing four friends along..."

Unknown to all, two blurry men were watching us from a distance. "That's them, Butch." said one. "At least the kids of two of the original members."

Butch grunted. "They know we are here, Hank." he muttered. "That friend of theirs seems to have some type of mental radar, we will have to get imaginative to obtain our targets."

The two men watched as...
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Continue

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Once we got outside, James was there, waiting for us. "Home, Miss?" he asked.

"No, my house," Garth replied, giving his address.

Garth was a sweet boy, but I'd have to explain to him that servants only obey their employers. I nodded to confirm the orders, adding, "Evasive maneuvers."

"Fasten your seat belts," James replied as he closed the door.

Once I closed the partition between the driver and the passenger area, we were underway. James could make the limo go faster than most people could imagine. I knew from personal experience that he would be able to hide from any pursuers, even with such a large vehicle.

"Can we trust the driver?" Garth asked. I couldn't tell if he was nervous from being spied on, of if James' driving skills had him scared.

"For the most part," I assured them. "I haven't told him about my powers. But he's been working for my family for years. He was originally hired to keep an eye on my Aunt Liv."

"Aunt Liv?" Grace asked. "Why did she need to be watched?"

"From what little they tell me," I replied, "she was something of a black sheep in the family. Hung out with the wrong crowd, married beneath her, that sort of thing. Of course, we're old money, so those terms could mean anything."

As we brushed debris off of ourselves, I took off my wig to inspect it. As I did so, I noticed something that hadn't occurred to me before. Lyssa had been right to say that I'd looked down my nose at them before. Now that I was looking them in the face, they looked somehow familiar, though I couldn't place it.

"When did that happen?" Beth asked.

I remembered that Grace and Beth hadn't been with Garth and Lyssa when I showed them my hair loss earlier. "A few days before I became telepathic. Brad and I got accidentally dosed with plutonium. I lost my hair and started reading minds. Brad... he's recovering, but it's taken him longer."

"Weird."

"Ironic, too. Plutonium was the brand name of the hair dye I used." They knew I'd gone bald, so I didn't see any harm in them knowing I wasn't a natural blonde.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: we quickly left the mall.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Once I was satisfied that my appearance was presentable, I whipped out my smart phone and called Marisol. She answered on the first ring. "Hello?"

"Hola, Marisol."

"Miss Caitlin? Chica, I was so worried. Did you hear what happened at the mall?"

"Yes," I replied, "I know about what happened. At least I wasn't the first one to interrupt your novelas today." We both chuckled.

"Are you alright, dear? Did you get hurt?"

"I'm fine. Nobody got hurt, and the gunman is in custody. However, something else came up, and I'll be spending some time with some other kids my age. I'll be back by supper."

"Just so long as you're not hurt, little one, I'm glad for that."

"Hasta luego."

"Goodbye, dear."

Once I hung up, I knew I should let Trish know what was going on. However, the phone could cause problems in the hospital. Luckily, I had another way to contact her. "Give me a few minutes," I said, and closed my eyes.

I got tuned in to Trish's brainwaves quickly. *Change of plans, girlfriend. I had to get away from the mall There was a shooting, and I think some of us may be watched.*

*Thanks for the tip,* Trish replied. *Brad's in "labor" right now.*

This I had to see, if not for myself, then through someone else's eyes. I tuned in Dr. Hagen's mind and "hopped" over.

It was quite a sight, as Trish was assisting what looked for all the world like a nine months' pregnant version of herself in a process that must have felt like actually giving birth. Even from this distance, I could hear Brad thinking, *I'm sorry I treated Trish so bad. If this is what she'll be going through, I wish I'd been better to her.*

Then, I picked up Dr. Hagen's thoughts, and they weren't funny or pleasant.

*I must find out what has caused this boy's condition. The Agency must have this secret. I'll have to declare a quarantine, confine these two to this area. Whether it's the boy or the girl, I'll know the answer. And whoever it is might have influenced the other.*

I had a hunch that this Agency might be connected to whoever was spying on us at the mall. Not sure yet what was going on, I sent a quick warning to Trish.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Contact

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Once we arrived at Garth's house, I told James, "Wait for Trish Wilson, and whoever is with her, at the hospital. Then bring them here. Evasive maneuvers."

Chief Jones opened the door for us. "Come on in," he said. "Beth, Lyssa, your parents are on their way here. Garth, Grace, your cousin, Susan, is on the way with her parents, as well. Caitlin, is there someone you'd like me to call?"

"James will be back later," I replied, "and Marisol knows where I am. My folks are away."

Now that I no longer regarded these kids as my social inferiors, I felt a different wall beginning to form: Envy. I was jealous of the close-knit relationship they all had with their parents. Half the time, when my folks were off on their pleasure trips, I had no idea where they were. When they were home, my mom wasn't really there, anyway. She'd long ago figured out that she wouldn't get a hangover if she drank enough that she was still drunk when she woke up.

"I've got a question," Grace said, pulling me out of my own thoughts. "Who was that woman who spoke to us, when we were linked?"

"That was Beatriz," Beth replied. "She's something of a spirit guide. Sometimes, when I'm looking for something, she gives me an idea of where to look."

"So why'd she call us her daughters?" I asked.

Beth shrugged. "Maybe we're related. Iole, Lyssa's and my distant ancestor, had 14 children, so there's bound to be a healthy representation of her in the gene pool."

"Makes sense," Grace replied. "I read that 1 in 200 people can trace their ancestry to Genghis Khan." She turned to me. "How much do you know about your Aunt Liv?"

"Not much," I answered. "I once had my lawyer try to track her down through her share of the inheritance, but she's hardly touched it. What could she be saving it for?"

"I gave some to an old friend," a voice responded. "The kids are going to college. And I had planned to pay for Lyssa's surgery, but it turned out she didn't need it."

We all turned. The Vances had arrived.

Now I realized what was so familiar about Beth and Lyssa. If I'd let my hair grow its natural color, I would look a lot like them. They were my cousins. "You... You're Aunt Liv?"

"Sarah," she replied. "I never liked the name Liv."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: The meeting

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
"We'll talk more inside." seriously, Ted said. "There is much we need to discuss."

We all began to follow him inside when another car arrived. Once it had parked by the road, A tall, slender man with sand brown hair and blue eyes stepped out. With him was an equally tall but muscular woman with long auburn hair and green eyes. Almost immediately, my mind told me she was Ted's sister, Amanda Tanner. Coming out of the back was a small girl with long brown hair and blue eyes, I recognized as Susan from school. "Are we late?" walking up to us, Susan's dad asked.

"Not at all, Geo." shaking his hand, Ted said. "Good to see you again."

"Likewise." releasing Ted, Geo said.

Ted then hugged Amanda. "Thank you for coming over, sis." smiling, he said. "I just wish it was under much better circumstances." he sighed. "Any word from Steve?"

Amanda winced. "His daughter is in the hospital." sadly, she replied. "She's not well, from what I hear."

Dad shook his head, looking worried. "We'll have to hold the meeting without him then." wincing, he said. "Everyone inside, we have a lot of ground to cover and, I fear, very little time."

Once everyone was inside and sitting down, I turned to Sarah. "I know this is not the place but... why were you called the black sheep of the family?"

Sarah giggled slightly. "When I was your age, the Spencer family liked to play by their own rules." looking at me, she explained. "They did not care for the police or for lawyers unless it worked in their favor. That said, they wanted me to marry into the Tanner family, to increase the family's wealth." she motioned to Amanda then added, "Only my friend had eyes for Geo and I had eyes for Frank Vance... a lawyer who worked for the police department."

"I imagine your parents didn't take it well." wincing, I said.

Sarah shook her head. "My dad walked me down the aisle to give me away." sadly, she replied. "Only he did not stay for the reception." she sighed. "He and my mother accepted my husband but not until they were on their death bed, wanting to make peace before they left this world."

"That's cold." tearing up, I said. "I'm so sorry, aunt Sarah."

"It's not your fault, sweetie." said Sarah. "Believe me, my parents, they deeply cared for my husband and I." she then smiled. "They wanted to make the man who put me in this chair vanish of the face of the Earth. If Mr Jones had not gotten to him first, they would have made it happen."

"Let's get started." interrupting my conversation, Geo said with a cold tone. "As you all know, most of us were members of the Problem Child Gang you kids like to read about. Our last mission was against a man named Sykes who we believed was the bottom of a drug and weapon running cartel." he sighed. "Unfortunately, he turned out to be just the opposite. He was a war monger drug lord, the top dog of the cartel."

My face and those of my friends paled, hearing that. "Was it this Sykes and his men who nearly killed you all?" almost whispering, Garth asked. "Or was it the Agency?"

"The Agency was after Sykes, just as we were." seriously Ted replied. "Sykes knew they were there and that we were hunting him down. He blew the building he was held up in, just as he made his escape." he shook his head. "We barely escaped with our lives only to find the Agency became... interested in us."

"What do you mean interested in you?" shaking, Lyssa asked.

"As I explained earlier, we had our talents." looking at Lyssa, Sarah said. "The Agency was in the business of brainwashing children with such talents to use them, make them do their dirty work so to gain wealth and power."

"Not only were we forced to flee for our lives from an exploding building, we had to escape the clutches of an underground terrorist organization." tearing up, Geo said. "We thought we were invincible, we were not. We thought this was behind us... its been chasing us all along."

"You- You think this cartel or this Agency may have interest in us." piecing things together, I said, turning pale.

Geo nodded. "That is why we are holding this meeting, my dear." he said. "The Agency has resurfaced and from what I have heard, many of you are already being watched by someone." he clinched a fist. "We can not take any chances or make any assumptions, we already made that mistake once."

Suddenly, I gasped, getting a vision like I received at the mall. My lips trembled, seeing a number of armed men charging into the estate. "No... they're outside of my house!" hoarsely, I screamed. Panicked and worried for Marisol's safety, I threw my hands against my temples and sent her a desperate mental warning...

"Marisol, you are in danger! RUN... NOW!!!!"

Before I knew what I was doing, a powerful surge ran through me. It felt as if I had been hit by truck when...
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Continue

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Everyone jumped as Marisol appeared in the room, screaming. She had her hands raised, as if to defend herself then screamed again, finding herself somewhere else. "Ay dios mio!" shaking, she breathed.

"Es importante que tu te relajes." walking up to her unsteadily, I said. "Somos buenos amigos."

"Qué pasó, Caitlin!?" startled, Marisol asked.

"Someone, please... English." muttered Ted, looking startled as well.

"It's okay, Marisol, you are safe." taking her hand, I said. "It looks like I got you here just in time." then I thought, "I feel so weak but I can't let her see that, she'll freak."

"What happened, child!?!" still shaking, Marisol asked. "I heard you scream I was in danger just as a number of men broke into the house!" she suppressed a sob. "They were right on top of me and then I found myself here!"

"We... We all have certain abilities, Marisol." urging her to sit down, I replied as I sat down with her. "Remember how I lost all my hair? Well, it also gave me powerful mental abilities, thanks to Amatra."

"Amatra?" confused, Marisol asked.

"Hola, Marisol." came a voice in her head. "Como Estas?" then her voice sternly echoed in my head. "You nearly drained us both completely doing that... don't try it again."

Marisol began to shake more until Ted cleared his throat. "Marisol is it?" he asked. she nodded. "I am Ted Jones, chief of police. There is an underground organization, known as The Agency, that forcibly makes use of such talented children like Caitlin Spencer and my children, Garth and Grace." he sighed. "It's a long story, which we will explain but in short, I believe those men were after Caitlin and they would have used you to get her."

"I- I see..." said Marisol. she turned to Caitlin. "You- You summoned me here?"

Looking very pale, I nodded. "You're like a mother to me." feeling weak, I said. "I- I couldn't let anyone hurt you. I... I..."

Suddenly, the world around me vanished as I felt myself fall out of my seat. The last I heard was Marisol. "Caitlin!"
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: A desperate move.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
I found myself in what looked like a sauna, but there was no heat. Comparing this to my most recent memory, I realized I must be dreaming. This was driven home as I realized I was naked. Normally I'm anxious in naked dreams, especially since I lost my hair, but I felt at ease this time.

"Can I come in?" called a voice that sounded familiar.

Before I could respond, someone who looked like an exact duplicate of me walked in. "Who-who are you?"

She smiled. "We've been talking for some time, now, Cait."

I finally placed the voice. "Amatra? Wh-why do you look like me?"

"I didn't think you were ready for a good look at the real me," she replied. "I figured, if I came to you like this, you would figure out who I was."

"What's going on? Why are we here?"

"You overexerted our abilities by teleporting Marisol, and you lost consciousness."

"Don't even think about lecturing me," I responded. "Marisol's been closer than my own mother. If I had to do it over again, I would."

"I understand," was Amatra's reply. "In fact, that's why I wanted to talk to you, so I made use of our 'alone time'."

"What is it?"

"You're on your way to being a different person than you were before this started. Not just how you treat Marisol, but the way you're handling Trish and even Brad."

I nodded. "The old me probably would have had Brad shot for cheating on me, and maybe even Trish, too."

"I know. That's why I wanted to ask you a favor."

"Name it."

"Could you... help me contact my mother?"

"What?"

"Your discovery of a family you didn't know about has stirred a longing within me. I haven't been able to contact my mother for as long as you've been alive. I had come to accept it, but your abilities lead me to think that, perhaps, we can find out what has become of her."

I nodded. "Don't worry, Amatra. As soon as I get a lead on which of my parents hosted your mother, I'll try to find her."

We embraced, and I suddenly felt cold water on my face.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: dreaming.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
As I felt water splashing on my face, I became aware that the number of voices I used to hear in my mind after I lost my hair were no longer present. In its place was a spinning of dizziness and a pounding in my head. Slowly, I opened my eyes, straining them against the light of the room. "Wh... wha... "

"You fainted, chica," Marisol replied. "Bringing me here was harder than you wanted to let on. I don't think you should do that again."

"You're not the only one," I replied. "My head is killing me. And I can't 'hear' your thoughts."

"Probably overstress," Beth suggested. "Give yourself a day or so before you try mind-reading again."

Marisol looked around at all of us. "You children all have these... powers?"

"Most of us," said Garth. "I can get big and super-strong."

"I've got total recall," Grace said, "and I can duplicate just about anything I see done."

"I've got super-speed," Lyssa said.

"I have a spirit guide," said Beth.

Susan stepped forward. "I've got powers from both my parents. You guys all thought Dad was just really good at sneaking in and hiding. It's more than that."

"What do you mean?" Ted asked.

Susan and Geo smiled... and disappeared.

"Geo? Susan?" Ted ran to where they'd been standing, waving his arms through the space where they'd been. "Where'd you go?"

"We're right here, Ted," Geo replied. "We can turn invisible and intangible."

"Put your arms down, Uncle Ted," Susan added. "We can't come back, if you're occupying the space."

Ted stopped waving his arms, and they returned. "How'd you get to do this?"

"It's a family trait," Susan answered. "Right now, I can only do it for about 15 minutes. But I should get better at it."

"Any other problems, besides solid objects?"

"Bright light," said Geo. "Our eyelids go transparent, too, so we can't block out bright lights."

"Sue," Garth asked, "you said you got powers from both your parents. What did you mean?"

"I was a hanger-on of the Problem Child Gang," Amanda said. "The book calls me the Unknown Amazon."

"That's how you got so big? You can Hulk out, like I do?" surprised, Garth asked.

Amanda nodded. "Sue hasn't found her trigger yet. Otherwise, I'm sure she'd demonstrate."

"My trigger was exercise. When we're done with this, I'll let you use my equipment."

"Thanks, Garth," Sue said. "Of course, we haven't gotten to the weird part."

"Weird part?"

"You guys might find this hard to believe," she said. "It turns out, I was originally born a boy. I turned into a girl a few days later. That's how I inherited Dad's powers: They're passed from father to son."

"That's not so hard to believe," smiling, Lyssa said.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Waking up

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Then a firm knock at the front door caused everyone to jump. Ted hurried over to the door, motioning everyone to stay clear, as he brought his sidearm to bear. "Who is it!" firmly, he demanded.

"Steve Connors and company." replied Steve's voice. "Someone tried to take my daughter, Ted. I have one of her friends with me, we need to talk."

Ted cautiously opened the door and peered out before allowing a tall and muscular man with short sand blond hair and blue eyes to enter with Travis Greenway and Megan from school following behind. Travis was a tall and muscular boy with jet black hair and blue eyes. Megan was a shy petite girl with blond hair and green eyes. Both seemed white as a sheet and they staggered slightly as they entered. Mom gasped seeing them and ran forward with Marisol helping her.

"Easy, Megan." said mom, gently taking her arm. "You better sit down a bit, dear."

"I- I'm fine." said Travis, blushing slightly as Marisol took his hand.

"The hell you are, Chico." sternly Marisol said. "You look like a ghost, sit down and rest."

"I said I'm fine." stubbornly but politely, Travis said. "I just need to catch my breath."

Garth smiled then turned to Grace and I as we smiled as well. I did not have to be a mind reader to know Marisol was not going to put up with male pride. "Sit... down." with a firm tone, Marisol said.

Travis sat down, his expression softening. Seeing him blush slightly, I surmised that he was not used to anyone being so forceful with him. "Yes, ma'am." he said.

"It's good to see you again, old friend." returning his sidearm to its holster, Ted said. "Any idea who tried to kidnap your daughter and her friend?"

"They weren't professionals." quickly, Steve said. "I'm guessing they were sent by Sykes. he motioned to Megan and Travis. "These two are just now discovering their 'gifts'. Megan's gift left her a bit shaken, same with Travis."

"What can you do?" still lying on the couch, I asked. "Mine is mental powers." moaning, I added, "Though I kind of over did it a few minutes ago."

"Megan can control machines and transform to some extent." motioning Megan to remain quiet, said Steve. "Travis has the ability to become an Anthro of various animals." pausing, he added, "I know you two have a voice of your own but you are both seriously drained from the kidnap attempt, rest all you can."

"Were they hurt?" asked Lyssa, concerned.

"Travis pushed himself to save Megan from being taken." with a grateful look, Steve said. "Megan did the same only it was from her powers going a bit nuts on her."

"Like mine did at the beginning, turning into a behemoth." shaken slightly, I said. "My power is super strength."

"Just like your dad." smiling, Steve said. then he turned serious. "We need a plan and time is something we don't have a lot of, we need to act, now."

What do you suggest?" asked Garth's mom.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: continue.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Before Steve could answer, there was another knock at the door. "Who could that be?" Dad asked. "We're all here." Drawing his sidearm again, he asked, "Who is it?"

"Tr-Trish Wilson, sir," came the reply. "Cait sent for us?"

All turned to me. "Something came up during the ride here," I explained. "I sent my driver to pick them up."

Ted opened the door, and in came Trish, Brad, and an older lady, probably Brad's mom. Except Brad looked rather feminine, I wondered how long his symbiont would keep him looking like a girl. Fortunately, he was no longer Trish's 'twin' but he still had girlish traits. I bit my lip, fighting the temptation to tease him as he seemed badly shaken. Also, he looked as if he got dressed in a real hurry, telling me they got out of the hospital just in time.

"You guys OK?" asked Garth.

"Getting better," Brad replied, his voice soft and feminine. "I... had quite an experience in the hospital. Please don't ask me to describe it to you."

"What's going on?" Heather. "Why did you come here?"

"Cait told me she'd picked up something," Trish answered, "and I should grab Brad and his mom and get in her limo. Whatever it was, it had her freaked worse than the shooting."

Everyone turned to me again. "I read Brad's doctor's mind," I explained. "He's connected to the Agency, and he wanted his hands on Brad and Trish. That's why I brought them here."

Ted shook his head. "Sykes, the Agency, and the kids of the Problem Child Gang. This is going to get a lot worse before it gets better."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: An interruption.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
"We need to get everyone started on training the sooner the better." said Geo. "I know of such a place, the original group headquarters near the coast. It's only about twenty miles from here."

"I thought our headquarters were destroyed by the Agency days after we escaped Sykes' death trap in Rome." confused, Heather said. "They completely burned the summer home mansion to the ground, trying to get to us."

"That was the sister mansion in England." countered Geo. "I'm talking about the original headquarters, here in the States, where we first starting training to hone our skills while not gallivanting around the world." he smiled. "It's old but its still standing and we can go there in a second's notice."

"The kids will still need individual training." worried, Sarah said. "Also, their skills are far more advanced than ours were."

"They will get individual training." said Geo. "You see, I had a feeling we had not seen the last of the Agency so I had an underground... err... vacation village constructed in a cave system for all of us to run to with our families, just in case."

"All of the training facilities we need are there?" asked dad.

Geo nodded. "It has everything we need to live and train for as long as it takes." serious, he said. "We can live there or commute there." he paused. "Its just an option."

"We'll commute there." said Ted. "The Agency will know we're onto them if we all suddenly vanish. Still, we must be on our toes at all times, understood!?" everyone nodded and Ted turned back to Geo. "I will check the mansion and training facility to ensure its safe and secure. We can take two along with us."

"What about the rest of us?" uncertain, I asked.

Ted smiled. "I know your family, Caitlin." kindly, he said. "They always like to be prepared for any emergency."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Training begins.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Once we took our leave from the Problem Child Gang (it was still so weird to think that the heroes of my favorite comic were all real people, and that I was now connected to so many of them), I asked, "What do we do now?"

"I think we should check out the damage to the house," Marisol said.

"You sure?" I asked. "I mean, I can't get us out of trouble."

"We must report whatever damage was done," she explained. "Besides, even if we're not staying there tonight, we'll need to collect some things for the next few days."

"But where would you go?" Brad asked.

Marisol smiled. "The Chief of Police was correct. The Spencers have a 'safe house' a few miles away. We can stay there until it's safe to return to the mansion."

Trish smiled wistfully. "I-I'm afraid I'll be packing for more than a few days."

"What do you mean?"

"Brad's mom has offered to adopt the baby when it's born," she explained. "And she's offered to let me into her home."

I smiled. "Congratulations, Trish. I'm sure that she'll work something out, so you can see the baby anytime you want." Turning my attention to James, I asked, "Do you know where this 'safe house' is?"

"Yes, Miss."

"Okay. Take us home to collect the things we need, then bring us to the safe house."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: continue.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
The safe house was a fortified home on the far side of town with a six foot stone wall surrounding the entire property to keep out the curious and sharp stones on the top to detour the determined. The house itself was a three story home with sparse windows and heavy double doors in the front and back. My mom had it built shortly after aunt Sarah was attacked, leaving her in a wheel chair for the rest of her life. Looking back upon my own experiences, I wondered if she sensed something on the horizon. Brian, his mother, and Trish were with us, all too shaken to speak.

"Marisol with Caitlin Spencer and three guests." stopping at the front gate, Marisol said to a speaker box. "The estate and our friends' homes were attacked."

The gates opened and Marisol drove through before the gates closed again. "I thought the safe house was always empty." surprised, I said. "Someone lives here?"

"The safe house has a live in security team your father can summon at a moment's notice." pulling up the long driveway, Marisol replied. "They are all loyal and well paid to protect the Spencer family."

As the car came to a stop in front of the house, Marisol and I spotted five muscular guards standing with a tall, thin woman with raven hair and blue eyes. I recognized her immediately as my mom and sighed. "Please be sober, mom." wincing, I thought.

The guards opened the doors for us and pulled Brian and Trish out first, frisking them for any weapons, despite their protests as the same was done to Brian's mom. "Easy, Ms Hawk." stepping out, I said. "They're just doing their job."

"Oh, my baby!" hugging me, mom wailed. "Are you alright, dear?"

"I- I'm fine." surprised not to small any alcohol, I said. "Just a little drained."

"That voice in my head is back, Caitlin!" releasing me, mom whispered. "Only, for some reason, I listened and I am grateful I did as someone attacked our villa in Spain!" she sobbed a little before adding, "I swear, I'll never drink again! That little voice saved our lives, we just barely escaped!"

"Where's dad?" concerned, I asked. "Didn't he come with you?"

Mom shook her head. "He sent me ahead, promising to take the next available flight." crying, mom replied. "Whoever was after us blew up our private jet."

"You mother bears my mom." came Amatra's whispered voice in my head. "She is the voice being referred to, I can hear her but just barely... she's sounds so weak."

I winced, hearing that as I figured it was mom's alcohol addiction that caused her own symbiont to become weakened and I took her hands into my own. "Mom... we need to have a talk." holding her hands, I said. "I hear voices too but its not our imagination."

Mom's eyes widened before they became uncharacteristically steeled. "Come inside, all of you, we will talk over tea."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: The safe house

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
As a servant poured the tea, Mom said, "Caitlin, before we get to the unpleasantness, what else has been going on? I hope you're all feeling well."

"Relatively," I said. "Brian and I had a little accident, one that's not without consequences."

She waved her hand. "Nothing we can't handle, I'm sure. What was it?"

"We got dosed with plutonium." I swallowed hard, then took off my wig.

Mom was shocked. "Caitlin, your beautiful hair!" She hesitantly touched my bare scalp.

"I'm okay, Mom," I assured her, as I put the wig back on. "Brian's recovering, too. It just took him a little longer."

"I'm glad you're feeling better, Brian. You and Caitlin always did make such a cute couple."

"We're not a couple anymore," I replied. "I found out Brian was cheating on me with Trish."

Mom turned her newfound steely gaze to Brian. "Is this true, young man?"

"Yes, ma'am," he replied, hanging his head.

"The situation's been resolved," Ms. Hawk added. "We're going to look after Trish and her baby."

"I see." Mom regained some of her composure. "Will you all excuse us? I'd like to speak with my daughter, on a private matter."

As they left the room, Mom said, "You said you've been hearing voices, too?"

I nodded. "The plutonium opened part of my mind. I can now communicate telepathically. Sometimes, I can see a little bit into the future."

"A-are you sure?"

"Positive. There was an incident at the mall earlier today. With the help of some new friends, I put a stop to it." I paused. "I know what's behind the voice you hear, too."

"What is it?"

I directed my thoughts to Amatra. *Perhaps you should tell her.*

*Hello, Mrs. Spencer,* Amatra called. *You are the host of my mother. I'm trying to communicate with her, but she's very weak. Do you know of anything that could be affecting her?*

Mom was almost floored. "I-I heard that! What is it?"

*She's a symbiont,* I explained telepathically. *Her name's Amatra. She speaks to me, just like your symbiont speaks to you. Only you've been responding by drinking. I think the residual effects are dulling her abilities.*

What happened next took me completely by surprise. I'd never seen my mother this way.

She collapsed into my arms, sobbing. "Cait... Baby, I don't want to drink any more. But I-I don't know how to be sober."

I hugged her as tightly as I could. "I'll contact Aunt Sarah. She'll know what to do."

"A-Aunt Sarah?"

"Your sister."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: A talk with mom.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
I called aunt Sarah on a special secure line with one of the security guards listening on another line. "Do not make any mention of your location, Miss Spencer." warning me, the man said. "Also, inform Sarah not to mention her location, no phone line is completely secure."

I nodded as aunt Sarah answered. "Hello?"

"Aunt Sarah, I need your help but I can not tell you where I am." wincing, I said.

"That makes it a bit difficult to help you, Cait." worried, Sarah said on the other line. "What is the problem?"

"Mom has a symbiont, like you and I." looking at mom, I said. "She had thought she was going mad and had drowned out the 'voices' by drinking. Only now, that 'voice' has saved her life as she and dad were attacked in Europe." gulping, I added, "Aunt Sarah, they blew up their private jet."

"I see." her voice quivering, Sarah replied. "Well, I would guess that her symbiont will have a difficult time as she too would be addicted to the alcohol Kit had been consuming all these yea..." she paused as if she had been interrupted.

"Aunt Sarah?" concerned, I asked. "Are you still there?"

"Yes, I'm here." sighing, Sarah replied. "I was just listening to Samara."

"Samara?" confused, I asked. "Who is she?" I held my hand up, seeing the security man about to end the call.

"Samara is the name of my symbiont." seriously, Sarah replied. "She told me that Kit's symbiont is her sister, Alaura."

"Your symbiont's name is Alaura." turning to mom, I said.

"Alaura?" shaken, mom said. "I thought someone was calling me that as a child."

*It was me... talking to you.* came a weak voice in Kit's mind. *Sorry, I was not much of a help to you.*

Kit began to sob all over again. "I'm the one who failed you." crying, she said. "I- I failed everyone."

"Alaura can heal herself but first, Kit has to quit drinking, as in right now!" sternly, Sarah said. "Only, as weak as they both are, I doubt Kit will ever develop any powers."

I gave aunt Sarah's message to mom and she touched her chest. "What power would I have had, if I didn't drink?" fearful, she asked. "Please, Alaura, I- I need to know."

Alaura heard a low sigh in her head as Alaura replied, *The power of healing any injuries.*

Mom's eyes grew wide as all the color drained from her face. I had a similar expression, having heard the question and response then winced as mom wailed into tears. She fell to her knees, burying her face into her hands. "I could have saved my sister!" wailing with grief, she said. "I could have healed you too, Caitlin! I- I'm a horrible mother!"

"No, mom!" crying as well, I said. "You are just sick. We'll help you." then I thought, "We'll help you both."

"I'm afraid we must end this call, Mrs Vance." said the security guard. "It is becoming emotional on this end."

"I understand." replied Sarah. "Call again if you need me."

With that, the man ended the call and watched on as I held my mom in my arms as she did for me as a child...
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Continue

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Later, I called Aunt Sarah again, and we set up a meet to take Mom to a private recovery center.



The next morning, I went to Mom's room and knocked. "It's Cait, Mom. Can I come in?"

"Sure, sweetie."

I opened the door. "I thought I'd give you a helping hand packing."

"Not to worry, dear. I've got just about everything squared away."

"It never hurts to double-check," I said as I opened her suitcase. My eyes were immediately drawn to the perfume and shampoo bottles that she'd packed. "What are these?"

"Uh, private things. You know how we girls like to feel pretty wherever we go."

I didn't need to be a mind-reader to know what she was really doing. "I checked with the treatment center. They'll supply you with shampoo, and they don't allow perfume." I opened the shampoo bottle and sniffed, confirming my suspicions.

Mom slumped, defeated. "Old habits die hard, I guess."

"If it were easy, it wouldn't be worth doing." I hugged her once more. "You'll be fine. Three weeks into your stay, they let your immediate family come visit. Aunt Sarah and I will be there. Count on it."



We rendezvoused with Aunt Sarah in an underground parking garage. Mom and I climbed into Sarah's van, and she drove us to the center. "Thanks for bringing us out here, Aunt Sarah," I said.

"Anything for family," she replied.

As we walked into the doors of the center, Mom gave us each a hug, then walked over to the reception desk. "My name is Kit," she said. "I want to quit drinking, but I don't know how."

The receptionist smiled. "We'll do all we can to help you, Kit,"she said. "An attendant will take your bags."

As Mom began her road to her new life, Aunt Sarah and I got back in the van and drove away.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Road to recovery begins.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
As we headed back to town, I said, "Thanks for helping us out, Aunt Sarah."

"Think nothing of it," she replied. "Anything for family."

"About that," I said. "I want to apologize for how I treated Beth and Lyssa. Especially Lyssa. She was having a hard enough time as it was, without me treating her like dirt."

"Sweetie, you had no way of knowing you were related."

"They were still people. I shouldn't have lost sight of that."

"Maybe it runs in the family. When I joined the Problem Child Gang, it was as a lark. I thought we were a talking dog away from having our own show. It was only after I started seeing the effects of what we were fighting that I turned into the 'black sheep'."

I turned to look at her. "Really?"

She nodded. "After one too many speeches about community responsibility, the family hired James to keep an eye on me. They were sure that the other kids were putting dangerous ideas into my head."

"What did Mom say?"

"Not much. By that time, she'd learned how to pick the lock on the liquor cabinet. Her symbiont must have started talking to her."

I looked back towards the center. "Think she'll be okay?"
