"They'll take good care of her, Cait. And, in a couple weeks, it'll be family week. That means we'll get to visit her once a day, to see how she's doing for ourselves."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Connecting with Aunt Sarah

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
After leaving the center, Sarah requested to join me at the safe house for a short while. I nodded my approval and James stepped forward with a blindfold. "Merely a precaution, ma'am." politely, he said.

"That is not necessary, I know the safe house very well." annoyed, Sarah said. "Kit and I were told to go there in any case of extreme emergency."

"No blindfolds, James." strictly, I ordered. "Aunt Sarah is family."

James nodded then drove us to the safe house where aunt Sarah was held up by two guards while a female guard searched her and her chair. I wanted to protest but Sarah stated that it was fine before I found myself being searched once they were done with her. "What is the meaning of this!?" angry, I demanded.

"Anyone could have placed a tracking device onto any one of you without notice, Miss Spencer." calmly, the female guard replied as she searched me. "We are merely ensuring you were not tracked here."

I nodded, understanding the logic as James was searched as well. Once we were all settled inside the family room aunt Sarah turned to me with a serious expression. "You are going to need more than your special mind power to survive in this game, young lady." firmly, she told me. "You have already proved that you can burn yourself out, losing your powers for a short time. That can happen again, when you need that power the most."

"What do you suggest?" looking at her, I asked.

"I was the thinker of the group." serious, Sarah said. "I had a talent for finding clues. I was also a very good escape artist and a crack shot with a tranquilizer gun or rifle." sighing, she added, "I learned the hard way that talent alone is not enough, even with practice. You need to know how to get out of a situation in case your power fails."

"I can't argue with that." wincing, I said. "Where do we start?"

Sarah smiled. "We start with..."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: My training begins.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
"... deductive reasoning," Aunt Sarah decided. "It's close enough to mind-reading that an unsuspecting person might think you were doing one instead of the other."

"Sounds interesting," I said. "What is it?"

"Basically, it's the art of using what is known to make educated guesses about what is unknown." She smiled. "For instance, I had a hunch that was you as the mall mannequin."

"What gave me away?"

"Nothing gave you away, Cait. The girls noticed a marked resemblance between you and the mannequin, and I remembered reading that the store would be hiring people to work as living mannequins. It seemed unusual that such a well-to-do girl should seek employment, but that was more likely than the notion of the store having a mannequin that coincidentally resembled you so closely."

"I think I get it," I said. "I think I used it this morning. Not to give too much away, but Mom would have had a harder time giving up drinking if she were around the house than at the center."

"I agree." She changed the subject. "Let me tell you how I used deductive reasoning to crack a case with the Problem Child Gang. Once, the boys were trying to figure out where some drugs were being distributed from. They puzzled over it for I don't know how long. But I eventually spotted it."

"What was it?"

She smiled. "It was supposed to be a lingerie shop. But it had no front window."

"A lingerie shop with no front window? Who ever heard of such a thing?"

"That's deductive reasoning, kiddo. Of course, finding the right answer won't always be so easy. You'll need to commit a lot of facts to memory."

*She'll have help,* Amatra said. *Don't worry.*
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: deductive reasoning.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
"So, where do I begin?" looking at the Teen Detectives Magazines, I asked.

"Not there." taking the literature away, Aunt Sarah said. "You need to find your own style of deduction, one that is all you and no one else. You can not waste time thinking, what would 'Heather' do in a situation like this."

"You're afraid I'd make the same mistakes?" guessing, I asked.

Aunt Sarah shook her head. "I'm afraid you will hesitate when you are needed the most." softly, she said. "Don't look to me or anyone else to help you in a jam. Use what you know and what you have learned to see you through."

A was about to say something but gasped as two men ran into the room and ran straight for aunt Sarah! They began take swings at her as she screamed. I jumped in immediately to help her but one of the men pushed me back into my chair and continued to throw fists at aunt Sarah. Only, as I jumped up a second time, I noticed that there were no sounds of their fists making contact with her body. They're swings were pulled, not at full force at all for men their size. Also, aunt Sarah's screams were not of fear, as it was they were all in the same tempo, not changing due to exertion in a struggle. It was all an act, which confused me more. "What the hell!?"

As quickly as it had started, the two men quickly left the room as aunt Sarah smiled at me. "You did not jump in the second time, why?"

"It was all an act." still stunned by the display, I said. "The men were pulling their punches and they were not making contact with your body, I would have heard the sound of bone on bone. Also, your screams were not exactly convincing."

Aunt Sarah giggled. "Very good, Cait." smiling, she said. "Did you get a good look at the attackers?"

I nodded. "One was about five foot ten with crew cut black hair and green eyes. He seemed to have been about 200 to 225 pounds in weight and was wearing military fatigues." looking at aunt Sarah, I said. "The other was six foot even with brown hair and brown eyes, looking to be 175 to 200 pounds in weight. He also wore military fatigues."

"How did you judge their height?" asked aunt Sarah.

"The approximate distance between their head and the top of the doorway." serious, I replied.

Aunt Sarah smiled. "Did you see their names on the front of their uniforms?" pointing at the door, she asked.

Blushing, I shook my head. "No." wincing, I said. "Did I fail your test?"

"When two men come after you, the last thing you want to look for is a name." smiling, aunt Sarah said. "A detailed description will do, which you can make note of in a second. The rest of the time you will need to defend yourself."

"What has this to do with deductive reasoning?" curious, I asked.

Aunt Sarah was silent for a moment then sighed. "The two men who 'attacked' me had black steel toe boots, used by construction workers, not the military." softly, she began. "Also, they swung their fists as if they were in a drunk bar fight, telling me they were not trained professionals." serious, she added, "They were hired muscle, ordered to send me a message. Not only do you have to be observant, you have to take what you see and reason out every detail once you have time to think."

"I have a lot to learn." sighing, I said.

"We are all constantly learning, Cait." sadly, aunt Sarah said. "You just need to use what you learn so you can deal with anything new that comes your way."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Research

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
After we had talked for a while longer, I became aware of increased activity outside the room. Opening the door, I saw servants bustling. Stopping one, I asked, "What's going on?"

"The master of the house is en route," he replied.

My dad was finally back in town. "How far away is he?"

"His plane has just touched down."

As I let the man go about his business, Aunt Sarah wheeled up behind me. "Perhaps it's time I take my leave," she said.

"If there's someplace else you need to be," I replied, "I won't hold you here. But you're as welcome here as I am."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: continue.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
"Thanks," Aunt Sarah said, "but Lyssa tells me there have been some developments with someone the Problem Child Gang encountered years ago. She needs our help. And, from what I understand, she may need yours, as well."

"I'll be by later," I said, "after I see Dad."

"But you don't know the... oh, of course. Well, I'll see you later." Aunt Sarah wheeled out of the room.



About an hour after we learned of his coming, Dad walked into the safe house. "Kit? Caitlin?" he called.

I ran up to hug him. "It's so good to see you, Daddy."

He chuckled. "It's good to see you, too, Cait. Where's your mother? She came back before I did."

"Mom's in a treatment center, Daddy. She's decided to give up drinking, once and for all."

Dad seemed puzzled for some reason. Then he said, "That's good to hear, Cait."

His voice didn't sound sincere, though, so I read his mind to find out why. *This can't be good,* he thought. *A sober Kit Spencer would notice my comings and goings.*

That seemed strange. Dad was always gallivanting, but I just chalked it up to my parents' hard-partying lifestyle. Now, it looked as though my dad had a secret.

His problem, though, was that secrets were no longer necessarily safe from me.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Aunt Sarah heads home

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
After I spent some more time with Dad, I arranged for James to drive me close to the old clubhouse. Aunt Sarah's thoughts had impressed upon me the importance of keeping the place secret, so I "dressed down" and wrapped a turban around my head in place of my wig.

When I was ready, I had James drive me, and told him to let me out about six blocks away from the clubhouse, instructing him to pick me up at the same spot when I called for him. Once I was reasonably sure nobody was following me, I made my way to the outer gate and pushed the intercom button.

"Who is this?" asked a voice.

"Caitlin Spencer," I replied. "Aunt Sarah said I was expected?"

"One moment."

After a while, Lyssa came out to greet me. "How you doing, cuz?"

"I can't complain," I replied. "Mom's started rehab this morning, so I'm looking forward to seeing her again. What've you been up to?"

"Yesterday was pretty wild. We got a signal from the old blind post office, and it turned out to be some old friends. Then we met some lady who had some problems with our folks, and now she's in a jam. That's why we called you. They're worried that there might be some brainwashing involved."

"And, since it involves the brain, you thought of me?" I chuckled. "Well, let's check her out."

Lyssa led me through the clubhouse to a room where a young woman was waiting. She was dressed like a teenager, but she looked more like a woman who had teenage proportions for some reason. "Ms. Barns," Lyssa said, "this is Cait."

"How do you do?" I asked.

She shrugged. "My life's turned upside-down and inside-out in the past week, but I'm holding together. Ted says you can help me unravel my past?"

"I can try."

"How does that work?"

"Just relax, and trust me."

Once the two of us made eye contact, I went for a little "stroll" through her mind.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Go to the PCG clubhouse

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
I soon found myself floating in space, surrounded by images. Before I could make heads or tails of my surroundings, Ms. Barns appeared before me. "How did you get inside my head? What's going on?"

"It's a long story, ma'am," I replied. "I had an accident a while back, and developed telepathy and a limited ability to see the future as a result."

"Do you go into people's heads often?"

"As a matter of fact, you're my first. Usually, I just pick up people's thoughts like you overhear their conversations. The closest I've done to this was when I linked up with two of my friends to try to reason with a young schizophrenic yesterday."

"I heard about that attack at the mall. You were there? You helped that boy?"

"Kinda. One of the girls has a spirit guide, who told us what was happening to him. Once we understood that, we were able to 'talk' him down."

She seemed to relax a little. "Well, I'm not schizophrenic, so I should be an easier case. What do you need to know?"

"As much about you as I can."

Ms. Barns gave me a guided tour of her memories, with stops at the mystery pregnancy she experienced, her reunion with her daughter, and the accident that gave her her shrinking powers. "It's nice to know I've got something in common with you, Ms. Barns."

"Sarah, please."

I smiled. "My aunt's name is Sarah. Now, why does the chief think you might be a problem?"

"When I was younger, I was under the thrall of a shadowy government agency. I was supposed to kill him, but I wounded him instead, and fled for cover."

I whistled. "Good thing you missed him."

"I shot his shoulder. I never miss."

"Okay. How about we check out your memories of that assignment, and see if we find a clue?"

"Alright."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Inside Sarah Barns' mind

choices: Pull her out of that memory
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Sarah Barns and I soon flashed back to her childhood, to the moment before she broke away from the Agency. She was in a small, windowless room, with nothing but a dummy for company. "Did you play many games with that dummy?" I asked.

"Is 'How many ways can you kill someone' a game?" she replied.

"No."

"Then no, I didn't play games with it."

The only door in the room opened, and a man stepped inside. "Kiss Kiss, my dear," he said. "I have your new assignment."

"What is it?" Sarah replied.

He gave her a picture of a boy. It looked an awful lot like Garth Jones. "This is your target," the man said. "He is to be exterminated. I want a clean shot, right between the eyes."

"Understood."

Then it hit me: The younger Sarah was responding, but so was the grown Sarah beside me.

"Kiss Kiss, my dear," the man had said. I now understood that this was a trigger phrase, meant to bypass her conscious mind, so she would carry out her orders more efficiently. And I had just plopped her into receiving kill orders. I had to do something, but what?
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Continue

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
I somehow knew that the only way to remove a memory permanently was to replace it with a new one. Moving through Sarah's memories of her childhood, I hoped to find a happy memory to 'cut', remold and 'paste' over the programming memories and cure her. While searching, I came across a strong memory of her meeting Ted, face to face in an alley in the city of Rome. At the time, Ted had used the name Tex 'the mighty' to hide his true identity.

Momentarily distracted, I focused on it and found that, as it was Sarah's memories, I saw the events through her eyes. The only problem was, because I was experiencing her memory, I found myself actually feeling the past world around me as if I were actually there. Unknown to me, it was a trap, set up to stop any deprogramming.

*Careful, Cait!* came Amatra's voice in warning. *Don't get lost in Sarah's head!*

I barely heard Amatra's warning as the memory engulfed me...

"We meet again, my mysterious friend." staring Sarah down, Tex said. "I'm sad to see you working for the bad guys."

"Bad guys?" tilting her head to the side, Sarah asked.

As this was happening, I felt my own head tilt, not knowing that the brainwashing affecting Sarah was starting its work on my own mind. Fortunately, my powers were strong enough to hold it at bay, for the moment.

"This boy is of no use to us, Kayo." stepping up behind Sarah, a tall man in a business suit said. "Kill him."

To my surprise, I felt myself raising a rifle in my hands. I could feel its weight as I pulled back the safety and touched the trigger, leveling it with Tex's heart. Only, I did not fire, I could not get myself to pull the trigger as Tex looked at me with an unfamiliar fear in his eyes. "I- I'm trying to obey, Jon." apologetically, I heard myself say. "I want to obey but-"

"Kayo, kill him, now!" sternly, Jon ordered.

"Don't listen to him!" regaining his composure, Tex said. "You are better than this, better than him!"

I felt my hands beginning to shake, a feeling of uncertainty filling my mind. "I- I must obey." stammering, I said. "Jon is my master, I am his slave."

"You are not a slave!" roared Tex, startling me. "You are a confused little girl being toyed with by a sick man who uses you to murder people!"

"Shut him up!" pointing at Tex, Jon yelled. "He is trying to turn us on each other!"

Again, I felt my hands shake. "Mommy... daddy...." tears forming, I whimpered.

"Did Jon kill them to get you?" taking a step forward, Tex asked. "Drop the rifle and I'll rattle his bones for you."

I felt my hands rise up again, my finger on the rifle trigger. "I must defend Jon!" blankly, I yelled. "Do not come closer!"

"You can't win, boy." smirking, Jon said. "Kayo is ours and nothing you can say will turn her against me."

Tex's eyes narrowed to angry slits. "Nothing, huh?" hissing, he asked. "Kayo, who killed mommy and daddy?"

Once again, I felt my hands quiver only I too felt tears running down my face. "Jon... did." slowly, tearfully, I replied.

"Why protect someone who killed those you love the most?" taking another step closer, Tex asked. "Drop the rifle."

"Kayo, for the last time, kill the boy or I will kill you both!" impatient, Jon said.

Inside the room, Garth and Grace exchanged concerned looks. "What's gotten into Cait?" asked Grace. "She's acting more and more like she's reliving a painful memory in Sarah's mind."

"You're asking me?" shrugging, Garth asked. "You're the one with the supercharged brain."

Suddenly, a handgun materialized into my hand and I turned to Garth, leveling it at his left shoulder. Everyone in the room froze as a sad smile formed onto my face. With a glassy look in my eyes, I said, "I am sorry."

With that, I pulled the trigger...
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Memory trap!

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
The gun clicked.

I pulled the trigger again. no result.

Garth slapped the gun out of my hand. "What's gotten into you, Cait?"

"I... I must kill you, Ted," I said. "But the gun won't work, so I cannot. I must. I cannot. Must... Cannot... "

I passed out.

I awoke later, and found myself handcuffed to a chair.

Grace cautiously opened the door. "Are you awake?"

"I think so," I said. "I guess I did something stupid, huh?"

"You could call it that," Chief Jones said, as he stepped into the room. "Apparently, you wanted to kill me, and tried to kill Garth. Good thing the gun you teleported wasn't loaded."

"You were right," I said. "Ms. Barns still has her programming. I took her back through her memories, and stumbled onto it. When I tried to undo it, I got trapped in the programming."

He nodded. "So we'll need to be careful around her. Rhea's not going to like that, but we can't take chances."

Garth's voice came from the hall. "Is she back to normal yet?"

"Still bald and telepathic," I replied, "but not homicidal. Is that close enough?"

He stepped into the room. "I'll take it." It was good to see him smiling again only I saw Lyssa standing right behind him, as if to protect him, making me inwardly sigh, though I couldn't really blame her.

"Hagen was too clever for us," the chief explained. "Cait's attempt to undo Barns' programming got her into a trap. The feedback loop from her unloaded gun knocked her out and freed her."

"Try to be gentle with her, Chief," I begged. "She's as much a victim as you were."

"I'll try to remember that, Cait. Thank you for the attempt. What do you want to do now?"

"I'll go a few blocks away, and arrange for my driver to pick me up. See you guys at school tomorrow."

"Sure you wouldn't rather spend the night here?" Grace asked.

I shook my head. "I've got some personal stuff to check up on. Sorry I couldn't be of more help."

Grace smiled. "You did what you could." sounding positive, she said. "And the old Caitlin Spencer wouldn't have done half as much for us. See you at school."

Ted unlocked the handcuffs. As Cait stood up and rubbed her wrists, Ted asked, "What was her trigger?"

"It was 'Kiss Kiss, my dear'," I replied. "Why?"

"I have an idea," was his answer. "I'll have the kids tell you about it tomorrow, if it works."

"Not even a hint?"

He smiled. "Let's just say Hagen wouldn't be the first person I've dealt with who turned out to be too clever for his own good."

"Before you leave, Cait," now smiling, Lyssa said. "There is something about Jess, err, Clem you need to know about."

"Clem?" curious, I asked. "What about him?"

"He's a shape shifter." beaming, Lyssa replied. "He also has a crush on you."

"I know about the crush but..." downhearted, I said. "Why would he date a hairless cue-ball like me?"

Lyssa giggled, confusing me, as she quickly lead me to Jess, who was now Clem again. "You two have the same secret." standing between him and I, Lyssa said. "I think it will help you both to know it."

Before either of us could react, she tore off our wigs, revealing both of our flawless bald heads. Both Clem and I gasped, seeing each other then smiled. After a moment, Clem seemed to snap out of his trance and quickly took out a notepad, scribbling down a telephone number.

"Um... call me later?" offering me the piece of paper, he asked.

Also snapping out of my trance, I shyly accepted the phone number and jotted down my own, offering it as well. "Um... you call me, okay? I have to go to work after school."

"The mall?" smiling, Clem asked.

"Yeah." blushing, I said. "I'm working as a living mannequin."

"So am I." to my surprise, Clem replied. "A salesgirl named Tracy Flynn suggested that I apply."

"That's why he was on the bus that day." hiding my building excitement. "He was trying to find a way to deal with his problem as I was."

"Were you interviewed by a Mrs. Rachel Waite?" looking at him, I asked.

Clem nodded. "Yes, I was." he replied.

"Oh boy." smiling, Lyssa said. "You two are likely to end up on the same display."

Both Clem and I blushed at that as Lyssa gave us back our wigs. "I'll have to thank Lyssa for that some time."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: The gun is empty.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Chief Jones unlocked the handcuffs. As I stood up and rubbed my wrists, he asked, "What was her trigger?"

"It was 'Kiss Kiss, my dear'," I replied. "Why?"

"I have an idea," was his answer. "I'll have the kids tell you about it tomorrow, if it works."

"Not even a hint?"

He smiled. "Let's just say Hagen wouldn't be the first person I've dealt with who turned out to be too clever for his own good."



Once James brought me back to the safe house, I checked back in with Dad. "How are things going at the house?"

"Crews are hard at work, kiddo," he replied. "They say we'll be back in our home by the end of the week."

Once I got back to my room, I turned on my computer, and started checking into some of Dad's business dealings. I figured I'd probably find some clues to his strange behavior there.

I was right. I found that he'd been sending money to two different women, people I didn't even know. Why would he do that?

As I looked further back, I started finding references to someone named Harrison Blackwell. This person dealt weekly with criminal slime like Clarence Mayweather and Jefferson Sykes.

This gave me pause. Why would my father know anyone connected to Sykes?
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Checking up on Dad

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
I printed out what I'd found, then went to Dad's study to confront him.

When I arrived, he was having a heated discussion with Marisol. "There's nothing to discuss with you," he said. "Or would you like for me to call Immigration?"

Marisol replied, "You can't do that, senor."

He sneered. "Watch me."

"I was not begging, Mr. Spencer. I have taken my citizenship exam. With all the help I've given Miss Caitlin with her schoolwork, I am likely to pass. I am only waiting for official word. A citizen cannot be expelled for arguing with her employer."

"She's right, Daddy," I said, inserting myself into the discussion. "And my lawyer says that she was eligible years ago, and that you were supposed to help her, but you held her green card over her head to force her into working for us. If you let her go without due cause, I'll make him available to her. By the time he's done, you'll be the one in the servants' quarters."

Dad blinked. He clearly wasn't expecting opposition from both his servant and his daughter. "That will be all, Marisol."

I didn't check on anybody's mind to see what they'd been arguing about, but Marisol had the look of someone who'd just won.

As she left, Dad asked, "Did you come here for any particular purpose, or did you just want to take sides on that issue?"

"I did want to talk to you, Daddy." I showed him what I'd found. "Who are these women? Why are you paying them? And what is your connection to Harrison Blackwell?"

He looked at the papers. "Can we discuss this another time?"

"Mom's not going to be at the treatment center forever. I want to know what she's going to discover, so I can help her with it. And the sooner I get my questions answered, the more time I'll have to decide what to tell her."

Dad sighed. The fear of Mom's reaction still drove him. "I've been sleeping with those women, while your mother's been getting drunk. The money is for their silence."

"I see. Is there any other concern? Any half-brothers or half-sisters who might turn up?"

"I've been quite careful," he replied. "As for Harrison Blackwell,... that name used to be mine."

"What were you doing working for the Sykes operation?"

"That's not important. Before I met your mother, I decided to skim some money from payments I was supposed to be collecting. I figured I could pass it off as skimming done by one of the guys I was reporting to, either Mayweather or Sykes. I picked Sykes."

"You didn't know he was the boss?"

"Not until after I'd done it. Needless to say, I needed a new identity, quickly, and your mother's insistence that I take her last name fit in perfectly." He paused. "Are there any other questions?"

I shook my head. "Ripping off Sykes was a stupid move, but I won't turn you in. However, you should consider cooperating with the authorities. Just avoid any dealings with a group called the Agency."

"And the girls?"

Now it was my turn to collect my thoughts. "I can't advise you on what to tell Mom. I don't know how she'll take it. But I do know that you need to call off your relationships with these women. Even if Mom should miss it, I'll know."

"Thank you, honey."

"Of course. And, Daddy?"

"Yes?"

I made sure I had eye contact with him. *I'm a lot harder to keep secrets from, since the plutonium.* With that, I went up to bed.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Confront Dad

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
When I woke up the next morning, I realized that I hadn't given any thought to what I would wear. Normally, I would have had my entire wardrobe planned out for the fall by a week before school started. With all that had happened to me, however, such things as fashion had almost slipped my mind.

It took me a while, but I got an outfit together. Then I put my hair on and went downstairs to breakfast.

When I got downstairs, Trish was helping Marisol fix breakfast. "Morning, Cait."

"Morning, Trish," I replied. "Sorry I wasn't down earlier, Marisol. I lost track of time getting dressed."

"I understand, chica," Marisol replied. "You're excited about the first day of school, after all."



I was talking to Garth, Lyssa, and the others outside the school, when I heard a loud noise. Suddenly, Lyssa fell over, with a hole in her head.

Garth looked up, there was another noise, and he fell down dead, too.

As the realization of what was happening sank in, panic filled the schoolyard, as more of my friends dropped like flies. I chanced a look across the street, and saw a man on the roof of a nearby building. Flashes of light matched up to the shots, and I realized that he was the one shooting.


"No!"

"Cait, what is it?" Trish asked.

At the sound of Trish's voice, I realized I was back at the breakfast table. No, that's not right: I hadn't left the table. I had had a vision of an attack at the school, one that would kill my friends. I immediately sent out a telepathic warning to Garth, Grace, Lyssa, Beth, and Sue.

"Cait," Trish asked, "what is going on?"

"I had a vision," I explained. "Somebody's going to do some shooting at the school."

My smartphone went off, so I answered it. "Yes?"

"Cait, it's Chief Jones. Is what my kids are telling me true?"

"Sir, someone will be on the roof of the apartment building across from the school, the one with the coffee shop on the ground floor, and that person is going to shoot a whole bunch of kids."

"Are you sure?"

"You have less than 59 minutes. Make them count." As I hung up, I realized that all the dead kids in my vision were the children of the Problem Child Gang. Was that a coincidence?

"Are you sure about that, Cait?" Trish asked.

"It's what I saw." I suppose I couldn't blame her. After all, now I was seeing two wolves in the schoolyard, snarling at kids. That didn't seem likely.

"Maybe we should stay home."

I shook my head. "The chief will have it under control, now that he knows where to be. We'll be fine. We weren't even among the injured."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Next morning (getting ready for school)

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
I sounded confident when I spoke to Trish. However, as we got closer to the school, I started to get nervous. What if my vision wasn't completely accurate? What if the shooter I knew about had an accomplice on another roof, who would take action if the first shooter got taken down? And why did I now keep seeing wolves prowling the schoolyard?

When we got to the schoolyard, we were met by Lyssa and Garth. "It's okay," Garth said. "Dad's got a team in position."

"We'll just act like everything's normal," added Lyssa, "and the other kids won't have any reason to believe otherwise."

We were soon approached by a young boy I'd seen at the clubhouse. As he got closer, a scan of his mind revealed that he was really an adult. "Hi, guys," he said.

I cocked an eyebrow. "Aren't you a little old to be hanging out at the schoolyard?"

"How did... oh, yeah, Sarah told me about you," he said. "My name's Todd. I'm Sarah's fiance. We heard on the scanner that there was something going on here today, so I came to keep an eye on things. I figured a teenage boy wouldn't attract as much attention."

"Speaking of Sarah, how is she?"

"She's fine," Garth said. "Once you were gone, they used the trigger phrase against itself. Hagen will never control her again."

Just then, Trish screamed.

When we looked to see why, we saw a pair of wolves, snarling and snapping at every student they approached. My second vision had somehow come true.

As we tried to figure out what was going on, I started to pick up something strange. I was reading thoughts, but I wasn't sure whose. With a start, I realized I was reading the wolves' minds. *Garth,* I warned, *these wolves... They're human!*

"Get everybody inside," he said. "I'll handle this."

As we herded the panicked students into the building, I began thinking about the wolf=people's thoughts. Something about one of them seemed... familiar.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: At school

choices: The girls ask me to set up 'Greg'.
I walk away to warn Lyssa.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Taking the chance to look at the wolves, I saw Garth grow to Olympian size before quickly looping one arm around one of the wolves and throwing it like a rag doll through a window. The glass shattered loudly, causing to gasp as I heard the mental cry of a boy. *Careful, Garth!* scolding, I thought to him. *They're human!*

Then I picked up his thoughts and was surprised by what I heard. *Travis Greenway!?* stunned, he thought. *How did he get mixed in with all of this!?*

It was then I saw Mr Sam Connors hurry through the window with Megan following. "Of course, Travis and Megan had a crush on each other since kindergarten.." muttering, I said. "Only how is Travis able to transform?"

When I saw Garth walk out with Travis, both normal again, I was tempted to 'take a peek' but quickly decided against it. I instead watched them talking with Mr Connors before looking up to see Clarence Mayweather being taken into custody by Mr Jones and a number of policemen. I smiled before hearing someone's thoughts. Don't give him the chance. Run him down. Finish him off.

"Who..." looking about, I asked.

Then a number of cheers rose from the crowd, causing me to turn to see Garth and Alyssa sharing a passionate kiss. "Well, its about time." smiling, I thought. "Lyssa wanted that kiss like forever."

"Just look at him." disgusted, a girl next to me said. "He's got Garth completely fooled, thinking he's a girl."

"The strongest boy in school and he picks Greg, the girl wannabe!" angrily, another girl grunted. "We should expose him for the fake he really is!"

I looked at the two girls, annoyed. More with myself as I used to hang around with them. "Had I stooped that low before all of this?" fighting my tears, I thought. "I better warn Lyssa."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: The school day begins

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
A mental scan helped me locate a vacant room. I slipped inside and gave the directions to Lyssa, adding that she should make sure she wasn't followed.

A short while later, Lyssa came in. "What's up?"

"First of all," I said, "congratulations on your first kiss."

She smiled, almost blushing, and touched her lips. "You saw that, huh?"

"What with that disturbance this morning, most of the school saw it. Congratulations, again. I hope it's the first of many."

"I can't get over it. My lips are still tingling from it." She took a breath. "You said there was something else?"

I nodded. "Some of my old friends - ex-friends, I should say - are plotting against you. They're figuring out some way to expose you in front of the whole school."

"Expose me? For what?"

"For getting a kiss from the strongest guy in the school, even though you were born the way you were."

Lyssa nodded, understanding. "Greg," she muttered. "Well," she said in her normal voice, "if they try, they'll be the ones in for a surprise. But thanks for the heads-up. Now I can't wait for PE."

"How do you figure?"

"Before, I had to dress and undress off in some corner away from the other girls." She smiled. "If they try something soon, it might just put me in with the others that much faster."

I gave her a hug. "Sorry for the way I acted before, cousin."

"We're not just cousins, Cait," she replied. "We're members of the new Problem Child Gang."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: I walk away to warn Lyssa.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
With our discussion over, Lyssa and I headed off to our homeroom. We were happy to recognize Sarah Barns as our homeroom teacher. *Thank you, Cait,* I heard her think. *Thanks to you, I don't have to worry about someone controlling me.*

*I'm glad to hear it,* I replied.

Before I broke off our mental link, I heard Ms. Barns think, *Now I just need to find some clothes that'll change size with me. I'm tired of walking around naked when I shrink and grow.*

That gave me an idea. One of my parents' friends was a yo-yo dieter. She got tired of having her favorite clothes being too big for her in some cases, and too small for her at other times. She paid somebody to develop a special expanding and contracting fabric, so that she could wear her favorite clothes no matter what she weighed. Perhaps I could get a few bolts of this fabric for Ms. Barns.

The school day started, and Ms. Barns stood up. "Good morning, class," she said. "My name is Ms. Barns. I'll be your homeroom teacher this year. This will be my first teaching position, so I'm starting out much like you are. My hope is that I will help you to grow into the best people you can be, and that this experience will make me a better teacher in the years ahead."

Through it all, I kept my eye on Lyssa. I knew my former friends would do everything in their power to sabotage her new popularity as Garth Jones's girlfriend, and I could only hope that she wouldn't be treated too badly, since I couldn't be with her all day.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Homeroom

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Once homeroom was over, it was time to make my way to my first class, American History. As I headed for the classroom, Amatra asked, *Are you sure about this? If you block out people's thoughts, you won't be able to perceive the future.*

*I'm sure,* I replied. *Reading minds would be quicker, but it would be cheating.*

As I took notes, a thought occurred to me: If I could enlist someone to watch over Lyssa, maybe that person could protect her from anything too awful.

Giving it some thought, I concluded that P.E. would probably be the girls' best chance to strike. Looking around the room, I spotted the unforgettable face of Lilith Nightshade, our school's resident goth. I remembered how I used to make fun of her, until she made it clear that she didn't care what I said about her. I'd never told her, but I kind of admired that about her.

As the class let out, I tapped Lilith on the shoulder. She looked at me and asked, "What do you want?"

I swallowed. "You've got 3rd period P.E. with Lyssa Vance, right?"

"So?"

"Keep an eye on her. I heard somebody planning something about her, and I don't want her hurt."

She snorted. "Since when do you care?"

I sighed. I deserved that. "I've changed a lot this summer. Besides, I found out she's my cousin."

She shrugged. "I'll see what I can do."

"Thanks, Lilith. I knew I could count on you."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: First class

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
I was well into 3rd period Geometry when the announcement came over the PA: "Will Caitlin Spencer please report to the principal's office?"

I looked to the teacher, who nodded, giving me permission to leave the class. As I made my way to Principal Hendrick's office, Amatra asked, *Do you still want to block out people's thoughts?*

*I'll be open during this talk with the principal,* I decided. *Once she's dismissed me, we'll go back to blocking.*

When I entered the principal's office, I saw Amber MacReady and Cassie Hamilton were there as well. They'd had P.E. with Lyssa, so I knew they must have done something.

"Good morning, Caitlin," Principal Hendrick said. "I want to know what you know about what happened to Alyssa Vance today."

I swallowed hard. "I overheard Amber and Cassie talking about doing something to her, so I warned her to be on her toes. Later, I saw Lilith, and I knew she was in P.E. with Lyssa, so I asked her to keep an eye on her. Is she okay? What happened?"

"And this is all that you know?"

"Yes, ma'am. Is Lyssa alright?"

"During dodge-ball, your friend, Amber, called everyone's attention to her, and pulled Alyssa's pants down, exposing her to the entire class. She was understandably shaken up, so I sent her home for the rest of the day."

I asked, "And why didn't Lilith stop it?"

Amber snorted. "The undead carpet-licker was on the wrong side of the net."

Principal Hendrick frowned. "Amber, we do not tolerate such hateful words. This is your verbal warning."

Amber shrugged. "Sorry. Rug-muncher? Anyway, what I want to know is, how'd she get her parts changed? She looked like a real girl."

"Maybe she found a plastic surgeon to do the job," Cassie suggested.

"Nobody would do that," I replied. "Just ask the doc who did your boobs."

As Cassie blushed, Amber said, "Who are you to talk? Everybody knows you get your blond hair from a bottle."

"Not anymore," I said, removing my wig.

Cassie looked back and forth from my head to Amber's hair. Even without mind-reading, I could tell what happened to her.

"Enough of this," the principal said. "Cassie, you are suspended from school for the next three days. Amber, you are suspended for six days, due to your language. You will both be given notes, which your parents must sign before you may return to school. Caitlin, you may return to your classes."

As we left the office, I caught Amber thinking about the principal. I won't repeat what she was thinking, but, if the principal had heard it, Amber might well have gotten expelled.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Later on

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
I met up with Trish again when we picked up our lunch trays. "What did the principal want?" she asked.

"Amber and Cassie attacked Lyssa in P.E.," I replied. "Principal Hendrick wanted to find out if I had anything to do with it, since I used to be friends with them."

We sat down with Garth, Grace, and Sue. "Did the principal say anything to you?" Garth asked.

I nodded. "Lyssa was shaken up, so she sent her home for the day. When you see her, tell her I'll come over sometime after work."

"What's being done about the other two?"

"Cassie's been suspended for the next three days. Amber's been suspended for six, since she mouthed off about Lilith Nightshade's sexual orientation."

Grace shook her head. "I can't imagine what she goes through."

I caught Garth thinking, *Cait, does she think nobody knows about her and Natalie?*

I gave her a quick scan. *She seems unaware. How many people know?* It was the first I'd heard about it.

*Just about everyone who knows either of them.*

Sue subtly caught my attention. *Cait, can I confide in you?*

*Sure,* I thought as I ate. *What's on your mind?*

*I'm not really sure about who I should be attracted to. Any advice?*

*I'm not sure I'm qualified to give dating tips, Sue. My first boyfriend cheated on me, and one guy I had a crush on turned out to be gay. I like Clem a lot, but we're just starting out.*

*I mean, I don't know if I'm straight or gay.*

I thought about that for a bit. *Try this: Whenever you're not busy, check out the people around you, or the people on TV, and tell yourself honestly which ones you'd like to sleep with. Once you've got a large enough group, you'll be able to figure out which way you go.*
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Lunch

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Once school was over, James picked me up and brought me home. As I changed into something more casual, I took a long look in the mirror. I had originally dyed my hair because I didn't like the light brown I was born with. Now that I had learned about my family, I started giving serious thought to getting a wig in my natural color. If nothing else, I thought, it might cheer Lyssa up when I see her after work.

Once I was dressed again, James drove me to Macy's. "I'm going to visit a store when I'm done," I told him. "I'll call you when I'm ready."

"Yes, miss."

When I reached the office where I'd leave my belongings, Clem was already there. "I hope I'm not late, Clem."

"You're right on time," said the manager. "Let me tell you what we're looking for from you. You'll be modeling our late fall looks. As you stand on the display, do not look at each other or touch each other. Remember, parents will be making the decisions on what to buy, and we want them to be able to see you as stand-ins for their own children."

"We understand."

As we got into our separate changing areas, I caught Clem thinking, *I wish she hadn't said that. I'd like to tell Cait how I feel about her.*

I grinned and sent, *That's easier than you think, Clem.*

I heard him gasp. *Y-you can read my mind?*

*And look an hour into the future. And, for the record, I feel the same way about you.*



We took our places at the display. Clem thought, *Cool. We can have a conversation without anyone knowing.*

*I know,* I replied. *How do you like your hair?*

*It's okay. My mom made it for me. I wonder if it'd look better if I had a professional do it?*

*I'm going to my wig shop after work. If you want, you can tag along, maybe see if they have anything you like.*
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Continue

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
I was enjoying myself more than usual as a mannequin. Part of it was that Clem was next to me, but it helped that I had some real company, someone who knew what I could do. We spent a lot of time exchanging thoughts as the customers looked at us, none of them suspecting that we were real people.

Suddenly, a disturbance caught my attention. Two teen boys were running through the store, pursued by a customer service representative. "Stop! Thieves!" she called.

*Should we do something?* Clem thought.

*We can't,* I replied. *We're supposed to be mannequins.* I sighed quietly. *I wish I could make them stop.*

Suddenly, I felt a burst of force shoot out of my brain, and the thieves fell over as if they'd been hit by a truck.

*Whoa,* Clem thought, *did you see that?*

*Yes, I saw.*

*Wonder what caused that?*

*I think... I think I did.*

*You didn't tell me you were telekinetic.*

*I'd never done anything like that before just now.* I would need to work on this new power. I wouldn't want to knock everything over. Sometimes, I figured, I would only want to catch something, or direct it from one spot to another.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: A surprise

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
The work day finally ended, and Clem and I put on our regular clothes again. "Who knew standing around doing nothing was so hard?" Clem said.

"I know," I replied. "C'mon, let's get our new hair."

When we got to the wig shop, we wound up with the same clerk who waited on me when I first found out I could read minds. *Great,* she thought, *the girl who hears voices is back. Wonder what she'll do next?* "Hello," she said.

"Hello," I replied. "I'm thinking of getting a different hair color, maybe light brown. And my friend, here, would like something other than his homemade look."

"I'll see what I can find," she said. "Sir, why don't you have a look around, and see what interests you?"

Once the clerk left for the back room, Clem and I started shopping for his wig. To my surprise, though, he seemed as interested in the wigs for girls as for boys. *Wonder how this would look on Jennifer?* he thought.

*Who's Jennifer?*

He jumped in surprise, then explained, *I'm a shape-shifter. Rhea likes it when I turn into a big sister for her, and she's taken to calling me Jennifer when I do that. She wants me to be her a little more often.*

I smiled at the thought of Clem wrapped around his little sister's finger. When the clerk returned, I pointed out a wig closer to Clem's hair and said, "I think I'd like one of those, too."

She nodded and said, "Just let me see to your friend, and I can pick up both." Then she thought, *Great, a wig for every personality.

Clem got his new wig, and we paid for our purchases. Once we were out of the store, I gave him the second wig I picked out. "Jennifer should look lovely in this."

"Thanks. So, what's next?"

"You can go home, if you like. I've got to go see Lyssa. She had a bad day today, and I want to see how she's doing."

"I'll go with you," he replied. "For two years, when Lyssa needed a friend, I stayed away. If she needs some cheering up, I want to do my part."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: At the wig shop

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
As we got into the limo, Clem called his Mom. "I'll be a little later," he said. "My friend Lyssa needs some cheering up, she had a bad day today."

"Alright, Clem," over the phone, I heard his mom reply. "I don't recall meeting any friend of yours named Lyssa."

"She used to be Greg," after a pause, Clem explained. "When she told me she wanted to be a girl, I didn't take it very well, and avoided her for two years. We're working on rebuilding our friendship. She's actually turned into a real girl, now."

"That's good to hear, Clem." came his mother's response.

I smiled, hearing an unspoken 'About time, young man,' "Tell Lyssa that I said hello, and that I'm glad that she got what she wanted. Goodbye."

As Clem hung up, he turned to me. "That sales clerk didn't seem to like you much."

I shifted, uncomfortable. "I make her nervous, is all."

"How would you make her nervous? Does she think you own the store, and she'll be fired if she screws up?"

I swallowed, wondering how to explain it. "Imagine that you didn't know what telepathy was, and a girl my age walked in and started arguing with nobody. What would you think?"

The implications sank in, and Clem gingerly touched my hand. "She thinks you're... ?"

I nodded, and took his hand. "And I can't tell her she's wrong, 'cause I don't know who she'd tell. We've got enough problems."

We arrived at Lyssa's house. Mrs. Vance opened the door for us. "Cait, good to see you. I like the new hair color." Turning to Clem, she said, "Clem, it's been a while."

Clem nodded. "Lyssa and I are working that out, ma'am. How is she?"

"Doing better. Garth was a big help for her. There have been a few more - "

Mrs. Vance was interrupted by her husband shouting, "Sam! Get down here this instant!"

Being telepathic, I instantly knew to look up. I was surprised to see Lyssa's two year old little brother waddling on the ceiling. "I have fun," the kid replied. "I wike this."

"Typical boy." smiling, I thought. "Trying to get away with everything he can." "Sam," gently, I said, "you don't look so good. How do you feel?"

Sam looked to her to reply, but started shaking his head instead.

"You'll feel better on the ground," holding my arms under him, I said. "Come down."

Sam floated down into my arms. "You had too much blood going to your head," smiling, I explained to him. "It was making you dizzy. Don't do that again. You might get hurt, and we don't want that."

I placed Sam into Mrs. Vance's lap, just as Lyssa came downstairs. "Hey, guys," she said. "Wow, Cait. With that new color, you look a lot like me."

I smiled at that. "That's why I picked it out. How you doing, cuz?"

"A lot better," she said, hugging me. Turning to Clem, she said, "I had quite a day today."

"So I hear," Clem replied. "What all happened?"

"Chief Jones and his men took down that guy who was going to shoot at us. Turns out he was Clarence Mayweather, one of the guys the original Problem Child Gang tangled with."

"We have quite the history," Mrs. Vance said. "He was the one who put me in this chair, trying to kill me."

"After that," Lyssa continued, "I got my first kiss from Garth."

"Congratulations," Clem said. "But you didn't get sent home because of a kiss."

Lyssa's expression turned serious. "A couple girls at school got jealous of all the attention I was getting, so they pulled my pants down in P.E. Don't worry, they've been punished."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Visiting Lyssa

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
That night, inside my family's safe house, I tossed and turned as disturbing images filled my mind. I saw a man with longish brown hair and wild green eyes standing on what could only be described as a large floating platform. I recognized him from the graphic novels as Sykes, 'the immortal one'. He was wearing an odd all leather armor than made him look like an actor from some medieval reenactment. Standing behind him, on the floating platform were a number of masked men with others behind him on four other platforms.

My heart jumped upon seeing the platforms were flying towards the mansion headquarters of the original Problem Child Gang. I wanted to yell out a warning, do anything to stop what was happening but I could do nothing but watch in horror as Sykes took what looked like a rocket launcher from one of his followers and fired a strange laser beam at the mansion. The second the laser hit, the entire mansion exploded into flames.

Sykes then laughed maniacally as he yelled, "Burn, you little brats! Feel the wrath of the immortal one!"

I woke up screaming, bolting up in bed. Sweat poured off of me as I trembled, struggling to catch my breath. Marisol ran in and saw me crying into my hands. "What is it, child!?" quickly sitting beside me, she asked. "Tell me what happened!"

I began to wail as I pulled Marisol into a hug. "Oh, Marisol, it was horrible!" crying, I said. "I'm praying it was only a nightmare!" I then explained the dream I had to her. "If its not a dream, Sykes is back and he's stronger than ever!"

Marisol gulped. "I read those novels." softly, she whispered. "If Sykes is back.... I have to call Chief Jones!"

"Mar- Marisol, should I go to school today?" shaken, I asked.

"I'll see what Chief Jones says." breaking the hug, Marisol said. "Wait here."

Marisol left the room, grabbing a telephone. I tried to hear what was being said but, in my emotional state, I found that I could not access my telepathic powers. "Calm down." desperately, I thought to myself. "Calm down."

A few minutes later, Marisol entered the room with a small suitcase. "Start packing, Caitlin." firmly but kindly, she said. "We are moving to the substation, police orders."

"What- What about school?" still shaken, I asked. "I- I can't calm do-down enough to warn the- the others with my- my telepathy."

"You will be going to school today." serious, Marisol replied. "But first, you need to tell Chief Jones exactly what you saw in your dream."

I sighed and took the phone from Marisol and relayed the entire dream between shaken tears. When I was done, Ted spoke. "I must ask you not to speak a word of this to anyone while at school." serious, he said. "Let it wait until we can all regroup, is that clear?"

"Yes, sir." still crying, I replied.

"I need you to be brave, Miss Spencer." firmly but kindly, Ted said. "You are no use to yourself or others if you can not get a grip and focus."

"I- I know, Mr Jones." sobbing, I said. "I'm just... just scared."

"I'd be worried if you weren't." gently, Ted said. "Please pull yourself together, I promise you everything will be alright, we beat Sykes before and we will again."

With that, Ted ended the call and I gave the phone back to Marisol. "I'll pack right now." shaking, I said. "Can- Can you stay with me? I'll help you pack when I'm done... I just don't want to be alone right now."

Marisol nodded and began to help me pack while I desperately tried to calm myself....
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Nightmare or vision...

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
I found it hard to focus at school, the nightmare or vision kept replaying in my head. I considered going to Principal Hendrick for advice but I was under 'police orders' not to talk to anyone about it at school. It was almost maddening, not being able to hear anyone's thoughts while I was still feeling extremely on edge.

"What am I going to do?" tearful, I thought.

*There is nothing you can do to stop what has been done.* came Amatra's voice in my head. *Focus your energies on what can be done.*

"It's good to hear a voice in my head." grinning slightly, I thought. "You've been silent lately."

*I don't like to be a 'chatter box'.* with a giggle, Amatra replied. *But, if spoken to, I do answer.*

That made me feel more comfortable and I was able to relax more. Slowly, people's thoughts began to trickle into my mind again. I blocked out most of them but, to a telepath, not hearing voices is disturbing, it made me feel very alone. I managed to make it to lunch, though I was still worried about the dream, and saw Lyssa talking to Lilith and her two Goth friends. In the beginning, I could not stand them but I slowly realized that I really knew nothing about them other than they were different.

"I really should get to know them better." wincing, I whispered. "After all, Lilith proved to be a good friend and I thought she was even creepier than them."

Just then, my phone rang and I quickly answered. It was Amber McReady, one of the girls who has attacked Lyssa the other day. "Cait, I hope we are still on good terms because I really need you right now." shaken, Amber said. "Something happened this morning, I- I can't explain it, you'll think I'm lying or crazy."

I immediately knew that Amber was genuinely scared and confused, which worried me, she was normally emotionally solid. "I've heard and seen a lot of crazy things in the past few days, Amber." patiently, I replied. "What is this about?"

"Not over the phone." her voice cracking, Amber replied. "Can you come to my house? If its possible, please bring Lyssa with you... she might know something."

"Okay..." worried, I said. "We'll be over shortly after school."

With that, I ended the call and walked over to Lyssa, who was still with Lilith and her friends. As I came closer, I heard Mel speak. "When Mom found out she was pregnant, my dad said he was heading out for a carton of cigarettes. That's the last anyone saw or heard from him."

I winced. "Ouch." Mel had never talked about her home life. It made me feel bad as I never knew she had it so rough.

"I'm sorry, Mel." wincing, Lilith said.

Mel sighed. "It really hurt with the cancer. Mom said my college fund was eaten up by my medical bills. I don't know what I'm going to do when I finish high school."

Hearing that, I remembered what Amatra had said to me earlier today. 'focus on what you can do...' I then knotted my jaws in decision and asked, "How much do you need?"

Everyone at the table turned to me, surprised as Mel asked, "What did you say?"

"What sort of schooling did you want after high school?" serious, I asked. "Find out how much it'll cost, and I'll pay for it. I didn't mean to interrupt, but I came to tell Lyssa something, and I couldn't help overhearing."

"I couldn't do that," Mel said. "I'd never be able to pay you back."

"Please," rolling my eyes, I said. "Do you know how many millions I'd have to give you before I started to feel it?" I giggled slightly. "Don't worry about the money. I've learned it's like fertilizer: Spread it around, and beautiful things come to light. Keep it in one place, and everyone knows where you live, but everybody thinks you stink."

Everyone at the table was floored by my generosity. The silence was almost killing me. Finally, Lyssa was the next to speak. "What did you want to tell me?"

"Oh. You're not going to believe this," looking at her, I said, "but Amber McReady wants to see both of us after school."

"What?" surprised, Lyssa asked. "What does she want to see me for? Did she say?"

"She didn't say. Don't worry, though." confident, I replied. "She knows we're cousins, and she knows I won't let anything happen to you, if I can stop it."

Lyssa gave me a questioning look. I knew that her women's intuition was strong, she sensed trouble at Amber's house, which was what I suspected as well. A quick glance at Lilith told me that she suspected this as well. "Perhaps it would be best if we brought her along." biting my lip, I thought. "Her magic powers may come in handy if we find trouble."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: At school.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
After school, I had James drive Lilith, Lyssa and I to Amber's house. Even before we came near to the house, I sensed something was wrong so, upon getting out, I turned to the driver. "Please wait here in case I need you." firmly but kindly, I ordered. "I have a bad feeling about this."

"Yes ma'am." fingering his sidearm, James replied. "I will be ready."

"If you had a bad feeling about this, why are we here?" curious, Lyssa asked.

"I have a bad feeling Amber is in trouble, not us." frowning, I replied. then I thought, "Not yet, at least."

Then a feeling of dread fell over me. I turned to Lilith in time to see her shiver. "I'm feeling it now." producing her Tarot card deck, she said. "I have a bad feeling Amber is not alone in there."

Then a scream was heard from inside, it was Amber's but it seemed strange somehow. I ran ran forward and thrust my hand forward. It was a new mental power I discovered while working as a 'living mannequin' with Clem at Macy's. I remembered how it knocked those two crooks for a loop and I used that same invisible force to reduce the front door to splinters. We all ran inside to find a man kicking and punching Amber all around the living room with her vainly struggling against him. Acting quickly, Lilith pulled a card from her deck and tossed it into the air, declaring, "Knight of Swords, defend Amber McReady!"

There was a puff of smoke and a knight on a horse appeared on the front lawn before it took off after a black van with tinted windows. "What..." puzzled, she whispered.

I was surprised as well, seeing the knight on horseback racing after the van but then I scanned the man's mind, along with Amber's and I realized it was a trap! "You commanded the knight to defend Amber McReady!" my eyes widening, I said. "That's not her!"

Suddenly the man stopped attacking the girl and landed a punch into my gut, forcing me to stumble back a few steps. Then the girl suddenly went after Lyssa, throwing kicks and chops in too quick of succession for her to use her speed. All she could do was dodge and back away, looking for room to move. I barely caught a glimpse of Lilith reaching for her deck when someone grabbed her from behind and pulled her out the front door with a cloth over her mouth and nose! "I have to help them!" concerned, I thought.

Only, I had problems of my own as the man gets lunging at me, trying to land a blow. Strangely, he seemed to be completely avoiding my head. That was when I realized they wanted us alive with little to no damage to our powers. Fortunately, being a telepath, I was able to read what move he was going to make before he made them and effortlessly dodged each blow. "I need to pacify this guy fast." worried for Lilith and Lyssa, I thought. "I think I know just the thing..."

I sent out a powerful mental command to the man's subconscious mind, "You are a baby!"

Almost immediately, he crumbled to the floor and began to babble like a happy baby. I giggled slightly, seeing him drooling. "Now, my little one, you are going to be a good baby and stay right where you are." cooing the man, I said.

I was transfixed on the man I had mentally regressed into infancy until Lilith ran in. Snapping out of my momentary trance, I turned to see Lyssa delivering super speed kicks to every part of the girl's body, keeping her pinned against the wall, shaking from convolutions from the rapid blows.

"Lyssa, that's enough!" touching her deck, Lilith yelled. "She's had it!"

For a moment, I feared that Lyssa had gone crazy with rage and I was about to push her away with my mind when she suddenly stopped, allowing the girl to slide to the floor, moaning. "I wasn't hitting her hard." limping towards Lilith, she protested. "The first thing she attacked was my legs, I couldn't kick with my full strength if I tried right now."

"Their trying to weaken us." fearful, Lilith mussed. "I had to use two cards at once to protect Amber and myself."

I nodded in agreement then turned to see a boy walk in behind Lilith. Seeing her as well, Lyssa's jaw dropped in shock. "Is that... Amber!?" stunned, she asked.

"I'm afraid so." wincing, Lilith replied. "She's hoping we can help her figure out what's causing this." she then quickly added, "There's more, James was not our driver. It was someone else and he managed to get close, too close, without any of us realizing it."

"This is not good." shaking my head, I said. "We can't stay here." I then turned to Amber. "I'm afraid you will have to come with us."

"How are we going to get to... where ever we are going?" curious, Amber asked.

Suddenly, she moaned slightly then sighed as her body changed back into a girl before our eyes. "I'm back..." relief in her voice, she said. "I'm beautiful again."

I sighed then pulled out my cellphone and dialed a number. A moment later, someone picked up. As it was on speakerphone, we all heard James' voice. "James here..." in a strained voice, he said.

"James. are you okay, you're not injured or anything?" urgently, I asked.

"Just a bump on the head." after a moan, James replied. "Where are you, are you okay?"

"We're fine but we need pick up, bring the fastest car you can snag." I gave the address.

"I'm on my way."

After I ended the call, Lilith turned to Amber. "This is not over." firmly but kindly, she said as Lyssa called Garth's father, the police chief. "Those goons will be back and, for whatever reason, they want you as badly as they want us."

Amber gulped. "But why!?" trembling, she asked. "What do I have anyone could possibly want!?"

"That is what we have to figure out." seriously, Lilith replied.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Visiting Amber.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
It was not long after before a familiar police cruiser pulled up with its lights and sirens blaring. Seeing Chief Ted Jones step out greatly surprised me. "I thought James was a fast driver, Chief." impressed, I said.

"I'm sure he is." serious, Ted replied. "But this car goes much faster than anything else on the street." he walked up to us. "What's going on, girls?"

"The Agency came after Amber McReady," Lilith said. "They had agents disguised as Amber and James."

"Why would they be after you, Miss McReady?" turning to her, Ted asked.

"I don't know," she replied. "But that's not the weirdest thing to happen to me today." She took a deep breath and swallowed. "For a few hours, I was a boy. I was hoping Lyssa could explain it, but I'm me again, so I guess I don't need to worry."

"Guess again." ruefully, Lyssa said. "When I started changing, I changed back and forth, too."

Amber looked worried. "But... that doesn't mean it'll happen to me. Right?"

"Amber," turning to her, I said, "how's your bra feel?"

Amber was puzzled by the question, then looked down and grabbed her breasts. "What's happening?"

"Your breasts are smaller," sighing, Lyssa said. "As I became a girl, my breasts grew. The opposite seems to be happening to you."

"Why is this happening?" tearing up, Amber asked. "What did you do to me?"

"None of us did anything," serious, Lilith said. "The seeds for this were sown long ago, and I don't know how to find the answers."

"Maybe Beth can," after a thought, Lyssa said. "I'll ask her."

"That will have to wait," Ted inserted. "If Amber is at risk, we need to take action to protect her." turning to Amber, he said, "Call your parents, collect anything you'll need. I'll need to bring you to the S.U.B. Station."

As other police officers arrived on the scene, Ted urged Amber to call her parents. "They are not going to believe me." frowning, she muttered. "What am I going to do?"

I turned, sensing a presence, and silently sighed, seeing Madam Vague appear behind the rest of the group as if she had just turned a corner. "She always seemed to appear when she was most needed." quoting a line from the graphic novels, I thought. "Maybe, someday, I'll be able to do that too."

"Leave that to me." calmly, she said.

The others turned to find Madame Vague. She approached Amber and gently took her phone. "May I?"

Amber nodded, dumbfounded as Vague then dialed a number. A few rings later, a woman answered. "Amber?"

"Blessed be, sister Tonya." gently, mom said. "Our mutual enemies have targeted Amber and tried to kidnap her; my daughter and her friends foiled the attempt."

A muffled response came from the phone. I could not hear what was said but Amber's mother sounded understandably upset.

"Be at peace, Tonya." calmly, Vague said. "Amber is just fine but Tex feels we should move her to the substation for her own protection." after a pause, she added, "She is showing the signs of becoming a guardian."

"A guardian?" curious, I thought. "What is that? A male Amazon, perhaps?"

"She's just started, from what I can see." eying Amber, Vague said to a muffled response. she then gave Lilith a glance and began to talk in a language I did not recognize.

I tried to use my telepathic powers to try to translate the words but Madame Vague seemed ready for that as all I got was static. "She's more powerful than she lets on." impressed, I thought.

After ending the call, Vague turned to Ted who was returning from the house. From the look on his face, I knew that the three who had attacked us were already long gone. "It was Vendetta and Psyche." with a growl, he said. "They both got away but we have their flunky."

I remembered the two characters names were mentioned a few times in the graphic novels. "The had tangled with the original group in the past." disturbed, I thought. "Only why did they look so young?" then I realized that they must have had powers similar to our own and suppressed a shiver.

"He won't talk, Ted." softly, Vague warned.

"I know, Madame Vague." frowning deeper, Ted replied. "Its not like the old days where we can scare what we want out of those we catch, I have to follow the letter of the law."

Twenty minutes later, we all arrived at the substation with Amber, who was still shaken by the sudden darkness when Lilith used the moon card to get us there. "It took me by surprise as well." urging Amber out of mom's car, she said. "Welcome to the Subterranean Urban Base station."

"It really existed!?" startled, Amber asked. "Does that mean..."

"Chief Jones was Tex the mighty." serious, Lilith replied. "All of it was real, including the Agency, who attacked you today."

"How did your mom know my mother?" still rattled, Amber asked. "Is there anything else I should know about?"

"Actually, there is." walking into view, Mrs Jones said.

I turned to find her walking towards us with Garth and Grace following, leading a short and thin thirteen year old boy with longish sand blond hair and green eyes. Upon seeing him, the boy's entire life flashed before my eyes. It was not because I had scanned his mind but because his mind was still innocent, an open book for any telepath to read. "Poor kid." wincing, I thought. "He's had it rough..."

"Blessed be, Mrs Jones and family." kindly, Lilith said. "Who is your new friend?"

Heather smiled. "Everyone, I'd like you to meet the newest member of our family." motioning to the small boy, she said. "This is Tim Jones, he was an orphan from Europe."

"I sense you were in the hands of the Agency." serious, Lilith said.

"He was but he was not brainwashed." cutting in, I said. "His mind is free." then I thought, "Free but very afraid. I guess that's why we haven't seen him before today."

"That and I have already met him." smiling, Mrs Vance said. "He has the strange power to make anything he draws come to life."

"Why didn't we meet him earlier?" confused, Lilith asked.

"Because, child," patiently, Vague replied, "he was too scared to come out."

"We convinced him you were all cool." placing a firm hand onto his shoulder, Garth chimed in. "These are my friends, little bro, you couldn't be in safer hands."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Ted Jones arrives.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
"Welcome to the S.U.B. Station, Tim," Lilith said, holding out a hand. "My name's Lilith."

"Hi," he replied, shaking her hand. "If Mr. Jones had said there were pretty girls like you here, I might have made my presence known sooner."

"Cool your jets, bro," Grace told him. "Lilith isn't into guys."

"So, you can bring your drawings to life?" Lilith asked, brushing off the attempted flirting. "I can call up the figures from my Tarot cards. That sounds similar."

"Not exactly," Tim replied. "My drawings actually move on the page. And I can actually become them. Want a demonstration?"

We all nodded eagerly.

He opened his sketchbook and stopped on one page. "Say hello to... "

Having powerful mental abilities somehow allowed me to see things moving fast with greater ease. I was surprised and impressed to see dozens of pieces of paper surrounding and reforming Tim's body into a different form. In what was the blink of an eye to others, A tall woman appeared where Tim once stood. "... Amazona, Princess of Power!" finishing his line, the woman said."

I grinned, shaking my head. This Amazon Tim had created around himself proved he knew very little about women in general. The figure was six feet tall, with breasts that were completely too big for her body under a skin tight costume. "He has a lot to learn." amused, I thought.

Lilith snorted. "Yeah, you came up with that one."

"What do you mean?" confused, the 'woman' asked.

"If you try moving around off the printed page," Lilith explained, "those bazongas are going to be more of a hindrance than a help. They block your field of vision, they'll restrict your arm movement, and they'll make you fall over the second your back isn't straight."

"Told ya, Tim." smiling, Grace added.

Madame Vague, I noticed, did well to stifle a giggle of her own. She caught Lyssa's eye and winked at her. "This child has little to no experience with real women." I heard her carefully whisper to Lyssa. "He will need guidance."

The woman, Amazona, tried moving around, and quickly saw that we weren't joking. "I see your point, younglings," she said. "I am sure the artist sees it, too."

"Huh?" confused, Lyssa asked.

"Tim doesn't just change physically," Garth explained. "The characters he creates come alive as he envisions them. So you're really talking to a character in a comic book."

Amazona touched the paper again, and all the papers that made her form flipped back into his notebook in a blink of an eye, reattaching themselves to the glue that held them there. In an instant, a sheepish Tim stood before us. "Thanks for the advice," he said. "I'll definitely redesign her before I call on her again."

"You do that," Grace said. "And, please, stop making her costume rip in strategic places in battle."

I smiled, hearing Lyssa giggle.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Getting to know Tim.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Tim's lips trembled slightly, tears forming. I could tell he was hurt, thinking he did not impress everyone as he had hoped to. "Poor kid." sighing, I thought. "At least he now has a brighter future ahead of him."

"There, there, Tim." cooing him, Lyssa said. "No one is mad at you."

"Not at all." roughing Tim's hair, Grace said. "Just give the female characters you make some dignity, okay?"

Tim sniffed at little but managed a smile. "O- Okay." he said.

"Good boy." smiling, Vague said. she turned to the others. "Lilith and I need to have a word with Amber before her mother arrives with her husband."

As Lilith and Madame Vague walked off to another room with Amber, a strong vision filled my mind. I saw my cousins, Annette, Damien, and Amadeus running from a number of me who were invading their home while my uncle Crecatous, dad's bother, fighting another group of the same men. I rose a hand to my head, as the vision vanished, worried for them.

"What's wrong?" concerned, Lyssa asked.

"I just got a vision." worried, I replied. "It's my uncle Crecatous, dad's bother."

"What about him?" worried, Lyssa asked. "Is he okay?"

I began to cry, something I tried very hard not to do in front of others. "They attacked his house...." tearfully, I said. "The Agency... they invaded his home, his kids are on the run..." then, I got another vision and saw them exiting an RV in front of my mansion home, which was currently vacant. "I have to go."

With that, I teleported out of the Substation and reappeared, feeling drained, inside the front foyer of my mansion home. I staggered slightly then moved to the pantry and quickly grabbed an energy bar from the cupboard before eating it. "That's a little better." my dizziness fading slightly, I breathed. "I have to work on building my strength before doing that too many times."

I then returned to the foyer and looked out the window, waiting. The RV soon parked in front of the mansion and saw Annette step out first. Immediately, I knew she and Damien had gained the ability to shrink and grow, much like Sarah Barns, our home room teacher. I winced slightly, sensing that she was tempted to become a giantess and stomp my home to pieces.

"Damien is tempted to turn into a giant and stomp on my home too." sadly, I thought. "I truly had been a total bitch to everyone." I sighed then whispered, "Well, that has all changed."

Shortly after, Amadeus, knocked on the door. I paused, sensing that he had somehow gained peak human abilities in everything. Attributes, intelligence, memory... it was a simple but powerful ability. "No wonder the Agency was after them." gulping, I thought. Summoning my courage, I opened the door.

"Hello, Caitlin. Its been awhile." calmly, Amadeus said.

"Amadeus. You and the twins are the last people I would have expected here." acting surprised, I said. "Where's your dad?"

"That is actually why we are here." wincing, Amadeus replied. "May we come in?"

"By all means."

As soon as they entered, Amadeus explained everything that had happened in the past weeks. Of course, I could have gained the entire story in an instant but I feared that Amadeus may sense it and become fearful, or worse, become offended. I did not interrupt but asked a few questions to confirm the story.

"So that's the story." sighing, Amadeus said. "We were hoping we could stay here for awhile."

"I would love to have you, Amadeus." serious, I said. "However, Agency could track you back here." I then smiled. "Fear not, though, I know where you can go."

"You do?" raising an eyebrow, Amadeus asked.

"You remember the Problem Child Gang your dad would always tell us about?" still smiling, I asked.

"Of course." confused, Amadeus replied. "Why?" then it seemed to hit him and I heard him think, "It was all real... I should have guessed!"

"Its starting back up again." turning serious, I replied. "Apparently, several of the kids from school have powers like me and you guys."

"Wait! You have powers?" surprised, Annette asked.

"Yes. I can read minds, among other things." ruefully, I said. "So I hope your not still planning to stomp my house down."

Annette gave a slight nervous giggle as Damien did the same. Only Amadeus broke the silence by speaking up again. "That would be an ideal place for us." serious, he said. "They might even be able to help my siblings gain control of their size changing powers." he then frowned. "However, I would need to know where this base is."

"I can take you there." nodding, I said.

"Fair enough." quickly, Amadeus said. "Come on! We're going back into the RV."

"Are we really taking her with us?" causing me to wince, Damien complained.

"No complaining, Damien." annoyed, Amadeus hissed. "We need her."

We then went back into the RV and drove off and Amadeus drove. "Head out of town." serious, I instructed. "None of you will stand a chance against the Agency without training and you are about to get a lot of it."
