I could sense that Annette and Damien were worried as they knew so little about the Agency and what they did but I had no time to deal with it then. Amadeus followed my instructions and quickly drove out of town. "Now what?" as we left the city limits, he asked.

I smiled. "We go down." simply she replied.

With that, I pulled out a 'door opener' Ted Jones had given me earlier and hit a button. To my cousins' surprise, a section of the road lowered in front of us like a ramp and Amadeus drove down it into an underground garage as the secret entrance closed behind us.

"Where are we?" as the RV stopped in a parking space, Annette asked.

"Welcome to the substation." smiling, I said. "This is the headquarters of the new Problem Child Gang."

"You trust us enough to take us directly here?" suspicious, Amadeus asked.

"If I could not read minds and see over an hour into the future, no." serious, I replied. "However, I can and I know that you three are legit and that you will be needed very soon."

"What do you mean needed?" worried, Damien asked.

"Sykes is about to make his move." serious, I said. "I confirmed this through Madam Vague and Lilith Nightshade, our in team advisers." she held back a shudder. "Something big is on the horizon and we all have to be ready."

"What is it you need us to do?" rising from the driver's seat, Amadeus asked.

I sighed. "We need to see what you can do then teach you how to use it and fast."

Who goes first?
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: trouble at home.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Damien and Annette walked ahead of us. "My brother and I will be going first." Annette said.

"Okay, let's see what you got?" kindly, I said.

I sensed Annette calming her mind before she quickly began to shrink. "Emotions control her powers." surprised, I thought. "That may prove a problem if anyone outside this group learns of that."

I then watched Damien do the same before growing to a ten foot height. "He has the same issue." sighing, I thought. "We will have to work on that."

"Incredible. Size changing powers." smiling politely, I said. "These could be useful."

"True, they could but, there is a problem." wincing, Amadeus explained. "Currently, their powers are linked to emotions." he sighed. "I've tried to get them to master those powers, but I have had no luck. I was hoping you and your friends could help them through that."

"I think we can do that." as Annette and Damien returned to their normal size, I said. "So, Amadeus. Care to demonstrate that special talent of yours?"

"I would be glad to." nodding, Amadeus replied.

"Special talent? What does she mean, big brother?" Damien asked in curiosity.

"You'll see in just a minute." serious, Amadeus said. "Its something I was born with. Hope you enjoy." he then turned to me. "I saw that this place has some automated defense systems, can you activate them?"

"I'm not sure about activating the automatic defenses." worried, I said. "True, they are twenty years old and designed not to kill but they are still really intense."

"It's a waste of time to try to explain everything to you as you obviously already read my mind." calmly, Amadeus said. "Still, I am asking you to trust me."

I sighed. "Sorry, I normally make it a rule not to read anyone's mind without their permission." looking at him, I said. "Are you sure you can handle this?" Amadeus nodded and I turned to Damien and Annette. "You two come with me, we can watch your brother from behind the security glass."

Wondering what their brother had in mind, the two followed me to a room where I closed a heavy steel door before turning to a control panel that had a microphone. "What is he going to do?" worried, Annette asked.

"Wave around his man card." frowning, I replied. I then hit an intercom button. "Get ready, I'm activating the defense systems." warning him, I said. "To shut them down, you will have to get to the control room on the other side of the station."

With that, I hit a small series of buttons and a number of trash receptacles rose at the lids, revealing automatic weapons that began to fire darts at Amadeus! Annette screamed, seeing this, but paused as we all saw Amadeus almost effortlessly dodge the line of fire, running right at them! I watched, nervous, seeing him get hit a total of eight times before finally reaching the second control room where he soon shut down the defense systems. "You reckless, impulsive..." scolding him I thought.

"I-Incredible...." whispered Annette.

"He got hit eight times." frowning, I said. "Had those been bullets, he would have been severely injured."

"Still, that's damn impressive." stunned, Damien said. "I didn't know Amadeus had that in him."

"That is my power, Cait." walking into the room, Amadeus said. "I can do anything I try as if I have done it all my life. I'm far from invincible but I'm really hard to take down."

I sighed. "You are reckless." scolding, I said. "The people we are up against are monsters, they will not hesitate to use any weakness you have against you."

"I'm glad to see you still care." with a slight smile, Amadeus said.

I returned the smile before....

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
We all turned to see Ted run in, looking about in alarm. "Why were the defenses activated?" taking notice of my cousins and I, he asked. "Are we under attack?" he then eyed my cousins suspiciously.

"They are no threat, Chief Jones," calmly, I said. "These are my cousins; Amadeus, Damien and Annette, the Agency attacked their house and I thought it best to bring them here for protection." then I thought to him, "The defenses were used in a training exercise."

Ted sighed. "You did the right thing Cait," more calmly, he said. "but next time you activate our defenses, give us some warning."

"I will." blushing, I said.

Ted then walked into the next room and cued a video on the control panel. A moment later, he came back out and looked at my cousins. "I just watched you three demonstrate your powers." serious, he said. "We'll need abilities like yours when we go up against Sykes and the Agency, if you can help us, we'll help you to find your dad."

"You believe he is still alive," hopeful, Annette asked.

"The Agency wants all four of you under its power," serious, Ted said. "They won't kill him if they think they can force you to join them through him."

"What do you need us to do?" asked Amadeus.

"Follow me," said Chief Jones "You four can join up with the others. I fear Sykes will attack in the next few days, so we need you to train together so you can fight more effectively."

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: meeting the other members.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
"I need you all to first settle in before we do anything." serious, Ted said. "Go pick out a room that has not been taken and unpack what belonging you have."

"We- We don't have any belongings." tearing up, Annette said. "We fled from our home and drove straight to cousin Caitlin's house. All we really have are the clothes on our backs."

"I'm sorry." sighing, Ted said. "We'll get your measurements and buy you some clothes and essentials as soon as we can." he then turned to me. "I have some funds set aside for..."

"Please, Mr. Jones." smiling, I interrupted. "I think I can spare the change."

Ted smiled then turned back to Annette, Amadeus and Damien. "Once you are all settled in, we will get you three up to date." calmly, he said. "Also, don't worry; we'll find your father, I promise."

Annette nodded then followed Amadeus and Damien further into the station to find some rooms to get settled in. Once they were gone, I turned to Ted. "Our family seems to be getting bigger and bigger." worried, I said. "How much bigger can it get?"

Ted sighed. "As big as it needs to be." he replied. "What do you think about Amadeus?"

"He's really good but a bit reckless." honestly, I said. "Why?"

"I'm thinking about making him second in command." serious, Ted replied. "I know he's new to the group but we need someone who can take the reigns if Garth cracks."

"Garth has some esteem issues, I'll give you that." wincing I said. "Only he's a really good leader."

"I'm not saying he can't handle it, Miss Spencer." firmly, Ted said. "Still, it would not hurt to have someone to turn to if things turn bad." his face softened as he added, "That and I have a gut feeling Garth could use someone to turn to when he feels uncertain."

"Why not you?" worried, I asked.

"I can't be there to help him all the time." softly, Ted replied. "He needs someone within the group to keep him balanced." he then smiled, adding, "Someone other than Alyssa Vance."

I smiled at that. "They do make a cute couple."

Ted chuckled then turned serious. "We better get back to the others so we can organize ourselves."
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: continue.

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Shortly after entering the 'main hall' as we had come to call it, Garth spoke up. "We should get everyone together." serious, he said. "We need to put everything we know on the table and try to get a better picture of what we are dealing with."

"Not now, tonight." firmly, Ted said. "When we are able to gather freely."

"Why?" curious, Gar asked. "Where is everyone?"

"Susan Tanner is in another part of the station, finishing her training with her parents." serious, Ted said. "They tell me they will be finished by tonight."

"Marisol is almost done unpacking." chiming in, I said. "Trish and Brad are helping her." I then smiled, adding, "I have a feeling they are going to get back together."

Heather sighed. "Alyssa is watching over her brother, Sam while her parents consult Beth." softly, she said. "Her ability to communicate with spirits had increased in power, it has her a bit shaken."

"I'd shaken too if ghosts talked to me." sighing, I thought. "Maybe I can help her block some of them out as I learned to block out other people's thoughts."

"My mom and I might be able to help her with that." serious, Lilith said. "We'll talk to her later."

Ted nodded then turned to Alex. "Mr Rodgers needs to be brought up to speed so he understands what he may be facing in the near future." calmly, he said. "Sarah Barns will arrive after sunset, Madam Vague has agreed to escort her here."

"Don't forget about me." piping in, Tim said.

"Relax, lad." roughing up his hair, Flynn said. "No one is forgetting about you."

"We'll discuss what you saw in your sketch book with Madam Vague when she returns with Mrs Barns and her husband." firmly but kindly, Ted said. he then turned to the others. "Damien, Anette, and Amadeus Johnson are getting themselves settled. We will be talking to them later."

"What of Travis and Megan?" looking as worried as everyone else, he asked.

"Travis Greenway and Megan Connors have gone missing." to everyone's concern, Ted replied. "I have my best men looking into it but, from what we have so far, it looks like some government agency got wind of their abilities."

Hearing this, Lilith drew a card from her deck. Only, upon seeing what she had drawn, she turned pale before turning to her mother who sighed. "Heaven help them." she whispered.

"What is it?" turning to Lilith, Gar asked. "What card did you draw?"

"It's the Devil card." softly, Lilith said. "Travis and Megan are with some bad company."

"Caitlin, can you find them?" turning to her, Gar asked.

I placed a light hand onto my head, focusing on Travis and Megan. I did not see much, just a tall man in all black with his back to my vision. He was talking with Travis and Megan in a bare room; both of them had fearful expressions on their faces. It was hard to determine if it was fear or anger or both.

"They are safe, for the moment." after a pause, I replied. "Though I sense they feel threatened."

Unknown to me, Madame Vague had drawn a card from her own deck but she did not show it to anyone, not even Lilith. "They are with a new player." cryptically, she said. "Someone who follows a different set of rules."

"That new player must be the man I saw in my vision." worried, I thought. "Only I can't tell who he is as I can't see his face."

We all turned to each other, concerned before dad sighed and said...

1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Before I could utter a word, I head the screech of breaks followed by Chief Ted's voice outside the main entrance! "Garth, Grace! Get in the car; NOW!"

We all rushed out through the front entrance of the mall to find Chief Ted outside a strange looking grey four door car. Right behind him, Alyssa's mom, who I called aunt Liv, stopped with a strange car of her own; calling for her and Beth. "Hurry, kids!" Urgency in her voice, she screamed. "Run!"

I followed behind the others and sighed in relief seeing a black limousine with James, my trusted driver in his security detail body armor. He was a tall dark figure who was like a second father to me. He held the back door open urging me to hurry. "Please, Miss Spencer!" Firmly, he urged, time is short!"

"Everyone knows where to go!" Firmly, Chief Ted barked. "Move! Move! Move!"

I jumped into the back of the limousine to find Marisol and Trish sitting inside looking nervous. "James picked us up saying that there was an emergency." Frightened, Trish said.

James closed the door to the limo then jumped in the driver's seat before driving away at high speeds towards the back roads behind the mall. "Your mother instructed me to keep you three safe." Serious, James said. "You will be taken to a secure location until she and the other parents can finish what they had started years ago."

"Do you know anything about that?" Worried, I asked.

James sighed. "I know that your mother and your aunt Liv were closer than they let on." Serious, he said. "The two of them have always been and will always be inseparable." He then smiled. "I was her to go guy to send messages back and forth."

I smiled, remembering aunt Liv. She was the 'black sheep' of the family because she married a private detective rather than to a wealthy man her parents tried to arrange for her. I giggled catching what James said about being mom's 'go to guy'. "You were the post boy for the Problem Child Gang!"

James chuckled. "I didn't see half of the action the Problem Child Gang got into but I had my share of bouts with Sykes and his merry men." Smiling, he said. "I got caught and tied up a few times only to be saved by 'Heather'."

I giggled inside seeing one of James' memories of him as a scrappy young boy being rescued by a spunky little girl. *Those misadventures must have inspired him to become so strong today.* Smiling, I thought.

*Where is he taking us?* I heard Trish think, frightened.

"James, I need to know where we are going." Firmly but kindly, I said.

James was silent for a moment before he replied. "We are going to the clubhouse. It is the safest place right now as its true location was kept out of the graphic novel."

I slowly nodded, knowing he was telling the truth. "When we get to the clubhouse, I want a full briefing, James." Sternly, I said. "You understand that my friends and I have many concerns."

"I will tell you what I can before I must be off again." Equally as stern, James said. "This is not a game or a fantasy, this is real life."

He then remained silent but I picked up one thought that startled me. *Our old enemies are after the kids to get revenge on us. I can't let that happen!*
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: Your choice.

choices: James left before I could stop him.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.content:
Within minutes, we arrived at the abandoned town of Nowhere. It was originally going to be an addition to Waterfront City only it was deemed unsafe to inhabit due to the fact it was built over an old coal mine. There were concerns regarding sinkholes so the town was left unfinished.

"Why are we here?" Curious, Trish asked. "This can't be the clubhouse from the graphic comic series."

James kept driving through the town straight towards the entrance to the old coal mine. He pressed a button on the dashboard and the boards sealing the entrance raised much like that of a garage door. The limo drove through with the door closing behind them. I looked out through the glass divider to find that we were driving down a slight slope on a spiraling road deep into the coal mine. Upon reaching the bottom, we realized we were in a small parking lot.

"The clubhouse took approximately twenty million dollars to construct." Serious, James said. "Your mother contributed five million while the rest of the funds came from the other wealthy members of the group. It was constructed in less than a month due to some out of town assistance."

He stepped out of the limo then opened the door for us. I looked around but found no door that would lead us any further. "Where do we go from here, James?" Politely, I asked.

James walked to a section of the wall and reached into a nook. We hard a series of buttons being pressed before a panel slid open revealing a key lock. "This is not the most direct way into the clubhouse." Remaining serious, he said. "We are taking this route just in case we were followed."

I nodded then waited as James retrieved a key from his pocket and turned the lock. With a click, a section of the wall moved, revealing a secret door leading deeper in. Upon hurrying through, we found a maze of tunnels. "This is maze hall, made for the sole purpose to slow down any would be intruders." Motioning to the dozens of passageways, James said. "You will be safe here until we finish what we had started and keep you busy enough to keep you out of harms way."

I knew that James had every intention to leave us alone in the maze and meet up with the rest of the original group. Only I was not certain how to react.
1511211212112111222112111122111111211111.title: We arrive at an abandoned town.

152.content:
Hi. My name's Alyssa Vance. You can call me Lyssa.

I'm 14 years old, and I've made about an A- average as I get ready for high school. I enjoy running, and I've recently gotten into tennis.

What makes me a "problem child"? Call it an accident of birth. I was born in the body of a boy.



I was seven when my older sister, Bethany, caught me in her room, wearing one of her dresses. "Greg? What the heck?"

Have you ever tried to explain something that even you don't fully understand? That's how I felt, explaining to Beth why I was wearing her clothes. By the time I finished, I was crying.

Beth surprised me with her reaction. While she was plenty mad when she first caught me, she calmed down as I spoke. When I started crying, she hugged me until the tears stopped. Then she had me wash my face, so my eyes wouldn't be puffy. Then the two of us went downstairs, to explain all this to Mom and Dad.

I had no idea how they'd take it. Dad always loved taking me out to the backyard to play catch, and Mom had just recently recovered from the car accident that left her in a wheelchair for the rest of her life.

As it turned out, they reacted a lot like Beth. They told me they loved me, and they wanted me to be happy. "If that means you want to wear dresses," Dad said, "then I guess you'll need to do that."

A few weeks later, on my eighth birthday, came the next step. It was after my birthday party, and all my friends had gone home. I went up to my room to watch TV. Before long, though, Beth knocked on my door and said, "Come on downstairs. Your birthday isn't over yet." I followed her, puzzled at what her words meant.

Once I was in the family room, I saw more presents waiting for me. Only, these were wrapped in pink.

As I unwrapped them, I found dresses, skirts, and blouses. All girl's clothes, even panties and girl's shoes. In one box was a wig.

"Your own clothes," Mom said. "You don't need to borrow Beth's, anymore. Why don't you try something on?"

I picked out some clothes and brought them upstairs. Back in my room, I took off all the clothes I'd been wearing, then tried out the panties. I didn't like the bulge in the front, and figured out I should tuck my stuff between my legs. Once I was fully dressed, I went back downstairs.

"Very nice, Greg," Mom said.

"That's not much of a Greg," Dad said. "I think somebody's going to need a new name, to go with the new wardrobe."

And so I began my double life. During the day, I was Greg. However, I was usually Alyssa by dinnertime.

After a few years of that, however, I got tired of it. So, one day, sometime after Mom had announced she was pregnant again, I made the announcement that I wanted to be Alyssa full-time.

"I had a hunch this was coming," Dad said. "For your last birthday and Christmas lists, most of the things you really wanted were for Alyssa." So, as of my twelfth birthday, I was no longer Greg.

Since Dad was an attorney, there was very little trouble getting me into junior high as Alyssa. The first jock who broke my nose got suspended, and the second was expelled. I've gotten philosophical about it; it's just one more thing to take care of, when the time comes for the full enchilada.

We got me on hormone therapy, so some of my features have slowly feminized, I'm not growing facial hair or thick body hair, and my breasts are slowly taking shape. Mom says they'll be fine, but I keep thinking I'll need to add implants to the full enchilada.

I've got a bit of a crush on one boy, Garth Jones, but I don't know if he shares my feelings. I haven't pressed him. We were friends back when I was living as a boy, so it might be strange for him. In any case, I'm still biologically male, so dating could get awkward for both of us.
152.title: Custom Character 2.

1521.content:
So, the morning began like most. Once I'd showered and washed my hair, and after it dried, I took my hormone pills and got dressed. The pills seemed to be affecting my privates, as they were smaller than they'd been when I started on this journey. Who knows, I thought, maybe I'll luck out and get the full enchilada early? Soon, I was ready for my morning run.

First, though, I had to hug and kiss my baby brother, Sam. Maybe I shouldn't call him baby, since he's 18 months old, but Mom and Dad still call him their baby, so I guess it's okay.

I stuck my earphones in, turned on my mp3player, and set off. Once Lady Gaga started playing, I zoned out, looking only to make sure I didn't accidentally head into traffic, as I ran alongside the highway.

Like I said, I found it pretty easy to lose track of the world around me as I ran, but one sign caught my attention. I ran in place, trying to decipher it. I'd never seen it before, and with good reason: It was miles from my house.

I looked at the sign. Then I looked at my watch. Then I looked back at the sign. Then, I dug out my phone, to doublecheck the time, in case my watch was broken.

The phone confirmed it. I had somehow run 60 miles in half an hour.
1521.title: Morning (far from) routine

15212.content:
"That is so unreal." I whispered. "How did I manage that?"

Feeling nervous I touched my chest, a learned girlish response, only to be in for another surprise. My budding breasts were not so budding anymore, they felt much larger. I looked down at myself and found that the bra I was wearing was now full with more than just a pair enhancement pads, I actually had breasts! "What is this!?" I whispered hoarsely.

Although it was my dream to truly become female, I was shocked to discover that I had grown B cup breasts in the time I had somehow ran 60 miles in a half hour. Part of me wanted to scream in horror while another part wanted to scream with delight but logic won out in the end and I quickly looked about to find a restaurant nearby. I jogged over to the eatery and entered the ladies restroom where I hurried into a stall and locked the door. "Is this a dream?" I wondered quietly, pulling down my gray and pink jogging pants and white panties. "Did everything change?"

I looked down and gulped, again feeling conflicted emotions as I discovered I now had a girl's vagina. It was like a sequence in a dream, my long sought after dream had come true. I teared up, wanting to shout for joy but became depressed as the changes reversed before my eyes, leaving me feeling drained. "What's happening to me!?" I cried. "This is too weird!"

It took me several minutes to calm myself down before I pulled my panties and jogging pants back up and left the bathroom. As I left the restaurant, still crying, I pulled out my cellphone again and dialed home. "Daddy, I need you!" I sobbed.

"Lyssa?" asked Dad's voice. "Where are you?"


Twenty minutes later, you were being driven home by dad who tried to get you to tell him what had happened. Only I was still too shocked and confused to put it into words. Upon arriving home, dad had a short conversation with mom and Bethany before they walked up to me with mom rolling closer in her chair. Even Sam, my baby brother, seemed concerned as he looked at me with his bright blue eyes. "Honey, please tell us what happened." said mom.

What can I do?
15212.title: The surprises continue.

152121.content:
"It... it's so hard to explain," I finally said

"Well," Mom said, "let's start with something that should be simple to explain. How did you get to be sixty miles from home, in so short a time? You should know better than to accept rides from strangers, or to go off with friends without telling us."

"I didn't get a ride from anyone," I said, "until after I called you. I... I ran that far, all on my own."

"What?"

"Es Issa okay?" looking up at mom, Sam asked. "She wok scar'd."

"We're trying to figure that out, sweetie." patiently, mom replied as she held him in her lap. "It'll be fine, I promise."

"Young lady," Dad said, "you'll need to make your story a little more plausible."

"It's the truth, Daddy. I was running, listening to my mp3 player, just zoning out. When I realized where I was, I found out I'd run that far, in just half an hour."

"If you could run that far, that fast," Dad asked, "why didn't you run back home again?"

"I wasn't sure if I could do it again. I didn't want whatever it was to conk out on me."

"That's certainly strange," Mom said. "Well, for today, I'm ordering you not to go running. I think one such adventure today is enough. And I don't want you running along the highway again. Just do a few laps around the park."

"I promise, Mom."

"It be okay, Issa." worried, Sam said. "Don't cwy."

With that, they left my room. Once I heard Mom's stairlift bringing her downstairs, I went to Beth's room.

"How'd it go?"

"I have to stay home today," I said, "and confine my running to the park."

Beth shrugged. "It could be worse. They really freaked after they got your phone call. Even Sam was worried and he's just learning to talk."

"I was pretty freaked, too." In a hushed voice, I added, "The running wasn't all that happened to me."

Beth's eyes went wide. "You didn't say anything about getting hurt."

"I didn't," I said, still whispering. "But, after I stopped running,... something else happened to me."

"What?"

"It didn't last long,... but I turned into a girl."
152121.title: I tell my family.

1521212.content:
Beth looked at me questionably. "What do you mean you turned into a girl?" she asked.

"I turned into a real girl." I replied. "Breasts, vagina, smooth skin, the whole enchilada!"

"You didn't feel any pain at all when this happened?" pressed Beth. "You did not notice your chest getting heavier or your clothing fitting better than before?"

I shook my head. "As I said, I was completely zoned out, listening to my mp3." I said. "Please, you have to believe me."

After a moment, Beth said, "I believe you, Alyssa. But what happened to you earlier might happen again."

"Well, what do you suggest?" I asked.

Beth smiled. "Let's try a controlled experiment on the treadmill in the basement." she suggested. "You get yourself in the zone, running on it and I'll monitor you for any changes." she smiled. "That way, we'll have a better idea of what to do."
I thought about this for a moment then smiled. "Okay, let's try it." I said.
1521212.title: Questions from Beth

15212121.content:
"So," I asked, "how are we going to do this?"

"Ho, sisters!"

The crew of the Amazonian fishing boat all responded to the lookout's cry. They took positions, expecting nothing, ready for anything.

It could have been anything, from a shark to an enemy vessel. What it was, however, was a raft, ill-suited for a voyage as long as was needed for it to reach this far. The Amazons approached the raft, and, peering over their own ship's rail, studied the raft.

On the raft was a young boy, burned by the sun, weak from hunger and thirst. Strangely, he was clad in the robes of a female. Why should a man dress as a woman? Moved by empathy and curiosity, they brought the boy onto their boat. Back on their island, the Amazons began nursing him back to health.

When he had recovered enough to speak, the Amazon queen herself went to speak to him. "Greetings, young traveler," she said. "I am Antiope, Queen of the Amazons. Who are you?"

The boy bowed his head. "I am Iolaus, Your Majesty."

"Well met, Iolaus. We found you adrift on the sea, and in a woman's robes. How came you into such dire straits, and why were you dressed so?"

"I... I scarce can explain myself, Your Majesty."

"Please, Iolaus, try."

"I... I like to wear such things. I know not why."

"Interesting. What put you on that raft?"

"The people of my city. My... dress offended them greatly. Some of them wanted to kill me outright."

"What stayed their hand?"

"They feared that the gods might think me an offering. If that happened, the gods would discover my true nature, and might be angered."

"Fear not, Iolaus. I have given the command that you are not to be harmed. I will direct my people to see if there is a way that we might help you."

When Iolaus could walk again, he was brought to the temple. There, he was bound to the altar, as the Amazon priestesses performed a strange ritual over him. Finally, the chief priestess unbound Iolaus, and led the traveler out of the temple.

All the Amazons, even Queen Antiope, were stunned. Iolaus was now a young woman.

"Sisters," cried the chief priestess, "I give you Iole, our new sister." And so Iole became known as the Twice-Named.

As Iole settled into life as an Amazon, it became clear that she had found favor with the gods. She could run faster than the eye could follow. She could outdistance any prey she chose. And, in the heat of battle, she could pluck an arrow in flight, as easily as fruit from a tree.

In time, she bore fourteen daughters and sons. When the time came for her to go to the Elysian Fields, at the end of her life, all the Amazons mourned her passing.

Blushing brightly, I did as my sister asked and she looked to find that I had a 'slit' below my tiny manhood. The blood was seeping from that slit. "Oh boy." she said, realizing what was going on. "I didn't expect it to happen like this." she giggled. "I thought I freaked when I had my first."

"What?" I asked, still shaken. "What's wrong with me?"

Beth grinned then reached into a drawer and pulled out a pad for me to see. "Welcome to womanhood, Alyssa." she said. "You're having your first period."

I gulped. "My first... period?" I asked. "How..."

Beth quickly explained what she had seen when she examined you then added, "You are becoming a true girl now, and everything that goes with it."

After a moment of thought, I smiled, still blushing. "After I get cleaned up, can you show me how to... um..."

Beth laughed. "Get cleaned up and I'll show you how to use one." she said.

I could not help smile as my dream was starting to quickly come true. "I'm having my very first period!" I whispered, giggling.

Beth shook her head, grinning. "You are the only 'girl' I know who's actually happy about having a period." she said. "I'm happy for you, though."

I nodded and stepped into the shower...
15212121221112222111121222.title: Scream for Beth

152121212211122221111212222.content:
"Good morning, girls, Sam." Mom said, as we sat down. "Lyssa, did I hear you scream last night? I thought I did, but your father slept through it."

"Sorry about that, Mom," I replied.

"Well, what was it about?"

With the biggest smile in the world on my face, I said, "I got my first period!"

"Per - Alyssa, you got a period?"

"Mmm-hmm. Once I got cleaned up, Beth showed me how to use a pad."

Mom wheeled over and hugged me. "Congratulations, sweetie. I can imagine how much this means to you. When you started down this road, as far as we knew, you'd never experience this part of womanhood."

"Yeah," Beth added. "Lucky for you, we have the family history we do."

Sam, sitting in his high chair, turned to me, confused. "Was a pewiod?" curious, he asked."

"It's a girl thing, Sam." smiling, Beth said.

"Oh." smiling back, Sam said. he happily returned to munching on his dry cereal.

"I'll be sure to pick up some things for you from the pharmacy, on my way home," Mom said. "Then, we can have The Talk after dinner." I swear, I could hear the capital letters when she spoke. "Are you having any cramps?"

"Not too bad. Like I did too many sit-ups."

"Unfair," Beth said. "When I ride the crimson tide, it's all I can do to get out of bed."

"Morning, all," Dad said, as he came in. He stopped when he noticed me. "Alyssa, are you padding your bra?"

"Nope. This is all me. And there's more."

"More?"

"I'm having my first period."

"What?"

"It's true, Frank," Mom said. "Lyssa's dream is coming true, in a big way. She's well on her way to true femininity."

He put his hand on my shoulder. "Congratulations, honey."

"Thanks, Daddy."
152121212211122221111212222.title: Telling mom at breakfast.

1521212122111222211112122221.content:
Dad graciously volunteered to drive us to the mall. "Hope you girls like knee-length skirts and blazers," he said. "That's what the new uniforms will be."

"Oh, great," Beth said. "We'll all look alike. Where's the incentive to learn our names?"

"They showed me some pictures of the outfits some girls were wearing," Dad replied. "As a father, I can tell you that uniforms are a much better way to go."



Dad's machismo could only take so much, so he went to look at the TVs while Beth and I got measured, and Beth helped me pick out some new bras. When we were ready, Dad paid for them, and we went to the food court.

"Thanks, Daddy," I said. "I know this wasn't how you wanted to spend the day."

"Don't be ridiculous," he replied. "Why wouldn't I want to spend the day with my girls?"

"I remember you always wanting to have a game of catch, when I was younger. I'm sure you miss that."

Dad's face turned serious. "Alyssa, from the day you were born, all I've wanted for you - for all my kids - was to be happy. When I realized what you needed to be happy, I'll admit, I felt bad about some of the things I had wanted to do with you.

"The more I thought about it, though, the more I realized I would be trading the things I would do with Gary for the things I would do with you. Like walking you down the aisle, and dancing with you at your wedding. And those are things I want to do. Plus, with what's going on now, I'll get to do even more things with you, like celebrate all the big announcements in your future.

"As I said, if you're happy, then I'm happy. With Sam, my worries ended when your mother was able to get through the pregnancy practically without a hitch. If Sam wants to play catch, I'll play with him. If he turns out to be the bookish sort, I'll buy him books. And, if he takes after his big sister, I'll be there, every step of the way, just like I am with you."

Dad's words struck a chord with me, and I started crying. The first time I discovered tears of joy.
1521212122111222211112122221.title: Father-daughter bonding

15212121221112222111121222211.content:
It was shortly after we had returned from the mall when mom asked me to join her in the bedroom. There, she asked me to close the door as she hoisted herself into the bed. "Do you need any help, mom?" I asked.

"No, I have this down to a science, dear." replied mom. "Thank you, though."

Mom got her self comfortable, covering herself with a light blanket, then looked me in the eye as I sat on the bed at her side, wondering what was on her mind. "You have already heard this lecture of puberty from a boy's perspective." said mom. "Believe me when I say, girls have a lot more to worry about."

Mom began to talk to you about periods and the dangers of having sex with a boy, stating, "When a girl has sex with a boy, she risks getting pregnant by that boy. That is something you are not ready for, young lady, so be careful."

"Mom, really?" I asked, blushing. "I don't even have a real boyfriend yet."

"You will, with as cute as you are, dear." said mom, winking at me. "Once the changes are finished, I have a feeling you will be turning a lot of heads at school." she lightly placed her hand onto my cheek, catching a single tear. "I'm happy for you, Alyssa, go make your dreams come true."

"Thanks, mom." I said, crying happily. "I'll do my best."

With that, I gave mom a kiss and a hug before leaving her to take a nap and walked down the hall to my room. Only, as I was about to open the door, dad called out, "Alyssa, you have a visitor!"

I turned towards the stairs, next to the elevator, curious. "A visitor?"

Who was it?
15212121221112222111121222211.title: Mom delivers The Talk

152121212211122221111212222111.content:
I went downstairs to see who it was, and got a pleasant surprise. Garth Jones was there, dressed in baggy sweats. "Hi, Garth. How are you?"

"I'm, uh, pretty good," he said, his eyes just about popping out of his head. "You look... different."

I smiled. "In a good way, I hope."

"Yeah," he replied. "What happened?"

I smiled wider, unable to contain myself. "I'm changing."

"Changing?"

I nodded. "I'm turning into a real girl. I thought I'd have to wait 'til I was grown to have surgery, but my body's doing it for me."

"How... how did this happen?"
152121212211122221111212222111.title: Garth Jones.

1521212122111222211112122221112.content:
"I'm still piecing it all together." I replied, blushing. "Part of it is because of my ancestry, a boy had changed into a girl under strange circumstances ages ago and, well, I guess it's my turn now."

"That's kind of creepy and mysterious." said Garth, hiding a grin. "I like that."

I giggled then leaned my weight onto one foot, imitating Beth when she was annoyed. "A girl can't share all her secrets."

Garth's smile broadened slightly. "You sound like my sister." he said. "I guess you really are becoming a girl." he chuckled. "I came over to see if your were okay but, from what I can see, you're doing just fine."

With that, he walked to the door. I rose my hand to stop him but brought it down as he turned back to me. "By the way, you really look cute." he said. "I'll see you at school."

After Garth had left, I turned to Beth, excited as mom smiled, knowing what was coming. "Did you hear that?" I asked, almost screaming. "Garth said I looked cute!"

Beth and I began to scream and laugh, jumping up and down, waving our hands in excitement. Mom giggled, shaking her head, "Alyssa is really becoming a true girl." she thought.

Outside, Garth winced, hearing Beth and I screaming and laughing then shook his head as well. "Girls, tell them their cute and they go ballistic." he muttered. "Go figure..."

Then, a voice inside him stated, "Excuse me..."

Garth blushed. "Oh, sorry."

152121212211122221111212222111221.content:
Ever since I talked to the doctor, I have been in a good mood. All that I had wished for all my life was finally coming to light. I thanked Iole in my prayers for helping make it possible last night and woke up feeling refreshed this morning. It was the day promised to paint the inside walls of the house and I was anxious to get started as it seemed each time I used my power of super speed, I became more and more truly female. "Slow down, honey." scolded mom from the other side of the table. "Save your speed for painting the house."

"I'm sorry, mom." I said. "I'm just anxious to get to work."

Mom nodded. "You'll reach full womanhood soon enough, dear." she said. "You've already reached a level we thought would be impossible for you." she sighed. "Relax, getting yourself worked up will not help you."

"You gonna get hiccups." looking at me, Sam warned.

Mom and Beth giggled. "You tell her, Sam." grinning, mom said.

I giggled myself, though I knew mom was right. I took a deep breath and let it out slow before finishing my breakfast at a slower pace. When I was done eating, Beth came down and we each gave mom a kiss on the cheek before heading out. "We'll be back in a few hours, mom." called Beth. "See you later."

Ten minutes later, Beth and I had gotten everything set up to start painting with newspaper down on the floor and the paint bin in a central location in the room we were starting with. "Okay, Lyssa, as soon as I get out of the way, do your thing." said Becky. "Just wait until I'm out of the room, I don't want to get painted."

I giggled and waited for Becky to step out of the room. Before I could start, though, Beth turned on some music. I let out a low laugh as the song was 'I'm so excited' by the Pointer Sisters. "It's fitting." I thought.

I moved my feet up and down in place in beat with the music then off I was, like a shot, painting the walls as if I were in on video, being fast scanned. Within a minute, the entire room was painted with two coats. "That was fun." I said.

"Off to the next room." said Beth. "Let's go." she paused, looking guilty. "I'm sorry I'm not much help."

I gave my sister a warm hug. "Not much help, really?" I asked. "You've helped me in ways I still don't know how to repay, ever since I started down this road to my dream of becoming a real girl. You've defended me against bullies, taught me girls' fashion, how to wear makeup, pulled an all nighter to research our family history to find Iole...." I shook my head. "You are more help than you'll ever know, sis."

"Thanks, Lyssa." said Beth.

I released Beth and gave her a light punch in the arm. "Come on, sis, let's bet back to work."

Beth nodded and took the radio to the next room, following me. Thirty minutes later, every wall inside the house had been painted in the colors that had been requested. As we cleaned up, Beth and i admired our work. "They're going to think we slaved all day to paint this house." giggled Beth.

"If it were not for my power, we would have." I said, smiling. "I thank Iole and God every day for these gifts."

Beth tiled her head, confused. "Gifts?" she asked.

I smiled. "Super speed and becoming a real girl."

1521212122111222211112122221112211.content:
As the day went on, I noticed that I wasn't changing back, like before. I watched the hours pass, in my feminine body, my excitement growing.

"It's starting to look like you might've finally stabilized," Mom said.

"I certainly hope so," I replied.

That night, when I went to bed, I slept naked, instead of putting on my nightgown. I didn't want anything to come between my eyes and hands, and the body of Alyssa Vance.



The next morning, when I woke up, I still hadn't changed. I was glad. The face in the mirror gave no hint that the person it belonged to had once been a boy.

Of course, that meant I had to go shopping yet again. This time, since it was Saturday, Mom drove Beth and me.

At Our Founders Mall, near the center of the city, I picked out enough new clothes to hold me over until a reasonable amount of time had passed, then said, "Let's look at the swimsuits."

"Lyssa," Beth said, "it's almost the end of beach season. Why get a suit now?"

"Maybe I won't spend a lot of time at the beach," I replied, "but we've still got a swimming pool. C'mon, let's see what they've got."

As I looked at the styles, Beth caught my attention. "Hey, Lyssa, check this out."

I went to where she was standing. At first, I thought she was looking at the swimsuit on the mannequin. Then, the mannequin's features caught my eye. "Holy cow! It looks like Cait Spenser!"

"Except she's got hair," Beth said.

I nodded. "And she keeps her nose higher in the air."

"Come on, girls," Mom lectured. "I thought I raised you better than to say mean things about people, behind their backs."

As we shopped, I thought, I wonder what Cait would say, if she knew I had finally turned into a girl?

*Congratulations.*

I turned around. Did I just hear Cait speak to me? I couldn't see her anywhere. Besides, I hadn't spoken aloud, so how could she have heard me? I chalked it up to low blood sugar.
1521212122111222211112122221112211.title: Shopping at the mall

15212121221112222111121222211122112.content:
As we returned home from shopping, mom took a glance at me in the rear view mirror and saw me frowning. This deeply concerned her as I had been all smiles up to this point during the day. "Honey, what's wrong?" she asked. "Are you changing back?"

I shook my head. "No, mom, I'm still a girl." I replied, tearing up. "I'm just worried that some might not accept me, once they learn that I'm a real girl now."

"That's ridiculous!" said Beth, looking at me from the front seat. "Garth accepted you for who you are, he even said you looked cute! Where are you getting this idea?"

"I'm just worried, that's all." I said, tears forming. "I'm really glad and grateful that I am a girl. It's just... you know how some people are."

"Those people you need not worry about, young lady." said mom, firmly but kindly. "We had this discussion when you first started down this path. Do what feels right to you and ignore those who would taunt you."

I smiled at that. "Thanks mom."

"No more depressing thoughts, okay." said Beth, smiling. "This is what you had been praying for all your life and now you have it, enjoy it."

My happiness returning, I let out a giggle. "I guess I had my first mood swing." I said.

Both mom and Beth laughed, causing me to blush. Only the laughter died when a loud bang was heard and mom began to struggle with the wheel as the car swerved violently. "Everyone hang on!" yelled mom.

Eventually, mom managed to regain control and parked the car at the curb, hitting the hazard lights. "Are you two okay?" she asked. "We had a blow out."

"We're fine." said Beth to my nod. "Just a little shaken."

"What are we going to do now?" I asked.

"Well, I guess I'll have to call in a tow." said mom, pulling out her cellphone.

Only, as she did, another car pulled up behind us and a familiar man exited the driver's seat. It was Ted Jones, followed by Garth, who was sitting in the front passenger seat. "Having a little trouble, Mrs Vance?" asked Ted, reaching the driver's window. "Could you use a hand?"

"That would be wonderful." said mom, smiling. she pulled a handle, popping the trunk. "The jack is not the best in the world, I'm afraid."

"That's okay." said Garth, smiling. "I think I can work with it."

Spotting dad's old work gloves on the floor by my feet, I picked them up and stepped out. "These might help." I said, offering them to Garth. "I don't want you to cut yourself."

Garth turned to me and took a step back, surprised. He was blushing! "Wow, you're hot." he whispered, causing me to blush with him. "Um... nice dress, it accents your figure well."

Ted smacked Garth in the back of the head. "Behave yourself." he scolded, lightly.

I giggled. "Thank you for the compliment." I said, smiling. "I'm a real girl now... the whole enchilada."

Ted turned to me, surprised. It looked as if he wanted to ask me something but he dismissed it and smiled politely. "Congratulations, Alyssa." he said. "I know that was your dream, I'm glad it came true for you."

"Thank you, Mr. Jones." I said, smiling.

"Everyone sit tight." said Garth. "This won't take but a minute or two."

"There's no one around, son." said Ted. "Let's do this."

At first, I was confused, wondering what the two were talking about. Then I was in for a surprise as Garth lifted the entire front end of the car with one hand and began to screw the lug nuts off with the other! Seeing my reaction, Ted chuckled. "You are not the only one who had gone through some changes." he said.

Inside the car, Beth and mom were startled, seeing Garth lift the front end of the car. Only Beth heard Beatriz' voice state... "Iole bore fourteen daughters and sons."

Beth smiled at this. "I guess Lole has smiled upon Garth as well." she thought.

Within two minutes, the spare tire was on the car and the flat tire was in the trunk. "You're all set to go, Mrs. Vance." said Ted, smiling. "I'm happy for your daughter." he then whispered, "So is my son."

Mom smiled, knowing of the crush I had on Garth. "I'll be sure to pass that along." she said.

"Thank you for your help, Garth." I said, blushing. "I really appreciate it."

Without thinking, I gave him a quick kiss on the cheek, causing him to blush brightly. "You're.... welcome." he said, slowly, rubbing his cheek.

Realizing what I did, I blushed even more and quickly got back into the car as mom thanked Ted and was soon driving off as Garth and Ted got back into their car.

"I think you just confessed your crush on him." said Beth, giggling.

Mom giggled as well. "I think he confessed his with the way he was blushing and rubbing that cheek." she added

Both mom and Beth giggled as I smiled, still blushing. "Do- Do you really think he likes me?" I asked.

"Why not call him and ask?" suggested Beth. "You're a real girl now, what's stopping you?"

That night...

With my hands shaking, I dialed Garth's number. When he and I first met, I was just starting my journey to become a real girl. At first, I did not have the heart to tell him that I was not a real girl but as our relationship grew, I could not bear the guilt and finally told him the truth. To my surprise, Garth still genuinely liked me. "What a great guy.." Dreamily, I thought.

I jumped when Garth answered the phone. "Hey, tomboy." Kindly, he said. "What's up?"

A giggle escaped my lips as tomboy was a nickname Garth had given me since I confessed to him years ago. "I just wanted to call and say Hi." Blushing, I said. "You got real strong over the summer, tough guy."

Garth chuckled on the other line. "Yeah... about that." Nervous, he said. "I got this tumor that is causing me to have huge growth spurts..."

"A tumor?!" Startled, I asked. "Garth, are you going to be okay?!"

"I'll be fine." Calmly, Garth replied. "It seems my dad has the same condition but I'm not allowed to really talk about it; something to do with our ancestry."

I smiled at that, remembering my own ancestry. Then I blushed, remembering why I had called. "Um... Garth... I really, really like you." Stumbling on my words, I said. "Now that I'm, well, a real girl now do you... do you, well you know...?"

I waited nervously, my hands shaking and sweating as I waited for Garth to respond. He was silent for only a brief moment but, at the time, it seemed like an eternity. "Alyssa, I have had a crush on you since I first laid eyes on you." Serious, Garth replied. "When I heard you had become a real girl, I mean the real deal, I was frantic thinking I would not summon the nerve to ask you out before someone else did."

I blushed brightly, hearing that then smiled. "Garth Jones, are you asking me out?"

There was another pause and I held back the urge to giggle as I could almost seeing him blushing on the other line. "Yeah... I- I guess I am."

I wanted to cheer as I had a huge crush on Garth for a while. It was more than because he supported me, protected me, he genuinely liked me for who I was and who I wanted to become. He was a true friend and now I knew he had a crush on me as well. "Tomorrow is Saturday." Smiling, I said. "What do you say we go out then?"

"Sounds good to me." Kindly, Garth said. "It's a date, I'll see you around noon."

"See you then." Blushing, I said.

Upon ending the call, I let out a happy cheer then turned suddenly hearing...

1521212122111222211112122221112211212.content:
I heard a crash, like the sound of a window breaking. It was immediately followed by mom letting out a startled scream. I ran out of my room in a blur to the second floor landing to find a man a in prison orange jumper! He was short but muscular with short messy black hair and green eyes. There was a deep scar along his right cheek as he faced mom in her wheelchair with a gun in his hand and a hunting knife in a sheath at his side. "Did you seriously think you could hide from me forever, Heather?" Scornful, the man demanded. "You little bitch! Because of you and your damned photographic memory, I rotted in prison for fifteen years!"

"Clarence Mayweather, you hurt dozens of people! Ruined many lives!" Defiant, mom countered. "People who didn't do anything other than be in the wrong place at the wrong time! All in the name of your master, Sykes the immortal thief!"

A low gasp escaped my lips as I heard mom facing the intruder. Did I hear her right, she fought the immortal thief, Sykes? The lead villain in the Teen Detectives graphic novel series? There was no time for me to think about it. Mom was in danger; she needed help quick and quick was now my specialty only I did not want this jerk to know who I was. Thinking quickly, I returned to my room and changed clothes in the blink of an eye.

Less than a second later, I came running out in a black spandex yoga body suit with tight blue jeans shorts, a bluejeans jacket, my favorite running shoes with my soccer shin guards, and a full face masquerade mask. I had also put on a large pair of bracelets I had found in the attic that I somehow thought might come in handy.

"You weave mommy awone!" Shaking, Sam yelled. "Go away!"

Clarence laughed. "Take a long look at your 'mommy', toddler." Taunting, he ordered. "She is about to go bye bye and not come back."

Grinning, he pushed the hammer down on his gun and fired one round. Only I was there and managed to deflect the bullet with my metal bracelet. It stung a bit but I saved mom and that was worth it. Not wasting time, I swung my leg up and knocked the gun clear out of Clarence's hand. The man yelled in pain, shocked to suddenly see me standing between him and mom.

"The only place you're going is back to prison!" Sternly, you yelled. "Give it up, Mayweather!"

"This isn't play time, kid!" Pulling his knife, Clarence demanded. "I'm going to give you your last wake up call!"

Clarence lunged at you with the knife! Only, to you, he was moving in slow motion and you easily dodged him and delivered a punch to his gut at nearly a hundred miles an hour. Clarence buckled over and coughed, the knife falling from his grasp. I was furious for many reasons. Mom never told me that she was a part of the teen superhero group I loved so much or that this Clarence Mayweather was real and a real threat to the family. I began to hit the man with a barrage of high speed punches and kicks that sent him literally into convulsions! After a second, I ended my attack with a single punch to the man's jaw that sent him to the floor, unmoving. Worried that I might have killed him, I quickly checked him out to find that he was wearing body armor under his prison uniform. He was alive, just unconscious and likely heavily bruised.

With the threat neutralized, I turned to mom, panting. "Are you alright... Mrs Vance?" In a forced calm, I asked.

Mom winced. "I'm fine...um..."

After a brief pause, I replied, "Isa."

It was what Sam called me with his cute lisp. It seemed to fit and I couldn't think of anything else at the time. Mom frowned at me. "Well, 'Isa'; I thank you for the rescue but I suggest you change back into your regular clothes before the police show up."

Within seconds, I had changed into normal clothing and helped mom tie up Clarence. Once we had a chance to catch our breaths, I turned to mom. "Why didn't you tell me you a part of the Problem Child Gang?" Hurt, I demanded.

Mom sighed, looking at Clarence, still unconscious on the floor. "Make a pot of tea, dear." Softly, she said. "It's a long story." She then gave me a sad smile. "Welcome to the club."
1521212122111222211112122221112211212.title: Welcome to the club.

15212121221112222111121222211122112121.content:
After the police had come, taken our statements and left with Clarence in custody, I made a pot of tea for mom, Beth, and I to share and a sip cup of milk for Sam. We all met at the table where mom began her story. "We were all talented in our own way." Serious, mom explained. "When we started the group, there were only four of us but it slowly grew into greater numbers including secret allies, informants, and old pros guiding us on the side."

"Old pros?" Confused, Beth asked.

"We were not the first group of kids to fight crime." Ruefully, mom replied. "Other groups inspired the comic book superheroes that have all been blown out of proportions."

I giggled at that. "Only in Teen Detectives, the heroes are kept down to Earth."

"I lead the fight to keep it that way." Smiling, mom said. "I and a few others own the exclusive rights to those stories."

"Stories that are apparently true." Serious, Beth said. "According to the graphic novel series, Clarence was Sykes' right hand man. He worked to cover his boss's tracks and detour anyone who got too close, including the Problem Child Gang."

Mom nodded as she took a sip of tea. "Correct. He was also a highly trained mercenary, an expert in hand to hand combat, military planning, and a marksman." She sighed. "I called myself Heather; I was the thinker of the group, their strategist. I too was a marksman, a martial arts prodigy, a talented escape artist, and a natural at strategic planning."

"So you were basically Clarence's equal." Surprised, I said. "That's impressive!"

"Not impressive enough." patting the wheel of her chair, mom said. "I can't count the number of times some lowlife got the better of me and tied me up." She smiled slightly. "I was always able to get out easily and give them the surprise of their life but still... Clarence ended up getting the last laugh in the end, leaving me forever tied to a wheelchair."

"He's the one who rammed your car?!" Angry, I demanded.

"He paid the price for attacking me and will pay the price for invading our home." Serious, mom countered. "While I agree jail time is too good for him, I do not pass judgement."

"How did you all get started?" Changing the subject, Beth asked.

Mom sighed sadly. "We were the children of parents who were either too busy or too rich to care about what we did or where we went." Softly, she explained. "My parents were rich indeed and they left servants to watch after my sister and I. At first, I wanted nothing to do with crime fighting but one kidnapping later, I was all in."

"You were kidnapped as a child?" Worried, I asked. "By who?"

"Who else?" Frowning, mom replied. "Clarence Mayweather. I was to be the first of his many child followers in Sykes' evil schemes." She let out a low chuckle. "Only it backfired on him big time and gave birth to the Problem Child Gang."

Beth and I were hanging on every word, listening to mom's story of her involvement in our favorite superhero group of all time. "What can you tell us about the other main members?" Curious, I asked. "Tex the mighty, Greg the chemist, and Sam the machine?"

Mom giggled. "Tex the mighty was a piece of work." Bemused, she said. "He was impulsive, cocky, and sarcastic but he also had a big heart. He was incredibly strong and nearly bullet proof; a living tank so to speak." She sighed, her smile vanishing. "This made him feel invincible but he was powerless against armor piercing rounds."

"He got hurt?!" Stunned, Beth asked.

Mom sighed. "I take it you have not finished the last published graphic novel." Softly, she said. "Sorry... Yes, Tex was hurt but he wasn't killed."

"Was dad a part of the gang?" Wincing, Beth asked.

Mom shook her head. "No, he wasn't." Honestly, she said. "However, soon after we were married I learned that he had carefully followed our exploits through his local newspaper and saved all of the articles." She winked at me, adding, "It was my alter ego who inspired him to become a master of martial arts, escape artistry, and marksmanship."

Beth and I smiled at that. "Being an attorney, he is also a strategist of sorts." Impressed, Beth commented. "He tried to be just like 'Heather'."

Mom laughed, nodding. "Why do you think we fell in love so quickly?"

"Does he know you were a member of the Problem Child Gang?" Wincing, I asked.

Mom nodded. "I told him shortly after we were married which was when he showed me his collection of newspaper clippings."

After a pause, Beth asked, "What caused you and the others to give it all up?"

Mom sighed, a sad look forming onto her face. "We were all nearly killed in our last fight with Sykes and his followers." Almost whispering, she said. "We discovered that Sykes was plotting to overthrow the leader of a terrorist cell known as the Hard Line. Back then, we only knew them as 'The Agency'. He was making his move just as we were finally closing in on him."

Both Beth and I turned pale. "When you confronted Sykes in Europe, you crossed paths with this Hard Line." Whispering, I said. "Are they still after you?!"

"They think we're dead." Sadly, mom replied. "Most of the world thinks we died along with Sykes in our last battle; which is why they did not continue the graphic novel beyond that point."

Mom took another sip of her tea and fell silent. I realized that it was a difficult subject for her and fell silent myself. Only Sam spoke up. "Mommy... is Issa gonna be membar?"

Mom sighed before turning to Beth and I with a sad look in her eyes. "I don't know... I can't see into the future, honey."

152121212211122221111212222111221122111.content:
After I'd been crying into my pillow for a while, there came a knock on my door. "Lyssa, honey, it's Mom. Can I come in?"

I got up and opened the door for her. "Come to yell at me some more?"

"I wasn't yelling, young lady," she replied. "Although I can't say I'm pleased with the way you're tracking boulevard bon-bons all over my house."

That was when I remembered my shoe. "Eww." I pulled it off, and set it aside to be washed later.

"I wanted to be sure you understood why I'm grounding you." She spotted the Teen Detectives comic by my bed, and flipped through the pages. "I remember this."

"Mom, you don't read comics. How could you remember that one?"

"I was there when it happened," she explained. "I was one of the kids in this book."

If my eyes got any wider, they'd have popped right out of my skull. "You?"

She nodded. "Me and Ted. That's Garth's dad. We used to help the police in this town crack difficult cases. Well, we called it 'helping'. Detective Flynn called it 'meddling kids sticking their noses into police business'."

I smiled. "Where'd you get the idea?"

"We had our gifts. I never thought of them as powers, but we could do things others couldn't, and we used our talents to make our little corner of the world better."

"What could you do?"

"I was the thinker of the group. I also had sharper senses than anyone around, and a certain talent for escape. I can't count the number of times some lowlife tied me up, and thought he was done with me for good, only to catch a Ked right where he didn't want it."

"Why'd you give it up?"

"I met your father. Starting a family and chasing bad guys didn't seem like a good combination, so I hung up my deerstalker, and left crimefighting behind me. Or so I thought."

"What do you mean?"

"We lied to you girls. It wasn't an accident. One of the guys we put away got out. He'd paid his debt to society, but felt like he owed me a certain something. So he decided to put me into a situation I couldn't escape from." She ran a hand over one wheel of her chair.

"Oh, Mom." I walked over and hugged her.

"This is why I'm so protective of you, sweetie. Spending the rest of my life in this thing is hard enough for me. With your speed, losing your legs would seem worse than death."

"I should have figured it was so important to you, after you used the C-word to me." One of the neighbors used the word 'cripple' in her presence once. I don't think he's recovered from her tongue-lashing yet.

"Promise me," she said. "Promise me you won't make the same mistake I did."

"I promise."

As we embraced, I thought, I'll have to think of some way to hide who I am. I can't prevent Mom from knowing what I'm doing, but I can keep others from figuring out my identity.

Beth and Grace reached the food court just as Garth and I arrived with Caitlin. "You two got done early," Grace said. "Who's yo - Caitlin Spencer?" *What's the Snoot doing hanging out with the likes of us?*

Caitlin shrugged slightly as if picking up a thought from someone "Hi," she said. "There's not much time. We-"

A burst of gunfire took out the skylight, interrupting the conversation.

We all grabbed what cover we could under the tables. I watched Garth take a peek, he seemed scared, a rarity for him, making me more frightened still but I doubted even my speed were a match for bullets. I turned to Caitlin to find her pressing her fingers against her temples with a look of heavy concentration on her face.

"What's Cait doing?" I asked.

Garth turned to look but before he could utter a word, Caitlin grabbed Grace's forehead, like a pro wrestler putting the claw hold on an opponent. Grace's eyes flew wide, and she got the same expression that Cait had before we left for the food court. She next put the claw on Beth, who also spaced out. I guessed Cait was trying to get through to the young gunman but needed extra brain power to do it. Taking a chance, I peeked to see the boy was shaking his head, as if he was drowsy, but he was wide awake. We still didn't dare to move a muscle.

"Look," I said.

Garth looked out with me to see the boy put his guns on the ground and kick them away. Mall security grabbed him, and he didn't resist as they took him away.

As Cait released the girls, Garth asked, "What just happened?"

"That boy was an undiagnosed schizophrenic," Grace explained. "The voices in his head were telling him to kill everybody here."

"I got a psychic vision," Cait added, "warning me of what was about to happen. I tried to reason with him, but I had trouble getting him to distinguish my 'voice' from all the others. So I needed Grace and Beth to help me."

"Y-you can do that?" stunned, I asked.

"For a few days now," Cait replied. "I found out what the people around me really thought about me, and I've been working to change that.

"Now," she added, "I've got a question for you: Do you guys really have these powers?"

Then, Caitlin's eyes widened as if she had heard something. By the way Garth smiled, I figured it was Amara talking telepathically to Caitlin. Suddenly, Garth grew in size to that of an Olympian weight lifter. I watched Caitlin's surprise turn to shock, looking at his new form. She relaxed when he quickly returned to normal. "I can get a lot bigger, if I wanted." he said, blushing. "Only, I'm afraid of losing control."

"Same here." nodding, Caitlin said. "I don't want to hurt anyone with a 'bad thought'." she then turned to Grace. "I got a feel of yours and Beth's power when we connected, a type of super total recall, right?"

"Something like that." smiling, Grace replied. "Basically, I can learn anything in minutes rather than days and master anything in hours rather than years."

"I have something similar." agreeing, Beth added. she blushed. "So far, I seem to be able to find anything I am looking for and instantly know how to use it... a sort of spiritual guide."

"That is impressive." smiling, Caitlin said. "What of you Alyssa?"

I smiled then ran from the group with such a speed, I seemed to vanish from sight. Startled, Caitlin looked around then jumped to find me standing right behind her. "Teleportation?" she asked.

"Sheer speed." sighing, I replied. "That's what got me into trouble, I tracked boulevard bon-bons up the side of Garth's house when I went to visit him."

Caitlin giggled slightly, hearing that. "You went passed old man Crane's house, didn't you?"

I blinked. "How did you?" I shook her head, remembering my power to read minds. "What does that have to do with what happened?"

"He's been illegally using his Saint Bearnard's droppings to fertilize his lawn." Caitlin explained, wincing. "Its been seeping onto the sidewalks, giving anyone who walks or runs passed real dung covered shoes."

"Well that explains how it was tracked all the way home." I said.

Just then, Caitlin looked around, nervous before seeing that Grace and Beth were doing the same. It hit me soon after, a strong sense that we were being watched. "We'd better get what we need and leave." her voice quivering slightly, Beth said.

"I'm calling off for the rest of the day." quickly, Caitlin said.

For a moment Garth seemed confused but a protective look forming on his face told me that he began to feel it too. Grace came close to Garth, worried. "All of us getting this feeling at the same time can't be a coincidence." fearful, she said. "My vote is to forget what we came for and leave."

"Security is tight, since that kid went on a mini rampage." serious, Garth said. "Whoever we're sensing, they won't try anything now but I say we leave as a group." he then turned to Cait. "That means you too."

Caitlin nodded then pulled out her cellphone, hitting a speed dial button. "James, I need to be picked up." her voice fearful, she said. "I'm bringing four friends along..."

Unknown to all, two blurry men were watching us from a distance. "That's them, Butch." said one. "At least the kids of two of the original members."

Butch grunted. "They know we are here, Hank." he muttered. "That friend of theirs seems to have some type of mental radar, we will have to get imaginative to obtain our targets."

The two men watched as...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Food court drama.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
While Caitlin called her boss, telling him she was too shaken from the shooting to continue for the day, Garth called his father on his cellphone. Taking a cue from him, I grabbed my own and dialed the house. Mom answered. "Lyssa, are you, Beth and the others okay?" she asked. "I heard there's been a shooting at the mall."

"We're fine, mom." quickly, I replied. "Listen to me, we all have this feeling we're being watched, its rattled us a bit so we're forgetting about the shopping and getting out." pausing, I added, "Caitlin Spencer is with us, she has powers too."

There was a sort pause before mom replied, "Alyssa, I want you to get everyone to go to Mr Jones' house right away, do you understand? Please be careful, I have a bad feeling about this."

"So do I, mom." wincing, I replied. "You be careful too."

With that, mom ended the call as Garth said, "We better get moving."

"Mom wants us to meet at your house, Garth." my voice quivering, I said. "She hung up after that." tearing up, I added, "Garth, I'm scared."

Caitlin, hearing this, turned back to her cell phone. "Security, I need a detail to protect Mr and Mrs Vance as I believe someone will use them to get to my father." she said in a serious tone. "Here is their address...."

With a security team being sent to check on Lyssa's family, you all headed to Caitlin's awaiting limousine to find...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: we quickly left the mall.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
... the driver, apparently James, opening the door for us. "Home, Miss?" he asked.

"No, my house," replied Garth, giving him the address.

Cait nodded, adding, "Evasive maneuvers."

As he closed the door behind us, he said, "Fasten your seat belts."

Once we were buckled in, Cait closed the partition between us and the driver. A moment later, the limo took off, faster than I would have imagined such a long car could go.

"Can we trust the driver?" asked Garth.

"For the most part," Cait assured us. "I haven't told him about my powers. But he's been working for my family for years. He was originally hired to keep an eye on my Aunt Liv."

"Aunt Liv?" Grace asked. "Why did she need to be watched?"

"From what little they tell me," Cait replied, "she was something of a black sheep in the family. Hung out with the wrong crowd, married beneath her, that sort of thing. Of course, we're old money, so those terms could mean anything."

As we drove along, Cait took off her wig to brush debris out of it. This surprised Grace and Beth, as they weren't with us when she did it before. "When did that happen?" Beth asked.

"A few days before I became telepathic. Brad and I got accidentally dosed with plutonium. I lost my hair and started reading minds. Brad... he's recovering, but it's taken him longer."

"Weird."

"Ironic, too," Cait said. "Plutonium was the brand name of the hair dye I used."

Cait then whipped out her smartphone. "Hola, Marisol," she said. "Yes, I know about what happened. At least I wasn't the first one to interrupt your novelas today." She chuckled. "I'm fine. Nobody got hurt, and the gunman is in custody. However, something else came up, and I'll be spending some time with some other kids my age. I'll be back by supper. Hasta luego."

After she hung up, she said, "Give me a few minutes," and closed her eyes. I couldn't tell if she was taking a nap, or maybe mentally contacting someone else.

Garth, taking a cue from her, pulled out his own cellphone. "Hi, Dad. We're on the way. Caitlin Spencer ordered a security detail to Lyssa's house. We'll be home with her, Lyssa, and Beth in about ten minutes."

I caught Mr Jones say something about a cousin Susan as Garth frowned. "Today? Not the best timing." he said.

When Garth ended the call, he seemed worried but I did not think it was the right time to ask.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: The driver waiting.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Once we got to Garth's home, Cait told James, "Wait for Trish Wilson, and whoever is with her, at the hospital. Then bring them here. Evasive maneuvers." That confirmed for me that Cait had been in telepathic communication with someone else, probably Trish.

Mr Jones opened the door for us. "Come on in," he said. "Beth, Lyssa, your parents are on their way here. Garth, Grace, your cousin, Susan is on the way with her parents as well. Caitlin, is there someone you'd like me to call?"

"James will be back later," she replied, "and Marisol knows where I am. My folks are away."

"I've got a question," Grace said. "Who was that woman who spoke to us, when we were linked?"

"That was Beatriz," Beth replied. "She's something of a spirit guide. Sometimes, when I'm looking for something, she gives me an idea of where to look."

"So why'd she call us her daughters?" Cait asked.

Beth shrugged. "Maybe we're related. Iole, Lyssa's and my distant ancestor, had 14 children, so there's bound to be a healthy representation of her in the gene pool."

"Makes sense," Grace replied. "I read that 1 in 200 people can trace their ancestry to Genghis Khan." She turned to Cait. "How much do you know about your Aunt Liv?"

"Not much," she answered. "I once had my lawyer try to track her down through her share of the inheritance, but she's hardly touched it. What could she be saving it for?"

"I gave some to an old friend," my mom's voice said. "The kids are going to college. And I had planned to pay for Lyssa's surgery, but it turned out she didn't need it."

We all turned. My parents had arrived.

Cait was completely stunned. "You... You're Aunt Liv?"

"Sarah," she replied. "I never liked the name Liv."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Arriving at the meeting.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"We'll talk more inside." seriously, Ted said. "There is much we need to discuss."

We all began to follow dad inside when another car arrived. Once it had parked by the road, A tall, slender man with sand brown hair and blue eyes stepped out. With him was an equally tall but muscular woman with long auburn hair and green eyes. I recognized her as Garth's aunt Amanda and her husband, Geo. Coming out of the back was a small girl with long brown hair and blue eyes, their daughter, Susan. "Are we late?" walking up to us, Geo asked.

"Not at all, Geo." shaking his hand, Ted said. "Good to see you again."

"Likewise." releasing Ted, Geo said.

Ted then hugged Amanda. "Thank you for coming over, sis." smiling, he said. "I just wish it was under much better circumstances." he sighed. "Any word from Steve?"

Amanda winced. "His daughter is in the hospital." sadly, she replied. "She's not well, from what I hear."

Ted shook his head, looking worried. "We'll have to hold the meeting without him then." wincing, he said. "Everyone inside, we have a lot of ground to cover and, I fear, very little time."

Once everyone was inside and sitting down, Caitlin turned to Sarah. "I know this is not the place but... why were you called the black sheep of the family?"

Sarah giggled slightly. "When I was your age, the Spencer family liked to play by their own rules." looking at her, she explained. "They did not care for the police or for lawyers unless it worked in their favor. That said, they wanted me to marry into the Tanner family, to increase the family's wealth." she motioned to Amanda then added, "Only my friend had eyes for Geo and I had eyes for Frank Vance... a lawyer who worked for the police department."

"I imagine your parents didn't take it well." wincing, Caitlin said.

Sarah shook her head. "My dad walked me down the aisle to give me away." sadly, she replied. "Only he did not stay for the reception." she sighed. "He and my mother accepted my husband but not until they were on their death bed, wanting to make peace before they left this world."

"That's cold." tearing up, Caitlin said. "I'm so sorry, aunt Sarah."

"It's not your fault, sweetie." said Sarah. "Believe me, my parents they deeply cared for my husband and I." she then smiled. "They wanted to make man who put me in this chair vanish of the face of the Earth. If Mr Jones had not gotten to him first, they would have made it happen."

"Let's get started." interrupting Caitlin's conversation, Geo said with a cold tone. "As you all know, most of us were members of the Problem Child Gang you kids like to read about. Our last mission was against a man named Sykes who we believed was the bottom of a drug and weapon running cartel." he sighed. "Unfortunately, he turned out to be just the opposite. He was a war monger drug lord, the top dog of the cartel."

My face and those of my friends paled, hearing that. "That had to be a shock to learn." wincing, I thought.

"Was it this Sykes and his men who nearly killed you all?" almost whispering, Garth asked. "Or was it the Agency?"

"The Agency was after Sykes, just as we were." seriously Ted replied. "Sykes knew they were there and that we were hunting him down. He blew the building he was held up in, just as he made his escape." he shook his head. "We barely escaped with our lives only to find the Agency became... interested in us."

"What do you mean interested in you?" shaking, I asked.

"As I explained earlier, we had our talents." looking at me, mom said. "The Agency was in the business of brainwashing children with such talents to use them, make them do their dirty work so to gain wealth and power."
