"Not only were we forced to flee for our lives from an exploding building, we had to escape the clutches of an underground terrorist organization." tearing up, Geo said. "We thought we were invincible, we were not. We thought this was behind us... its been chasing us all along."

"You- You think this cartel or this Agency may have interest in us." as if reading Geo's mind, Caitlin said, turning pale.

Geo nodded. "That is why we are holding this meeting, my dear." he said. "The Agency has resurfaced and from what I have heard, many of you are already being watched by someone." he clinched a fist. "We can not take any chances or make any assumptions, we already made that mistake once."

Suddenly, Caitlin gasped, her lips trembling. "No... they're outside of my house!" hoarsely, she screamed. she threw her hands against her temples. "Marisol, you are in danger! RUN... NOW!!!!"

Before anyone could react...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: continue.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Everyone jumped as a woman appeared in the room, screaming. She had her hands raised, as if to defend herself then screamed again, finding herself somewhere else. "Ay dios mio!" shaking, she breathed.

"How did she get here?" stunned, I thought. "Did Cait..."

"Es importante que tu te relajes." walking up to her unsteadily, Caitlin said. "Somos buenos amigos."

"Qué pasó, Caitlin!?" startled, Marisol asked.

"Someone, please... English." muttered Ted, looking startled as well.

"It's okay, Marisol, you are safe." taking her hand, Caitlin said. "It looks like I got you here just in time." then she thought, "I feel so weak but I can't let her see that, she'll freak."

"What happened, child!?!" still shaking, Marisol asked. "I heard you scream I was in danger just as a number of men broke into the house!" she suppressed a sob. "They were right on top of me and then I found myself here!"

"We... We all have certain abilities, Marisol." urging her to sit down, Caitlin replied as she sat down herself. "Remember how I lost all my hair? Well, it also gave me powerful mental abilities, thanks to Amatra."

"Amatra?" confused, Marisol asked.

She began to shake more until Ted cleared his throat. "Marisol is it?" he asked. she nodded. "I am Ted Jones, chief of police. There is an underground organization, known as The Agency, that forcibly makes use of such talented children like Caitlin Spencer and my children, Garth and Grace." he sighed. "It's a long story, which we will explain but in short, I believe those men were after Caitlin and they would have used you to get her."

"I- I see..." said Marisol. she turned to Caitlin. "You- You summoned me here?"

Looking very pale, Caitlin nodded. "You're like a mother to me." sounding weak, she said. "I- I couldn't let anyone hurt you. I... I..."

She then fainted, falling out of the chair, causing Marisol to panic. "Caitlin!"
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Marisol appeared.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"What happened?" Garth asked, as we all rushed to Cait's side.

"She must have pushed herself, teleporting Marisol here." worried, I thought.

"I'd say that stunt surprised her as much as the rest of us," Heather replied. "And, from the look of things, it took a lot out of her." She checked her over. "Her pulse is getting stronger. I don't think she'll need medical attention. Just a reminder not to go bending the space-time continuum."

Garth carried her to the couch, making me feel a little jealous but I didn't say anything as I knew he was merely showing concern for a friend. Marisol got some cold water from the sink, and lightly splashed her face.

Slowly, Cait's eyes began to open. "Wh... wha... "

"You fainted, chica," Marisol replied. "Bringing me here was harder than you wanted to let on. I don't think you should do that again."

"You're not the only one," Cait replied. "My head is killing me. And I can't 'hear' your thoughts."

"Probably overstress," Beth suggested. "Give yourself a day or so before you try mind-reading again."

"We all have our limits, I guess." wincing, I thought. "I wonder what mine is."

Marisol looked around at all of us. "You children all have these... powers?"

"Most of us," said Garth. "I can get big and super-strong."

"I've got total recall," Grace said, "and I can duplicate just about anything I see done."

"I've got super-speed," nodding, I said.

"I have a spirit guide," said Beth.

Susan stepped forward. "I've got powers from both my parents. You guys all thought Dad was just really good at sneaking in and hiding. It's more than that."

"What do you mean?" curious, Ted asked.

Susan and Geo smiled then vanished from sight.

"Whoa!" surprised, I thought. "That's a neat trick!"

"Geo? Susan?" Ted ran to where they'd been standing, waving his arms through the space where they'd been. "Where'd you go?"

"We're right here, Ted," Geo replied. "We can turn invisible and intangible."

"Put your arms down, Uncle Ted," Susan added. "We can't come back, if you're occupying the space."

Ted stopped waving his arms, and they returned. "How'd you get to do this?"

"It's a family trait," Susan answered. "Right now, I can only do it for about 15 minutes. But I should get better at it."

"Any other problems, besides solid objects?"

"Bright light," said Geo. "Our eyelids go transparent, too, so we can't block out bright lights."

"Sue," Garth asked, "you said you got powers from both your parents. What did you mean?"

"I was a hanger-on of the Problem Child Gang," Amanda said. "The book calls me the Unknown Amazon."

"That's how you got so big? You can Hulk out, like I do?" asked Garth.

Amanda nodded. "Sue hasn't found her trigger yet. Otherwise, I'm sure she'd demonstrate."

"My trigger was exercise. When we're done with this, I'll let you use my equipment."

"Thanks, Garth," Sue said. "Of course, we haven't gotten to the weird part."

"Weird part?"

"You guys might find this hard to believe," she said. "It turns out, I was originally born a boy. I turned into a girl a few days later. That's how I inherited Dad's powers: They're passed from father to son."

"That's not so hard to believe," blushing, I said.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: we all have limits.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Then a firm knock at the front door caused everyone to jump. Ted hurried over top the door, motioning everyone to stay clear from the door, as he brought his sidearm to bear. I stayed near Beth though I wanted to be near Garth at the moment. "Who is it!" firmly, Ted demanded.

"Steve Connors and company." replied Steve's voice. "Someone tried to take my daughter, Ted. I have one of her friends with me, we need to talk."

Ted cautiously opened the door and peered out before allowing a tall and muscular man with short sand blond hair and blue eyes to enter with Travis Greenway and Megan from school following behind. Travis was a tall and muscular boy with jet black hair and blue eyes. Megan was a shy petite girl with blond hair and green eyes. Both seemed white as a sheet and they staggered slightly as they entered. Heather gasped seeing them and ran forward with Marisol helping her.

"Easy, Megan." said Heather, gently taking her arm. "You better sit down a bit, dear."

"I- I'm fine." said Travis, blushing slightly as Marisol took his hand.

"The hell you are, Chico." sternly Marisol said. "You look like a ghost, sit down and rest."

"I said I'm fine." stubbornly but politely, Travis said. "I just need to catch my breath."

I smiled seeing Caitlin and Grace smiling as well. One did not need to read minds to know the look Marisol was giving Travis, she was not about to put up with any male pride. "Sit... down." with a firm tone, Marisol said.

Travis sat down, his expression softening. The tone of Marisol's voice made me shiver slightly and I I guessed it had the same effect on Travis. "Yes, ma'am." he said.

"It's good to see you again, old friend." returning his sidearm to its holster, dad said. "Any idea who tried to kidnap your daughter and her friend?"

"They weren't professionals." quickly, Steve said. "I'm guessing they were sent by Sykes. he motioned to Megan and Travis. "These two are just now discovering their 'gifts'. Megan's gift left her a bit shaken, same with Travis."

"What can you do?" lying on the couch, Caitlin asked. "Mine is mental powers." she moaned. "Though I kind of over did it a few minutes ago."

"Megan can control machines and transform to some extent." motioning Megan to remain quiet, said Steve. "Travis has the ability to become an Anthro of various animals." pausing, he added, "I know you two have a voice of your own but you are both seriously drained from the kidnap attempt, rest all you can."

"Were they hurt?" concerned, I asked.

"Travis pushed himself to save Megan from being taken." with a grateful look, Steve said. "Megan did the same only it was from her powers going a bit nuts on her."

"Like mine did at the beginning, turning into a behemoth." shaken slightly, Garth said. "My power is super strength."

"Just like your dad and aunt." smiling, Steve said. then he turned serious. "We need a plan and time is something we don't have a lot of, we need to act, now."

What do you suggest?" asked Heather.

Before Steve could answer, there was another knock at the door. "Who could that be?" Ted asked. "We're all here." Drawing his sidearm again, he asked, "Who is it?"

"Tr-Trish Wilson, sir," came the reply. "Cait sent for us?"

We turned to Cait. "Something came up during the ride here," she said. "I sent my driver to pick them up."

Ted opened the door, and in came Trish, Brad, and an older lady, probably Brad's mom. Except Brad looked kind of funny, and it looked like he'd gotten dressed in a hurry. Then I noticed the hospital ID bracelet on his wrist, and remembered Cait had said he'd been recovering from plutonium exposure. "You guys OK?" asked Garth.

"Getting better," Brad replied. Even his voice was different. "I... had quite an experience in the hospital. Please don't ask me to describe it to you."

"What's going on?" Heather asked. "Why did you come here?"

"Cait told me she'd picked up something," Trish answered, "and I should grab Brad and his mom and get in her limo. Whatever it was, it had her freaked worse than the shooting."

We all turned to Cait again.

"I read Brad's doctor's mind," she explained. "He's connected to the Agency, and he wanted his hands on Brad and Trish. That's why I brought them here."

Ted shook his head. "Sykes, the Agency, and the kids of the Problem Child Gang. This is going to get a lot worse before it gets better."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: More company.

choices: Beth and I go to the mansion.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"We need to get everyone started on training the sooner the better." said Geo. "I know of such a place, the original group headquarters near the coast. It's only about twenty miles from here."

"The clubhouse mansion..." stunned, I thought. "If only to see it first hand..."

"I thought our headquarters were destroyed by the Agency days after we escaped Sykes' death trap in Rome." confused, Heather said. "They completely burned the summer home mansion to the ground, trying to get to us."

"That was the sister mansion in England." countered Geo. "I'm talking about the original headquarters, here in the States, where we first starting training to hone our skills while not gallivanting around the world." he smiled. "It's old but its still standing and we can go there in a second's notice."

"The kids will still need individual training." worried, Sarah said. "Also, their skills are far more advanced than ours were."

"You're still a legend to me, mom." smiling, I thought. I made a note to make her see that later.

"They will get individual training." said Geo. "You see, I had a feeling we had not seen the last of the Agency so I had an underground... err... vacation village constructed in a cave system for all of us to run to with our families, just in case."

"All of the training facilities we need are there?" asked Ted.

Geo nodded. "It has everything we need to live and train for as long as it takes." serious, he said. "We can live there or commute there." he paused. "Its just an option."

"We'll commute there." said Ted. "The Agency will know we're onto them if we all suddenly vanish. Still, we must be on our toes at all times, understood!?" everyone nodded and dad turned back to Geo. "I will check the mansion and training facility to ensure its safe and secure. We can take two along with us."

"Please pick me...." looking at Ted, I thought.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: The training begins.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
To my disappointment, Mr Jones decided to take his son and daughter to the mansion headquarters first. As we left the house, Beth gave me a quick hug. "Don't worry, sis, we'll all get a chance to see PCG headquarters soon enough." releasing me, she said. "Right now, we need to focus on our training."

"Training your mom and I will help you with." walking next to mom's chair, dad said. "I may not have been a member of mom's group but that does not mean I have nothing to offer."

"Your father was fourth runner up in the teen world martial arts competition three years in a row." smiling, mom said. "He might not have won any trophies but when you consider the fact that hundreds of hopefuls entered the competition..."

"Dad?" surprised, Beth asked. "We never knew you were into martial arts."

"There is a lot you don't know about your mother and I." smiling, dad said. "We like to think we are full of surprises."

Beth and I looked at each other for a moment then laughed. "These passed few days has certainly been that." smiling, I said. "One surprise after another."

"We'll get started the second we return home." turning serious, mom said. "Both of you will need to be on your toes at all times if you are going to follow in our footsteps." tearing up, she added, "This is not a game you have stumbled into."

"I will teach you both martial arts under one rule." an uncharacteristic steel in his eyes, dad said. "Always remember that what I teach you is an art designed for fighting, it is not a toy to play with."

"We know." worried by mom and dad's seriousness, I said. "Why are you..."

"Being so suddenly strict?" looking at us, dad asked. "Your mom and her friends were nearly killed. If you follow their path unprepared, you will face the same fate."

The trip back home was mostly silent with mom driving and dad silent in thought. Beth and I looked at each other, uncertain but remained silent ourselves until we were safely back home. "Where should we start with our training?" trying to break the ice, I asked.

"Think fast!" tossing me a long bamboo pole, dad said.

I caught the pole then turned to dad to ask what I was supposed to do with it when I saw him charging me with a bamboo pole of his own. He let out a yell, bringing the pole down onto me, causing me to scream. I rose my pole in defense, closing my eyes, only I did not feel the other pole make contact.

"What?..." opening my eyes, I asked.

I jumped, seeing dad's face almost touching my own then screamed as he shouted, "Never close your eyes!"

"Y-Yes, sir!" taking a step back, I said.

I was shaking. I had never seen dad like this before and it frightened me. "When a person attacks you, do not allow your sight off him or her for a second!" seriously, dad instructed. "If I see you close your eyes during this training again, you will find a welt on your buttocks!"

"Yes, sir!" gaining some composure, I replied.

"I- I never saw dad like this before." shivering herself, Beth said.

"He is teaching her skills that will save her life, there is no room for 'kid gloves'." seriously, mom said. "Now for your training, young lady. When dad is done with Lyssa it will be your turn with him."

"I- I'm ready, mom." gulping, Beth said.

"Are you?" smiling, mom asked. she then held up a pair of keys. "You didn't even notice me taking them out of your pocket and I took my time." she then frowned. "Attacks come in all shapes and sizes. If Sykes were to get your keys, you can bet there will be a bomb in your car or a stranger in your house later."

I turned to see Beth talking to mom but immediately turned back to dad, feeling a sharp pain in my behind. "Eyes on me at all times, young lady!" he shouted. "That hit could have been to your head!"

I sighed, both Beth and I knowing it was going to be a long afternoon.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Serious training.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Dad had me on my toes for nearly an hour, blocking blows and dodging swings. I was panting for breath only he seemed to not even have broken a sweat. "Why don't you use that super speed of yours, Lyssa?" taking another swing, dad asked. "I wouldn't be able to keep up with you."

"I- I don't want to hurt you dad." panting to keep up at normal speed, I replied.

Dad smiled. "Good answer." hitting my behind lightly, he said. "However, unless you use all your skills, you will always loose to someone who will take advantage of your hesitation."

Then, dad stopped half way through a swing, hearing the telephone ring and turned as mom rolled her chair to answer it. Seeing an opportunity, I swung my pole towards his buttocks but he effortlessly blocked it before I even got close. "Time out." turning to me with a smile, he said. "Nice try, though."

"He saw it coming, even with his back turned!" a slight smile on my face, I thought. "My dad is incredible!"

"Hello?" answering the phone, mom asked. she frowned, listening to someone on the other line. "That makes it a bit difficult to help you, Cait. What is the problem?"

"What's wrong?" whispering, I wondered.

Dad hushed me silent. "She will tell us if we need to know." whispering back, he replied.

"I see." her voice quivering, mom said. "Well, I would guess that her symbiont will have a difficult time as she too would be addicted to the alcohol Kit had been consuming all these yea..."

Mom paused suddenly and I took a step forward, concerned. Only mom raised her hand, letting me know she was fine. "Yes, I'm here." sighing, mom said. "I was just listening to Samara."

"Samara?" worried, I thought. "Who is she?"

"Samara is the name of my symbiont." seriously, Sarah replied. "She told me that Kit's symbiont is her sister, Alaura."
then her face hardened as she sternly added, "Alaura can heal herself but first, Kit has to quit drinking, as in right now! Only, as weak as they both are, I doubt Kit will ever develop any powers." there was a pause before mom nodded and said, "I understand. Call again if you need me."

With that, she ended the call and turned to us. "That was my niece, Caitlin." sighing, she said. "I have a feeling she will be needing me to help her mother very soon."

"If she does, go." nodding, dad said. "I can start training Beth while Lyssa takes a break."

Nearly an hour later, mom got the call and was picked up by two security guards. One gave dad a weary look before escorting mom out to the waiting limousine. "What was that all about?" curious, I asked.

"Oh, that?" blushing, dad asked. "He was part of the security detail Cait had sent us without warning. I thought he was an intruder and gave him a few lumps."

Beth and I merely shook our heads only I stepped out of the way as dad threw Beth a bamboo pole. "Think fast!"
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: A phone call interrupts.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Once Beth's training session was through, she joined me in the living room. "How's your tuchus?" she asked.

I rubbed it. "Not as sore as when I fell down ice-skating last winter," I said. "Either I heal faster now, or Dad wasn't hitting that hard."

"Take it from me," she replied, "you're healing faster." She placed a pillow on the couch and eased herself down.

Mom came home. "How's Cait's mom?" Beth asked. It was still strange to think that we were related so closely.

"She's made the first step to recovery," Mom said. "Tomorrow, I'll drive her and Cait to the treatment center. They'll help her make it through the next 28 days."

All of a sudden, the TV came on, all by itself, making me jump. The screen showed one of those old-time test patterns, with the Indian head in the center, and the speakers called out, "Pueri Problementa!"

"Latin for 'Problem Child," I said. I shivered. This was too weird. "What?"

"Someone has left a note in the 'blind post office'," Mom said. "The call only goes out to the televisions with a special box Sam made for us." Pausing, she added, "I'm surprised it still works after all these years."

"What do we do, Mom?"

Mom slowly shook her head. "I don't know," she whispered. "It could be a trap."

"Maybe Lyssa could check it out," Beth suggested. "With her speed, she could be out of there before any trap could spring."

"Maybe," Mom said. "Don't take any foolish chances, though, young lady."

"I'll be careful," I said as I left.

Once out the door, I started running. Before I got up to top speed, I spotted a minivan I recognized as belonging to Susan Tanner's dad. It stopped, and the back door opened.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: News on two fronts

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Hi, guys," climbing in, I said. "You got the message, too?"

Everyone nodded and Ted said, "You're checking it out, too?"

"Taking a quick look, anyway." trying to sound nonchalant, I replied "I figured, if it's a trap, I can get away before it closes." then I thought, "At least I hope."

"Since we're headed that way," Ted suggested, "Why don't you ride with us? You may need your speed later."

I didn't need to be asked twice, and slid next to Garth in the back seat.

We got to the school, and left the car to check things out. "Nobody's here, now," Ted said. "How about I check the 'blind post office', and you kids keep watch?"

"I see tracks," pointing, Grace said. "It looks like whoever was here took off in a hurry."

"Yeah," looking at the tracks, I agreed, "and they had company." I turned to Ted. "Chief Jones, one set of footprints is small, like a little kid's."

"As Sherlock Holmes said, 'The game's afoot'." seriously, Ted said. "Better check this out more closely. If it gets too hairy, try to lead them back here."

The three of us followed the tracks, not knowing what or who we were about to find.

Grace, Garth and I ran behind the school to see Clem Rodgers backing away from three men as he kept a little girl, I knew to be her little sister behind him. "Looks like we got her just in time." running closer, Garth said. "Lyssa, we need to get the girl out of danger, fast."

"Fast is what I do." running with Garth, I said. "I got it covered."

"How did you get here?" asked Clem, seeing us join him against the three men.

"Long story." quickly, I said. "Who're these guys?"

"Don't know," between panting breaths, Clem said. "They're after us. I... don't know how long... I can keep... "

"Not your problem anymore," grabbing Rhea, I said. I then turned to her. "Hang on. Don't let go."

Feeling Rhea holding onto me tightly, I ran off so my friends could do their job. I expected Rhea to be screaming in fright from moving so fast only I found her reaction to be quite the opposite...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Continue

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Wheee!" Rhea called, as I sped from the scene.

"You'll be okay," I told her, as I began to slow down. "I'll drop you off somewhere safe, then I can - "

"No, no, no!" she demanded. "Keep going!"

"What about your brother? And my friends?"

"They'll be okay," she said, strangely confident. "And don't worry about my brother. He's got surprises those bad people don't know about. How fast can you go?"

"Watch and find out." I let myself go as fast as I could for a few seconds.

"This is fun!" she decided. "Way better than a pony ride!"

"I'll take your word for that. My name's Lyssa. Your brother and I used to be friends."

"I saw your picture. You look much better in girl clothes."

"Huh?"

"My friend Tobi told me all about you. How you used to be a boy, but you were really a girl."

"Who's Tobi?"

"She lives in my tummy."

This was turning into a discussion for a later time. "Let's get back to the clearing. I'm really concerned how things are going back there."

"Okay, Lyssa. But they're okay, you'll see."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: continue.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Upon returning to the school, I saw that the three men were gone. I sighed in relief, seeing everyone was unharmed. "I told you they'd be okay, Lyssa." smiling, Rhea said. "Those poopyheads are gone."

I could not help giggle. "Poopyheads?" amused, I asked. "Where did you learn such language?"

Rhea giggled as I approached them. "Sorry I missed the action," smiling, I said. "This little monkey demanded a ride."

"You must be Rhea," smiling, Grace said. "I'm Grace. This is Garth. And you've met Lyssa. We're friends of your brother's."

"How'd you guys find me?" still in shock, Clem asked. "It's like you knew where I was the whole time."

"We had an idea where to look," turning to Clem, I said. "Glad to see you again, Clem. It's been too long."

"My fault. I apologize. But how'd you know where I was?"

"The 'blind post office'. As you may have guessed, there really was a Problem Child Gang. They were our parents."

"I told you she was a girl." sticking her tongue out, Rhea said.

Clem turned to me, stunned. "G-Greg!?"

I began to seethe when Clem said that, fighting my tears. "That's not my name anymore!" feeling hurt, I thought.

"I seen your picture," Rhea said, seemingly unaware of Clem's 'social mistake'. "Clem said you was a boy, 'cause you was dressed like one, but I knowed you was a girl."

"It's a long story," Grace said.

Suddenly, Garth pulled Clem aside, I caught a glimpse of anger in his eye. "Clem," he said, "you haven't hung out with Lyssa in a long time, and that's your business. But, if you want to hang out with us," - he said the part through clenched teeth - "you don't use the G-word in her presence!"

Clem swallowed hard. "S-sorry,... Lyssa," he said. "I guess I forgot."

Garth and I both calmed down somewhat. "Clem," sighing, I said, "what are we going to do with you?"

"I know!" Rhea said. "Make him be a girl, for the rest of the day."

I chuckled, amused by her innocence. "It doesn't work that way, cutie-pie. I can't turn people into girls."

"But Clem can change!" Rhea insisted. "He can be a girl, or a pony. Or even SpongeBob Squarepants!"

"Just a minute," Grace said. "Rhea, you said you knew Lyssa was a girl from an old picture. How is that possible?"

"Rhea's got special vision," Clem sighed. "Just by looking at you, she can tell how you're feeling. and, apparently, if you're in the wrong body."

Rhea nodded. "That's how I found out I was adopted. Mommy and Daddy are aliens, and Clem is like them. That's why he can change his shape."

Ted came running up the hill. "I heard fighting," he said. "Thought I'd better... " He stopped talking when he saw Rhea.

"Dad," turning to him, Garth said, "you remember Clem Rodgers. This is his kid sister, Rhea."

Clem shook Ted's hand. "Garth says you were part of the original Problem Child Gang. Guess you found my note."

Unbeknownst to us, we were being watched from the trees. One man spoke into a communicator. "Looks like we've got ourselves a new Problem Child Gang."

"Continue to observe," came the reply. "Will advise as necessary."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Back with the others

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Make him be a girl for the day!" persisted Rhea. "He can change into anything, honest!"

"Something we need to know?" turning to Clem, Ted asked.

"You're 'killing' me, sis!" sighing, Clem said. "We're supposed to keep that a secret! Mom will be furious!"

Rhea teared up. "But... you promised." her lip trembling, she said. "They can do stuff too, they won't tell on us."

"Yeah, Clem." seeing an opportunity for mischief, I said. "We won't tell on you, let's see your feminine side."

Grace, seeing my mischievous look smiled as well. "If your bashful, we can turn around." teasing, she said. "You saw our secret, let's see yours."

"Enough." firmly, Ted said.

"It's okay, sir." blushing brightly, Clem said. "I used the G word with Lyssa without thinking, I owe them at least this."

"Alright but quickly." looking about, Ted said. "I doubt you want your secret to become publicly known."

Rhea giggled as Clem blushed brightly before concentrating. We all watched wide eyed as Clem's body shrank down to feminine proportions before his face and body changed to that of a teen girl. The silent shock turned to amused chuckling as Rhea pointed at her brother, or rather sister and her clothing shifted, changing into a skirt and tube top, showing off her curvy mid drift. Unknown to us, she remembered to summon the wig as well. "Much better." giggling, Rhea said. "Say hi to Jenny."

We all snickered as Jenny blushed brightly. Rhea giggled but then moaned, stumbling backwards. I saw her falling and quickly caught her. "Easy, little one." concerned, I said. "I'm guessing you're the one who changed Clem's clothing."

"She has some mental powers as well." shaking her head, Jenny said. "Only she's a little too young to use them for very long, it takes a lot out of her."

"What about you?" looking at Clem, Garth asked. "Doesn't changing forms take a lot out of you?"

"Just when I change into something larger than myself." shrugging, Jenny replied. "Still, I have to be careful as I am going through a form of puberty."

Garth and I saw that she winced that that last part as Garth asked, "What do you mean a 'form' of puberty?"

Jenny sighed and removed her wig. "Alien puberty." near tears, she said. "Rhea wasn't joking when she said my parents are aliens, I am one too, just born on Earth."

A small gasp escaped my lips. "He's completely hairless... Just like Cait." whispering, I said.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Clem becomes Jenny.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Cait?" Jenny's hand went to her head. "Cait's like this, too?"

Before anyone could respond, Garth look around as I started to feel something... dark. "Anyone else feel that?" looking nervous, Garth asked.

"Feel what?" Jenny asked.

Grace and I nodded. "Just like the mall," Grace said.

"Dad," turning to his father, Garth said, "I think we need to get out of here. And we need to get creative about how to get... there."

"Understood," nodding, Ted said. "The police academy taught me everything I know about losing pursuers."

As we got underway, we told Ted about the fight, and Jenny told us about the note. "What do you think, Chief?" uncertain, Clem asked.

"It sounds like Rhea's caught the attention of the Agency," Ted said. "It's a quasi-governmental agency that recruits kids to do their dirty work."

"Weird..." she said.

"When a 5-year-old girl points a sniper rifle at your head, 'weird' is one letter longer than any word going through your mind." He said this while staring at Rhea. I got the feeling that there must be something about her that made him uncomfortable, but he wasn't saying what.

"Like my dream," Rhea said. "I saw some men who wanted to take me away. And there was something much worse looking for me, too."

"That could be Sykes," Ted said. "Sykes and the Agency are out to destroy each other, and they don't care much about anyone caught in the crossfire." He turned his attention to Jenny. "How are you explaining your, uh condition? I mean, when you're not changing shape."

"Mom found an article," Jenny explained, 'about Plutonium beauty products causing hair loss. I tell people that I used the body wash."

"Interesting timing," Ted said. "I heard through the grapevine that Plutonium had just dodged a buyout attempt by Cain Chemical, right before that problem started. And Cain is one of Sykes's front companies."

"Could you guys do me a favor?" Rhea asked.

"Sure, boo," smiling, I said. "What is it?"

"If something bad happens to me, find my mommy. My real mommy, the one who borned me. Tell her I'm in trouble."

"Okay," my smile flattening, I said. "How will we know when we find her?"

"Tobi says you'll know."

"Tobi's her symbiont," Jenny explained. "That's where she gets her powers."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Danger sense.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
It was not long before we realized we were driving on the freeway, heading east. "Where are we going, dad?" turning to him, Garth asked. "I thought we were going to take Jenny and Rhea back to their homes."

"That would only lead those interested in Rhea to her doorstep." driving, Geo said. "You may not have realized it but there is a black car about three car lengths back, its been following us since we left the school."

Rhea gasped and turned to look out the back window of the van but Grace pulled her down as something hit the window, breaking a hole in the glass, causing her to scream. "Don't do that again." sternly, she said.

I saw Garth turned to see what is was and gulped. In the next breath, he yelled, "Everyone down!" as he pushed Grace and my head to our knees. I gulped myself as I saw a tranquilizer dart harmlessly hit the back of the passenger seat. "Those maniacs are firing on us!"

Jenny grabbed Rhea and, to my surprise, quickly changed into a box, with Rhea inside while Garth used his own body to protect Grace and I. "Uncle Geo, get us out of here!" begging, Garth called to him.

"Give me the wheel!" moving to the front, Ted ordered. "You know what to do."

Geo nodded then got out of the driver's seat, still holding the wheel while dad took the seat before taking the wheel and steered through traffic. "Everyone hang on." walking towards the back, ordered Geo. "This is going to be a kick in the ass."

Curious, I watched as Geo opened a panel under the back window and turned a switch. Unknown to us, just above the rear bumper, a large panel opened, revealing what looked like a rocket booster. "Turbo turbine ready." turning to Ted, Geo said. "Kick it!"

We all turned to the front to see Ted hit a switch on the steering wheel before letting out an excited yell as we felt the van suddenly pick up a lot of speed with the turbine firing. Ted turned the wheel with expert precision, moving through the traffic, leaving the back car in the dust. I exchanged startled looks with Grace and Garth but they turned to smiles as we rolled our eyes hearing Ted and Geo declare, "Problem Child!"

Minutes later, we arrived at...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Road Chase.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
It was modest, as mansions went, but it was still huge to my perspective. The main hall was impressive as well but something seemed off. "This is incredible, Mr. Jones." impressed, I said. "Only, what is with the strange puzzle locks on all of the doors?"

"Ah, you noticed that; they were put there to keep out the curious and to slow down the determined." smiling, Ted said. "They were also placed there to help keep our minds sharp." his smile faltered. "Not that it made much difference."

"Don't talk like that." begging, I said. "Your team did a lot of good, saved a lot of people."

"Maybe." halfhearted, Ted said. "That's all in the past." his smile returned slightly. "This is your legacy, make it better than ours if you decide to run with it."

"We will." smiling, I replied. "We just want our parents to be proud of us."

"We are all proud of you kids." lightly touching my shoulder, Ted said. "We always were. All of you have come a long way since discovering your gifts." he turned serious. "Just remember not to show off your gifts to anyone outside of your little circle if you don't want serious trouble to find you."

"The Agency?" shivering slightly, I asked.

"Them, Sykes, or someone worse." eying me, Ted replied. "The gifts we had are a sneeze compared to your own. A person or group could become very powerful if he or they can find a way to control any one of you."

I gulped, hearing that. "Did you have this fear?" looking at Ted, I asked.

Ted nodded. "Every day we went out on a mission." serious, he said. "That's why we used aliases when we talked to each other in the field."

“Did you guys live here?” changing the subject, I asked.

“Occasionally, we did.” sadly, Ted replied. “You see, all of our parents were always off somewhere, leaving us to basically fend for ourselves.” he sighed. “My parents were the security team for the Tanner family so Amanda and I were left in the care of servants who really didn’t care much for us.”

“That’s horrible.” tearing up, I said. “I never knew…”

“That was how we first got together, Lyssa,” looking at me, Ted said, “our shared need for a family.”

“What made you want to fight crime?” curious, I asked.

“That was Mr. Tanner’s idea.” smiling, Ted replied. “He stumbled upon a plot to kidnap your mother for a heavy ransom by the security guards working at one of his dad’s tech companies.”

“So that’s how it all started.” whispering, I said. “I don’t remember seeing that mission in the story, though.”

“Not all of the missions were recorded, my dear.” chuckling, Ted said. “Just the… err… highlights.”

“Who among the original gang wrote these stories?” curious, I asked.

“None of us, I assure you.” smiling, Ted replied. “It was Detective Gordon Flynn, the best man the police department ever had and my mentor when I joined the police force." he sighed. "Although he did not approve of our actions, he found them to be noble and I guess he did not want everyone to forget the good that we did.”

“That’s amazing, Mr. Jones.” smiling, I said. “Um… can I see my mom’s room? I want to get a feel of what it was like to be in her shoes.”

Ted smiled. “This way…”
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: PCG headquarters.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Ted led me to a room on the second floor. "I can guess what you're thinking," he said, "a bunch of teenagers living together. No, we didn't have sex. We knew that, if there were a disagreement over how serious the relationship should be, it would tear the team apart."

"I can understand that," I replied. "Before my powers surfaced, and I started changing, I didn't dare tell Garth how I felt about him. I figured, since he knew me from before, he might feel awkward."

"Here we are," Ted said, as we came to a door. "I don't think much has changed since we stopped coming here." He opened the door and let me in.

The room was beautiful. I could tell Mom had handled the decorating. It had been cleaned recently, as if expecting my arrival.

I paused at Mom's track trophies. "I never knew Mom was a champion runner."

Ted nodded. "Nowhere near as fast as you, but she won awards. She always told us she wanted her kids to live their own dreams, so she left her trophies here. Later, after the hit-and-run, they were just a reminder of what could never be."

"Think I should try out for track?"

"You'd have to dial your speed way back. Sarah worked hard to win those awards. It wouldn't be fair to competitors if you showed up and ran at triple-digit speeds."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: 'Heather's' bedroom.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Grace stuck her head in the doorway. "I thought Dad might bring you here," she said. "I'm taking Rhea on a tour of the house. Want to come along?"

"Sounds good," I said. Turning to Ted, I said, "I'll see you later, Chief."



As we walked along, I asked Rhea, "So, where'd you get your symbiont?"

"My born mommy," she replied. "One time, Tobi and I talked to her sym - her friend. My born mommy doesn't know about her yet."

"Do you know anything about her?" Grace asked.

"I think she's a teacher. I would have liked to meet her, but Mommy and Daddy are homeschooling us. They say they can teach us faster than regular schools."

"Well, maybe you'll still get a chance to run into her, sometime."

We passed a room where I could hear Ted talking on the phone. "Yes, I'm sure," he said, "Geo was with me. He saw her, too."

I hung back so I could hear more.

"I don't know what it means," he said. "It's certainly not the same girl from years ago. But the resemblance is beyond uncanny. It's exact."

I remembered the way Ted looked at Rhea when he first saw her. Was that what he was talking about? If so, what happened years ago? And how could Rhea figure into it?
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Touring with Grace

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Mr Jones, I saw how you looked at Rhea." walking into the room, I said. "I also heard you talking on the phone, how is Rhea involved in all of this?"

"Please close the door, Lyssa." sighing, Ted said. "Rhea doesn't need to hear this and I'll thank you not to tell her."

"She'll know you're hiding something." closing the door, I said. "Remember, she can see auras."

"Adults hide a lot of things, Lyssa." looking at me, Ted countered. "To the point, we had encountered this strange little girl during many of our exploits as the Problem Child Gang." pausing, he added, "She always seemed to be watching from a distance with a sort of sad look in her eyes."

"Did you find out who she was?" curious, I asked.

"No, we didn't." softly, Ted replied. "However, she was always around when we were foiling Sykes schemes, just... watching us, it gave us all the creeps. She did occasionally somehow help us out of one or two tight spots but she was always gone before we could talk to her."

"Was she there at your last mission?" looking at Ted, I asked.

Ted nodded before rolling up his left shirt sleeve, revealing an old scar from a gunshot wound. "I looked her square in the eye from across an alley as she shot me in the shoulder." sadly, Ted replied. "She was a brainwashed member of the Agency and Rhea is the spitting image of that girl."

"Do you think she still works for the Agency?"

"I don't know but seeing Rhea is adopted, I'm guessing that she is at least free from them but may soon be a target." seriously, Ted said. "I'm guessing that is who those three goons were who attacked her and Clem."

I stood, frozen in fear by this news. "Poor Rhea." tearing up, I said.

"Telling her will only make her more frightened than she already is." softly, Ted said. "This is your case, you decide where to go from here."

What am I to do?
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Continue

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Before hunting down Grace and Rhea, I decided to get some advice from someone who wasn't as wrapped up in this as Garth and I, or our parents. So I gave Beth a call.

"Hey, sis," she said when she answered her phone. "Good to hear your voice. Mom says you're getting a tour of the old headquarters. How's the place look?"

"It's amazing," I replied. "But that's not why I'm calling. I need some advice about something huge."

"Define huge."

"Bigger than me turning into a girl, even."

"That sounds pretty big, alright. What's the problem?"

"That alarm from the blind post office? It was from Clem and his kid sister. Somebody's after them, and it's serious."

"Like what? Like they're being bullied?"

"Worse." I told her a short version of what Ted told me. "These people are after her, and we can't even tell her why. If she knew what was going on, she'd be a basket case. At the same time, she knows when people are hiding things from her, so she's bound to try to pry things out of us. What am I supposed to do?"

"Well, you've got to help her, Lyssa," Beth replied. "She's asked for your help, so you can't just blow her off. Besides, you're always saying that you feel you've got your powers for a reason. If you can think of a better reason than helping a little kid who's being chased by goons, I'd like to hear it."

"Thanks, Beth. I needed to hear it put that way. That's why I called you."

"Of course. After all, you asked me for help, too."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Ask Beth for advice.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Deciding that it was best not to keep any direct secrets, I decided to quickly call everyone into the library, including Rhea, she had a right to know at least part of the truth. "Okay, Lyssa, what was so urgent that you needed to see all of us right away?" concerned, Grace asked. "You sounded super worried over the house intercom."

"Remember those goons who were after Clem and Rhea?" seeing Ted Jones shake his head, I asked. "Well, Mr Jones told me that the Agency was after Rhea's birth mother twenty years ago. My guess is they want Rhea and Clem for the same reasons, they both have a unique power they can use to their advantage."

I paused, seeing their shocked expressions and Ted discretely nodding his approval of my version of the truth before Clem asked, "How did they learn of Rhea or even me?"

"Rhea's mother got away from the Agency on our last mission." speaking up, Ted said. "In that sense, I guess we gained a small victory." he shuddered slightly. "Bear in mind, though, these people are true monsters. I can only guess they had been tracking Rhea's birth mother and discovered her child in one of those searches."

"The van watching the house." thinking out loud, Clem said. "They must have been with this Agency."

"If that is the case, they had been watching you for a while, young man." serious, Ted said. "They were merely waiting for the right time to strike."

"No one is going to take you two anywhere if we have anything to say about it." serious, Garth said to Clem and Rhea.

"Wh- What about my- my birth mommy?" frightened, Rhea asked. "I do- don't want mo- monsters to g- get her!"

"Maybe mom and dad can find her." trying to calm her sister, Clem said. "They have... gifts of their own."

Rhea gave Clem a grateful smile only to have it suddenly turn to terror. "They found her!" her lips and hands quivering, she screamed. "The monsters are chasing her!"

I quickly knelt down and turned Rhea's head to face me. It broke my heart to see such a small child so very terrified. "Where is your birth mommy?" firmly, I asked. "Can you tell us where she is?"

"Hospital!" crying in hysterics, Rhea replied. "They're running from the hospital!"

"That's only five miles from here." startled, Geo said.

"Mount up!" pointing in the direction of the garage, Ted ordered. "Grace, you drive. We will give advice through ear piece radios as we watch through the camera feeds!"

Within minutes, we were all given earpiece radios, exactly as they were described in the comic series and led to the garage where Grace moved to get into the family car. "Not that one, honey." moving to a tarp covered vehicle. "This one."

I watched in shock as Ted pulled off the tarp to reveal a modified, sleek black, van! "The Beast!" an awe filled smile forming, I whispered. "You really had it!"

"This is the 1983 GMC Vandura G series, which Ted and I had modified." quite proudly, Geo said. "This bad boy as a 10 inch armored plated hull and armored glass windows. It carries a 2.7 liter supercharged V8 engine that delivers 300+hp and 400+ torque with a top sustained speed of 180 mph."

It was indeed an impressive machine that carried a lot of muscle, I just hoped Grace would be able to handle it.

"We can talk cars later." scolding, Ted said. "Get moving!"

We all piled into the van and sped off, towards the hospital. Our first mission had begun....
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Telling the others

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
I looked back through the rear window at Rhea waving sadly as we drove away from the mansion. Ted thought it was too dangerous for such a young girl to get involved. "I hope she'll be okay with being left behind like that." wincing, I said as I turned to face the front. "It is her birth mother, after all."

I let out a low scream, seeing Rhea suddenly appear in front of Jessica. She looked painfully pale and she was shivering but her expression was one of determination. "I- I'm go-going with y-you, Jess." panting, she said. "S-She's my mo-mommy!"

"Rhea, are you crazy!" gripping her shoulders, Jessica asked. "Look at yourself, you look like a ghost!" she sighed wearily. "Please don't use your powers unless you really have to, you're going to hurt yourself!"

Rhea began to cry, having been yelled at by her brother/sister. "But... my mommy."

Jessica shook her head and I knew she wanted to lecture her sister but I sighed as she let it go and put her into an empty seat before fastening the seat belt. "Just make sure you stay behind us." she said.

We drove in the direction of the hospital, until Rhea said, "Stop!"

Grace stopped. "What is it?"

Rhea pointed at a gathering crowd. "There they are! Mommy and her boyfriend!"

I looked, but all I could see was a small boy in a dress carrying a doll, being surrounded by some goons carrying weapons. "Rhea's mom or not," Garth said, "we can't let this go down." We all piled out of the Beast and made for the group, Garth hulking up to weightlifter size.

We got to the group in time to hear the goons' leader say, "Kiss, Kiss, my dear."

Garth wasn't having any of that. "KISS THIS!" he roared, and punched the man in the jaw.

The guy sat up, rubbing his jaw. "Hello again, Garth. You caught me off guard, but not without resources." At that, the goons aimed their weapons at Garth.

Nobody was going to point a weapon at the sweetest buns this side on Grandma's Thanksgiving rolls with me around. "Think fast," I said, then ran over to start collecting the guns.

I'd been getting better at looking where I was going since the dog-mess incident, so I was able to get a look at the boy in the dress. What I'd taken for a doll was actually a tiny woman, and she was terrified. As I looked at her face, I could see a distinct resemblance to Rhea. Was this her birth mother? How did she get so small?

Putting those thoughts aside for the moment, I finished collecting the guns and piled them in front of us. I figured that we could maybe analyze them later, to see what we were dealing with. "Too slow," I said, after I was through.

The leader's eyes narrowed. "You kids don't know what you're in the middle of. You need guidance."

"We've got guidance," Garth replied. "And it's you who doesn't know what he's doing. Drop this, before it gets dropped on you."

One of the goons said, "Looks like Blue team wasn't kidding. Your orders?"

"We've got all the information we need," the man said. "We can easily pick up Sarah and her fiance at our leisure. Ta-ta." With that, they all touched devices on their wrists, and they and their weapons disappeared. So much for analyzing them.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Arriving on the scene.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Strange." looking at the 'girl' I thought. "She looks like a girl but she's standing like a guy."

I suspected the girl was actually a disguised boy, having been one myself, I know that look of nervousness that comes with wearing that first dress.

The 'girl' sighed. "Looks like I owe you kids one."

"Kids?" surprised, I thought. "He looks younger than us."

"Our pleasure." returning to his normal size, Garth said. "Where's Sarah? You're dressed like a Sarah, but I don't think you are her."

"That would be me," the 'doll' said. "We'd present ourselves better, but we're short on the right size clothing just now."

"They have powers of their own." a frown forming, I thought. "No wonder Hagen wanted them. But what was with the 'kiss kiss' crap he threw at her?"

Rhea stepped forward and carefully took the doll from the child. "Are... are you my mommy?"

"I am, sweetie," tears filling her tiny eyes, the 'doll' said. "You look okay."

"We'll need to save the reunion," the 'girl' said. "Hagen's right. He's got access to our personal information, and he can track us down whenever he feels like it. We're going to need someplace to lie low."

"We've got just the place," motioning to the van, Garth said. "Hagen's got to master several puzzles before he can even think about getting in."

We ushered the cross dressed boy and the doll, in Rhea's careful hands into the van. Grace then drove us all back to the mansion. As we exited the van, Garth said, "Welcome to the clubhouse of the Problem Child Gang."

"Thanks again," the boy, who introduced himself as Todd said. "It's a lucky thing you kids showed up when you did."

"Nuh-uh," said Rhea, who was still carrying Sarah. "Andromeda told Tobi where to find you."

"Andromeda?" curious, I thought. "Tobi?"

"Who's Andromeda?" having the same thought, Garth asked. "And who's Tobi?"

"Andromeda," Sarah explained, "is an alien symbiont who lives inside me. Tobi is her offspring. And Rhea is a clone of me, created to save Tobi's life."

We were about to walk through the garage door, when it opened, revealing Ted's muscular form. "She's not coming in here!" firmly, he declared.

"But she's my mommy!" Rhea protested.

"Honey," Todd asked, "what is he talking about?"

"When I was Rhea's age," Sarah explained, "Dr. Hagen had me shadow the Problem Child Gang. Then, he wanted them dealt with."

"The one who shot Mr Jones in the shoulder." eying Sarah, I thought. "Oh, boy..."

Ted shook his head. "You have such a pretty way of describing shooting someone in the shoulder."

"It's not that I shot you in the shoulder. It's that I didn't shoot you in the head or heart."

"What?"

Sarah nodded. "Hagen ordered me to kill you, but I didn't want to. I deliberately shot you in the shoulder, instead. Then, I went into hiding, using the last name Barns. If it weren't for Cain Chemical, Hagen still wouldn't know where I was living."

Ted shook his head again. "Sykes again. These names just keep turning up, don't they?"
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: The clubhouse.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Sykes?" confused, Todd asked. "Can someone fill me in here?"

Ted sighed, looking as if he were struggling to make a decision. "Alright, everyone inside." finally, he said. "We'll find you all some suitable clothing."

A few minutes later, Todd sat next to Sarah on a comfortable couch inside a spacious library. They were both the size of teenagers, wearing teen clothes. "It looks like Mr Jones wants to keep them at a more controllable age." wincing, I thought. "I guess he doesn't want to take any chances."

I decided it wise not to say anything on the subject. Instead, I took my turn as we all sat around them, explaining the events surrounding our brief encounter with Hagen and his men on the streets near the hospital. In turn, we listened as dad and Geo explained who Sykes was and how their group came to lock horns with the Agency.

"We had thought that the Agency wanted us as part of their army of brainwashed soldiers." finishing his explanation, Ted said. "Apparently, we were wrong."

"The Agency had considered it but, with half your group was related to the most wealthy families on the planet, it was too much of a security risk." looking at dad, Sarah said. "Believe me, Mr Jones, you will never know how lucky you and your team was." she teared up, adding, "They killed my family to claim me."

"It's a small wonder why mom and dad wanted us to stay away from crime fighting." with a low sigh, I thought. "Too late now, I guess, since Hagen is one of the bad guys."

Jess placed a reassuring hand onto Sarah's shoulder. "They won't get you a second time, not if we can help it." smiling, she said. "Rhea is my adopted sister, I won't let anything happen to her birth mother."

"Jessica is really my brother, Clem, mommy." smiling, Rhea said. "He can change into almost anything." giggling, she added, "Even an older sister."

Sarah could not help giggle at that as Jessica blushed. "Thank you for taking care of my little girl.. Jessica." pecking her on the cheek, Sarah said. "Do you all have powers like this?"

"We do." seriously, I replied. "However, I think its more important that we focus the issue at hand... The Agency."

"I agree, we need to place all we know on the table now." equally as serious, Geo said. "We don't want to be caught off guard a second time."

"We know that Dr Hagen knows about all of us, perhaps even that Travis kid." speaking up, I said. "Only I'm guessing you didn't know him back then, Mr Jones."

Ted shook his head. "No, we didn't." with a hint of regret, Ted replied. "Had I known who Dr Hagen was, I would not have allowed him anywhere near my children." then a thought occurred to him. "He told us that he had removed the 'tumor' that caused Garth's body to build up, yet the symbiont..."

"Amara said that Hagen only took a piece of her, stunning her enough to return me to normal." after a pause, Garth said. "That can only mean..."

"He knows about the symbionts." his face turning white, Ted said.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: A realization.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"We'll work out a plan of action against Hagen later." serious, Ted said. "How about the kids show you two around the place, since you'll be staying here until things calm down?"

"Sounds good to me," Sarah said.

"One moment, Garth." said Ted, motioning him over, out of hearing range.

Curious, I watched Garth talk to Ted for a moment before seeing his eyes widen slightly as he nodded at his father then returned to our group, starting the tour.

"Bet you never thought you'd see the inside of this building." smiling, Grace said.

"Never." Sarah agreed. "I'll probably need another tour, I'm so distracted."

"It can be a lot to take in," Jessica said.

"It's not just that. I was supposed to start teaching in a couple of days." sighing, Sarah said. "I'll have to come up with a believable explanation for my absence, since no one is going to ever believe I'm on the run from some shadowy government organization."

"Chief Jones will help you in any way he can," confident, I replied. "My mom will help, too. She's got to drop off my aunt at a treatment center, then she wants to talk with my cousin. She should be by sometime after that."

"Tell them thanks. Actually, though, I'm worried about how my absence will affect my homeroom class." with a grateful smile, Sarah said. "As a baptism of fire, I've been assigned mother-hen status to a group of kids who've been classified as problem children." after a pause, she explained, "They are a number of kids who aren't applying themselves well, a rich girl with an attitude problem, and a transgender student I'm supposed to keep my eye on in case of bullying. I don't know how they'll react if I'm not there; they might think I'm abandoning them."

"They'll be fine," reassuringly, I said, "don't worry."

"Thanks. You kids wouldn't be cruel to the transgender girl, would you?" asked Sarah. "You understand that she's going through a rough time?"

"I try to treat her well," I said, suppressing a chuckle. "She looks me in the eye when I brush my teeth."

Sarah's eyes just about popped out of her head. "Y-you're her? You-you look so feminine."

"Now it's my turn to thank you," I said, turning around to show my figure. "This past summer, I started turning into a complete girl."

"But how is that possible?"

"Long story. For now, let's just say that it runs in the family."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Touring the clubhouse.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
As we moved along, I noticed that Grace and Garth purposely but discretely blocked Sarah and Todd's view of certain halls as we passed them; it became obvious that Mr Jones did not fully trust her. As I thought about it, I realized that it was not because she was necessarily untrustworthy but because she had been brainwashed with no proof that it had ever been undone. "I was right, Mr Jones is not taking any chances." frowning slightly, I thought. "Still, I feel sorry for them. Sarah is as much a victim as any of us."

Seeing her disappointed expression, Garth nodded and explained, "Dad wants you to know just enough to stay here for a while as a guest. It's not because you are not trustworthy, its because you were brainwashed."

"That was twenty years ago." sighing, Sarah argued. "I suffered countless nightmares from my year under their thumb, I still do but I managed to move on."

"Did you do anything to try to undo that brainwashing?" serious, Grace asked.

Looking surprised, Sarah slowly shook my head. "No... I never looked back after I fled from The Agency." tearing up a little, she said. "I was found, trembling in an empty alley, by a young couple who adopted me."

Grace sighed. "Unless you saw someone to break that brainwashing, you are still under their control." serious, she said. "All it takes is one code phrase from them, likely over a phone, and you are theirs again." pausing, she turned to us and muttered, "We better get Cait over here, fast."

"Cait?" confused, Sarah asked. "How many members does this new gang have?"

We all ignored her question as Garth suddenly grew to the size of an Olympian and took a strong hold of her arm. "Please do not take any offense to this." pulling Sarah along, he said. "We can not risk you turning on us."

With that, he half dragged, half carried a struggling Sarah into a spacious room with only one exit and gently pushed her inside while Grace pushed Todd in behind her. Garth then shut the door and locked it tight. "I really hated to do that." muttering, he said. "She's as much a victim as anyone else."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: A partial tour.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Two hours later, Ted heard the front gate buzzer go off and hit the intercom. "Who is this?"

"Caitlin Spencer," calmly Cait's voice replied. "Aunt Sarah said I was expected?"

Ted sighed, relieved. "One moment." he released the intercom switch and turned to me. "Cait has arrived, she's at the front gate, Lyssa." firmly, he said. "You are the fastest, go let her in."

I ran out the main entrance, after taking a minute to solve the lock puzzle, and reached the main gates a few seconds later to greet Caitlin. "How you doing, cuz?" smiling, I asked.

"I can't complain." smiling back, Cait replied. "Mom's started rehab this morning, so I'm looking forward to seeing her again. What've you been up to?"

"Yesterday was pretty wild." a bit shaken, I said. taking a breath, I explained, "We got a signal from the old blind post office, and it turned out to be some old friends. Then we met some lady who had some problems with our folks, and now she's in a jam. That's why we called you. They're worried that there might be some brainwashing involved."

"And, since it involves the brain, you thought of me?" chuckling, Cait asked. "Well, let's check her out."

I led Cait inside, through the clubhouse to a room where we were holding Sarah Barns and her husband, Todd. Both of them were still in the form of teenagers. With them, the rest of the group was waiting. "Ms. Barns," motioning to my cousin, I said, "this is Cait."

"How do you do?" calmly, Cait asked.

Mrs Barns shrugged. "My life's turned upside-down and inside-out in the past week, but I'm holding together." looking shaken, she said. "Ted says you can help me unravel my past?"

"I can try." stepping in front of Sarah, Cait replied.

"How does that work?" curious, Sarah asked.

"Just relax, and trust me." her voice almost echoing, Cait replied.

Once the two made eye contact, both of their eyes fell half open as they stood, unmoving. "That's the same look Cait had when he was in that kid's head at the mall." mussing, I thought. "She must be in Mrs Barns' head."

Minutes passed with the two unmoving as we could only watch, and hope. Then, Cait turned her head to the side, as if she were suddenly confused. "Bad guys?" in a flat tone, she asked.

She paused then rose her hands as if she were holding a rifle at Mrs Barns. "She's acting weird." unnerved, I thought. "I wonder what's going on in their heads."

"I- I'm trying to obey, Jon." apologetically, Cait said. "I want to obey but-"

"Oh crap!" startled, I thought. "She's acting like she's been possessed!"

Of course, I dared not say anything out loud in fear of breaking the connection and making things worse. Still, I tried to be ready for anything. Only I began to worry more as Cait's hands began to shake with a look of uncertainty on her face. "I- I must obey." stammering, she said. "Jon is my master, I am his slave."

"Not good!" worried, I thought. "I wonder if I should try to snap her out of it."

I was about to do just that but Garth stepped forward only to pause as Cait spoke again, her hands still shaking. "Mommy... daddy...." tears forming, she whimpered. she then rose her hands, barely still as she blankly yelled, "I must defend Jon! Do not come closer!"

Not knowing what to do, Garth turned to dad to see he was just as concerned before Cait once again, quivered, crying. "Jon... did." slowly, tearfully, she said, as if answering a question.

"What's gotten into Cait?" concerned, Grace asked Garth. "She's acting more and more like she's reliving a painful memory in Sarah's mind."

Garth turned to her and shrugged. "You're asking me? You're the one with the supercharged brain."

Suddenly, a handgun materialized into Cait's hand and she turned to Garth, leveling it at his left shoulder. Everyone in the room froze as a sad smile formed onto her face. With a glassy look in her eyes, Cait said, "I am sorry."

With that, she pulled the trigger...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Cait arrives.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
The gun clicked and Cait pulled the trigger again. no result.

Turning red, Garth slapped the gun out of her hand. "What's gotten into you, Cait?" almost screaming, he asked.

"I... I must kill you, Ted," to our surprise, Cait said. "But the gun won't work, so I cannot. I must. I cannot. Must... Cannot... " she sighed before passing out where she sat.

"I think she got caught up in Mrs Barns brainwashing." wincing, Grace said.

"I'm forced to agree." sighing, Ted said. "Hagen obviously thought that someone would try to break her from their control and set a trap." he then produced two pairs of handcuffs and slapped them onto Cait's wrist before locking the other end onto the arm of the chair. He repeated the process with the other hand. "We'll see how she acts when she wakes up."

I was told later, with Garth, that Cait was awake and we went up to check on her to hear her talking to Grace.

"Are you awake?" concerned, Grace asked. "Are you okay?"

"I think so," in a pained voice. Cait replied. "I guess I did something stupid, huh?"

"You could call it that," walking past her, into the room, Ted said. "Apparently, you wanted to kill me, and tried to kill Garth. Good thing the gun you teleported wasn't loaded."

"You were right," sighing, Cait said. "Ms. Barns still has her programming. I took her back through her memories, and stumbled onto it. When I tried to undo it, I got trapped in the programming."

Ted nodded. "So we'll need to be careful around her. Rhea's not going to like that, but we can't take chances."

Finally, Garth spoke up with me right behind him, "Is she back to normal yet?"

"Still bald and telepathic," Cait called back, "but not homicidal. Is that close enough?"

Garth stepped into the room, relieved to see Cait acting normally again. "I'll take it." smiling slightly, he said.

I entered right behind Garth, almost shadowing him in fear of something else happening. I could not bear the thought of losing him. "Had that gun been loaded," tearful, I thought. "I don't know what I would have done."

"Hagen was too clever for us," Ted explained. "Cait's attempt to undo Barns' programming got her into a trap. The feedback loop from her unloaded gun knocked her out and freed her."

"Try to be gentle with her, Chief," begging, Cait said. "She's as much a victim as you were."

"I'll try to remember that, Cait." nodding, dad said. "Thank you for the attempt. What do you want to do now?"

"I'll go a few blocks away, and arrange for my driver to pick me up." with a rueful smile, Cait replied. "See you guys at school tomorrow."

"Sure you wouldn't rather spend the night here?" Grace asked.

Cait shook her head. "I've got some personal stuff to check up on. Sorry I couldn't be of more help."

Grace smiled. "You did what you could." sounding positive, she said. "And the old Caitlin Spencer wouldn't have done half as much for us. See you at school."

Ted unlocked the handcuffs. As Cait stood up and rubbed her wrists, Ted asked, "What was her trigger?"

"It was 'Kiss Kiss, my dear'," I replied. "Why?"

"I have an idea," was his answer. "I'll have the kids tell you about it tomorrow, if it works."

"Not even a hint?"

He smiled. "Let's just say Hagen wouldn't be the first person I've dealt with who turned out to be too clever for his own good."

"Before you leave, Cait..." smiling, I said. "There is something about Jess, err, Clem you need to know about."

"Clem?" curious, Cait asked. "What about him?"

"He's a shape shifter." beaming, I replied. "He also has a crush on you."

"I know about the crush but..." downhearted, Cait said. "Why would he date a hairless cue-ball like me?"

I giggled, confusing Cait, as I quickly lead her to Jess, who was now Clem again. "You two have the same secret." standing between them, I said. "I think it will help you both to know it."

Before either of them could react, I tore off their wigs, revealing both of their flawless bald heads. Both Cait and Clem gasped, seeing each other then smiled. After a moment, Clem seemed to snap out of his trance and quickly took out a notepad, scribbling down a telephone number.

"Um... call me later?" offering the piece of paper, he asked.

Cait, also snapping out of her trance, shyly accepted the phone number and jotted down her own, offering it as well. "Um... you call me, okay? I have to go to work after school."

"The mall?" smiling, Clem asked.

"Yeah." blushing, Cait said. "I'm working as a living mannequin."

"So am I." to Cait's surprise, Clem replied. "A salesgirl named Tracy Flynn suggested that I apply."

"Were you interviewed by a Mrs. Rachel Waite?" looking at me, Cait asked.

Clem nodded. "Yes, I was." he replied.

"Oh boy." smiling, I said. "You two are likely to end up on the same display."

Both Cait and Clem blushed at that as I gave them back their wigs.

As Cait later left, I wondered what Mr Jones had in mind to help Mrs Barns.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: The gun is empty

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Thanks, Alyssa." blushing, Clem said. he sighed. "I know I wasn't there when you needed a friend before..."

"That's in the past." interrupting him, I said. "All that counts is that you are here now."

"I won't let you down again." tearing up, Clem said. "You have my word on that."

I gave Clem a quick hug. "That means a lot to me, Clem." releasing him, I said. "Let's see how the others are doing."

Clem and I walked up the stairs to find Garth talking to his dad. "What's the plan, dad?" curious, Garth asked as we walked in. "You saw the result of trying to fight the brainwashing."

"We don't fight the brainwashing, we use it." with a knowing smile, Ted replied. "like a scorpion stinging itself, we make the brainwashing cancel itself out."

"Interesting." raising an eyebrow, Geo said. "What do you propose?"

"We use the trigger phrase then command her to ignore that phrase completely before using the trigger word again to bring her back to herself." confident, Ted said. "Once that is done, the Agency will not be able to control her."

"Not bad." hearing the conversation, I thought. "Not bad at all."

"Simple, yet brilliant." impressed, Geo said. "It's worth a try."

"I'll do it." offering, Ted said.

"No, Sarah Barns still has a standing order in her subconscious to kill you." firmly but kindly, Geo said. "I will do it." he then turned to Garth. "Garth, I will need you and your dad as back up in case something goes wrong."

Garth nodded, though he seemed a little uncertain. "I'll do my best."

With that, I followed the three upstairs with Clem and Rhea following, to the room we had locked Sarah and Todd Barns. Geo opened the door and entered, closing the door behind him as we all waited. Minutes past with nothing alarming being heard before Ted knocked and peeked his head inside. "How'd it go?" he asked.

"It worked like a charm," Geo replied. "your hunch paid off."

"What hunch?" confused, Sarah asked.

"You had a trigger phrase," Geo explained, "which Hagen used to control you. Cait told us what it was, and we used it to shut down the mind-control system. Hagen won't be able to control you anymore."

"Is that why you told me to kiss you?" disturbed, Sarah asked.

Geo nodded. "That was your trigger. When I said it the first time, you went into a trance, ready for orders. If Hagen tries it again, he'll get a much different response from you."

Sarah nodded, looking relieved. "So I'm good to go?"

Ted smiled. "We'll let you see more of the place, but they're still looking for you at your apartment. By the way, somebody's waiting to see you."

He opened the door wider, and Rhea came in, accompanied by Clem. "Hi, Mommy," she said, giving Sarah a big hug.

"Hi, sweetheart," Sarah replied. "Who's this?"

"My name's Clem," he said. "Rhea's brother. This is what I usually look like. Jessica was... something of a punishment. I called Lyssa by the wrong name."

I smiled, hearing that. "At least he can admit his mistakes."

"Tsk, tsk. You shouldn't have done that." shaking a finger, Sarah said.

"Yes, ma'am. Yesterday gave me some insight into what she went through all those years. It won't happen again."

"I like Jessica," Rhea said, pouting.

Clem chuckled. "I meant that I won't call Alyssa the wrong name again. Maybe sometimes, I'll let Jessica out to play."

"Yay!"

"He still has a good heart." holding back a giggle, I thought. "Maybe we can let 'Jessica' out sometime."

We all laughed, and Rhea told Sarah about the years since the Rodgers family adopted her. As she did, dad tapped my shoulder and pointed to the door. Getting the hint, we all walked out, allowing Sarah and her husband to have a private moment with their Rhea and Clem.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Ted's idea.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
The following day, I called mom and to bring her up to date on everything that had happened since I had last called about Sarah Barns. "It seems as if we are now, unofficially, the new Problem Child Gang." finishing my story, I said. "Already we are neck deep in our first case."

"Just stay sharp, Lyssa." sighing, mom said. "Try to come home in one piece."

"I will, I promise." serious, I said.

Soon after I ended the call, I finished getting dressed when Cait's frantic voice echoed in my mind.

*There is going to be an attack at the school!* her panicked voice echoing, she called. *A gun man on a roof top, firing at all of us! We have to be ready!*

In the next breath, I ran out with Garth and Grace doing the same. "DAD!!" in unison, we screamed.

Ted was up the stairs in the next breath with Geo following. "What's wrong!?" concerned, he demanded.

We relayed Cait's message to him and he was about to grab his smartphone when a panicked scream was heard, it was Rhea and, seeing her abilities, I guessed she got the same vision as Cait. I was in Rhea's room in a heart beat with the rest quickly following to find Rhea siting on her bed. She was shaking, wide eyed, and terrified as she looked out into the distance, crying. "It's going to be okay, Rhea." as dad quickly walked off, dialing a number on his phone, Garth said. "My dad is the chief of police, he will stop this before it happens."

"What- What about the wolves?" still shaking, Rhea asked. "Who will deal with them?"

Trying to make Rhea feel better, Garth increased in size to the size of an Olympian and made a 'muscle' pose. "Who's afraid of the big bad wolf?" using a bad Arnold Schwarzenegger imitation, he asked. "I will pump him up!"

For a moment, Rhea looked at Garth as if he was insane then giggled, seeing Clem behind him, making the same poses but with his significantly smaller body. I and the others soon giggled as well, seeing him before Garth turned to see him smiling. "I couldn't resist." he said.

Garth shook his head and smiled only it vanished when Ted walked back into the room. "Okay, everyone, listen up." sternly, he said. "I want all of you to act as if nothing is going on when you go to school but be ready for anything, understood!?"

We all nodded then got ready for school.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: preparing for school.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
I tried to be confident, when I met Beth at school but, with her spiritual wisdom, there was no fooling her. "Uncle Ted will not let anyone hurt us." reassuring me, she whispered. "He'll stop the shooter, I know he will."

"You're right, Beth." managing a smile, I whispered back. "I guess I'm just nervous."

Beth touched my cheek. "You are a real girl now, the whole enchilada." smiling, she whispered. "That and we are among the members of the new Problem Child Gang."

I nodded then turned to Garth to see he was trying not to make it obvious that he was keeping a sharp look out for anything that looked like a threat as Natalie Turner, Grace's girlfriend, caught up with us. Natalie was Grace's height and just as fit with long auburn hair and wild green eyes. She gave Grace a loving kiss then looked at her crossly. "Where have you been the past couple of days!?" worried she asked. "It was as if you had suddenly dropped off the planet!"

"It's a long story, Nat." sighing, Grace said. "Garth was in the hospital.."

"Oh my gosh!" startled, Natalie said. "Garth, are you alright!?"

"I'm fine." focusing on keeping a look out, Garth replied. "Just a little rattled, I guess."

Natalie frowned. "There is more to this." stepping in front of Garth, she said. "Garth, what happened to you?"

Garth sighed, turning to her. "It would take too long to explain everything." quickly, he replied. "Do you remember the Problem Child Gang mystery book series?"

Natalie nodded. "Yeah, Grace and I love to read them together." confused, she said. "What does that have to do with..."

Her jaw dropped as Garth increased to an adult size in front of her. "The characters in that book were based on real people; Tex the mighty was our dad, Natalie." returning to normal size, he said. "Grace and I... inherited those powers."

"Their enemies are real as well and we suspect they are after us." adding Grace. "We needed to train so to be better prepared when they make their big push." tearing up, Grace added, "Please don't think differently of me."

Natalie gave Grace a passionate kiss. "Never." touching her forehead onto Grace's. "I love you, no matter what."

Grace smiled, grateful and kissed her before breaking away and we continued walking towards school. On the way, I quickly explained the situation to Natalie and assured her that everything would be fine. Upon entering the schoolyard, we were met by Cait Trish. "It's okay," seeing their worried looks, Garth said. "Dad's got a team in position."
