"We'll just act like everything's normal," I added, "and the other kids won't have any reason to believe otherwise."

We were soon approached by a young boy I'd seen at the clubhouse. As he got closer, a knowledgeable smile formed onto Cait's face. "Hi, guys," the boy said.

Cocking an eyebrow, Cait asked, "Aren't you a little old to be hanging out at the schoolyard?"

"How did... oh, yeah, Sarah told me about you," he said. "My name's Todd. I'm Sarah's fiance. We heard on the scanner that there was something going on here today, so I came to keep an eye on things. I figured a teenage boy wouldn't attract as much attention."

"Sarah Barns, our homeroom teacher this year." whispering carefully, Garth said to Natalie. "She and her husband have certain powers as well."

"Garth is not mentioning me or the others." carefully, I whispered to Beth.

"He's trying to protect us by only telling Natalie what she needs to know at the moment." whispering back, Beth replied. "With the enemies our parents had, the less she knows, the better."

"Speaking of Sarah, how is she?" curious, Cait asked.

"She's fine," smiling, Garth said. "Once you were gone, they used the trigger phrase against itself. Hagen will never control her again."

Before another word could be said, Trish screamed.

When we looked to see why, we saw a pair of wolves, snarling and snapping at every student they approached. What Rhea had explained was coming to life, wolves at the school!

"Get everybody inside," running towards the wolves, Garth said. "I'll handle this."

I jumped into action, yelling to the students to get inside quickly. The panicked crowd obeyed without hesitation and I took a chance to see if Garth was okay to he him grow to Olympian size and scoop his arm under the first wolf to reach him and heaved it into the air. The animal let out a loud yelp as it crashed through the window then I yelped as I saw him jump in after him. "Garth, be careful!" crying out, I yelled.

I wanted to run to his aid but I paused, curious, seeing Mr Sam Connors hurry through the window with Megan following. "What's going on over there?" watching, I wondered.

Moments later, I saw Garth walk out with Travis and remembered Mr Connors saying that he could transform into various animals, including Anthros. Both he and Garth were normal again and I glanced up to watch a man being taken into custody by uncle Ted and a number of policemen. I smiled before hearing someone's thoughts. Don't give him the chance. Run him down. Finish him off.

That was when I ran over to Garth, full speed, hoping he was unharmed. Garth jumped, seeing me suddenly 'appear' in front of him and I wrapped my arms around his waist, relieved he was not hurt. "Garth, I was so worried for you!" almost in tears, I said. "When I saw you go after that wolf, I... I..."

As quickly as I ran to him, Garth pulled me into a long, passionate kiss. Cheers from fellow students rose around us but I could only hear my own low moan as fireworks went off in my mind. I had wanted this moment to come forever; I slowly closed my eyes, not wanting the kiss to ever end. When we finally broke the kiss, I sighed, a dream like look forming on my face. "Never mind."

Garth chuckled and kissed me again, this time I heard the students cheering. "I was officially Garth's girlfriend."

"Life doesn't get much sweeter than this." I thought.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: At school.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
After things had died down a bit, I walked into the school with Garth, we were holding hands and I was in heaven. I was almost sorry when we parted to go to our lockers. Only, as I was placing my purse into my locker, I heard Cait's voice in my head. *We need to talk, Lyssa.* she said. *Take the first hall to your right, I'm in the third room to your left.*

I followed Cait's mental directions and entered an empty class room where I found her. "What's up?" I asked.

"First of all," smiling, Cait said, "congratulations on your first kiss."

I smiled, almost blushing, touching my lips. "You saw that, huh?"

"What with that disturbance this morning, most of the school saw it." still smiling, Cait said. "Congratulations, again. I hope it's the first of many."

"I can't get over it." dreamily, I said. "My lips are still tingling from it." I took a breath, to focus my thoughts. "You said there was something else?"

Cait nodded, turning serious. "Some of my old friends - ex-friends, I should say - are plotting against you." looking at Lyssa, I said. "They're figuring out some way to expose you in front of the whole school."

"Expose me?" curious, I asked. "For what?"

"For getting a kiss from the strongest guy in the school, even though you were born the way you were."

Understanding what she meant, I nodded. "Greg," I muttered. "Well," I said in my normal voice, "if they try, they'll be the ones in for a surprise. But thanks for the heads-up. Now I can't wait for PE."

"How do you figure?" curious, Cait asked.

"Before, I had to dress and undress off in some corner away from the other girls." smiling, I replied. "If do they try something soon, it might just put me in with the others that much faster."

Cait gave me a hug. "Sorry for the way I acted before, cousin."

"We're not just cousins, Cait," hugging her back, I replied. "We're members of the new Problem Child Gang."

After hugging for a moment, we hurried to homeroom where I noticed all of the members of the new gang were seated together with Sarah Barns our homeroom teacher. As I sat down, I noticed a goth girl named Lilith Nightshade. She and I were not exactly friends but I admired her for the courage she always showed, not caring what others thought of her. I wondered how she would react to the news I was now a real girl. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw her look at me with a bit of surprise before a thin smile formed onto her face. "I guess she saw that kiss too." blushing a little, I thought.

"Welcome to East Shore High School, class." smiling, Sarah said. "For those who had not yet met me, I am Sarah Barns and I will be your homeroom teacher."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Homeroom.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
At the gym, I found a spot around the corner where I could change. I smiled, wondering how the other girls would react when they learned that I was now one of them, in body as well as mind.

For our first day, Coach had us play dodge-ball, to the groans of many. I focused mainly on the game, although I couldn't help noticing that Lilith Nightshade, the local goth girl, seemed particularly bothered by the net between her group and mine.

Then Cassie yelled, "Hey, Garth, check out your girlfriend!"

Before I knew what was happening, she and Amber pulled my shorts and panties down around my ankles.

I have superhuman speed. I can run over 300 miles per hour. I can hit somebody before he even sees me move. None of that does any good, however, if I am simply too stunned to think. I stood there, gradually absorbing the fact that every eye in the gym was focused on me and my nether regions.

Finally, Coach grabbed me by the hand and led me back to the locker room. Once there, she led me to where my clothes were, and asked, "When did this happen?"

"I... I... " I was still having trouble thinking.

"I've read your file, Lyssa," Coach continued. "I know that you were born a boy. How did you change?"

"My family," I finally said. "Sometimes it happens like... " I began to cry, as the enormity of what had just happened sank in. Two girls exposed me to the entire class.

"Get dressed, Lyssa," Coach said. "I'll take you to the principal's office."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: skip to P.E.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Still shivering and crying from the humiliation, I entered Principal Hendrick's office with the coach. The principal sighed and asked the coach to close the door.

"I was briefed by Alyssa's parents about her condition, coach Winston." serious, principal Hendrick said. "She has a rare genetic condition that reversed her gender over the summer, the hormone therapy sped it up." she passed coach Winston some papers. "I remind you that this is confidential information; Alyssa Vance is now as much a girl as you and I."

"Incredible." shaking her head, coach Winston said. "Well, during dodge-ball, Amber MacReady and Cassie Hamilton called everyone's attention to her, and pulled Alyssa's pants down, exposing her to the entire class." she sighed, adding, "I questioned her about her gender change and she fell apart."

"Winston!" annoyed, principal Hendrick snapped. "You know better than to push a student for personal information!"

"I apologize, Miss Vance." pouting slightly, Winston said. "I was out of line."

"Amber and Cassie were more out of line." sobbing slightly, I said. "You- You were just... concerned, I guess."

"Alyssa, I'm going to call your father and have him pick you up." gently, principal Hendricks said. "I promise those two girls who attacked you will hear from me."

"Thank you, ma'am." still sobbing, I said.

Principal Hendricks smiled. "I'm happy that your dream to become a real girl has come true, Alyssa." she said. "I hear you and Garth are already kissing."

I blushed brightly at that as she then turned to Winston. "Send Amber MacReady and Cassie Hamilton to my office the moment you get back to the gym." she said.

Winston nodded and left the room.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: At the principal's office

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Dad came to pick me up, with Sam riding along in his seat. When we got home, I helped Sam out of the car, and he touched my face. "Wet."

"I had a bad day, Sammy," I replied.

Dad said, "Lyssa, I'd like you to help me with Sam today, while I tend to my files." I may not be a mind-reader like Cait, but even I could tell he hoped Sam could help cheer me up.

I was in Sam's room, helping him play with his blocks, when Dad came to the door. "Lunch is ready."

Once I got to the kitchen, I saw that Dad was willing to do what he could to make me feel better: Tomato soup with cheddar Goldfish crackers and Italian seasoning. "Pizza soup."

Sam wasn't allowed to watch TV yet, so most of the early afternoon was spent playing with Sam, with one break to change a wet diaper and another for his naptime.

After school let out for the day, Beth came in. "Hey, sis. I got your homework for the rest of the day. And I brought somebody with me."

Garth peeked out from behind her. "Hi."

As much as Sam and Dad had helped my mood, Garth made it that much better. I went over and hugged him.

"Hello, Garth," Dad said. "Your parents know you're here?"

He nodded. "Mom says it's okay, long as I stay in the common areas." He turned to me. "My folks say they're sorry about what happened today."

"I'm doing better," I said. Then I whispered in his ear, "I had hoped that, when you saw me naked, we'd be the only ones in the room."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: At home.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
As we were talking, Sam came over and got my attention. "Di-di," he said as he pulled on my jeans.

"I can tell," I replied, my nose wrinkling from the smell. "Di-di" was his word for diaper.

We went to his room, and I put him up on the changing table, making sure to cover him with a fresh diaper while I changed him. "Pretty soon," I told him, "you'll need to start working on the potty."

"I wike di-di."

"Well, I'm sure you'd like a big-boy bed, and you need to be good on the potty to get one of those."

Once Sam was clean again and ready to go, we headed back to the living room, running into Dad on the way. "How soon 'til Sam starts potty-training?"

"We can start trying," Dad replied. "But it takes a while to learn. He wasn't born knowing how to hold it, any more than he was born knowing how to walk."

"How long does it take?"

"Beth took about six months. You took, I think, a couple weeks longer." He chuckled. "My sisters used to ask me what my secret was with you, since their boys took the better part of a year. Of course, I guess the secret turned out to be yours."

I sighed. I was not looking forward to spending a year arguing with Sam about the potty.

"By the way," Dad said, "you've got another visitor. Some girl dressed like Dracula's daughter."

"Sounds like Lilith. Wonder what she's here for?"

"One way to find out."

I went to the living room, and there she was, talking to Beth and Garth. The funny thing was, I could see daylight between the soles of her shoes and the ground.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Another visitor

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
As I reached the living room, I heard Beth say, "I didn't expect you to drop by, what brings you here?"

"I wanted to see how Lyssa's doing," I heard Lilith reply. "And I hoped I'd get some answers."

"Answers?" I asked, entering the room, I asked. "About what?"

"For a start, how did you change?" curious, Lilith asked. "I've never seen anything like it."

"It's a family trait," simply, I replied. "The same thing happened to an ancestor of mine."

"Okay," raising an eyebrow, Lilith said, "but what about the rest of you? It seems like a lot of the kids at school, and at least one of the teachers, are more than they appear to be."

"And how do you know that?" Tim asked.

"Because there's more to me than meets the eye, too," simply, Lilith replied. "I know there's something different about you because I can smell it. I got a concussion from my father beating me when I was a kid, and my senses have been cranked to 11 ever since."

Gar turned to Lilith and I knew he saw her hovering as I did. He opened his mouth to speak but I clapped my hand over my mouth, motioning him to remain silent.

"And you expect us to take your word for this?" Tim continued.

"There is more," Lilith admitted. "I know it sounds crazy, but I woke up this morning lying on the ceiling over my bed."

"That would explain it," Tim said.

"Explain what?" curious, Lilith asked.

I took her hand away from Gar's mouth and nodded. "Lilith," he said, "you're an inch off the floor."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Talking with Lilith

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Lilith looked down and gulped. "So, I am." her voice quivering, she said. "Do you guys have any idea why?"

Beth stood up, giving her a sympathetic look before touching my shoulder. "We'll help you find some answers, Lilith." gently, she said. "We were all scared, at first."

"I was changing back and forth from boy to girl for days before my gender stabilized." honestly, I said.

Lilith winced, I could tell she was uncertain. Garth, as if sensing her uncertainty, grew into a seven foot muscle bound giant before Lilith's eyes. She took a step back, fearful. "I was in the hospital, paralyzed with pain for days before my condition stabilized." in a deep voice, he said. he then shrank back down, adding, "Mine is due to something passed on by my mother so you could call it genetic as well."

Lilith relaxed a little but she still seemed worried. "Please, if you know something..." quietly, she begged.

"Are you familiar with the graphic novel series, 'The Problem Child Gang'?" serious, dad asked.

"Yes, it's my favorite book series." confused, Lilith said. "What does that have to do with..."

"That series was based on a true story." interrupting her dad said. "My wife was a member of that gang; as was Garth's father and mother."

"They made real enemies, Lilith." chiming in, Garth added. "Now, they are after us."

"Th-That was all real!?" stunned, Lilith asked.

"Yes." serious, dad replied. "If your parents were involved with this gang or its enemies, it is likely you will be a target as well so we need to get some answers and fast."

"I- I see...." shaking, Lilith. "I'd better talk to my mother right away."

Just then, Sam waddled in and spotted Lilith, hovering an inch above the floor. "Hewwo." smiling, he said. "Who you?"

"Sam, this is Lilith, a friend from school." patiently, I said. "She came to see how I was doing after school."

"Wiwith?" turning back to Lilith, Sam asked. "You can fwy?"

Lilith blushed at that. "I dunno, kid." still shaken, she replied. "I really haven't tried."

Then, to everyone's surprise, Sam rose above the floor, hovering at eye level to me before he giggled. "It easy, Wiwith." smiling, he said. "Twy it."

"Great." frowning, dad muttered. "I have a toddler who can fly."

Sam then touched Lilith's nose. "Tag!" giggling, he said. "You it!"

We all smiled slightly, seeing him waddle away, giggling. Only he was doing it in the air instead of on the floor. "Come here, you rascal." teasing, Lilith said. "I'm gonna get you..."

She began to playfully give chase in the air, walking in the air as Sam was. She tried to move faster to catch him but yelled in surprise as she suddenly took off into flight and hit the ceiling with a heavy thud before falling to the floor with a thud, more embarrassed than hurt. "Ow!"

Sam came down to the floor, looking worried. "You okay, Wiwith?" pouting, he asked. "I sowwy."

"Yeah, I think so." blushing slightly, Lilith replied.

"I think we better give your mother a call." frowning, dad said. I winced as he then turned to Sam. "No flying for now, okay?"

Sam pouted, tears flowing. "What I do?" hurt, he asked.

I sighed and took Sam into my arms as he began to cry. "He doesn't understand, dad." comforting my little brother, I said.

"We'll deal with that later." firmly, dad said. "Right now we need to see to our guest." he then handed Lilith the phone. "Call your mother... now."

Lilith took the phone and dialed home. "Mom, it's Lilith."

"Hi, honey. How are things going with your friend?" came the muffled response.

"She's doing okay, but something major has come up." Lilith took a deep breath. "Mom, I can fly."

There was a long pause before a muffled response came, "Y-you can fly?"

"Yes, I can. And there's a whole lot more. Could you come down here? And bring my Tarot?" Lilith gave her mom my address.

"I'll be right there, honey." came the response.

As Lilith hung up, Garth asked, "What's the Tarot for?"

"It'll give us a hint about what the future holds." looking at Garth, Lilith replied. "The key is understanding what the cards really mean." pausing, she added, "I use the Legacy deck, since I feel the pictures help me interpret the messages."

"You really believe that stuff?" curious, Garth asked.

"It works, Garth. Trust me on that."

"Somehow I don't doubt it." thinking of my own ancestry, I thought.

Beth asked, "You're not going to start telling us about long sea voyages and meeting tall, dark strangers, are you?"

"You've been seeing too many movies, Beth. You'll do as much work interpreting the messages as I will."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: continue.

choices: she has Lilith read her cards.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Minutes later, a soft but firm knock was heard at the door and mom answered. As the door opened, I got a strong scent of a expensive perfume. I turned to see our visitor, I assumed was Lilith's mom, knell down to hug Mrs Vance as if they were old friends. "That's odd, mom never told me that she knew Lilith's mom." curious, I thought. "They act like they've known each other for years."

"It's been too long, Madam Vague." releasing her, mom said. "I'm honored that you bring light to my home."

"The honor is mine, dear child." rising to her feet, Lilith's mom, calling herself Madame Vague, said. "When Lilith told me the address, I knew it was your family and the family of your friends she was concerned for." she then teared up. "I am truly sorry I was too late to save you from the wrath of Clarence Mayweather..."

"You saved me from bleeding to death on the side of the road, Madam Vague." tearing up with her, mom said. "I owe you my life, still today."

"Mom?" my voice shaking, Lilith asked. "You know Mrs Vance?"

"Why yes; I do." turning to her, Madame Vague said. "She had called herself Heather 'Hawkeye' as a member of the Problem Child Gang, twenty years ago."

"But... you- you were just a- a kid then too." stammering, Lilith said. "Please mom, what is going on?"

I threw Beth a questioning look but she merely shrugged. "I'm just as lost as you are." whispering, she said.

Madame Vague smiled and casually walked over to her daughter. "The cards will explain everything, Lilith." showing her a Tarot card deck, she said. "Place your trust in the wisdom of the Mystics."

"Mom, those aren't my cards." confused and frightened, Lilith said.

"No, my dear." still smiling, Madame Vague replied. "Your cards are in your hands." shocked, Lilith looked and saw that she was holding her Legacy deck then turned back to her mom as she said, "These are mine."

With that, she threw the cards into the air and they flew about with a fluttering sound as they shuffled themselves before lining up in the air as if they were being stacked onto a table. Once done, they were all shown face down, no matter which side you looked at, ready to be read and shown to all. Everyone's jaws dropped in shock, including my own. Lilith, looking more shocked than the rest of us, lost her grip on the deck she was holding and they fell from her hands. Mom alone was smiling Lilith's Tarot cards, like her mom's shuffled themselves in the air then lined themselves up before her.

"That's a neat trick." stunned, I thought. then a thought hit me and I turned pale. "Madame Vague... she was the mysterious gypsy girl who gave advice to the Problem Child Gang!"

"Not the most graceful cast, my dear." amused, Madame Vague said. "Still, you are just beginning to learn."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Enter Madame Vague.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Draw a card, Lilith Nightshade," her mother instructed.

Lilith drew the topmost card on my deck, which proved to be the Tower. "A major event," she explained to me and the others. "It will shatter what has come before, to make room for something new."

Madame Vague nodded. "You are wondering about your new powers, and how I shuffled my deck in the air. You have known for some time that you are not like the others. It is time that you learned your destiny." leaning close, she said. "Lilith Nightshade, you are a witch, like your mother before you."

Lilith looked at her mom stunned. "A-a witch?"

"I guess her tower hit hard." wincing, I thought.

Madame Vague nodded again. "Our powers are not quite so grand as popular fiction would suggest. However, if enough of us were to gather, we could accomplish great things."

She turned her attention to me. "For instance, twelve witches once encountered a young man who, more than anything, wanted to be female. Can you guess what happened?"

I swallowed hard. "Th-they turned Iolaus into Iole?" then I thought, "Now my tower hit hard."

"Precisely." Madam Vague turned back to Lilith. "This morning, after you left for school, I dug out my Tarot, and drew the Judgement card. Do you know what that signifies?"

"There was a call that you should heed." nodding, Lilith replied.

"Yes. Always trust in the cards, daughter." darkly Madame Vague said. "I disregarded their warnings once, when I was attracted to my first husband. As a penalty, I was denied my powers, until today. That is why I could not protect us from his wrath."

"Why does Mrs. Vance keep calling you Madame Vague?" asked Lilith.

"I know..." still stunned, I thought.

Lilith's mom smiled. "Her expectations were formed by old movies, where the fortune teller could lay out exactly what was to come. When I could only say things like 'There is conflict coming,' or 'The current situation will change,' she started calling me Madame Vague, much as you would call someone who told you what you already knew Captain Obvious."

"About the cards," Lilith said. "Dad's always so secretive about his job, so I tried asking the cards what he does. Whenever I do, though, I keep drawing the Death card. What does it mean?"

As she spoke, she drew another card from her floating deck. Instead of Death, though, she drew the Moon card. Seeing it, I had no idea what it meant but, seeing Madame Vague's expression, I had a feeling it going to be a major shock.

"If he ever learned about this, it would mean the death of us both." serious, Madame Vague said. she took a deep breath. "Lilith, you drew the Death card because your father is dead. My first husband is not your father."

"Oh boy...." turning pale, I thought.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: she has Lilith read her cards.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Who- Who was my father?" looking pale, Lilith asked.

"Your father was Dr Thomas Vague." gently, her mom replied. "I found it fitting that Sarah called me 'Madam Vague' as, in a way, it honored his memory."

"Why don't you ever talk about him?" curious, Lilith asked. "I have a right to know..."

"It is a long story but I will try to explain." sadly, Madame Vague said. she took a breath and turned a card, revealing the High Priestess. "Twenty years ago, I was an ordinary sixteen year old girl. I was looking forward to graduating high school and moving on to college. Only, two men stormed my house and tried to take me by force. I ran out of the house, not daring to look back but I knew they were on my tail."

"Who were they?" concerned, Garth asked.

"I don't know." shaking her head, Vague said. "I managed to lose them just outside of Fallen Heroes Cemetery on the edge of town where I found a number of people in dark robes gathered around a fire among the tombstones."

"Creepy." shivering, I muttered.

"It turned out to be a coven of witches." said Vague, softly. "A young woman among them approached me and smiled...."

"Welcome, Madeline Wallace." the woman said. "I have been expecting you."

Madeline, terrified and out of breath, took a step back. "Yo- You know who I am?"

The woman smiled then threw a number of cards into the air. They shuffled on their own then lined themselves in the air. "The cards never lie." serious, she said. "My time in this world is coming to a close but your time is just beginning."

Madeline took another step back. "What do you want from me?" almost crying, she asked. "Has everyone gone crazy!?"

"You are in no danger, Madeline Wallace." said the other cloaked people. "Come...."

Madeline found herself slowly walking forward, though her mind screamed to run away. Once she was before them, staring into the camp fire, the young woman walked up and placed her hands onto Madeline's shoulders, staring into her eyes as the others formed a circle around them. They all began to chant with Madeline reciting it with them, though she had never heard it before. As they did, a light, glowing mist bellowed from the woman's mouth and entered Madeline's mouth, causing them both to glow with an eerie light. Madeline stared in horror as the woman became older and older before her eyes. Finally, the chanting stopped and the once young woman was not nothing more than dust, blowing in the light wind.

"What... happened?" trembling with terror, Madeline asked.

"Our sister has passed to the next realm." solemnly, one of the cloaked figures replied. "She had no children to pass her power onto so she has chosen and entrusted you to to be that daughter she never had."

"Her knowledge, her wisdom, and her power is now your own." added a second hooded figure. "Use your gifts wisely." she then smiled. "Welcome to the coven sisterhood."
.............................................

Vague wiped the tears from her eye. "I had lost my mother when I was young and watched a woman who had chosen me as a daughter she never had die before my eyes." emotionally, she said. "I had vowed make her proud."

"Woah..." awestruck, I whispered.

Vague nodded. "My first husband, Darren, and I fell in love quickly and did not consult the cards before marrying him." looking slightly ashamed, she said. "That brings us to Dr Thomas Vague." she paused to force a smile. "He was our family doctor and always defended me when he could."

"What happened, mom." taking in every word, Lilith asked.

"One night, Darren had beat me senseless and left to get even more drunk. I called Dr Vague and he came over to tend to my wounds." her smile vanishing, Vague replied. "As he was treating me, Darren returned, found the two of us together, and went into a rage. He mortally wounded Dr Vague with his hunting knife." she cried freely. "That was when I had enough and used my magick on him. One punch sent him through the closed door, across the hall, and through the wall into the room beyond."

"Mom... one punch!?" her eyes widening to saucers, Lilith asked. "That could have killed him..."

"I learned that magick can not kill." almost regretful, Vague said. "Still, to this day, he fears me when I become angry." she sighed. "I then turned my attention onto Dr Vague and consulted the cards to find a way to save him."

"You didn't find a way, though." sadly, Lilith said.

"No, I didn't." shaking her head, Vague replied. "But I did find a way to help him carry on."

"You made love to him as he died?" stunned, I asked.

"I honored his last request as a debt of honor, Lilith." sternly, mom replied. "He wanted... a family. I had intended to 'introduce' you to him once Darren's visitation rights were officially revoked next week, Lilith."

For a moment, Lilith did not respond, none of us did. We were all still soaking everything in. Finally, a small smile slowly formed onto Lilith's face. "My dad sounds like an incredible man." dreamily, she whispered.

Vague smiled. "He was." she then turned to mom. "The Agency may be after my daughter and I for my involvement with the Problem Child Gang twenty years ago."

"It's possible." admitted mom. "You did help us in your own mysterious ways."

"Want to join the new gang?" offering my hand to Lilith, I asked.

Lilith turned to the cards, causing me to frown slightly, before she turned back to me. "Sure."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: continue.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Shortly after my friends had left, I heard the doorbell ring. "Who could it be now?" curious, I thought out loud.

I walked down the stairs to the living room and smiled upon seeing Cait and Clem. "Hey, guys," smiling, I said. then I noticed Cait's new wig. "Wow, Cait. With that new color, you look a lot like me."

Cait smiled. "That's why I picked it out. How you doing, cuz?"

"A lot better," hugging her, I replied. Turning to Clem, I added, "I had quite a day today."

"So I hear," Clem replied. "What all happened?"

"Chief Jones and his men took down that guy who was going to shoot at us. Turns out he was Clarence Mayweather, one of the guys the original Problem Child Gang tangled with."

"We have quite the history," sighing, mom said. "He was the one who put me in this chair, trying to kill me."

"After that," blushing slightly, I continued, "I got my first kiss from Garth."

"Congratulations," Clem said. "But you didn't get sent home because of a kiss."

My expression turned serious. "A couple girls at school got jealous of all the attention I was getting, so they pulled my pants down in P.E. Don't worry, they've been punished."

That morning, mom seemed very quiet. She only did this when something was seriously wrong. I asked her about it but she told me that it was nothing for me to worry about. I asked Beth if she knew anything but she was just as much in the dark as I was. "Something happened, Beth." worried, I said. "Did you ask your spirit guide, Beatriz if she knew anything?"

"I did but Beatriz would only say that history repeats when no one listens." shaking her head, Beth replied. "With the history of our family and the rest of the gang, that could mean anything."

"We'd better keep our eyes open for anything, then." trying to sound confident, I said. "Two of our houses have already been attacked and we know two others are being watched."

Beth nodded. "Clem said that he saw a black van outside his house." softly, she said. "Then Megan mentioned that she saw a black van in the parking lot of the hospital while she was there."

"This is getting serious, sis." gulping, I said. "Watch yourself at school, okay?"

"You too." fearful, Beth said.

She and I exchanged a quick hug before we headed out for school. "See you this afternoon, mom." giving her a kiss, I said. "Is Sam still in bed?"

Mom sighed and pointed up. I looked and giggled, seeing Sam sleeping on the ceiling. Beth saw him as well and laughed. "Hey, Sammy!" loudly, she called.

Sam let out a small shriek for fright before falling down into mom's arms. "Morning, sleepy head." cooing, mom said. "You can't be sleeping on the ceiling, okay?"

"It comfy." rubbing his eyes, Sam protested.

Mom sighed then turned to Beth and I. "Be careful going to school, girls." softly, she said. "We will be packing when you get back."

"What, packing?" worried, I asked. "Mom, what's wrong?"

"We are not taking any chances, Alyssa." serious, mom replied. "We are all moving to the SUB station until further notice, end of discussion."

Taken back by mom's tone, I asked. "What about the mansion headquarters?"

Mom teared up and rolled away from us, taking Sam with her. It was then, I had a feeling what had happened and it was hitting mom hard. I took a step to comfort her but Beth pulled me back. "I have a feeling she needs her space right now." sadly, she said. "We'll dig for answers at school."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Morning woes.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
In homeroom at school, I noticed that Gar seemed on edge about something. That was proof enough for me that something drastic had happened. Judging by how upset mom got when I mentioned the old mansion headquarters, I deduced that it was the mansion was hit. Thus the need to move to the SUB station as it was not mentioned in the graphic novels. "The Agency is getting bolder." worried, I thought.

The first two classes went remarkably smooth and I gradually began to relax. When third period P.E. came around, all the girls in the class piled into the girls' locker room. I was about to head around the corner, as I always had, but one of the girls stopped me.

"We've got extra lockers here, Lyssa." smiling, she said. "Why not join us?"

"You sure?" surprised, I asked.

"Why not?" pulling me out of the corner, the girl countered. "After all, you're as much a girl as any of us."

"Yeah," said another, greeting me. "And if Bitch one and Bitch two don't like it when they get back..." she placed a hand onto her hip. "...that's their problem."

I smiled, feeling my confidence rising, and found a vacant locker. "I suppose none of us are going to see anything we don't already have." looking at the other girls, I said.

"I wouldn't go that far," Lilith replied. "I mean, so far, I'm the only girl in the locker room with a third nipple."

Whatever tension there was left in the room dissipated in the laughter...

At lunch, still worried about what was going on, I decided to visit Lilith's table where she was talking to her two goth friends, Julie and Mel. "Hi, Lilith. Can I ask you something?" nervous, I asked. "I mean, private?"

"Hi, Lyssa. It's okay, you can trust Julie and Mel." motioning to her two friends, Lilith said. "They've been my friends forever. They introduced me to goth."

I sat down next to Lilith. "Can you really see the future with your cards?" looking at her, I asked.

"They've never steered me wrong," confidently, Lilith replied. "I've misinterpreted once or twice, but they've never lied."

"What do they see for me and Garth?" trying not to sound like I was fishing, I asked.

Lilith smiled then shuffled her cards under the table. I guessed it was so nobody would see the cards flying around on their own. "I'll do a three-card spread," bringing up the cards, she explained. "This first card will represent you." she turned the card over. "The Empress. She symbolizes abundance, creation, and fertility."

I swallowed hard. "My ancestor had 14 children. I seem to be taking after her."

Lilith nodded. "Well, this card means you probably won't need medical help when you decide to have children." smiling, she said. "However, if you don't want to get pregnant, you'll need to take matters into your own hands."

I watched as Lilith then turned over a card, she stated was for Garth. "Strength. The big cats symbolize the practical, assertive, or even aggressive side of his nature." pointing at the card, Lilith explained. "The woman signifies a strong feminine influence. Under her guidance, he finds a peace and power he's never imagined."

The last card, I guessed, represented Garth and my future together. "The Ten of Cups. The dog and cat symbolize unconditional love." looking at me, Lilith said. "The blazing hearth symbolizes warmth, comfort, and safety. The ten chalices represent the emotions and relationships that will bring you to this place."

I smiled, feeling a sense of relief. "So, things will work out between us."

"If that's what he wants."

We all turned when Mel spoke. "When Mom found out she was pregnant, my dad said he was heading out for a carton of cigarettes. That's the last anyone saw or heard from him."

Lilith winced and I guessed she did not know that about her friend. "I'm sorry, Mel." softly, she said.

Mel sighed. "It's really hurt with the cancer." tearing up, she said. "Mom said my college fund was eaten up by my medical bills. I don't know what I'm going to do when I finish high school."

"How much do you need?" came a feminine voice.

Nobody expected Cait Spencer to show up at our table. "What did you say?" surprised, Mel asked.

"What sort of schooling did you want after high school?" Cait replied. "Find out how much it'll cost, and I'll pay for it. I didn't mean to interrupt, but I came to tell Lyssa something, and I couldn't help overhearing."

"I couldn't do that," Mel said. "I'd never be able to pay you back."

"Please," was Cait's reply. "Do you know how many millions I'd have to give you before I started to feel it? Don't worry about the money. I've learned it's like fertilizer: Spread it around, and beautiful things come to light. Keep it in one place, and everyone knows where you live, but everybody thinks you stink."

We were all floored by Cait's generosity.

"What did you want to tell me?" breaking the silence, I asked.

"Oh. You're not going to believe this, but Amber McReady wants to see both of us after school." turning to me, Cait replied.

"What? What does she want to see me for?" surprised, I asked. "Did she say?"

"She didn't say. Don't worry, though." serious, Cait replied. "She knows we're cousins, and she knows I won't let anything happen to you, if I can stop it."

Lilith gave us both a questioning look then turned to her Tarot deck. I could tell she could sense something but it was impossible to tell what it was. Then I heard Beatriz whispering in my mind as she said...

"Amber is experiencing her ancestry."

Hearing that, I had a good idea why Amber wanted to see us, I just hoped I was wrong. After school...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Go to school.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
After school, Cait had James drive her, Lilith and I to Amber's house. "Please wait here in case I need you." firmly but kindly, Cait said. "I have a bad feeling about this."

"Yes ma'am." fingering his sidearm, James replied. "I will be ready."

"If you had a bad feeling about this, why are we here?" curious, I asked.

"I have a bad feeling Amber is in trouble, not us." frowning, Cait replied.

Lilith shuddered. "I'm feeling it now." producing her Tarot card deck, she said. "I have a bad feeling Amber is not alone in there."

Then a scream was heard from inside, it was Amber's but it seemed strange somehow. Cait ran forward and thrust her hand outward; an invisible force reduced the door to splinters. We all ran inside to find a man kicking and punching Amber all around the living room with her vainly struggling against him. Acting quickly, Lilith pulled a card from her deck. "Knight of Swords, defend Amber McReady!" tossing the card into the air, she commanded.

There was a puff of smoke and a knight on a horse appeared on the front lawn before it took off after a black van with tinted windows. "What..." puzzled, she whispered.

"You commanded the knight to defend Amber McReady!" her eyes widening, Cait said. "That's not her!"

Suddenly the man stopped attacking the girl and landed a punch onto Cait, sending her stumbling as the girl suddenly went after me! She threw a series of fast kicks and chops, forcing me onto the defensive as his attacks were in too quick of succession for me to use my super speed. All I could do was dodge and back away, looking for room to move as the unknown girl kept kicking at my legs, getting a lot of hits in, making it hard to keep my balance. I made a mental note to thank dad for his martial arts lessons as, otherwise, I would not have had any chance at all.

While I was fighting the unknown girl, I was too preoccupied to notice Cait's driver turn onto Lilith with a wet cloth but I could smell chloroform, making me panic. "Shit, they must have hit Amber when she called!" frightened and angry, I thought. "They were expecting us and set a trap!"

This made me very worried for Amber as I struggled to save myself but then I noticed, through a window, a man in medieval armor walk into view with Amber and slam a heavy fist onto a man's head. He was wearing a chauffeur's uniform but he was not the man who had driven us to Amber's house. "It was a trap..." my blood boiling, I thought. "And this... girl is working for them!"

That was when I lost it and began to send a fury of kicks and punches of my own but at a speed much faster than the other girl could follow. My legs were bruised and sore from all the hits they got from her but I was still able to force her into the wall where I began to pummel her with enough rapid kicks to every part of her body, pinning her to the wall, literally sending her into convulsions. I was not using my full strength as I did not want to kill her but I kept her pinned to the wall with the sheer force of my mad counter attack as to send a clear message that this girl won't take getting attacked laying down.

This went on for only a few seconds before I head Lilith scream, "Lyssa, that's enough! She's had it!"

I stopped a few seconds after hearing her and watched as the girl slowly slumped to the floor, softly moaning in pain. "I wasn't hitting her hard." limping towards Lilith, I protested. "The first thing she attacked was my legs, I couldn't kick with my full strength if I tried right now."

Turning to Cait, I smiled, shaking my head. She had a rueful smile on her face as she stood over the man who had attacked her. He was sitting on the floor, babbling happily like a newborn baby.

"Their trying to weaken us." fearful, Lilith mussed. "I had to use two cards at once to protect Amber and myself."

Turning back to Lilith, my jaw dropped in shock. "Is that... Amber!?" stunned, I asked.

"I'm afraid so." wincing, Lilith replied. "She's hoping we can help her figure out what's causing this." she then quickly added, "There's more, James was not our driver. It was someone else and he managed to get close, too close, without any of us realizing it."

"This is not good." shaking her head, Cait said. "We can't stay here." she then turned to Amber. "I'm afraid you will have to come with us."

"How are we going to get to... where ever we are going?" curious, Amber asked.

Suddenly, she moaned slightly then sighed as her body changed back into a girl before their eyes. "I'm back..." relief in her voice, she said. "I'm beautiful again."

Cait sighed then pulled out her cellphone and dialed a number. A moment later, someone picked up. As it was on speakerphone, we all heard James' voice. "James here..." in a strained voice, he said.

"James. are you okay, you're not injured or anything?" urgently, Cait asked.

"Just a bump on the head." after a moan, James replied. "Where are you, are you okay?"

"We're fine but we need pick up, bring the fastest car you can snag." she gave the address.

"I'm on my way."

After she ended the call, Lilith turned to Amber. "This is not over." firmly but kindly, she said as I pulled out my cellphone and dialed Ted Jones' number. "Those goons will be back and, for whatever reason, they want you as badly as they want us."

Amber gulped. "But why!?" trembling, she asked. "What do I have anyone could possibly want!?"

"That is what we have to figure out." seriously, Lilith replied.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: a visit to Amber's house.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
We didn't have to stand around long before a familiar police cruiser pulled up. Cait was clearly surprised. "I thought James was a fast driver, Chief."

"I'm sure he is," Ted replied. "But this car goes much faster than anything else on the street. What's going on, girls?"

"The Agency came after Amber McReady," Lilith said. "They had agents disguised as Amber and James."

"Why would they be after you, Miss McReady?" turning to her, Ted asked.

"I don't know," she replied. "But that's not the weirdest thing to happen to me today." She took a deep breath and swallowed. "For a few hours, I was a boy. I was hoping Lyssa could explain it, but I'm me again, so I guess I don't need to worry."

"Guess again." ruefully, I said. "When I started changing, I changed back and forth, too."

Amber looked worried. "But... that doesn't mean it'll happen to me. Right?"

"Amber," Cait said, "how's your bra feel?"

Amber was puzzled by the question, then looked down and grabbed her breasts. "What's happening?"

"Your breasts are smaller," sighing, I said. "As I became a girl, my breasts grew. The opposite seems to be happening to you."

"Why is this happening?" tearing up, Amber asked. "What did you do to me?"

"None of us did anything," serious, Lilith said. "The seeds for this were sown long ago, and I don't know how to find the answers."

"Maybe Beth can," after a thought, I said. "I'll ask her."

"That will have to wait," Ted inserted. "If Amber is at risk, we need to take action to protect her." turning to Amber, he said, "Call your parents, collect anything you'll need. I'll need to bring you to the S.U.B. Station."

As other police officers arrived on the scene, Ted urged Amber to call her parents. "They are not going to believe me." frowning, she muttered. "What am I going to do?"

"Leave that to me." a familiar voice replied.

We all turned to find Madame Vague. "Where did she come from!?" Vague gently taking Amber's phone from her. "May I?"

Amber nodded, dumbfounded as Vague then dialed a number. A few rings later, a woman answered. "Amber?"

"Blessed be, sister Tonya." gently, mom said. "Our mutual enemies have targeted Amber and tried to kidnap her; my daughter and her friends foiled the attempt."

A muffled response came from the phone. I could not hear what was said but Amber's mother sounded understandably upset.

"Be at peace, Tonya." calmly, Vague said. "Amber is just fine but Tex feels we should move her to the substation for her own protection." after a pause, she added, "She is showing the signs of becoming a guardian."

"A what!?" confused, I thought. "What is a guardian?"

"She's just started, from what I can see." eying Amber, Vague said to a muffled response. she then gave Lilith a glance and began to talk in a language I did not recognize.

"Not very sporting of you, Madame Vague." frowning, I thought.

After ending the call, Vague turned to Ted who was returning from the house. From the look on his face, I knew that the three who had attacked us were already long gone. "It was Vendetta and Psyche." with a growl, he said. "They both got away but we have their flunky."

"Vendetta and Psyche?" curious, I thought. then I remembered the two named were mentioned a few times in the graphic novels. "They must have powers like our own."

"He won't talk, Ted." softly, Vague warned.

"I know, Madame Vague." frowning deeper, Ted replied. "Its not like the old days where we can scare what we want out of those we catch, I have to follow the letter of the law."

Twenty minutes later, we all arrived at the substation with Amber, who was still shaken by the sudden darkness when Lilith used the moon card to get us there. "It took me by surprise as well." urging Amber out of mom's car, she said. "Welcome to the Subterranean Urban Base station."

"It really existed!?" startled, Amber asked. "Does that mean..."

"Chief Jones was Tex the mighty." serious, Lilith replied. "All of it was real, including the Agency, who attacked you today."

"How did your mom know my mother?" still rattled, Amber asked. "Is there anything else I should know about?"

"Actually, there is." walking into view, Mrs Jones said.

I turned to find her walking towards us with Garth and Grace following, leading a short and thin thirteen year old boy with longish sand blond hair and green eyes. "Who is this?" curious, I thought.

"Blessed be, Mrs Jones and family." kindly, Lilith said. "Who is your new friend?"

Heather smiled. "Everyone, I'd like you to meet the newest member of our family." motioning to the small boy, she said. "This is Tim Jones, he was an orphan from Europe."

"I sense you were in the hands of the Agency." serious, Lilith said.

"He was but he was not brainwashed." cutting in, Cait said. "His mind is free."

"That and I have already met him." smiling, mom said. "He has the strange power to make anything he draws come to life."

"Why didn't we meet him earlier?" confused, Lilith asked.

"I bet he was too shy or too nervous." seeing the boy's sheepish smile, I thought.

"Because, child," patiently, Vague replied, "he was too scared to come out."

"We convinced him you were all cool." placing a firm hand onto his shoulder, Garth chimed in. "These are my friends, little bro, you couldn't be in safer hands."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Ted Jones arrives.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Welcome to the S.U.B. Station, Tim," Lilith said, holding out a hand. "My name's Lilith."

"Hi," he replied, shaking her hand. "If Mr. Jones had said there were pretty girls like you here, I might have made my presence known sooner."

"Cool your jets, bro," Grace told him. "Lilith isn't into guys."

"So, you can bring your drawings to life?" Lilith asked, brushing off the attempted flirting. "I can call up the figures from my Tarot cards. That sounds similar."

"Not exactly," Tim replied. "My drawings actually move on the page. And I can actually become them. Want a demonstration?"

We all nodded eagerly.

He opened his sketchbook and stopped on one page. "Say hello to... "

Having super speed somehow allowed me to see things moving fast with greater ease. I was surprised to see dozens of pieces of paper surrounding and reforming Tim's body into a different form. In what was the blink of an eye to others, A tall woman appeared where Tim once stood. "... Amazona, Princess of Power!" finishing his line, the woman said."

I held back a giggle as this Amazon was six feet tall, with breasts that looked like she was smuggling basketballs under her skin tight costume. "Is he kidding?" amused, I thought.

Lilith snorted. "Yeah, you came up with that one."

"What do you mean?" confused, the 'woman' asked.

"If you try moving around off the printed page," Lilith explained, "those bazongas are going to be more of a hindrance than a help. They block your field of vision, they'll restrict your arm movement, and they'll make you fall over the second your back isn't straight."

"Told ya, Tim," Grace added.

Madame Vague, I noticed as doing well to stifle a giggle of her own. She caught my eye and winked at me. "This child has little to no experience with real women." carefully, she whispered. "He will need guidance."

The woman, Amazona, tried moving around, and quickly saw that we weren't joking. "I see your point, younglings," she said. "I am sure the artist sees it, too."

"Huh?"

"Tim doesn't just change physically," Garth explained. "The characters he creates come alive as he envisions them. So you're really talking to a character in a comic book."

Amazona touched the paper again, and a sheepish Tim stood before us. "Thanks for the advice," he said. "I'll definitely redesign her before I call on her again."

"You do that," Grace said. "And, please, stop making her costume rip in strategic places in battle."

I giggled, hoping no one had heard me.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Talking to Tim

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Tim's lips trembled slightly, tears forming. "There, there, Tim." cooing him, I said. "No one is mad at you."

"Not at all." roughing Tim's hair, Grace said. "Just give the female characters you make some dignity, okay?"

Tim sniffed at little but managed a smile. "O- Okay." he said.

"Good boy." smiling, Vague said. she turned to the others. "Lilith and I need to have a word with Amber before her mother arrives with her husband."

As Lilith and Madame Vague walked off to another room with Amber, Cait rose a hand to her head as if she suddenly got hit with a headache. "What's wrong?" concerned, I asked.

"I just got a vision." worried, Cait said. "It's my uncle Crecatous, dad's bother."

I did not know Cait's uncle, she had never spoken about him before this. That only increased my worry as I could see Cait seemed very shaken. "What about him?" worried, I asked. "Is he okay?"

Cait began to cry, something I had never seen her do before. "They attacked his house...." tearfully, she said. "The Agency... they invaded his home, his kids are on the run." after a moment of looking into the distance, she suddenly announced, "I have to go."

With that, she vanished from sight. That made me panic as I thought of my own family, still at home and I ran at my top speed down the makeshift roads, knowing they moved everywhere under the city. "I have to get to them, bring them to the substation before they are hit." worried, I said.

Fortunately, there were signs that told me where I was under the city and stopped at small lift elevator that carried me to the surface. I was very surprised to find myself rising up inside an old payphone that never seemed to work. Only I was more worried about my family and I ran to my house to find that the front door had been kicked open. "I'm too late!" running inside, I thought.

Dad was busy fighting two men at once with his martial arts while Sam was screaming in fright crawling along the ceiling, away from a man trying to catch him. Mom was on the floor, her wheelchair knocked over, trying her best to fight off a man who was trying to force a cloth over her nose and mouth.

"Get away from my family!" screaming, I demanded.

I then hit a button on a necklace dad had given me for emergencies then jumped the man attacking my mother with a series of kicks and chops, hoping help would arrive soon...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Trouble at home.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
After a grueling ten minutes of fighting what seemed like an endless number of home invaders, a bight light suddenly flashed in the house. When the light faded, I was overjoyed to see my friends and Ted Jones standing in the living room with us. "Everyone, pick an opponent," Ted commanded.

"You must be the troublemaker from before," said one, closing in on Lilith.

"Just stand still, missy," said the other. "We'll make this short and painless."

"Lyssa!" grabbing my arms, dad called. "Machine gun kick!"

The machine gun kick was an attack dad dreamed up to make use of my super speed. I had used it on the girl who had attacked me earlier and, as dad swung me around the four men surrounding us, I used it again, kicking the bad guys dozens of times as I passed each person, sending them to the floor, moaning, unable to cause us any further trouble.

"Where is Beth?" looking around, I asked. "What happened to her!?"

I heard a scream and turned just in time to see a man literally flying out of Beth's bedroom before slamming into the wall and slide to the floor unmoving. The ghostly figure of a tall and muscular woman stepped out behind him then turned in my direction. It was Beatriz, Beth's spirit guide! She smiled, winking at me, before vanishing from sight as a shaken Beth walked out into the hall.

"Are you okay, sis?" worried, I asked.

"Define okay." tearing up, Beth said. "Our home is being invaded..."

"I brought some help." motioning to the fight in the living room, I said.

"Pick up brass!" called one of the Agents. They all activated devices on their wrists and disappeared, leaving the house in shambles and a small pile of ruined weapons.

I was trying to help mom back into her wheel chair when Amber walked up and offered his hand. I accepted and the two of us managed to get mom Mom back into her seat while Sam came down. He was shaken, still crying, but otherwise unharmed.

"Everybody okay?" Lilith called.

"Looks that way," Ted said. "Hey, we scored a bonus. When these guns were chopped, it must have damaged whatever lets them teleport. We can finally get a look at their tech."

"They sent someone disguised as me," rubbing my hand, I said. "Her problem was, she moved too slowly. A few dozen punches per second, and she didn't see them coming." then I thought, "Thank goodness Sam can tell the real me from a faker."

I then turned my attention to the former Amber. "Thanks for the help, Amber. Though it sounds funny calling you that at the moment."

"I suppose I'll think of something," shrugging, 'Amber' said. "I guess I'm finding out what life was like for you, huh? Sorry I was such a pain."

"Like they say, what doesn't kill me makes me stronger," shrugging, I replied. I then gave Amber a hug. "Thanks again."

"You're welcome." smiling, Amber said. he paused. "Boy, you smell nice."

"Uh, thanks, but I already have a boyfriend." blushing, I said.

"Whoa," breaking the hug, Amber said. "Guess I've got a lot to get used to."

"Attention, everyone," Ted called. "Given the current situation, we think it's best that we all relocate to the S.U.B. Station until things blow over."

"We've got the phone tree started," serious, mom added. "So, for those of you already at the station, you're all going to have company."

Amber's cell phone rang, and he checked it. "Cassie," she said. "We usually get together about this time, but I'm not at my house. And if she went there, she's probably seen what a wreck it is."

"Let me talk to her," Ted said. "Hello? Hello, Cassie, this is Chief Jones. Yes, we're aware of what happened at Amber's house. She and her family are safe, and they've been relocated. I'll see that she gets your call, and I'm sure that she'll return it as soon as possible. Just remember that she's going through a lot right now. More than you know. Alright. Goodbye." He returned Amber's phone to him.

"Thanks," Amber said. "Now I just have to figure out how to explain all this to her. When I change back, it won't be all the way. Who knows what I'll look or sound like?"

"Maybe start with texting," Lilith suggested. "Let her know as much as you're comfortable with. She will need to know what's happening to you, though. If you were to keep it secret from her, she'd want to know where her friend went, and where this guy came from."

"It's okay, Sam." cooing my little brother, I whispered. "The bad guys are gone."

Sam sniffled a little. "De wuined my icecweam." pouting, she mumbled. "Tupid bad guys..."

I shared a smile with mom...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Help arrives.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Vague's Moon card brought us all back to the S.U.B. Station. "Where day go?" Sam asked.

"We're underground, sweetie," wincing, mom replied. "We'll be here until things are brought somewhat back to normal."

"As normal as they get for us, anyway," Lilith added.

"No wike," Sam said.

"We're not here because we want to be, Sam," looking at him, I said. "We're here because being up there isn't very safe right now."

"Let's pick out where we'll be living until things die down," dad said.

I followed as dad pushed mom along with Sam sitting on her lap. "This was originally built as an emergency headquarters in case the mansion was hit." softly, mom said. "I never thought we would ever have to use it."

"Be thankful its here and not directly mentioned in any of the books." looking around, dad said. "Otherwise, we would have no safe place to go."

Finally, we stopped at a small group of offices that had been refitted for living quarters. "This place will do." sighing, dad said. "Its fairly clear of dust, good for Sam."

Mom took the wheels of her wheelchair and pushed herself through the door. "It's handicap friendly too." with a sigh of her own, she said. "We should be right at home."

She began to sob with dad comforting her. "Don't worry, mom." coming closer, I said. "You guys beat them before and we will beat them again."

"We didn't finish the job." sobbing, mom said. "Now, they're back and after you kids and here I sit... a..."

"Don't say it!" hugging mom, I cried. "Don't say that word!" I sighed. "You were great then and you are great now, don't you forget it!"

Mom managed a slight smile. "Thanks... I needed that."

"Why don't you go catch up with the rest of your team." serious, dad said. "Your mom and I can set everything up here."

I really did not want to leave them after mom's short breakdown but I left and soon caught up with the others and told them where we were setting up our living quarters. Lilith seemed relieved that we were on the other side of the station. I could not blame her, who would want to be too near to the smell of diapers.

The next group to arrive was Susan and her family. "Everybody OK?" Mr Tanner asked.

"A few of us are shaken up," Lilith replied, taking the opportunity to hug Susan, "but nobody's hurt. From what I've seen, we've got plenty of space."

"We'll need it," Susan said. "You know that Asian girl who just started at our school?"

"Narrow face, close-set eyes, high cheekbones, doesn't talk to anybody?"

Susan nodded. "Her name's Mindy Saotome. Dad's done some checking, and he thinks she and I might be related. Apparently, her maternal grandmother and my paternal grandfather were brother and sister."

"Not the best circumstances for a family reunion," Mr Tanner said, "but they'll have to do."

"I'll need to think of some way to explain this to Mel and Julie," Lilith said.

"Whatever brings them down here," Ted said. "It's a cinch the Agency will come after them, too."

Looking beyond us, Lilith asked, "Who's that?"

Ted looked. "Looks like the Rodgers family, and they've got somebody with them. Not to worry; we figured we'd need to accommodate a lot of people, and we've got the space."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Exodus to the substation.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"Long time no see, David." shaking Mr Rogers' hand, Ted said. "I just wish it was under better times." he then motioned to the boy. "I see you have added a new member to your family."

"This is Alex, our second born." surprising everyone, Mr Rogers said. "He has the same ability to change reality as Christina and I only he had no power over it."

"What do you mean?" concerned, Gar asked. "Was his power out of control?"

"He has the power to literally become an added member to any family with that family never aware he was an intruder as, to them, he was always one of them." serious, Mr Rogers said. "My wife and I have the same power, we used it to infiltrate the criminal element when we helped the Problem Child Gang back in the day."

"Poor Alex was literally jumping from family to family, blacking out each time before entering and leaving." with a sad look, Mrs Rogers said. "He never had any memory of being a part of those families he visited but he remembered everything about them, now knowing why."

"Poor kid." wincing, I thought. "That had to have been driving him crazy."

"That had to be maddening." wincing, Gar said.

"We managed to stabilize his power and changed reality so he was always and will always be our son." touching Alex's shoulder, Mr Rogers said. he then sighed. "The reality holding him to his family had corrupted after years of constantly jumping around, they no longer know who he is."

"That literally made him an orphan." tearing up, I thought. "I'm glad he found his way to their family and they had the heart to adopt him."

"That's terrible!" stunned, Lilith said. she then paused. "Wait, why don't any of us know him as always being your son, Mr Rogers?"

"Because, with your powers, you or Beth, or Caitlin would have seen through the reality change and suspected Alex as an intruder." serious, Mr Rogers said. "We exempted you and the others from the reality change so there will be no doubts that Alex is our son."

"Well, in that case, welcome to the substation, Alex." extending my hand, Gar said.

Alex smiled. "Thanks."

Just then, my phone buzzed and I quietly stepped back to answer. It was mom. "We need you come back to the rooms we picked out, Alyssa." quickly, she said. "Beth is freaking out."

"Why?" worried, I whispered. "What happened?"

"Her ability to see spirits has apparently grown stronger." worried, mom replied. "We need you to keep an eye on Sam while we try to help her."

"That sounds more like something Lilith or Cait could help with." worried, I thought. then I said, "Okay, mom. I'm on my way."

After I ended the call, I quietly informed Mrs Jones where I was going and why then silently slipped away, as dad had taught me and ran off to meet with mom and dad.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: continue.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
I got to where we were staying. Mom, Dad, and Beth were still there. Beth was very pale, like all the blood had rushed away from her face. "You okay, Beth?"

"I don't know," she replied. "I've started seeing ghosts."

"Is it real bad?"

She shivered. "I was talking to one of my friends, and I saw her grandfather walk up to her. I told her she had a guest, but she couldn't see him. When I said who it was, she couldn't understand why I was talking like that. Then she got called to the principal's office." She started sniffling. "Her grandpa died, and she had to hear about it from me."

Dad went to hug her. "It'll be okay, hon," he said. "Let's us go somewhere and talk about it."

As they left, Beth asked, "Did you know three people died digging this place?"

"No, dear," Mom said.

"They're still walking around down here."

With that, the three of them went off, and I got to look after Sam.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Seeing Beth.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
I sat down next to Sam who seemed just as worried about Beth as I was. "Issa, is Beth okay?" touching my hand, he asked. "She say she sees ghosts."

"Beth can see and hear things we can't and that scares her a little." wincing, I said. "Mom had a power like that, so she is trying to help her."

"Mom could see ghosts?" trying to understand, Sam asked.

"Well, I don't know about ghosts but mom could see, hear, smell, and taste better than anyone." smiling, I replied. "She used all of her intense senses to keep up with the Problem Child Gang."

"Oh." making a confused look, Sam said. "Can mom hear that hum?"

"Hum?" curious, I asked. "What hum?"

"It coming from there." pointing in one direction, Sam said. "Sounds like daddy's car."

"It sounds like a car?" turning to where Sam pointed, I asked.

Suddenly, Sam rose off the ground and began to fly in that direction. "I wanna see what it is."

"No you don't , Sam!" firmly, I said. "Get back here now!"

"Come with me." tugging on my hand, Sam said. "I wanna see."

"We will tell mom and dad about the hum and they will check it out." pulling Sam down into my arms, I said. "You don't need to be flying off on your own."

Sam pouted. "But Issa..." whining, he said. "I wanna see."

"The answer is no." firmly, I said.

Sam sighed then.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Taking care of Sam

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
I sighed as Sam began to cry and wail, flaying his arms around in a full tantrum. "I wanna see!" crying, he yelled. "Why won't you wet me!?"

Trying to reason with a two year old while having a tantrum was not easy. Still, I managed to keep my cool and smiled at him. "Stop crying and I will tell you." calmly, I said.

Sam stopped crying for a moment and looked at me, curious. "At least I got his attention." pausing, I thought. "I wonder how mom deals with him."

"Why won't you wet me see?" pouting, Sam demanded.

"Because I have to keep you safe." calmly, I replied. "That humming may be something bad and you don't want to go near anything bad, do you?"

Sam pouted more. "No." reluctantly, he said. "But the hum no stop, it a-no-yang."

I giggled at Sam's attempt to say 'annoying'. "Is it still humming?" smiling, I asked. Sam nodded. "Then it will not hurt you to wait until mom and dad get back and check it out."

Unknown to me, Beth was sitting on a bench with mom and dad a few halls away when she suddenly lifted her head, startled. "What was that!?" she asked.

Mom listened carefully and gasped. "It sounds like... machinery." whispering, she said. "But it has a strange pitch, almost like a jet engine."

Dad listened but shook his head. "I don't hear anything." whispering himself, he said. he then placed a hand against the wall for a moment. "The wall is shaking very slightly but that might be from the traffic high above us."

"I'm hearing voices." shivering, Beth whispered. "Their coming from the closed off area." she pointed to an unfinished tunnel, adding, "Maybe twenty or thirty yards in but I don't see anything."

"Stay here with your mother." serious, dad said. "I'll check it out."

"You- You shouldn't go alone." frightened, Beth said. "Let me go with you."

"Then who will look after your mom?" turning to Beth, dad asked. he managed a smile. "Don't forget, I am very capable of defending myself."

Beth stepped forward to give dad a hug but screamed as the floor beneath her gave way, sending her falling into a vertical shaft! She heard dad yell her name before she broke though some dirt to find herself free falling in a much larger tunnel. She screamed again but gasped as something stopped her quick descent and slowly lowered her to the floor. "Th-Thank you." not knowing who she was thanking, she said. "Who are you?"

"I am Xenophon." replied a deep voice. "You may call me Zen, if you find it easier."

Beth looked around her, hoping to see her rescuer but froze in a stunned state of awe upon seeing what only could have been described as a massive alien ship! It was V shaped, heavily damaged from what she could see, but she could not determine its true size. Much of it was buried and she guessed it had slammed into the Earth centuries ago. "Is... Was that your ship, Zen?" gulping, she asked.

"It was." flatly, Zen replied. "I am what you might call an artificial intelligence, the ships computer."

"Well, thank you for saving me." shaking, Beth said. "I better try to get back to my family."

"There is no safe way for your frail form to return to the tunnels above you." in an even tone, Zen said. "I suggest you make use of the teleportation unit two hundred and eighty feet ahead of you."

Beth look forward and saw what looked like a long open tube with glowing lights on the top and bottom of it, looking like something from a science fiction movie. Only, between her and the tube were literally hundreds of ghostly alien forms. She gulped, not knowing what to do.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: The hum.

choices: Meanwhile, back with Lyssa and Sam...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
"What are they?" Beth asked. "Are they going to hurt me?"

"There are no lifeforms between you and the teleportation unit," Zen replied.

Beth hugged herself. "Oh, God, I'm seeing alien ghosts."

One of the creatures moved up to her and made a series of noises.

Beth shook her head. "S-sorry, I don't understand your language, a-and Zen doesn't know you're here."

The alien stared at her for a while. Beth guessed that, even if he didn't understand her, he got the gist of what she'd said.

Then, to Beth's surprise, he placed two of what his race had for hands on either side of her face, and plunged his head through hers.

Beth screamed in horror, as her mind flooded with sounds and images, perhaps the alien's dying moments. When the alien's head pulled out of hers again, she collapsed in a heap.


When she opened her eyes again, she checked her watch, and saw that she'd been unconscious for less than five minutes.

"Are you well?" said a voice that was strange yet familiar.

Beth looked up, and saw the alien standing over her. "I hope I did not injure you."

"I'm fine," she said as she stood up. "But I can understand you now."

"I regret that what happened to you was necessary," the alien said. "But you are the first sentient we have encountered since our discorporation, and it was necessary that we communicate."

"I understand. What do you need to tell me?"

"We are bound here, my crewmates and I. We cannot be released until our ship is unbound."

"Something about the ship holds your spirits here?"

"Yes," the alien replied, "and we desire only to move on."

Beth nodded. "Three humans who worked above this ship are also ghosts. Perhaps what holds you here holds them, as well."

"Can you free us?"

"When I return to where I came from, I will tell others, and we will try to help all of you. However, it will take some time."

The alien sighed. "Time, human, is one thing we have in great supply."

With that, Beth made her way to the teleporter. "Energize."

"I do not understand," Zen replied.

"Sorry. It's a reference to part of Earth culture. Send me back up."

Something shimmered around her, and her view of the wrecked spacecraft was replaced with the S.U.B. Station.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: continue Beth's POV.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Mom and dad both jumped when I appeared in the tunnel with them. "Beth, what happened?" worried, mom asked. "Are you alright, dear?"

"I'm fine, just shaken." quickly, I replied. "Dad, there is crashed an alien ship down there!"

Mom and dad both seemed shocked. "What!?"

"Are you certain?" looking at me, dad asked.

"Yes, I'm certain." firmly, I said. "An alien ghost reached out to me, something is keeping them connected to the ship." pausing, I added, the same thing must be keeping the ghosts of those two workers down here."

"It must have crashed here centuries ago." thoughtful, mom said. "Pieces of it must have been scattered for miles around when it hit...." her voice trailed off as if a thought had suddenly entered her mind. All the color ran from her face as she then whispered, "Something out of this world... Shit! That's what he meant!"

Without another word, mom began to roll herself down the tunnel as quickly as she could push herself along, muttering to herself. Dad and I exchanged a worried glance and hurried after her. "Mom, what's wrong, where are you going?" worried, I asked.

"If you want to find out, push me so I can get there faster." panting, mom replied.

Dad took a hold of the chair and started pushing her with me following. "Where to?" he asked.

"To the main hall, I need to talk to Geo, Ted, and Sam." serious, mom said. "I know what Sykes was after all this time."

"You think he was after that spaceship I found?" startled, I asked.

"I'll explain everything once we get everyone here together." quickly, mom said. "Why don't you be a dear and go get Lyssa and Sam."

I sighed then ran off down another tunnel.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Beth talks to her parents

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
I was about at my wits' end dealing with Sam's incessant curiosity, when Beth came into the room. "C'mon, you two," she said, "Mom wants us all."

"Good timing, Beth," I replied. "Sam hears this humming sound, and he insists on checking it out."

"I did that, little brother," she said to Sam. "It's an alien ship, and it's underneath the station."

"What?" I could hardly believe it. "A spaceship, underground? And it still works?"

"I was just there. Not only does it still have power, but something about it captures dead spirits. The crew is still down there, just like those workers I told you about."

"Beth, this is huge!"

"Don't I know it. That thing is hundreds of years old. And Mom thinks it's what Sykes has been after all this time."

"I wanna go!" Sam demanded.

"Take it up with Mom and Dad," Beth replied. "Right now, Mom wants everyone down here together."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: continue Lyssa's POV.

choices: We disobey and go to the surface.
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Upon rolling into the main room, mom declared, "Delay whatever you are planning, all of you! My daughter, Beth has discovered new evidence that changes the game!"

"What did Beth find?" curious, Garth asked.

"An alien ship." panting, Beth replied. "It must have crashed here centuries ago."

"I always found it strange that, when we recovered something Sykes had stolen, he never went after it again, he targeted something else." serious, Sarah said. "What was also strange was that he repeatedly said he was after something out of this world."

"He's after the technology the ship offers." turning pale, Garth said.

Lilith threw her cards into the air, waited for them to shuffle, then drew a card. "The tower." muttering, she said. she drew a second card. "The Earth." she drew a third and gulped. "Death..."

"Every decision we make from here on in will be critical." serious, Madam Vague said. "From what my daughter has read in the cards, this will change the world but not all will see its conclusion."

"I do not believe in fate." appearing in the room with his daughter, Susan, Geo said. "We forge our own destiny through the choices we make." he sighed. "However, yes, I agree every move will be critical and thus must be carefully planned."

"Where is Steve?" worried, Sarah asked. "He needs to know this too."

"He's with our daughter at CHILD headquarters." stepping up, Mrs Connors said. "He called me a few hours ago, tell me they had an interest in our daughter."

"Have you heard from him since then?" serious, I asked.

Mrs Connors teared up, shaking her head. "No and I'm worried." softly, she said.

Garth bit down onto his lip, thinking. "We'll have to change our strategy." finally, he said. "Beth, can you take us back to the spaceship you found?"

"I fell through the floor in the unfinished tunnel." shaken, Beth replied. "I was teleported back by Zen."

"Zen? Who is Zen?" curious, Geo asked.

"The ship's artificial intelligent computer." serious, Beth replied. "It led me to a teleportation unit that brought me back to the tunnel with mom and dad."

"A teleporter that could take us straight to CHILD." serious, Garth said.

"That might be like placing your hand into a hornets nest, Gar." warning me, dad said. "Those people do not like uninvited guests and they do not play games."
