"One of us has to make the first move." serious, Garth countered. "I suggest a small away team go to CHILD and see what they want with us."

"How much information would you share with them?" raising an eyebrow, Geo asked. "Would you or those you select for this away team be able to hold their own under an interrogation?"

"I trust this CHILD about as far as I can kick them." ice in his tone, dad said. "They will use any means necessary to obtain their goals and, so long as the greater good is done, they do not care who gets hurt or killed in the process."

"I will go alone." darkly, Garth said. "Those who wish to join me may but understand the dangers involved." he turned to his father and frowned. "Its not my first choice to deal with them either but if Sykes has alien tech at his disposal, we are going to need some outside help to deal with him."

"Its happening all over again." sighing, dad said. he turned to Geo. "We may have to come out of retirement, old friend."

Geo nodded. "Indeed." serious, he said.

Garth turned, hearing voices, to find two boys and a girl entering the room. He nodded at them.

"They must be Cait's cousins, she mentioned." Seeing them, I thought.

I then returned my focus to the conversation as detective Flynn spoke. "I will go with you, Gar." calmly, he said. "I cleaned Blitzkrieg's clock before, I can certainly do it again."

"I will go as well." firmly but kindly, Madam Vague said. "I have a lot of clout in many places, not to mention a few tricks up my sleeve, they will listen to me."

"I'll go with you." offering, Tim said. "They kidnapped me..."

"We are not going to them to start a pissing match." firmly but kindly, Garth said. "You stay here."

Then, Annette politely cleared her throat and we all turned to them. "Ah, Annette, Damien." motioning them closer, Cait said. "Meet the rest of the gang."

"These are two of the three you told us about?" calmly, Garth asked.

"Garth, these are my cousins, Annette, Damien, and Amadeus." introducing them, Cait said. "Annette and Damien both have the ability to grow and shrink but the trigger is a bit unusual." she then turned to Amadeus. "Their bother, Amadeus has the power to do anything as if he were trained to do so all his life, though he's a bit reckless."

"So I heard." nodding at them, Garth said. "I have super strength and endurance." He motioned to the others... "My sister, Grace, total recall; my brother, Tim, paper manipulation; Alyssa Vance, super speed; Bethany Vance, psychic spiritual guide... "

"I can sort of talk to ghosts." shrugging, Beth said. "Its complicated." she then giggled seeing a toddler boy walking passed above them. "Come down, you rascal!" the boy giggled as Beth pulled him down by his arms. "This is my brother, Sam. He has the power to fly but being only two..."

"I can imagine." giggling, Annette said.

Garth nodded then continued. "Clem Rodgers, shape shifting; Susan Tanner, ghost powers and ninja training; Lilith Nightshade, magical powers and mystic wisdom." motioning to the others, he said. "We have two other members but they are in the hands of CHILD.

"Travis Greenway, who is an Animancer and Megan Connors who is a Technomancer." turning to Annette, Cait said. "We suspect CHILD took them after the first day of school."

"Animancer... Technomancer?" confused, Damien asked.

"Who is this CHILD?" serious, Amadeus asked.

"An Animancer is a person who can shift shape into any form of animal, including Anthros like Minotaurs or Centaurs." serious, Cait replied. "A Technomancer has the psychic power over machines, making them work on their own within the limits of their design."

"Can she change into machines?" curious, Damien asked.

"Not without seriously injuring herself." wincing, Beth replied. "Even without that, her power is impressive, hence why we think CHILD wants them."

"I don't doubt it." stunned, Annette said. "We have quite an arsenal of power here." she winced, asking, "Are you planning a rescue mission?"

"Well, new evidence has us thinking that even our power may not be enough." softly, Ted Jones said. "The Agency has people under their control who have powers like our own, they are a greater threat now than when we faced then twenty years ago."

"What of Sykes?" curious, Amadeus asked. "Was he not the greatest adversary of the Problem Child Gang when they were active?"

Before anyone could answer, a number of alarms sounded, startling everyone in the room. "What was that?" startled, Beth asked.

Ted turned to a table and hit a button, causing a large screen television to rise from the floor. It came on, showing camera images all over the city. One showed a number of strange hovering platforms, moving into the center of the city. He hit another button, filling the screen with that image. What they saw was Sykes and a number of his followers on five strange floating platforms, firing what looked like sci-fi laser rifles at random buildings. Dad focused the camera image on a man on the lead platform before a low growl echoed from his throat. The man was tall with longish brown hair and piercing green eyes. He was wearing oddly ancient leather armor as he held a laser rifle of his own while holding the hilt of a sword at his side.

"Sykes!" anger in his voice, he said. "He's returned and he is attacking the city!"

"But why!?" angry as well, Garth asked. "What could he possibly gain by..."

"Bait." flatly, Geo said. "He's trying to draw us into the open."

"What- What are we going to do?" worried, Lyssa asked.

"We'll handle this." serious, Ted said. "Its us he wants."

"Not alone, you're not!" firmly, Garth said. "We are the new Problem Child Gang."

"You are a bunch of kids with no real experience in taking down criminals!" snapping, Ted countered. "All of you will stay here!" he then turned to Tim. "I need you, however, to come with me."

Tim gulped. "Me?" surprised, he asked.

Dad nodded. "I'll explain on the way to the surface." serious, he said. he then turned to the other parents and nodded before leaving the room with them following.

As I watched them leave, I realized I was facing my first real command decision....
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: The meeting

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Before I could utter a word, I head the screech of breaks followed by the voice of Garth's father outside the main entrance! "Garth, Grace! Get in the car; NOW!"

We all rushed out through the front entrance of the mall to find Chief Jones outside a strange looking grey four door car. Right behind him, mom stopped with a strange white car! She honked her horn and frantically waved us to her! "Hurry, kids!" Urgency in her voice, she screamed. "Run!"

We all ran for our parent's cars with Caitlin behind us! She breathed a sigh of relief seeing a black limousine with a tall dark figure holding the back door open. "Please, Miss Spencer!" Firmly, he urged, time is short!"

"Everyone knows where to go!" Firmly, Chief Jones barked. "Move! Move! Move!"

I jumped into the front seat while Beth hopped into the back. The second the doors were closed, mom floored the accelerator and we were off like a rocket! Chief Jones drove towards the Forefather's bridge while mom raced towards Settler's Airport. Glancing in the passenger's rear view mirror, I saw Caitlin's limo racing down the old back roads behind Our Founder's mall.

"What's going on, mom?!" Worried, Beth demanded.

"It's what I, we all feared from the start, kids!" Racing down the street, mom replied. "The Agency has discovered your talents!" She sobbed slightly. "I will not lose you to them!"

Beth and I exchanged startled looks before Beth looked out the back window and gasped. "We have company!" Startled, she announced.

I looked back to find an ominous black four door car chasing after us on the empty road leading to the airport. "That's them!" Her voice quivering, mom yelled. "Everyone hang on! We'll be in the clear shortly!"

"In the clear?" Confused, I asked.

Mom smiled before saying, "I was always good at escapes."

As if on cue, a plane swooped down over them and made heavy contact with the roof of the car! In the next breath, we were air-born, flying way out of the reach of the pursuing car!

Mom smiled as she picked up a a CB mike. "Nice timing, Frank!" Calmly, she said. "It's a good thing we all still keep in touch."

"I only wish I could have been there with you all in the beginning." Dad responded through the radio.

"You are one of us now." Smiling, mom replied. "You know where we have to go."

"Where are we going, mom?" Worried, I asked.

Mom smiled at me. "We are going to a place we called..."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Mom arrives in a strange car.

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Mom smiled at me. "We are going to a place we called the fort." Sadly, mom said. "You two will be taking Sam to the clubhouse where you will wait for your father and I to come back for you."

"What?!" Surprised, I asked. "You're just going to leave us?!"

"Just until we finish what we started." Touching my cheek, mom said. "I will be the eyes and ears of the group like I was in the beginning."

"Mom, we can help!" Tearing up, I said. "No one is faster than I and Beth..."

"Sam needs your protection." Firmly, mom interrupted.

She pressed a button on the dashboard, causing the roof of the car to slide open. I watched in disbelief as a lift raised her into the plane holding the car. Shortly after, the lift came back down with Sam sleeping soundly in a car seat.

"You have two minutes to get into the driver's seat, young lady." Scolding, mom said. "I hope you were paying attention when dad gave you those driving lessons last year."

My eyes widened as the roof of the car closed. Moving in a blur, I secured Sam into the front passenger seat then took my place behind the wheel of the car. "Hang on, Beth!" Frightened, I yelled, I think we're about to get dropped off, literally!"

Beth gripped the seat belt that was fastened around her as the plane swooped down towards Nowhere, an abandoned addition to Waterfront City that was standing over an abandoned coal mine. The plane came close to the ground before the car was released. Beth and I screamed as I struggled with the steering wheel before bringing the car to a stop right in front of the coal mine entrance. The plane flew back up heading towards the dense forests of New York state.

"What a rush!" Shaking, I breathed.

I turned to check if Sam was alright. He was still fast asleep; typical. I turned to look at Beth; she was unharmed but just as shaken as I felt. I jumped when my cellphone then rang and quickly answered. "How could you just leave us here?!" Distraught, I demanded. "We want to help!"

"There is a remote control in the glove compartment, Alyssa." Firmly, mom responded. "Press the button; everything will become clear then." Dad then ended the call.

Frustrated, I tossed my cellphone onto the dashboard and threw open the glove compartment. I found the remote; it was a garage opener. Curiosity raising above my anger, I pressed the button and found the boards covering the entrance to the coal mine open like a garage door. "Woah..."

Turning on the headlights, I drove in with the door closing behind us. The road before us spiraled down into the mine but at a gentle slope. Upon reaching the bottom, we found ourselves in a small parking lot where we stopped the car. "I don't believe it!" Whispering, I said. "The clubhouse was not a mansion in the woods like the comics depicted. The clubhouse is really..."
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: Dropped off!

1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.content:
Still shaken, I stepped out of the car and looked about. "I don't see any doors." Worried, I said. "Beth, what do you see with your clairvoyance?"

Beth stepped out of the car and looked around. "There is a control panel inside a little nook in the wall behind you." Presently, she said. "Let me get Sam and we'll check it out."

As Beth got Sam from the car, I walked over to the wall and found the small nook that held a keypad inside. I began hitting numbers at blinding speed, trying every combination I could think of. Within a minute, I hit the right code which was ironically my birth date. A beep was heard and a panel opened revealing a key lock.

"Perfect!" Sarcastically, I said. I turned to Beth. "Do you know how to pick a lock?"

Beth sighed. "I can try."

She began to hand Sam over to me when he woke up. He sleepily looked at me then smiled. "Mommy told me to give dis to you Issa." Tiredly, he said. In his tiny hand was a key on a chain. "She said it let you in."

I took the key as Beth continued to hold him and pushed it into the lock. With one turn, the lock clicked and I pulled it out. The instant I did, a section of the wall moved and we walked into a large circular room with passageways leading in practically every direction. Upon looking at it, I recognized it from the graphic comic book series. "This is the maze hall." Almost whispering, I said. "Every passage leads to a different part of the clubhouse." I sighed, turning to Beth. "I can either run through each passage and hope to get lucky and not get lost or we can rely on your clairvoyance."

Beth winced. "Either way its a gamble." Softly, she said. "I have not really put my senses to the test outside of contacting our ancestors. Also, if you get lost in those tunnels..."

I bit my lip, wondering what to do...
1521212122111222211112122221112211221111.title: An underground lair.

15212121221112222111121222212.content:
I stayed up crying for a few hours; wondering just how much my decision to be a girl had affect my relationship with dad. On top of all that, I'd deprived Sam of an older brother to look up to. But then I told myself that Dad was right; I had to become a girl to be happy, I was miserable as a boy.


I eventually went to bed around 11:00; so exhausted that I didn't wake up until 9:30 the next morning.
15212121221112222111121222212.title: Next morning

153.content:
My name is Alex Winter. It's short for Alexander, but don't be surprised if people called me "Alexandria".

Seriously, it's true. I live in a town near Los Angeles Calfifornia, around the San Franando Valley. I'm 13 years old and currently attending middle school with my friends.

One of the things that people have picked on me about is my rather odd appearance. I am male, I assure you that. However, my body frame is rather small, and my face is, for lack of a better word, "delicate" in appearance. Often at times, people will treat me like a girl, even though I don't act like one.

Bullies often do it to me, and some girls get in on it as well. My friends and family, thankfully, support me. I'm very much grateful for their support.

As for my appearance, I have short strawberry-blonde hair, blue eyes, about 5'7 in height. I'm not a twig by any means, just a little underdeveloped for a male my age. Puberty has been a little slow for me, that's all.

I have a younger brother and sister, and two parents. All normal for a family. My siblings often tease me a bit on my appearance as well, but it's mostly just good fun and I can laugh with them about it.

However, often one things disturbs me, my family, and friends. I often have these black-outs, and nobody knows why they happen. To the doctors, I'm perfectly healthy. It hasn't been a huge concern, but I often wonder. Another thing that the school has seemed to notice is that I somehow disappear when there's trouble around. This has also lead to some memory lapses for me. Kind of much to take in, I know.

Do I disappear? I'm not sure. It's kind of maddening when you think of it.

Anyway, little did I know what was to happen. A lot of the other students call me a 'problem child' as I seem to know a lot about their personal lives.. too much for comfort, so I hear. It never made sense to me. Nor did I realize that all of this would change me, both figuratively and literally, in a sense.

And it all started with what I saw next:
153.title: Alex Winter

1531.content:
Today was September 15, just a few weeks after school started. Lunch had began and I ate my lunch with my friends at our usual table. However, after I finished, I excused myself, needing to clear my head. Luckily, my friends didn't judge me by how odd I acted. They accepted me, faults and all.

"What would I do without them," I laughed to myself, as I took a small walk around the school. Lunch time lasted quite a while so I was in good shape for now.

"Now, if only I could solve my memory issues," I whispered to ymself. Truth be told, there was something else that bugged me. I would often have these wierd dreams, knowing stuff about people that I shouldn't know. It was so wierd. For example, there was this one girl from a year back who still collects dolls at her age. I actually told her about that, and she was shocked at how someone would know this secret about her.

Needless to say, I stayed away from her and neglected to tell mostly others about it. However, I sometimes had a tendency to speak out about something I learned. That's why most people find me a bit creepy, because I know things about them I shouldn't.

"What could it be?" I asked myself. However, something grabbed my attention instantly.

"Leave me alone!" yelled a small feminine voice. I turned to my left and looked out over a corner, near the school doors. There was a little girl there, probably around 10 years old. With her, there was a big guy, possibly my age or older. However, he seemed to be picking on the poor girl, grabbing her hair and laughing it off. I really didn't like seeing such injustice. That girl likely had a parent nearby who was briefly busy.

I knew that I should help her, but what can I do? I'm not very strong, but how can I leave this girl alone with a bully like him? My heart told me to go, but my brain had other ideas. However, the heart was winning. I couldn't just stand there and watch the girl get hurt. With some courage (and an odd force welling within me), I slowly approached them both.

They both were too busy to notice or hear me as I approached. I began to extend my hand out, ready to tap the bully on the shoulder and tell him to back off. As I approached them, a small wave of dust seemed to swirl in front of me. Suddenly, I felt a little nauseated, and my vision began to blur. Bad time to come down with something, but I continued onward.

I reached out and grabbed the bully's shoulder, before my world went dark.

*****Change*****

"Hey, back off my sister!" I yelled at the bully and turned him around to face me. I was mad right now. How dare he pick on a little girl, let alone my sister?

"Alex!" yelled Tania, and she ran behind me while I covered her.

"Oh, we were just having some harmless fun" said the boy, nonchalantly. I resisted the urge to kick him in his you-know-whats.

"Just stay away. Don't come near her again" I said as calmly as I could, moving a lock of my long blonde hair out of my face.

"Whatever" said the boy and he walked away. I scowled at him, but my face softened as I looked at Tania.

"Are you ok? Why did you walk away from Mom?" I asked her. By the way, my name is Alexandria Morrow, 17 years old and a high school senior. My school had a teacher work day today so myself and Mom brought Tania, who's in elementary school, here to see the sights. This also allowed Mom to talk to someone here about some urgent matters.

"I'm sorry" said Tania sincerely. I smiled and hugged my little sis. Right now, I'm currently wearing a blue tank top with regular jeans and shoes. My waist-length blonde hair felt down my back unhindered.

"It's alright. Let's go to the car. Mom's waiting for us" I told her.

I grabbed her hand and we began walking together.
1531.title: Little girl getting bullied

choices: You feel like going with the family (change again)
15312.content:
"Can we get McDonalds for lunch, please?" asked Tania. I rolled my eyes and giggled a bit. Tania was so addicted to fast food now.

"Tania, we had fast food a couple days ago. Keep eating that stuff and you'll get fat" I giggled at her. Tania stuck her tongue out at me.

"Yeah right. You eat more than I do and no one says you're fat" retorted Tania.

"Well, I'm an adult" I said with a smile.

"Well, when I'm older, I'm going to eat anything that I want" declared Tania. I outright laughed at that, and gave her a small tickling for that. We both enjoyed a good laugh at how silly we were acting. It was so refrshing afer getting that mean bully away from her. A job well done, I'd say.

As soon as I thought that, a brief flash of dust crossed my vision as I blacked out.

*****Change*****

"Ugh, what happened?" I said to myself as I woke to find myself on the grass outside the school. I slowly got up and looked myself over. I seemed to be my normal self as usual. Did I have another back out?

"Guess I did" I said to myself. I somehow blacked out and ended up in this patch of grass. Another odd chapter of my life. Suddenly, I heard a womanly voice.

"Tania! Melissa! Let's go!" yelled the woman. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw two girls walk up to the woman. One was an older girl who looked like a high school senior. Man, she was pretty! The other girl was...

"Wait! That's the girl who I saw was..." you muttered to yourself. It was the little girl who you was getting bullied. As you mulled this over, the two girls happened to glance at you and they smiled, to your confusion. Then, you saw the older girl motion for you to come over. You were confused but walked over anyway.

"This is the boy who saved Tania from that bully. The bully knocked him out pretty hard, but that distracted him enough for me to get Tania" explained Melissa. The woman looked at me.

"Thank you very much for your help. Who knows what could have happened to Tania" said the woman. You blushed at all the attention you were getting. It felt nice, but a little embaressing. You then felt even more so when Melissa bent over and gave you a small peck on the check in thanks.

'I don't really have a clue as to what I did, but I guess I'm glad I did it' you thought, feeling happy for the first time in a while.

What's next?
15312.title: Along the way there

153121.content:
As the school day went on, you felt glad that you helped that little girl, even though you didn't really remember it at all.

"Oh well. At least something good came out of it this time" you said to yourself with a smile.

Anyway, school went on as usual. You went to your usual classes and weren't bugged for once by your strange blackouts. You didn't seem to suffer anymore through out the school day.

After the final bell rang, you said good bye to your friends at school before walking home.

"Glad I was able to help that girl" you said to yourself.

Your thoughts turned to her older sister, who you had to admit was pretty hot. You smiled to yourself while thinking about her, thinking about how beautiful she was.

As your mind fantasied about her, you were so focused on a woman like her that your shoes will giving way to her flip flops and your feet were shrinking into hers, dust beginning to fly around them as it happened. However, something felt odd and you shook your head and the changes reverted quickly, completely escaping your notice.

"That got a little wierd" you said to yourself as you kept walking.
153121.title: After School

1531211.content:
Looking at your watch, you saw that you had plenty of time before your parents got home. They would be coming home late tonight, and your siblings didn't get home for some time.

"Guess I can have a little fun to myself" you smiled to yourself. You were feeling a little more confident right now, although the looming sense of dread was still firm in your mind.

Anyway, you turned a corner and began walking towards the center of town. It wasn't that busy, so it was easy to walk through. You looked through the various stores and restaurants that were in the area.

"So many places to go" you muttered to yourself.

While the thought of the girl from earlier kept you company, you couldn't shake the feeling that something huge was going to happen. Something really big.

Eventually, what happened?
1531211.title: End up walking through town

15312111.content:
Wanting to get the days events off your head, you decided to take that walk around town. It was a nice and pleasant afternoon after all, and you enjoyed just walking around and looking from shop to shop.

"I wonder if anything interesting is going on around here." you wondered to yourself.

You passed by many restaurants and other places, each of them looking pretty appetizing right now. However, you knew that you would be having dinner sometime soon, so you figured that you shouldn't bother.

However, you did end up coming up to the nearby movie theater. It was decently crowded, but not too bad. You could get in if you really wanted to. However, you weren't sure about trying to do that. You just hoped that you wouldn't have any blackouts soon.

That being said, taking a brief look around the theater won't kill anybody, and you could just play in the arcade if you wanted to. With that in mind, you decided to walk into the theater.

What do you see inside?
15312111.title: Stopped at the movies

153121111.content:
"Alex, snap out of it!" snapping her fingers, a young woman said, firmly. "I've been looking for you all over town, you really need to focus more."

I looked around, as if lost then turned to face a tall and slender young woman with long strawberry blond hair and gentle blue eyes. "Mo- Mom!?" surprised, I asked. "What happened....?"

"You blacked out." more softly, mom replied. "You were almost in a trance." she sighed. "I admit you are getting better at phasing in and out but you need to keep your head together when you do."

"I'm sorry, mom." confused, I said. "What are you talking about?"

"You honestly don't know?" surprised, mom asked. she looked at me for a moment, thinking, then took a firm hold of my hand. "Come on, I'm taking you home."

"Am I in trouble?" worried, I asked.

Mom sighed. "No but we do need to have a serious talk about your blackouts." pulling me along, she said. "Your father and I want you to be able to enter the family business soon."

Now I was even more concerned. "Family business?"
153121111.title: A worried teenager/young adult

1531211111.content:
Eventually, you and Molly, your mom, arrived back home. It appeared as though your dad, Tyler, had yet to come home.

"So what are you talking about?" you asked as you and Molly got situated into the family room.

"Well, you know those blackouts you've been having?" she asked.

"Yes." you nodded.

"I have that ability, as does your dad." said Molly, causing you to gasp.

"What? How can that be?" you asked.

"Our family has been capable of phasing in and out of people's lives as a way to help them out. You've noticed that no one has any recollection of you specifically when you become someone else, right? We help them deal with any problems, be they social, financial, or the like." explained Molly.

"And I can do that too?" you asked.

"Yes, although you could use some more practice. Once you do, it's quite the lucrative lifestyle." smiled Molly.

You overall weren't too sure though.
1531211111.title: Mom explains at home.

15312111111.content:
Eventually, you got home with Molly, and your dad, Tyler, soon arrived home as well. Everything was explained, and your dad was accepting of it too.

"So you both can do this?" you asked.

"Yes. There are some restrictions though. I can't become anyone younger than me." said Molly. "And your father prefers not going into any woman."

"True enough." smiled Tyler.

"However, you seem to be able to get along well with girls. You seem to have a gift with that." smiled Molly. You blushed a bit, not sure where to go with that.

"Anyway, we'd like you to learn the art better. Once you do, you could possibly even do an adult at your age." said Molly.

"You'll also have to train your siblings some time, so there's more to it." said Tyler.

This was a lot of information, and it made it difficult for you to process it all.

"How about this, you and I will go on a mission tomorrow." said Molly. "I've learned of a situation where we could help."

"Like what?" you asked.

"You'll find out." smiled Molly.

That stayed in your head for the rest of the day and even through the night. It was quite surprising to learn that your entire family had the ability to become parts of other families.
15312111111.title: More explanations

choices: I enter the mission with mom.
153121111111.content:
The next morning, Molly... err... mom took me out to a run down part of town where she pointed out a small family, all with a narrow face, close-set eyes, high cheekbones. There was a mother, a teenage daughter, and a little boy. "That is the Saotome family." quietly, she explained. "The mother, Andrea, does her best to raise her fourteen year old daughter, Mindy and her five year old son Milo."

"They're struggling, aren't they." feeling sad, I asked.

"Control your emotions, Alex." sternly, mom ordered. "We will help them but you have to stay focused." she pulled a file from the back seat and had me open it. "They have been watched by an American government agency known as CHILD."

"Child?" confused, I asked.

"Central Headquarters of Intelligence Logistics and Defense." evenly, mom replied. "They use gifted children and teenagers to face the super children of the Agency, a European based terrorist organization."

"What does this CHILD want with them?" curious, I asked. "If they are using kids..."

"They're ancestors were part of a secret, elite group of ninjas who defended the secrets and treasures of Japan for centuries." patiently, mom replied. "The boy, Milo has the potential but his sister has a much greater power, one I fear both agencies will very much want to control."

"Wait a minute." suspicious, I asked. "How do you know all of this?"

"What do you think we have been doing while you were in subconscious training?" turning to me, mom asked. "I'll tell you this, I wasn't rocking in a chair, knitting you a new blanket." she sighed. "All of this and more started twenty years ago and is about to explode."

"So, what are we to do?" curious, I asked.

"What we have always done, Alex." smiling, mom replied. "We help them while staying in the shadows." she then pointed to Mindy. "She has the the powers of a ghost but in the form of a Kitsune or fox spirit." she frowned. "Neither he or she has yet discovered their power but they will and soon."

My jaw dropped at this knowledge, wondering if it was safe to enter this family. Seeing my expression, mom smiled and asked, "Did you think this job was easy?"

What am I to do?
153121111111.title: Next Morning

153121111112.content:
You were sleeping peacefully through the night, despite your obvious concerns about whatever your parents had in store.

As the sun came up, you slowly got up, already dreading what was coming though as you went through your morning routine and got some good clothes on.

"Well, time to face the music." you groaned as you walked downstairs. Your dad was reading the paper as usual, while Molly was preparing some breakfast. It was Saturday, so they were obviously preparing something for him today.

"Good morning Alex. How do you feel?" smiled Molly.

"Good enough." you replied.

"That's good. After breakfast, we're going to be heading out on that mission I mentioned the other day, so be prepared." said Molly as she put down some eggs and bacon, one of your favorites.

You ate your breakfast at a normal pace, wondering about what Mom had planned. You got your shoes on soon afterwards, and she began ushering you outside.

"Okay, we're going to be taking a walk, since it's not too far. Keep up." she said.
153121111112.title: Other choice

15312112.content:
I began to feel more and more anxious with each passing minute. I didn't know why but something was telling me that girl I had saved, Tania, was in trouble again. Finally, I had to find out what was going on and I made a run for the nearest McDonalds restaurant as I seemed to remember she was asking her older sister, Melissa if they could eat there. My first fear was that it was that boy trying to stir up trouble again. "If he hurts her, I'll..." angry, I muttered.

I saw a police car drive by and wished I could catch a ride to get there faster just before I blacked out...

*Change*

I pushed harder on the accelerator, having heard a report that there was a disturbance at a local restaurant. Some punk teenager was reported to be stalking a little girl. I feared the worst. As Ted Jones, the chief of police, it was my duty to see to the safety of all in my city. "If he hurts her, I'll..." angry, I muttered.

"Easy, dad." calmly, a teenage boy said, sitting in the passenger seat. "I'll scare the punk straight."

I smiled, knowing that my son, Garth had the ability to grow in both size and strength at will. "Just don't do it where you can be seen by others." serious, I warned him. "The last thing we need is your ability going public."

"I'll be careful, dad." nodding, Garth replied.

We arrived at the restaurant and I saw the little girl crying in her mother's arms while her older sister, Melissa stood at her side. "Is everyone alright?" stepping out of my squad car, I asked.

Just as I asked that, I felt faint yet again and suddenly found myself as...
15312112.title: Strange Feelings

1531212.content:
Pushing aside whatever odd feelings you felt a second ago, you continued on your walk home, thinking often of the girl from earlier but not as hard as before.

As you walked home, you happened to pass by your next door neighbor, Jenny. She was about your age and in your grade. Thankfully, she was actually one of the few people to treat you nicely.

"Hi Alex!" she called over, waving a bit as she did.

"Hello" you said, a little shy as you said that. Few girls ever talked to you, so you were always a little shy when Jenny wanted to talk.

"You doing ok?" she asked, a hint of concern in her voice.

"Nah, I'm ok" you replied quickly, not wanting to ruin the mood. Jenny looked at you strangely, but decided to let it go.

"Really? You're ok? Well if you say so" she said. After that, she had to get back home to get some work done, so she went ahead and got to her own house.

"Man, will I ever be able to talk to her normally" you sighed as your continued on your way.

Eventually, you got to your front door and unlocked it, unaware of what was to come. Mor odd feelings began to surround you as you entered.
1531212.title: Get home and relax

15312121.content:
Suddenly, the door changed from a simple light brown door to an elaborate Victorian style white door just before I blacked out once again....

I blinked, looking at the door then to a name plate near it that stated 'Rodger's Residence'. For a brief moment, I forgot where I was. "Alexandria Rodgers, how can you forget your own home?" giggling, I thought, scolding myself.

Then a commotion reached my ears and I turned to see my older brother, Clem facing off against Mark Derringer, a known bully at my school. I sighed seeing this, knowing that my brother and I were Earth born alien shape shifters. He got his powers a few days ago and soon it would be my turn.

"Back off my brother!" angrily approaching them, I said. "You don't want to make him mad, believe me!"

Mark, obviously not wanting to deal with two people at once, scarpered off.

"Are you all right, Clem?" turning to him, I asked. then she whispered, "I don't know why you don't use those alien shape shifting powers of yours to make yourself a harder target for idiots like him."

Clem sighed as if he had explained why a thousand times. "Alexandria, you know very well why I don't." annoyed, he whispered back. "Using my powers in public is like throwing matches at a tank of gasoline." pausing, he asked, "Don't you think people might just notice if I change into a lion whenever I get jumped? Plus you are forgetting about mom and dad's enemies from 'out of town' and the Agency who Chief Jones warned was back in action."

"I know, I know..." sighing myself, I said.

"Look, I wanted to smash him too." ruefully, Clem said. "Only, If you do, you only descend to his level." he then smiled. "Come on Alexandria, lets get back inside.

We walked up the path to the house with Clem looking slightly concerned but it was beyond me to tell what was bothering him. As we walked into the house, we were greeted by....
15312121.title: Another change of families.

153121211.content:
"What kept you?" Rhea demanded, as we entered. "We've had supper waiting!"

"Something came up," Clem answered. "Besides, it's not like you've been here alone."

Rhea then turned her attention to me; she looked as though she did not recognize me at all. "Who are you? And why are you dressed like a girl?"

"Come on, Rhea," Clem told her, "you know full well she's a girl."

"Nuh-uh," Rhea insisted. "He's a boy. And he doesn't live here."

"Rhea," with a heavy sigh, I said. "I've had enough of this foolishness. I'm your big sister, Alexandria."

Rhea stood there for a while, just staring at me. Then, suddenly, she reached out and placed her finger on my forehead.

I heard a soft feminine voice say, *See.*

Again, I felt faint; but I did not black out. Instead, my vision became blurry for a second before I saw that I was no longer in front of my house but somewhere else, in someone's home! "Holy crap!" panicked, I said. "Where am I?"

"You're in the Rodgers family house." firmly but kindly, a boy replied. "How did you get here?"

I turned and saw a boy I recognized as Clem Rodgers from school along with his little sister, Rhea, both waiting for an explanation.

"I don't know," she replied. "My-my name is Alexander Winters. I passed out, and woke up here, thinking I was your sister. How did this happen?"

"I have no idea," softly, Clem replied, "maybe Mom and Dad can figure this out. If they can't, I know some other people who can help us."
153121211.title: Rhea, tapping her foot.

choices: Is dead, you are an orphan.
1531212111.content:
Clem and Rhea brought me to their mom and dad where they told them what had happened. The two turned to each other curious then turned to us, making me feel nervous.

"You have an extremely rare ability, young man." softly, Mrs Rodgers said. "It is so rare that only one in two billion would have it."

"What- What do I have?" frightened, I asked. "Does it have to do with my black outs?"

Mr Rodgers nodded. "It's directly linked to your blackouts, Alex." serious, he said. "What you have is called Psychic Genealogic Fluidity or Psy-gen-flu."

"It sounds like a disease." wincing, I said.

"It could be seen as such or as a curse." gently, Mrs Rodgers replied. "Basically, you are literally becoming a part of other families at random."

"Those families you merge with will see and treat you as one of their own with pictures of you, growing up, in their photo albums." serious, Mr Rodgers added. "It is a disorienting and maddening power, feel grateful you enter other families unaware otherwise, you would likely be half mad now."

I gulped, hearing that. "Can it be controlled?" shivering, I asked. "I barely remember my own family."

"It is impossible to control without knowing what triggers the psychic connection with another family." looking at me, Mrs Rodgers said.

"Clem was being picked on by another boy in our driveway before he ran from our house." after a thought, Rhea said. "Maybe seeing someone in trouble does it."

"That's it." giving Rhea an impressed look, Mr Rodgers said. "Feeling a deep sympathy or empathy for another has been known to trigger the psychic link."

"What about the black outs?" curious, Clem asked.

"Psy-Gen-Flu takes a huge amount of mental energy." serious, Mrs Rodgers replied. "Alex most likely passes out due to the sheer effort his mind gives out."

"Excuse me but..." shaking, I asked. "... but how do you know all of this?"

Mr and Mrs Rodgers sighed. "Can you keep a secret?" with a deadly stare, Mr Rodgers asked. "Can you resist telling a single soul what we are about to share?"

"He won't tell anyone." placing a reassuring hand on my hand, Rhea said. "He has a good aura."

"A good aura?" confused, I asked. "Who are you people?"

"Calm down." cooed Mrs Rodgers with a slight smile. "We know of this condition because we have it as well."

"We found comfort in each other as we both had the same maddening power." taking his wife's hand Mr Rodgers said. "Can you imagine the odds of two people of this condition finding each other?"

"Not to mention the odds of a third person finding the other two." stunned, Clem added. "Why didn't you tell us?"

"We did, honey." with a rueful smile, Mrs Rodgers said. "Remember us telling you how we used to live on the streets as kids?"

Clem gasped, an awestruck expression forming onto his face. "Unbelievable!" whispering, he said.

"How did you finally control it?" tearing up, I asked.

"By discovering it was happening." serious, Mr Rodgers said. "Rhea gave you that realization through abilities of her own but I ask you keep that to yourself."

"Can you help me control it?" my lips trembling, I asked. "Please...?"

Mrs Rodgers pulled me into a hug where I silently broke down into tears. "This has been driving you mad." rocking me like a small child, she said. then she softly added, "We will help you."

"The first order of business is to contact the boy's family." grabbing a telephone, Mr Rodgers said. "I can have the office track down his parents through his school records."

Hours later, Alex was talking with Rhea and I in the living room when mom and dad entered. "We found your family, Alex." flatly, dad said. "However..."

"However... what?" gulping, Alex asked.

Dad turned to mom who winced before she replied. "Honey, your family..."
1531212111.title: I'm taken to Clem's parents.

15312121111.content:
Hours later, I was talking with Rhea and Clem in their living room when Mr and Mrs Rodgers entered. "We found your family, Alex." flatly, Mr Rodgers said. "However..."

"However... what?" gulping, I asked.

Mr Rodgers turned to his wife who winced before she replied, "Honey, your family... was completely unaware you were missing; they were unaware of who you are."

"What...!?" feeling hurt, I asked. "They- They forgot about me!?"

Mr Rodgers placed a hand onto my shoulder, "Alex, can you tell me when these blackouts started?"

"A few years ago." tears falling, I replied.

"That's not good." sighing, Mr Rodgers said. "My wife and I were lucky, we always managed to return to our families as we were both aware of who we were but you kept losing your memory of your original family."

"How does that make his family forget about him?" worried, Clem asked.

"Alex has been jumping from family to family, returning to his normal life for only brief periods of time." patiently, Mr Rodgers replied. "Over the years, his psychic link to his original family corrupted and was lost; all memory, all evidence that he was once their son was forever erased from existence."

"This power is a curse!" crying, I wailed. "I'm an orphan!!"

"Can't he just use his power to be their son again?" curious, Rhea asked.

Mrs Rodgers sadly shook her head. "He could but it would not last very long." gently, she replied. "He would have to keep making himself a part of their family again and again for weeks to get them back." she sighed. "Unfortunately, because of how draining it is to the mind..."

"Any attempt to do so would kill him." turning pale, Clem said. "Damn, that sucks!"

"What am I going to do now!?" crying, Alex asked. "I- I have no where to go!"

"You could live with us." touching my shoulder, Mrs Rodgers said. "We can use our power to stabilize your own so you won't jump to another family."

"What do you say, Alex?" knelling in front of me, Mr Rodgers asked. "Want to be a Rogers?"

I responded by wrapping my arms around him, crying uncontrollably on his shoulder. Clem exchanged smiles with Rhea as my new mom and dad then placed a gentle hand onto my head. I gasped, feeling a sudden rush as if the world itself had shifted slightly.

"What was that!?" startled, Clem asked.

"That was Alex permanently becoming a member of this family." catching his breath, dad said. "You will find the photo albums filled with pictures of him, growing up from birth."

Rhea looked hurt. "Why wasn't that done to..."

"We tried." gently, mom interrupted. "It did not work, likely due to your own power so we simply adopted you the regular way."

"All those within our little circle will know Alex was adopted." smiling, dad said. "However, to the world at large, he was born into this family."

Clem smiled at that but paused as a thought came to mind. "If he was 'born' into this family..."

Mom and dad nodded. "He will discover this soon enough." smiling, mom said.

"Discover what?" curious, I asked.
15312121111.title: Does not remember you.

153121211111.content:
"You're changing," Rhea said.

I looked down, and saw my arms becoming tentacles. "What's happening to me!?"

"Remember asking about my alien shape-shifting powers?" Clem asked. "Now they're yours, too."

I looked at Mom, panic filling my eyes, including the new ones. "M-Mom?"

"It's alright, Alex," she told me. "Just calm down." she assumed her alien form. "Except for Rhea, we are Oltroxians. This is our natural form. If you calm yourself, you will be able to change back."

It took a while, but I did manage to calm down, and Mom guided me in returning to human form. When I finally did, I asked, "You guys are aliens?"

"Your mother and I are," dad said. "You kids were born on this planet, so you're not technically aliens."

"We were the rulers of our world," mom added, "until a revolution occurred. We were exiled to this planet, and we used our shape-shifting and reality-warping powers to fit in."

"You ever read the Problem Child Gang comics?" Clem chimed in. "They really existed, and Mom and Dad helped them."

I looked from one family member to the other. "How much of this do the other kids at school know?"

"We're home-schooled," Rhea answered.

"We are now," Clem clarified, "but a lot of my friends from before are kids of the original Problem Child Gang, and they have powers of their own."

I sat down to prevent myself from fainting. "This is a lot to take in."

"And there's more coming," smiling, mom said. "Oltroxian puberty is a little different from what humans go through."

Clem nodded, and took off his wig. "I'll take you to the wig shop tomorrow, after our lessons."
153121211111.title: I start to change

choices: I lose all of my hair!
1531212111111.content:
As Clem took me to my new room, I discovered how powerful changing reality was as his, now our, bedroom had already been rearranged to suit two boys as if it had always been that way. "No wonder mom and dad were both out of breath after they changed reality." stunned, Clem whispered. "The literally reshaped our entire world."

"Not exactly, Clem." kindly, mom said. "Those who do not know or have never heard of our family were unaffected as there is no need to. Your father and I only needed to change reality for ourselves and those who know this family."

"Why do I know Alex as adopted rather than a part of the family?" curious, Clem asked.

"Because we exempted you from that change, along with the other members of the Problem Child Gang." simply, mom replied. "The reason we did this is because there are a number of members who can see right through the reality change, such as Beth Vance, Lilith Nightshade, Caitlin Spencer..." Clem, I noticed, blushed at Cait's name and mom smiled. "The point is, we would have to explain the situation again and again to those in our little circle who can see through the reality change. It's easier to have them all see the truth and be told we changed reality to make Alex our son."

"That makes sense, I guess." shrugging, Clem said. he then turned to me. "Want to grab some pizza? I know you love that extra peperoni." he paused, surprised. "How did I know that?"

Mom laughed. "You are not completely unaffected by the reality change, dear." amused, she said. "You see, having 'grown up' with Alex, you would naturally know all of his likes and dislikes."

"This is deep." sighing, I said.

Mom nodded. "Just accept what you know and the rest will follow with ease." kindly, she said.

With that, she walked away as I sat onto a bed that had my name carved into the foot board. "At least I won't be jumping from family to family anymore." sadly, I said. "I just wish they could have done that with my real family." I sighed. "No offense... bro."

That got Clem thinking and he excused himself for a moment before walking out. Just as he left, mom entered the room. "I need you to listen to me carefully, Alex." calmly, she said. "We are all relocating to a safe house of sorts."

"A safe house?" confused, I asked.

Mom nodded. "Sykes and the Agency are after us all, including you." serious, she replied. "Do not fear, we have prepared for this. Do you remember the brief mention of a place called the S.U.B. station in the Problem Child graphic novels?"

"Vaguely." wincing, I said. "It was only mentioned in a few of the books."

"That is where we are going." motioning to the hall, mom said. I looked and saw two small suitcases. "Now, I know you just became a member of this family and there is a lot for you to take in but try to understand; this is necessary."

"How long will be be at this substation?" worried, I asked.

"Just until we can deal with Sykes and the Agency once and for all." serious, mom replied. "Pack what you believe you will need for the next few days, we will come back for anything more later."

With that, she brought in the two suitcases then left the room to talk to Rhea, who was standing in the hall, looking upset. "I know you sense what is happening, dear." whispering, mom said. "Please trust me, it's for the best."

Rhea shook her head. "It's not right." tears forming, she said. "You know that."

Mom sighed and closed the door to my room, silencing their conversation. "I guess she doesn't like the idea of moving underground." frowning, I muttered. "Well, she's not alone."

I sighed, knowing mom was better suited to talk to her than I and greeted Clem as he walked into my bedroom to tell me the news. Having already heard it, I took it better than he seemed to think and we both began to pack. Minutes later, just as we were about to leave....
1531212111111.title: sharing a room.

15312121111111.content:
I felt and itch and scratched my head only to gasp, startled, as I found a handful of hair had come out into my hand! Clem turned and looked over at me, to see I now had a bald spot, and was holding a handful of what I knew was my hair. "My scalp itched," I explained. "I just scratched, like normal, but... " my voice trailed off, tears forming.

Clem nodded. "I was asleep when my hair fell out. I'm sure mom and mad have a wig or two for you. They're homemade, so they'll look kind of rough, but they'll cover your head."

Nodding at one of Clem's bundles, I asked, "What's with the girl's wig?"

"Sometimes, Rhea likes to pretend she has a big sister." blushing slightly, Clem explained. "Since I can change shape, I get to play Jessica for her." he smiled. "I'll bet mom has a female identity picked out for you, too, so don't laugh too loudly at me."

Dad came up. "Ready, boys?" he saw my hair. "Honey, Alex needs his wig."

"I had a hunch he would," came mom's voice as she climbed the stairs. Walking up to me, she produced a hairbrush. "Don't fight me on this, Alex, we might as well get as much of this off as we can before we put your wig on."

Mom gave me a thorough brushing, removing about half the hair on my head. "The rest will come off in due time," she assured me. Then, she gave me my wig to put on. "I've received word from Ted. There are five families down below already, with more to come. Good thing the S.U.B. Station has so much room to work with."

"What is the S.U.B. Station?" curious, I asked.

Dad nodded. "Subterranean Urban Base. It was always a fallback position for the Problem Child Gang. Now, it seems, it's time to fall back."

We all followed Dad to his den. It was the first time I'd ever been in that room, as Dad kept a strict rule about only going in if invited. Now, I could see the reason for such strictness, as he opened a secret door in his bookcase. As a kid, I would have played with that thing for hours, if I'd had the chance. "This way to the S.U.B. Station," he said. "This will be our home until things are straightened out."
15312121111111.title: I lose all of my hair!

153121211111111.content:
The secret door led to an elevator, which we all boarded and rode down several levels underground. Upon reaching our destination, the doors opened and we all walked out onto a wide sidewalk next to a sheer drop down to a long run of subway tracks. "These tunnels, which run almost everywhere under the city, have been long abandoned and forgotten." calmly, dad explained. "There are no records anywhere of it ever existing, we made certain of that."

"You hope." frowning, Clem said.

Then, a towing man approached us with a small group following. I recognized many of them from school, they were my friends. I gave a shy smile as Mr Jones, the police chief took dad's hand and shook it. "Long time no see, David." shaking dad's hand, Ted said. "I just wish it was under better times." he then motioned to me. "I see you have added a new member to your family."

"This is Alex, our second born." surprising the group, dad said. "He has the same ability to change reality as Christina and I only he had no power over it."

"What do you mean?" concerned, Garth asked. "Was his power out of control?"

"He has the power to literally become an added member to any family with that family never aware he was an intruder as, to them, he was always one of them." serious, dad said. "My wife and I have the same power, we used it to infiltrate the criminal element when we helped the Problem Child Gang back in the day."

"Poor Alex was literally jumping from family to family, blacking out each time before entering and leaving." with a sad look, mom said. "He never had any memory of being a part of those families he visited but he remembered everything about them, not knowing why."

"That had to be maddening." wincing, Garth said.

"We managed to stabilize his power and changed reality so he was always and will always be our son." touching my shoulder, mom said. she then sighed. "The reality holding him to his family had corrupted after years of constantly jumping around, they no longer know who he is."

"That's terrible!" stunned, Lilith said. she then paused. "Wait, why don't any of us know him as always being your son, Mr Rogers?"

"Because, with your powers, you or Beth, or Caitlin would have seen through the reality change and suspected Alex as an intruder." serious, dad said. "We exempted you and the others from the reality change so there will be no doubts that Alex is our son."

"Well, in that case, welcome to the substation, Alex." extending his hand, Garth said.

I smiled. "Thanks."
153121211111111.title: In the S.U.B. station.

153122.content:
"It was no problem really. I just couldn't leave her to get bullied like that" I answered sheepishly. This was the first time a group of people I didn't know were so nice to me. Melissa smiled at me.

"Well, we're very grateful for your help" she said, making me bluch more. Then, their mom spoke up.

"We should get going. Thanks again" said their mom with a grateful smile as she motioned for the girls and herself to get into the nearby car.

As I watched them get into the car, I felt this feeling that I wanted to go with them somehow. I wondered why I would be feeling such things. I didn't know these people that well, did I? I don't think so. Still, I felt like I had seen them before and wanted to be in their presence a bit longer. As these thoughts came to me, I felt myself getting riled up again. I dreaded these feelings. They always seemed to be connected to my common black outs. I couldn't really figure out what that conncection was, but there had to be something in the works.

Slowly, as I watched the car drive away with the family in it, I reached my hand outwards, a brief flicker of dust forming around my hand.

Then, I passed out right there.

*****Change*****

I opened my eyes slowly, feeling a sense of motion that indicated I was in the car right now. My head felt a little hazy, but that was solved when I heard someone call out to me. A very familiar voice.
153122.title: You feel like going with the family (change again)

1531222.content:
"You alright, Alexandria?" asked Mom. I blinked in confusion and shook my head, wondering what just happened.

"Yeah mom, I'm fine. I just blanked out for a moment" I said to mom, assuringly. Mom seemed to accept that answer and turned back to looking at the road. I don't know why I just blanked out like that. Maybe I haven't been getting enough sleep or something.

"So, how is your senior semester starting so far?" asked Mom.

"It's going well" I replied with a smile.

"Good. I'm hoping for you to get straight A's again" said Mom, giving me a knowing smile.

"I can only try, mom" I replied, giggling softly. I was a consistant straight A student, although I honestly didn't care too much about it. I was just doing my best, and trying to get into a good college. I didn't have school today because the seniors were off. It was Friday anyway.

As the car drove by, we happened to pass by the Winter house, who was in the same neighborhood as us. They had 3 kids and I often babysat them, as it waa good credit and they were fun to be around. However, their oldest son, Alex, was kind of wierd. Maybe it was because their parents were always out, but he always seemed to be way out of it. I felt sorry for the guy. He always had this sick look on his face, even when he was perfectly healthy.

"Here we are" said Mom, opening the garage door and allowing us to all go into the house. Tania instantly ran right up to her room to go play. After that, Mom turned to me.

"I have to go run some more errands. I'll be back in perhaps an hour or two" said Mom.

"Ok" I replied. With that, Mom drove off again and I went inside the house.
1531222.title: "You alright, Alexandria?" (become "...

15312222.content:
I walked up to my room and went inside. It was an average girl's room- pictures of boy bands on the walls, a trumpet lay on top of a chest of drawers along with a few trophies from my school prize giving. I was about to flop down on my bed, when I heard a loud commotion outside. A boy was being pushed against a wall by another boy. I suspected he was being bullied. One thing was for sure, I was not just going to sit here and let that boy get beaten up. I got up and left the house.

As I made for where the two boys were, I started to feel faint. "I really have to do something about these blackouts," I thought as I reached out to pull the boy around.

Change

"Back off my brother!" angrily, I said. "You don't want to make him mad, believe me!"

The bully, an obvious coward, scarpered.

"Are you all right, Clem?" turning to my brother, I asked. then I whispered, "I don't know why you don't use those alien shape shifting powers of yours to make yourself a harder target for idiots like him."

Clem sighed. "Alexandria, you know very well why I don't." annoyed, he whispered back. "Using my powers in public is like throwing matches at a tank of gasoline." pausing, he asked, "Don't you think people might just notice if I change into a lion whenever I get jumped? Plus you are forgetting about mom and dad's enemies from 'out of town' and the Agency."

"I know, I know..." sighing myself, I said.

"Look, I wanted to smash him too." ruefully, Clem said. "Only, If you do, you only descend to his level." he then smiled. "Come on Alexandria, lets get back inside.

As I entered the house, I knew that I was Alexandria Rodgers, Alex to my friends. I have a brother, Clem, who's a couple of years older, and a sister, Rhea, who's a couple of years younger. Both Rhea and I were adopted; Rhea was taken in as a baby, I was adopted a few years later. It was just recently that we discovered that our parents were aliens and that Clem was an Earth born alien, all capable of changing into almost anything they wished.

Rhea revealed to Clem and I that she can see things that are invisible or known to others, though she did not understand it herself. Mom and Dad figure she has super charged senses as she can see a dime on the side walk a block away. She also has some cool mental powers but they drain her something terrible. She faints after doing just one thing... As for me, well, I don't have any powers that I am aware of. Mom said she sensed something about me but could not put her finger on what. Coming from her, being an alien, that could mean anything... When we finally walked into the house...
15312222.title: Looking around (another change)

153122222.content:
"What kept you?" asked Rhea "We had supper waiting!"
"Something came up," said Clem "Besides, it's not like you've been here alone."
Rhea then turned to me. I expected her to greet me in the same way she'd greeted Clem. I was about to tell her where I had been, when she said "Who are you? And why are you dressed like a girl?"
Of all the things I had expected to hear from my little sister, that was the last. Me and Rhea had been the best of friends a few days ago. I had protected her when we left the blind post office near the school. While I had no powers, I had compensated for that by improving my fighting skills with the help of one of my relatives, Geo Tanner.
"Come on Rhea," said Clem, after sharing a confused glance with me "You know full well she's a girl."
"Nuh-uh," said Rhea "He's a boy. And he doesn't live here."
"Rhea," I said, with a sigh "I've had enough of this foolishness, I'm your big sister, Alexandria."
Rhea stood there for a while, just staring at her. I made a mental note to ask Mum and Dad to get her checked out for amnesia, we weren't sure what side effects her powers might have. Then, Rhea reached up, and touched me on the head.

Suddenly, I remembered that I was not Alexandria Rogers, I didn't live here, these weren't my siblings, and that my name was Alex Winters. "Holy crap!" I said "Where am I?"
Clem seemed just as surprised as me "Your in the Rogers family house. How did you get here?"
"I don't know," I said "My-my name is Alexander Winters, I passed out and woke up here thinking I was your sister. How did this happen, and how do I change back to a guy?"
"I have no idea," Clem told me "Maybe mom and dad can figure this out, if not, I know some other people who might be able to help you."
153122222.title: We're greeted by Rhea

choices: were killed last year, your an orphan
1531222221.content:
Rhea and Clem brought me to their mum and dad, where they told their parents what had happened. They turned to each other, curious, then turned to me. "You have an extremely rare ability, young man," Clem's mom said, softly "So rare, that only one in 2 billion people have it."
"What-what do I have?" I asked, frightened "Does it have anything to do with my blackouts?"
Mr Rogers nodded. "It's directly linked to your blackouts, Alex," he said "What you have, is called Psychic Genealogy Fluidity, or psy-gen-flu."
"It sounds like a disease," I said, not liking the sound of this at all.
"It could be seen as such, or as a curse," Clem's mom replied, gently "Basically, you are literally becoming parts of other families at random."
"Those families you merge with will see and treat you as one of their own with pictures of you, growing up, in their photo albums," Mr Rogers said, seriously "It is a disorienting and maddening power, be thankful you were unaware otherwise you would be half mad by now."
I gulped "Can it be controlled?" I asked, shivering "I barely remember my own family."
"It is impossible to control without knowing what triggers the psychic connection to another family." Mrs Rogers said, looking at Alex.
"Clem was being picked on by another boy in our driveway before he ran from our house," said Rhea, thoughtfully "Maybe seeing someone in trouble does it."
"That's it," said Mr Rogers, impressed "Feeling a deep sympathy or empathy for someone has been known to trigger the psychic link."
"What about the blackouts?" Clem asked
"Psy-gen-flu takes a lot of mental energy," Mrs Rogers replied, seriously "Alex most likely passes out from the sheer effort the mind gives out."
"Excuse me, but..." I said, still a little confused about how they knew all this "...how do you know all this?"

Mr and Mrs Rogers both sighed "Can you keep a secret?" asked Mr Rogers, with a deadly stare "Can you resist telling a single soul what we're about to tell you?"
"He won't tell anyone," said Rhea, placing a hand on top of mine "He has a good aura."
Far from reassuring me, this just left me even more confused "A good aura?" I asked "Who are you people?"
"Calm down," said Mrs Rogers "We know of your condition because we both have it as well."
"We found comfort in each other as we had the same maddening power," said Mr Rogers "Imagine the odds of two people with the exact same condition finding each other?"
"Not to mention finding a third," said Clem, looking between the three of us "Why didn't you tell us?"
"We did, honey," said Mrs Rogers "Remember we told you we used to live on the streets as kids?"
Garth fell silent. For a full minute, nobody said anything. Then, unable to take it anymore, I blurted out:
"Can you help me control it?" I felt on the verge of tears "Please..."

Mrs Rogers, a woman I had known as 'Mom' a few minutes ago, pulled me into a hug. Even though I had never met her, I felt comfort in her arms. "This has been driving you mad," she said, rocking me "We will help you."
"The first order of business is to contact the boys family," dad said, grabbing a telephone "I can have the office track him down through his school records.

About an hour later, I was talking to Rhea and Clem when Mr and Mrs Rogers entered "We found your family, Alex," said Mr Rogers, flatly "However..."
"However what?" I asked, gulping.
It was Mrs Rogers who answered, however. "Honey, your family..."
1531222221.title: Mr and Mrs Rogers

choices: I wake up (my point of view)
15312222212.content:
"I'm sorry," said Mrs Rogers "Last year, your family went on holiday to Europe, while there, they were attacked by some of our old enemies, the Agency, while they were staying overnight at a hotel."
"So, how did I escape?" I asked
"We believe your powers acted like a defence mechanism," said Mr Rogers "You latched onto another family and ended up here, but it must have been very traumatic, seeing your parents killed, it must be too traumatic to remember."
"We believe the Agency were after the Winter's children," said Mrs Rogers "We found records of two children, Tommy and Aura Winters, your brother and sister."
"Were they killed by the Agency too?" I asked
Mrs Rogers hesitated "They're bodies were not found at the scene," she said "But there's no evidence to show that they survived."
"But if they're in the hands of the Agency..." Clem began
"We'd best hope they're not," said Mr Rogers "Brainwashing is a fate worse than death."

That was the end of the conversation. For today, I was staying in the Roger's residence. While Rhea had given me knowledge of who I was, and turned me back into a boy, the world at large still believed I was the Rogers' adopted child, and this seemed to be the safest place for me now. As I headed upstairs, I felt a tug on my sleeve. I looked down to see Rhea.
"Your brother and sister are still alive," she said "I can feel it."
I smiled at her attempts to make me feel better "Thanks for the comfort, Rhea," I said "I really hope your right."
As I headed up the stairs, I said to Rhea "I just wish I could remember them."
Rhea remained silent until we got to the top of the stairs, then told me where the guest room was.

I went into the room and, tired after the long day with multiple shifts, I fell asleep.
15312222212.title: were killed last year, your an orphan

choices: Rhea tells Mum and Dad (Rhea's pov)
153122222121.content:
As soon as the door to my bedroom closed, Rhea immediately went to Clem. He was sitting in his room, looking at the several wigs that were lined up on his dresser.

"Clem," asked Rhea "Can I talk to you?"

Clem smiled, and patted the bed next to him. Rhea ran over and climbed up onto the bed.

"I know Alex's brother and sister are still alive," she said "He said he wanted to remember them, I can't help him with that, but..."

"But maybe Cait could," Clem realized, getting out his phone to immediately call her.

Rhea, however, put her hand over his "Not yet," she said "I have a feeling that Alex needs his sleep."

Clem put his phone away. "So how's your day been?" he Clem "Anything interesting happen?"

"Not really," said Rhea "Tobi said her mom will try to teach me how to use my powers better, I think I'm starting to get the hang of it." she pointed to one of Clem's wigs. It floated off the desk a few inches, then fell back down. "I can't keep it up for very long," she said. "But I'll get better, you'll see."

"That reminds me," said Clem "We haven't even had dinner yet, we forgot with all this stuff going on, you must be hungry, let's go find Mum and Dad, and have dinner." Clem left the room, with Rhea following him downstairs, smiling.
153122222121.title: Rhea talks to Clem.

choices: I talk to mom and dad.
I keep it to myself for now.
1531222221211.content:
Inside what was now my bedroom, I tossed and turned on my bed as if to run from the disturbing images that were flooding my mind. I saw a small boy who looked much like myself, tied to a chair, trembling, while a tall slender man stood over him. "Your parents were the unfortunate victims of a trap we had set for someone else." coldly, he said. "However, you and your siblings possess gifts that carry great potential."

"What- What do you- you mean we have gifts?" stammering, the boy asked. "We're nothing special."

"Oh, but you are." serious, the man replied. "If you were not, I guarantee you would both be dead and buried along side your parents right now."

"What do you want with us?" crying, the boy asked. "What have we done!?"

"We want to make use of your gifts, of course." serious, the man said. "You will need training but that can easily be arranged. You also need some toughening up but that too can be done."

"What makes you think I'll ever work for you?" angry, the boy asked.

The man roughly grabbed the boy by the hair and pulled his head back, forcing him to scream in pain. "If you don't do exactly as I say, when I say to do it, your little sister will pay the price." softly, coldly, he said. "To show that I am serious... I'll force you to watch as they are beaten each time you fail to serve me.... I own you, boy. I own all of you."

The boy cried freely at those words as the man then released his hair. He looked up at the man but anger was still clear in his voice. "I will make you pay for this!" whispering, he hissed. "You are not going to win!"

With that, the boy vanished. The ropes that had held him fell loose, leaving the man looking stunned. The boy reappeared in front of a familiar looking school. "Where am I?" confused, he muttered.

********************************************************

It was then I woke up with a start and looked around, tears streaming down my face. "That- That boy in my dream," shaken, I whispered, "that was me!"
1531222221211.title: I wake up (my pov)

15312222212112.content:
I walked downstairs to find Rhea and Clem sitting in the living room.
"Hey guys," I said, smiling at them as I sit down on a couch next to Rhea "So, you guys are shapeshifters, then?"
"Sort of," said Clem "Rhea's adopted, so she doesn't have our shapeshifting powers, but she has, at this point, limited psychic abilities."
"That's how you could tell I wasn't part of your family?" I asked. Rhea nodded.
"We were talking while you were out," said Clem "We've got a friend who can read minds, we thought she might be able to unlock the memories you've suppressed, maybe find out what happened to your brother and sister."
"I don't know," I said, remembering the dream I had just had "Maybe those memories were suppressed for a reason, maybe I shouldn't dig up the past.
"It's possible that those suppressed memories will just keep coming out in sleep," said Clem "Better to get them into your conscious so you can sleep easier."
I thought. If I suppressed memories, they would just drive me half mad at night.
"O.K," I said "When can your friend come over?"
"She was coming over today to hang out," said Clem "I can ask her then, do you want to do it today.
"Yeah," I said, now that I had decided to do it, it would be better just to get it over with "The sooner the better."

1531222221211212.content:
"I can see now why you need my help," said Cait "I'll help you to find out what happened to your family, and if they're still alive, help you to find out where they are."
"Thank you, Cait," I said, smiling at her.
"Now, you might want to sit down," said Cait "Unlocking repressed memories can be a painful process."
I sat on one of the couches. Suddenly, my vision went black. I appeared in a very black area. I was standing on something solid, maybe a floor, but I couldn't make out anything in the darkness. Suddenly, Cait appeared in front of me.
"Where are we?" I asked
"Your subconscious," said Cait "When people try to repress memories, they put them into their subconscious, just below the surface of their consciousness. Whenever your ready, we can begin."
"I'm ready," I said.
Cait pointed to a dark area of the room. A large door appeared, with multiple other doors visible behind it.
"Interesting," said Cait "It seems that each of your suppressed memories act as barriers to the others, I'm guessing that each time we open a door, you'll gain the memories of the last family you were with. If we keep going, you'll gain more memories, I don't want to overwhelm you, which these memories will if we open all the doors at once."
