154111121221111111211111211221.content:
"Trying to save your neck," I replied with a growl.

Sam came rushing over. "It's an emergency, Garth," he explained, as Megan joined us. "Clarence Mayweather is going to kill somebody."

I expected some reaction from Garth, but I didn't expect him to relax. "It's okay, Mr. Connors. It's being taken care of."

"What?" We all turned to look at Mayweather's perch, where he was now being taken into custody. "How'd that happen so quickly?"

"You can thank Cait," Garth explained. "She got a vision warning of the attack, and alerted us. At least, she alerted the kids she'd already made mental contact with. Once Dad heard about it, he got a team ready to take him down."

Sam was still upset. "Why didn't I hear about this? And why would he send you kids to school, knowing what was going to happen?"

"Dad wanted him to think his plan was still going smoothly. And we only had an hour's warning. Dad couldn't contact everybody, and still draw up a counterstrike."

Sam began to relax. "I guess that makes sense."

"You said Mayweather is the gunman?"

Sam nodded. "We'd had run-ins with him as the Problem Child Gang. More recently, he tried to kill Sarah Vance, but only succeeded in putting her in a wheelchair."

Garth grinned. "Dad's been looking for him since he escaped. He may want to conduct that interrogation personally."

Everybody else started to calm down, but I heard another voice, saying, Don't give him the chance. Run him down. Finish him off.
154111121221111111211111211221.title: Making someone a harder target.

1541111212211111112111112112212.content:
Feeling unnerved by the strange voice in my head, I headed for my homeroom class. I found it ironic that all of the kids involved in the 'new problem child gang' were there. Only, before I reached the classroom, a strong hand grabbed me from behind and pulled me into a dark and empty classroom. "Relax, son." whispering, dad's voice said. "We need to talk."

"What's wrong, dad?" worried, I said. "Is mom okay?"

Dad took a step into the dim light, startling me as he was in the form of an Anthro wolf! "I am what this world calls an Metamorphic humanoid, I can change into any creature by willing my DNA to rewrite itself." calmly, dad said. "I come from a world where everyone is a shape shifter but, as we all look different, we all have a different type of shape shifting."

"Are you serious!?" stunned again, I asked. "Here I thought being a test tube baby was a wild explanation..."

"That was a failure." firmly, dad replied. "As far as your mother is concerned, however, it was a success."

"What..."

Dad sighed. "Your mother was an operative, working for The Agency." urging me to sit down, he began. "I was her latest acquisition target as her employers had learned of my abilities through my own exploits outside of the original Problem Child Gang. I did cross their paths here and there but I kept to my own work.. I was dubbed the 'unknown shadow'."

My eyes widened to saucers. "So, I am connected to PCG." whispering, I said. composing myself, I asked, "So, I'm a half alien human or something like that?"

"If your mother did not have the ability to 'bend' the rules of reality, you would not exist right now." serious, dad said. "You see, our species is not compatible with humans. We have a... 'double plug' to coin a phrase." he sighed, adding, "I'm not certain if she altered me or herself but we made love and, nine months later, you were born."

"What about all that talk about the test tube project..." I tried to ask.

"Everything your mother told you about that project was true only it was a complete failure." wincing, dad said. "She made the attempt two months before we managed to have true intercourse." sadly, he said, "She 'miscarried' in her sleep only a month after the experiment but there was no body, just fluids."

"A false pregnancy." wincing, I said. "That must have torn her apart inside."

"She doesn't know." showing a hint of shame, dad replied. "I sedated her into a deep sleep and cleaned the mess, changing the sheets, before she awoke." turning back to me, he said, "Your mom is never to know this as there is no death to mourn, just a failed experiment."

"Tell me more about your world, dad." after a pause, I said. "Why did you come here, how can I change forms quickly..."

"There was a military coup on my old world." interrupting me, dad said. "My mother and father were given the task of protecting the crown prince and his prearranged wife as they fled into exile; I was taken with them. Only we were forced to crash land on Earth... I and the royal couple were the only survivors."

"Where are they now?" curious, I asked.

"They live in this very town, son." looking at me, dad replied. "I never took the oath to protect them so I ended up becoming adopted by the Greenway family while they moved on to their prearranged lifestyle as 'live alone' kids."

"And changing forms?" hopeful, I asked.

Dad smiled. "To change forms quickly, you must first learn how your body works and how to control it." he said. "It's like learning gymnastics or martial arts, you have to train your body to work the way you want it to."

"Can you teach me?" begging, I asked.

"Start by changing part of your body from animal to human all day." smiling, dad replied. "Make certain it is a part no one will notice like your leg or arm, covered by your trousers and long sleeved uniform shirt. That alone will give you all the practice you need to change faster."

"I never thought about that." surprised, I said. I then showed dad the 'watch' Mr Connors gave me. "What about this?"

Dad took it and crushed it in his hands, destroying it. "That's cheating." chuckling, he said. "You know better than that."

I smiled as dad then returned to his human form and quietly walked out of the room.
1541111212211111112111112112212.title: The truth of my past.

15411112122111111121111121122122.content:
My walk out of the room was short-lived as I was suddenly pushed into a set of lockers. "Hey Freakshow! Ready for a face rearrangement?"

Bradford Boss, local football jock and school bully. He's over six feet tall and well built. Blonde hair, blue eyes, and a few missing teeth. He's been held back a few years, but the only other reason he wasn't held back more was from his "important" role on the team. He's all brawn and no brains. And the worst part, he's the guy I beat up when I was younger.

I sighed as I stood up straight. "Come on Bradford, I don't want to be late on my first day back." I tried to go around him, but he kept pushing me behind his wall of muscle. "Alright" I sighed, "What will it take for you to let me go?"

He cracked his knuckles as he cracked a smile. "One punch...that's all."

I smiled with an idea, but I made it fade. I acted scared, "No Bradford...p-please don't p-punch my face!"

He laughed as he reached back. He threw his fist forward, but I saw that coming. I ducked, making his fist hit the locker. He stepped back to soothe his hand, giving me my moment to escape. But once again, it was short-lived. Bradford grabbed my neck and pinned me against the lockers. "You think you're so smart don't you freak?" he asked. I smiled but that only made this worse. His massive hand clenched my neck tighter. I couldn't breathe and I couldn't transform, he would tell someone and there were cameras everywhere. I could only stay here and constantly get punched in the stomach.

Strangely, as I was being punched, I felt something form. It was...in my stomach. But it quickly rose up my throat and in my mouth.

Bradford held his fist back, "Any last words?"

With no control, I spat the contents of my mouth. I heard the bully scream as he let go of me. I dropped to the ground while regaining my breath. Whatever I spat out was green, and worse it was corrosive. Bradford was screaming like his face was on fire, which he probably wanted less. I couldn't let the guy suffer. There was the janitor's cart so I quickly ran over. I grabbed the bucket of mop water, rushed over, and splashed his face with it. Good news, it wiped off. Even more good news, the gunk did not do much damage. Bad news, Bradford was okay. I found myself once again in a chokehold.

"I don't know what you did ya freak, but this time I'll-!"

"Mr. Boss, drop him this instant." We both turned, seeing the principal of the school. Bradford was shocked, shocked enough to let me get free. "Both of you, to my office, now..."

I let Bradford ahead of me as I hung back. Great, my first day here and I already got in trouble. But what was that green stuff? Why couldn't I have done that before? I cant believe i already lost control of my powers. And how am I going to explain THAT to the principal?
15411112122111111121111121122122.title: First day, second fight

154111121221111111211111211221221.content:
The principal, or rather the assistant principal, Mr. Ross, was a towering bald man of 6ft, two inches. He had muscle on top of muscle, making him appear very intimidating but his gentle blue eyes gave away his more gentle nature. Still, he could certainly hold his own.

"Bradford Boss, I have constantly warned you not to pick fights in school." patiently, Ross said. "Honestly, I was surprised you did not fight back, Travis." he showed a look of concern. "I just happened to catch the confrontation on my monitors, I saw you throw up, are you ill?"

"I've been in the hospital." honestly, I replied. "I had a few issues."

Ross sighed. "Well, I am impressed how you held yourself today, Travis." smiling, he said. "If you feel you can get through the day, I'll write you a pass. If you feel the need to go home, I'll call your parents after I'm done with Mr Bradford Boss."

Moments later, I walked out of the office, smiling, as I held my pass back to homeroom. "This is actually turning out to be a good day for once." whispering, I said.

Then my keen senses spotted two men who did not seem to belong. I gave them a 'passing glance' and felt a sense of dread about them. I was not sure if it was my instincts warning me they were a threat or if it was just my nerves after all that had happened thus far. Still, I made a mental note to mention it to the others. Just as I was passing the two men, they quietly....
154111121221111111211111211221221.title: Things go well

1541111212211111112111112112212211.content:
Just as I was passing the two men, they quietly stepped into my path. Both of them were dressed in black suits with dark shades covering their eyes. The first man was tall, well built, with black hair and a stone carved features that made him look formidable. The second man was slightly shorter but just as well built with brown hair and deep tan. "Mr Travis Greenway," flashing a badge for me to see, the first man said, "may we take a minute of your time?"

"Are you two from the police?" firmly on guard, I asked.

"Not quite." politely, the second man replied. "I am special agent Parker and this is special agent Holmes. We are from a government organization that specializes in children and teenagers like yourself."

That threw my mind into overdrive as I was warned of the Agency and their plans to build an army of super children to do their dirty work. Only I knew that a fight here would result in others getting hurt so I decided to play things cool for the moment. "What exactly do you want with me?" ice in my voice, I asked.

"We are in the process of recruiting young people with talents such as yours to help us against a criminal organization, calling themselves the Agency." to my surprise, Holmes said. "We know all about your mother's involvement with the Agency twenty years ago and would like to offer you a chance to earn her a clean slate and a fresh new beginning."

"So you are the good guys?" raising an eyebrow, I asked. then I caught what they had said about my mom and turned red with anger. What!?! Are you two threatening to imprison my mother!?"

"No one can run from their past forever." serious, Parker said. "We have evidence, proving your mother was involved in multiple kidnappings, murders, and more while working of the Agency." he shrugged. "We could easily send her to a prison for life or worse."

"Before you go 'wild' on us, Mr Greenway, listen to what we are offering you." quickly, Holmes said.

I took a deep breath, my teeth grinding. "I'm listening." angrily, I hissed.

"We can wipe your mother's criminal record clean and give her a new identity to start her life anew." calmly, Parker said. "We can also give you the best training the government can offer, granting you the chance to do what your predecessors failed to do twenty years ago... stop the Agency for good."

"All you need to do is say you are in and we can start you on your training." offering his hand, Parker said. "What do you say, Mr Greenway?"

I took a deep breath, mostly to calm myself so to think clearly. I had no idea if these two clowns were legit or part of some scheme from the Agency to lure me in. Finally, I made up my mind and replied..
1541111212211111112111112112212211.title: A dark offer.

15411112122111111121111121122122111.content:
I was not about to let two men, regardless of who they claim to be, to just walk up to me and threaten my family like that. I was about to tell them to go to hell before I saw dad appear behind them with mom at his side, neither of them looked impressed. I decided to let them handle the situation. "I'm not going anywhere with you two without first consulting my family." firmly, I said. "Also, who are you to threaten my mom like that!?"

"They are from the Central Headquarters of Intelligence, Logistics, and Defense or CHILD." startling the two men, dad said. "It's been a long time, agent Parker."

"The last time I saw you, agent Holmes, you worked for the FBI." ice in her voice, mom said. "Still seeing shadows around every lamp post?"

"Mom? Dad?" worried, you asked. "Do you know these guys?"

"They were in their early twenties when we first tangled with them." stepping forward, dad replied. "Long story short, I was captured by the Agency and mom was assigned to brainwash me but, instead, she fell in love and I talked her into running away with me."

"We made our way to the States where we first met these... gentlemen." with a forced politeness, mom said. "They were with the FBI and somehow knew we had fled the Agency."

"They were the first solid lead we had in investigating them." serious, agent Parker said. "True, we saw an opportunity to make a name for ourselves but your parents were less than cooperative."

"I was young and scared!" angry, mom snapped. "You were a rookie agent, not knowing jack shit of what you were trying to go us against!"

"Enough!" firmly, dad said. "What does CHILD want with our son, Parker?"

"We offered him the chance to earn your wife a clean slate in exchange for his services as an operative." flatly, Parker replied. "He does not seem to like the offer."

Dad grunted. "Did you finally get your ship in the air?" with a scoff, he asked.

"Its in the air." nodding, Holmes replied. "We would have rather used its original engines, though."

"Wait a minute!" curious, you asked. "What ship!? What do you mean 'original' engines!?"

"We can tell you but only if you agree to join up." with a slight grin, Parker replied.

"Dad, you know about this?" worried, I asked.

"The original Problem Child Gang was watched by more than just local law enforcement, Travis." looking at me, dad replied. "The FBI, Interpol and the KGB were also interested in their exploits. When the gang locked horns with the agency, they opened the eyes of government law enforcement around the world."

"Thus forcing the Agency to go underground for nearly twenty years." serious, Holmes added. "We tried to recruit your father shortly after we got wind he had convinced one of their operatives to defect."

"Your mother and father made certain to fall off the grid after their first encounter with us but we managed to monitor your family's movements, from a distance." turning to me, Parker said. "However, with the Agency resurfacing and the mysterious Sykes seemingly more powerful than ever, we need strong players on our team and you fit the bill."

"What do you think, dad?" sighing, I asked.

Dad grunted. "Personally, I trust these two about as far as I can spit on them." gruff in his voice, dad replied. "However, I heard CHILD is run by a man who saved my life a few times."

I shook my head, a moan escaping my lips. What dad said was not what I wanted to hear. I was hoping he'd give me some advice as to what to do. Finally, I turned to Parker and Holmes. "I will need more than just your word before I agree to anything." firmly, I said. "I want to meet the head of this CHILD organization and hear from him. Even then... no promises."

Parker and Holmes nodded. "I believe that can be arranged." softly, Parker said.
15411112122111111121111121122122111.title: No promises.

15411112122111111121111121122122112.content:
"Go to hell..."

The two men looked shocked, "W-What did you say?"

I swatted his hand away, "I said go to hell. You know; no deal, I'm not interested, go jump of a cliff...you're choice."

Parker looked angry, "Perhaps you haven't heard us." The two men closed in, but I grabbed Parker's shirt collar.

"Oh...I heard you." I rose him from the ground, "And like I said, go to hell." I threw him into his partner. "Listen, I know my mom has done things she regrets, and I know that she only wants the best for me. But I am not letting two clowns in black suits come in here, and threaten my family." I felt a warmth pass over me, but I let it slide. I did not want to change here. "So, listen well, and listen good. Leave me, my friends, my family, and everyone else that I could have a connection to alone. Otherwise, you'll have possibly the most dangerous animal on your asses..."

I turned to leave, for they have taken too much of my time. Holmes grunted in anger, "You still cannot stop the Agency! You and your misfit friends are too unexperienced! You'll never defeat them!"

"Have faith in the youth..." I spoke back, "Before the youth decides to do something drastic. And don't bother trying to recruit my friends...I'll tell each and every one of them what you just threatened. And you, your partner, and your whole department will be on the list of enemies." I heard their footsteps as they ran out of the building. I was glad that they left, otherwise I would have to get wild.

-------

Parker and Holmes rushed out of the school. Parker looked back in anger, "Scared out of a school by a kid...pathetic..."

Holmes reached into his pockets, "Though, that child could rip us apart over twenty different ways with over fifty different animals." He pulled out his phone and started to dial a number. "Our boss should know of this."

"Are you crazy?! We failed! And that kid's going to tell all of those brats!"

"He'll join..." Holmes spoke, "They will all join. All they need...is the right amount of incentive."
15411112122111111121111121122122112.title: Denied

154111121221111111211111211221221121.content:
A few minutes later, just as I was about to enter my next class, I saw another pair of men in black business suits and sunglasses walking towards the exit. Only they were each firmly holding Megan by the wrist as they urged her along! Megan threw me a pleading look as they passed, telling me she was in trouble! With my adrenaline at an all time high, I ran passed the men and barred the exit with my body. "Stop right there!" with a growl in my voice, I commanded. "Where are you taking my girlfriend!?"

"Say nothing, Miss Connors." quickly, the first man warned.

"This does not concern you, kid." sternly, the second man said. "Step aside."

"Not happening!" fangs growing into place, I growled. "Let her go... NOW!"

"We don't have time for this." flatly, the first man said.

He nodded to the second man who drew a strange gun like device and fired before I could react. A flash of light and heavy wave of pain later, I found myself being thrown out the door. I landed in a heap, shaking from a sort of electric shock as the two men half carried, half dragged Megan passed me to an awaiting helicopter that seemed to make no noise at all. I struggled to my feet just in time to see the helicopter fly off with Megan looking out a window at me. There was a fearful look on her face and tears in her eyes which was all I needed to ignore the pain I was in. "Megan!"

I had considered calling for the others but I knew that the helicopter would be long gone before they could come running; I was on my own. With a roar of anger, I summoned all the strength I had and leaped into the air, becoming the most powerful flying creature I could think of, the classic dragon. Unfortunately, there was no time for me to worry about anyone seeing me as I took to the air. My only thought was to save Megan.

"No one kidnaps my girlfriend!" closing on the helicopter, I thought. "Those punks will dread the day they ever crossed our path!"

I fired a blast of fire across the helicopter's left side before passing it and firing another blast across its right side from the front, circling it. I could see fear on the pilot's face as he took evasive action. He pulled on the stick, sending the helicopter climbing into the clouds above so, I thought, to lose me in the haze. I followed right behind, intending to chase it down. "Hiding from me won't help you!" fuming, I thought. "I can see the heat from your engines!"

Only, as I cleared the clouds, I saw what could only have been described as a massive flying wing! The ship was the size of two Nimitz class aircraft carriers, fused together in a 'V' formation, with twin control towers in the middle where the two halves met! As I climbed higher, following the helicopter, I saw that the engines were in a huge, triangular shaped piece that filled the space between the two wings. It was an intimidating and impressive sight that sent a chill down my spine. "What the hell!" startled, I thought. "Who are these people and what do they want with Megan!?!"

I watched, almost helplessly as the helicopter came to a landing on the ship and was lowered inside with the landing pad sinking down inside. I had only seconds to decide what to do.
154111121221111111211111211221221121.title: Megan is kidnapped!

1541111212211111112111112112212211211.content:
I could not take the chance of losing the ship, as huge as it was, by flying back to get help. I was on my own and it was up to me to save Megan. Ignoring the danger I was likely placing myself into, I dived down at an angle so to miss the helicopter's primary rotary blades and flew inside to a large hangar. There was little room to fly about so I landed, hoping to keep my dragon form long enough to pull Megan to safety. I immediately noticed a small army of armed men in military uniforms running my way and fired off a stream of fire as a stern warning to keep their distance. The soldiers stopped in their tracks but remained close enough to deliver a hail of bullets, which worried me.

"Stand down!" a stern voice commanded.

"Commander on the deck!" announced a soldier. the men saluted.

Curious, I turned to see a tall and muscular man, in all black and a long black coat, causally approaching me as I stood in front of the helicopter. He had black hair and brown eyes with a face that seemed to have been carved out of stone with strong features that gave him a commanding presence. "Your girlfriend is in no danger, Mr Greenway." standing directly in front of my dragon form, he said. "Stand down, return to your human form, or I will pin you down until you run out of energy to maintain your dragon form."

Although I was exhausted, I could not help chuckle at the man's demand. "You? Pin me down?" a hiss to my voice, I asked. "That's a laugh!"

My smile quickly vanished as I noticed the guards suddenly back away from the man. I turned back to him and gasped, seeing a hundred of him standing before me! "Last chance, Mr Greenway." darkly, the man said in a hundred voices. "Stand down or be taken down."

I turned to the helicopter to see Megan still looking fearful then turned back to the man. If this was a trap, standing down could prove to be a big mistake. On the other hand, I was near exhaustion, I would not last long if I was forced to fight.
1541111212211111112111112112212211211.title: I follow them in!

15411112122111111121111121122122112112.content:
I growled at them all, I didn't care how many of them there were, they stole my girlfriend against her will. They are now forcing me to surrender for their trap. I got ready for what would come next, "I said LET HER GO!" I exhaled as massive as a stream of flames as I could. But even though, all it managed to do it burn the ground and a few soldiers behind him. The next thing I knew, I was being pummeled by the hundred men. I tried to thrash them off, but they simply multiplied. Their weight was getting heavier and heavier. My mouth was forced shut as I hit the ground, several men holding it shut. One looked to me, "We warned you..."

My eyes went to Megan, who was watching in mortal terror. I couldn't let her suffer my fate. "Megan duck!" With the last bit of freedom I had, I swung my tail to the two guards holding her. Thankfully she did as she was told, and ducked before my tail hit the two. They fell unconscious, and my efforts blocked more from coming. "Megan go! Leave now!"

"B-But...Travis..." She looked absolutely terrified.

My mouth was forced shut before I could respond to her. All I saw was the man. He smiled at me, "It is only a matter of time." More came into view, "Soon you will both be part of our organization." The sound of an engine whirling was suddenly heard. I also heard some crackles of electricity. Some of the men on my head looked back and looked terrified, "M-Men take her down!"

Before anything else could happen, streaks of electricity seemed to bolt to the soldiers. The copies of the man began to loosen, so I took advantage. As soon as they were off my line of sight, I turned back to see the horror. Megan was in her silver mannequin-like state, only this time I saw her eyes. They were glowing and filled to the brim with rage. The floor panels below her were broken off, wiring entangled her legs. Electricity flowed through her like she was a part of the ship herself. The helicopter behind her was airborne, their propellers spinning at high speeds to where it could finally be heard. "Leave. My boyfriend. ALONE!" The helicopter suddenly flew in my direction. Most of the clones fled off, but only some were knocked off by the powerful air currents. Megan directed the helicopter to where the man was separated from me. Sadly I did not have the strength anymore, my form turning human. And once again, I was in tathers for clothes, mainly pants.

I took a second look to Megan. Although I was safe, she remained her current state. Her eyes were still filled with rage as she eyed the man and his soldiers. The helicopter's tail rotor soon broke off, intentional or not, and it flew straight towards the clones. I was shocked by the amount of aggression she was showing. It was like it was not even Megan anymore. The helicopter continued to get more and more pieces off of its hull. "Megan, we need to get out of here! We need that helicopter intact!"

I spoke as loud as I could, hoping my words would go into her mind after piercing through all of the screams. Her eyes looked to me, so she did hear me. "We will leave..." Her voice seemed to take to a new tone, "After their blood paints the walls of this ship..." Her response horrified me. She directed the attention to the troopers, to where now wires were bursting through the floor panels and electrocuting them.

I couldn't stand seeing my girl like this. I needed to get her and me off the ship and get her disconnected from those wires. But she became supercharged with electricity from them. Then, my mind clicked with an idea. It was a longshot, possibly with a greater chance at death than life. But I couldn't let my girlfriend became a killer. With the last bit of energy I had left, I charged straight towards her while transforming. I took the form of the only animal I could have thought of that could withstand electricity, an electric eel. I crashed straight into her, thankfully disconnecting her from the floor. Sadly, that was out only connection. My tackle caused us both to fall out of the open hangar doors, plummeting to the ground miles below. Even more, I felt my energy sap away as I could hardly stay awake anymore. My eyes closed from the lack of energy.
15411112122111111121111121122122112112.title: Last Chance

154111121221111111211111211221221121121.content:
I woke up, surprised to be alive, and found that I was lying on a small but comfortable cot. I slowly sat up to find that I was inside a large round glass cage. Outside of the cage was the tall man in all black with Megan at his side. She looked at me sadly but managed a smile. The man, however, remained serious as he approached the glass.

"Glad to see you're finally awake, Mr Greenway." politely, he said. "Your little tantrum stirred quite a ruckus on my ship." he then turned to Megan. "Your loss of control didn't help matters any, Miss Connors but I'll let you help explain things to your boyfriend."

Megan walked up to the glass, placing her hand onto the door. I stood uneasily and walked over, placing my hand against the glass. "How did we get back on the ship?" worried, I asked. "Did they hurt you?"

"Easy, Travis." calmly, Megan said. "I came with these people willingly. My father is with us too."

"What!?" surprised, I asked. "Then what was with your attack on the soldiers?"

"Those were energy clones, not living people." serious, Megan said. "However, they are just as solid and as heavy as real people." she cringed. "I feared they might crush you so I cried to the ship for help only something happened."

"What happened?" worried, I asked.

"There was some kind of feed back." wincing, Megan replied. "I completely lost control of myself." she moaned then added, "Blitzkrieg said that my power was likely incomparable with the ship."

"Is that what Mr multiple personality calls himself?" scoffing, I asked.

"We are the Central Headquarters of Intelligence, Logistics, and Defense; CHILD." stepping forward, Blitzkrieg said. "The idea was to entice you to follow Megan in since those sent to recruit you used a less desirable approach."

"Why us?" focusing on Blitzkrieg, I asked. "How did you save us from falling to Earth?"

"We didn't fall anywhere, Travis." wincing, Megan replied. "We both passed out on inner deck." pausing, she added, "You must have dreamed that."

"We work to protect and maintain efforts towards a world balance and peace." serious, Blitzkrieg said. "The Agency is threatening that balance by building a small army of super powered individuals."

"So you need super powered people of your own to correct that balance." guessing, I said.

"Specifically, they need super powered individuals who've had experience in dealing with the Agency." chiming in, Megan said. "My dad thinks both they and we can use all the help we can get."

"Its only a matter of time, Mr Greenway." looking at me, Blitzkrieg said. "You and your girlfriend will both be a part of our organization."

"What makes you think we will ever join you?" annoyed, I asked.

Blitzkrieg walked away from the cage, He then hit a button on a control panel, opening the cage door. "I never said anything about you joining us." simply, he said. "We need you and I can guarantee you will be needing us." he walked back to face me. "The Agency is gearing up for something huge and we need to be ready for when they strike!"

I turned to Megan who winced before giving me a nod. "Alright, you got my attention." softly, I said.

Blitzkrieg nodded. "Let's get straight down to business." he said. "Follow me to the conference room."
154111121221111111211111211221221121121.title: Welcome to CHILD.

154111121221111111211111211222.content:
I was about to say something, but a sudden click caught my hearing. It was a gun, the guy on the roof top must have a silencer. But that was not the worst thing I heard. I heard a loud shrill scream, a very familiar one. My heart sank as the color ran from Garth's face. "Someone got shot!" stating the obvious, he said."

Without hesitation, I jumped out the same window I was thrown through and ran to the front of the school but stopped. What I saw was devastating, Megan was lying on the ground! I ran to her and began to check for signs of life, I heard little heartbeat and small breathing, her body felt cold. Sam had vanished into an alley, only to shortly return, now back to normal. Garth showed had immediately followed me, also back to normal, not that I cared at the time.

"...Megan...?" I asked while trembling. She had a deep wound in her chest, the sound of her heartbeat left me and I could not tell if she was breathing or not. "That man, he did this!" My mind was running wild only this time I did not fight it. I ran away from the group, towards the building we saw the man Sam called Mayweather, wanting to tear him limb from limb. My power rose with my anger and sorrow. As I entered an alley to climb the fire escape to the building roof, I felt my body shift into a new form, it was that of a tiger. I felt more muscle in this form. Growls escaped my mouth, and I did nothing to stop them. Unknown to me, Garth and Sam were on my tail, looking worried, but did I care? Not really. My anger spiked as I saw the man, coming down the same fire escape.

"You're dead!" I shouted towards the rooftop. The man, climbing down, seemed surprised as he looked down at my feline form. A thin smile formed on my face as I caught the scent of his fear. "You heard me, YOU ARE DEAD, MAYWEATHER!"

The man scrambled back up, sweat dripping from his forehead, giving me another smile. Silly prey...he believes he can outrun me.

I lurched for the first rung of the ladder to climb up but I was suddenly grabbed my two massive hands. Garth held me tightly, causing me to struggle to get free. "Let me go!" I shouted. "That human must pay for his deed!"

"Travis, control yourself." Sam said calmly. "He's long gone."

"HE KILLED MY MATE AND YOU WANT ME TO CALM DOWN?!"

"She's not dead."

Lies! They just want him for themselves! Fight them! came a voice in my head.

*No dear wild one, she is fine. Her father is correct, she is still alive.*

I knew that voice. I heard her before in the hospital room. "...Zoe...?" I said aloud.

Don't listen to her! She's trying to trick you! Kill the man who killed your mate! came the mad voice again.

*Travis...please be at peace. If Megan were to be deceased, I would be gone too, no? I am her symbiont, when she dies I die...*

No! No...no... the voice in my head died down to complete silence as logic began to prevail.

I felt my senses coming back to me and I stopped struggling. Sam and Garth were looking at me with concern. "Travis...are you okay?" Garth asked.

"...Yeah..." I managed to spill out. "Y-You....can let me go now..." Garth put me down and shrank down a bit. I held my head, "Uh...that was brutal..."

"What's wrong?" Sam asked.

"I think...I think I'm losing it. For a second there, I heard someone else in my head. Only it wasn't me, I had a fight my feral instincts again...." I stood up a bit, "But this time...I won, thanks to Zoe."

"Just like that boy at the mall." whispering, Garth said. "It can't be a coincidence."

"Let's hope you can keep doing that." firmly, Sam said. "You are staying home today, IO want to run a full number of tests on you."

When we returned to the school, I saw Megan, awake again, though barely, being loaded into an ambulance. I ran to her and took her hand, happy she was still alive. "I called for this ambulance but its going to the clubhouse." whispering carefully, Sam said. "The hospital is not safe for any of us right now."
154111121221111111211111211222.title: Feral Instincts

1541111212211111112111112112222.content:
Back at the house, Sam was performing a surgery on Megan. I watched carefully as he removed the bullet. What was weird was that the bullet seemed flat; like it hit a wall or something. The other thing that was weird was that her skin already seemed to start closing up.

I turned away, I couldn't stand looking at her anymore. I promised to protect her, and all I did was make her an easier target. I caused her pain, I made her an easy target, how could I ever be called even her boyfriend?!

"Travis...?" I turned to the voice, surprisingly I saw my mother. "Travis...it's okay dear..." She sat next to me and gently hugged me. "You cannot blame yourself..."

"But it was me!" I shouted at her. I made sure she saw my face, "See my scar? Sam gave me a few of them to remind myself that I cannot hurt Megan! At the school, me running around scaring the others away only opened her up for a clear shot! I'm a failure as a friend, and an even bigger failure if I was her boyfriend!"

My mother gasped, and I knew why. I quickly forgot about my scar. This morning I hid it from her. But the cover washed off. Sam walked through the door, I got up. "How is..."

"Relax Travis..." he said quickly. "She's half alien. Megan's unconscious at the moment, but she will be fine. Now...I would like for you to come with me for your own tests."

I watched as my mom walked up to him before slapping him across the face. "You better fix what's wrong with my son. We'll talk later about those scars..."

She walked away mad, leaving Sam to stare at me confused. I shrugged, "It's a long story..."

I entered a separate room to where Megan was. It was all white, like a common hospital room. In the middle was what looked like an MRI. "Lay on this and I'll scan your mind."

I did as he asked and approached the machine. But he stopped me. "To get better results, I believe you should change into the animal from before."

I nodded, shifting my form into a tiger. Sam looked...it wasn't surprised but more like intrigued. "Is there...something wrong...?" I asked.

"This form..." he started, "You're...taller. Yes, you seem to have increased in height and in muscle build. But let's fix one problem at a time."

I laid on the bed just as he instructed. I slowly moved into the machine, seeing a couple of lights flash on me and scan. What I couldn't get over was his comment. Was I really different? The machine stopped and I was let out.

"The results will be in soon. I believe Megan should be well enough for you to see her."

I took no time into running over. I opened the door into the next room. I hoped Megan wasn't to upset.
1541111212211111112111112112222.title: Reactions

choices: She has a royal flush...Travis loses
15411112122111111121111121122221.content:
As soon as I entered the room I exclaimed "Megan!" Her reaction was shock, but then she eased up. First thought: coming in as a tiger was not the best idea. But, I ran to her bed. "Megan...I'm... I'm sorry I wasn't there to protect you" I said. "I had to scare off the others, but I only made you more of a target. I..." I tried to hold a tear back but it fell, "I'm so sorry..."

I did not want to see her face. I broke a promise. If she wasn't alien then she would have died. Even more so I lost control of myself again. I shouldn't even deserve to be with her. However she thought otherwise. I suddenly felt her arms around me.

"Travis..." she raised my head with her hand so we were eye level. "I do not blame you for this. If you never did anything, you or maybe even an innocent kid could have been killed. I'm tougher than I look."

I smiled. "Besides..." Megan gently scratched behind my ear, a purr escaped from the good feeling. "I don't mind seeing you wild. But we just have to play it safe." She stopped after a bit. Sure I was sad the feeling was gone, but I understood why. She rubbed her head on my arm, "Your fur is so soft..."

I chuckled, "So are your hands..."

After our little make up, I helped Megan up. She was still shaky so I helped her walk. Her father was worried about this, but she convinced him otherwise. Today we were able to stay another day. School apparently was still happening. Megan and I just decided to play a simple card game. If I lost, I would have to change into an animal of her choice and do something. If I won, well I didn't decide right on then. But, she allowed it.

I dealt the cards, we were playing Blackjack. The game was always still fun even if you weren't gambling. I smiled as I laid down a flush. I was still in tiger form but she didn't mind. "Beat that Mech..." I said slyly.
15411112122111111121111121122221.title: Megan is fine

154111121221111111211111211222212.content:
Megan's pokerface disappeared into a big smile. She laid down her cards, royal flush. I couldn't believe it, the one hand that could beat mine. I sighed, "A deal is a deal" I changed back to human, "What do you want?"

She looked at me slyly. "I think I know what..." I grew nervous; who knew what she had planned. "I want you to turn into...an Anthro Arachnid!"

I was a bit shocked, but mostly confused. Why did she want me to become a human/spider hybrid? "Megan...I'm not so sure about that" uncertain, I said. "I can't really change into anything else but mammal forms; I don't think my body is ready for it."

"But you said that you would try to improve right?" pressing, Megan asked. "Plus you were going to try to expand your capabilities. And from what I heard, you changed into a cobra AND an eagle!"

"That was a male version of a Naga and a Garuda." correcting her, I said. "An Anthro Arachnid is a far cry from either of those. Do you know what the difference is?"

Megan pouted but she suddenly frowned. Her eyes welled up and tears began to form. I panicked, it was the puppy dog face. I wanted to turn and walk away but I couldn't. She looked so...helpless. Unknown to me, Megan was a reluctant participant in a test on me by her father.

I sighed, "Alright, I'll do it..." to her smile, I said. "But I need to remove some clothing, I don't want to ruin my pants."

Megan nodded in agreement. I walked into the bathroom, took off my pants and undergarments, and then focused on becoming a humanoid spider. At first, nothing happened but then, I could feel my skeleton changing, almost breaking. It hurt, it hurt along and I was forced to grit my teeth as my buttocks grew outward and another pair of legs and feet shot out before my torso stretched and another pair of arms and hands shot out, giving me eight limbs! The pain was bad but it subsided and I felt a warmth coursing through me.

"Well...that wasn't so..." I was unable to finish my thought as a new pain hit my entire face. It felt like I was hit with a concrete block. I couldn't contain it, I screamed in anguish. The pain stopped just as fast as it came and I took a few deep breaths to steady myself.

"Travis?" knocking on the door, Megan asked. "Are you okay?"

I managed to stand, having four legs now, I really needed to reestablish my balance. I took a look in the mirror to get a first look at myself. The first thing I noticed was the hard shell-like plates that ran across my body. Next thing, I had eight eyes. Two were my own, turned red within red, with three smaller eyes in a triangular formation around each one. Lastly, I noticed that my canine teeth had grown into large fangs that looked like pincers. I slowly twisted the doorknob to get out. I was greeted by Megan's worried face. But it changed to one of shock mixed with slight...excitement, at least I hoped. "So...how do I look?"

Megan led me to a full body mirror. I followed without question; I wanted to see what I look like. As I moved, I felt the significant change in my walk. Spiders have a very good sense of balance; my body barely moved compared to a human. I stood before in mirror in awe. My lower body was an entire spider abdomen but with only four legs as I had four arms, eight limbs total. By my coloration, it was hard to tell what kind of spider it was. But I looked exotic, truly a sight to behold. "Whoa..." is all I said.

Megan hugged me, "You look perfect for Halloween!" She separated and focused on my legs, "Hey, do you think you can do all a spider can?"

I stepped away from her, "To be honest, I don't know." I gently approached the wall. I raised my leg and placed it against the wall. Strangely, I felt it stick. I placed another, the same thing happened. Soon, my entire body was vertical with the wall. The world looked strange sideways. I continued to the ceiling. The world looked even weirder upside down.

"Enjoying yourself?" Megan joked.

"Laugh all you want" I said. I scurried across the ceiling, "I'm loving being a spider."

"Glad your liking that, because that's what you'll be doing." okay, now I was confused. The only reason she asked me to be a spider, was to crawl on the ceiling? I crawled closer to her as her smile widened. "I want you to prank my dad."

I gulped, "Uh...what...?"

"You heard me, I want to prank my dad. And this is the perfect way to do it. When your above him, spray him with your silk."

I crawled back down to the floor. I approached her, "Megan, you expect me to pull a prank on your dad? I'm not even sure if I can-" she suddenly jabbed me in the throat. It hurt, bad. I began to cough, but something else came up. On the ground, was white webbing.

"Can't do it?" Megan looked at me slyly. "A deal is a deal right?"
154111121221111111211111211222212.title: Impossible Prank part 1

1541111212211111112111112112222121.content:
Once again, I sighed with defeat. The ceilings were pretty high, so I should be able to do it without trouble. "Fine...I'll...I'll do it."

Megan embraced me with a smile but that only lasted for a few seconds. I made my way back to the ceiling and made my way to the next room. Megan helped me with the first door but she stopped after that. I was alone on this mission.

Being upside down wasn't as weird as you think. It's kind of nice actually, however I was also half arachnid so it could have been that.

"I wish I knew where he was..." I said. I went through a lot of common rooms, but I have not even found a trace of him. The ceilings were pretty high, enabling me to move without detection. But I was beginning to get bored, so I changed tactics. I crawled to the corner of the ceiling and waited. It felt odd, but something happened.

I was spitting silk. It was like I was fine one moment, but then next thing I knew I was stringing yet another web. I stopped entirely. It was weird, but now the corner had a decent sized web in the corner. I sat down on it, and it suddenly became very comfortable. No wonder spiders always made webs.

But it occurred to me, how did I know how to make a web? My instincts seemed to be overtaking me or something. I shouldn't be learning that fast. Maybe I should use that device. I mean, yeah I have some control but if I'm going to perform an instinct is going to happen every new form I have, I might even loose myself.

A click of a door opening hit my ears (if I had any). I then took notice of the room; it was the kitchen. Megan's father entered in a humming tune. Ah man...I can't ruin his good mood.

However what came next was unprepared for both me and him. A stray stream of silk must have trailed off, because his hand caught onto it. He tugged and pulled, trying to get it off. That's when it happened, instincts took over. I could feel my body beginning to move. No! Not again! Mr Connors look out!

But I couldn't speak. I could only watch helplessly. I pounced on him, pinning his arms and legs to the ground using my limbs. I immediately spat silk to hold him down. "Travis?! What's the meaning of this?!"

"You're in my web...silly little pest..." That voice, it was not mine in the slightest. I leaned down closer to his neck. The prey was moving to much. My fangs, they were ready."

"Travis NO!" I stood up and turned, but I only met a silver light. In one hit peas knocked off of Sam and knocked out.

-----------

When I came to, I was lying on the kitchen floor. Megan, her parents, and my parents were all looking at me. Each one had a different emotion; Megan with sadness, my parents with concern, Megan's mom with worry, but I couldn't tell Sam's emotion. I hate to bet against him; his poker face was amazing.

"W-What...happened?" I slowly sat up, rubbing my head. The headache was bad. I was rushed into a hug from Megan and my mom. The pain went away.

"Travis...we need to talk." My attention was now on Sam Connors. "These actions have occurred more than once, and your body cannot take another one." I was handed the makeup mirror my mother had. My skin, it was paler than ever before. It could almost be called snow white. "You're focusing on getting more forms than to practice and control what you already have."

I sighed in defeat. "Mom...you still have that device I gave you?" She quickly reached into her purse and handed me the device. It was the device Megan's father gave me. I instantly put it over my left wrist. Hopefully when I go out in public people will just think it's some weird watch. "Your right...my body is losing it. And I know that I'm not ready for it. I'm not instantly going to be a superhero, especially if I'm training like this. So, I'm going to wear this from now on."

"Good decision...now then, let us eat."

Megan helped me up, "You made dinner while I was unconscious?"

She only giggled, answering my question. What was weird was that my body felt different. No idea why, but I couldn't do it on an empty stomach.

The meal was delicious, although I could not think that they never truly "cooked" the meal. It was simply spaghetti and meatballs. And whatever was in it made me tired. It was either that or my body finally giving out. With a few finals hugs from my mom, I retired to my room. I slipped into my sleepwear and quickly fell asleep.
1541111212211111112111112112222121.title: Impossible Prank part 2: Trouble

choices: Next morning, Travis talks to Megan of his nightmare
He keeps it secret, but something else happens
15411112122111111121111121122221212.content:
When I awoke, I felt terrible. I felt dirty and sore like I was sleeping on a filthy metal floor. Light poured onto my eyes, blinding me for a bit. I shot up and shielded my eyes. That's when I noticed, once my vision cleared I saw scales. I could feel it, my long tail and the hood on my head; I was in my cobra naga form. I tried to shift back, but I could barely change at all.

Another bright flash of light blinded me for a few seconds. "No flash photography, it could startle the beast" a voice spoke. I rubbed my eyes to look. First thing, I was in a cage. A full metal, filthy, cage. Second, I was at the zoo. Thirdly, I was huge! I mean, I was coiled up and it seemed like I could almost touch the edges of my cage. Another flash, This is getting really annoying... "Mam, I'm going to have to ask you to remove the camera from your daughter."

I looked out, seeing three people. One zookeeper, one woman, and one little girl. I was completely confused to why I was here. "Uh...hello?" I attempted to ask. But the only thing that came out  was a hiss. The little girl backed up in fear. "What's going on?" again, all that came out was a hiss. I grabbed the bars and tried to pull them a bit. Suddenly, a painful shock was delivered through my body. I released the bars and fell back.

"You would think this thing would have learned by now..." the zookeeper mumbled. 

I couldn't believe this, I was a animal in the zoo. This...this had to be a nightmare. The three left the cage, but someone else came. It was Megan! "Megan!" I slithered to the edge and grabbed the bars. "You have to help me! Please!" But sadly, all that came out were hisses.

She glared at me horribly, "Hiss all you want Travis, you're not getting out." I couldn't believe it, why was I even here? "We're done with you, all of us."

The direction she gestured I followed. The rest of the Problem Child Gang were there. They all stared at me in anger. What did I do...? I knew I couldn't talk, but I just hissed instead.

Megan turned away in response. She seemed to be trembling, but that was just my imagination probably. She started to walk away, but I couldn't let her. I threw my tail and got her leg. She stared at me in horror, "Help! Someone please help!" I've never seen that much fear in her eyes before. The same shock was delivered, but this one was three times as strong. Not only that, I felt like I was being jabbed by something sharp. The pain forced my eyes shut, it was too much, I had to retreat. Although it hurt, nothing hurt more than seeing Megan walk away; with her hand as a knife covered in blood. She...she stabbed me...and she took control of the cage...M-Megan...?

I couldn't tell what hurt worst, my tail or my heart. Megan left me, the gang left me, and I think I saw my parents in that group. Moist tears fell from my eyes as I sat there, lying on my own body. I heard the laughs, I heard the names, I felt whatever was thrown, but I didn't care. It felt like hours, thats when I felt a sinister presence.

"Hello...Travis..." I turned and saw a man wearing a suit and coat. The hat was tipped to hide his face. Something about him seemed, evil. "I'm a traveling representative for the Agency."

At the sound of the name, I turned my head. This weird feeling passed through my mind, the world went blurry for a few seconds, but I pushed it aside. "I'm not interested." I do not know why I spoke, but I really didn't care about that anyway.

"You never gave me a chance to explain..." I gasped,  "Yes, I can understand you. You would be surprised what we can do."

"You mean kidnap kids, kill their parents, and force them for your own tasks?"

"Well, that seems so good compared to what they did to you." I couldn't help it, but he sound convincing. He kept urging me to listen to him. "Instead of helping you return to normal, they set you aside like an animal. Especially the one you held dear..."

I...I couldn't let him into my head; something wasn't right. "W-Why do you care?"

"Oh dear Travis, I care for you. You have more power than you know." I turned to him, slightly interested. "You can change to any animal you want, but deep inside of you is your true form, a form that can best all of them. And besides, don't you want to meet your other relative?" I couldn't believe what I was hearing. "If you cone and join us, I'll be to assure you that we can make your life better." The man stuck his hand out to me, "You have my word. Do we have a deal?" I looked at his hand carefully. Before anything else happened, it all went black.

===============

I woke up in a startle. I was back in the room they provided for me. The clock read 3am. Truly I was shocked. I didn't know if that was a nightmare, a dream, a vision, or all three. But that man, he spoke things that I could not get out of. My true form, did I really have one? Plus the mentioning of a relative, did I have one? The worst part of it was, I felt like accepting his deal.
15411112122111111121111121122221212.title: The Nightmare

choices: Megan and I study the dream alone.
Megan and I call the team.
154111121221111111211111211222212121.content:
I walked out of my bedroom, shaking slightly, only to find Megan shaking as well. "A nightmare?" she asked me.

"Yeah, it- it was horrible." tearing up, I said. "I was in a cage at Creator Zoo, put on display for everyone to see me."

"I saw myself in a cage too." crying, Megan said. "I saw you try to save me only to explode into flames!" she covered her face, crying. "Then a man in a business suit came to me with an offer... I had the same dream."

I gulped, hearing that. "In my dream, you said you were done with me and walked away, leaving me alone until a man in a business suit came to me with an offer." crying slightly, I said. "It was not the same dream."

Megan looked at me for a moment before becoming thoughtful. "We both had a nightmare with the same theme, with the same ending, but different details." rubbing her chin, she mussed. "It can't be a coincidence."

"What do you think it is?" curious, I asked.

After a moment of thought, Megan grabbed my hand and pulled me along with her. "I remember something odd about the nightmare, Travis." running, she said. "We have to talk to your mom."

"What for?" running with her, I asked.

"My nightmare was a bit fuzzy, like a television station that was not quite coming in." reaching the first floor of her house, Megan explained. "Did you notice that as well?"

"Sort of." not making the connection, I said. "Why?"

"Just trust me." pulling me into the family room, Megan said.

Upon running in, we were greeted by a concerned mom and dad who were talking to Mr and Mrs Connors. "Where's the fire, Megan?" standing up, Steve asked.

"Mrs Greenway, you can alter reality to a point, right?" out of breath, Megan asked.

"Well, yes." taken back, Crystal said. "I try not to use it though, why?"

Megan and I began to describe the nightmare we had shared, with the differences between them. "I have a gut feeling that there is a message in that nightmare." finishing her story, Megan said.

"I am in tune with the animal kingdom, being able to change into any creature." chiming in, I said. "Megan is an alien/human hybrid." he winced. "No offense."

"None taken." shrugging, Megan replied. "Bottom line, Mrs Greenway, it is possible that we are receiving a psychic message between the two of us."

"Highly unlikely." frowning, Sam said. "However, in a dream like state, the mind is more open to psychic signals."

Crystal sighed. "Stand side by side, you two." firmly, she ordered. "I will try to 'project' your nightmares on the wall like a movie, played on the big screen."

Megan and I did as we were told and Crystal placed a light hand onto our heads from behind before a replay of our nightmares played onto the wall, side by side. "There does seem to be something there." curious, Crystal said. "Let's try something here..."

Megan and I watched, uncertain as the two images came together, overlapping. Once it was done, everyone's jaws opened to see a small boy and a small girl standing where there was once no one. The boy seemed fairly fit with short raven hair and brown eyes. The girl, who seemed younger, was very petite with doll like features; she had auburn hair and green eyes. Both of them had sad, desperate looks on their faces.

“Please... Please, someone help us.” crying, the boy called out. "Can anyone hear me!?"

"Help us!" also crying, the girl called out. "Please... Please someone hear me!"

"Its a call for help." almost whispering, I said.

Then a man from Megan and my nightmare appeared behind them. "There is no escape." coldly, he said.

Almost upon instinct, I changed into an anthro lion with a long black mane and roared at the image of Jon. With me, Megan gave a an angry grunt as every car horn within a hundred yards of the house angrily sounded off, equally matching my roar. "We hear you!" not knowing if my voice reached them, I said.

"We will help you!" added Megan.

We then sounded in unison, "Problem Child!"

Our mission had begun.
154111121221111111211111211222212121.title: Not a nightmare, a call for help!

1541111212211111112111112112222121211.content:
I felt my mother's hand come off my head and turned as a result. "Mom, do you think you can put our nightmares on something? Like a CD or disc or something like that?"

"Well...I could" Crystal spoke, "But why?" Megan and I looked at each other strongly. I heard my mother gasp, "On no Travis...y-you can't! At least call the other members!"

"I have to side with Crystal on this one Travis" Sam agreed. "You still have no proper control of your powers, while Megan is still trying to find all of hers."

"And the other members are just as skilled" I argued. "Sam, Crystal, I honor and respect both of you. But we will never get the chance to get better if we don't do this." I sighed as I shifted back to human form, "Could we at least look at the nightmares? We will call the team afterwards if we find anything."

My mother faced Megan's dad with concern. With a reassuring nod, I once again felt my mothers hand on my forehead. A small jolt passed through me, but in her other hand formed a disc. Megan walked over, and the same thing happened. After we each received our discs they wished us luck.

According to Megan, this place had a media room. To be honest I think she was better with her powers. Since this entire home was a machine, I guess she could navigate it easier. When we reached it, I couldn't believe my eyes. It was like every gamer's dream; flat screens, surround sound, plush seats, it was truly amazing. Megan mentioned that the screen can become as large as a movie theater screen. I told her that we don't need that.

"So...which one should we look at first?" I looked to Megan who seemed nervous for her's to be picked first. I did not like mine either, but her's was obviously more traumatic.

I walked up, slipped my disc into the DVD player, and then prepared for it. Experiencing a nightmare is one thing, telling someone about it was another, but showing someone what exactly happened was a complete other story. It started on the big screen as all black. Then the first flash happened, clearing the video. I heard Megan giggle when she saw the little girl and the camera. I couldn't help but to chuckle as well; it was a cute moment. But then, we got to THAT part. I couldn't help but cry again at what Megan said in the nightmare, even though the real Megan was beside me. Then I heard her gasp at when I was attacked by the dream Megan. I couldn't stand to watch it again; I turned away and sobbed for a bit. I heard the video stop and a gentle hand on my back.

"Travis, it's okay" she spoke. "You know I will never do that to you..."

"But..." I was silenced by a gentle kiss on my cheek. My face flushed red right afterwards, I could feel the heat. "Uh...c-can we..."

"Watch the rest?" I nodded since she already finished the sentence. With another small giggle, she restarted the video. We were both surprised by the man's offer. Megan was more surprised on two accounts; that is what happened in her nightmare too, and that I was beginning to extend my hand. "You were...going to...accept?" she asked.

"Well..." I couldn't lie, "I was..."

"Travis why?!" she gasped. "They are..."

"The ones that have my cousin." Megan was silenced, "I know it could be just the message playing tricks, but that did not sound joking. If that was real, I was going to join so I could save him and anyone else in there. I would sacrifice myself for any of those kids, any member of the team, I would even sacrifice myself for you..."

A moment of silence passed through the room. The video even seemed quiet, or it could have been Megan's doing. We were soon both embraced into a hug. It was definitely going to be a long night filled with emotional drama. Thank goodness we were both excused from school. We decided to stay on this video. But I wondered why.

"There could be clues hidden here" she explained.

I nodded and watched the film. She was right, there would be a way to tell where they were.
1541111212211111112111112112222121211.title: Nightmare Review

15411112122111111121111121122221212111.content:
I looked at the screen and noticed that the image of Megan was distorted slightly. "I wonder." moving the mouse, I said.
placing the two videos onto each other again, I saw a third video being played. "There's a video hidden in our dreams!" excited, I announced. "We must have just caught the tail end of it!"

"Then let's play it from the beginning." reaching for the mouse, Megan said.

He hand touched mine and we both blushed but I allowed her to guide my hand as she clicked on a few options in the play back program before clicking on play. The images from both nightmares vanished and we saw a black screen before the image of the boy and the girl appeared on the screen.

"My name is Tommy Winters." introducing himself, the boy said.

"My name is Aura Winters." introducing herself, the little girl said.

"If you are receiving this message, please listen carefully, we do not have much time." quickly, Tommy said. "My sister and I are being held against our will by a group called, The Agency."

"They are using what we can do to hurt people... kill people we don't know." tearfully, Aura said.

"Twenty years ago, The Agency was defeated by a brave and powerful group known as the Problem Child Gang." speaking quietly but clearly, Tommy said. "If you can find them..." he paused, crying, then blurted out, “Please... Please, someone help us! Can anyone hear me!?"

"Help us!" also crying, Aura called out. "Please... Please someone hear me!"

Then the man from both Megan's and my dream appeared behind them. "There is no escape." coldly, he said.

With that, the screen went black. "They had been caught, sending a call for help." crying, Megan said.

"I refuse to believe they are dead." clenching a fist, I said. "There has to be a way to find them!"

After a moment of thought, Megan touched the computer tower. "Please...." tears falling, she whispered. "Help me find Tommy and Aura Winters."

Almost instantly, the monitor came to life with image after image flashing into view as the computer searched the web. At the same time, hers and my cellphones began to do the same. Unknown to us, the computer before us had contacted the computer next door and it began to search as well. Watching the monitor, I came up with an idea of my own but I had no idea weather or not it would work.

"I saw this in a movie once but that's a movie." running outside, I muttered to myself. "It's crazy but anything is better than nothing at all." I sat down in the front yard and placed my hand onto the ground, whispering,. "Mother Earth, hear my plea... help me find my cousins, Tommy and Aura Winters."

At first, nothing happened but then, I began to see through the eyes of a cat nearby then a hawk, high above the city before I saw through the eyes of a dog in front of Our Founders Mall. The animals were searching from where they stood and, if they saw nothing, they moved the message on. "Incredible..." awestruck, I thought. "I'm connected to a natural world wide web!"

One would think I would be excited by this discovery when, in fact, it humbled me. I had thought my power was so complex when it was actually quite simple. I was one with nature itself... "I'm an Animancer." whispering, I said.

*Focus, wild one.* came Zoe's voice in my head. *You do not wish to be 'logged out'.*

I smiled, finally realizing what I truly was, and focused on finding my cousins. It was now just a matter of weather I or Megan will find them first.
15411112122111111121111121122221212111.title: I find a clue first

154111121221111111211111211222212121111.content:
I switched between animal to animal, creatures big and small, trying to locate them. I needed to find them, they were my cousins. I don't know why my parents never told me, but at this point I did not care. Then, I saw them. "Megan!" I shouted. "Megan get out here quick!"

I did not want to lose the connection I had, so I stayed with my hand on the ground. I heard someone run out of the home, followed by a few others. "Travis" I heard Megan, "What's wrong?!"

"I see them!" I exclaimed.

"Y-You found them?!" Crystal spoke. "H-How?!"

"Well...from what I can tell, there's a spider in their room."

I wasn't lying, I had like eight different ways of looking at Tommy. There was a television in his room, showing a video feed of his sister, Aura, being tortured. I felt sorry for him, but even more for the Agency. I growled, knowing what I would do to the Agency. Once I get them, I'll tear them apart limb by limb in front of their boss.

"T-Travis..." Megan spoke, "Y-You're changing..."

It was a bit late, but I indeed felt part of the change take place. I shifted into a lion, strangely with the black mane and dark coat. But I still held the connection. "I can still see them, I just wish I knew where they were" I spoke aloud.

Suddenly my vision shifted and began to move; whatever animal's eyes I was looking through was moving. Based on the sideways angle of the room, I could now determine that I was looming through the eyes of a spider. It stopped at a small hole where I saw the face of a rat. My vision shifted again, this time looking through the eyes of the ray. It darted back into the darkness before appearing on the floor of a room. The strangest part was that I was slightly feeling the movement myself. The room held a work desk and comfortable chair along with two normal chairs facing it. The rat hopped onto the chair and then onto the desk. Did they...did they hear me? The rat shifted through the papers lying on the desk. Then, he stopped at one, giving me what I needed. My vision blacked out after that.

I woke up outside, surrounded by Megan, my parents, and her parents. Before I had the chance to sit up I was hugged by Megan. A quick check showed that I was human again. "Don't get up too fast" Sam said, "You took a lot of energy out of you."

I sat up with the aid of Megan. "I...I know where they are..." But before I finished, I faced my parents. They looked a bit distressed. "Mom, dad, we need to talk."

"I know Travis, I know..." Crystal spoke quite sadly.
154111121221111111211111211222212121111.title: I find them first.

1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.content:
After things were cleared up, we all gathered inside to the common area. The house had all of the places I seen are hidden beneath. The house was truly a common house; but it could be a base of operations truly.

My mother looked a little distressed, since nearly every being in the room was focusing on her. "Travis, Megan, you two are wondering how Tommy and Aura fit into this" Crystal spoke. "Travis, what I am going to say might be hard. You see, I had...a twin sister." I couldn't believe it; well I knew something had to fit together but still, I had an aunt? "She, unlike me, was normal. Her side of genetics contained nothing for her to develop powers. But..."

"But...what?" I asked.

"She still carried the traits. Her children, Tommy and Aura, received them. They were both born with significant powers, making her family a double target for the agency." The next part looked tearful for her, since I could already see tears beginning to form. "They went on a small trip together, a family vacation" she started in a sad tone. "Their room was payed for, by some man. They took it, only to...find..." Crystal cried into her hands before she could finish.

I knew it was too painful to continue, but I understood the rest. Her sister and husband died because of the Agency, and their two children were captured. I walked over, sat down beside her, and embraced her in a hug. My father joined in soon after, my mother calming down.

Suddenly the window behind us broke, two things landed on the floor. Our embrace broke as everyone's attention was gained. The two objects beeped slightly. Sam jumped up, "Everyone duck!"

A small explosion of light and smoke exploded in the living room. The lights went out as well, darkening the room. My eyes changed, adjusting so I could easily see through the smoke and dark. "Megan! Where are you?!"

A few coughs caught my attention. I was able to see her, she was pinned under a chair. I made my way over to her. I grabbed her hand to reassure her it was me before I helped her up. To my surprise, her eyes had changed as well only she seemed to have almost glass eyes with what looked like mechanical parts. I knew then that she too was able to see through the smoke and dark only she was very frightened and confused. We ran down the hall into a bedroom where we paused to rest. "T-Travis..." she spoke, "W-What's going on?"

She was obviously scared, I was too. But I had to be brave. We heard more commotion; the door was kicked down and footsteps entered. "Find the kids" one spoke. "We can take care of the parents later."

Megan gasped but I covered her mouth. She breathed quickly, the lights flickered from her fear. She needed to calm down. I slowly rubbed her back, while hugging her. Her breathing settled as she finally became quiet. "Travis..." she whispered, "Get ready."

The door was kicked down as one man stood with a gun towards us. "Freeze you brats!" in a threatening tone, she said. "You are now property of the Agency!"

A high whirring sounded through the hall, causing the man to turn away. "What the?" he backed away, only to get knocked of his feet by a super fast automated vacuum cleaner. We both ran out as the man hit the floor but another man stood before the kitchen door, raising a weapon of his own. Another sound of whirling mechanics caught our attention. A blender spun its blade so fast that it shot out of the glass pitcher, scaring us both. The spinning blades bounced off the ceiling and embedded itself in the man's wrist, forcing him to drop his weapon. The man howled in pain as the ice cube maker in the door of the fridge began to fire ice cubes like bullets from an automatic rifle. The man ran passed us, trying to avoid the painful ice, only to be knocked off his feet by the speeding little vacuum cleaner. He fell onto the other man.

"Travis now!" I jumped out in mid-transformation pressing the alien device on my wrist. I felt a long snake tail form and immediately wrapped up the two men. I was hoping to become a Naga, a mythological anthro snake. However there was something different. I did not feel a hood like when I was a Naga, plus my tail felt longer. In the newly acquired light, I was instead an anaconda anthro! That explained why I was so long. I adjusted myself so I had more than enough body length and tail length in-between the wrapped men.

"Alright..." Megan spoke as she approached the two wrapped men, "You two will tell us who sent you and why."

"And what will you do about it Missy?" scoffed the larger of the two.

A small frown appeared on her face but she turned to me. I think I knew what she was going to do. And I decided to play along. I nodded back, causing her to smile. "Well, I'm not going to do anything" she spoke. "But I never said he wouldn't..."

On cue, I moved to where he could see me. Even with his ski mask on I could tell he was scared. I flicked my tongue at him, barely scraping the skin. It tasted and smelled good, something in me wanted to eat them but I shook the idea out of my head. Well, not completely. "Pleasssse shall I eat them, missstresss..." I spoke in a lisp.

Megan hid her giggle as she approached the men. "I do not know, if they are going to talk-"

"We'll never talk!" the smaller man shouted. "You and your freak of nature can just go and-"

With a snap of her fingers I reacted. I bit down over the small one's head, but I did not chomp. Snakes eat their prey whole, and boy was this guy tasting good. I slowly swallowed him, already past his chest area.

"O-Okay we'll talk! We'll talk! Just call off your beast!"

Megan snapped her fingers again to play along. I spat him out, rather sad that I couldn't. No Travis...don't think like that... Sam was the first to recover while the others began to. "Release them... now." he spoke.

To further the act, Megan snapped her fingers one last time. I slowly uncoiled, the two men looked rather thankful that they were free. As the parents interrogated them, I slithered off with Megan. She playfully pushed me, "What was with the "mistress" act?"

"Well...it worked didn't it?" I asked. She rubbed between my eyes, a sweet spit for snakes. I immediately relaxed and hissed with pleasure before returning to my normal form.
1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.title: Agency sends a Gift

choices: still no one taking the bait.
1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.content:
Five minutes after Sam and Anna dragged the two attackers into the lower halls, they returned alone with a scorned look on their faces. "What happened?" rising to greet them, I asked.

"The two who attacked this house had a cyanide capsule hidden under a false tooth." flatly, Sam replied. "They killed themselves before we could get anything out of them."

"This was a 'fishing' trip." serious, mom said. "The Agency wanted to see what we were capable of before sending in the real guns to capture or take us out."

"So, what should we do?" turning from mom to Sam, I asked. "They know where you live now, Mr Connors."

"We'll simply relocate." shrugging, Sam replied. "Everyone down stairs, please."

Curious, I followed Megan down the stairs with her parents and mine to a sitting area. Once settled, Sam walked to the door leading to the stairs and closed a steel door with a wheel like hatch. "Just sit tight of a moment." walking out of the room, he said. "This will only take a minute."

Moments later, the entire room shook slightly, startling everyone present before Sam returned to the room and opened the hatch like door. "Okay, Megan, go see your new home." he said.

Megan walked up the stairs, with me behind and we all gasped, seeing a completely different house with all of their belongings set in a similar manner. "That is creepy." shivering, I muttered.

"More creepy than a boy who can become any animal?" smiling, Sam asked. "I merely teleported everything from our old hour to one that was up for sale a few miles away." he then pointed to a computer. "I have labor robots placing identical items in each room so no one will know we left."

"They won't stay long when they find out no one is home." pointing out, I said.

"Depending upon who they send, I might confront them." serious, Sam replied. "You are welcome to help, kids."

"When do you think they will strike?" curious, Megan asked.

"The computer will alert us if anyone enters." simply, Sam replied.

Later that day...
1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.title: No Interrogation.

1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.content:
The computer alerted us that there was an intruder in the now empty house and I looked at the monitors with Megan to see a small but well built boy wandering about the house. He occasionally touched an ear piece radio, muttering "No one seems to be home." Finally, he walked back to what was Megan's bedroom and placed a piece of paper onto the bed.

"It's just a kid." surprised, I said.

"Kids can be dangerous too, Travis." seriously, Sam replied. "I know this from experience."

"The mysterious child that kept following the group." shuddering, Megan muttered.

"She was one of the brainwashed soldiers under the Agency's command." nodding, mom said. "Those bastards have a small army of such kids."

"I wonder what that note is all about." watching the boy leave the house on the monitors."

Sam frowned. "Let's find out."

"Not all at once." warned mom. "Just one person with someone as back up."

Who goes in?
1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.title: someone enters the house.

1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.content:
"I'll go" I spoke out. I did not even stay to hear their refusal. I changed to a cheetah, simply to get to the "old" home. But to avoid detection I stopped the house before.

Alright Travis think... I thought to myself, I need to be an animal with great stealth. But what?

I looked to the window, seeing how most of it was now broken and out. It was a perfect way to enter. And I just remembered the perfect animal for the task. However I had to look at my wrist. The device was still clamped on. I sighed, "Hope this works." I made a mad sprint for the open window. Then I concentrated, and shifted my form.
