I became the anthro arachnid again, and I immediately shot a web to the high ceiling. I was lucky that most of my pants tore up outside.

So far so good... I stayed low to the high ceilings and crawled down the hall. I surprised myself when I could not hear my steps. It only took a few seconds to find the boy.

He appeared to be a preteen, around thirteen or fourteen. In his hands was a strange weapon. They looked like a policeman's nightstick, but with what looked like a sledgehammer's head on the end. It looked funny, but dangerous. I watched as he checked each room of the upper level. He entered back into the main room, performing another short scan of the room before sighing. He pressed against his ear, possibly an earpiece, "No one's home."

"Alright then" a voice spoke back. "Return to mobile command."

The boy did as ordered and walked out of the house. I jumped back down as soon as I sensed it to be safe. I walked out just before seeing a van drive off. "Travis!" I turned to see Megan running towards me.

"Megan, that boy is returning to their command center. This is our chance!"

"You're going to catch them as a spider?"

I saw her reasoning. Only one problem. "My pants...they're shredded." I was handed a pair, to my surprise. She simply smiled to me. I quickly changed back, put the pants on, and shifted into a cheetah again. "The boy had an earpiece" I continued. "Maybe you can-"

"Got the signal" she spoke. "Let's go."

"You're on the ball today. You sure you're not a mind reader?"

"This is serious." I could hear the flatness of her voice. She was right, I nearly forgot. This wasn't just a tracking mission, it was a rescue mission. My cousins were being held hostage. And it was our job to bust them out. "Alright, let's go." With a burst of speed, we chased after the van.
1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.title: Spider Sneak

1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.content:
I moved with incredible speed, hitting nearly seventy miles an hour with Megan effortlessly riding on my back. I had no time to look at the driver's face when we overtook the van and passed it but this was not about getting reactions, this was about results and time was not in our favor. "Its now or never, Megan." running in front of the van, I said. "There will be no turning back once we confront them."

I heard, or thought I heard, Megan gulp but her voice was steady when she replied, "Let's do it."

Nodding, I knotted my jaws and focused on my next transformation. The device on my wrist did not respond, my body did and I effortlessly changed with a dull flash into an Anthro Woolly Mammoth. I easily towered over the van as the driver, panic in his eyes, slammed on the breaks, stopping a mere inches from my massive feet. Megan, sitting on my shoulder, must have focused on the van as the doors opened on their own.

"I know you can hear me!" her voice echoing through the van's radio and the men's ear piece communicators, she said. "Step out or my boyfriend will step on you!"

I paused, stunned. "Did she say boyfriend?"

Knowing I could not allow my mind to wonder, I rose my foot. "We will not repeat our demand!" my voice booming, I said.

The driver and two others stepped out with the boy following. "Okay, we're out!" his hands raised, the first man said. "What do you want of us!?"

"Are you or are you not of the Agency!?" firmly, Megan asked.

"We don't know what you are talking about." flatly, the second man replied.

I heavily brought my foot down in front of the man and he stumbled backwards from the ground shaking. "Answer the question, you insect!" irritable, I roared.

"We- We are." stepping forward, the boy stammered. "I'd run now, if I were you."

"Silence, Bull!" snapped the first man. he then turned to Megan and I. "You two are children of the original members of the Problem Child Gang, are you not?"

"We are asking the questions here, not you!" eying the man, I thundered.

"Enough, Travis." flatly, Megan said. "Do not forget our objective."

I fell silent to that, getting the hint that Megan had a plan in mind as she then eyed the first man. "I'll get straight to the point, gentlemen." eying them, she said. "You are to take us to your leader where we will give him our demands."

The first man was silent for a moment before he gave a low, dark laugh. "Do you seriously think you two would stand a chance against us alone?"

"The four original members of our group kicked your asses alone twenty years ago." in an even tone, Megan countered. "Only that is not our objective... not yet."

"We can't take you to our 'leader' in the form your boyfriend is currently holding." calmly, the man said. "He will have to return to his human form."

"Human is overrated." darkly, I said.

The man took a step back, I knew I had unnerved him, at least as little. He only relaxed when I changed my form to an Anthro snake with Megan at my side, looking like a person of liquid metal. "You will our normal forms when we am ready to show you." in a deadly tone, Megan said. "Take us to your leader... now."

She then touched the man in the neck and he gave a yelp of pain while I touched the second man with the same result.

"What was that?" annoyed the first man asked.

"A special form of lead poisoning." softly, Megan replied. "You will get the antidote when we arrive at our destination, awake and alert."

"You got a form of snake poison." changing into my Anthro wolf form, I said. "Without knowing which snake I was, you can not make an anti-venom so I suggest you don't do anything stupid, earning your antidote."

Both men gulped then led us into the van. "Hang on, Tommy and Aura." buckling my seat belt, I thought. "We're coming to bust you both out of there."

Unknown to us, mom was watching from the rooftop of Sam's house. Once the van drove off, she took out a cellphone and dialed a number. "They took the bait." softly, she reported. "The rest is up to you."
1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.title: Preditor and Prey.

1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.content:
As the van drove, my mind kept racing. I knew we had a serious mission on our hands, but it just kept racing. It was what Megan said. Boyfriend...she said boyfriend. Even after everything I've done to push her away, she chose me. Oh man, I have to ask her on a date when this is all over.

I looked out the window to try and clear my mind. But I then failed to notice Megan. Her hand was resting on mine. I slowly moved it, but her's darted away; probably by surprise. I knew I was blushing but looked to the window. I just watched the landscape pass by. But then, I saw the window fade black. It wasn't that we were going through a tunnel or anything, but all of the windows, even the windshield. Became completely black. "Hey?!" I exclaimed, Megan aware of it too, "What gives?"

The man driving smiled, "Did you really think we would let you know where the base was at? Stupid kids."

I shot him a deep feral growl which made him turn back around. Megan grasped my clawed wolf hand, calming me. "Okay, that's fair" she spoke, "But how can you see?"

"Regulation" said the second. "We may not have powerful mutations, but the lab boys gave us special lens for our eyes so we can see through it."

I grumbled, "That's actually useful."

The van kept driving, not knowing a single moment of our location. Then, after a few bumps, the van stopped. The others got out, us following wherever we were looked like the inside of a parking garage.

"F-Follow us..." said the one man. I noticed there was sweat on his brow. I think it was from him being noticed, but then I saw a few dark veins in his neck. I smiled; the poison was setting in. The other guy looked just as bad.

We were taken to an elevator, which the men took us up. I had no idea what happened to the kid. The trip up would have been silent if it wasn't for their deep breathing. The doors reopened and they led us into the long hallway. The man with my venom was now shaking.

"Enjoying our poison?" I laughed. The guys did not respond, only even deeper breathing. When they approached the door, one pulled out a card key. They attempt to slide it, but they couldn't. One fell over, the other joined him.

I looked to Megan who gave me a nod. I shifted back into the same anthro snake from before, and bit him with my fangs. I quickly sucked the venom out, as well as a lot of blood. I licked my scaly lips for some reason. Megan stopped me though, after she cured her guy. I grabbed the card and swiped it. The door opened, revealing a office.

The man sitting at the desk looked familiar, but I couldn't match his face to a name. He let out a chuckle, "I never knew you two would attempt what you did."

"We do what we must" Megan spoke. "We have come to make some demands."

"But first" I slammed down my fist and hissed in his face, "WHERE ARE THEY?!"

He smiled, unfazed by motion. "Of course, you need to see them." he pressed a button on his intercom, "Alright, bring them in."

The door buzzed behind us and opened. I turned, happily waiting to see my cousins. But I saw two men and a woman, and that woman was my mom. "M-Crystal? What are you doing here?" I corrected myself.

She pulled out a silver gun, which she fired. A cable wrapped around Megan, sparking to life. Electricity coursed through her, causing her to scream in pain.

I couldn't believe what I saw. My mother attacked Megan. I hissed in anger as Megan fell unconscious. "You!" I felt something inside, something I couldn't control. I quickly darted towards her, but she pulled something else out. Suddenly my ears rung with noise, and surprisingly it was sweet. My vision went black before I could even get to her.

----------------

A jolt passed through my head, forcing me to wake up. As my vision cleared I was aware of my surroundings and myself. I appeared to be in some animal storage area, because I could hear the other animals. I was still a snake, crammed in but still fine. I made my way to the front, "Hey! Let me out!"
1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.title: Doped

1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.content:
I hissed in anger, seeing a man walk in with Megan at her side. He had a smug smile on his face. "After all that talk about escaping the Agency, mom is still just one of their puppets!" furious, I said. "If you harm one hair on her head...!"

"You poor little fool." cooing me, Megan said. "Don't you realize that we are about to become a part of greatness?" she chuckled. "Why, with our powers, we could easily work our way up to being Alpha's personal bodyguards! Everyone will fear us and respect us though that fear..."

I could not believe what I was hearing! Megan seemed excited about becoming one of the Agency's puppets! As she then continued to ramble on about how great she and I could become, I flicked my tongue and got a taste of something very unfamiliar to me. It was then I remembered that snakes had a sense of taste a hundred times more acute than humans. I tasted the air again and discovered that the girl talking to me was not Megan. "Whoever this is, she's damn good at changing her appearance and voice but she can't change the way tastes to a snake." angry, I thought. "She and her 'puppet master' need to learn just who they are toying with."

"As you can see, Travis, your girlfriend sees the potential for greatness and wants you to share in it." softly, the man said. "All you need but do is swear your loyalty to the Agency and we will start you both on your way to that greatness."

I rose my serpentine head up as a cobra would then gave an almost human laugh with my hissing. "I have a much better idea in mind." almost smiling, I said. "Why don't we do lunch?"

With that, I gave the mental command to my body and I rapidly grew to both 'Megan' and the man's horror. I had read about a prehistoric snake that was the length of a football field and could easily devour a horse. That was what I decided to become to push my point across, a Titanoboa!
1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.title: Titanoboa!

1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.content:
I continued my hissing laugh as my body grew beyond the holding capacity of the glass cage. The man backed away slowly as the teen girl stood in complete shock. The glass shattered, sending the snakes that were in the cage with me to flee for their own lives while I continued to grow in size. Powerful arms formed as my new shape finally took hold and towered over the girl who, to my surprise changed as well but into a girl no older than five years of age. She opened her mouth as if to scream but nothing came as the man slipped through a set of steel doors, closing them behind him.

"Your master had fled, leaving you to die." my voice raspy, I said. "I guess I'll have to settle with you."

The girl looked around then gulped, realizing she was now alone. She then made the mistake of trying to run to a door that was still open. I fought the instinct to hunt and merely wrapped myself around her so she could not escape. The girl screamed, fearing she was about to be devoured. "Please don't eat me!" crying, she screamed.

"Feel lucky I don't have a 'crush' on you." with a hissing laugh, I said. "Tell me where I can find Megan Connors, Tommy and Aura Winters and I will release you."

"I don't know!" trembling, the girl replied. "This place is huge, they could be anywhere!"

I moved my mouth to the girl's head, causing her to wince then sob only she fell into a fit of giggles as I merely wiggled my forked tongue in her ear, hissing softly. "Where are they?" softly, I asked.

"I don't..." giggling, the girl said.

I wiggled my tongue in her ear, hissing again, and she began to scream in laughter. "Stop! I can't take it!" laughing, she pleaded. "It tickles! It tickles!"

"Where?" hissing, I repeated.

"In the detention cells!" tearing up with laughter, the girl replied. "South Wing!"

Upon getting the answer I needed, I slithered to the steel doors and easily ripped them open before returning to my human form. "I'll need to eat soon." frowning, I thought. "This shape shifting makes me hungry."

With that, I left the vaulted room with the girl still giggling...
1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.title: continue.

1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.content:
The groaning in my stomach increased, it was loud. I took too much time as an anthro, I needed something. As I walked past a tinted lab window, I saw my reflection. My skin could be described as snow white. Oh man, I need to eat something now... My eyes glanced down at the tattered clothing I now had. And some pants...

I heard footsteps and ducked into the first door I saw. The lights turned on automatically. It looked like the employee's lounge. A few lockers were there, as well as a working fridge and microwave. "Wow, just what I needed!"

I first headed towards the lockers. I opened the first one and smiled. There was a one piece jumpsuit inside. But I recognized the material. I forgot the specific name of that stuff, but the fabric could be stretched dramatically and still keep it's original size. "Man, Garth would kill for this stuff."

I tossed it aside and looked through the fridge. There, resting in there, looked like a miracle. It was a six inch chicken sub! I never ate that fast in my entire life. But it was good. I should have had enough energy soon.

The door creaked open and I rushed into the closet. I could hear voices, but not clearly in my human form. I slowly creaked the door open, hearing the voices now. "I can't believe those rotten brats!" I silently gasped; it was those two drivers. "Poisoned by that metallic whore!"

I grumbled at that remark. "Hey, at least yours had a positive antidote. I was bit and I had no idea what it was! I hate snakes!"

The other guy chuckled, "Hey! Who ate my chicken sub?!"

My stomach let out a quick growl. Apparently I was still hungry. However from the limited amount of vision I had I could see them approach the closet. I panicked quietly, I had no energy until I digested that sub. I was cornered, like an animal waiting to die.

I felt something in my gut, it wasn't vomit, but it was something. It flowed up my throat and into my mouth. As soon as the door flew open I let out whatever it was. The two men's faces were coated in the green sickly stuff. They were both screaming in pain. I let this be my opening. I ran and jumped, drop kicking them both. That hit knocked them both out.

After cleaning their faces, I tied them up back to back and stuffed them in the closet. Obviously whatever I upchucked was my defense mechanism; the tactic that all animals had when facing immanent danger. I looked at my reflection, seeing my skin being normal. But then my eyes went to that suit. I then spotted one item the man dropped, his Swiss army knife. "I wonder..."

Using the knife, I made some modifications to the suit. Then I slipped in on and changed into an anthro wolf. The suit was now sleeveless, showing my muscular wolf arms. The suit also had short pants, revealed a good bit of my legs. I also made sure to cut a hole for my tail. I balled my hand into a fist, "Don't worry everyone, I'll save you."
1541111212211111112111112112222121211111.title: Pit Stop

choices: Jon Doe (10 yr old street orphan.)
Sarah Barns (25 yr old school teacher.)
155.content: Can't think of a character or all the others are taken? Try one of these characters.
155.title: Someone else?

choices: I look through the photo albums.
I wake up from a dream.
1551.content:
'For the time being, my name is John Paul. My real name is Jon Doe as no one know who I really am, not even me. I do not remember much of my past other than walking away from a crash around the age of five. I do not know what kind of crash it was or who else was in it, just that it was some type of crash.'

'I was found by the police a few hours later, walking on the side of the road. Five years later, after no one taking me in, I ran away from the orphanage to find my mom and dad. Hours later, tired and hungry, I walked up to a house and knocked on the door for help. For some strange reason, the man who answered, seemed to know my first name and he ushered me inside where a woman also called me by my first name and told me to get washed up for supper. A twelve year old boy and a fourteen year old girl, members of the family also seemed to know me. This family I had stumbled upon genuinely believed I belonged there as a family member. Only, it did not feel like home....'

I looked up from the journal that I had found in what seemed to have been my room, confused and frustrated. "How did they know my name?" I wondered, quietly. "They all seemed to have known everything about me, even the fact I loved my pizza with vegetables but not meat." I sighed. "What's more curious is that, within the first hour of being in their home, I also knew everything about them but it feels more like a remembered dream than an actual memory.

It was a strange mystery, one that frustrated and confused me to the point I wanted to scream. "Could this family, am i really Jon Paul?" I whispered to myself. I shook my head. "If so, why doesn't it feel like home?"

I decided to investigate....
1551.title: Jon Doe (10 yr old street orphan.)

15511.content:
My investigation started in the family photo albums. They were as boring as you'd expect, looking at other people's memories. And they were other people's. Just as I expected, I was nowhere to be seen in any of them. Packing a few of the albums under my arm, I went to confront "Mom" and "Dad".

I found them in the den. "Hello, John," Mrs. Paul said. "What have you been up to?"

"Proving something," I said.

Mr. Paul smiled. "What were you looking to prove, son?"

"I'm not your son," I said. "I was in an orphanage for five years, just a few miles away, and none of you even came to visit. I'm not in the family albums, either. What's going on? Who are you people, who am I, and why have you been pretending to be my family?"

Mr. Paul sighed. "I suppose there's no harm telling you."

"Evan," Mrs. Paul cautioned, "do you think it's wise?"

"We knew he'd start asking questions sooner or later, Deidre," he replied. "Might as well get it over with."
15511.title: I look through the photo albums.

155111.content:
Deidre sighed then tearfully turned to you. "We are your real family." she replied, almost sobbing. "The reason this place does not feel like home is because we are not from here."

"We are from another country?" I asked, trying to make sense of everything.

Evan shook his head. "Maybe it would be better if we just show you." he said.

I was about to ask them what they meant but then Evan touched my head and I saw a rush of images fly through my brain, like a terrible memory or a dream...

Lights were flashing and sirens were blaring all around me as I found myself sitting in the middle of a dark, smoke filled corridor somewhere. My leg seemed to have been injured as I could not get myself to stand. People of all descriptions and walks of life were running passed me with a sense of danger and panic clear on all of their faces.

"What... What's happening!?" I asked.

"This is your past." replied Evan's voice. "A past you most likely forgot... please observe."

I began to worry as I could literally smell smoke everywhere and feel the shaking of the floor as the panicked crowd ran passed me. I heard a muffled explosion as it shook the corridor and turned to its source to find a wall of fire quickly surging towards me, taking the people who fell in its path. A scream echoed from my own throat just as someone from the frantic crowd swept me into his arms as he ran with the fire scorching his heels.

"I'm scared." I sobbed. "Please, I don't want to see any more."

"You must, John." replied Deidre's tearful voice. "This is the truth of who you are."

I watched the vision, helpless to stop it with my own mind as I felt myself being carried through a number of halls into a small room where a dozen other people were desperately talking in a language I did not understand. They all fell silent as an ear shattering explosion shook the room.

"Ow!" I complained, holding my hands to my ears. "What was that!?"

Another jolt was felt and a heavy double door sealed the room with a loud hiss, just as a slender woman reached it with a small girl in her arms. She pounded on the glass of the door, tears falling from her face, as a man appeared behind her and began to pound as well. Four men inside the room desperately tried to force the door open but it was to no avail as a smaller explosion shook the room and it moved away from the woman on the other side of the door. As I saw stars through the growing distance between the couple and myself I saw tears running down the man and woman's face as I saw her mouth my name 'John!' Then, I heard myself scream, "Mommy!"

The vision then ended and I found myself back in the living room, shaking and crying from the terrifying experience. It was as if I was actually there. I turned to Evan and Deidre, not knowing what to do or say but gasped as I recognized their faces from the vision.

"It was you two who was trying to get in the room." I said.

"Actually, it was an escape pod." replied Evan. "You see, we are not from this planet."

"Long story short, dear, one of the drive engines on our ship malfunctioned and exploded while we were passing through this sector and we were forced to abandon ship, flee to this world, they call Earth."

I was still very shaken by the vision and brief explanation but I still had my doubts. "Even if I believed all of this, why did you not come looking for me?"

"The escape pods were scattered all over this globe, honey. For us to find you was like looking for a needle in a haystack as we look very similar to the inhabitants of this world." replied mom, crying. "Any technology we brought with us was lost with the mother ship when it exploded, we are marooned here."

How do you react?
155111.title: Story 1

1551112.content:
By this time, Samantha and Derek, my older sister and brother, had come into the room as well.

"If we're from another planet," I asked, "why aren't we there? Why come to Earth?"

"Because of the Throg," Dad said. "They coveted our world's resources, so they came to take them. A fleet of battleships against a peaceful world.

"Ours was the only craft to escape the Throg onslaught, John. All others were captured, the people handed over for what the Throg called 'research'." He shivered. "The Throg's idea of 'researching' other species involves torture and death. They would skin you alive, just to record exactly how long it took you to die. So our ship held the last Oltroxians." He sighed. "I wish you children could have seen Oltrox, before the fall."

"Wait a minute," I said, turning to Sam and Derek. "You guys didn't see our homeworld, either?"

"'Fraid not, little dude," Derek replied.

"The three of us were born on that ship," Sam added.

"We were searching for an uninhabited world," Mom said, "where we could settle, and rebuild our society. If the engine hadn't malfunctioned, we would have continued our quest."

"The last thing we wanted," Dad said, "was to draw Throg attention to another world."

"They wouldn't follow us all this way," I said. "Would they?"

"Remember what Dad said about Throg research?" Derek said. "Oltroxians are quite fascinating."

"What do you mean?"

Sam leaned in close. "We can do things."
1551112.title: You want to know more.

155112.content:
"We used to represent a group called the Agency," said Mrs Paul "A long time ago, we found out they were kidnapping kids to use in a child army, special kids, who could do things that most people couldn't even imagine. We wanted no part of their scheme, so we left and traveled to America, hoping as many others did, of finding a new life there, an opportunity to escape the Agency. We settled here, in Waterfront City."
"The Agency wouldn't let us go that easily though," said Mr Paul "It was years later, but they sent a small, five year old boy, brainwashed into their service, to find us and kill us, so that our information about the inner workings of the Agency would not get out, by that time of course, we had settled in Waterfront City and had children of our own to look out for, we couldn't run anymore, there was only one option open to us, we would have to fight."
"I'm sorry," I said "But what does all this do with me?"
"Jon," said Mrs Paul "That little boy was you."
"You had been brainwashed, Jon," said Mr Paul, continuing his story "You didn't know what you were doing, you shot your way into our house, your shots were so accurate that you would have killed both myself and my wife if our children had not had powers of their own. You changed tactics, instead knocking out both our children and taking them out to a waiting jeep. You drove off with our children, we followed. What happened next, we do not know, but you crashed the jeep into a wall, although our children were not hurt, got out of the car, and walked off down the road, we think it may have been a latent power in one of our children, but we are not sure."
"You think one of your children might have wiped my memory of before the crash?" I asked
"It's a possibility," said Mr Paul "It could have been head trauma from injury during the crash, but I don't think it was, I'm sorry Jon, but I don't know who your real family is, but you can stay with us as long as you want."
"Why would you take in someone who tried to kill your family and kidnapped your children?" I asked "From what you told me, I'm a monster."
"That was in the past, Jon," said Mrs Paul "You were not responsible for your actions."
155112.title: Story 2

1551121.content:
"I'll join your family," I said "But I would like your help to find my real family, if they're still alive, I have to try and find them."
"We'll do whatever we can to help you," said Mr Paul, or perhaps I should be calling him 'dad' now, I'm not sure. I should really feel relieved right now, relieved that I finally had a family to love and who would love me, but somehow, I felt nothing.
"Dinner is almost ready," said 'mom', walking into the kitchen "You can meet your new brother and sister now if you wish."

Do I go and meet my new brother and sister?
1551121.title: Join the Paul family

15513.content:
I suddenly found myself standing in an alley next to a grocery store; around 6:30 at night. Looking around, I realized that the house I imagined myself in was all a dream. That being said, I was shocked to see my ‘family’ walking past me as they entered their car.

I couldn’t quite explain it; but seeing them probably stirred up a longing for family and I found myself imagining they were my family. I’ve been on the run for over 5 months, fearing that my parents and siblings wouldn’t understand my new ability. My name changed every time I altered reality; but it was originally John Henault and I was a 16 year old boy.

During my five month life on the road, I had to learn to control my ability quickly to stay alive. It was not enough to just change my age or gender, I had to also change my student ID to another ID or a driver's license and fill my wallet with money. There was no telling where the money came from and I felt bad taking money from some stranger but I needed it to keep myself alive and my 'talent' a secret, if you can call it that.

As the family drove off, I realized I was getting hungry. Looking around, to my annoyance, I saw the only place was a club down the road. Walking down the road, I turned to walk into the club when the bouncer stood in front of me. “Sorry kid, you’re too young for this place.”

I was about to protest when I realized that I had the form of a 13 year old boy at the moment. Simply nodding, I turned and walked back around the corner. Once I was out of sight, I concentrated on my appearance. By time all was said and done, I had the body of a 22 year old; complete with ID.

Satisfied with my appearance, I smiled and walked back to the club. It wasn’t long before the bouncer let me into the club; without even mentioning the 13 year old who tried to get in.
15513.title: It's all a dream

155131.content:
Once inside the club, I immediately made my way to the bar. Taking a seat, I spotted my reflection in the mirror. Turning to look at it, I saw that I was now an attractive 22 year old brunette wearing an attractive dress (http://www1.macys.com/shop/product/jones...).

Seeing my reflection, I wondered how my twin sister would react if she ever saw me like this. I was brought back to reality when the bartender walked over. "What can I get you, beautiful?"

Turning to the bartender, I said, "I'll take a Samuel Adams and a turkey sandwich."

"You bet."

As the bartender left, I decided now would be a good time to see who I was in this reality. Digging through my purse, I found my ID. Looking at it, I saw that my name was now Kelly Thompson; and I was from San Francisco. It wasn't long before the bartender returned with my order; taking my payment as I took my food.


I'd just finished my sandwich, and was drinking my beer, when a guy walked over to me. "Is this seat taking?"

One of the things I had to get used to over the last 5 months was guys flirting with me; and not just when I was a girl. Looking at him, smiling, I said, "No, have a seat."

Sitting next to me, the guy said, "I'm Allen; what's your name?"

"Hi Allen." smiling, I said, "I'm Kelly."

"I've never seen you here before, Kelly; what brings you to Oregon?"

Allen didn't know it; but he's known me for almost 2 weeks now. The first time we met, I was a 23 year old pregnant woman at a grocery store; but most of the time I was either a guy or girl in their 20s. I bet you're wondering why I made myself a pregnant girl; the truth is, I just wanted to know what being pregnant felt like.

"Well, Allen." pausing, I said, "I'm just passing through; I've got a lot on my mind and I thought a little trip would be good for me."

"What's on your mind? Maybe it's something I can help you with?"

"You wouldn't believe me if I told you." sighing, I said, "My sister came home last week to find me making out with her boyfriend; she, uh, got angry and kicked me out."

"I see." taking his drink, Allen said, "If you don't mind my asking; why were you making out with her boyfriend?"

"It wasn't my idea; he started it and I wasn't in a condition to stop him."

"Did you tell your sister that?"

"I tried; but she wouldn't listen." sipping my beer, I said, "I'm traveling around hoping she calms down enough."

"I'm sure she's calm enough now, Kelly." looking at me, Allen said, "I'm sure she misses you."


Allen and I talked for a few hours, occasionally getting up to dance. By the time I decided it was time to leave, Allen had convinced me that I should go home. As we talked, I realized that I made a mistake when I ran away; I should've just told my family about my ability rather than hide it.

Smiling, as we walked out of the bar, I turned to Allen and said, "Thanks for listening, Allen; you're a sweet guy."

"No problem, Kelly." looking at me, Allen said, "I hope things work out with your sister."
155131.title: Continue

1551311.content:
I spent the night, as Kelly, at a hotel near the airport. As awkward as I knew it would be, I knew I had to return to my family. Before checking out of the hotel, I altered my appearance to make it so I was now 5 months pregnant. As weird as it was for me to be pregnant, this form had its uses; I could get early boarding on the plane.

After checking out of the hotel, I took a cab to the airport. Once he'd helped me from the cab, the driver grabbed my suitcase and purse (originally my backpack). Handing them to me, he said, "Have a nice flight, ma'am."

"Thank you." handing him my fare plus tip, I said, "Have a nice day."

It wasn't long before I got through security. Making my way to my gate, I suddenly remembered why I didn't use this form very often...the frequent trips to the bathroom. After making a stop in the bathroom, I found my way to the gate.


45 minutes later, the ticket agent called for passengers eligible for early boarding. Walking up to the jet-way, by a funny coincidence, I saw the ticket agent was also pregnant. Spotting my belly, she said, "Ma'am, would you mind stepping aside."

Momentarily concerned, I said, "Is something wrong?"

"Nothing's wrong, ma'am." Leading me over to the counter, she said, "The plane is not fully booked; and I thought you might be more comfortable in a first class seat."

"Oh." pausing, I said, "That's not necessary."

"Take it from me, ma'am." chuckling, the woman said, "When you're as far along as we are, economy seats aren't very comfortable."

"Now that you mention it; they are a little cramped." chuckling, I said, "Thank you."

"You're welcome." handing me the ticket, the agent said, "Have a nice flight."


It was another 5 minutes before I got to my seat. After putting my luggage away, with the help of the stewardess, I took my seat.
1551311.title: At the airport

15513111.content:
I sat back as the passengers continued to board the plane. I was about to fall asleep when, to my surprise, I heard a familiar voice. "There you are, Kelly."

Opening my eyes, I saw a familiar face staring at me. "Allen!? W-What are you doing here?"

Sitting down, Allen said, "Is that anyway to talk to your boyfriend, Kelly?"

"Boyfriend!?"

Concerned, Allen looked at me and said, "Kelly, are you okay?"

I stopped to think for a minute; it seemed that every time altered reality, Allen seemed to pop up. It looked like he was my boyfriend in this reality; meaning he was probably the father of my...baby. Turning to Allen, I said, "I'm fine; you just startled me."

"I'm sorry." placing a hand on my belly, Allen said, "I didn't mean to startle you."

After I managed to calm myself down, I laid back and closed my eyes. As I fell asleep, I couldn't help but wonder why Allen kept popping up.


I woke up about 45 minutes later to the sound of screams in the cabin. Looking around, I saw a man holding another pregnant woman hostage.
15513111.title: A Surprise

155131111.content:
“If everyone would remain calm; we’ll all get through this.!” Holding a gun to the woman’s head, she said, “My partner’s talking to captain as we speak; so this will all be over soon.”

Seeing the look of terror in the woman’s eyes, I growled under my breath. I wanted to change reality for them; but I couldn’t decide what reality to give them. I briefly considered making them infants, when I saw the stewardess trying to calm the gunman.

With a grin, I said to myself, “The stewardess did they were short handed on this flight.”

Seeing me, with the grin on my face, the gunman said, “What’s so funny, lady?”

“Oh, nothing.” Still grinning, I said, “I’m just admiring how great you look in that uniform.”

He gave me a confused look as the air in the cabin began to ripple; unbeknownst to everyone but me. Concentrating on the man, I wondered what measurements to give him. Once that was decided, I decided to make him and his partner twins.

As the new reality took effect, the young woman was sitting in the next across from me. “How far along are you?” smiling, she said, “I’m just over 6 months.”

Smiling, I said, “I’m 5 months.”

Walking over to us, the gunman turned stewardess said, “Is this the first pregnancy for both of you?”

Both the girl and I nodded, “Yes.”

“My sister just had her first a few months ago; this is her first flight since coming off maternity leave.” Smiling, she said, “I’m hoping to have my first soon.”

The former gunman was now a tall, slender stewardess with a model’s figure. Knowing who she’d been before, I smiled and said, “I wish you luck.”

Giggling, the stewardess said, “Thanks.”

The rest of the flight was uneventful; I passed the time talking with the other pregnant woman. Her name was Amber, and she was on her way to visit her parents. As I got off the plane, I wondered how I was going to convince my family why I was suddenly a pregnant woman with a boyfriend. It was then I decided it was time for another reality change. Concentrating, I changed myself into…
155131111.title: Continue

1551311111.content:
As the reality took effect, I found that everything around me was taller than before. I was about to start walking, when I felt an overwhelming sadness roll over me. As I started crying, I realized it was because of the sudden disappearance of my unborn child; who no longer existed now that I changed reality.

I cried for a few moments until I heard a familiar voice say, "Kelly, sweetheart, what's wrong?"

Looking up at Allen, I said, "I-I'm going to miss you, Uncle Allen."

"I'm going to miss you too, sweetie." kneeling down, Allen said, "I'm glad I got to spend some time with my niece."

Giggling, I said, "I had fun this week."

"I'm glad to hear it."


It wasn't long before 'Uncle' Allen and I made our out of the airport; passing the new twin stewardesses as we went. As we waited for a cab, I realized now would be a good time change reality again. As I returned to my original form; that of 16 year old John Henault, I was surprised to see that Allen had disappeared.

I felt a pang of sadness at that; as I'd enjoyed his company the last couple weeks.


The cab ride home was uneventful; surprising considering how nervous I was. After paying the fare, I grabbed my backpack and headed up the driveway. Knocking on the door, I didn't have to wait long for my older sister Colleen.

Looking at me, she said, "John!?"
1551311111.title: Home

15513111111.content:
Before I could say anything, Colleen pulled me inside. "Where have you been!?"

Hearing all the commotion, Mom came out of the kitchen and dropped the phone on the floor. "John!?"

"Hi guys." weakly, I said, "I-I'm home."


It wasn't long before Dad came upstairs; he was by far the most vocal of the three, wondering why I'd run away for 5 months and not tell them where I was. "Wh-Why would you do that, Jonathon?"

Mom and Dad only used my full name when they were angry. Taking a breath, I proceeded to explain about my...ability. When I was done, it was immediately obvious that they thought I was nuts. Looking at me, Mom said, "Were you in a mental hospital? Is that where you've been?"

"No mom, I'll prove it to you."

Having been perfecting my ability, I created a 'shield' around my family to protect them from the change in reality. Something happened as I focused on the family cat, Oscar. Instead of changing him into a dog like I'd intended, I accidentally changed reality so that Colleen was 5 months pregnant.
15513111111.title: Continue

155131111111.content:
Colleen’s feet gave out under the sudden change in gravity. Looking down at her belly, Colleen turned to me and said, “What the hell, John!?”

While Mom helped Colleen to the couch, I said, “I-I didn’t mean to do that,
Colleen; I only meant to change Oscar into a dog.”

“How could you mix up changing Oscar with making me pregnant!?” panicking,
Colleen said, “I’m not ready for a baby!”

Looking at me, Dad said, “I hope you can fix this, young man!”

“I can fix this.” Pausing, I said, “I-I just need time to…recharge.”

A hand on her belly, Colleen said, “How much time!?”

Wincing, I said, “12 hours; putting a shield around you guys took a lot of me.”

“12 hours!?” glaring at me, Colleen said, “I’m stuck like this for 12 hours!!”

“Colleen, you have to stay calm.” Taking Colleen’s hand, Mom said, “Stress isn’t good for the baby.”

Slowly getting up from the couch, Colleen said, “I’d like to be alone for a while.”
I watched silently as Colleen waddled upstairs to her room; leaving me with two annoyed parents.


I spent the next hour explaining to my parents how I discovered this ability; and why I felt it necessary to run away. After ending the conversation, I walked upstairs. Slowly approaching Colleen’s door, I knocked and said, “Colleen, it’s me.”

I heard footsteps approach the door, as Colleen opened it. Looking at me, she said, “What do you want?”

“I wanted to apologize.” Sighing, I said, “You have to believe me; I never meant for this to happen.”

Stepping aside, Colleen said, “Come on in.”
155131111111.title: Continue

Walking into Colleen’s room; I noticed that there weren’t many differences in this reality. That being said, I did notice quite a few books on pregnancy.

“You made a mistake, John; I forgive you.”

“Yeah, I do.” Sighing, gesturing to her journal, Colleen said, “Apparently in this reality I was so upset after you ran away; I went out and had a one-night stand.”


Colleen and I talked for a little while, about the father being a classmate of Colleens and how he wants nothing to do with her. After a while, I decided it was time to reveal something.

“If it makes you feel better; I know what you’re going through.”

“What?” confused, Colleen said, “How could you possibly know what I’m going through?”

I proceeded to explain how I’d made myself pregnant a few times; to survive. When I was finished, I said, “It’s quite an experience; having a baby growing inside you.”

“I can’t image what you’ve been through, John.” Looking at me, Colleen said, “Promise me you won’t run off again?”

“I won’t, I promise.” Chuckling, I said, “Unless you want to be pregnant for the next 4 months.”

“Not a chance!” grinning, Colleen said, “I’m not ready for a baby just yet.”

“Sam’s been doing it for a year; but I’m afraid that this will cause a burn out.” Tearing up, Colleen said, “Do you think you can help him?”

Thinking to myself for a moment, I said, “All I could really do is change reality so that Sam lives at a boarding school; either for girls or boys.” Pausing, I said, “That way he can stay one gender and be away from his parents.”

“That’s a good idea.” Picking up her phone, Colleen said, “I’ll call Sam and see what he thinks.”

As the months passed, my belly grew, and I started feeling the stirrings within my womb. Prof. Kingsbury offered a sympathetic ear, but the whole process left me feeling lost at sea.

I had decided not to have an abortion. I figured that, if I had one, then whoever - whatever - had gotten me pregnant without so much as a formal introduction might just try again later. Instead, I decided to place the baby up for adoption. Somebody else could be the mother that this baby needed, the mother I couldn't be.

I the fullness of time, I gave birth to a baby girl, and that was the last time I saw her.



As I pulled out of my reverie, a thought struck me: I found out I was pregnant after that camping trip, the one where I drank from a stream and picked up the runs. And that stream wasn't far from where Todd and I found that dumpsite.

I sat up. Could there be a connection?
15522121222221211.title: Flashback - "I'm WHAT?"

155221212222212111.content:
Deciding to find out, I left the living room to talk to Todd. I found him moments later, sitting behind his desk in the den we both shared to do our work at home. "Um, Todd." nervously, I said. "Can we talk a moment?"

Todd turned in his chair, smiling. "I always have time to talk to you." gently, he said. "You never need to ask." he then became concerned. "What's on your mind?"

Taking a breath, I asked, "Todd, I-I have to tell you something."

"What is it, Sarah?" rising to hold my hand, Todd asked.

"Do you remember me telling you how I got pregnant five years ago; even though I didn't sleep with anybody?" trembling slightly, I asked him. "The girl I gave up for adoption..."

"Honey, you were young, and had no means to take care of a child..." trying to comfort me, Todd began. he stopped, seeing me tear up then nodded. "Yeah, I remember. You told me that you had drank some contaminated water a few months before hand, right?"

"That's right." after a tearful pause, I said. "I-I think there's a connection between that and our...new found abilities."

"Drinking contaminated water cannot make you pregnant, Sarah." looking at me, Todd said. "I agree there might be a connection between the dump sight and the contaminated water you drank five years ago but for it to make you pregnant... there is something missing from that equation."

*Actually, you are both right.* came a voice inside my head, surprising me. *My name is Andromeda. I inadvertently made you pregnant with my child when you... drank me in.*

All of the color drained from my face, causing Todd to become very concerned. "Sarah?" coming closer, he asked. "Sarah, what's wrong? Talk to me, honey."

I did not hear Todd at first. "Where are you?" quivering, I asked.

"I'm right in front of you, Sarah." now looking panicked, Todd replied. "I think we better get you to the hospital."

*I am inside of you.* her voice echoing in my head, Andromeda replied. *I am what you might call a symbiotic alien.*

"It's going to be okay, Sarah." trying to remain calm, Todd said. "I'll take you to the ER."

Todd turned to get his keys when, suddenly, I...
155221212222212111.title: Talking it over with Todd

1552212122222121111.content:
I fainted.



I suddenly found myself out in the wilderness, by the creek I had drunk from. I was in my hiking gear. "How'd I get here?"

"Calm yourself," came the voice I had heard earlier. "You have lost consciousness. I constructed this image in your mind, so that we could talk."

I turned to the direction of the voice, and saw... myself. "You're... me?"

"Not really," the being replied. "I chose to appear to your mind in this form, as my natural form can be somewhat disturbing to human minds. My name is Andromeda."

"You said before... You're the one who got me pregnant? How did you do that? And why?"

"It was not my first choice," she replied. "I was but a youngling, dwelling in the water until I could find a host. Suddenly, I became aware of foul additives in the water."

"Runoff, from the illegal dumpsite," I guessed.

"Correct. The pollutants caused me to begin discharging eggs. Without any sort of a host body, my offspring were dying. My heart was breaking, when you lifted the water I was in to your lips."

"So that's how you got inside me. But how did I get pregnant?"

"I discharged one final egg within you. I could not bear to lose another child to this cruel fate. I directed your ovaries to release two ova, instead of the usual one. Then, I combined their genetic material, to create a new being, who could host my child."

I began to process this. "I had a baby... to save yours?"

"Correct. I would not have done it otherwise, and I have not done it since. It may comfort you to know that she is well and healthy."

"You... you know how she is? How?"

"We can communicate easily. She is more active in the child than is usual, perhaps because of lingering effects from the pollution. Normally, our hatchlings do not reveal themselves to their hosts until the host reaches puberty, but she is already enhancing the girl's perceptions. However, she is still too young to understand everything she perceives." Andromeda lifted a hand, and an image appeared. "This is how she looks."

I was astounded. "She... she looks like me, when I was that age."

"Correct. I used only your genetic material, so she would naturally resemble you. My daughter, Tobi, is enhancing her perceptions of the world around her, so that she can see a person's aura. In fact, that is how she learned that her adoptive parents are aliens."

"You mean there are more like you?"

"Yes. However, your daughter's adoptive parents are of a race of shapeshifters, unlike my race. Tobi tells me that she is greatly concerned about what the future holds for little Rhea."

"They're going to hurt her?"

"No, they love her very much. However, there are those who have taken an interest in her. The company that dumped the chemicals, and those who seek to destroy that company, by any means."

I grabbed Andromeda by the shoulders. "How can I save her?"

"I amnot certain," came the reply. "However, I believe that things will become clearer in the days ahead. Watch for the signs, and be ready."
1552212122222121111.title: fainted.

choices: Todd and I try to escape.
15522121222221211111.content:
I woke up to the subtle movements of the car and slowly opened my eyes to find that I was sitting in the front passenger seat of Todd's jeep with him behind the wheel, driving down the freeway. "Wh- Where are we going?" sleepily, I asked.

"You're awake." relief in his voice, Todd said. "You passed out in the living room and would not wake up, no matter what I tried, talking some crazy nonsense that did not sound like any language I ever heard, I'm afraid that waste you fell into may be effecting your mind." I tried to protest, assuring him that I was fine but he cut me off. "I was exposed to it too, Sarah." he said. "It may only be a matter of time before I am also effected, it won't hurt to get checked out."

"Should we tell them about what happened to us after we were exposed to that waste?" nervous, I asked.

Todd gave worried glance. "Who would believe it?" chuckling nervously, he asked. "Its best if we keep that to ourselves unless there is no other choice."

I sighed, relieved that Todd felt the same way I did about telling anyone about the size and age changes. "I hope they don't find anything too bizarre." thinking of Andromeda, I said.

Todd sighed. "I hope so too, honey." giving me a worried glance, he said. "I'd hate to become some doctor's pet project because some company wanted to cut corners."

I gasped slightly at that as something in Todd's words struck a chord. I remembered a time when I was very young, standing before a strange man with my uncle John at my side, holding me in place, though I did struggle. "So you are Dr Smith's pet project." smiling at me, the man said. "It was clever of him to hide it inside his own daughter." turning to my uncle John, he asked. "Were the Smith's neutralized?"

John nodded. "An unfortunate house fire, sir." with a slight grin, he said. "Poor Sarah Smith was the only survivor."

The man grunted. "Well, she was made with Agency property so she is now Agency property." emotionless, he said. "Prepare our new doll for special training."

I heard myself screaming as uncle John forced me out of the room....


I woke up with a start, feeling Todd gently shaking me awake. "Please, Sarah!" begging, he said. "Wake up, you passed out again, open your eyes!"

Todd sighed, seeing my eyes open then pointed to two nurses, hurrying out with a gurney. "They are coming to get you into the emergency room, Sarah." trying to sound comforting, he said.

Shaken, I weakly got onto the gurney and allowed the two nurses to wheel me inside. The emergency room was busy but, for some reason, I was pushed ahead of everyone else. "Your husband tells us you were exposed to an unknown bio-hazard waste." said the first nurse. "The effects could be lethal, that makes you a priority."

Once I was placed into a room, Todd tried his best to keep me calm as I felt an increasing sense of dread, though I did not know why. Then a tall, middle aged man in a physicians uniform and lab coat walked into the examination room with a large file in his hands. "Hello, Sarah Barns." smiling, he said. "It's been years since I saw you last."

I looked up at the man and immediately began to panic as I remembered seeing the man before. "Dr Hagen!"

"You remember me." his smile broadening, Hagen said. "I'm touched."

"Sarah, you know this man?" taking a defensive stance, Todd asked.

"I was her doctor when she was very young." looking at me, Hagen replied. "She was our little pet project."

"I don't like where you are going with this, doctor." annoyed, Todd said. "We're leaving."

"I'm afraid its much too late for that." seriously, Hagen said.

I began to panic as I saw a number of male nurses walking in our direction to Hagen's silent gesture. What can I do?
15522121222221211111.title: Waking up to a nightmare.

choices: The bad guys catch up with Todd
155221212222212111111.content:
"Now that we have you back, Sarah," Dr. Hagen said, "we're not letting you out of our sight."

I briefly considered growing, in order to get the upper hand on the nurses, but I rejected it. I knew I'd do some damage to the building, which would hurt all the innocent people who'd come here for medical help. Plus, just because I was resistant to damage when I was small, I wasn't sure if the same applied when I got huge.

Instead, I shrank, willing myself as small as I could, as quickly as I could.

That turned out to be pretty quick, as my clothes collapsed around me. "She's gone!" one of the nurses said.

"Gone?" Hagen demanded. "How is that possible?"

As I dug my way out of my clothes, I did a quick estimate, and figured I was less than an inch tall. I jumped up and grabbed a passing shoelace, figuring that I could easily get out of the room that way. But how would Todd get out?

I didn't have to worry, as Todd took advantage of the confusion my "disappearance" caused, running out of the room. Hagen's stooges (including the one I'd hitched a ride with) ran out into the hall, determined to search for him.
155221212222212111111.title: Todd and I try to escape.

1552212122222121111112.content:
"Search every room!" one goon ordered. "He can't have gone far!"

As the goons searched, noise could be heard coming from a restroom. I could see shadows moving under the door. "Looks like this is it," whispered the goon I was riding. "Get ready."

Somebody opened the door, to reveal a 5-year-old boy in a hospital gown. "I'm lost," he said, his lower lip trembling. "I can't find my mommy!"

"Sorry, kid," my ride said. "Haven't seen her." I hopped off his shoe as the goons left the room.

Once the boy and I were alone, he waited a few seconds before peeking out the door. "Looks like the coast is clear," he said. "Now, to find Sarah."

"Todd?" I grew to a foot high. "Is that you, honey?"

"I figured you must have snuck out," he said, returning to adulthood. "I had to disguise myself fast, and a lost little boy wouldn't attract the wrong attention."

"Good plan. Unfortunately, we need another. Dr. Hagen has our address, so he can track us down."

I looked at my naked body. I'm definitely going to need something to wear, I thought, when I change size like this.
1552212122222121111112.title: No sign of him... or so it seems

15522121222221211111121.content:
*I can lead you to those who can help you.* serious, Andromeda said. *However, you must get out of the hospital on your own and quickly before they put the building in lock down.*

Thinking quickly, I turned to the hall and saw a small pile of girl's clothing on a table with a doll lying next to them and winced, turning to Todd. "I have an idea but you won't like it."

Todd looked across the hall and moaned but quietly nodded. "If it will get us out of here fast..."

Five minutes later, Todd, blushing brightly, walked towards the main exit. He was in the form of a five year old in a blue dress, stockings, and mary janes, doing his best to walk causally while he carried me as a favorite doll in a pink dress. We both saw the guards working on locking the main exit doors and Todd ran up, his lips trembling. "Mommy is waiting for me outside!" using a false alto voice, he said. "Please, they just said I can go home."

"Fine, fine." quickly, the guard said. "Get going, kid."

Todd happily ran out the door, following the side walk, towards the parking lot. Only he froze, seeing two of the goons standing near his jeep. "Any suggestions?" whispering, he asked.

*Just walk to the west.* in a whispered voice, Andromeda said. *I'll get the help to come to you.*

"Head west." whispering just loud enough to hear. "I'll explain later."

With a subtle nod, Todd started walking towards the west, trying not to hurry until we were out of sight of the hospital. Once we were, Todd began to run with me with the intention of gaining as much ground as possible. He seemed to have ran for ages before he gasped, "How much further?"

*They will be here any moment now.* serious, Andromeda said.

"I think we can wait here." happy Todd had a strong grip, even as a five year old. "Andromeda said some help should be here soon."

"Andromeda?" curious, Todd asked.

Then, Todd gave a scream as two cars came screeching to a halt near us. I swallowed hard, seeing Dr Hagen step out. "That was a neat trick, regressing yourself, young man." smiling evilly he said. "However, I have a gift as well.. I can follow anyone's scent and you both left your clothes behind."

With the motion of a single finger, the four goons pulled out what appeared to be handguns. "Come along quietly unless you wish to be tranquilized." still smiling, Hagen said. "Kiss, Kiss, my dear."

"KISS THIS!" came an enraged voice.

Before anyone could react, a huge fist barreled into Hagen's jaw, throwing him completely off his feet. Seeing Hagen crash to the pavement, moaning, I turned to find a teenaged boy with muscles more suited for an Olympian weight lifter. Behind him were three other teenagers and a little girl who looked a lot like me. "My baby..." stunned, I thought.
15522121222221211111121.title: Plan of escape.

155221212222212111111211.content:
Hagen began to sit up, rubbing his chin. "Hello again, Garth," he said. "You caught me off guard, but not without resources." Around us, Hagen's goons aimed their weapons at the boy.

"Think fast," said one of the kids, a girl about the same age as the Garth boy.

There was a gust of wind, and, in the blink of an eye, the guns were piled at the feet of my teenage rescuers. "Too slow," said the girl.

Hagen's eyes narrowed. "You kids don't know what you're in the middle of. You need guidance."

"We've got guidance," said Garth. "And it's you who doesn't know what he's doing. Drop this, before it gets dropped on you."

"Looks like Blue team wasn't kidding," said one of the goons. "Your orders?"

"We've got all the information we need," Hagen said. "We can easily pick up Sarah and her fiance at our leisure. Ta-ta." Hagen and his goons touched devices on their wrists, and they and their weapons disappeared.

Todd sighed. "Looks like I owe you kids one."

"Our pleasure," said Garth, losing his muscles. "Where's Sarah? You're dressed like a Sarah, but I don't think you are her."

"That would be me," I said. "We'd present ourselves better, but we're short on the right size clothing just now."

The little girl picked me up. "Are... are you my mommy?"

"I am, sweetie," I said, tears filling my eyes. "You look okay."

"We'll need to save the reunion," Todd said. "Hagen's right. He's got access to our personal information, and he can track us down whenever he feels like it. We're going to need someplace to lie low."

"We've got just the place," Garth said. "Hagen's got to master several puzzles before he can even think about getting in."
155221212222212111111211.title: continue.

1552212122222121111112111.content:
The kids drove us to a large mansion. As we entered the building, Garth said, "Welcome to the clubhouse of the Problem Child Gang."

"Thanks again," Todd said. "It's a lucky thing you kids showed up when you did."

"Nuh-uh," said Rhea, who was still carrying me. "Andromeda told Tobi where to find you."

"Who's Andromeda? And who's Tobi?"

"Andromeda," I explained, "is an alien symbiont who lives inside me. Tobi is her offspring. And Rhea is a clone of me, created to save Tobi's life."

We were about to walk through the garage door, when it opened, revealing a familiar face: Ted Jones. "She's not coming in here!" he declared.

"But she's my mommy!" Rhea protested.

"Honey," Todd asked, "what is he talking about?"

"When I was Rhea's age," I explained, "Dr. Hagen had me shadow the Problem Child Gang. Then, he wanted them dealt with."

Ted shook his head. "You have such a pretty way of describing shooting someone in the shoulder."

"It's not that I shot you in the shoulder. It's that I didn't shoot you in the head or heart."

"What?"

I nodded. "Hagen ordered me to kill you, but I didn't want to. I deliberately shot you in the shoulder, instead. Then, I went into hiding, using the last name Barns. If it weren't for Cain Chemical, Hagen still wouldn't know where I was living."

Ted shook his head again. "Sykes again. These names just keep turning up, don't they?"
1552212122222121111112111.title: At the clubhouse

15522121222221211111121111.content:
"Sykes?" confused, Todd asked. "Can someone fill me in here?"

Ted sighed, looking as if he were struggling to make a decision. "Alright, everyone inside." finally, he said. "We'll find you all some suitable clothing."

A few minutes later, Todd sat next to me on a comfortable couch inside a spacious library. We were both the size of teenagers, wearing teen clothes but it was better than what we had before. Sitting around us were the teenagers who had rescued us, Ted Jones, and Geo Tanner. We listened as Ted then explained who Sykes was and how their group came to lock horns with the Agency. "We had thought that the Agency wanted us as part of their army of brainwashed soldiers." finishing his explanation, Ted said. "Apparently, we were wrong."

"The Agency had considered it but, with half the group related to the most wealthy families on the planet, it was too much of a security risk." looking at Ted, I said. "Believe me, Mr Jones, you will never know how lucky you were." I teared up, adding, "They killed my family to claim me."

A girl, who introduced herself strangely as Jessica/Clem, placed a reassuring hand onto my shoulder. "They won't get you a second time, not if we can help it." smiling, she said. "Rhea is my adopted sister, I won't let anything happen to her birth mother."

"Jessica is really my brother, Clem, mommy." smiling, Rhea said. "He can change into almost anything." giggling, she added, "Even an older sister."

I could not help giggle at that as Jessica blushed. "Thank you for taking care of my little girl.. Jessica." pecking her on the cheek, I said. "Do you all have powers like this?"

"We do." seriously, Garth replied. "However, I think its more important that we focus the issue at hand... The Agency."

"I agree, we need to place all we know on the table now." equally as serious, Geo said. "We don't want to be caught off guard a second time."

"We know that Dr Hagen knows about all of us, perhaps even that Travis kid." speaking up, Lyssa said. "Only I'm guessing you didn't know him back then, Mr Jones."

Ted shook his head. "No, we didn't." with a hint of regret, Ted replied. "Had I known who Dr Hagen was, I would not have allowed him anywhere near my children." then a thought occurred to him. "He told us that he had removed the 'tumor' that caused Garth's body to build up, yet the symbiont..."

"Amara said that Hagen only took a piece of her, stunning her enough to return me to normal." after a pause, Garth said. "That can only mean..."

"He knows about the symbionts." his face turning white, Ted said.
15522121222221211111121111.title: Continue

155221212222212111111211111.content:
"We'll work out a plan of action against Hagen later," Ted said. "How about the kids show you around the place, since you'll be staying here until things calm down?"

"Sounds good to me," I said.

I was led around by Garth's sister, Grace, Jessica, and Lyssa. Rhea, of course, tagged along. "Bet you never thought you'd see the inside of this building," Grace said.

"Never," I agreed. "I'll probably need another tour, I'm so distracted."

"It can be a lot to take in," Jessica said.

"It's not just that. I was supposed to start teaching in a couple of days. I'll have to come up with some way to explain my absence, since nobody's going to believe I'm on the run from a shadowy government organization."

"Chief Jones will help you in any way he can," Lyssa replied. "My mom will help, too. She's got to drop off my aunt at a treatment center, then she wants to talk with my cousin. She should be by sometime after that."

"Tell them thanks. Actually, though, I'm worried about how my absence will affect my homeroom class. As a baptism of fire, I've been assigned mother-hen status to a group of kids who've been classified as problem children. A few kids who aren't applying themselves well, a rich girl with an attitude problem, and a transgender student I'm supposed to keep my eye on in case of bullying. I don't know how they'll react if I'm not there; they might think I'm abandoning them."

"They'll be fine," Lyssa assured me, "don't worry."

"Thanks. You kids wouldn't be cruel to the transgender girl, would you? You understand that she's going through a rough time?"

"I try to treat her well," Lyssa said, supressing a chuckle. "She looks me in the eye when I brush my teeth."

My eyes just about popped out of my sockets. "Y-you're her? You-you look so feminine."

"Now it's my turn to thank you," she said, turning around to show her figure. "This past summer, I started turning into a complete girl."

"But how is that possible?"

"Long story. For now, let's just say that it runs in the family."
155221212222212111111211111.title: Touring the clubhouse

1552212122222121111112111111.content:
As the kids discretely blocked my view of certain halls as we passed them, I got the feeling that Ted Jones did not trust me, at least not fully. As if sensing my thoughts, Garth nodded. "Dad wants you to know just enough to stay here for a while as a guest." softly, he said. "It's not because you are not trustworthy, its because you were brainwashed."

"That was twenty years ago." sighing, I argued. "I suffered countless nightmares from my year under their thumb, I still do but I managed to move on."

"Did you do anything to try to undo that brainwashing?" serious, Grace asked.

Surprised by the question, I slowly shook my head. "No... I never looked back after I fled from The Agency." tearing up a little, I said. "I was found, trembling in an empty alley, by a young couple who adopted me."

Grace sighed. "Unless you saw someone to break that brainwashing, you are still under their control." serious, she said. "All it takes is one code phrase from them, likely over a phone, and you are theirs again." pausing, she turned to the other kids and muttered, "We better get Cait over here, fast."

"Cait?" confused, I asked. "How many members does this new gang have?"

The kids ignored my question as Garth suddenly grew to the size of an Olympian and took a strong hold of my arm. "Please do not take any offense to this." pulling me along, he said. "We can not risk you turning on us."

With that, I was half dragged, half carried into a spacious sitting room where I was pushed inside with Todd before Garth closed and locked the only door. I do not know why but I walked over to the wall and gently touched it. "Solid steel, this is a holding cell."

"Honey, I love you more than anything in this world." looking at me, Todd said. "However, I must now insist... no more mysteries, tell me everything."
1552212122222121111112111111.title: Continue

15522121222221211111121111111.content:
"I should warn you," I said, "that 'everything' covers a lot of ground. Once I get started, we can't go back to what we had before."

"Honey, we're engaged," Todd replied. "The vows say, 'for better or for worse,' and I intend to keep that promise. But I must know what the worst is."

"Alright." I took a deep breath. "I was born Sarah Smith."

"Your family changed their name?"

"Don't try to get ahead of me, sweetheart. As I was saying, the Smiths documented every little thing about me."

"That's only natural, especially with the first child. If we start a family, I'll look forward to following our little one with a camera."

"I wasn't just their little girl, Todd. I was the product of their work."

"Huh?"

"Don't get me wrong, the Smiths loved me, and would have no matter how I'd turned out. But the fact remains that my genes were personally selected by my parents, and sometimes even improved upon."

"Like how?"

"The only time I've gotten sick was five years ago, when I picked up a case of giardiasis, with a side order of unplanned pregnancy. In addition, I started walking and talking before my first birthday, and I was learning to read and write at an age when other kids were still struggling with toilet training."

Todd whistled. "Impressive. So what happened? Why'd you change your name?"

"Jon Hagen happened."

"The doctor who tried to capture us?"

"He's not just a doctor. At the time, he was working for a group I only knew as the Agency. So was my father." I paused, marshaling my strength to continue. "Dad had used Agency equipment to create me, so they decided that they owned me, and sent Hagen to collect me."

"I bet your parents weren't about to let that happen."

"That's why he shot them. Right in front of me."

Todd put his hand on my shoulder. "You... you saw your parents killed?"

I nodded. "The worst was yet to come."
15522121222221211111121111111.title: A long talk.

155221212222212111111211111111.content:
"Jon Hagen is my uncle." to Todd's shock, I explained. "He burned down my family home to hide the murders and presented me to the head of the Agency as if I were a prized doll." I began to sob at the memory.

"I'm sorry, honey." taking my hand, Todd said. "You don't have to say anything more."

"Yes, I do." rubbing the tears with my free hand, I said. "I need to get this off my chest." I took a moment to compose myself then continued. "Jon took me to a room where I was strapped to a chair and given an injection that made me feel a little sleepy only I did not fall asleep, i was sort of in between."

"A hypnotic drug." grimly, Todd said. "I heard they are dangerously addictive."

I nodded. "That was what they used to brainwash me." tearing up, I said. "Each dose stronger then the next, telling me that I was Jon's slave and he was my master. I had to obey or be punished."

"We'll make him pay for this, Sarah." seriously, Todd said. "We'll make them all pay." pausing, he asked, "How did you manage to break free form that brainwashing?"

"That day, when I shot officer Jones in the shoulder, they forgot to give me my daily dose of the drug and 'Tex' was able to reach me." tearfully, I replied. "I- I never looked back."

Todd hugged me as I broke into tears. "We'll get through this." stroking my hair, he promised. "You are a strong woman, I know we can beat this."

We hugged for what seemed like an eternity before the door clicked and opened, revealing Mr. Jones, Mr Tanner, and the kids with another teen who I assumed was the girl, Cait they had mentioned.

"Ms. Barns," Lyssa said, "this is Cait."

"How do you do?" politely, Cait asked.

I shrugged. "My life's turned upside-down and inside-out in the past week, but I'm holding together. Ted says you can help me unravel my past?"

Cait sat down across from me. "I can try."

"How does that work?"

"Just relax, and trust me."

Once the two of us made eye contact, everything seemed to go blank.

I soon found myself floating in space, surrounded by images. Before I could make heads or tails of my surroundings, Cait appeared before me. "How did you get inside my head?" sternly, I demanded. "What's going on?"

"It's a long story, ma'am," quickly, Cait replied. "I had an accident a while back, and developed telepathy and a limited ability to see the future as a result."

"Do you go into people's heads often?" unimpressed, I asked.

"As a matter of fact, you're my first." trying to sound confident, Cait said. "Usually, I just pick up people's thoughts like you overhear their conversations." pausing, she added, "The closest I've done to this was when I linked up with two of my friends to try to reason with a young schizophrenic yesterday."

"I heard about that attack at the mall." concerned, I said. "You were there? You helped that boy?"

"Kinda. One of the girls has a spirit guide, who told us what was happening to him." wincing, Cait said. "Once we understood that, we were able to 'talk' him down."

That made me relax a little. "Well, I'm not schizophrenic, so I should be an easier case. What do you need to know?"

"As much about you as I can."

I gave Cait a tour of my memories, with stops at the mystery pregnancy I had experienced, my reunion with my daughter, and the accident that gave me my shrinking powers.

"It's nice to know I've got something in common with you, Ms. Barns." smiling, Cait said.

"Sarah, please."

Cait smiled. "My aunt's name is Sarah. Now, why does the chief think you might be a problem?"

"When I was younger, I was under the thrall of a shadowy government agency." frowning, I replied. "I was supposed to kill him, but I wounded him instead, and fled for cover."

Cait whistled. "Good thing you missed him."

"I shot his shoulder. I never miss." serious, I fired back.

"Okay. How about we check out your memories of that assignment, and see if we find a clue?"

"Alright."

Cait and I soon flashed back to my childhood, to the moment before I broke free and ran away from the Agency. I was in a small, windowless room, with nothing but a firing dummy for company. "Did you play many games with that life sized dummy?" Cait asked.

"Is 'How many ways can you kill someone' a game?" sighing, I replied.

"No."

"Then no, I didn't play games with it."

The only door in the room opened, and a man, I recognized as uncle Jon stepped inside. "Kiss Kiss, my dear," he said. "I have your new assignment."

"What is it?" in a robotic tone, my past self replied.

He gave her a picture of a boy. It looked an awful lot like Garth Jones. "This is your target," the man said. "He is to be exterminated. I want a clean shot, right between the eyes."

"Understood."

Then it hit me: The younger Sarah was responding, but so was the grown Sarah beside me.

"Kiss Kiss, my dear," uncle Jon had said before leaving. My past self then returned to what she was doing as if nothing had happened.

The next thing I knew, I was back in the room Todd and I were held in with Cait being carried out, unconscious to a room across the hall. "Wait, what happened?" I asked as Ted, the last one to leave reached the door.

"She'll be fine." quickly, Ted replied. "Don't worry."

With that, he closed the door, locking it again.

"Are you alright?" concerned, Todd asked.

Just then, Geo walked into the room alone and motioned for Todd to move aside. Reluctantly, he obeyed and Geo looked me in the eye. "Kiss kiss, my dear." in a serious tone, he said.

Todd gasped and moved to stand in the way but Geo stared him down then turned back to me to see my eyes had glazed over and I was staring at him, not really thinking anything at all. "Yes... Geo?" with a robotic tone, I asked.

"From this moment forward, for the rest of your life, the phrase, 'kiss kiss, my dear' will mean nothing to you." in a firm tone, Geo said. "Whenever someone says this phrase, you will ignore it, is that understood?"

I slowly nodded. "It is understood, Geo." still talking in a robot like tone, I said. "The phrase 'kiss kiss, my dear' means nothing to me, I will ignore it."

"Good girl." smiling, Geo said. "Kiss kiss, my dear."

With that said, I slightly shook my head and looked at Geo, confused. "I'm sorry, Geo." as if waking from a dream, I said. "Was there something you wanted to say?"

Geo nodded. "Kiss kiss, my dear."

Clem chuckled. "I meant that I won't call Alyssa the wrong name again. Maybe sometimes, I'll let Jessica out to play."

"Yay!"

We all laughed, and Rhea told me about the years since the Rodgers family adopted her. I didn't regret giving her up to a different family, but I was glad to be in touch with my daughter again.
