15531.content:
My name is Tom Winters, I am thirteen years old. I have fairly fit body with short raven hair and brown eyes. I have a little sister named Aura; she's seven. She is a very petite girl with doll like features; she has her mom's auburn hair and green eyes, if I remember right.

She and I are being held prisoner by a group calling themselves The Agency. I want to escape, I really do, but I don't know where they are holding my sister. That and, if I resist them or try to escape, they promise to beat her senseless until I comply or return for a punishment of my own, usually having to watch Aura being tortured on a video screen.

“Please... Please, someone help us.” crying in my bed, I whispered. "Can anyone hear me!?"

I have the ability to gain knowledge and skills from other people's minds but I am not able to talk to them this way, though I still try. I am hoping I will, someday, reach someone and get them to send help for me and my little sister.

We had just celebrated my twelfth birthday before his nightmare began, Aura and I had come to Europe on vacation. Only, our bungalow was not yet ready so we had to find a hotel room to stay the night. We had walked into a hotel, just inside the outskirts of Rome and approached the desk where dad politely cleared his throat. He was an average sized man, from what I remember, but he was very strong, always wearing a business suit....

“May I help you?” asked the clerk, politely.

“Yes, we are vacationing here in your beautiful nation." smiling, dad said. "Unfortunately, our bungalow is not ready yet. We were hoping you had a room available for the four of us tonight.”

The desk clerk looked down at some papers then turned back to dad, smiling. “You’re in luck, sir.” he said. “A gentleman, Mr. Kline, had reserved a two bedroom suite a few weeks ago but canceled at the last minute. He left instructions to give the room to someone who could use it. It‘s paid up until the end of next week”

Dad smiled. “Now, that’s generosity.” he said.

The clerk nodded. “He’s known for that.” he waved to someone behind them. “If you will be kind enough to sign in on the registry, I will have the bellhop carry your bags up.”

Dad signed his name in the book then followed the hotel worker to the elevator, which took them up to the tenth floor.

“This is your room, sir.” politely, the bellhop said.

“Thank you.” handing the teenager a large bill, dad said. “Just leave the bags here, my kids and I can carry them in.”

“Yes, sir.” smiling, the bellhop replied. “Thank you.”

With that, he placed the bags down and walked away as dad unlocked the door and walked in with mom following close behind with Aura and I in the hall, gathering the smaller bags. Just as we reached the door, a powerful explosion rocked the room, sending the two of us to the floor. I looked up as Aura screamed to find, to my horror, that the room mom and dad had just walked into was completely engulfed in flames.

“Daddy!”

The next few days afterward were a blur to me as Aura and I were taken away to a strange, frightening place were we were separated and I was given a number of injections, making my mind feel clouded and confused. The monsters who had kidnapped us forced me into training in how to kill and torture people, form strategies on what I learn from people's minds and find weaknesses in those people they put before me. I wanted to escape, only my captors are holding my sister, Aura hostage. We were a prisoner of The Agency.

“You will do exactly as you are told.” one man had said. “If you don’t, we will beat your sister until she stops moving. Is that clear, Tom?”

I has been a year since then and i still want to escape. The only question was how?
15531.title: Tommy Winters.

155311.content:
I sat up in my bed, rubbing the sleep and tears from my eyes, and looked around my room. It was small, plainly decorated, with a large mirror covering almost a quarter of the wall to my right. I knew it was a reverse mirror, a window for my captors to keep an eye on me. On the wall to my left was a dresser mirror combo and a small closet and a door which led to a small washroom. Across the room from my bed was a closed, locked door; the only way out. Under the reverse mirror was a number of toys and games, on the floor, given to me for past jobs well done; they all meant nothing to me, I wanted my younger sister, Aura to be safe. I buried my face into my hands to silence the cries of the hundred victims I had help slay in my year as their puppet strategist.

I have a rare ability they called 'Psychic Clairvoyance'; the power to see through the eyes of other people, know what they know and, to some extent, control their bodies. I do not need to see that person to do this, a photograph will do as long as that person is within my range. Jon, my 'master', has the ability to manipulate the nervous system and has used it to increase that range several fold, though it gives me a headache later. I have tried to see through his eyes, searching for Aura, but his ability blocks me from 'getting in'. On the bright side, my own ability allows me to block him out as well, if I so desired. Jon knows about my power but not about the ability to control a person's movements. I am keeping that a secret as I try to hone that skill, I intend to use it as a trump card when it is my time to escape. Until then, I and Aura were prisoners of the Agency. “Please... Please, someone help us, can anyone hear me!?"

I paused, hearing a knock at the door. This was new to me as no one had ever knocked before, they merely entered. "Tommy, are you awake?" firmly, a deep voice asked.

I recognized the voice as my 'master' Jon. "Y- Yes, I am awake." pulling myself out of bed, I called back.

A buzz and a click was heard before the door opened and Jon entered the room. He was tall and muscular with short light brown hair and copper green eyes. He wore a black business suit and black dress shoes. He turned his gaze upon me and again surprised me by giving me a slight smile. "Ah, you just woke up, good." with a courteous tone, he said. "Get dressed, we are in for a treat today."

"A treat, sir?" walking into the washroom, I asked. "Dare I ask what this treat is?"

"You and I have been personally requested by the CEO of the Agency." with a hint of pride, Jon replied. "I can only imagine that this is due to our perfect track record."

"Yes, sir." trying not to sound depressed, I said.

"Now, cheer up." his voice still courteous, Jon said. "Do well at this meeting and I will you allow a two minute telephone conversation with your little sister."

That got my attention as Jon never offered such a prize for a job well done. "This must be very important to him." moving quickly to get ready, I thought. "I better be at my best if he is to honor that promise."

I was clean and dressed in a black suit of my own in under five minutes and Jon led me out of my prison bedroom, down the hall to the heart of the Agency complex. Their headquarters, as far as I could piece together was a vast underground facility, originally used as a nuclear bunker during the cold war. Now it served as the United Europe Orphan Placement Organization. It was the Agency's cover to allow them to do their work undetected. The UEOPO (pronounced yo- po) was an internationally funded foundation that sheltered and provided homes for orphans no one seemed to want or know existed throughout Europe and beyond. That was the cover story; in reality, they searched Europe and beyond for uniquely talented children and teens to be used as their soldiers in their quest to influence their world to their liking.

"Do not speak unless you are spoken to." in a deadly serious tone, Jon instructed. "The members of the board do not tolerate any insubordination; I have seen them kill a twenty year veteran for merely speaking out of turn."

I gulped then nodded, indicating that I understood as we reached two large doors. In front of them were two heavily armed guards who opened the doors for us. "They are expecting you, gentlemen." flatly, one said.

Jon and I nodded then entered a spacious room to find a number of well dressed but serious faced men and women sitting, around a long table. "Welcome Jon." a man at the head of the table said. he then nodded at me. "Tommy."

Again, we both nodded and the man motioned for us to take an empty seat on either side of him. We immediately did as told and the meeting began.

"Tommy, I am the CEO of the Agency, the people before you call me Alpha but you may only address me as 'sir', is that clearly understood?"

"Yes, sir." quickly, I replied.

Alpha nodded then pushed a thick folder in front of me and another in front of Jon. "You are to both study this while I brief you and the others on this mission." he said.

"Yes, sir." I replied.

Thus the meeting began.
155311.title: A promise of a reward.

1553111.content:
I opened the folder as Jon opened his own, revealing a detailed report on four teenaged individuals, each with a name and what appeared to have been an alias as it was in quotations. With them, were computer generated age progression photos of each person. I found it strange that I could not look through any of their eyes but figured that, whoever they were, they must have been out of my range.

"A little over twenty years ago, we encountered the four teenagers you see in the file in front of you." serious, Alpha began. "They had called themselves the Problem Child Gang."

I rose a single eyebrow. "They were real!?" surprised, I thought. "Did they fight the Agency!?"

"At first, we viewed them as nothing more than a minor nuisance as they were fixated upon Sykes, a long time enemy to our cause." frowning, Alpha continued. "However, Sykes led them to believe we were his employer and their attention was shifted onto us."

"They did fight the Agency." awestruck, I thought. "They fought, survived, and escaped."

"Something on your mind, Tommy?" noticing my expression, Alpha asked.

"I am impressed, sir." softly, I said. "To lock horns with the Agency and survive..."

"Actually, we were impressed as well." flatly, Alpha said. "However, two of the members of that group were the children of the most wealthy and influential families on Earth." he frowned. "To take them then would have been too much of a risk and we let them go."

Alpha then turned to a professionally dressed tall and muscular woman with long black hair and green eyes. "Beta will take it from here."

"Thank you, Alpha." politely, Beta said. "Tommy, you will call me ma'am or mistress at all times, understood?"

"Yes, mistress." quickly, I replied.

Beta nodded. "Around the time the Agency had first encountered this Problem Child Gang, we were working on a child soldier project, of which you are a part of, Tommy." looking at me, she said. "We had considered making them a part of that project but, as Alpha explained, it was too much of a risk."

I raised my hand and she gave me the permission to speak. "Why is the Agency interested in the members of this group after twenty years?" curious, I asked. "They are all in their thirties by now."

"It is not them we are after, Tommy." with a deadly stare, Beta replied. "We want their children."

My eyes grew wide, hearing that as Beta continued. "I heard you are reading the graphic novel series, based on that group, is this correct?" she asked. I nodded. "Where are you in this series?"

"Book eight." softly, I replied. "The road to Rome."

Beta nodded. "That is the last book in the series." she explained. "However, that was not the last mission of the Problem Child Gang." she turned to Alpha, who nodded, then continued. "The group had a mansion headquarters, here in Europe, Sykes and his men burned it to the ground, leaving clues that we were responsible in case they had survived, as they did the trap in Rome."

"Oh man, she spoiled the end of the book." trying not to pout, I thought.

"You haven't finished reading it, I take it." with a slight smile, Beta said. she then turned serious. "You are now living the story; the Problem Child Gang, despite their injuries, came to us in retaliation."

She turned to Alpha who then took over. "Our headquarters was originally a modern castle, built in the cold and fog shrouded northern Ural mountains." serious, he said. "The Problem Child Gang used powers we had never expected to see out of anyone, especially those as young and injured as they were." frowning, he added, "They completely destroyed the castle as Sykes destroyed their mansion, setting us and our plans back twenty years!"

"So this is a matter of revenge." feeling a cold chill run down my spine, I thought. They want their children, if any, to use in their child soldier project or use them as bait to destroy their parents."

"We need you to find them, Tommy." after getting a nod from Alpha, Beta said. "We have narrowed the search down to the New England states in America, searching news and police archives for unusual events and occurrences."

"That's not going to be easy." pressing my lips together, I thought.

Just then, a muscular man, who looked to be in his mid twenties, entered. He was of average height with light brown hair, and blue eyes. "Forgive my tardiness, Alpha." politely, he said. "My flight ran late."

I turned to the man, curious, then saw all of the adults from the file in his mind. He had not only seen them, he had made contact with them in the last twenty four hours. "They were right under their noses all this time!" impressed, I thought. "This group is truly worthy of being superheroes."

"Welcome, Max Hagen." frowning, Alpha said. "Take your seat." he then turned to me, seeing my hand raised. "Speak!"

"I have found them, sir." flatly, I said.

"Perfect track record." with an impressed look, Alpha said. "You've trained him well, Jon."

"Thank you, sir." showing pride, Jon replied.

"Tell me where they are and I will grant you one wish within my power."

"Waterfront City, New York State." again, flatly, I replied.

"Locate this Waterfront City and send a scout team!" parked Alpha to his team. he then turned to me. "Name your reward for this service."

My lips trembled slightly before I replied, "Freedom."

Alpha chuckled darkly. "You wish for freedom, do you?" looking amused, he asked. I nodded, not knowing that Jon was touching the handle of his sidearm. "So be it."

This surprised both Jon and myself as Alpha then turned to Jon. "Tommy and Aura Winters are no longer your property but your apprentices." firmly, he commanded. "Their price for failure is the same as your own."

It was not what I wanted but it was a step closer. I was no longer a prisoner but an 'employee'. "Well played, Tommy." after we were dismissed, Jon said. "You are now one of us."

"For now, Jon." nodding silently, I thought. "Just for now."

Jon smiled. "Now that you and Aura are employees and not property, you may see your sister."

My eyes lit up as if every birthday had come at once. Little did I know I was playing right into their hands as I was only being taken deeper into the complex...

Jon led me through a maze of halls, all of which looked much the same. It was obvious that I would not find my way back later without any help. Seeing her tear stained face, I turned to the woman, accusingly. "Why is she crying?" angry, I demanded.

"She had a rough day." not turning to face me, the woman replied. "We all have them."

"Tommy, this is Lady Sapphire." politely, Jon said. "She is in charge of Aura's care, just as I am in charge of yours." he then turned to Sapphire. "Alpha has declared that Tommy and Aura are now employees."

"I see..." placing my hand against the glass, I said. "Her first?"

Sapphire nodded then turned to the controls. The lights in the room dimmed and a light above me came on before she then turned to a microphone. "Aura." firmly but kindly, she said. "Aura, you have a visitor."

Aura moaned then opened her eyes, facing the window. Upon seeing me, she leaped out of bed and hurried across the room, leaving a trail of her tears as she almost literally jumped at the window, placing her hand level with my own against the glass, sobbing loudly with me. With that, Jon removed me from the room. Later that day...

155311121.content:
Later that day, Jon knocked on my door, asking to enter. I gave my permission, not wanting to push anything just yet, and he entered, holding a book and a large folder under his arm. "Alpha has a mission for us." firmly, he said. "You are to read this book and study this file carefully."

"Why a book?" curious, I asked.

"It is a loose documentary on what had happened in Rome about twenty years ago before Sykes went into hiding." serious, Jon replied. "We had gone over this countless of times but Alpha seems to think you might catch something we missed." with an amused smile, he added, "I thought placing it into book form would make it easier for you to study."

I shrugged, not seeing the difference then motioned to the file. "Are those the recon reports on Waterfront City?"

Jon nodded. "We don't have a lot at the moment but I figured I'd give you what we had so you can start working on them."

I nodded and Jon left to allow me to get to work. First, I opened the book and began to read...

It was close to noon in a small suburb inside the busy streets of Rome. There was a certain calm in the air, one that would make any alert person uneasy. Greg, in traditional western clothing, walked out into the open and gazed upon the ten story building they had targeted. There did not seem to be anything out of the ordinary, however, his instincts were telling him otherwise. Inside the target building was a man named Sykes, whom they needed information from, and they were not about to let that man get away.

"Keep a sharp eye out, everyone." he said, through his ear piece radio. "I have a nagging feeling that we are not the only people working this side of the street."

Nearby, Jon, a tall, well built man in a black business suit, raised a hand to an ear piece radio of his own, having heard the transmission. "What the hell?"

"Did you hear that, Jon?" came a woman's voice.

"I did, Crystal." replied Jon, radioing back. "It's coming over the static, their frequency must be overlapping our own."

"That means they must be real close."

"Rodger that. Keep your eyes out. I don't want any surprises. Sykes won't get away this time." he turned to a small girl, standing next to him, holding a sniper rifle in her arms. "Kayo, get ready."

The girl looked up at Jon with a blank look in her eyes. "Yes, Jon." she said.

On the roof of another building, Heather, in western clothing, sat crouched down in front of a number of small flat panel screens on a folding rack rising from an expensive violin case. Each screen showed a parts of the surrounding area and key rooms inside their target building through cameras on small, mechanical flies, built by Sam.

"I... I'm nervous, Greg." she said, her voice wavering.

"Why?" asked Greg. "What do you see?"

"There has been a large increase of suit activity in the area and there is a heavy smell of gun oil in the air. I'm afraid we are not the only people after Sykes."

"Remain calm and keep an eye on them. If they get too close to your location, move to your alternate spot."

"Rodger that."

Inside a small government car, Crystal, a slender, well dressed woman with Italian features, listened to the children talk, taking notes, then turned to her radio. "Confirmed. This group is also after Sykes. What are your orders?"

"We wait for them to make their move. If they are successful, we simply surround them and take Sykes off their hands. You know the routine."

"Rodger that."

Standing in a nearby alley, Tex, also in western clothing, rolled his eyes and touched his radio. "We tracked this guy for weeks." he said, irritably. "I say we go for it now! Besides, that worm is holding a small girl hostage! Who knows what he's doing to her in there!"

Inside a black, full sized van, Sam, also in western clothing, frowned. "Relax, Tex." he said into his radio. "You'll get your chance to bust a few heads soon enough."

"We have to consider the suits." added Greg. "We can not afford a battle on two fronts, not now."

"And if they are after Sykes as well?" radioed Heather.

Greg gnawed his jaws in decision. "Tex, I want you to crash the party inside the target building. Make as much noise as you can and take Sykes. I will follow behind, handle anyone you miss, and rescue the girl. Sam you're our transport out, be ready. Heather, do you have a physical visual of the girl?"

"Yes, Greg."

"Keep an eye on her, tranquilize anyone who gets too close, understood?"

"Yes, Greg."

"Let's do this!"

'Rodger that.' came Tex's voice.

Inside her car, Crystal's eyes widened in surprise. The voice sounded very close. She looked up to find a tall boy, no older than thirteen or fourteen years of age, standing a mere twenty feet from her car. The child wore a brown T- shirt and brown cargo pants with a long jacket and heavy black boots. In a sheath on his back was what looked like a long, heavy metal bar. Looking at him, he appeared to have been carved out of stone with eyes that burned like wild fire. Crystal suppressed a cold shiver as the boy ran passed her to charge the front doors of his target building. He puled out the long bar and ran through the doors, without slowing. Inside, she could hear muffled gun shots and adult screams as the child began his attack. Immediately after, another boy ran passed.

He was taller, but far more slender than the first. Most of his body was hidden behind a long black cloak. His face, however, was pale with cold, calculating eyes that threatened to enter her very soul. Crystal watched him run into the building through the destroyed door before hearing more adult screams as puffs of different colored smoke lightly billowed out of the door and open windows. Seeing this, she shivered off a certain coldness then turned to her radio.

'Jon, I have made visual contact with two members of the other party..' she said, quietly. 'They are teenagers.'

Jon touched his ear piece radio. 'Teenagers? It must be the Problem Child Gang.'

'Difficult to say at this time.' said Crystal. 'But, judging from what I saw of them, it will not be easy to bring these kids down, if it comes to that.'

'Then, let's hope it doesn't come to that.'

'Rodger.'

Inside the building, Tex charged passed the men, their bullets bouncing off of his rock like frame as Greg took them down with both fighting skill and various chemical creations of his own design. The bullets that came his way, bounced harmlessly off of his specially designed bullet resistant clothing his partner, Sam had designed and built for him and the others, though Tex felt he had no need for it.

'Let's get this done quickly, Tex.' he called out. 'We can't stay long.'

'Rodger that!' replied Tex.

He made a bee line for the stairs.

Inside the building next door, Josh and Vendetta made their way up a number of stairs, heading to the top floor. Vendetta, with her genetically advanced hearing, detected the faint sounds of gun fire. She turned and let out a low gasp as she witnessed a scene taking place in the building next door. Josh turned, hearing her gasp and stared as well.

There, through one window, they caught view of a young boy with short dust blond hair charging up a flight of stairs, towards a man armed with an automatic weapon. Vendetta's mouth opened as if to scream as the man opened fire upon the boy. Her eyes widened in surprise as she witnessed the bullets bouncing harmlessly off of the boy's body as if he were made of stone. Josh, seeing this as well, touched his ear piece radio.

'We have a visual on one of the other party.' he said. 'The boy appears to be unaffected by small arms fire. Inform all units not to approach these individuals directly.'

'Rodger that.' came Jon's voice. 'Continue on to your primary target.'

'Understood.'

'Is he... one of them?' Vendetta wondered silently. 'If he is...'

'Let's go, Vendetta.' said Josh. 'We have work to do.'

Vendetta hesitated as she continued to watch and was taken back as the boy knocked the weapon out of the man's hand with a wave of his own then, with his free hand, delivered a crushing blow to the man's stomach. Vendetta could hear the man cry out in pain as a gush of blood flew out of his mouth. Then the boy grabbed the man by the belt and swung him in the air a full one hundred and eighty degrees before sending him flying through a window. The man sailed across the alley and crashed through a window close to where Vendetta and Josh were standing.

Vendetta let out a low scream of surprise then reached for her secondary weapon, a forty five magnum, resting in a holster, strapped to the small of her back. But Josh stopped her and pointed to the man, he was completely out cold.

'He is no threat to us.' he said. 'Let's go.'

Vendetta turned back to the window, hoping to catch another glimpse of the strange boy but he was gone.

I looked up from the book, curious. "I know Josh, he is field training instructor." whispering, I said. "Only who is this Vendetta and how does she play in all of this?"
155311121.title: I am handed a new graphic novel.

1553111211.content:
I decided that the answers to my questions had to be somewhere in the pages of the book John had handed me so I continued to read....

...Vendetta turned back to the window, hoping to catch another glimpse of the strange boy but he was gone. “I’m coming.” she said.

Back to Tex, as he threw the guard through the window, he caught a glimpse of the girl and the man. A look of recognition flashed on his face. “I’ve seen them somewhere before.” softly, he muttered. he shrugged it off and continued up the stairs. "I have a bigger fish to fry today!"

Inside one room on the top floor of the building, Sykes paced nervously back and forth in front of his hostage, fingering the handle of an automatic pistol.

“This is not good.” impatiently, he mumbled. “No one is taking the bait and time is running out.” he turned to the small girl, tied to a chair with a gag in her mouth. “If either of those two fools don’t make a move soon, my dear, I am afraid I am going to have to kill you.”

The small girl pleaded and begged under her gag as tears flowed from her eyes.

“Now, now; it’s nothing personal." cooing the girl, Sykes said. "I actually like you, I was tempted to take you in as one of my own." he gave a dark chuckle to the girl's muffled response. "Unfortunately, this is business and you have become an unnecessary asset.”

He pulled out the gun, turning off the safety, as he then pointed it at her head.

Heather, watching from her roof top post let out a low gasp, seeing Sykes make his move, and quickly took up a sniper rifle with a silencer before taking a quick but careful aim.

On Kayo’s post on another building, she let out a low gasp of her own before taking a defensive position in front of Jon. She had spotted a small girl on the roof of their target building, raising a sniper rifle with a silencer on the muzzle. She let out a sigh of relief, however, as she watched the girl point it at a different building and open fire.

Seeing this as well, Jon raised a hand to his ear piece radio. “There is a small girl, armed with a sniper rifle on the roof of our target building.” he said. “She might have seen us. I want her detained, if possible.”

“Rodger that.” came Crystal’s vice. “Josh and Vendetta have silenced their target. I am in the building with the clean up crew now, I will get it done.”

Back to Sykes, the girl cringed as he pushed down the hammer of his weapon but let out a cry of pain as a bullet ripped through the window and struck his hand, forcing him to drop the gun. At that exact moment, Tex literally crashed through the door and landed a heavy blow to Sykes jaw, throwing him completely off of his feet. Sykes landed hard against the wall then slid to the floor, he looked to be unconscious. After checking the man's pulse to ensure he was still alive, Tex took notice of the bullet wound in his hand.

“Nice shot, Heather.” he radioed.

On the roof, Heather let out a low giggle. “Thanks.”

Tex then turned to the girl, still tied to the chair, and removed her gag. “When are you not going to be in trouble, Hannah?" smiling slightly, he asked. "You're lucky I like you so much." he then released her from her bonds as Greg entered the room.

“Sykes men have fled the building.” with a hint of worry, he said. “I don't like this, it was easy, almost too easy... I smell a trap."

"At least we finally got Sykes." turning to where he left the man, Tex said. his voice died as he saw he was no longer there. "Where did he go!?"

Greg looked around, his eyes slowly widening. "I saw explosives on the first floor, secured to the main support pillars." panic in his voice, he said. "This place is rigged to implode!"

Tex, showing fear, turned to the window; he let out a low gasp as he spotted a woman, leading a number of men up a flight of stairs, towards the roof. “It's a trap, Heather, you have company coming!” screaming, he radioed. “Get out of there, now!”

“Rodger that!” replied Heather.

Greg then turned to his radio. "Sam, its a trap, bring the ride!"

It was then that the entire building Tex and Greg were in shook from a heavy explosion, nearly throwing Tex, Greg, and Hannah off balance. "Sam, bring the ride!"

Inside an armored van, Sam threw the gear shift into drive and floored the accelerator. The vehicle reacted immediately and sped forward, out of one alley, down a long, narrow road, towards the alley next to the target building just as an explosion was heard, sending heavy amounts of rock and dust into the air while, on her roof top perch, Heather abandoned her equipment and ran to the corner of the roof. She latched a hook with a long piece of rope to a special belt she was wearing, preparing herself for her jump, as practiced since they first targeted the building. Only she nearly fell over the edge as an explosion rocked the building and she screamed, seeing the target building crumbling onto itself!

“The building is falling!" panicked, she radioed. "Sam, hurry!"

Heather gasped as a second explosion rocked the first floor in the room where her two friends had confronted Sykes. Only she breathed a sigh as she heard Greg radio, "Sam, the ride, NOW!"

The van raced between the two buildings as one was falling straight down. Greg jumped from the top story building, his body covered in gashes and scrapes from flying debris. He fell down through a roof door, into the van with pinpoint accuracy. Tex jumped from a window further down, with Hannah screaming in his arms, both just as injured only Tex more so as he had to have shielded Hannah from some type of blast. The two landed inside the van in the same way. As Heather waited for her turn, she heard the roof door swing open. She turned around with a low gasp to face Crystal and a number of men in business suits.

“Freeze!” ordered Crystal. “Stay where you are!”

“Ten seconds, Heather!” radioed Sam. “Jump now!”

Hearing this, Sleuth gave Crystal a mischievous smile. “Hmmm…. No.”

With that, she jumped up and back, diving off of the roof. Crystal ran over to the edge and was immediately aware that she was attached to a rope. She looked over the edge to see her land inside an armored van, though a roof door, as it passed. Then, she was gone, lost in the smoke and debris of the fallen building, the rope swinging freely in the wind. The sound of an engine reached her and she turned to see the van pulling out of the smoke. It sped away with a number of black cars giving pursuit. Seeing that her men were giving chase, she sighed and touched her radio. “She got away.” disappointed, she said. “She jumped off of the roof into an armored van, heading north, the back up unit is giving pursuit." pausing, she spotted the abandoned equipment. "She left behind her monitoring equipment." radioing again, she said. "Its like nothing I've ever seen, its worth study."

“Roger that.” replied Jon. “Pack it in and return to headquarters.”

From his post, Jon let out a low sigh of his own. “Those kids are far from ordinary.” annoyed, he muttered. "If we manage to catch them, I want to know exactly who they are!” he turned to Kayo. “Let’s go home.”
......................

I placed the book down and sighed. "Well, now I know where they got this part of story from, the abandoned monitoring equipment." softly, I muttered. "The Problem Child Gang is indeed far from ordinary."

I then...
1553111211.title: I continue to read.

15531112111.content:
The following day, Jon returned to the crumbled building to search for signs that might tell him if Sykes was dead or had gotten away. He was about to head back to the car through an alley with Kayo in the lead but froze as she suddenly motioned him to stay back. Standing at the mouth of the alley was the tall, muscular boy who had attacked the target building and escaped its deadly trap. He and his Problem Child Gang had lost the back up team and he guessed that they had returned for the same reasons. The boy, who he recognized as Tex 'the mighty' was covered in blood from scratches and gashes from the explosion and falling debris. He looked at Kayo, then at Jon before turning back to her. "We meet again, my mysterious friend." staring Kayo down, Tex said. "I'm sad to see you working for the bad guys."

"Bad guys?" tilting her head to the side, Kayo asked.

"This boy is of no use to us, Kayo." stepping up behind her, Jon said. "Kill him."

Kayo rose her sniper rifle, leveling it with Tex's heart, and turned off the safety before touching the trigger. Only she did not fire, it was as if she could not get herself to do so as Tex showed a hint of fear, staring down barrel of the rifle. "I- I'm trying to obey, Jon." apologetically, Kayo said. "I want to obey but-"

"Kayo, kill him, now!" sternly, Jon ordered.

"Don't listen to him!" regaining his composure, Tex said. "You are better than this, better than him!"

Kayo's hands began to shake, a look of uncertainty on her face. "I- I must obey." stammering, she said. "Jon is my master, I am his slave."

"You are not a slave!" roared Tex, startling Kayo. "You are a confused little girl being toyed with by a sick man who uses you to murder people!"

"Shut him up!" pointing at Tex, Jon yelled. "He is trying to turn us on each other!"

Kayo's hands shook a little more. "Mommy... daddy...." tears forming, she whimpered.

"Did Jon kill them to get you, Kayo?" taking a step forward, Tex asked. "Drop the rifle and I'll rattle his bones for you."

Kayo lowered the rifle for a second then rose it back up again, fingering the trigger. "I must defend Jon!" blankly, she yelled. "Do not come closer!"

"You can't win, boy." smirking, Jon said. "Kayo is ours and nothing you can say will turn her against me."

Tex's eyes narrowed to angry slits. "Nothing, huh?" hissing, he asked.

The coldness of his voice caused Jon to hesitate as Tex then turned back to Kayo. "Kayo, who killed mommy and daddy?" softly, he asked.

Once again, Kayo's hands began to shiver, tears running down her face as she slowly, tearfully replied, "Jon... did."

"Why protect someone who killed those you love the most?" taking another careful step closer, Tex asked. "Drop the rifle."

"Kayo, for the last time, kill the boy or I will kill you both!" impatient, Jon said.

A look of desperation came across Kayo's face before she suddenly moved the rifle so it was pointing at Tex's left shoulder. With a tearful look in her eyes, she said, "I am sorry."

With that, she pulled the trigger. The force of the shot sent Tex stumbling into the street before Kayo wildly turned to Jon, leveling the rifle at his heart. "Murderer!" crying, she screamed.

The shot echoed in the alley as Jon fell to the floor while Kayo ran out into the streets, sidearm in hand as she ran into the streets. Her foot falls echoed into silence as Tex then turned to Jon and easily lifted him off the ground with his one good arm and threw him into the wall of the building, holding him there with a vice like grip. "I will only ask you once..." hatred in his voice, he said. "Where do I find your boss!?"
............................................................................ .

I placed the book down, my face turning pale, then turned to see Jon standing near the bed. "Yes, I am the one who told them how to find the castle headquarters." flatly, he said. "I had thought we could easily dispose of or capture them if we lured them there."

"Only you underestimated their power." softly, I said.

Jon nodded. "I did not, Carlos did." gruffly, Jon replied. "Alpha was second in command at the time, now he is in charge after disposing of Carlos for his incompetence."

"What of this Kayo who turned against you?" curious, I asked.

Jon smiled. "Do not worry." walking out of the room, he said. "I'll settle that score eventually."

With that, he closed the door behind him.
15531112111.title: continued to read.

155311121111.content:
I lay on the bed in my room, wondering where this Kayo was now, and what Jon planned to do with her. It was as I was pondering this, that a curious thing happened. I felt a probing at my mind, similar to how I felt when I entered someone else's mind. It didn't feel like the presence was threatening, or the gentle probing intruding, it felt like the equivalent of a knock at the door. I opened my mind to the presence.
'Hello,' said a female voice 'I wondered where you were. There isn't much time, I'm here to get you and your sister out of here.'
'These rooms are guarded all the time,' I replied 'How are you going to get both me and my sister out of here?'
'I have my ways,' said Owl 'I can't seem to get in contact with Aura, though, and I haven't been able to find out where she's held.'
'I've been promised sitting across from her at lunch tomorrow,' I said 'If there was a better time to rescue us, I can't think of one.'
'All right, sit tight, I'll have you both out of here by tomorrow night,' and Owl broke the connection.
155311121111.title: continue.

choices: Everyone in the room, except Tommy, Aura and Jon fall asleep
1553111211111.content:
I was lead into what appeared to be the mess hall. Various other children and older kids were sitting, eating in a mechanical way, almost like they were programmed to do it. I had always been given food in my room before. I guessed the kids in here were Agency-brainwashed goons.
"Are you here?" my mind quested out for Owl, still shielding myself from John as I searched
"Just sit down at the table," said Owl "Act natural, but don't eat the food."
"Why?"
"Toxins in the food, used to make you more compliant, they're making their play to brainwash you two,"
"I'll be on guard," I replied "Have you managed to get through to Aura?"
"I found her, she knows not to eat, when all hell breaks loose, run for the door," I nodded, then realised she might not be able to see me, and stopped. John led me towards a table, where Aura sat. Her eyes immediately lit up when she saw me, and she jumped down from the chair and ran to me. We embraced each other as Jon watched impassively.
1553111211111.title: Tomorrow, lunch

15531112111112.content:
There were several small thuds throughout the room, as every single brainwashed kid, and the kitchen staff that had been bringing out food, immediately fell unconscious. Jon immediately drew his gun, and pointed it at the door.
"I know you're here, Owl," he said "If your little commune with my charges wasn't enough, that trick is the first one I taught you."
"That predictable, am I?" said a voice, which seemed to come from one of the unconscious kids. Jon shot a bullet at him, and he fell to the ground, dead.
"How about this?" said another voice, coming from the other side of the room from where Jon had just shot, and every one of the tables in the room, which were bolted to the ground, uprooted themselves, and flew towards Jon.
Jon dodged to the side to avoid one table, but was struck by another, sending him into a wall. Two more of the kids stood up from their chairs, and offered hands to myself and Aura.
"It's nice to finally meet face to face," said both kids at the same time "Even if it's not my own face, come on."
Although I was a bit put-off by the way the two kids were talking in sync, I got up to follow them out of the room, jogging slightly to keep up with their brisk pace.
15531112111112.title: Everyone in the room, except Tommy, Aura and Jo...

choices: run through the maze with Aura.
155311121112.content:
I was startled by a firm knock on my door. It opened and a tall, dark figure with short black hair and brown eyes cautiously entered. I recognized him as Josh. He was wearing a black business suit with black dress shoes and leather gloves. "I apologize for the interruption, Tommy." Politely, he said. "However, I need to take you to the training field. As an employee, you must be fully certified in hand to hand and weapons combat."

I silently nodded then followed Josh through a series of hallways and corridors to an open field in the back corner of the complex. There were other training fields throughout the property; this one was a garden maze with high walls of shrubbery and paths which mostly lead to dead ends.

"Why did we take the scenic route here?" Darkly curious, I asked.

"It's standard procedure for any new employee." Serious, Josh replied. "We want to know if we can trust the new hire before we allow them to know their way around."

Again, I silently nodded. I now understood why Jon took me through such a maze of hallways to see Aura; he did not want me to find her again so easily on my own. "Where do we start, sir?" Softly, I asked. "Hand to hand?"

"If you wish." Calmly, Josh said. "Only I was thinking more of a maze run."

"A what...?" Confused, I asked.

The sound of a door opening reached my ear and I turned to see a young woman stepping out onto the field. She was tall and slender with shoulder length blond hair and hazel eyes. I gasped upon seeing Aura step out right behind her! My first instinct was to run to her but Josh firmly held be back with an iron grip upon my shoulder. "Thank you for retrieving Aura for me, Vendetta." Calmly, he said. "You know what must be done."

I became fearful as Vendetta leaned down and began to whisper in Aura's ear but paused as Josh whispered into mine. "Your goal was to run through the garden maze in front of you to find and kill a trespasser whom we had caught and questioned last week." Serious, he explained. "Vendetta and I already too care of that nasty business. Your job is to run through the maze and find your way out before they notice you and your sister made a run for it."

I turned to Josh surprised. "Why...?"

Josh frowned. "There is no time to explain, kid." Darkly, he said. "This is your only chance to get out before you are both in too deep. If you fail, you will both die."

I gulped at that and turned to Aura; she seemed just as nervous and uncertain as I felt. We only had seconds to decide. I took a breath and decided to...
155311121112.title: An unlikely ally.

1553111211121.content:
I ran to Aurra, grabbed her hand and sprinted into the maze.
“We don’t have very long before they realise what happened,” I said, panting slightly as you turned a corner “It’s good to have you back, Aurra.”
As I turned another corner, I saw two agency goons with guns coming from down one of them the maze corridors. I couldn’t outrun them, but I could make so many twists and turns that the goons would have trouble finding us. I appeared to know instinctively which way the exit of the maze was, as myself and Aurra continued running. Had I read it in one of the handlers minds? It was strange. I was pretty sure I didn’t have the power to move through mazes instinctively. As we continued, we almost ran right into the woman on the other side of the maze. I swerved to avoid her tripped over, pulling Aurra with me, and landed hard
1553111211121.title: run through the maze with Aura.

15531112111211.content:
"Quickly, children!" Urgently, the woman said. "We don't have much time!"

The woman looked exactly like Vendetta; tall and slender with shoulder length blond hair and hazel eyes. "Who are you?" Worried, I demanded.

"The name is Creed." Quickly, the woman replied. "I'm with the Cloaked Dagger."

I turned to Aura, uncertain but relaxed as she gave a relieved sigh. "They're the European version of the Problem Child Gang."

I nodded then quickly followed Creed with Aura right behind me. We were lead to a small car where Creed urged us to get in. She jumped in herself and barked to the driver, "Go, Ace, go!"

The driver, Ace, hit the accelerator and we were off, speeding away from the dark complex that had been our prison for over a year. "Thank you for the rescue." Timidly, I said. "Is Josh a member of your group as well?"

"Josh was a double agent, working for the British secret service." Surprising me, Creed replied. "Vendetta is my twin sister; she and I were a part of the original Cloaked Dagger group. She and Josh worked together to help undermine the Agency back in the day."

"How did you find us?" Wincing, Aura asked.

"We didn't." Gruffly, Ace said. "A kid from the new Problem Child Gang heard your cries for help and contacted us." He gave a low chuckle. "I must admit, it feels good to be back in action."

Ace was a bald, slender, muscular man of average height in his early thirties. I caught a glimpse of his green eyes in the rear view mirror.

"We can waltz down memory lane later, Ace." Scolding, Creed said. "Right now, we need to get these two back to the old HQ and find out how much they can tell us about The Agency's plans."

With that, she picked up a phone and dialed a number. Moments later, a feminine voice answered. "Madam Vague, we have them." Serious, she said. "Tell your daughter they are in good health and in good hands." There was a pause before Creed then said, "Yes, we will contact you if we learn anything more."

With that, she ended the call then turned to see my confused expression. "Madam Vague is an old friend of both groups." Kindly, she explained. "She was an advisor of sorts though her messages were a bit cryptic to say the least."

"Hence her name." Guessing correctly, Aura said.

Creed nodded. "Precisely."

Within minutes Ace turned the car down a narrow road to...
15531112111211.title: The Cloaked Dagger.

155311121112113.content:
Within minutes Ace turned the car down a narrow road to... a canal! I let out a surprised shriek only to pause, confused as the road in front of us lifted, revealing an underground passage. The car drove down it and the doorway closed on its own behind us. As we passed through the entrance, I felt slightly light headed as a dull flash enveloped us. I looked around to find that we had stopped in a large parking garage. "What the bloody hell was that all about?!" Stunned, I demanded. "I feel weird..."

"Teleportation." Bemused, Creed replied. "Just one of the many things Sykes and the Agency are after, not to mention CHILD."

"We are in a modified underground bunker that was used by Italian resistance forces during the second World War." Calmly, Ace said. "The 'garage door' we went through is just the access port; anyone else would only find the garage of a resident multimillionaire."

"He was the leader of our group." Smiling, Creed said. "You will meet him later."

"Everyone out." Firmly, Ace said. "The rest of the group is expecting us."

Uncertain, I followed Aura out with Creed and Ace leading us through a heavy metal door into a long hall that lead to another and another. "Just another maze." Sighing, Aura muttered.

"I understand your concerns." Calmly, Creed said. "These hallways were already here when we took it over. It was to slow down anyone who managed to gain entry."

After taking nearly a dozen turns passed various rooms and other hallways, we entered a large conference room where a dozen other people were waiting. All of them were in their early to mid thirties with serious expressions on their faces. Creed urged us both to sit down side by side as a boy no older than myself walked up with his hands passively behind his back. Professionally dressed, he was rather muscular with black hair and piercing green eyes.

"Good morning, children." Calmly, he said. "My group name is Cog. As you may or may not have guessed, I have not aged in over fifty years. I have the ability to slow down or even work outside of normal time."

"How is that even possible?" Stunned, I asked.

"For now, all you need to understand is that there are certain places on our planet where powerful people are born." Serious, Cog replied. "There are powerful people, both good and evil, after the secrets of these places." He sighed. "It is our job to protect those secrets."

"I'm guessing we are a part of that secret." Glumly, I said.

"All those born in these places are a part of that secret." Gently, Creed said. "The point is, we cannot allow that power to fall into the wrong hands."

"Hence the birth of the Cloaked Dagger and The Problem Child Gang." Serious, Cog said. "We all knew and understood that the fight would rekindle eventually as it had again and again all around the world for decades."

"An endless waltz..." Softly, Aura said. "That's what daddy said war was like."

Cog nodded. "That it is... an endless waltz." Softly, he replied. "All we can do is put out the fires in front of us and pray others after us pick up the fight."

I turned to Aura who gave me a nod with a look of determination. I nodded back and turned to Cog with the same expression. "We are in."
155311121112113.title: Endless Waltz.

1553111211121131.content:
"You've already met Creed and Ace." Calmly, Cog said. "Creed is exactly like her sister, Vendetta. Both are literally masters in all styles of fighting with gun, knife or bare hand. They are nearly untouchable in combat. Ace has the ability to literally become one with any vehicle, piloting them with incredible skill. He can also possess any person he chooses and 'pilot' them as well within a certain distance."

"That's insane..." Startled, I muttered.

"No more insane than your ability to see through the eyes and hearts of other people." Calmly, a plump man in loose fitting clothing said. "They call me Freak. I have the ability to grow into a literal giant and fire energy blasts from my hands. Originally, I worked for a group called The Guard back in the States but they asked me to give them a hand."

Freak had gentle blue eyes but his wind burned face was covered in scars, making me wince. He smile kindly at my reaction. "I have looked worse after a mission."

"They call me Blacksmith." A towering muscular man said. "I built anything and everything they needed from Assault rifles to Zeno tapes." He smiled. "Also, I'm not half bad when it comes to fighting if I have to."

I nodded but could not help stare. Blacksmith seemed to be made or at least covered in steel from head to toe with just his green eyes showing through a mask. "What happened to you?" Was all I could ask.

"Blacksmith was badly injured during our last mission twenty years ago." Sadly, Cog replied. "He had shielded us from a massive explosion that would have killed us all." He paused, rubbing one eye. "He may have a body like steel but he still suffered from third degree burns over more than seventy percent of his body."

"This steel seeped from my own body to protect me while I slowly healed." With a slight smile, Blacksmith explained. "It stayed so I am now literally a 'man of steel'.

"You may call me Gargoyle." Calmly, another muscular man said. "I have the ability to shape shift into any creature I desire, past, present, or mythological. My brother has the same powers but he has moved to the States to help the clean up crew there." He frowned. "I heard that he and his wife produced a child who, after a failed assassination attempt, was born with an advanced form of our powers."

Gargoyle had longish black hair and piercing green eyes with a face, an entire body that looked as if it were carved from stone. All I could do was nod in return.

"You may call me Mirage." Calmly, a slender woman said. "I have the ability to create solid illusions to distract, slow down, or even fight any would be pursuers or enemies." She sighed. "Make no mistake, what you are hearing, The Agency already knows as we have dealt with them on more than a few occasions."

Mirage had long brown hair and brown eyes and wore regular western style clothing which confused me. A bemused smile formed on her face seeing my expression. "The best way to vanish into a crowd is to blend in." Smiling slightly, she said.

"These are the original members of The Cloaked Dagger." Serious, Cog said. "The other five are our support team and clean up crew."
1553111211121131.title: meeting the other members.

15531112111212.content:
The woman pulled a net from her back and threw it towards them. You pulled Aurra back into one of the other passages in the maze. You continue moving, but knew that at some point, running would no longer be an option.

Remarkably, you found yourself emerging on the other side of the maze, to find a young woman waiting for you.
“No time to explain,” said the girl “But we need to go, now.”
“We can trust her,” said Aurra “She’s on our side.”
You nodded, and began running. You felt a strange amount of adrenaline as you continued to follow the mystery girl across the plains that the maze had opened up onto.
“Owl to base, I have the kids, we’re on our way to the rendezvous,” she said, glancing over her shoulder “They’re right behind us.”

A few moments of silence: “Understood.”
As they continued running, something so bright, you couldn’t look directly at it passed overhead. Not stopping, not looking back, you continued running.
15531112111212.title: The woman is an enemy

155311121112122.content:
As you continued running, you skidded to a halt, as several agents faded into existence in-front of you.

15532.content:
My name is Aura Winters, I'm seven. I'm smaller than most girls, I look a little like a doll. I have auburn hair, like my mom, and green eyes, like my dad. I miss them and my big brother, Tommy so much. He and I are being held by someone called The Agency. I want to get away from here but not without my brother. The people who come to see me said that if I am bad, Tommy will get hurt. They make me watch a television, showing him getting beat up, each time I am bad. I wish I knew where he was so I could save him. I just know that, together, we can get away.

"Help us!" hugging a teddy bear, I thought. "Please... Please someone hear me!"

I seem to know everything about anyone I see as if I had known them all their life. I really don't know how it works or why, it just does. I tried to use it on the people I see here but what I get from them don't make any sense. Its like piecing a puzzle together without a picture to go by.

We had just celebrated Tommy's twelfth birthday before all this started. We had all come to Europe for a vacation but the house, I think it was called a bungalow, was not ready yet. Daddy took us out to find a hotel for the night. We all walked into one hotel, just outside of Rome and walked up to the desk. Dad politely cleared his throat. He was not tall but not short either and he was strong. I think he always dressed fancy....

“May I help you?” asked the clerk, politely.

“Yes, we are vacationing here in your beautiful nation." smiling, dad said. "Unfortunately, our bungalow is not ready yet. We were hoping you had a room available for the four of us tonight.”

The desk clerk looked down at some papers then turned back to dad, smiling. “You’re in luck, sir.” he said. “A gentleman, Mr. Kline, had reserved a two bedroom suite a few weeks ago but canceled at the last minute. He left instructions to give the room to someone who could use it. It‘s paid up until the end of next week”

Dad smiled. “Now, that’s generosity.” he said.

The clerk nodded. “He’s known for that.” he waved to someone behind them. “If you will be kind enough to sign in on the registry, I will have the bellhop carry your bags up.”

Dad signed his name in the book then followed the hotel worker to the elevator, which took them up to the tenth floor.

“This is your room, sir.” politely, the bellhop said.

“Thank you.” handing the teenager a large bill, dad said. “Just leave the bags here, my kids and I can carry them in.”

“Yes, sir.” smiling, the bellhop replied. “Thank you.”

The guy placed the bags down and walked away as dad unlocked the door and walked in with mom right behind him. Tommy and I were in the hall, picking up some of the bags. Just as we got to the door, the whole hall shook, throwing us both to the floor. I looked up and screamed, seeing fire shooting out of the room. I guess it was too much for me because I think I passed out. The last thing I heard was Tommy screaming. “Daddy!”

The next few days after that were horrible. Tommy and I were taken away to a strange, scary place under the ground. They took us in different directions... that was the last time I saw my big brother. I was given a number of shots, they made my head hurt then feel messed up and confused. Those jerks who took us made me learn how how to kill and torture people, form strategies on what I learn from people's minds and find force confessions out of those people they put before me. I wanted to escape, only they have my big brother somewhere in this strange place.

“You will do exactly as you are told.” one man had said. “If you don’t, we will beat your bother until she stops moving. Is that clear, Aura?”

It's been a year since then, I still want to get away but not without my brother.

1553212212211.content:
We did not go home, as I thought was the original plan. We instead went to the home of an old friend of my dad who we knew as Dr Khan. He was an elderly man of far eastern decent but was as physically fit as a man in his early twenties. He had short black hair with some gray highlights and blue eyes which seemed to twinkle when he laughed. On the way there, dad called him on the cellphone and told him what had happened to which he informed dad to hit us both with some chloroform, something we were unaware of until Amadeus shoved a foul smelling cloth against both of our faces.....

"It was a meteor of unusual properties that had struck your children, Mr Johnson." upon waking up, I heard Dr Khan say. "However, it was an old meteor, ejected from the ground, somehow. Otherwise, a direct hit like that would have killed your entire family instantly."

"I need answers, doctor." not seeing I was awake, dad said. "Give me your thoughts."

"Well first, the meteor is highly magnetic and giving off low levels of radiation." wincing, Dr Khan began. "Upon testing it, I discovered that it was also saturated with chemicals and compounds I would expect to find in a toxic waste dump." he sighed. "I'm guessing it was effected by these chemicals, which only added to its unusual properties. I would also guess that it was ejected from an illegal dump site that had exploded due to the heat, igniting the chemicals. Did you hear any explosion before you saw the 'meteorite'?"

"I heard something like a sonic boom before Amadeus spoke up." thoughtful, dad said. "Do you think the effect this had on my children will wear off?"

"Unfortunately, no." regretfully, Dr Khan said. "I fear this is only the beginning."

"Are you saying this going to get worse!?" frightened, I asked.

Dad turned to me, worried. "Easy, honey." softly, he said. "You don't want to start growing in here."

"Allow me to explain, my dear." walking up to me, Dr Khan said. "Normally, humans do not suddenly grow or shrink to any degree as you and your brother did. However, the strange properties of the meteorite, added to the volatile chemicals it was saturated in, changed your body's entire chemistry."

"Cut to the chase, Dr Khan." tearing up, I said. "What happened to my brother and I?"

"I'd probably lose you with the technical jargon so I will try to explain it simply." smiling slightly, Dr Khan said. "The meteorite that hit you and your brother unlocked a part of your brain that is largely unknown to science as it is normally dormant. That part of your brain is producing an energy that allows your body to grow and shrink at will." he paused, allowing his words to sink in. "So far, this new ability is reacting to your emotional state, like a reflex. I suggest we work on getting some form of control over this before going any further with studying it."

You turned to dad, uncertain who nodded. "Dr Khan has never steered us wrong before, honey." he said.

15532122122111.content:
After the visit to Dr. Khan, we decided to wake Damien and explained everything to him. A few weeks after we returned home, Dad and Amadeus started to help the both of us get better control of these powers. Everyday, they took measurements on how much we either grew or in my brother's case, how much he shrank. But we were still nowhere near normal size. I had to sleep in my old dollhouse till I was back to normal and my brother had to sleep in our houses gigantic basement, using several curtains as a makeshift blanket. But one night, I heard my dad and Amadeus talking out in the halls.

"Dad, are you sure about this? I mean, its been years."

"Amadeus, you and I both know that sooner or later, the Agency is going to find out, being one of their former benefactors."

"But would they really take them?"

"Yes they would, and I won't let that happen. Amadeus, I need you to do something important for me if they ever do come."

"What is it, dad?"

"If they ever arrive, I want you to grab your brother and sister and get away from here as fast as possible. I have some former friends who could help you."

15532122122111.title: Learning control.

155321221221111.content:
Later that night, almost as dad had predicted, a heavy knock came to the door and dad answered to find two blurry men in black business suits. "What do you want here?" coldly, he asked. "I told you I was done with your agency, I want noting to do with it!"

"You don't understand, Mr Johnson." with equal coldness, the first man said. "We have been interested in your children for some time."

"What!?" horrified, dad asked. "You want my kids!?" he then grew angry. "Over my dead body!"

"That would be unfortunate, Mr Johnson." said the second man. "However, it is your choice."

Having heard the commotion in the living room, I peered down the stairs to see dad facing against two large men in dark clothing. Behind me was Damien and Amadeus. "Daddy..." worried, I called. "Is something wrong? Who are those people at the door?"

Dad turned to me, only briefly, and yelled, "Kids, run!"

I gasped, feeling Amadeus' hand grip my shoulder. "We need to go, now!" urgently, he said.

I hesitated but gasped upon seeing dad suddenly become twelve dads before my eyes and charge the two men, shoving them out the door! I wanted to stay and watch but Amadeus pulled me back and thrust me up the stairs. "Dad told us to run!" in an authoritative tone, he yelled. "We have to move!"

Sensing his true urgency, I reluctantly ran up the stairs to the second floor where Amadeus led us to an emergency escape door that we used to get out fast in case the house was on fire. The door led to a small closet that had what looked like a fireman's pole which we used to slide down to another closet which lewd to the back yard where the RV was parked. "What about dad!?" opening RV's side door, Damien asked.

"He told me to take you three to safety and watch over you until he can catch up to us." urging me into the RV, Amadeus replied. "I'm not going to argue with his orders so please don't argue with mine!"

With that, he jumped into the driver's seat and started the engine. I let out a scream as something broke the back window and found myself tempted to become a giantess. only Amadeus floored the accelerator, throwing me off balance as the RV sped away from the mansion summer home at top speeds. "We could have stayed and fought them off." tearing up, I protested. "Damien and I can become giants."

"Right now, your powers are useless as you can not easily control them." scolding, Amadeus said. "If you and Damien were in better practice, I might have agreed with you but..."

His words were interrupted by a loud explosion that shook the road. Amadeus struggled slightly with the wheel before looking in the rear view as you and Damien looked out the back window. A large ball of flame was rising where the mansion summer home once stood. My eyes filled with horror as tears flowed like rivers down my cheeks. "Daddy....!" crying, I whispered.

"No!" crying as well, Damien yelled. "We have to go back!"

"Dad told me not to look back!" tears falling, Amadeus snapped. "He told me that this Agency was as evil as they come, we need to find a place to lay low!"

"A Johnson does not run from his problems!" stating the family motto, I snapped back. "We have to do something, not just run from those who killed our dad!"

"We don't know if he is dead or not." regaining his composure, Amadeus said. "All we know is that those two are willing to blow up a house to capture or kill us. We need to come up with a plan."

With that said, Amadeus turned silent and I sat down in the passenger seat, watching him. "Do you think we'll be alright?" after a pause, I asked.

Amadeus sighed. "I don't know." honestly, he replied. "We'll think of something, okay?"

I slowly nodded. "O- Okay."

1553212212211111.content:
"Where are we going then?" I asked, trying to stay calm after my ordeal. I had most probably just seen my own father killed. No! I thought to myself, if I believed he was dead, I would give up hope that he was still alive. But what then? If he was still alive, he must be captured by the Agency, and they would torture him to find out where we had gone. I wasn't sure which was worse, believing my father was dead, or believing he was being tortured.
"Waterfront City," replied Amadeus "Remember our cousin, Caitlin Spencer?"
I nodded. How could I forget? A few years ago at a family gathering, we had gotten into a fight. I'm glad to say that I kicked her ass, the bitch insulted Damien. He would never hit a girl, he's too nice for that, but it didn't stop me.
"We're not going to that bitch for help are we?" whined Damien "I'd rather we'd been captured."
"Don't say that, Damien," said Amadeus, stopping the car "You don't know what the Agency would have done to you if they had captured you."
"You're right," said Damien "Still, I think I've made my point, I don't like her."
"Neither do I, Damien," admitted Amadeus "But she's our only choice, Aunt Liv disappeared years ago, so unless you'd rather chase leads for a few years, we'll have to stick with Caitlin."
1553212212211111.title: continue.

15532122122111111.content:
The RV soon parked in front of the home of that stuck up cousin of mine. I was tempted to become a giantess and stomp it to pieces, but this was really the only place we could go. Me and Damien stayed close to Amadeus as he knocked on the door. Soon, my enemy, Caitlin Spencer opened it. Though there was something a bit off about her.

"Hello, Caitlin. Its been awhile." he said in his usual calm voice.

"Amadeus. You and the twins are the last people I would have expected here. Where's your dad?"

"That is actually why we are here. May we come in?"

"By all means."

As soon as we came in, Amadeus explained everything that had happed in the past weeks. Caitlin did not react beyond asking an occasional question.

"So that's the story. We were hoping we could stay here for awhile."

"I would love to, Amadeus. But if the Agency could track you back here. But I do know where you could go."

"You do?"

"You remember the Problem Child Gang your dad would always tell us about?"

"Of course. Why?"

"Its starting back up again. Apparently, several of the kids from school have powers like me and you guys."

"Wait! You have powers?" I said in surprise.

"Yes. I can read minds. So I hope your not still planning to stomp my house down."

I just gave a slight nervous giggle as Damien did the same. Apparently, he had the same idea.

"That would be an ideal place for us. They might even be able to help my siblings gain control of there size changing powers. However, I would need to know where there base was."

"I can take you there."

"Fair enough. Come on! We're going back into the RV."

"Are we really taking her with us?" Damien complained.

"No complaining, Damien. We need her."

We then went back into the RV and drove off. What awaited us next was a surprise to all of us.

Who goes first?

15532122122111111111.content:
Amadeus turned to Cait. "I saw that this place has some automated defense systems, can you activate them?"

"I'm not sure about activating the automatic defenses." worried, Cait said. "True, they are twenty years old and designed not to kill but they are still really intense."

"It's a waste of time to try to explain everything to you as you obviously already read my mind." calmly, Amadeus said. "Still, I am asking you to trust me."

Cait sighed. "Sorry, I normally make it a rule not to read anyone's mind without their permission." looking at him, she said. "Are you sure you can handle this?" Amadeus nodded and Cait turned to Damien and I. "You two come with me, we can watch your brother from behind the security glass."

Wondering what my brother had in mind, I followed Cait to a room where she closed a heavy steel door before turning to a control panel that had a microphone. "What is he going to do?" worried, I asked.

"Wave around his man card." frowning, Cait replied. she then hit an intercom button. "Get ready, I'm activating the defense systems. To shut them down, you will have to get to the control room on the other side of the station."

With that, she hit a small series of numbers and a number of trash receptacles rose at the lids, revealing automatic weapons that began to fire darts at Amadeus! I screamed, seeing this, but paused as I saw Amadeus almost effortlessly dodging the line of fire, running right at them! I found myself holding my breath as my brother passed every weapon before reaching the second control room where he soon shut down the defense systems. "I-Incredible...." was all I could manage to say and that was almost in a whisper.

"He got hit eight times." frowning, Cait said. "Had those been bullets, he would have been severely injured."

"Still, that's damn impressive." stunned, Damien said. "I didn't know Amadeus had that in him."

"That is my power, Cait." walking into the room, Amadeus said. "I can do anything I try as if I have done it all my life. I'm far from invincible but I'm really hard to take down."

Cait sighed. "You are reckless." scolding, she said. "The people we are up against are monsters, they will not hesitate to use any weakness you have against you."

"I'm glad to see you still care." with a slight smile, Amadeus said.

Cait returned the smile before....
15532122122111111111.title: continue

155321221221111111111.content:
Cait's phone then began to ring.

"Sorry, I have to take this." she said as she answered the phone.

"Please take your time." Amadeus said in his usual calm manor.

"Yes? Really? Are you sure about this? All right. I'll tell them." Cait said as she hung up her phone.

"Who was that?" I asked out of curiosity.

"That was the original PCG. They saw what all three of you could do through the secret surveillance and they want you all to join the gang."

"Interesting. But I would like to ask my siblings first before making a decision. What do you two think?" Amadeus asked the both of us.

"Yes!" We both said in unison.

"Then I guess its official. We will join your little group for a while."

"That's great to hear. Now they want each of you guys to do something. Annette. They want you and Damien to head to the living area to get better acquainted with the others. Amadeus, they original group wants to meet you in person."

"Understood." Amadeus said as he began to head for the doors.

"Are you sure you don't need my help finding it?"

"It shouldn't be that hard. I'll catch up with all of you later."

He then walked out the door as Cait took me and Damien to meet the rest of the team.
155321221221111111111.title: her phone rings.

1553212212211111111111.content:
Unknown to us, in a dark meeting room, Amadeus entered to find all the original members of the famous Problem Child Gang sitting at a round table with only a candle in front of each of the members to light their faces in the darkness. It was enough to cause him to gulp.

"Welcome, Amadeus." in a serious tone, Geo said. "Forgive the theatrics bu we can not allow Cait Spencer or Rhea Rodgers to learn what we are planning."

"What exactly are you planning?" after closing the door, Amadeus asked.

"We had just recently discovered that Sykes had us all duped from the very beginning." frowning, Ted Jones replied. "He was not after rare artifacts or priceless art, or even rich kids for ransom. He was after the secrets that were hidden within them."

"Blue prints to insanely advanced technology, computer chips with volumes of data." serious, Steve Connors said. "All of it came from one source, a crashed space ship, buried under our feet."

Amadeus blinked, stunned by this news. "So Sykes had vanished for twenty years to study and make use of that new tech he had acquired." turning pale, he said. "What do you plan to do?"

"We have a plan but its not for you to hear." softly, Sarah Vance replied. "Your body and mind make you a 'perfect soldier' but you are no match for a telepath. Its best you don't know."

"What is it you want me to do?" concerned, Amadeus asked.

"My son, Garth, has accepted the role of leader of the new Problem Child Gang." looking at Amadeus, Ted said. "If he falls, we want you to take command."
1553212212211111111111.title: continue

choices: The twins meet some of the members of the gang
15532122122111111111111.content:
"You would seriously trust me to take over if Garth falls to the enemy? Are you sure that I am worthy? Not that I am questioning your decision of course." he said in a surprised tone.

"It is no mistake. We all know what you can do. You are smart, cunning and strong. You are also willing to risk your life to protect the ones closest to you. Those qualities are what make you a perfect leader. Do you accept this position?" Sarah asked the young man.

Amadeus then looked down for a minute thinking over everything that had been said. He then gripped his fists and rose his head.

"Then I accept this position. I will take over when Garth falls. I will do my best to protect my fellow members, including my sister and brother."

"We were hoping you would say that, Amadeus. And if your father was here, he would be very proud of you." Ted said walking up to him.

"You knew my father?"

"He was an old friend to the gang, after leaving the Agency. Now, let's get you over to the weapons lab. You'll need to be properly equipped for future missions and battles."

Ted then lead Amadeus out of the room so he could be properly weaponized.
15532122122111111111111.title: Amadeus' reaction.

155321221221111111111111.content:
Damien and I entered a large room that looked much like a lounge to find a number of teenagers talking amongst themselves. From the tone of their voices, they all seemed worried. "He gave Sykes everything." trembling slightly, one girl said. "Everything he needed to destroy our parents."

"He didn't realize Sykes was still alive." wincing, a tall and muscular boy replied. "If it were not for those graphic novels, we might have never have known about our parents' secret past."

"All is not lost, he did not state our parents' real names in the novels." calmly, a shorter boy said. "Sykes does not know who they are."

"You hope." shuddering, a small girl said.

Seeing an opportunity, I politely cleared my throat and the teenagers tuned to us. "Ah, Annette, Damien." motioning us closer, Cait said. "Meet the rest of the gang."

"These are two of the three you told us about?" calmly, the muscular boy asked.

"Garth, these are my cousins, Annette and Damien." introducing us, Cait said. "They both have the ability to grow and shrink but the trigger is a bit unusual."

"So I heard." nodding at us, Garth said. "I have super strength and endurance." he motioned to the others... "My sister, Grace, total recall; Alyssa Vance, super speed; Bethany Vance, psychic spiritual guide."

"I can sort of talk to ghosts." shrugging, Beth said. "Its complicated." she then giggled seeing a toddler boy walking passed above them. "Come down, you rascal!" the boy giggled as Beth pulled him down by his feet. "This is my brother, Sam. He has the power to fly but being only two..."

"I can imagine." stunned, I said.

Gar nodded then continued. "Clem Rodgers, shape shifting; Susan Tanner, ghost powers and ninja training; Lilith Nightshade, magical powers and mystic wisdom." motioning to the others, he said. "We have two other members but they have gone missing.

"Travis Greenway, who is an Animancer and Megan Connors who is a Technomancer." turning to me, Cait said. "They went missing after the first day of school."

"Animancer... Technomancer?" confused, Damien asked.

"An Animancer is a person who can shift shape into any form of animal, including Anthros like Minotaurs or Centaurs." serious, Cait replied. "A Technomancer has the psychic power over machines."

"Can she change into machines?" curious, Damien asked.

"Not without seriously injuring herself." wincing, Beth replied. "Even without that, her power is impressive."

"I don't doubt it." stunned, I said. "We have quite an arsenal of power here."

"Well, after our visit to retired Detective Flynn, we are not so sure even our power will be enough." softly, Garth said. "The Agency has people under their control who have powers like our own, they are a greater threat now than when our parents faced then twenty years ago."

"What of Sykes?" curious, I asked. "Was he not the greatest adversary of the Problem Child Gang?"

Before anyone could answer, an explosion from above was heard. It was strong enough to rattle the walls of their underground headquarters. "What was that?" startled, Beth asked.

Then Amadeus came running into the room. "The city is under attack!" firmly, he announced. "A small army of goons on floating platforms!"

Gar ran from the group to a control unit on one side of the room where he hit a few buttons, activating a big screen monitor on the wall above it. It showed an image of Sykes and a number of his followers on five strange floating platforms, firing what looked like sci-fi laser rifles at random buildings. Gar focused the camera image on a man on the lead platform before a low growl echoed from his throat. The man was tall with longish brown hair and piercing green eyes. He was wearing oddly ancient leather armor as he held a laser rifle of his own while holding the hilt of a sword at his side.

"It's Sykes!" anger in his voice, Garth said. "He's back!"

"We have to stop him before he leave this city in shambles." serious, Amadeus said.

Gar nodded. "Agreed." turning to him, he said. "Everyone to the Beast!"

I gasped, remembering reading about a near invulnerable armored van the original group used as their transport into and out of their missions. "Does anyone have a plan?" following the group, I asked.

"Yeah." grabbing a long metal bar from a display case, Garth replied. "We go, we see, we kick his ass!"
