I winced. "Not much of a plan." worried, I thought.

Amadeus seemed to sense my uncertainty. "We go to the surface, assess the situation, and deal with it as needed to resolve the crisis." quietly, he said. "Gar just has a less definitive way of putting it."

We left Beth and Clem behind to watch over Sam and Rhea then raced onto the surface through the secret entrance to face Sykes and his men....
155321221221111111111111.title: Sykes returns!

choices: Chief Jones has us settle in first.
Chief Jones leads us to a briefing room with all of the PCG
155321221221111111112.content:
A tall and powerfully built with short sand blond hair and blue eyes ran into the room.
"Why were the defenses activated?" asked the man "Are we under attack?"
He eyed the three of us suspiciously.
"They are no threat, Chief Jones," said Cait "These are my cousins: Amadeus, Damien and Annette, the Agency attacked their house and I thought it best to bring them here for protection."
"You did the right thing Cait," said Chief Jones "But next time you activate our defenses, give us some warning."
"I will," said Cait, turning pink.
"I saw your powers," said Chief Jones "We'll need powers like these when we go up against Sykes and the Agency, if you can help us, we'll help you to find your dad."
"You believe he is still alive," I asked, hopeful
"The Agency wants all four of you under its power," said Chief Jones "They won't kill him if they think they can force you to join them through him."
"What do you need us to do?" asked Amadeus.
"Follow me," said Chief Jones "You four can join up with my own kids that are down here, Sykes will attack in the next few days, so we need you to train together so you can fight more effectively."
155321221221111111112.title: someone runs in.

choices: A toddler, walking on the ceiling.
1553212212211111111121.content:
"I need you all to first settle in before we do anything." serious, Ted said. "Go pick out a room that has not been taken and unpack what belonging you have."

"We- We don't have any belongings." tearing up, I said. "We fled from our home and drove straight to cousin Caitlin's house. All we really have are the clothes on our backs."

"I'm sorry." sighing, Ted said. "We'll get your measurements and buy you some clothes and essentials as soon as we can." he then turned to Cait. "I have some funds set aside for..."

"Please, Mr. Jones." smiling, Cait interrupted. "I think I can spare the change."

Ted smiled then turned back to Amadeus, Damien, and I. "Once you are all settled in, we will get you three up to date." calmly, he said. "Also, don't worry; we'll find your father, I promise."

Feeling heavy hearted, I followed my brothers deeper into the station where we soon found a set of offices that had been converted into simple but functional dorm rooms. "Well, I guess this is home for a while." trying to be brave, I whispered. "I'll find a small room for myself."

"This is only temporary, sis." looking into my eyes, Amadeus said. "We are going to be just fine."

I nodded but could not help cry. "You're right, bro." tears falling. "It still hurts, though."

Amadeus pulled me into a hug and I began to freely cry as Damien joined in on the hug. For the longest time, we just stood there, comforting one another until someone approached us. It was..."
1553212212211111111121.title: Chief Jones has us settle in first.

choices: Remain calm, figure out how to come down
15533.content:
My name is Lilith Nightshade. I picked it out myself. It suited me more than Olivia Wallace. Or, to use my stepfather's name, Olivia Hastings.

I've been goth for a couple of years now, and most of the kids have started to at least tolerate me. I sometimes get flak from Cait Spencer and her clique, but that's trickled off since I let it be known I don't give a rip about their opinions. A few teachers still give me the hairy eyeball, though, to the point that Mom actually had to take me to a psychiatrist. The upshot is that I've got documentation saying I'm not crazy or suicidal. It's just that, instead of rainbows, unicorns, and dotting my i's with little hearts, I like black, rats and spiders, and the occasional picnic in a cemetery.

I suppose I can understand why they think I'm messed up. My birth father was a real piece of work. He's ex-military, but his favorite battlefield was our home. Mom finally had enough when I landed in the hospital with a concussion, and got him locked up for a while. He still gets monthly supervised visits, though, and it's after these visits that I usually start talking tattoos with Mom and my stepfather. So far, they've held firm that I can't get one until I'm of legal age.

Don't ask me what my birth father does for a living since he left jail, because he won't tell us. Seriously, he changes the subject every time we ask. All we know so far is, every now and then, he'll mention somebody named Hagen, but he goes right back into super-secret mode as soon as we ask.

So that's most of my life. Sounds pretty normal, for the most part, and I'd agree with you, if it weren't for the day when things got weird, even by goth standards.



It was my first day of high school. I was having this dream, where I'm taking a shower, and Sue Tanner comes in and we start kissing. I've had it before, but this time, I noticed I felt something different behind me.

As I started to wake up, I still felt this difference, and I began to realize that I wasn't sleeping on my mattress. Had I rolled off during the night? I rubbed the sleep out of my eyes, and I saw what had happened.

I had gone to sleep in my bed, but I woke up lying on the ceiling.
15533.title: Lilith Nightshade

155332.content:
"Mom!" Maybe it's not very goth to ask your parents for help, but I couldn't think of any other way to get back down off the ceiling.

A few minutes later, Mom knocked on my door and opened it, sticking her head inside. "Did you call me, hon - Where are you?"

"Up here."

Mom looked up and turned pale. "Wha... How did you get up there?"

"I don't know. I just woke up, and here I was. Can you help get me down?"

"I... I suppose I can try," she said, making her way to the side of my bed. "Can you give me your hand?"

I gave it a try, and surprised myself by succeeding.

Mom grasped my hand and gave it a tug. That must have been all that was needed to break whatever held me up there, because I fell right on top of her. It knocked the wind out of both of us.

Once we could breathe again, Mom said, "You'd better get ready for school, Lilith."

"You think I should still go, after... after whatever this was?"

"If I kept you home, I'd have to explain why. And I'd rather not tell your new principal that you and gravity suddenly need to work things out."

I couldn't argue with that. "Let me fix myself up, and I'll grab some cereal downstairs."

Since I'd have to wash after P.E., there was no sense putting on my powder, so I kept my makeup simple: black mascara, purple eyeliner, black lipstick, and black nail polish. Then I checked my hair for roots showing through: nothing major, so I could let it slide until later. I got my products from a goth supplier online. It cost more than store-bought, but that stuff never had the right shade, especially the hair dye. Of course, after one store-bought product started making people's hair fall out, my stuff looked a lot more reasonable.

I brushed my hair. My hair was straight and shoulder-length, with bangs cut in a wide V. Once I was presentable, I went downstairs for breakfast.
155332.title: Panic and call for help

1553321.content:
Now, you'd think that waking up on the ceiling would be hands-down winner for Weirdest Thing to Happen Today. However, once I got to school, I found that it would have a lot of competition.

For a start, one of the first people I saw in the schoolyard was Alyssa Vance. Now, I've known Lyssa for a couple of years. We're not great friends or anything, but I know a few things about her. The thing is, up until a couple years ago, she was a boy. Then, at the start of junior high, she showed up in a skirt and longer hair. She told me once that she was taking different pills to suppress male hormones and stimulate female, but she still looked like a long-haired boy with tiny boobs.

Today, though, she looked like a regular girl. Her facial structure was different, she needed at least a B cup, and she had curves. I was starting to get turned on. How did she get that way? I didn't think any doctors would do that kind of work on a teenager.

She met up with Garth Jones, and then the next weird thing happened: Cait Spencer showed up. Normally, Caitlin Spencer was in the running for Snob of the Year. Today, though, she walked up to Garth and Lyssa and started talking with them. When did they get so chummy?

I couldn't ponder that mystery too long, though, because Trish Wilson (one of Cait's nicer friends) screamed. When I turned to look, I saw two wolves charging at the kids. Garth and Lyssa started herding everybody inside, then Garth stayed outside to deal with the wolves. Don't ask me what he planned to do against wild animals. I had thought Lyssa was inside, too, but she wasn't where I thought I'd seen her, so I figured I'd imagined it.

Eventually, Garth and Lyssa came back inside. Then he surprised her (and everybody else, me included) by kissing her full on the mouth. Once she recovered from that surprise, he kissed her again. A lot of kids cheered. Me, I couldn't help wondering how weird the day was going to get.
1553321.title: At school

15533211.content:
The weirdness continued for me as I saw that all of the 'problem' students were placed into one homeroom. Worse, I could sense a strange vibe from all of them. I could always tell if someone was more than they seemed and it felt as if this class was full of students like that, including the teacher, it was real creepy.

"Welcome back to East Shore High School, class." smiling, the teacher said. "For those who have not yet met me, I am your homeroom teacher, Sarah Barns."

"There's a dark past behind that teacher." suppressing a shiver, I thought. "I could probably guess what it is, if I had my Tarot Cards."

I was a firm believer in the powers of the Mystics and I often turned to the Tarot Cards when I felt lost or frightened. I had tried to use them to guess what my birth father did for a living after he got out of prison but I always encountered the death card, a warning not to follow that path. Turning to Lyssa, a thin smile formed onto my face. "I don't know how or when but she is definitely all girl now." bemused, I thought. "No one can fake that true feminine scent."

My senses had always been sharp. I think it was my father's beatings that brought them on, a developed early warning system to help me prepare. However I got them, it forced me to wear heavy perfumes to keep other people's scents, good or bad, from attacking my nostrils and special ear plugs to keep me from hearing every whispered conversation. Also, I had to get special contact lenses to protect my eyes as they became sensitive to bright lights. My sense of smell and taste were strong as well. It drove me crazy, at first but I learned to live with them. Only today, I did not have the time for the usual morning routine and I was keen to everything and everyone around me.

"Everyone in this class has changed somehow, including myself." looking about, I thought. "There has to be a connection but what?"

I decided it best to try to ignore everything for now and consult the cards after school. I managed to get through my first class, American History, and was about to go to my next class when someone tapped me on the shoulder. I sighed then turned around to find Caitlin Spencer. "What do you want?" trying to be patient, I asked.

"You've go 3rd period PE with Alyssa Vance, right?" looking at me Caitlin asked.

"So?" wondering where this was going, I asked.

"Keep an eye on her," her eyes almost pleading, Caitlin said, "I heard someone planning something about her and I don't want her hurt."

I snorted. "Since when did you care?" coldly, I asked.

Caitlin sighed, giving me a 'I deserved that look'. This surprised me as I had always known Caitlin to be filled with vanity and pride, she was not herself. "I've changed a lot over the summer." looking at me, she said. "Besides, I found out she's my cousin."

I shrugged, inwardly impressed with Cait's improved attitude. "I'll see what I can do."

"Thanks, Lilith." with a look of relief, Cait said. "I knew I could count on you."

As she walked away I was more certain than ever that more strange events were ahead. "Brace yourself, girl." steeling myself, I muttered. "I have a feeling this is going to be a crazy day."
15533211.title: First class

155332111.content:
When we got to PE, we were given our choice of lockers to put away our things. I took one closest to the bend, where Lyssa changed into her things. She's had her first period, I thought. I could tell by her scent.

I could also hear Amber and Cassie giggling over something. When I looked, I saw Cassie passing a note to Amber. That must be the plot, I thought. Wish I could read it from here. Funny, Cait and them used to be tight.

We got to start PE with my least favorite activity, dodge-ball. Boys played on one side of the gym, and girls played on the other. As if I didn't dislike it enough, Coach put me and Lyssa on different teams, so I was on the other side of the net.

We hadn't been playing long when Amber shouted out, "Hey, Garth, check out your girlfriend!"

The whole class looked as, to my horror, Amber and Cassie pulled Lyssa's shorts and panties down, exposing her to everyone. Thanks to them, what happened to Lyssa was apparent to everybody, as there's just no way to fake lady-business.

Coach acted immediately, benching Amber and Cassie, then helping Lyssa with her clothes and walking her to the locker room. Dodge-ball was forgotten by everyone. We all watched as Coach took Lyssa, tears streaming from her eyes, out of the gym, probably to the principal's office.

When Coach returned without Lyssa, she said, "Everybody, hit the showers." Then she turned to Amber and Cassie and said, "You two are going straight to Principal Hendrick's office when you're through."

As we washed off what little sweat we had, I caught Amber's scent. It had changed somehow. I couldn't put my finger on what was different. It must have happened after she attacked Lyssa. What's going on with this school?
155332111.title: skip to P.E.

1553321111.content:
By the end of school, word got around that Lyssa had been attacked, and that she was now a real girl. I was glad to hear that Cassie and Amber had been punished for their actions. Especially Amber - she'd been a real problem for me ever since I came out as a lesbian. The news that she'd slurred me in the principal's office didn't shock me at all.

I saw Lyssa's sister, Beth, and passed along the homework for the other classes I shared with Lyssa.

Once I got home, I changed out of the school uniform and into my standard black outfit. With that done, I told my mom, "I'll be out for a while. A friend from school had a real bad day and got sent home, so I want to see how she's doing."

"Don't be out too late, honey," Mom replied. "We're having lasagna tonight."

I walked the blocks to Lyssa's house and knocked on her door. When her father answered, I was greeted by the telltale smell of a dirty diaper. "Yes?" he said.

"I'm Lilith," I replied, "a friend of your daughter's. I came to see how she's doing."

He smiled. "I'm glad you care so much about her. Come on in. She's got another friend visiting, too. She's helping me with Sam, but she'll be right back."

I went inside, and Garth was there on the couch. He and Beth were talking. "I didn't expect you to drop by," Beth said. "What brings you here?"

"I wanted to see how Lyssa's doing," I replied. "And I hoped I'd get some answers."

"Answers?" Lyssa said, as she joined us. "About what?"

"For a start, how did you change? I've never seen anything like it."

"It's a family trait," she replied. "The same thing happened to an ancestor of mine."

"Okay," I said, "but what about the rest of you? It seems like a lot of the kids at school, and at least one of the teachers, are more than they appear to be."

"And how do you know that?" Mr. Vance asked.

"Because there's more to me than meets the eye, too," I replied. "I know there's something different about you because I can smell it. I got a concussion from my father beating me when I was a kid, and my senses have been cranked to 11 ever since."

Garth looked like he wanted to say something, but Lyssa clapped her hand over his mouth. "And you expect us to take your word for this?" Mr. Vance continued.

"There is more," I admitted. "I know it sounds crazy, but I woke up this morning lying on the ceiling over my bed."

"That would explain it," Mr. Vance said.

"Explain what?"

Lyssa took her hand away from Garth's mouth and nodded. "Lilith," he said, "you're an inch off the floor."
1553321111.title: A visit to learn answers

15533211111.content:
I looked down and inwardly panicked. "So, I am." my voice quivering, I said. "Do you guys have any idea why?"

Beth stood up, giving me a sympathetic look before touching my shoulder. "We'll help you find some answers, Lilith." gently, she said. "We were all scared, at first."

"I was changing back and forth from boy to girl for days before my gender stabilized." honestly, Lyssa said.

I turned to her and winced. "She's honest but still holding something back." I thought. "I don't know why but I know its something major.

Garth grew into seven foot muscle bound giant before my eyes, making me fearful for a moment. "I was in the hospital, paralyzed with pain for days before my condition stabilized." in a deep voice, he said. he then shrank back down, adding, "Mine is due to something passed on by my mother so you could call it genetic as well."

"Again, he's holding something back." worried, I thought. then I said, "Please, if you know something..."

"Are you familiar with the graphic novel series, 'The Problem Child Gang'?" serious, Mr Vance asked.

"Yes, it's my favorite book series." confused, i asked. "What does that have to do with..."

"That series was based on a true story." interrupting me, Mr Vance said. "My wife was a member of that gang; as was Garth's father and mother."

"They made real enemies, Lilith." chiming in, Garth added. "Now, they are after us."

"Th-That was all real!?" stunned, I asked.

"Yes." serious, Mr Vance replied. "If your parents were involved with this gang or its enemies, it is likely you will be a target as well so we need to get some answers and fast."

"I- I see...." shaking, I said. "I'd better talk to my mother right away."

Just then, Sam waddled in and spotted me, hovering an inch above the floor. "Hewwo." smiling, he said. "Who you?"

"Sam, this is Lilith, a friend from school." patiently, Lyssa said. "She came to see how I was doing after school."

"Wiwith?" turning back to me, Sam asked. "You can fwy?"

I blushed at that. "I dunno, kid." still shaken, I replied. "I really haven't tried."

Then, to everyone's surprise, Sam rose above the floor, hovering at eye level to me before he giggled. "It easy, Wiwith." smiling, he said. "Twy it."

"Great." frowning, Mr Vance muttered. "I have a toddler who can fly."

Sam then touched my nose. "Tag!" giggling, he said. "You it!"

I smiled slightly, seeing him waddle away, giggling. Only he was doing it in the air instead of on the floor. "Come here, you rascal." teasing, I said. "I'm gonna get you..."

I began to playfully give chase and I was surprised that I was walking on the air, just as Sam was. I tried to move faster to catch him but yelled in surprise as I suddenly took off into flight and hit the ceiling with a heavy thud. "Ow!" I fell to the floor with a thud, more embarrassed than hurt. Sam came down to the floor, looking worried. "You okay, Wiwith?" pouting, he asked. "I sowwy."

"Yeah, I think so." trying to ignore the throbbing in my buttocks, I replied.

"I think we better give your mother a call." frowning, Mr Vance said. he then turned to Sam. "No flying for now, okay?"

Sam pouted, tears flowing. "What I do?" hurt, he asked.

Lyssa sighed and took Sam into her arms as he began to cry. "He doesn't understand, dad." comforting her little brother, she said.

"We'll deal with that later." firmly, Mr Vance said. "Right now we need to see to our guest."

I began to worry as he then handed me a phone. "Call your mother... now."
15533211111.title: Continue

155332111111.content:
I called home. "Hello."

"Mom, it's Lilith."

"Hi, honey. How are things going with your friend?"

"She's doing okay, but something major has come up." I took a deep breath. "Mom, I can fly."

She was silent for a while, so long that I began to wonder if we'd been disconnected. Finally, she spoke again. "Y-you can fly?"

"Yes, I can. And there's a whole lot more. Could you come down here? And bring my Tarot?" I gave her the address.

"I'll be right there, honey."

As I hung up, Garth asked, "What's the Tarot for?"

"It'll give us a hint about what the future holds. The key is understanding what the cards really mean. I use the Legacy deck, since I feel the pictures help me interpret the messages."

"You really believe that stuff?"

"It works, Garth. Trust me on that."

Beth asked, "You're not going to start telling us about long sea voyages and meeting tall, dark strangers, are you?"

"You've been seeing too many movies, Beth. You'll do as much work interpreting the messages as I will."
155332111111.title: Calling mom.

choices: mom has me read my cards.
1553321111111.content:
Minutes later, a soft but firm knock was heard at the door and Mrs Vance answered. As the door opened, I got a strong scent of mom's expensive perfume. I turned to see that it was indeed my mom at the door. "Odd, she only wears 'Rare Diamonds' on very special occasions." my eyes then went wide as I saw mom knell down to hug Mrs Vance as if she were an old friend. "She acts as if she's known Mrs Vance all her life... what is going on!?!"

"It's been too long, Madam Vague." releasing mom, Mrs Vance said. "I'm honored that you bring light to my home."

"The honor is mine, dear child." rising to her feet, mom said. "When Lilith told me the address, I knew it was your family and the family of your friends she was concerned for." she then teared up slightly. "I am truly sorry I was too late to save you from the wrath of Clarence Mayweather..."

"You saved me from bleeding to death on the side of the road, Madam Vague." tearing up with her, Mrs Vance said. "I owe you my life, still today."

"Mom?" my voice shaking, I asked. "You know Mrs Vance?"

"Why yes; I do." turning to me, mom said. "She had called herself Heather 'Hawkeye' as a member of the Problem Child Gang, twenty years ago."

"But... you- you were just a- a kid then too." stammering, I said. "Please mom, what is going on?"

Mom smiled and casually walked over to me. "The cards will explain everything, Lilith." showing me a Tarot card deck, she said. "Place your trust in the wisdom of the Mystics."

"Mom, those aren't my cards." confused and frightened, I said.

"No, my dear." still smiling, she replied. "Your cards are in your hands." shocked, I looked and saw that I was holding my Legacy deck then turned back to mom as she said, "These are mine."

With that, she threw the cards into the air and they flew about with a fluttering sound as they shuffled themselves before lining up in the air as if they were being stacked onto a table. Once done, they were all shown face down, no matter which side you looked at, ready to be read and shown to all. Everyone's jaws dropped in shock, including my own as my Tarot cards fell from my hands. Mrs Vance alone was smiling as my Tarot cards, like mom's shuffled themselves in the air then lined themselves up before me. "Not the most graceful cast, my dear." amused, mom said. "Still, you are just beginning to learn."
1553321111111.title: Enter Madam Vague.

15533211111112.content:
"Draw a card, Lilith Nightshade," Mom said.

I drew the topmost card on my deck, which proved to be the Tower. "A major event," I explained to the others. "It will shatter what has come before, to make room for something new."

Mom nodded. "You are wondering about your new powers, and how I shuffled my deck in the air. You have known for some time that you are not like the others. It is time that you learned your destiny."

Mom leaned in close. "Lilith Nightshade, you are a witch, like your mother before you."

I felt like my tower had been knocked out from under my feet. "A-a witch?"

Mom nodded again. "Our powers are not quite so grand as popular fiction would suggest. However, if enough of us were to gather, we could accomplish great things."

She turned her attention to Lyssa. "For instance, twelve witches once encountered a young man who, more than anything, wanted to be female. Can you guess what happened?"

Lyssa swallowed hard. "Th-they turned Iolaus into Iole?"

"Precisely." Mom turned back to me. "This morning, after you left for school, I dug out my Tarot, and drew the Judgement card. Do you know what that signifies?"

I nodded. "There was a call that you should heed."

"Yes. Always trust in the cards, daughter. I disregarded their warnings once, when I was attracted to my first husband. As a penalty, I was denied my powers, until today. That is why I could not protect us from his wrath."

I asked, "Why does Mrs. Vance keep calling you Madame Vague?"

Mom smiled. "Her expectations were formed by old movies, where the fortune teller could lay out exactly what was to come. When I could only say things like 'There is conflict coming,' or 'The current situation will change,' she started calling me Madame Vague, much as you would call someone who told you what you already knew Captain Obvious."

"About the cards," I said. "Dad's always so secretive about his job, so I tried asking the cards what he does. Whenever I do, though, I keep drawing the Death card. What does it mean?"

As I spoke, I drew another card from my deck. Instead of Death, though, I now drew the Moon card. Something was about to change, and it would either be fraught with deception or reveal important truths. Something told me it would be the latter.

Mom sighed. "If he ever learned about this, it would mean the death of us both."

She took a deep breath. "Lilith, you drew the Death card because your father is dead. My first husband is not your father."
15533211111112.title: mom has me read my cards.

155332111111121.content:
"Who- Who was my father?" almost afraid to know, I asked.

"Your father was Dr Thomas Vague." gently, mom replied. "I found it fitting that Sarah called me 'Madam Vague' as, in a way, it honored his memory."

"Why don't you ever talk about him?" curious, I asked. "I have a right to know..."

"It is a long story but I will try to explain." sadly, mom replied. she took a breath and turned a card, revealing the High Priestess. "Twenty years ago, I was an ordinary sixteen year old girl. I was looking forward to graduating high school and moving on to college. Only, two men stormed my house and tried to take me by force. I ran out of the house, not daring to look back but I knew they were on my tail."

"Who were they?" concerned, Garth asked.

"I don't know." shaking her head, mom said. "I managed to lose them just outside of Fallen Heroes Cemetery on the edge of town where I found a number of people in dark robes gathered around a fire among the tombstones."

"Creepy." shivering, Lyssa muttered.

"It turned out to be a coven of witches." said mom, softly. "A young woman among them approached me and smiled...."

"Welcome, Madeline Wallace." the woman said. "I have been expecting you."

Madeline, terrified and out of breath, took a step back. "Yo- You know who I am?"

The woman smiled then threw a number of cards into the air. They shuffled on their own then lined themselves in the air. "The cards never lie." serious, she said. "My time in this world is coming to a close but your time is just beginning."

Madeline took another step back. "What do you want from me?" almost crying, she asked. "Has everyone gone crazy!?"

"You are in no danger, Madeline Wallace." said the other cloaked people. "Come...."

Madeline found herself slowly walking forward, though her mind screamed to run away. Once she was before them, staring into the camp fire, the young woman walked up and placed her hands onto Madeline's shoulders, staring into her eyes as the others formed a circle around them. They all began to chant with Madeline reciting it with them, though she had never heard it before. As they did, a light, glowing mist bellowed from the woman's mouth and entered Madeline's mouth, causing them both to glow with an eerie light. Madeline stared in horror as the woman became older and older before her eyes. Finally, the chanting stopped and the once young woman was not nothing more than dust, blowing in the light wind.

"What... happened?" trembling with terror, Madeline asked.

"Our sister has passed to the next realm." solemnly, one of the cloaked figures replied. "She had no children to pass her power onto so she has chosen and entrusted you to to be that daughter she never had."

"Her knowledge, her wisdom, and her power is now your own." added a second hooded figure. "Use your gifts wisely." she then smiled. "Welcome to the coven sisterhood."

Mom wiped the tears from her eye. "I had lost my mother when I was young and watched a woman who had chosen me as a daughter she never had die before my eyes." emotionally, she said. "I had vowed make her proud."

"Woah..." awestruck, Lyssa whispered.

Mom nodded. "My first husband, Darren, and I fell in love quickly and did not consult the cards before marrying him." looking slightly ashamed, she said. "That brings us to Dr Thomas Vague." she paused to force a smile. "He was our family doctor and always defended me when he could."

"What happened, mom." taking in every word, I asked.

"One night, Darren had beat me senseless and left to get even more drunk. I called Dr Vague and he came over to tend to my wounds." her smile vanishing, mom replied. "As he was treating me, Darren returned, found the two of us together, and went into a rage. He mortally wounded Dr Vague with his hunting knife." she cried freely. "That was when I had enough and used my magick on him. One punch sent him through the closed door, across the hall, and through the wall into the room beyond."

"Mom... one punch!?" my eyes widening to saucers, I asked. "That could have killed him..."

"I learned that magick can not kill." almost regretful, mom said. "Still, to this day, he fears me when I become angry." she sighed. "I then turned my attention onto Dr Vague and consulted the cards to find a way to save him."

"You didn't find a way, though." sadly, I said.

"No, I didn't." shaking her head, mom replied. "But I did find a way to help him carry on."

"You made love to him as he died?" stunned, Lyssa asked.

"I honored his last request as a debt of honor, Lilith." sternly, mom replied. "He wanted... a family. I had intended to 'introduce' you to him once Darren's visitation rights were officially revoked next week, Lilith."

For a moment, I did not respond as I was still soaking everything in. Finally, a small smile slowly formed onto my face. "My dad sounds like an incredible man." dreamily, I whispered.

Mom smiled. "He was." she then turned to Mrs Vance. "The Agency may be after my daughter and I for my involvement with the Problem Child Gang twenty years ago."

"It's possible." admitted Mrs Vance. "You did help us in your own mysterious ways."

"Want to join the new gang?" offering her hand to me, Lyssa asked.

I turned to the cards, causing her to frown slightly, before I turned back to her. "Sure."
155332111111121.title: Continue

1553321111111211.content:
As Mom drove me home, she asked, "What convinced you to join your friends?"

"I drew the Temperance card," I replied. "The right elements were coming together."

When we got home, my stepdad was waiting for us. "I got your note," he said to Mom. "How'd everything go?"

"It was all a surprise," I said. "How much did you know?"

"Most of it. Your mother told me about your real father, of course. Later, I found the cards, and she explained them to me." Turning to Mom, he said, "I figured it was too late for lasagna, so I ordered pizza."

"Good guess, hon," she said as she kissed him.



After I did my homework, I was pretty wiped out, so I went to bed early.

I was awakened by a gentle hand on my shoulder. "Lilith?"

I opened my eyes. Since my eyes were so sensitive, I could see perfectly in the dark. "Mom? What is it?"

She stood up. "This was always my favorite time for flying, since most people are asleep, and the others don't generally scan the skies. Want to go for a spin?"

That did sound good. "Let's."
1553321111111211.title: Returning home.

choices: A light in a friend's house
15533211111112111.content:
"What's the first step to flying?" I asked as I opened my bedroom window.

"Just throw yourself out there," Mom replied. "Your power will hold you up and let you move around."

I gave it a try, and it worked just like Mom said. "Whoa."

Mom came out to join me. "How does it feel?"

"Terrific," I replied. "Poop on you, Amber MacReady and Cassie Hamilton, the goth lesbian can fly!"

As we flew around, Mom asked, "How do you feel about everything you've learned about yourself today?"

"I think I'm doing okay. It makes sense, now that I think about it: The Death card is supposed to mean an ending that makes a beginning possible, and that's what it was telling me. My father's death made my life possible."

Mom held my hand. "You're the only thing I don't regret about my life with Darren. I've loved you since I knew you were inside me."

As we flew, I grooved on seeing the familiar things in my neighborhood from a new perspective. All I needed to do was think about it a little more, and I could recognize my surroundings and find my way around.

As we flew, something caught my eye...
15533211111112111.title: Flying around the neighborhood

155332111111121111.content:
We were flying over Sue Tanner's house and I saw a light shining in the back bay window. Curious, I flew towards it with mom following. We landed in a dark part of Susan's back yard to see Susan and her mom engaged in what looked like a crazy dance only their moves reminded me of some form of martial arts. "What are they doing?" curious, I asked.

"It's called Capoeira." serious, mom whispered. "Its a Brazilian form of martial arts. It may look like a dance but believe me, it is a powerful and effective fighting style. The Amazon women used Capoeira on the ground, in the trees, and in the mountains of the dense jungles."

"Incredible." moving closer, I whispered. "Susan's mom must be teaching it to her."

"Not too close, dear." kindly, mom said. "I had consulted the cards regarding your friendship with Susan before waking you up and drew both the King and Queen of Wands."

"The Tanner family guards a lot of secrets, I know." pausing, I said. "Mr Tanner is the CEO of a huge technology firm."

"There are darker secrets in this world normal people do not see, Lilith." pulling me back, mom said. "Mrs Tanner and I are direct descendants of two of the witches who brought Iole into the world. Susan's father has an ancestry just as mysterious as her mother." she paused. "Just as a deck of cards has four suits, the world has four corners, four elements, four powers."

"Earth, fire, wind, and water." nodding, I whispered.

Mom shook her head. "Those are the four elements." correcting me, she said. "The four powers are strength, magick, agility, and stamina. Each descendant has two of these powers to guide them. You have magic and stamina where Susan has magic and agility." she smiled. "I also drew the Two of Cups card, showing a good chance for a relationship with Susan but the King and Queen of wands over that suggests you get closer to her with caution."

"Welcome, Madam Vague." startling mom and I a voice said. "You usually always get the drop on me."

We turned to find Mrs Tanner standing before us with a towel draped over her shoulders. "It's good to see you are finally learning, Amanda." smiling back, mom said. "My daughter has discovered her path, I'm guiding her."

"Hey, Lilith." startling me, Susan said behind me. "What's up?"

I turned around but saw no one there. "Sue?" looking around, I asked.

Then Sue appeared from nowhere in front of me, smiling. "My parents have the coolest ancestry." she said.

"So do mine." smiling back I said. I rose above the ground, hovering there for a moment, then came back down. "I just became a member of the new Problem Child Gang."

"That is incredible!" hugging me, Susan said. "Welcome to the group!"

"You too!?" surprised, I asked.

Susan gave me a soft but loving kiss on the lips, causing me to blush. "I share your feelings, Lilith Nightsade but we have to keep this a secret." whispering into my ear, she said. "Father would not understand." then she said, "Dad will be honored to hear you have joined our group."

This caused me to smile. "Susan shares my feeling towards her!" almost crying, I thought. "Still, the King and Queen of wands... we must be careful." then I asked, "Who else is in our group."

"Practically all of the 'problem' kids in our homeroom." smiling, Susan replied. she giggled as she added, "That includes our homeroom teacher."
155332111111121111.title: A light in a friend's house

1553321111111211112.content:
"Why don't we continue this inside?" Mrs. Tanner said. "Welcome to our home, Lilith."

"Thank you, Mrs. Tanner," I replied. "I'm a little surprised to see you working up a sweat like that. Most women in your condition prefer to take things easy."

I could tell I surprised both her and Susan. "You know that I'm pregnant?"

I tapped my nose. "I can smell the changes in your hormones."

"Ah. Well, we're trying to keep it a secret for two more months, so please don't spread it beyond these walls."

"No one will hear it from me." Turning to Susan, I asked, "So, what other powers are in our group? I know that Garth can make himself muscular, and you saw some of my magick."

"I can turn invisible and intangible," Susan replied. "Mom says I've probably inherited her Amazon muscles, but I haven't found the trigger yet."

"It'll come, dear," Mrs. Tanner said.

"Lyssa has super-speed," Susan continued. "I heard that Clem inherited some powers from his parents, but it left him as bald as those kids who used Plutonium products. And you know Megan Conners and Travis Greenway? They can change themselves into other things. They were those wolves who prowled around the schoolyard this morning."

"Why would they do that?"

"They spotted some guy on a roof across from the schoolyard, getting ready to shoot some kids. Fortunately, the rest of us knew about it already, so the police were ready to take him down before he could fire a shot."

My eyes got wide at the news of a foiled school shooting. "How did you find out?"

"From Cait. She's got telepathy, and she can see a little bit into the future."

"Probably not as far as your Tarot cards," Mrs. Tanner added, "but she can see with greater clarity."

"We've got quite the group," I said. "How about our homeroom teacher? You said she was a part of this, too?"

"She's got a history with the original PCG," Susan explained. "When she was just a little kid, the Agency kidnapped her and turned her into this pint-sized assassin. But she broke free of them. Since then, she can make herself bigger or smaller."

"Well," Mom said, "it was good seeing you again, Amanda, but I should probably get Lilith back in bed. We wouldn't want her to be bleary-eyed on her second day of school."

We went back outside and, after a goodbye hug from Mrs. Tanner (and a goodbye hug and kiss from Susan), we flew back home.

Something kept me from getting back to sleep, however. I couldn't help thinking about what powerful members we had in our new Problem Child Gang. Nature doesn't like wasting things, and we had enough power to hold off an army. What would we be needed to do?
1553321111111211112.title: The talk continues inside.

15533211111112111121.content:
That morning, I woke up early to ensure I was fully dressed and ready for school. It took me several minutes but I wanted to look my best for Susan when we tell the others we were going on our first official date after school. I had just grabbed my long black cloak, as it was chilly out, and was about to walk out of my room when I heard the sound of the door being broken open, we were being invaded! My first thought was to hide and call 911 but I heard mom scream and I dashed out into the open, grabbing my Tarot deck on the way out. Why I did that, I had no clue.

"Mom!" worried, I called. "Mom, are you okay!?"

"Lilith, run!" hysterical, mom yelled.

Panic struck me as I saw two men dressed in military fatigues and ski masks came into view with what I recognized as tranquilizer guns. "Olivia Wallace, come quietly or we will take you by force." serious, the first man said.

"That is not my name." backing away, I protested.

"It doesn't matter." equally as serious, the second man said. "Consider yourself property of the Agency."

Now I was really panicked. I read about the Agency in the graphic novel, Problem Child Gang. They were a quasi government organization that used children and teens as their soldiers in a push to change the world to their liking. Out of desperation, I drew a card from my Tarot Deck. I expected the two men to smile at such a move only they backed away a few steps as if they had seen it before. I drew the Magician and threw it at the first man, hoping to distract them enough to run for safety. Only, to my surprise, the card glowed for a second before a man in a red robe appeared between me and the men. He waved his hand and two doors on either side of the hall violently opened. One hit the first man in the face while the other hit the second man in the back, rendering them both unconscious.

"Run, child!" commanded the magician.

I did not hesitate; I ran from the two fallen men to find mom. Unknown to me, the magician vanished, the card appearing in a random spot in my deck. Upon finding mom, I saw her standing over two unconscious men with a man in a knight's armor at her side. "Thank you, Knight of swords." grateful, mom said. "Your services are greatly appreciated."

"It was an honor to serve, my lady." bowing, the knight replied.

With that, the knight vanished, the card flying back into a random spot in her deck. Mom then turned to me and sighed. "I told you to run, Lilith." scolding, she said. "Why didn't you listen?"

"I was cut off." tearing up, I replied. "That and I won't leave you to fend for yourself."

mom sighed again then smiled. "Well, I'm glad to see you have discovered the true power of the cards." pointing to my glowing deck, she said. "As long as you have faith in them, they will always protect you."

"What can we do now, mom?" still shaken, I asked. "These guys are only the first of many if they work for the Agency."

"These people were just a scouting party, to force our hand." frowning, mom replied. "Note the cameras, strapped to their heads, their superiors now have a better idea of what we are capable of and send someone who can deal with it."

"We'll have to relocate then." wincing, I said. "I have read about these people, they are relentless."

"So are we." nodding, mom replied. "That was how we defeated them the last time."

She paused, as if the think, then took up a telephone and dialed a number. "Tex, this is Madame Vague." serious, she said. "Yes, my daughter and I were attacked as well..."

I listened to mom talking to Tex, the mighty on the telephone; only I had no idea who he really was. After a moment, mom ended the call and turned to me. "You have ten minutes to pack two bags, Lilith." serious, she said. "Pack only what is necessary to have, we'll come back for more, if needed, later."
15533211111112111121.title: The Agency makes its move.

155332111111121111211.content:
Ten minutes later, I had two bags packed with what I thought was essential and walked to the front door where I met mom with two bags of her own. "I'm going to miss this house." tearfully, I said. "Do we have to move away?"

"We'll return to this house, sweetie." gently, mom replied. "For now, however, we need to live somewhere else." she gave me a knowing smile. "The S.U.B. station."

My eyes went wide, hearing that. The Subterranean Urban Base station was only mentioned once in the eighth book of the series but there was no mention of exactly what or where it was. "You know about that place?" surprised, I asked.

"I helped build it." giggling, mom replied. "My coven and I, that is." she sighed. "We helped under the promise we would be able to hold our meetings there."

"Is um... Tex coming to pick us up?" curious, I asked.

"He is." seriousness returning to her eyes, mom said. "Bear in mind, he is of the original group, show respect."

As if on cue, three squad cars came to a halt in front of my house and a number of officers jumped out, running for the house with the chief of police, Ted Jones among them. "Are you injured, Mrs Wallace?" concerned, Mr Jones asked.

"We're just shaken, Ted." sighing, mom replied. "How are the others?"

"The same." serious, Ted replied. "Were moving everyone who was attacked to a substation where they will be safe."

Chief Jones was Tex the mighty!?" surprised, I thought. "Well, that explains Garth's strength."

Mom and I were quickly lead to Ted's squad car where I noticed that it was not your normal squad car. The equipment inside looked like something I might expect to find in a space shuttle. Seeing my expression as he got in, Ted smiled and explained, "This is one of the many vehicles we used twenty years ago. All of this is old but its still cutting edge."

With that, mom took the front passenger seat while I sat in the back before Ted drove off, towards the edge of the city. After a while, I looked out at the passing scenery, worried. "Where exactly is this substation, Mr Jones?" turning to the front, I asked.

"You will see." giving me a glance in the rear view mirror, Ted replied. he then turned to mom. "Madam Vague, will you do the honors?"

Mom produced her Tarot deck and drew the Moon card. Instantly, the sky outside went from a morning light to a midnight dark, causing a scream to escape my lips. Before the shock could wear off, the car stopped and I looked again to find myself in an underground parking lot as the card slid itself back into mom's deck. This left me shaken and confused before mom stated, "There is a normal way in but we are dealing with the Agency, we can not afford to leave anything to chance."

We all stepped out and walked out onto a walkway where I discovered we were in what appeared to be a modified old subway station. Instead of tracks for trains, there were two roads for cars. I guessed that they went everywhere under the city with smaller stations that had secret ways to the surface. On either side of the two roads were several rooms that were originally made to serve shops. Only now, they served as a base of operations. Through a window in one of the rooms, I caught a glimpse of electronic equipment. Through another window, I spotted a gym.

"Welcome, Lilith Nightshade," smiling mom said, "to the headquarters of the new Problem Child Gang."
155332111111121111211.title: Our new home.

1553321111111211112111.content:
Mom led me to one of the rooms, which was dominated by a large table surrounded by chairs. "This will be our meeting area," she said. "The offices and stockrooms for the businesses that were originally intended to be here will now be our living quarters. We've been assigned this space."

Once we got to our temporary home, Mom said, "Just take out the things you'll need for school right now. We'll get you properly situated after school. Don't worry; this time, I'll take a more normal route to the streets."



Once Mom dropped me off, I was met by Garth and Grace. "Are you alright?" Grace asked.

"Just surprised," I replied, as Beth and Lyssa joined us. "Being jumped by Agency goons is no way to start the day."

"What happened?" came Cait's voice. When I turned to see her, I was surprised that her hair was now light brown. Maybe she used Plutonium products, I surmised. The brown hair really brings out the family resemblance.

"Lilith's place was attacked by the Agency," Garth explained.

"My house was attacked just a few days ago," Cait said. "I think the two might be connected."

"Everybody, keep your eyes open," Grace said. "If the two home invasions are part of a pattern, any of us could be next."

The school doors opened, and I went to my locker. Once I put my things away, I heard a voice. "Miss Wallace, may I see you in my office?"

I sighed. What could I have done to get in trouble with the principal?
1553321111111211112111.title: Meeting the others.

15533211111112111121111.content:
So there I was, standing in front of Principal Hendrick's desk. "Have a seat, Olivia," she said, "this won't take long."

"I don't use that name," I said, as I sat. "I prefer Lilith Nightshade."

A slight smile crossed her lips. "Alright, Lilith it is. I just wanted to know what happened this morning."

"I-I don't know what you're talking about."

She didn't do anything for a while. Then, she reached into a desk drawer and pulled out an orange candle and a lighter.

As she lit the candle, she said, "Gaze into the candle flame, Lilith Nightshade. Feel your unnecessary fears leaving you."

I could actually feel my mind responding to her words. Holy cow, I thought, the principal is using magick!

"Now, what happened at your house this morning?"

"W-we were attacked," I said, "by people from a secret government agency. We got away, but Mom figured we should lie low for a while."

"Were any of you hurt?"

"No, ma'am."

She sighed. "That's a relief."

As she blew out the candle, I asked, "How did you know something had happened?"

"As first among equals," she explained, "it is my duty to look after my sisters."

"Your sisters?"

"Your mother has told you about the Sisterhood, hasn't she? I am the magistra."

"She told me, but she didn't say you were still around."

She nodded. "Indeed, our homes are spread all over this city. Your geometry teacher, Mrs. Dawkins, is also in the Sisterhood. The rest work in various capacities all over town. I take it you've been brought to the S.U.B. Station?"

"You know about that, too?"

"We hold our Sabbats there. Do you know where the custodian's closet is? Have you noticed the door nearby, marked 'No Admittance'? Through that door is another passage to the station. You and your friends may use it, when you need it."

"Thank you, ma'am."

She nodded. "You should probably get back to your homeroom. Incidentally, I like that you took the name Lilith. It was once used by the woman who bequeathed her powers to your mother."

I smiled at the synchronicity.
15533211111112111121111.title: The principal's office

155332111111121111211111.content:
Between first and second periods, I was able to join my goth friends, Julie and Mel, for our usual get-together. I was especially glad to see Mel, coming back as she was from a cancer scare. "They're sure they got it all," she assured us. "I'm just going through additional chemo to make sure it doesn't come back too soon."

"Good to have you back," I told her. "And, Julie, the fangs look good." Julie had talked her parents into spending $300 to get a set of fangs made from dental-grade acrylic. She planned to wear them until lunch, or until a teacher told her to take them out.

"Pretty trippy about Lyssa, huh?" Julie asked. "Any guesses how she turned into a girl?"

"Magick," I replied.

"It's okay not to know, Lil," Mel said. "Jules just asked for a guess."

"I wasn't guessing. I know for a fact, it was magick."

"And how do you know that?"

"Because I'm a witch. Lyssa had an ancestor who was changed from male to female, and she inherited it. They think her hormone therapy made it go faster, is all."



When third period P.E. came around, all the girls in the class went into the girls' locker room. Lyssa was about to head around the corner, like she had before, when one of the girls stopped her. "We've got extra lockers here, Lyssa. Why not join us?"

"You sure?"

"Why not?" she replied. "After all, you're as much a girl as any of us."

"Yeah," said another. "And if Bitch 1 and Bitch 2 don't like it when they get back, that's their problem."

Lyssa smiled and found a vacant locker. "I suppose none of us are going to see anything we don't already have."

"I wouldn't go that far," I replied. "I mean, so far, I'm the only girl in the locker room with a third nipple." Whatever tension there was left in the room dissipated in the laughter.
155332111111121111211111.title: In class

1553321111111211112111111.content:
I rejoined Julie and Mel for lunch. "How'd the fangs go, Julie?" I asked.

"Teacher spotted them in second period," she replied. "Fair warning: Mrs. Barns is not easy to fool."

To our surprise, our table received a visitor: Lyssa. "Hi, Lilith. Can I ask you something? I mean, private?"

"Hi, Lyssa. It's okay, you can trust Julie and Mel. They've been my friends forever. They introduced me to goth."

She sat down next to me. "Can you really see the future with your cards?"

"They've never steered me wrong," I replied. "I've misinterpreted once or twice, but they've never lied."

"What do they see for me and Garth?"

I smiled. Who doesn't want to know if love will last? I shuffled under the table, so nobody would see the cards flying around. "I'll do a three-card spread," I explained as I brought the cards up.

"This first card will represent you," I said, turning it over. "The Empress. She symbolizes abundance, creation, and fertility."

She swallowed hard. "My ancestor had 14 children. I seem to be taking after her."

I nodded. "Well, this card means you probably won't need medical help when you decide to have children. However, if you don't want to get pregnant, you'll need to take matters into your own hands."

Next, I turned over a card for Garth. "Strength. The big cats symbolize the practical, assertive, or even aggressive side of his nature. The woman signifies a strong feminine influence. Under her guidance, he finds a peace and power he's never imagined."

The last card represented their future together. "The Ten of Cups. The dog and cat symbolize unconditional love. The blazing hearth symbolizes warmth, comfort, and safety. The ten chalices represent the emotions and relationships that will bring you to this place."

Lyssa smiled. "So, things will work out between us."

"If that's what he wants."

We all turned when Mel spoke. "When Mom found out she was pregnant, my dad said he was heading out for a carton of cigarettes. That's the last anyone saw or heard from him."

Ouch. Mel had never talked about her home life. It had never occurred to me that she'd had things so rough. "I'm sorry, Mel."

She sighed. "It's really hurt with the cancer. Mom said my college fund was eaten up by my medical bills. I don't know what I'm going to do when I finish high school."

"How much do you need?"

Nobody expected Cait Spencer to show up at our table. "What did you say?"

"What sort of schooling did you want after high school?" Cait replied. "Find out how much it'll cost, and I'll pay for it. I didn't mean to interrupt, but I came to tell Lyssa something, and I couldn't help overhearing."

"I couldn't do that," Mel said. "I'd never be able to pay you back."

"Please," was Cait's reply. "Do you know how many millions I'd have to give you before I started to feel it? Don't worry about the money. I've learned it's like fertilizer: Spread it around, and beautiful things come to light. Keep it in one place, and everyone knows where you live, but everybody thinks you stink."

We were all floored by Cait's generosity.

Lyssa was the next to speak. "What did you want to tell me?"

"Oh. You're not going to believe this, but Amber McReady wants to see both of us after school."

"What? What does she want to see me for? Did she say?"

"She didn't say. Don't worry, though. She knows we're cousins, and she knows I won't let anything happen to you, if I can stop it."

Even if I didn't know that Cait was telepathic, I could tell that she knew more than she was saying. A glance at Lyssa showed that she knew no more than any of us what lay in store at Amber's house.

I went back to my lunch. I would have loved to know what was coming, but the Tarot couldn't forecast with that kind of accuracy.
1553321111111211112111111.title: Lunch

15533211111112111121111111.content:
After school, Cait had James drive her, Lyssa and I to Amber's house. "Please wait here in case I need you." firmly but kindly, Cait said. "I have a bad feeling about this."

"Yes ma'am." fingering his sidearm, James replied. "I will be ready."

"If you had a bad feeling about this, why are we here?" curious, Lyssa asked.

"I have a bad feeling Amber is in trouble, not us." frowning, Cait replied.

Then a feeling of dread fell over me, forcing a shiver. "I'm feeling it now." producing my Tarot card deck, I said. "I have a bad feeling Amber is not alone in there."

Then a scream was heard from inside, it was Amber's but it seemed strange somehow. Cait ran forward and thrust her hand forward; an invisible force reduced the door to splinters. We all ran inside to find a man kicking and punching Amber all around the living room with her vainly struggling against him. Acting quickly, I pulled a card from my deck; it was the Knight of Swords. "Knight of Swords, defend Amber McReady!" tossing the card, I commanded.

There was a puff of smoke and a knight on a horse appeared on the front lawn before it took off after a black van with tinted windows. "What..." puzzled, I whispered.

"You commanded the knight to defend Amber McReady!" her eyes widening, Cait said. "That's not her!"

Suddenly the man stopped attacking the girl and landed a punch onto Cait, sending her stumbling as the girl suddenly went after Lyssa, throwing kicks and chops in too quick of succession for her to use her speed. All she could do was dodge and back away, looking for room to move. I turned to my deck to pull another card to help but someone grabbed me from behind, forcing a foul smelling cloth over my nose and mouth. "Shit, its chloroform!" panicked, I thought. "I have to get free before it overtakes me!"

I was about to drop my deck to gain a free hand to struggle with but mom's words filled my mind... I'm glad to see you have discovered the true power of the cards. As long as you have faith in them, they will always protect you.

"I have faith in the cards..." feeling my consciousness slipping, I thought.

With my last ounce of strength, I drew a card and threw it. There was a puff of some before a tall and beautiful woman in sparkling ropes appeared; it was the High Priestess! "Release that child or great peril will await you." in a melodious voice, she warned. "This is your only warning."

The man, either stunned by her appearance, or floored by her beauty, slowly released me and I felt an iron clad hand pulling me out into the fresh air before I heard the clang ans crunch of metal hitting bone. "Amber McReady is in safe hands, my lady." came a strong male voice. "However, I fear 'she' is no more and 'he' is born."

That was enough of a shock to pull me out of the chloroform induced trance and I sat up to find a man I did not recognize in James' uniform. "He has to be a minion from the Agency." stunned, I whispered. "Only how did they fool Cait's telepathy?"

I then turned to see a traumatized teenage boy wearing girl's jeans and tank-top. Although the person was clearly male, I recognized the facial features. "Amber... Is that you!?" almost whispering, I asked.

The boy slowly nodded, tears forming. "Yeah, its me." on the verge of tears, Amber replied. "I- I heard this happened to Alyssa and I'm hoping she knew what is causing this."

I gasped. "Alyssa, Cait!" I ran into the house as the knight of swords and the High Priestess vanished from sight and paused, stunned. Lyssa had the girl shaking from convolutions with super speed kicks to every part of her body, pined to the wall by the force of her blows. Cait was smiling, standing over a the man who had attacked her as he sat on the floor, babbling like a newborn baby.

"Lyssa, that's enough!" touching my deck, I yelled. "She's had it!"

For a moment, I feared that Lyssa had lost it and would kill the girl but she stopped immediately, allowing the girl to slide to the floor, moaning. "I wasn't hitting her hard." limping towards me, she protested. "The first thing she attacked was my legs, I couldn't kick with my full strength if I tried right now."

"Their trying to weaken us." fearful, I mussed. "I had to use two cards at once to protect Amber and myself."

Lyssa's jaw dropped in shock. "Is that... Amber!?" stunned, she asked.

"I'm afraid so." wincing, I replied. "She's hoping we can help her figure out what's causing this." I then quickly added, "There's more, James was not our driver. It was someone else and he managed to get close, too close, without any of us realizing it."

"This is not good." shaking her head, Cait said. "We can't stay here." she then turned to Amber. "I'm afraid you will have to come with us."

"How are we going to get to... where ever we are going?" curious, Amber asked.

Suddenly, she moaned slightly then sighed as her body changed back into a girl before their eyes. "I'm back..." relief in her voice, she said. "I'm beautiful again."

Cait sighed then pulled out her cellphone and dialed a number. A moment later, someone picked up. As it was on speakerphone, we all heard James' voice. "James here..." in a strained voice, he said.

"James. are you okay, you're not injured or anything?" urgently, Cait asked.

"Just a bump on the head." after a moan, James replied. "Where are you, are you okay?"

"We're fine but we need pick up, bring the fastest car you can snag." she gave the address.

"I'm on my way."

After she ended the call, I turned to Amber. "This is not over." firmly but kindly, I said as Lyssa called Garth's father, the police chief. "Those goons will be back and, for whatever reason, they want you as badly as they want us."

Amber gulped. "But why!?" trembling, she asked. "What do I have anyone could possibly want!?"

"That is what we have to figure out." seriously, I replied.
15533211111112111121111111.title: After school

155332111111121111211111112.content:
We didn't have to stand around long before a familiar police cruiser pulled up. Cait was clearly surprised. "I thought James was a fast driver, Chief."

"I'm sure he is," Ted replied. "But this car goes much faster than anything else on the street. What's going on, girls?"

"The Agency came after Amber McReady," I said. "They had agents disguised as Amber and James."

"Why would they be looking at you, Amber?"

"I don't know," she replied. "But that's not the weirdest thing to happen to me today." She took a deep breath and swallowed. "For a few hours, I was a boy. I was hoping Lyssa could explain it, but I'm me again, so I guess I don't need to worry."

"Guess again," Lyssa said. "When I started changing, I changed back and forth, too."

Amber looked worried. "But... that doesn't mean it'll happen to me. Right?"

"Amber," Cait said, "how's your bra feel?"

Amber was puzzled by the question, then looked down and grabbed her breasts. "What's happening?"

"Your breasts are smaller," Lyssa said. "As I became a girl, my breasts grew. The opposite seems to be happening to you."

"Why is this happening? What did you do to me?"

"None of us did anything," I said. "The seeds for this were sown long ago, and I don't know how to find the answers."

"Maybe Beth can," Lyssa replied. "I'll ask her."

"That will have to wait," Ted inserted. "If Amber is at risk, we need to take action to protect her." Turning to Amber, he said, "Call your parents, and collect anything you'll need. I'll need to bring you to the S.U.B. Station."
155332111111121111211111112.title: Ted Jones arrives.

choices: I and mom talk to Amber alone.
1553321111111211112111111121.content:
As other police officers arrived on the scene, Ted urged Amber to call her parents. "They are not going to believe me." frowning, she muttered. "What am I going to do?"

"Leave that to me." a familiar voice replied.

I turned to find mom gently taking Amber's phone from her. "May I?"

Amber nodded, dumbfounded as mom then dialed a number. A few rings later, a woman answered. "Amber?"

"Blessed be, sister Tonya." gently, mom said. "Our mutual enemies have targeted Amber and tried to kidnap her; my daughter and her friends foiled the attempt."

I could hear Amber's mother, Tonya begin to sob on the other line. "Is she alright!? Did they hurt her!?"

"Be at peace, Tonya." calmly, mom said. "Amber is just fine but Tex feels we should move her to the substation for her own protection." after a pause, she added, "She is showing the signs of becoming a guardian."

"She's going through the change?" surprised, Tonya asked. "How far along is she?"

"She's just started, from what I can see." eying Amber, mom replied. she then gave me a glance and began to talk in a language I did not recognize.

"Not fair, mom." pouting a little, I thought.

After ending the call, mom turned to Ted who was returning from the house. From the look on his face, I knew that the three who had attacked us were already long gone. "It was Vendetta and Psyche." with a growl, he said. "They both got away but we have their flunky."

"He won't talk, Ted." softly, mom warned.

"I know, Madame Vague." frowning deeper, Ted replied. "Its not like the old days where we can scare what we want out of those we catch, I have to follow the letter of the law."

Twenty minutes later, we all arrived at the substation with Amber, who was still shaken by the sudden darkness when I used the moon card to get us there. "It took me by surprise as well." urging Amber out of mom's car, I said. "Welcome to the Subterranean Urban Base station."

"It really existed!?" startled, Amber asked. "Does that mean..."

"Chief Jones was Tex the mighty." serious, I replied. "All of it was real, including the Agency, who attacked you today."

"How did your mom know my mother?" still rattled, Amber asked. "Is there anything else I should know about?"

"Actually, there is." walking into view, Mrs Jones said.

I turned to find her walking towards us with Garth and Grace following, leading a short and thin thirteen year old boy with longish sand blond hair and green eyes. "Blessed be, Mrs Jones and family." kindly, I said. "Who is your new friend?"

Heather smiled. "Everyone, I'd like you to meet the newest member of our family." motioning to the small boy, she said. "This is Tim Jones, he was an orphan from Europe."

"I sense you were in the hands of the Agency." serious, I said.

"He was but he was not brainwashed." cutting in, Cait said. "His mind is free."

"That and I have already met him." smiling, mom said. "He has the power to make anything he draws come to life."

"Why didn't we meet him earlier?" confused, I asked.

"Because, child," patiently, mom replied, "he was too scared to come out."

"We convinced him you were all cool." placing a firm hand onto his shoulder, Garth chimed in. "These are my friends, little bro, you couldn't be in safer hands."
1553321111111211112111111121.title: At the S.U.B. Station

choices: Mom and I talk to Amber
15533211111112111121111111211.content:
"Welcome to the S.U.B. Station, Tim," I said, holding out a hand. "My name's Lilith."

"Hi," he replied, shaking my hand. "If Mr. Jones had said there were pretty girls like you here, I might have made my presence known sooner."

"Cool your jets, bro," Grace told him. "Lilith isn't into guys."

"So, you can bring your drawings to life?" I said, brushing off the attempted flirting. "I can call up the figures from my Tarot cards. That sounds similar."

"Not exactly," Tim replied. "My drawings actually move on the page. And I can actually become them. Want a demonstration?"

We all nodded eagerly.

He opened his sketchbook and stopped on one page. "Say hello to... "

Something crawled up his arm and reshaped his entire body. "... Amazona, Princess of Power!" This Amazona was six feet tall, with breasts that looked like she was smuggling basketballs.

I snorted. "Yeah, you came up with that one."

"What do you mean?"

"If you try moving around off the printed page," I explained, "those bazongas are going to be more of a hindrance than a help. They block your field of vision, they'll restrict your arm movement, and they'll make you fall over the second your back isn't straight."

"Told ya, Tim," Grace added.

She tried moving around, and quickly saw that we weren't joking. "I see your point, younglings," she said. "I am sure the artist sees it, too."

"Huh?"

"Tim doesn't just change physically," Garth explained. "The characters he creates come alive as he envisions them. So you're really talking to a character in a comic book."

Amazona touched the paper again, and a sheepish Tim stood before us. "Thanks for the advice," he said. "I'll definitely redesign her before I call on her again."

"You do that," Grace said. "And, please, stop making her costume rip in strategic places in battle."
15533211111112111121111111211.title: Meeting Tim Jones.

155332111111121111211111112111.content:
Tim's lips trembled slightly, tears forming. "There, there, Tim." cooing him, I said. "No one is mad at you."

"Not at all." roughing Tim's hair, Grace said. "Just give the female characters you make some dignity, okay?"

Tim sniffed at little but managed a smile. "O- Okay." he said.

"Good boy." smiling, mom said. she turned to the others. "Lilith and I need to have a word with Amber before her mother arrives with her husband."

Everyone agreed and I led Amber as I followed mom to a room not too far away. Once inside, mom closed the door and motioned us to sit down. We did so and mom sat down with us before taking a breath. "First, your mother and I have been friends since childhood, Amber." serious, she began. "We never introduced this to either of you because you were not yet ready to join the sisterhood." pausing, she added, "That and we firmly believe everyone must make their own paths in life, we can only guide you and hope you make the right choices."

"Um... Mrs..." Amber began to say.

"Please, Madame Vague." smiling, mom said. "Its too formal to call me Ms Wallace."

"I thought it was Mrs Hastings." confused, Amber said.

"My husband is not the best in the world but he is still my husband." sadly, mom said. "To protect him, I take on my maiden name in public and Madame Vague when among the new gang." she sighed. "What is your question, child?"

"I heard you say I was close to becoming a Guardian." uneasy, Amber replied. "What is that and does it have anything to do with me changing into a guy?"

"That is a long story, Amber." sighing, mom replied. she took strange colored candle from a nearby table and lit it with a wave of her hand. "Look into the flame and your answer will be told."

Amber and I both looked into the flame and soon found ourselves in a trance as images and sounds filled our minds...
=========================
"Ho, sisters!"

The crew of the Amazonian fishing boat all responded to the lookout's cry. They took positions, expecting nothing, ready for anything.

It could have been anything, from a shark to an enemy vessel. What it was, however, was a raft, ill-suited for a voyage as long as was needed for it to reach this far. The Amazons approached the raft, and, peering over their own ship's rail, studied the raft.

On the raft was a young boy, burned by the sun, weak from hunger and thirst. Strangely, he was clad in the robes of a female. Why should a man dress as a woman? Moved by empathy and curiosity, they brought the boy onto their boat. Back on their island, the Amazons began nursing him back to health.

When he had recovered enough to speak, the Amazon queen herself went to speak to him. "Greetings, young traveler," she said. "I am Antiope, Queen of the Amazons. Who are you?"

The boy bowed his head. "I am Iolaus, Your Majesty."

"Well met, Iolaus. We found you adrift on the sea, and in a woman's robes. How came you into such dire straits, and why were you dressed so?"

"I... I scarce can explain myself, Your Majesty."

"Please, Iolaus, try."

"I... I like to wear such things. I know not why."

"Interesting. What put you on that raft?"

"The people of my city. My... dress offended them greatly. Some of them wanted to kill me outright."

"What stayed their hand?"

"They feared that the gods might think me an offering. If that happened, the gods would discover my true nature, and might be angered."

"Fear not, Iolaus. I have given the command that you are not to be harmed. I will direct my people to see if there is a way that we might help you."

When Iolaus could walk again, he was brought to the temple. There, he was bound to the altar, as the Amazon priestesses performed a strange ritual over him. Finally, the chief priestess unbound Iolaus, and led the traveler out of the temple.

All the Amazons, even Queen Antiope, were stunned. Iolaus was now a young woman.

"Sisters," cried the chief priestess, "I give you Iole, our new sister." And so Iole became known as the Twice-Named.

As Iole settled into life as an Amazon, it became clear that she had found favor with the gods. She could run faster than the eye could follow. She could outdistance any prey she chose. And, in the heat of battle, she could pluck an arrow in flight, as easily as fruit from a tree.

In time, she bore fourteen daughters and sons. When the time came for her to go to the Elysian Fields, at the end of her life, all the Amazons mourned her passing.....
==============================

As the images and sounds left us, returning us to the small room, mom sighed. "Iole's daughters, granddaughters, and so on, changed genders to become guardians where her sons, grandsons, and so on did the same to become Amazon warriors, such as Alyssa Vance." she said. "In Alyssa's case, she gained super speed and agility."

"But.. what is a Guardian?" pressed Amber.

"Only one child in each generation changes." seemingly ignoring Amber, mom replied. "Chief Jones, or 'Tex the mighty', was a Guardian. You read the graphic novels; he had incredible strength, natural resistance to small arms fire; near invulnerability to pain..." she smiled. "Chief Jones did not know the truth of his power, thus he never fully discovered it."

I gasped. "Chief Jones was..."

Mom nodded. "He was originally Tia Jones before he had his change upon reaching puberty." smiling, she replied. she then became serious. "I have been intrusted to keep that a well guarded secret, do not betray my trust in you two."

Amber and I quickly nodded. "It won't leave this room." serious, I promised.

"Not a word of this, I promise." not wanting to risk a witch's wrath, Amber said. she then teared up. "Am I really going to become a guy for life?"

"Yes, I am sorry." softly, mom replied. "However, you will be a boy of incredible power, like Alyssa."

"We will help you all we can." turning to Amber, I said. I offered my hand. "Friends?"

Amber paused but then hesitantly took my hand and shook it. "Acquaintances." sighing, she said. "We'll work up to friends, fair enough?"

I sighed myself. "Yeah, fair enough."

Mom then rose from her seat. "We will talk about this more later." she said. "Chief Jones is waving us to him. I believe he wishes to show us something."

What does Ted wish to show everyone?
155332111111121111211111112111.title: Mom and I talk to Amber

choices: The exodus to the S.U.B. Station begins
1553321111111211112111111121112.content:
"We've got big trouble," Ted said, as we all gathered round. He pointed to a flashing light. "We're getting a distress call from the Vance residence."

Amber groaned, and became a boy again. "Just what I didn't need."

"On the contrary," Mom said. "The strength of a Guardian will be needed."

"We'll probably need this, too," Tim added, bringing out a male character this time. "The name's Nightside."

"Alright, everyone," Mom said, as she took out her Tarot deck. "Focus on the Vance household."

We were surrounded by a bright light. I guessed that, since the Moon card teleported us to the S.U.B. Station, she was using the Sun card to bring us to the surface.

When the light faded, we were standing in the Vance living room, as a horde of Agents ran roughshod over the place. "Everyone, pick an opponent," Ted commanded.

I didn't have too long to decide, as two of the bad guys came after me. "You must be the troublemaker from before," said one.

"Just stand still, missy," said the other. "We'll make this short and painless."

That didn't sound good to me, so I drew a card: Justice.

The Agents were startled by the sudden appearance of two women right in front of them. "Thou art weighed in the balance," said one.

"And found wanting," added the other, as she brought her sword down upon their weapons, destroying them.

As they stood staring at their now useless firearms, I drew another card: Strength. Now, the Agents also had to deal with a lion, a tiger, and a leopard.

"Pick up brass!" called one of the Agents. They all activated devices on their wrists and disappeared, leaving only the ruined weapons.

"Everybody okay?" I called.

"Looks that way," Ted said. "Hey, we scored a bonus. When these guns were chopped, it must have damaged whatever lets them teleport. We can finally get a look at their tech."

"They sent someone disguised as me," Lyssa said, rubbing her hand. "Her problem was, she moved too slowly. A few dozen punches per second, and she didn't see them coming." Her attention turned to the former Amber. "Thanks for the help, Amber. Though it sounds funny calling you that at the moment."

"I suppose I'll think of something," he said. "I guess I'm finding out what life was like for you, huh? Sorry I was such a pain."

"Like they say, what doesn't kill me makes me stronger," Lyssa replied, as she gave Amber a hug. "Thanks again."

"You're welcome. Boy, you smell nice."

"Uh, thanks, but I already have a boyfriend."

"Whoa," he said, breaking up the hug. "Guess I've got a lot to get used to."

"Attention, everyone," Ted called. "Given the current situation, we think it's best that we all relocate to the S.U.B. Station until things blow over."

"We've got the phone tree started," Mrs. Vance added. "So, for those of you already at the station, you're all going to have company."

Amber's cell phone rang, and he checked it. "Cassie," she said. "We usually get together about this time, but I'm not at my house. And if she went there, she's probably seen what a wreck it is."

"Let me talk to her," Ted said. "Hello? Hello, Cassie, this is Chief Jones. Yes, we're aware of what happened at Amber's house. She and her family are safe, and they've been relocated. I'll see that she gets your call, and I'm sure that she'll return it as soon as possible. Just remember that she's going through a lot right now. More than you know. Alright. Goodbye." He returned Amber's phone to him.
