It is not what one would call 'perfect vision' but it is far better than anyone with normal senses can claim to have.* After a pause, she added, *I suggest you take some time to walk about the house and learn how to focus your new found senses.*
1553322212222221121211.title: Exploring my powers

15533222122222211212111.content:
Since I was in my room, it only made sense for me to start there. As Dee had said, my echolocation was a lot better than sight. For one thing, it didn't depend on light. For another, since not all the sound waves I was emitting went right to my ears, I could also get a rough idea of the room around me without turning my head. My bed, my clock, my bookcase; I could perceive it all.

I stepped out into the hall, and found a rectangle hanging on the wall. I knew it was a picture that the rest of the family liked, but it was still blank to my senses. Lesson Number 1: Not all the sighted world was clear to me.

I heard Zack in his room, typing on the keys on his computer. I could hear his heavy breathing, smell his sweat, his -

Eww.

Okay, Lesson Number 2: Heightened senses sometimes tell me things I really didn't want to know.

I followed the hall to the upstairs landing, then went downstairs. More art on the walls, but now I could perceive the sculpture in the foyer. As a little girl, I hadn't been allowed to touch it. Now, though, I could appreciate its beauty.

I followed the sounds of the TV to the living room. Mom was watching her afternoon programs. She turned her head when I came into the room. "Hello, Melissa. I'd like to talk with you."

I sat down next to her. "About what?" I asked, but I had a pretty good idea.

"What exactly is going on with you? What do you and the Chief of Police know that I don't?"

"Well," I began, "you know how sighted people say that visually impaired people develop heightened senses to compensate?"

"Yes."

"Well, with Mrs. D, it was true. And, thanks to her, it's now true for me, too."

"Like what?"

"Well, I apparently now make a noise so high-pitched that my brain doesn't even recognize it as a sound. But, when it bounces off of something, I hear the echo, and my brain forms a picture from it. Like a bat's echolocation. Also, my ability to feel the room temperature is now so sensitive that I can detect body heat."

"Huh. And what do you plan to do with this?"

"Right now, I'm expanding my perceptions of the house. I figured it would be best to start here, since I know the floor layout and nobody would think it was strange I was walking around without my cane."

"Keep the cane anyway, Mel. No need to let anyone else know your senses are this sharp." She pointed to the mantel. "What do you see up there?"

"Picture frames," I replied. "I can't tell what they're pictures of, though."

"They're pictures of our family. The one on the far right is you, when you were little."

I got up and touched the frame. I still couldn't perceive the pictures, but knowing they were us made them special to me.
15533222122222211212111.title: Learning to 'see'

155332221222222112121111.content:
"How is exploring the house going?" Mom asked.

"Pretty well," I replied. "I'm finding out a lot of things I didn't know before. Which, in Zack's case, isn't necessarily a good thing."

"Oh? Like what?"

"Trust me, Mom, you don't want to know what he's doing on the computer."

Mom cursed under her breath. "I've changed that password five times already." Then she cleared her throat. "How about we check out the backyard?"

"Okay."

Mom opened the back door, and I followed her out. We have a tall fence, so the neighbors wouldn't see me navigating with no assistance.

It was like an entirely new world. I'd heard the wind playing in the leaves on the trees before, but now, I could perceive the way each leaf moved. And that wasn't all: I could now perceive living things around me. I pointed to a creature with a bushy tail. "What's that?"

"That's a squirrel."

There was something fluttering around. "And that?"

"Butterfly."

"And that thing with the funny things sticking out of its head?"

"That's a rabbit. Those are its ears."

I smiled. "I think I like butterflies and rabbits."

Then, someone called over the fence. "Hello?"

Mom replied, "Can I help you?"

"Grace and Garth Jones," said a girl's voice. "We heard there was a girl here, who was with Mrs. D when... " Her voice trailed off.

"That's right," I said, "I was."

A boy spoke this time. "Um, we were thinking that, maybe, you might want to talk about it?"

"Alright," Mom said, unlatching the gate. "The three of you can talk, if you want. I'll just run in and get you kids something to drink."

"Thanks, ma'am," said the boy, Garth.

As soon as Mom closed the door behind her, Grace said, under her breath, "Puer quaestio."
155332221222222112121111.title: Exploring the backyard

1553322212222221121211112.content:
Those words... Chief Jones had earlier told me it was Latin for problem child. I was not certain then why he told me that but now I had a better idea. I turned to Garth and gasped; his muscles were generating insane amounts of energy! He was just like Chief Jones only his strength seemed to have been energy based rather than instant muscle inflation. I then turned to Grace, wide eyed, seeing a beautiful pattern of coloration in her mind as well as her body. I was not certain what it meant as I was still learning how my power works but I guessed she had some type of mind over matter ability that was sure to surprise me.

"You are members of the new problem child gang." Whispering, I said. "Exactly what is it that you want from me?"

"Miss Shadow was a valuable ally to the original problem child gang." Quietly, Garth replied. "From what I heard from my mentor, you possess similar powers."

"We have reason to suspect Miss Shadow was your mentor." Kindly, Grace added. "We are hoping you might be willing to help us in the future."

"You are not asking me to join?" Surprised, I asked.

Garth shook his head. "We ask no one to follow us." Serious, he said. "Those who join us do so under their own free will and at their own peril."

"What we do is dangerous and the authorities frown upon such actions from anyone." Softly, Grace explained. "However, there is a real threat to this city and we believe it can use all the help it can get."

Garth handed me a card with a number on it. "If you decide you wish to help us in our fight or find you need our help, call us at any time; day or night." Kindly, he said. "Puer quaestio."

You paused, hearing mom returning and turned to Grace who seemed to have sensed her coming as well as she quickly changed the subject of the conversation. "We are very sorry for your loss, Melissa." Sadly, she said. "She was a dear friend of our father; she had helped him out of a few jams when he was around our age."

"He mentioned that." Nodding, I replied.

"I see you three are getting along well." Smiling, mom said as she approached. "Melissa will be going to your school once summer vacation is over."

"Zack told us all about it." Politely, Garth said. "He's already informing everyone that he would be protecting her from any type of bullying."

Mom giggled at that. "Zack has always been protective of her." Smiling, she said. "Although I'm certain it drives Melissa crazy at times, he does mean well."

After several minutes of normal conversation, Grace and Garth said their farewells and left in good spirits. Mom seemed pleased that I had made new friends so soon but I remained worried. Although Mrs D got involved, I was not so certain I wanted to place my normal family, as normal as it was, at risk. I decided to go to my room to try to think things through. As I passed Zack's bedroom, the door opened and Zack peeked his head out. "Melissa!" Whispering, he called. "Get in here! I need your help!"

I sighed, smelling Zack's sweat and 'heightened hormones' to put it politely. "What is it, Zack?" Patiently, I demanded. "It's been a weird enough day."

Zack frowned. "It's about to get more weird." Serious, he said.

Before I could react, Zack pulled me into his room and closed the door. Inside, I was surprised to find his room as neat as a pin when normally it was a trashed up mess. "Did you lose something during your yearly clean up?" Sarcastically, I asked.

"Very funny, sis." Frowning, Zack said. "I'm trying to be serious here!"

I paused, noting fear and frustration in Zack's voice. "There was something genuinely frightening him which was a rarity given the lengths he went to stand up for me in the past. "What's wrong?" Becoming worried, I asked. "Did something happen?"

Zack sighed. "You and Mrs D had a lot in common." Surprising me, Zack said. "Including an overprotective brother."

I gasped upon suddenly seeing a surge of energy building up within Zack and took a step back as he then...
1553322212222221121211112.title: Puer Quaestio

15533222122222211212111121.content:
To say I was surprised would have been the understatement of the century. Zack's body had drastically changed in a matter of seconds! His usual tall, muscular square frame had shrunk over an inch and had gained the curves of a teenage girl! He, or rather, she was still quite muscular but there was no doubt in my mind that she was now completely female!

"Okay, you got my attention." Shaken, I said. "How did you know Mrs D and how are you able to swap genders like that?"

"I never really spoke to Mrs D." Blushing, Zack said. "I was approached by her older brother that day you flipped out on me for following you to her house that first week you started visiting her on a regular basis."

Zack's new voice was soft and melodious, like mom's only slightly deeper in tone. I could tell she was blushing by the heat I could detect on her face. The way she was standing gave me the impression that she was not very comfortable with her new form. "What happened?" Whispering, I asked. "Did he do something to you to cause this?"

"He told me that he was very protective of his sister too." Shifting uncomfortably, Zack explained. "He taught me ways to watch over you without you feeling I was constantly standing in your shadow, looking over your shoulder. He taught me how to read facial expressions and verbal tones; tell who looked at you with good or bad intentions." She sighed. "He also taught me how to track people in case someone..." Her voice trailed off.

"I get the idea." Wincing, you said. "What about you changing genders?"

"That's the weird part." Frowning, Zack said. "I went to him the day Mrs D passed away, thinking he might need someone to talk to. He told me that you were going to need my help more than ever and that his ancestry would help me do just that."

"His ancestry?" Confused, I asked.

Zack nodded, shifting uncomfortably. "I didn't get it either." Tearing up, she said. "He told me that he was descended from an Amazon woman called Lole, the twice named." She shivered slightly before continuing. "It was a strange tale to say the least but he proved it by changing into a woman right in front of me!"

"What?!" Stunned, I asked. "How is that even possible?!"

"How is this even possible?!" Irritated, Zack countered.

I sighed. "Point taken. What did he, err, she do to you?"

"Well, my first instinct was to run for the door." Frowning, Zack said. "However, she changed back and told me that I had nothing to fear. That and I found I couldn't move." She sniffed away a tear shifting again. "He then performed some weird ritual in front of me and before I knew what was happening, I was a teenage girl."

"Wow..." Shaken, I muttered. "Are you able to change back and forth as you said he could?"

Zack shook her head. "I don't know." Now crying, she said. "I'm barely able to control it right now because I feel so weird..."

I gasped, suddenly realizing what was happening and grabbed Zack's wrist, pulling her into her private bathroom. She and I had our own bathroom suite which made things easier for us both. Once inside, I pulled down her sweat pants. Sure enough, I could detect the telltale signs of her having her first period. "So that's what I was smelling in here." Sighing, I muttered. "Good grief!"

"What's happening to me, sis?" Frightful, Zack demanded.

I sighed. "Get yourself cleaned up." Firmly but kindly, I said. "I'll find you some clothes and then we will need to have a long talk."

"You're not going to tell mom, are you?" Worried, Zack asked.

"She's going to find out eventually." Wincing, I replied. "You went from my tall, dark and dorky brother to my slim, curvy and hot sister in less than a minute."

"Ha, ha." Frowning, Zack muttered. "I suppose you'll want to give me a girl's name to go with this new look I gained."

I decided not to answer as then was not the time to start an argument. Zack was way out of his comfort zone with her new situation and I had to get some answers before something else happened to her that might make things worse.
15533222122222211212111121.title: Transformed into a teenage girl!

155332221222222112121111211.content:
I picked out some outfits for Zack to try. I wasn't sure how well they would fit, since she was bigger than I was, but they were all I had to work with. Well, almost all. I grabbed a few tampons from my nightstand drawer, then went to Zack's room.

She was pretty much where I had left her. The only difference was that she was unrolling a mess of toilet paper. "How long does it take to stop bleeding?"

"Let's not go into that right now," I said. I unwrapped a tampon. "Here. You insert it like you're injecting marinade."

Once the flow was interrupted, we could concentrate on getting my new sister cleaned up. "You know," she said, "I once saw a movie online, about this 11-year-old girl who had a baby. I thought for sure that would be the weirdest thing I ever saw, until this happened."

"This has been a day for surprises," I replied. "So, tell me about Mrs. D's brother."

"His name's Eli. He said that Mrs. D wasn't much older than you are when she started the whole Miss Shadow thing. He wanted to look out for her, because he knew that enhanced senses and agility aren't much good against something faster than the speed of sound. Like a bullet." She pulled on the panties. "I feel like Sigourney Weaver in Alien."

*Eli was very successful,* Dee told me. *We had no idea she was being followed, nor that her older brother could change sex.*

"He was relieved when she got married," Zack continued. "He said having a husband and a family kept her too busy for crime-fighting." She struggled with my bra, then threw it aside. "That's too small. Anyway, he just about had a heart attack when the Problem Child Gang started up, and she up and decided to suit up again. I mean, he was 80 by then, and she wasn't far behind. Hardly the age to be comfortable chasing a bunch of 'whippersnappers,' as he called them." She squeezed into my clothes, then stood up.

"What do you think?" I asked.

"I guess I'm still the big sister," she said. "I'm fine, as long as I don't do anything crazy. Like breathe or eat."

"And he's the reason you're a girl now?"

"Yep. He said I would figure out how to control it, but I've had no luck so far. My first change today came right on the heels of an or... uh, I mean, I was 'getting happy'."

"Yeah, Mom's going to want to talk to you about that. Something about half a dozen passwords?"

"Guilty as charged. Though I can only guess what my search history will look like after this. I've got to get in touch with Eli, to find out what went wrong."
155332221222222112121111211.title: Zack and I talk.

choices: the mall for a new wardrobe.
1553322212222221121211112112.content:
I opened my mouth to respond but paused as I heard mom coming up the stairs. Zack saw my expression and moaned as mom entered my room. She looked at us, surprised but did not say anything at first. I decided to jump in before she got the wrong idea.

"Mom, something weird happened to Zack." Wincing, I said. "Mrs D brother..."

"Eli?" Wide eyed, mom asked. "You talked to Eli Mist?"

"You know him?" Taken back, I asked.

Mom shook her head, looking disappointed. "Let me guess, he tried to help you look after your sister without her knowing."

Zack nodded, though she seemed as confused as I was. "How do you know him?"

"He was my mother's crush." Frowning, mom replied. "He would have become her second husband if she and I had not discovered he was literally living a double life." She sighed then turned to Zack. "Well at least now you don't need to hack the computer pass codes to look at pretty girls in next to nothing, you can just look in the mirror."

Zack blushed brightly. "I did it for..."

"You did it for the articles, I know." Rolling her eyes, mom said. "You got that lame excuse from your father. He finally admitted he does it to keep himself loyal while traveling abroad. He told me that no woman compares to my beauty."

I giggled at that as I could hear mom's eyes roll as she said that. Mom giggled back before her face softened slightly. "I do not know how Eli was able to give you this power to change genders but I am guessing its an ancient ritual, one that is likely irreversible."

"So what do we do?" Wincing, Zack asked.

A bemused look formed onto mom's face. "We do the only thing we can do right now... Zoe." Smiling, she replied. "Get ready to head out; we're all going to..."
1553322212222221121211112112.title: Mom's strange past.

15533222122222211212111121121.content:
"First," Mom said, "let's get you into some clothes that fit." She sized Zack up and down. "You look about my size. I'll get you some things from my closet."

As Zack put on Mom's clothes, she said, "I feel ridiculous."

"If you think you feel ridiculous now," Mom replied, "just wait until your friends come by, wanting to shoot some hoops. Which euphemism would you like me to use?"

"What do you mean? I won't be on my period that long, will I?"

Mom turned to me. "You haven't told her?"

"She was half-panicked when it happened," I explained. "I didn't want to pile on."

"How long is it?"

"Well,... you know that T-shirt your friend Boomer likes to wear, that he thinks is so hilarious, and I think is garbage?"

"Oh, you mean, 'Don't Trust Anything That Bleeds For 3 Days And Doesn't Die'?"

"Yep, that's the one."

Zack thought about this exchange, then groaned.



Once Zack was dressed, we went over to Eli Mist's house. He took a while to answer the door. When he did, he was bent over. Zack seemed concerned. "Can I help you?" Eli wheezed.

"Eli Mist?"

He looked up. "Do I know you, ma'am?"

"You knew my mother long ago, and you knew my son more recently. We'd like to talk about the latter, if we can come in."

Eli let us in and slowly led us to the living room. "What is this about?"

"You're Mrs. D's brother?" I asked. "She talked about you, but I thought you were... "

He chuckled. "Not quite yet, young lady. You must be Melissa."

"We came to talk about Zack, Mr. Mist," Mom said. "You gave him the ability to turn into a girl for some reason?"

"At the time," he said, "it seemed like a good idea."

"Well, this is Zack," she said, pointing to my new big sister. "She can't change back, and she just became a woman."

"Oh." Eli said this as though his worst fears had been confirmed.

"Can you undo this?"

"Unfortunately, ma'am," Eli said, "this is something it's easier to get into than out of. There's a way that has been used sometimes, but it usually doesn't work, and oftentimes can even make the person younger. You wouldn't want to risk that, would you?"

From the way Zack was acting, though, I got the feeling there might be another reason. She was shocked to see Eli so frail. Maybe, I thought, changing Zack took more out of him than he thought. If that was the case, even if he undid it, he might not live long enough to be thanked.
15533222122222211212111121121.title: talk with Eli.

155332221222222112121111211211.content:
"If there is a way to change Zack back to normal, I must insist that you try, Eli." Firmly but kindly, mom demanded. "My son did not ask for this."

"My sister, Ina did not ask for her gifts and nor did I." Tearing up, Eli said. "I suspect that Melissa did not ask for hers either."

"How did you know..." Taken back, I demanded.

"Eli smiled. "You forgot your cane, young lady." Politely, he said. "Also, you entered without any help from your family so I knew right there that you had gained my sister's abilities to see the world in different ways." He wheezed, catching his breath. "It was what I had suspected which was why I gave Zack the gift of the Amazons."

"Chief Jones told us that Mrs D might have been Miss Shadow of the problem child gang." Firmly, mom said. "Does that have something to do with what you did to my son?"

Eli sighed, shaking his head. "The original problem child gang only knew Ina as Miss Shadow while she was in her eighties." Gruffly, he replied. "I grew up with her. I knew her when she donned that persona to lead the resistance."

"The resistance?" Curious, I asked.

Eli nodded. "It was near the beginning of the cold war, many years before the original problem child gang was first founded." Softly, he explained. "This entire town was targeted by some secret government agency called CHILD. They were very interested in children who were reported to have strange abilities. Ina, or Miss Shadow, lead a group of resistance fighters to drive the government agency out. I was her unseen shield, her unknown partner in her struggle against impossible odds."

Eli paused, reaching for a tank of oxygen. I winced seeing how weak he seemed. "Changing Zack's gender took a lot out of you, didn't it?"

"Don't worry about me, child." Lightly, Eli said. "Also, your sister will have the power to change back into her male form once her menstrual cycle passes." He flashed a rueful smile. "I was on my own for my first experience so your brother is fortunate in that regard."

"What will a gender change do to help me in any way?" Curious, I asked. "Right now, she needs help from mom and I more than anything."

"I did more than merely change his gender." Serious, Eli said. "She will soon discover she has skills far beyond any Olympian athlete including heightened reflexes, sharp senses, everything a warrior needs to achieve success." He then turned to mom with a kind smile on his face. "I did nothing more than what my dear sister did with Melissa." Calmly, he said. "I passed on a gift that gave me the power to protect my sister."

He then unsteadily reached into his jacket pocket and pulled out a large notebook. "Here are all my notes on what I had discovered about my powers; you can use them as a guide.

With that, Eli...
155332221222222112121111211211.title: Mom lets the matter rest

choices: A meeting with the Vance family.
1553322212222221121211112112111.content:
Uncertain, I took the thick notebook from Eli. It was hundreds of cut up pieces of paper sewn into a makeshift cardboard cover, wrapped in plastic. The pages were worn with several corners folded; I guessed they were reference points for him. I turned back to thank him but detected no breath leaving his nose or mouth. I turned to his chest and heard nothing. I quickly realized the worst had occurred; Eli had passed away.

"Eli...?" Fearful, Zack called.

I turned to him and winced before slowly, tearfully shaking my head. "I'm sorry..."

Zack buried her face into her hands as mom pulled her into a comforting hug. "We'll figure this out, honey, I promise." Whispering, she said. "It'll be okay."

Zack continued to cry in mom's arms, much as I did shortly after Mrs D passed away in my arms only a few days before. "Mrs D gave me her symbiont for a reason." Saddened, I thought. "That reason, whatever it was, had to have driven Eli to give his gift to Zack."

*Eli was a good man.* Sadness in her voice, Dee said. *He had told Ina that no one should face their troubles alone.*

"That's why he did it." Whispering, I muttered. "He knew what might happen."

"What was that, Melissa?" Worried, mom demanded. "You think you know why Eli did this?" She sighed, shaking her head. "It really doesn't matter now, I guess."

"He... He said I'll change back after this period passes." Crying, Zack said.

"He said you will have the power to change back." Softly, mom corrected. "Hopefully these notes he left us will give us a clue as to how." She pulled out her cellphone. "I had better call the authorities and let them know of Eli's passing."

Mom released Zack to call the police while I took over the task of comforting her. Minutes later, a squad car pulled up and Chief Jones entered with the coroner and a deputy.

"Guard the door while I speak with the witnesses." Firmly, he ordered.

The deputy nodded and walked to the front door to stand guard while Chief Jones turned to us with a rather serious look on his face. "Normally, someone being close to the deaths of two related people raises more than a few red flags." Serious, he said. "Fortunately, I had spoken to Mr Mist earlier. I knew that he was close to dying but he refused to go to the hospital; he said he had some unfinished business to deal with." He frowned, eying Zack. "I see that business had to do with your son who I see is now an attractive young daughter."

"How do you know about all of this?" Fearful, mom demanded.

"Because it happened to another boy not that long ago." To all of our surprise, chief Jones replied. "He, or rather she, was descendant from the same Amazon tribe as Mr Mist." His voice then dropped to a whisper. "I can't give you the details but I can point you in the right direction to get more answers."

Mom nodded and Chief Jones handed her a piece of paper with a number and an address on it before starting his usual questions regarding the passing of Mr Mist. We were all free to leave about an hour after and mom drove us home. On the way there, she dialed the number Chief Jones gave her. Three rings later, a woman answered. "Vance residence, who am I speaking to?"

Mom gasped. "Liv...?"

The voice on the phone gasped back. "Kris...?"
1553322212222221121211112112111.title: fell silent.

15533222122222211212111121121112.content:
Minutes later we were all seated in the living room of the Vance residence. Zack had a puzzled look on her face as two teenage girls walked in and sat down across from her, mom and I. Both girls had roughly shoulder length hair and an attractive figure. Only one walked with a little more grace; the other seemed to be a bit awkward in her steps. I was curious as to why but decided not to ask. Mrs Vance entered shortly after in a wheelchair with a toddler boy in her lap who was sleeping. "My husband, Frank is out running errands." Kindly, Mrs Vance said. "Kris, you told me over the phone that your son, Zack had been changed by old Eli Mist."

"In a big way, I fear." Motioning to Zack, mom said. "Chief Jones gave us your number and address, saying that you could give us some answers."

Mrs Vance sighed. "I see..." Calmly, she said. "Well, my daughter, Alyssa went through the same transition as Zack." She motioned to the girl with the awkward step. "Her sister, Beth was a great help to her during this time. However, in her case, it was something she truly wanted."

Zack gasped, raising a hand to her mouth as she turned to Alyssa who blushed but said nothing. Fortunately, Zack did not say anything in return. I decided to try to break the ice. "Zack told us that Eli Mist used some weird ritual on Zack, turning him into my new sister."

Beth nodded. "I had done a lot of research into our family ancestry." Looking at me, she explained. "Eli Mist is directly related to the high priestess who had transformed the adopted Amazon woman, Lole the twice named. I do not know how he was able to switch genders at will if his ancestry gave him that power but I do know he would have had to have been female to learn the ritual."

"Do you have any idea why he did this to my son?" Worried, mom demanded. "Is there any way to reverse this?"

"Eli was old." Wincing, Beth said. "I can only guess he was trying to pass on his gift, if you wish to call it that." She sighed. "I had spoken to Mrs D when I was working on my research to help Alyssa and she told me that if someone of old age performs the ritual, it almost always only has a partial effect on the one being changed."

"What does that mean?" Worried, I asked.

Beth sighed. "It means that, like Eli, your daughter is only transformed half way." Almost sadly, she explained. "She will be able to switch genders at will and gain great attributes, reflexes, and so much more." She winced. However....only a full transformation can be reversed."

"On the bright side, she can choose to remain in one gender form or another." After a thought, Mrs Vance said. "Have you considered a new name for your child's feminine persona in the mean time?"

Mom sighed. "I was leaning towards Luana." Softly, she said. "If my son is stuck as my daughter, or will be switching back and forth for who knows how long, I would have to get her a new wardrobe."

Mrs Vance smiled. "I was about to take the girls shopping for more clothes when you called. Want to come along with us?"

Mom smiled slightly. "Maybe Alyssa and Beth can help her pick out some outfits."

Mrs Vance smiled in return.
15533222122222211212111121121112.title: A meeting with the Vance family.

choices: Back at home, Dad meets the new Zack
155332221222222112121111211211121.content:
The Vance sisters were helping Zack pick out clothes. I kept close by, but didn't say too much. After all, I was blind, so there was no reason for the Vances to believe that I could perceive the world around me almost as if I could actually see.

Meanwhile, Mom and Mrs. Vance were talking. Apparently, they had been good friends in high school, but had somehow drifted apart after graduation. "I couldn't believe my eyes when I saw you," Mom said. "How'd you end up in a wheelchair?"

"It's a long story," Mrs. Vance replied. "So how well do you know Chief Jones?"

"Steve's a detective on the force. We talk just about every chance we get. Of course, he still finds ways to surprise me."

"How so?"

"Well, would you believe that the Problem Child Gang from the comics was a real group? Seriously. A bunch of kids actually went out and did a lot of the things they put in the funny papers."

"Hard to believe," Mrs. Vance said.

However, when she said that, her heart rate went up, and I knew she was lying. She knew more about the Problem Child Gang than she was telling.

I knew she was about the same age as Chief Jones. Could it be that she was also a member of the Problem Child Gang? Was that how she ended up in a wheelchair?

*She was,* Dee told me. *She had a talent for escape artistry. Perhaps an old enemy decided to put her in a situation she couldn't escape from.*

They wanted to put her in a chair?

*Or a coffin.*

As we went along, I noticed something interesting.

Like most stores, this one had mannequins showing off the latest styles. However, in this store, at least one of the mannequins was... alive.

Yes, I was certain. She breathed. She had a heartbeat. She radiated heat.

There was something even more unusual: This person's brain was bursting with energy, just like Garth's muscles. Was there a connection?

As I pondered the situation, the mannequin girl became nervous. But why? I hadn't said anything.

I noticed that Mom and Mrs. Vance were moving on, so I followed them. We were meeting back up with Zack and Mrs. Vance's daughters.

"I think we've got enough at least to start her off," Alyssa said. "She only wanted one pair of shoes at first, but, once we got her to try some different styles, she realized she wanted more."

"Alright, let's get you girls rung up."

We brought our different purchases to the register. "Good afternoon," said the cashier. "My name's Mike. Did you find everything okay?"

"We sure did," Alyssa said.

As Mike rang up first the Vances' items, then ours, I noticed Zack was breathing heavily. Her heart was beating like she'd just run a marathon. She kept her eyes fixed on one spot.

I followed her line of sight, and gasped. Zack was looking squarely... at Mike the cashier.

Zack had only been a girl for a few hours, and she was already crushing on a boy.
155332221222222112121111211211121.title: At the mall.

1553322212222221121211112112111211.content:
It was late afternoon when we returned home from shopping. Zack, taking on the name of Luana, was blushing brightly with a perplexed look on her face. At first, I did not know how I was able to see her expression. Then, I heard Dee speak. *Your senses are becoming more focused.* Calmly, she said. *You will eventually be able to see every contour of everything including a person's facial expressions only not their skin tone or hair color.*

I sighed, looking at Luana. "How are you holding up, sis?"

"I'm not sure." Wincing, Luana replied. "That boy who rang up our order... just looking at him made me feel weird. I had the strangest urge to spark a conversation with him."

"Oh, boy..." Sighing, mom said. "You haven't been a girl more than two days and you are already crushing on a guy."

"I'm what?!" Blushing more, Luana asked. "Ew!"

Mom and I giggled at her reaction as we got out of the car. "It's just another girl thing you'll have to get used to, sweetie." Kindly, mom said. "Why don't you go upstairs and put on one of your new outfits. Your father should be home soon."

Luana frowned, a sigh escaping her lips. "He's going to be mad, isn't he?"

"There was nothing you could have done to prevent your situation, Luana." Patiently, mom replied. "Just head upstairs and pick out an outfit to wear for the rest of the day. I'll deal with my husband when he gets home."

"I'll help you, sis." Urging her up the stairs, I said. "Maybe you can wear that skirt and blouse set you picked out on your own."

Minutes later, I came down the stairs, remembering my cane this time in case of any surprise visitors and found mom in the living room. Dad's car had just pulled into the garage. "Luana finished getting dressed." With a huff, I said. "She can be so indecisive..."

Mom giggled. "Try to remember that she is new to all of this." Bemused, she said. "Her exploring her femininity is like you exploring your new world of sight; new discoveries and surprises around every corner."

"Touche." Grinning, I said.

Just then, dad walked in, already removing his tie. He gave mom a quick peck on the cheek before moving to his favorite chair which had a full view of the entire room. "How was work dear?" Kindly, mom asked. "Any issues in our fair city?"

"It was just another day at the office, dear." Sighing, dad said. "You know... mundane."

I sensed dad's heart rate go up when he said that. Something did happen at work only he either does not want to talk about it or was ordered not to. Mom smiled then asked, "Can I get you a drink to sooth your nerves, honey?"

"No thanks." Smiling back, dad said. He then decided to change the subject. "So, did anything interesting happen here today?"

Mom let out a low sigh. "Well, I have good news and bad news." Wincing, she said. "The good news is, Zack is done looking at girlie sites on the internet."

Dad nodded, a look of satisfaction on his face. "Glad to hear it. What's the bad news?"

As if on cue, Luana walked down the stairs in full view of dad wearing a simple dress and mary-jane shoes. "Hi, daddy..." Nervously, she said.

Dad let out a heavy sigh as he leaned back in his seat. "On second thought, I think I'll have that drink you offered."
1553322212222221121211112112111211.title: Back at home, Dad meets the new Zack

15533222122222211212111121121112111.content:
Dad took a swallow of his drink. "Okay," he said, "who wants to tell me about this? Zack?"

"I was told about a way I could look out for Mel better," she began. "Only it worked in a way I didn't expect."

"Specifically," Mom added, "she's become a woman."

"This isn't easy to work with," Dad said. "I heard about all the hassles the Vances had, getting accommodations for their daughter when she came out as trans."

"There was nothing Luana could do, Steve," Mom said.

"Luana?"

Lu nodded. "It means 'gentle warrior maiden'."

"I'm just saying it's not going to be easy for you, dear. I wish it could be."

"How hard can it be?"

"Alyssa got her nose broken twice. They weren't trying to hug her."

"We also came by an interesting scrapbook," Mom said, changing the subject. "It concerns Mrs. D, and some peculiar things that happened around here in the '50s."

"Let's not look at that just yet," Dad said. "Right now, let's just have a family meal."

Whatever happened back then, it sure made a lot of people nervous.



Later that night, there was a knock on my door. "Sis?"

"C'mon in."

Lu came in. "I wanted to thank you again for everything you've done for me since this started."

"No problem."

"From now on, unless I say I want privacy, you are welcome in my room, anytime."

"Thanks. Same here."

She grinned sheepishly. "Think I could sleep in here with you?"

I smiled. "Sounds like something sisters would do."

Lu got into bed, then I did. We fell asleep with her arms around me.
15533222122222211212111121121112111.title: continue.

155332221222222112121111211211121111.content:
I fell asleep, wondering what had happened back in the fifties that made so many people, including dad, nervous. Dee seemed to have sensed this... I dreamed that I had fallen back in time to the early nineteen fifties in the middle of Waterfront city. There were trucks and equipment everywhere with a strange logo on them. It was a large C with the word 'hild' inside its inner curve. I knew from my world history that Hild was one of the Valkyries in Norse mythology, a personification of battle. Then it struck me. The trucks belonged to the government organization known as CHILD.

"It's for the safety of your children, ma'am." Sternly, a gruff voice said. "What is happening to them is not natural and could negatively effect them in the long run."

I turned to see man in bio hazard gear with no markings. He was pulling a small girl away from what appeared to be her mother while other children and teenagers were being escorted into the trucks with their hands zip-tied behind their backs. Some were being carried off, unconscious with bruises on their faces. "I don't car what government agency you claim to be from!" Hysterical, the woman protested. "You have no right to take my child!"

The man scoffed. "You have no rights; its an illusion."

The woman screamed as the man struck her with the butt of a gun and began to drag the girl away, crying and begging to be let go. It was a terrifying scene; I was about to yell out in protest myself, not that it would have done much. Only a familiar voice rang out. "Let her go!"

The man paused only to be struck in the face with a powerful kick. He fell off balance, letting the girl loose who ran to her mother. I turned, surprised, to see a tall and slender woman who appeared to have been in her early thirties. She wore all black with long flowing black hair and a doll like face. As she stepped into the light, I noticed that the features of her face were somehow distorted, as if everything but that was in focus. It had to have been Miss Shadow.

"Lady, you just made your last mistake." Drawing a gun, the man growled.

Miss Shadow took a defensive posture but then the man suddenly howled in pain, dropping the gun before falling to the pavement, unconscious. I looked about, surprised as did Miss Shadow only I spotted a strange distortion in the air in the form of a feminine figure near the unconscious man. It had to have been her gender swapping brother but I did not understand how she could not see her standing there. I turned to see her reaction only she was already off, working on freeing the others while a small group of teenagers joined the fray. Miss Shadow kicked then vanished as if she were never there then would appear a second later from another angle and throw a series of punches. She threw flash bombs, blinding her opponents as more men came to bring the situation under control...

I woke up with a start, drenched with sweat. The dream felt so real only I could not jump in to help, if I could have helped. *The organization, CHILD tried to kidnap half the city's children population.* Sadly, Dee explained. *I am sorry if my nightmare effected you. All of that happened a long time ago.*

"How was Miss Shadow able to vanish like I saw her do in the fight?" Curious, I asked.

*She was able to move very short distances at incredible speeds.* Calmly, Dee replied. *She only looked like she could vanish.*

"I saw Mrs D's brother." Still shaken, I said. "He, err, she seemed to have the ability to distort the light around him. I think that was why Mrs D never knew he was there."

A low sigh came from Dee. *If that is true, you may wish to help your new sister learn how to control it.*

I turned to Luana and sighed myself. She was becoming invisible then reappearing in her sleep. "Feel so weird..." Sleeping, she muttered.
155332221222222112121111211211121111.title: Bad dreams

1553322212222221121211112112111211111.content:
The next morning, I got out of bed first. Luana was slower to wake up, but she poked her head out from under the sheets. "Morning."

"Good morning, sis," I said. "How'd you sleep?"

"Had a weird dream. I was Zack, and I was hanging out with Boomer and the guys. Boomer was showing us these nude pictures he'd gotten. As I looked at them, I realized that they were of me, Luana. And I knew I hadn't posed for them knowingly. Suddenly, I became Luana, and the guys were all looking at me funny. I got nervous as they got closer, and then I disappeared. What do you think it meant?"

I thought it meant she was starting to identify more with the girls in the pictures, and starting to think more about Zack's choice of friends, but I wasn't going to tell her that. Instead, I said, "I don't know. My dreams tend to be just recaps of the day before." Which was true, before Dee came into my body.

I was half-dressed when Lu spoke again, her voice shaky this time. "M-Mel?"

"Huh?" I turned toward her.

She was sitting up in bed. Or, rather, half of her was. "Wh-where are my legs?"

I walked over to her, and put my hand where her legs should have been. They were there, alright, just... undetectable.

"Fascinating," I said, turning so she could see my face. "It's not just your eyes. I can't detect the body heat coming off your legs, and my echolocation isn't showing them to me, either. Once you get the hang of this, the bad guys won't know you're there until your fists start flying."

"Eli never mentioned this," she said, feeling her legs with her hands. "Do you think I can walk like this?"

"I don't know why not."

She stood up and walked, the rest of her body fading from view before she reached the door. "This is going to take some getting used to."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111.title: The next morning.

15533222122222211212111121121112111112.content:
I decided the time had come to look through the crude notebook Eli had given me to help Luana. Dad had allowed me to hold onto it; he seemed to not want anything to do with it. That and I suspect he did not expect me to be able to read it. Upon opening the book, I was surprised that I could detect every written word. Then I realized that the words were written with a heavy hand and every letter had left an imprint.

"I can feel every word." A smile forming, I whispered. "It's like reading a different type of Braille."

*Mrs D learned how to read hand written letters with her power; I can help you.* Kindly, Dee said. *I will give you that knowledge to save time.*

Gaining instant knowledge of anything was quite the rush. Still, I was grateful for Dee's help as it allowed me to read what Eli had written. I began my search with the ear-marked pages and quickly found a series of notes about invisibility. What Eli had written down in his notes made my heart race...

...The Amazon Women had several talents and powers that were worthy of legend. They had the ability to navigate through the jungle with hardly a sound at surprising speeds, leap to impressive heights, and swim almost like a fish. This gave them a clear advantage in any fight. Added to that, they possessed the ability to turn their physical power into energy and use it to not only bend light but absorb sound. It took me weeks to learn how to control this technique as it is focused on a feeling rather than a command. An Amazon warrior only uses this technique when she feels cornered or fears an ally is cornered. I had to train my own mind to focus on this feeling when I needed to be invisible. Unfortunately, it also made me a devastatingly effective fighter as a cornered animal or person rarely holds back...

"Luana's dream..." Thoughtful, I whispered. "She felt cornered when shown nude pictures of herself by her friend, Boomer." I sighed, feeling a headache coming on. "That is not going to be easy for her to master."

I decided to look through the other pages and found three subjects of interest. The problem was, I only had time to read one as mom was calling us down for breakfast and a talk.
15533222122222211212111121121112111112.title: Eli's notes.

155332221222222112121111211211121111123.content:
I found, I guess you can call it, a chapter marked 'People you can trust'. It was a number of short lists of names of people Eli seemed to trust. The first list came with a brief note from Eli...

Ever since that whatever it was crashed into the cliff walls at the edge of the city, back in 1852, every child born in our growing community developed special skills and abilities. When news of this spread, witch hunters and greedy business men came to investigate. We were the members of the first group to protect our city, including my sister, Ina and myself. We dedicated our immortal lives to stop those who would bring harm to us or to use us for their own selfish ends or means. We were the Soothsayers; those who fought against the so called witch hunters and power hungry business men who dared to enter our growing community. We were: Ina Mist, Eli Mist, Cy Keys, and Heather Wild. Unfortunately, Cy Keys fell into madness due not being able to be killed or die of old age. He became obsessed with learning all and obtaining all power, which corrupted him completely. He merged his first and last name, calling himself Sykes, the immortal thief. The rest of us tried to save him from himself but to no avail.

As the years passed, we continued our quest with other groups forming to protect the city including The Street Guardians, The Resistance Guild, and the somewhat famous Problem Child Gang. Heather joined the Problem Child Gang and fell in love with a powerhouse of a boy who called himself Tex the mighty. If you are ever in a bind, seek out the Soothsayers or the members of the groups below. They will help you; they you can trust...

I was shocked to find that I knew a lot of the people on the various short lists. Among them were my teacher from my old school, Sarah Barns, The technology tycoon and private investigator, Geo Tanner, and several others within the community!

"That is insane!" Stunned, I whispered. "All this time, I was surrounded by local legends!"

A knock on my door pulled me away from Eli's notes. I opened the door to find Luana standing nervously in the hall. She was blushing brightly, causing me concern. "What's wrong?" Softly, I demanded. "Did something happen?"

Luana nodded. "I- I can't get that boy we saw at the grocery store out of my head." Tearfully, she said. "I have to see him again, just to convince myself that there is no real feelings there."

I sighed, fighting the urge to giggle. "Oh, boy..." Softly, I said. "You got it bad, don't you, sis? Worse, you seriously aren't used to this from a girl's perspective..."

"What do you mean?" Wincing, Luana asked.

"Girls have a lot more to risk when it comes to a relationship than boys; especially when it becomes... more involved." Serious, you explained. "I think now is the perfect time for mom to give you The Talk."

Luana gulped hearing the capital letters in 'The Talk'.
155332221222222112121111211211121111123.title: People you can trust.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Luana and I went downstairs. Dad was at the precinct already, and Mom was getting our breakfast started. "Morning, girls," she said. "Boy, it sounds strange to say that after sixteen years. How'd you sleep?"

"We slept okay," I replied. Now was not the time to tell Mom about the dream Dee gave me, or Luana turning invisible. "But Luana wants to talk to you."

"Oh, really? What about?"

Lu opened her mouth, but, before she could speak, I said, "Boys."

"Melissa!" Lu said, slapping my shoulder.

Mom sat down. "What about them?"

"Remember the cashier from yesterday?"

"Vaguely."

"Well, I've been thinking about him lately, and Mel thinks I've got this crush on him, so I want to see him again, to show myself that I don't really feel like that."

"That could be risky, Lu," Mom said.

"How?"

"Boys act differently than girls about dating. As Zack, you may have heard a lot of stories about crazy ex-girlfriends. But girls don't talk about crazy ex-boyfriends that much."

"Why not?"

"Crazy ex-boyfriends tend to kill the girls who break up with them."

Lu's heart rate doubled. "K-kill?"

Mom nodded. "It's something you want to keep in mind, if you want to see this boy again."

I heard the blood flow away from Lu's face, and she went invisible.

"Lu?" Mom stood up. "Where are you, sweetie?"

"I-I'm right here Mom," Lu said.

"She's scared," I told Mom. "She'll come back when she calms down."

"When did this start?"

"Last night. I read about it in Eli's scrapbook."

"The three of us are going to have a long talk," Mom said. "And I'll definitely be looking at that scrapbook."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Mom gives Luana The Talk.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
I brought down the scrapbook and gave it to Mom. When she opened it, the first thing she said was, "This isn't in Braille. How did you read it?"

"Eli pressed down hard when he wrote," I explained. "I can feel the imprint of each letter. My symbiont taught me the letters."

She began reading for herself. "My God," she said. "This names everyone in the Problem Child Gang. Chief Jones, Geo Tanner,... Liv." She set the book down. "Liv was part of the Problem Child Gang. That explains how I was chosen for the Guard."

"'Guard'?"

"One day," she explained, "I found an anonymous note in my locker, telling me to go to this old abandoned warehouse at a certain time, and not to tell anyone about it. When I got there, the Problem Child Gang was there, and so were a bunch of other kids, including Steve. Tex the Mighty explained that the Problem Child Gang had to go to Europe on a mission, and they wanted to leave Waterfront City in our hands until they got back. Somebody likened it to the National Guard keeping watch over America while the Army went off to war, and so we called ourselves the Guard."

"How did they pick you?" Luana asked, coming back to visibility.

"Like the Problem Child Gang, we had our own unique abilities. It's been a while since I've done this, but let's see if I can still pull it off."

She sat up in her chair and closed her eyes. The next thing I knew, she had disappeared, leaving her clothes to fall into the chair.

"Mom?" Lu called, running over to the chair Mom had just vacated. "Where'd you go?"

"Mel, honey," Mom's voice called from upstairs, "could you come up to your room, and bring my clothes?"

Lu helped me gather Mom's clothes, and I brought them to my room, where Mom sat on my bed, wrapping herself in my sheets. "I'm a little out of practice," she explained. "I forgot that I have to concentrate on bringing my clothes with me."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Mom and the Problem Child Gang

choices: Getting ready for Luana's first date
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Once Mom got dressed, she said, "Let's hold off on that book, shall we, and help Luana with her cashier situation."

"Sounds good to me," I said. "We should find a good place to hide it, though." I hadn't forgotten how someone looking for something was desperate enough to cut up Mrs. D's cane.

"I've got just the place in mind," Mom said. Once we were back downstairs, Mom picked up the book and teleported again, remembering to bring her clothes with her this time. As soon as she returned, we got in the car and went to the mall.



As we walked toward the mall, Mom looked off to one side and said, "Looks like we got here just in time."

Lu looked, but I didn't have to. The cashier she was interested in was coming to the door, too. "Must be the start of his shift."

"Go ahead, Lu," Mom said, "we'll hang back."

Lu didn't need extra encouragement. She walked right up to him. "Hi," she said.

"Hi," he replied.

"I'm Luana."

"Mike. If it's okay, I've got to go in for work."

"Oh, sure. Do you think we could get together some other time and talk?"

"I'm free Saturday night."

"So am I."

"Okay. Where do you want us to meet?"

"How about my place? I can give you the address."

"Alright." Lu wrote on a slip of paper and handed it to him. "My number's there, too. Give me a call."

"I'll do that." He went inside.

Lu came back to us. "How'd it go?" Mom asked.

"Oh my God," Lu said, "I just made a date with a guy!"

"If it helps," I said, "he seemed nervous and excited, too. Maybe he's done some thinking about you."

"If he hasn't," Mom said, "he certainly will now. What do you want to do now?"

"Well," Lu replied, "I do have this date to get ready for. I don't know where to start."

"Since we're here," Mom said, "let's start with some outfits. We can also look at makeup, if you're interested."

Lu looked at her reflection in the mirror. "Is my hair alright?"

"If you'd like to do something with it, I'm sure the mall has a salon."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Back to the mall and Mike

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
As Mom helped Luana pick out some new outfits, she said, "I'm sure this must be a struggle for you."

"That's the weird part," Lu replied. "It doesn't feel like a struggle. It's like when I stopped watching Sesame Street. One week, I loved Elmo, and the next, I was into different stuff. The only difference is, with this, I remember when I would have freaked if someone said I was into guys."

On a whim, Lu decided to check out the makeup counter. The clerk put some stuff on her, then let her look in the mirror. "Wow," Lu said. "It's like it draws attention to my eyes."

"And you'll notice how we accentuate your cheekbones," the clerk said. "Makeup is supposed to minimize flaws and focus on assets."

Lu didn't need much encouragement to add makeup to her purchases. Turning to me, the clerk asked, "Can we do something for your other daughter, ma'am?"

"I don't wear much makeup," I replied, showing her my cane.

We took our purchases to a different cashier. We wanted Mike to be surprised when he saw Lu Saturday night.

We were about to check out the shoe store for shoes to match Lu's outfits when Mom's phone rang. Mom talked for a bit, then hung up. "We'll need to cut this shopping trip short, girls. Your father wants us at the hospital."

"What's wrong?" I asked. "Is Dad alright?"

"He's fine, girls," Mom replied. "But something's happened that brings back three names from the past: The Guard, CHILD, and Jack Stalker."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Getting ready for Luana's first date

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Upon arriving at the hospital, Mom, Lu, and I were accompanied by dad and two other police officers who urged us to stay close as they escorted us into an isolated wing of the critical care unit. "Why are we being taken here?" Nervous, Lu asked.

"Please save your questions for when we are alone." Firmly but kindly, dad said. "This is a very serious and delicate matter."

I winced at that but followed in silence until we all entered a hospital room where I saw Violet McBride, a friend who lived down the street from me, lying in a bed with a thirty some year old man in a separate bed on the other side of the room. Dad ordered the guards to wait out in the hall as the chief of police, Ted Jones entered with his wife and two children. I recognized them as Garth and Grace. Chief Jones quietly closed the door before turning to us.

"First, everything said in this room is to be treated as beyond top secret." Serious, chief Jones said. "Tell no one without first consulting myself or detective Steve Davenport. Second, none of you are required to go along with this but once you are in, there is no backing out."

Lu gulped. "What are you trying to say, chief Jones?" Nervous, she asked.

Chief Jones sighed. "The Problem Child Gang was a real group, as was The Guard." Darkly, he explained. "We fought against real dangerous criminals who wished to do our fair city and its citizens harm."

"For a time, there was no need for us or so we thought." Jumping in, dad said. "The time has come to pass the torch. Our old enemies have returned and a new Problem Child Gang has emerged to meet the challenge."

"However, this new group is young and inexperienced as we were in the beginning and will need help; not only from the original members but from a second team of heroes." Firmly but kindly, Mrs Jones said. "We need The Guard to rise up from the ashes with new members to be there when the new problem child gang is in need."

"It will be dangerous work; you will be placing your lives on the line." Serious, mom said.

"Only you have an advantage that we did not." Smiling slightly, chief Jones said. "You have the police department on your side."

"Why can't the police handle this threat?" Wincing, Lu asked.

"As I said, this is a serious and delicate matter." Frowning, chief Jones replied. "We can't afford to bring too much attention to this city. We need to drive these threat out without the world at large knowing about it."

"This city spawns people with unique and sometimes powerful abilities." Darkly, mom explained. "If word got out, everyone born in this city will become a target of government agencies around the globe as well as dangerous individuals who would use their powers to advance their greed for wealth and influence."

"These attacks are all pointing at eliminating the original members." Serious, chief Jones said. "So far, the attacks are all linked to one man, John Stalker."

"A few friends and I have formed the new Problem Child Gang." Serious, Garth said. "We can use an ally and we are hoping you are up to the challenge."

I turned to Lu who knotted her jaws before nodding. "We can't let those who blew up Violet's house get away with it." Softly, she said. "Mrs D and Mr Mist would make them pay."

I could not argue with that. Mrs D, or Miss Shadow, had protected the city for a long time with Mr Mist, also known as the unknown guardian. I somehow knew that when I was given the symbiont, I was also passed a torch to carry on her legacy. I looked at everyone in the room before stating, "Call me Miss Silhouette."

"Mirage." Pointing at herself, Lu said.

Mom sighed before pointing at herself. "Lady Fade."

"Lady Fade?" Giggling, I asked.

"Hey, I was a teenager!" Defending herself, mom said. "I couldn't think of anything else that fit."

"We'll have to get you a more updated 'username'." Smiling, I said.

"You will need more members." Serious, chief Jones said. "I know a few people but we will have to work quickly."

"When do we start?" Nervous, Violet asked.

"The moment you and your father are discharged from the hospital." Serious, Mrs McBride replied. She turned to me, noticing my surprised look. "Yes, my husband has returned. It's a long story, though."

"I was part of an experiment that went wrong." Serious, Violet's father explained. "Long story short I shrank to a microcosmic level. There I found a way to grow back to normal size."

"Will you be part of the Guard?" Curious, Lu asked.

Mr McBride shrugged. "If I am, it will be a base operation. I am better at logistics than fighting."

"Then its settled." Serious, chief Jones said. "I will contact you with names and addresses for you to gain more members. "Time is against us; we must be ready for when our enemies make their next move."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: The Guard returns.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
At home, Dad spent an hour on the phone. When he hung up for the last time, he said, "I've put the word out to the old Guard members. They'll be checking out their kids, and any with... special skills will be told to call or visit us."

"So you know," Mom said, "we'll be receiving a visitor Saturday night, one with no established connection to the Guard."

"Oh?"

Mom smiled. "Luana has a date. Which reminds me: Lu, how about the two of us talk in the den?"

Lu got up, then turned to me. "Shouldn't Mel come along?"

"Mel has already heard what I'm about to tell you."

After Mom closed the door to the den behind her and Lu, Dad asked, "Out of curiosity, how does The Talk differ between girls and boys?"

"Well, from my experience, Mom starts with how long she was in labor with each of us. Then, she talks about what can go wrong in pregnancy. Then, she works her way to STIs. By the time she starts talking about contraceptives, you're wondering why she bothers, since you're pretty sure you never want to sleep with anyone as long as you live. She's already cautioned Lu about guys who get too clingy. What did you tell Zack?"

Dad swallowed. "I, uh, just warned him about diseases and getting girls pregnant, then handed him a box of condoms. I guess it's easier for guys."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: retuning home.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
After supper, I went to my room. After a few minutes, Lu joined me. "How was The Talk?" I asked.

"Does the idea of sleeping with somebody ever come back?"

"Yes, it does. Actually, in my case, it didn't take too long. You might even start thinking of it Saturday night."

"I can't imagine it. Let's change the subject: How about this new Guard?"

"I'm glad you agreed to it, Lu. I wanted to step up as soon as I heard what happened, but I didn't want to volunteer you."

"You'll need to pick up some combat skills, sis. I'll start teaching you tomorrow."

*That won't be necessary,* Dee said. *Ina traveled in her younger days, between 1852 and 1952. She learned martial arts, and I can teach you. Are you ready?*

*If it's anything like learning to read English immediately,* I replied, *there's no such thing as ready. But, if you can teach me, I'm willing to learn.*

A moment later, my brain was filled with words and movements.

I must have seemed like I was passing out, because, when the flow stopped, Lu was holding me up. "Mel, are you alright?"

"Whoa."

"What happened?"

"I know kung fu," I replied in my best Keanu Reeves impression.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: That night

choices: Lu comes home from the date
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
The rest of the week went by with no word from other Guard members. Apparently, none of their children had developed powers as yet. The only development was that Violet had chosen the name Iota.

Luana thought she was ready for her date with Mike right up until Saturday night, when she got really nervous. "What if something goes wrong?" she asked. "What if I turn invisible on our date? What if I accidentally let on that I was a boy a week ago?"

"You're going to a movie, Lu," I reminded her. "You've been to movies before. Nothing's going to happen that would make Mike think there was anything different about you."

"If it helps," Mom added, "I'm sure Mike is every bit as nervous. Your father was a wreck on our first date."

The doorbell rang. "He's here!" shrieked Lu.

"Just relax," Mom said, then walked over and opened the door.

Mike was there, and he'd brought a surprise: an eight-year-old girl. "Hi, Mrs. Davenport," he said. "This is my little sister, Sandy. She'll be joining us." He didn't sound too happy about it.

The little girl held out her hand. "Hi. I prefer Sandra, but most people call me Sandy."

Mom shook her hand. "Delighted to meet you, Sandra. Come in, both of you."

Sandra smiled. Her smile made me wonder why anyone would call her anything that wouldn't make her smile.

Dad wrapped his arm around Mike's shoulders. "Why don't you ladies get acquainted," he said, "while Mike and I get to know each other?"

"Sure thing, Mr. Davenport," Mike said.

Dad chuckled. "My father was Mr. Davenport, Mike. Call me Detective." With that, he ushered Mike into the den and closed the door behind them.

"So, Sandra," Mom asked, "what brings you on your brother's date?"

"Mom said I might like the movie," Sandra replied. "But I think it's a subterfuge. We have a cousin in New Jersey, about Mike's age, who had to drop out of school to take care of a baby, and Mom and Dad don't want that to happen to Mike or Luana."

"You must be, what, eight or nine?" Mom asked.

"Eight."

"Looking forward to the third grade?"

"Actually, I'm starting high school."

While all this was going on, I could hear Dad talking to Mike in the den. *What is your father talking about?* Dee asked me.

*I think he's explaining the local rape laws,* I answered.

*Fascinating,* Dee said. *No such laws existed when my previous hosts were your age. I'm glad your culture has advanced so much.*

Once Dad was sure Mike knew what he would and wouldn't be allowed to do, he brought Mike back out to the living room, and Mike, Lu, and Sandra went to the movies.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Luana's first date

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
A few hours later, I heard Mike and Sandra bringing Lu home. Mike and Lu talked about what a nice time they had, and both agreed that they would like to see each other again.

When Lu came in, Mom asked, "How was it?"

"We had a good time," Lu said. "Mike says he'll call me."

I noticed that Lu's lips seemed hotter than usual, and realized that Mike had kissed her. She's had her first kiss from a boy, I thought to myself.



Later that night, as we each settled in for the night, I thought about what Lu had to be feeling. She might decide to pleasure herself as a girl for the first time, I thought. I'm not sure I want to pay attention to that.

*Would a diversion help?* Dee asked me.

Like what?

*How about a minor mystery, one your Mrs. D never solved?*

That sounds interesting, I thought.

Suddenly, it was like I was no longer sitting in my room. Instead, I perceived a doctor's office. "It'll take some time for the test results to be sure, Mrs. D," the doctor said. "But I'm pretty sure I can give you a clean bill of health. I wouldn't be surprised if you lived to be over 100."

I felt Mrs. D smile. Clearly, the doctor didn't know she was already over 150. "Did the tests pick up anything... unusual?"

"Like what?"

"You will laugh."

"I assure you, Mrs. D, I don't laugh at my patients."

"It's not a judgment, doctor. I laugh when I think about it, myself."

The doctor took a deep breath. "Alright, Mrs. D, what are you worried about?"

"Well, lately, I've been feeling... pregnant."

The doctor burst out laughing.

"I know," Mrs. D said, after the doctor settled down, "Mr. Dalrymple has been dead for some time, and I haven't had the curse for decades. Nevertheless, I find myself feeling symptoms I haven't felt since I was out to here with my youngest." She held her hands out past her flat belly. "I thought, perhaps, you might be able to explain why."

The doctor shook his head. "It's certainly a new one on me. I'll mail you the test results."

With that, I was back in my room. Did the tests say what it was?

*No. As far as anyone could tell, there was no reason for her to feel like she was pregnant.* Dee was quiet for a few moments. *If it had been a baby, it would be about your age today.*
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Lu comes home from the date

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
That night, as i pondered over the mystery Dee shared with me, I heard a strange ticking sound from outside the kitchen door. "What is that?" Curious, I thought.

A gasp came from Dee. *Someone is picking the lock!* Alarm in her voice, she replied.

At the same time, I heard a click followed by the door slowly opening downstairs. My heart began to race as I then heard the click of a bullet entering the chamber of a sidearm. Nervous, and afraid, I hurried out of my room, through the dark to get to mom and dad's bedroom. I managed to pound on the door twice before I saw a tall and muscular man standing at the top of the landing on the opposite end of the hall! He raised his sidearm, aiming directly for my heart.

"It's not personal kid." Darkly, the man said. "You're just a paycheck."

I gulped, taking a defensive position, but almost screamed as Luana's bedroom door almost literally exploded open and the dark figure was thrown off his feet into the wall over the stairs, badly cracking it. "Surprise, mother fucker!" Luana's voice rang out.

The man fell down the stairs and I felt another breeze as Luana went after the intruder. Fortunately, mom and dad ran from their room and dad caught Luana's hand despite the incredible speed she was moving at.

"How...?" Stunned, I asked.

"What's happening?" Serious, dad demanded.

"Intruder!" pointing to the stairs, I screamed. "he tried to kill me bu Lu pounded him to the wall."

That's when dad surprised me. He turned to the stairs to see the would be assassin coming back for more. Steve grunted. "You have till I flip a coin to run." Cryptically, he said. "Your choice, robot." With that said, Dad pulled a coin from his pocket and flipped it into the air.

*Get back... NOW* Alarmed, Dee warned.

I grabbed mom's hand and and Luana's hand, who had become visible, jumped back just as the coin came down. Dad hit the coin with his thumb with a spark of electricity. Instantly after, the coin was launched with such speed, a sonic boom shook the house! I screamed as the sound was intense to my new sense of hearing and found them ringing for a few seconds before my hearing returned.

"What was that?" Shaken, I asked.

I looked up and gasped again seeing what was left of a robot person and a smoking round hole the size of my door through the walls of two rooms to the outside. Dad sighed and turned me with a rueful smile. "You are not the only one Mrs D had 'kissed', Melisa."

My eyes went wide. "The feeling of pregnancy..." Shocked, I thought. "It wasn't Mrs D who was pregnant, it was Dee!"

You were about to ask Dee about it when dad said, "I sure you all have questions."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Many hath Mrs D kissed.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
*No, you were not the only person Mrs D had passed a symbiont to.* Softly, Dee explained. *She passed one of my children to your father when he was your age.*

"Could she have felt the your pregnancy during these times?" Curious, you thought. "That would explain a lot, even if it was just once."

*The symptoms went away shortly after she gave a symbiont to your mother.* Sadly, Dee said. *She also gave her something else... something precious.*

My eyes went wide, my body shivering as what Dee was saying hit me. I could hear my heart beginning to race as tears began to fall. "She gave her me..."

"The entire neighborhood had to have heard that boom." shaking her head, mom said. "Honestly, Tinker. Don't you think that was a bit overkill?""

"Hey, I'm out of practice, Boomer." Defensively, dad countered. "Right now, we need an excuse for the boom and damage."

"Tinker... Boomer?" Shaken, Luana asked.

"A discussion that will have to wait, dear." Gently, mom said. "Excuse us a moment."

I watched with my jaw dropped as dad moved in a blur, piecing together what looked like a cylinder shaped drone which, once done, mom plowed into the floorboards with one blow of her hand! "Perfect angle." Satisfied, she said. "Now for what's left of that assassin robot."

Within seconds, the scene had been set and dad walked over to Lu while mom walked over to me. Both Lu and I were already trembling from our parents' display of power so very little acting was necessary when neighbors came rushing over to see the damage. They saw the 'crashed drone' and the 'robot pilot' shaking their heads muttering about crazy government projects. The police then arrived with Chief Jones looking at the damage with a serious expression.

"It looks like you are going to need to relocate for a while." Calmly, he said. "Do you have any relatives you can bunk with?" He noticed me shaking and crying, holding mom like a small terrified child. "Will your children be okay?"

"The sound terrified my daughters." Honestly, dad said. "Its not every day a super sonic drone crashes into your house. He sighed, comforting Luana. "We'll make arrangements to stay with some relatives for now."

As Chief Jones and dad talked, I was in mourning all over again. Mrs D was my mentor, she had given me so much but now I learn that she was my mother and had passed me to who I had called mom all my life for whatever reason.

"I need to know what happened." Crying, you thought.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Tinker in action.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"I'm going to help Melissa pack." Calmly, mom said. "The crew should have our house back to normal in a few weeks."

Dad nodded. "I'll help Luana." serious, he said.

Mom then took your hand and led you into your room which was fortunately untouched by the blast dad had created with a mere quarter. "Are you really my birth mother?" Crying, I asked. "Dee told me..."

Mom sighed, a pained look on her face. "Miss Shadow had saved a lot of lives in her long career, Melissa." Sadly, she said. "She saved Tex, Tinker, Me... and you before you were even born."

Again, my yes went wide. "Before I was born?"

"Someone poisoned me when I was pregnant with you, trying to kill me and you." Tearfully, mom explained. "As a direct descendant to the high priestess who brought Lole the twice named into this world, Miss Shadow performed a ritual that allowed her to carry you almost to term." She wiped a number of tears from her eyes. "With her carrying you, I was able to fight off the poison without any risk coming to you."

My lips quivered. "What happened?"

Mom began to cry. "When she transferred you back into my womb to deliver you, she gave you a gift... her immortality." Sobbing, she said. "She knew she would not live much longer after that and thus became your Godmother, your mentor."

"I- I'm immortal?" Stunned, I asked. Then a horrifying thought came to me. "Why did she do that?!"

"I do not know, sweetie." Sadly, mom said. "I do know this..." She sighed, dabbing at her tears. "Mrs D... Miss Shadow and Eli, the invisible shield were legends. They chose to pass the torch... to their children."

I was crying freely at this point. "I will not let them down." Serious, I vowed. "I will protect this city."

"We all will." Crying, mom said.

We shared a tearful embrace, remembering the legends who had save our lives and the lives of our city... Miss Shadow and The Invisible Shield!

Inside Luana's bedroom, she was crying as well with dad who had told him a similar story of courage on Eli's part. "Eli took all the punishment despite Mrs D's immortality." Tearfully, he said. "He and she were living tanks with everything including one hell of a gun!" A hint of pride flashed on his face. "He taught me how to do it himself."

"I have that coin cannon too?!" Stunned, Luana asked.

Dad gave a hick-up type laugh. "Is that what you call it?" Bemused, he asked. He wiped at his tears. "Eli gave you his power, his legacy with his dying breath. Now you are the invisible shield to your sister, Melissa."

Luana showed a spark of determination. "I have always protected Melissa and I am not about to stop." Tears falling, she said. "I am her body guard brother... err sister."

Dad and Luana shared a tearful hug. "Your mother and I will always protect you both." Serious, dad said. "We are the legends now."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: When legends pass the torch.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Once we were packed, Dad called a family meeting.

"We've told your aunt and uncle about Luana," he said. "However, as far as they know, Melissa is the same as when we last saw each other, so you'll need to keep your powers a secret. I know you could get around their house better than they could, but you should use your cane for the sake of appearances, at least for the first few weeks."

"Makes sense," I replied. "Mrs. D never let on to me that she was anything more than an old blind woman. I'm still wrapping my head around who she was."

"It's not completely new territory," Luana said. "The Joneses are right next door, so we can talk to them when we need to let our hair down."

"But we shouldn't do that too often," Mom cautioned. "Melissa never went to the same school as Garth before, so she shouldn't know him too well. And Grace and Zack were hardly friends, given Zack's... particular taste in reading material. Your cousins would certainly get curious if anything unusual happens, and they might try to follow you to figure out what's up."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Family meeting.

choices: Garth and Grace pay a visit.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Although dad's brother, Stan and his wife, Fawn knew about the problem child gang, they were never members. As dad explained it, he kept his brother in the dark as a way to protect him. Fawn had the power to swoon any man, make him do literally anything for her affections. This terrified her so she never answered the call though it was offered.

We were greeted with open arms upon arriving and Fawn gave me a warm hug before whispering in my ear. "I know your mother told you about me." Darkly, she said. "All I will say is Stan is immune to my power which is why I fell in love with him."

I nodded. "May I assume she told you about me?" Whispering, I asked.

Fawn nodded. "Only your mother, Stan and now you know of my power, no one else." Whispering carefully, she said. "So, humor your father and make believe you are just a normal blind teenage girl."

Fawn and I shared a smile before Fawn then turned to Luana. "I see you had an encounter with the feminine kind." Teasing, she said. "How are you coping with being a girl with a boy's mind?"

"Barely." Wincing, Luana replied. "But... I'm getting better."

Fawn giggled, a bemused look on her face. "You are not the first boy born in this city to experience a gender change." Smiling, she said. "I have no doubt you have already learned a great deal about what we girls go through."

"Boys go through their fair share of troubles too." Grinning, dad remarked.

"Um... I need to change." Blushing, Luana said.

Fawn turned to Luana and sighed. "I'll show you to the bathroom." Kindly, she said. "How long has this been going on?"

"Two days... I think." Sighing, Luana replied. "It seems like its lasting forever."

Fawn giggled. "The first one always does."

The following morning...
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Going to stay with relatives

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
