The night was uneventful. The biggest thing was getting settled in Dana's room. Dana had only come out as gender fluid a few weeks ago, and we were all getting used to xer new identity and pronouns. But it was better than bunking with Kyle, who was twelve, and had Aunt Fawn suspecting that he had discovered the same websites that Zack had been interested in before becoming Luana.

After breakfast, we were all settled in the living room. Uncle Stan was the fire chief, and he was telling us stories about some of the cases he had worked on, when there was a knock on the front door. "I'll get it," Mom said.

When Mom opened the door, I heard a voice I hadn't expected to hear. I guess I figured he lived closer to our house than here. "Hey, Mrs. Davenport. I thought that looked like your car in the driveway."

Mom swallowed, something she always did before she spoke to him. "Good morning, Scooter."

Apparently not one for standing on ceremony, Scooter let himself in, followed by his three buddies. "Didn't expect to see you guys here. Where's Zack? Haven't seen him in a while."

Mom always tried to be nice to people, but I could hear her heartbeat and breathing, and I could perceive her body temperature. I could tell that she was getting upset. "Actually, Scooter,... "

Luana stood up. "I'm right here, Scoot."

I'm getting pretty good at reading people's facial expressions with my echolocation, but I didn't have to be with Scooter and his friends, because they all had the same expression. "Z-Zack? Y-you're - "

"I'm a girl, now," she said. "The name's Luana. I suppose it's a good thing you dropped by, so I can tell you that I'm looking for different friends."

"What?"

"I had a dream a few nights ago, after I became a girl, that made me see things in a different light. I'm not interested in you guys anymore. You can let yourselves out, just like you let yourselves in."

One of the bigger guys stepped between Luana and Scooter. "You think you can push us around? I don't care who you were, no dumb chick - "

Luana stood her ground. "My day began with me lying in a pool of my own blood. How do you want your day to end?"

I won't tell you what all I smelled coming from those guys, but, suffice it to say, the fight went right out of them. They filed out the door.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Luana meets her old friends.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Mom sighed in relief. "Well played, Luana." Smiling, she said. "I don't think they will be bothering you anymore."

Luana sighed herself but with a rueful look on her face. "What did I ever see in them in the first place?" Shaking her head, she muttered.

"They had similar interests as you when you were a boy." Calmly, I replied. "Becoming a girl changed more than just your outlook on life, it changed how people see you and how you see them."

I could tell Luana was feeling uncomfortable. Like me, she had been plunged into a whole new world and she was still uncertain of herself. "Don't worry, sis." Smiling, I said. "We'll look out for each other."

I could see the warmth of Luana blushing. "Thanks, sis."

Another knock came to the door and uncle Stan answered before smiling. "Hey, Grace." Smiling, he said. "What brings you here this early?"

"I heard about the drone crash at Mrs Davenport's house." Serious, Grace replied. "I just wanted to make sure everyone was alright and if they needed anything."

"We're fine, Grace." Smiling, mom said. "We appreciate your concern."

Grace nodded then walked back to the door. As she did, I noticed that there was an increase of warmth in her left shoulder. It was small and round... "She's been shot!" Stunned, I thought. "Someone shot her!" Then Luana, seeing the same thing spoke up. "Grace... why is your shoulder bleeding?"

Grace froze, not answering. Only before she could respond, uncle Stan urged her to sit down and ordered her to take off her shirt. Blushing, she did so. Sure enough, Grace had been shot in the shoulder, right in the shoulder joint. "Who did this to you?!" Firmly, Uncle Stan demanded. "What happened?!"

"Our house was invaded last night." Almost timidly, Grace replied. "I thought I could take him but he got me right in the shoulder joint." She teared up. "If it weren't dad and Garth coming to my rescue..."

I could feel Stan's heartbeat increasing and his body heat rising, he was not in the least impressed with her. "You could have been shot in the heart, young lady." Sternly, he said. "Was anyone else hurt?"

"Dad and Garth went after the intruder and kicked his ass to the curb." Tearfully, Grace replied. "He's in jail right now."

Stan examined the wound and sighed. "You were very lucky." Serious, he said. "The bullet bounced off the bone and exited out." He looked Grace in the eye. "You are going to be sore for a while so take it easy."

Stan then began to wrap Grace's wound while I turned to Luana, concerned. "Our house was not the only one invaded. I began to wonder if there was a pattern.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: A pattern forming.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"You're sure nobody else was hurt?" Mom asked.

"Just me," Grace replied. "Hope wanted to check it out, too, but I said no."

"Who's Hope?"

"Our new sister. It's kind of a long story."

"Telling her to remain home was the only smart decision you made in this case," Uncle Stan said.

"You're sure Grace will be okay, Uncle Stan?" Luana asked.

"She ought to be," he replied, "given enough rest. And assuming she doesn't forget she isn't bulletproof again."

Grace took a careful look at Luana. "Do I know you?"

"My name's Luana. I used to be Zack."

Grace's eyes widened. "Zack? As in Zack Davenport? One of the five reasons I haven't opened my curtains since puberty?"

Luana hung her head. "That sounds familiar. I've been going through some changes lately. You might have seen Scooter and the boys leaving before you got here. I kicked them to the curb."

"Good."

"I'm still learning about being a girl. I could use somebody to show me the way."

"It's not that hard, Luana." Then Grace smiled. "Maybe I can give you a couple of pointers."

Luana smiled back. "I'd like that."

I smiled, too. My new big sister had just made her first friend.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Luana makes new friends.

choices: Luana and I go to school.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Just then, a slender but well-toned teenage girl with long brown hair and green eyes hurried up to the door in blue jeans and a light blouse. She bowed respectively to uncle Stan and aunt Fawn. "I am Hope Jones." Introducing herself, she said. "It is an honor to meet you." She then turned to Grace. "Sis, mom is so upset with you! Why didn't you tell her you got shot?!"

"You didn't tell your parents?" Surprised, uncle Stan demanded.

Grace blushed and uncle Stan sighed, tapping one foot. "I didn't want them to worry." Defensively, Grace said. "It was just a flesh wound..."

"It's attempted murder, young lady!" Showing anger, uncle Stan snapped. "Never do that again, am I clear?!"

Grace allowed her head to fall. "Yes, sir."

Uncle Stan shook his head as Grace began to sob. "There, there." Giving her a hug, he said. "I will walk you both back home and have a talk with your father."

As they left, I turned to mom, worried. "What do you think is going to happen to her?"

Almost as soon as they stopped talking, I heard Mom and Dad. "Think we're ready for another baby?"

"We never asked that before," Mom replied. "The kids came when they came, and we were glad to have them."

"You're right," Dad said. "We'll be glad for this one, too. Hope the girls don't mind babysitting too much."

"I'm sure we'll hear all about how they feel in a couple of months, when we tell them."

I had to sit in the computer chair. Both of our parents were pregnant, at the same time?
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: the surprises continue.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Luckily, just when I needed something to take my mind off the two pregnancies, Dana stepped into the room. "What are you two up to?"

"I decided to get off the computer for a while," Kyra said. "I need to get to know my symbiont."

"Well," Dana said, "I have no clue what a symbiont is, but I never thought anything could pry you away from the keyboard, Kyle."

"It's Kyra, now," she replied.

"Oh. Pardon me."

"Dana," I said, "let's the two of us go into your room. There's something I need to talk to you about."

When we were alone, I told Dana what Dee had told me. "You can bring your powers under control," I told her, "but you'll continue to gain auras until you do."

"And you think this has something to do with me being gender fluid?"

"Even if it doesn't, you can't keep pulling pieces off of people."

"That's for sure. I guess there's a piece of you in here, huh?"Luana

"Probably."

"Wonder what that's going to be like?"

"Well, you can see, so maybe your eyesight will be stronger, able to see details of for distances that others can't. At any rate, you'll be able to find your way around in the dark."

"Any other details that will let everyone know whose powers I'm cribbing?"

"Hard to say. I'm bisexual, if that helps."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Talking to Dana

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Kyra fell silent for a moment then sighed. "Rina told me that Dana as the ability to 'borrow' the power of someone else by draining some of their aura." Softly, she said. "Only what she drains becomes a part of her as a separate aura."

"I wonder what that means." Worried, I said.

Allow me to explain, dear. Kindly, Rina said.

Dana and I turned, surprised to find Kyra a sort of trance and Rina was talking through her. "I didn't know symbionts can do that." Whispering, I said.

"It takes much concentration but it saves time." Softly, Rina replied. Kyra turned to Dana. "You have what is called 'Aura Link' which basically allows you to borrow a person's powers."

"Why do I have to take a piece of someone's aura?" Wincing, Dana asked.

"By taking a piece of a person's aura you add him or her to you 'contacts list' so to speak." Kindly, Rina explained. "This way, you can borrow that power again and again but at a great price."

"I feel more and more like that person." Uncomfortable, Dana said.

Rina shook her head. "No, you lose who you are." Darkly, she replied. "The piece of aura you took will grow each time you borrow his or her powers. Borrow from too many people too many times and you will end up with a multiple personality complex... many auras, remember?

Dana gulped. "Is there any way to control this so that doesn't happen?"

Kyra smiled kindly. "Do not allow your gift to become a curse." Softly, she replied. "Use it only when needed until you are able to find your own... (giggle) number among your many contacts."

With that, Rina fell silent and Kyra shook her head, looking concerned. "I hope she doesn't make a habit of that, it felt really weird."

"Did she have to use a phone for a reference tool?" Wincing, Dana asked. "I'll never look at my cellphone the same again."

I winced as well though I did find the humor in it. Dana is never anywhere without her phone. Suddenly, it hit me. "That wasn't a joke, it was a clue!" Serious, I blurted out. "Unlock your phone and give it to me."

Taken back, Dana gave me her phone. "How can you see the icons?"

"The icons give off heat in the shape they are in including the lettering." Quickly, I said. "I'll just be a moment."

You moved to Dana's contacts list and smiled. "It's just as I suspected. All of the powers I had seen you use belong to those on your contact list. You took a piece of their aura while talking to them on the phone."

"So the phone is the tool?" Surprised, Dana asked.

"One of them at least." Shrugging, I said. "I'd lay off the phone chatter for a while until we can figure this out."

Dana nodded. "Mom said I needed a break from it anyway."

Later on, I decided to...
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: A gift or a curse.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
After that experience, Kyra lay down on Dana's bed. Almost as soon as her head touched the pillow, I could hear her gentle snoring. "When Rina said that took a lot of energy," I said, "she wasn't kidding."

*******************************


After Kyra woke up, I said, "Let's get a better handle on your powers, Kyra. Now that you know where they come from, what can you do?"

"I think I'm still a know-it-all," she answered. "But I no longer need to look things up. I can read people like a book. Want an example?"

"Knock yourself out," Dana said.

Kyra looked straight at me. "You used to think that your relationship with Mrs. D was strictly mentor - protege. But there's more to it, isn't there? You were closer, weren't you?"

I nodded. "A lot closer."

"Huh?"

"Mrs. D carried me in her womb for a few months," I explained. "I haven't had the chance to talk about this with Mom yet."

"But there's more to Mrs. D's story, something I don't know if she knew."

I leaned forward. "Tell me."

"You know Hope from next door?"

"I remember her."

"She wasn't born the way you or I were. She was grown in an artificial womb, in the C.H.I.L.D. lab outside of town."

"I've heard of C.H.I.L.D.," Dana said. "They're supposed to be bad news."

"Very bad," Kyra confirmed. "They've clashed with the Problem Child Gang and the Guard. They created Hope so they could use her to destroy their old enemies. And, just to give the dagger a little twist, they used the DNA of two of those enemies to make her."

Dana gulped. "Which two?" she asked, although I thought I could guess.

"They harvested Chief Jones's sperm, and an egg from Mrs. D."

"It's... it's like we're sisters."

Kyra nodded. "You're Mrs. D's last two children."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: help Kyra explore her powers.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"Well," Dana said, "this is fun, but I'd really like to contact somebody. And, since my phone is feeding me people's souls, I guess that means I need some face time."

"Who do you want to talk to?" I asked.

"Let's start with Faith. She lives next door, on the other side from the Joneses."

"Sounds good. Let's go say hi."

No sooner had we stepped out the door, than a girl carrying a shopping bag approached. "Hi, Dana. How've you been?"

"Doing alright, Faith. This is my cousin, Melissa. We were just on our way to see you."

"Come on in. I've got some big news to share with you."

Faith let us inside, then led us to her room. She had several easels set up in her room, and I wished I could be able to see what she had painted. One wall was almost bare, except for a cross hanging in the middle.

Faith guided me next to her bed and invited me to sit. Then she began emptying the bag. She had bought several more crosses.

Dana was clearly surprised. "Faith, I know you've always been religious, but when did you become wall-full-of-crosses religious?"

"I guess it comes with the territory."

"What territory?"

"It's what I wanted to tell you," she said with a smile. "I'm pregnant with God's baby."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Contacting a friend

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Dana was stunned. "What makes you think you're pregnant with God's baby?"

"I've taken three different tests," Faith replied. "I'm definitely pregnant. And, since I'm a virgin, that doesn't leave many possible fathers. Except for God, of course."

Dee, I thought, how much of this is true?

*Faith is with child,* Dee told me. *But her child is not divine. Many years ago, when Ina was your age, several girls became pregnant under circumstances they could not explain. It was their new symbionts. I believe that is what has happened here.*

I swallowed. I would need to choose my words carefully. "Faith," I said, "I'm not very religious ," - which was an understatement, but this was neither the time nor the place for that discussion - "but I know that God told Mary what He wanted, and gave her the opportunity to decide what she wanted. Did that happen for you?"

"Nooooo," she answered. "But what other explanation is there?"

"It's called a symbiont, and a lot of us have them." I told her what Dee had told me, holding her hands as I went.

When I finished telling her what Dee had said, I said, "Your baby can be a gift, as much as a baby is a gift for any mother who wants it." A gentle pull was all I needed to take the cross out of her hands. "But it's notthis big of a gift."

Faith was stunned. "I... I thought I was going to bring something amazing into the world. I thought I could be somebody."

"You still can," Dana said. "I've seen your artwork. You have talent. When you're ready to show the world what you can do, they'll be amazed."

Faith hugged us. "At least I found this out before I told my folks about the baby."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Faith's baby

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"Tell me more about your art," I said to Faith. "What's your technique?"

"It's hard to describe," she replied. "Once I decide what to paint, I tend to zone out while I'm painting. Hours can go by without me noticing."

"It pays off, though," Dana said. "Look at this landscape. It looks better than a photo."

"I know," Faith replied, reaching toward the canvas. "I painted it, and, sometimes, I almost think I could... " As she spoke, her fingertips disappeared into the canvas.

Her eyes widened. She pulled her hand back, and her fingertips reappeared. She reached for the canvas again, and her whole hand disappeared. Her eyes almost popped out of her head. Then she began climbing into the canvas.

*Amazing,* Dee said. *I've never experienced anything like this.*

"Faith," Dana said, "you're inside the painting!"

"I know, right?" Her voice sounded like she was there, but not there, as if she were on a radio or TV. "It's like something out of Mary Poppins."

"I was thinking Harry Potter."

"I wouldn't know. Mom and Dad say those books are full of devil worshippers."

Faith climbed back out. It was incredible. To me, the canvas was solid, but Faith could climb in and out like a window. "What's it like in there?" Dana asked.

"It's like being there," Faith said. "It's the most amazing thing I ever... " She looked like something had just occurred to her.

"Faith?"

She sat down on the bed. "I thought it was a dream. I thought ithad to be a dream."

"What?"

"Do you remember Jeremy Sharpe?"

"Sure, he's the boy who died last year, you had a crush on him. Didn't you do a life-size portrait of him?" Now it was Dana's turn to get wide-eyed. "You don't mean - "

"I was up late painting it. I had just finished it when I felt myself falling. But, instead of hitting the canvas, I just kept falling, until I felt someone catch me. I opened my eyes and saw Jeremy. I lost control of myself and kissed him. When I stopped kissing him, I started taking off my clothes. He did the same, and we... we made love.

"I came back out of the portrait and went to bed. When I woke up, I figured I just had a weird dream. I mean, people can't go into paintings, and painted people can't have... have sex, right? So I gave the Sharpes the portrait and didn't give it another thought." She put her hands over her uterus.

"Faith, are you saying you're pregnant by a dead boy?"

Faith shook her head. "I'm pregnant by a painting of a dead boy."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Faith's amazing paintings

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"I'd better call Kyra." After a thought, I said. "Maybe Rina has an explanation to this."

"Kyra?" Curious, Faith asked.

I winced. "He was once my cousin Kyle." Softly, I said. "Long story short, not too many boys in our bloodline keep their Y chromosome."

"How can Kyra help?" Wincing, Faith asked.

"She has a strange form of clairvoyance." Quickly, I said. Kyra answered on the third ring and I placed the call on speakerphone. "Hey, Kyra, you remember Faith, right?"

"Yes..."

"Can you ask Rina about her abilities? She seemed to have become pregnant with a painting of a dead boy, Jeremy Sharpe."

"That's creepy. I'll ask though."

I waited for nearly a full minute before Kyra answered again. "You still there?"

"Yes, what did Rina say?"

"Rina told me that Faith's paintings are windows to literally anywhere and any time." Serious, Kyra replied. "She had made the painting of Jeremy Sharpe as she remembered him when he was alive."

Dana gasped. "So when Faith fell through the painting, she actually fell into the past into Jeremy's arms when he was still alive!"

"That's how Rina explained it." Yawning, Kyra said. "Now, please... I'm really tired."

"Thanks for your help, Kyra." Kindly, I said. "Sleep well."

I then ended the call and turned to Faith. "Kyra's ability really takes a lot out of her." Softly, I explained. "Your power likely does the same."

"What do you mean?" Worried, Faith asked.

"Faith, you are pale." Serious, I said. "I suggest you don't jump into too many paintings for too long until you can better learn to control your powers."

Faith reluctantly nodded. "I'll try." Rubbing one arm, she said. "Still, if I fell into the past as this Rina said..."

"I wouldn't risk it, Faith." Serious, Dana warned. "Meddling with time is never a good idea, you never know what might happen."

Faith gently rubbed her tummy. "I already proved good things can come of it, though not deliberately." Dreamily, she said.

"Still not a good idea." Serious, I warned. "You might have just gotten lucky this time." You sighed. "Please promise me you won't try to change the past by jumping though one of your paintings."

Faith pouted, tearing up then in a tiny voice, she said, "I promise..."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Asking the 'know it all'.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
I wasn't so sure that Faith wouldn't try meddling with time. As she drifted off to sleep, I contacted Dee. Can you put me in contact with Faith's symbiont?

A few minutes later, I heard a voice in my head. *Yes?*

My name's Melissa Davenport. I need you to help me convince Faith not to try changing the past.

*What's wrong with that?*

There's no telling what she might end up doing, even accidentally. I tried to think of something that might give Faith pause. She might hurt the baby. Or she might even undo her pregnancy.

*I'll try,* the symbiont said.

I sighed and stood up. Suddenly, my head swam, and my legs questioned the rightness of carrying my weight.

Dana caught me before I fell. "Are you okay, Melissa? Do you need a nap, too?"

"I don't think so," I replied. "I think a chair is all I need for now."

"Okay, I'll help you to the kitchen." It might have been a coincidence, but, as we left the room, I heard Faith make plaintive noises in her sleep.

Dana guided me to a chair. "I'm glad you're here, Melissa," xe said. "It might help keep the Richardsons at least somewhat civil."

"What do you mean?"

"You know how the Spencers are richer than God? Well, the Richardsons are more religious than God, and they're not huge fans of the neighborhood gender fluid teenager."

"That reminds me," I said with a grin, "am I wearing my bisexual pride flag T-shirt and my 'Born Again Atheist' button?"

"You joke, but nothing you've got on advertises you as any of that. Lavender hair in this style says, at the very least, that I'm not the preacher's kid."

We talked for a few more minutes when we were joined by the Richardsons. "Hello, Dana," Mr. Richardson said, his friendly words belied by his contemptuous tone. He was tall and thin, with thick glasses and a combover that might fool somebody, but not me. "What brings you here?"

"Hello, Mr. Richardson. I was just hanging out with Faith. This is my cousin, Melissa."

"How do you do, sir?" I asked , holding my hand straight in front of me.

At length, Mr. Richardson figured out what I was doing and shook my hand. "A pleasure to meet you, Melissa. Have you accepted Jesus?"

"Yes, sir," I lied. I figured any other answer would lead to efforts to save me.

"Where is Faith?" Mrs. Richardson asked.

"Taking a nap."

"She's doing that an awful lot lately," Mrs . Richardson said. "She's been off her feed lately, and, with her skipping meals when she's painting, I'm afraid it'll do something to her health. Perhaps I'd better take her to the doctor?"

Sounds like Faith is going to have to have that talk with her folks, I thought. "Well," I said, getting up, "I suppose we'd better be going."

"Goodbye, Melissa," they said warmly. "Dana," they added, with less warmth.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: I am not convinced.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"Charming couple," I said when we were outside. "I didn't know it was possible to make someone's name sound like an insult."

"Mrs. Richardson is a little better," Dana said. "She can get her husband calmed down when he gets really bad."

Aunt Fawn was waiting for us at the door, with Luana and a bleary-eyed Kyra next to her. "Welcome back, you two. Dana, there's a little matter I need to discuss with Melissa."

"What is it, Aunt Fawn?"

"It's not a punishment, dear, just a warning." She pointed down the street. "Focus your attention on that man over there."

"The one mowing his lawn?"

"That's him. His name's JT. Avoid him, if at all possible."

"Why?"

"He has the ability to persuade anyone to do whatever he wants. And, often, what he wants is the bodies of young girls."

"Can't anybody stop him?" Kyra asked.

"It's been tried, sweetie. But, with his powers, even if he can't talk the police into letting him go, he can always talk the jury into an acquittal. The only good news is, if you know what he's capable of, you can resist him. Which is why I'm warning you about him."

I swallowed. "Thanks for the advice, Aunt Fawn."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: At home

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
The next morning, Aunt Fawn asked me, "What's your plan for today?"

"I'd like to see Faith again," I replied. "I want to make sure she's not doing something I think she shouldn't. Plus, I don't know if she's heard about J.T."

"Maybe you could use some help?" Luana suggested.

"The more, the merrier."

"Sounds like a plan," said Kyra.

So the four of us went next door to the Richardsons' house.

Mrs. Richardson was there to greet us. "Faith is busy at the moment," she said. "She gets this way when she paints."

I didn't like the sound of that. "Let's drop in and see how she's doing."

We opened her bedroom door, and it was just as I feared. Faith wasn't in her room. The only clues were a new painting and a newspaper.

Dana picked up the paper. "This is the story about the accident that killed Jeremy."

Kyra looked at the painting. "And this is where it happened."

I sighed. "She's trying to change the past. She wants to save Jeremy."

"But that can't work," Kyra said. "Doesn't she know that would cause a time paradox?"

"Kyra," Dana said, "pretend that you're the only person in the room who knows what a time paradox is."

Kyra sighed. "If she changed the past, she'd do away with the reason for her to go back in time, so she wouldn't, so things would happen the way they did before."

About the time Kyra stopped explaining time travel, Faith climbed out of the painting. Whatever she had seen had shaken her to the core. Mrs. Richardson wrapped a blanket around her and led her to the bed.

"Faith, are you alright?" Kyra asked.

"Leave her be for now," Mrs. Richardson said. "She's dealing with what she's seen."

"What did she see?" I asked.

"She saw what caused the accident that killed Jeremy. She saw my curse."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Checking in with Faith again

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"'Curse'?" Dana asked. "No offense, Mrs. Richardson, but I think Faith knows her way around 'The Curse.'"

"It's not that curse, Dana," Mrs. Richardson said. "I could only wish it were only that."

She tucked Faith in and sat on the bed. "It began when I was a girl." She pointed at Kyra. "Scarcely older than you.

"I had such promise. But I listened to a young man, and let his silver words lead me away from God's plan for me. A few words was all it took, and my virtue was as if it had never been."

*That sounds like J.T.'s work,* Dee told me.

"I think that's why the curse fell upon me. The devil sent the Beast to tempt me, and I failed the test, so God saw fit to punish me.

"It was our fourteenth birthday when it happened. My twin brother, Jackson, had been fooling around with a riding lawnmower, when he fell into a ravine. The lawnmower teetered on the edge. I ran to it, hoping to pull it away. Suddenly, this force flew out from behind my eyes and pushed the mower into the ravine, right on top of Jackson.

"My screams brought the others out of the house. They all assumed it was an accident. Only I knew that he was dead because of me."

She swallowed. "I kept it bottled up for years, never letting anyone know of the evil within me. Then, last year, I was walking down the street in the shopping district, when I suddenly bumped into Faith. It puzzled me, because I had left her back at the house, and she was wearing different clothes from what I knew she owned. I asked her what she was doing, but she didn't want to talk to me. Then, it happened.

"We found out later that the driver was trying to close a business deal while driving, but all I could see was his car coming at me. I remember thinking, I don't want to die, God, let me live. Then that terrible force came out of me again. I thought it would stop the car, but it only deflected it, sent it on a new course."

"At Jeremy," I said.

She nodded. "I am cursed to kill and destroy whenever I want only to save." She began to cry.

I sat down next to her and put my arm around her. "You're not cursed, Mrs. Richardson. You have the power of telekinesis. But your fear of it prevents you from controlling it. And now, that fear controls you."

"J.T. has uncanny powers of persuasion," Dana added. "You have to know what you're dealing with to have a chance against him."

"You're not cursed, and you're not damned. You're just a frightened woman."

"I... "

We turned. Faith had awakened.

"I wanted to save him," she said. "I wanted to give my baby its daddy. Instead, all I could do was watch him die."

"I'm sorry, baby," Mrs. Richardson said. "I'm sorry he died because of me."

"No, Momma. You didn't make that man drive and talk on the phone." She sat up and hugged her mother. "You wanted to save him, just like I did. But we couldn't."

"We?"

"You pushed the car away from his body, Momma. You tried to save his life, not take it."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Mrs. Richardson's curse

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"What are you talking about?" Mrs. Richardson asked. "I can't save anyone. I can only kill."

"That's not true, Momma," Faith replied. "I was there. I saw. You wanted to save my Jeremy, and you used your powers to try. It's not your fault you couldn't."

*Sometimes,* Dee told me, *people see what they expect to see. She sees her powers as a terrible curse, so she didn't see herself doing what is right.*

"You know how much Faith loved Jeremy," I said. "She's got the proof in her womb. If Faith believed, for one second, that you didn't try to save him, don't you think she would say so?"

Mrs. Richardson said nothing. She just clutched her daughter and wept on her shoulder. Faith, for her part, cried into her mother's shoulder.

When Mrs. Richardson found her voice again, she said, "Tomorrow, sweetie, we'll take you to a doctor, get you checked out. You'll need to be healthy if you want a healthy baby.

"After that, I want you to stop time travelling. I don't want Satan to come looking for you."

"I think you're exaggerating," I said.

She held up a finger. "Make no mistake, Sykes, the Agency, and CHILD are doing the Devil's work on Earth."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Continue

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
The following day, I got a phone call from Mrs. Richardson. She seemed upset. "I'm sorry to call you so early, Melissa. " In a pained voice, she said. "I was hoping you could come with my daughter and I to see Dr. Hal at her office later today."

"I don't see why not." Kindly, I said. "Is something wrong?"

"It- It's noting." Trying to be light, she replied. "I- I was just hoping for some company."

I knew something was wrong. There was a lot of stress in her voice and I could hear the phone shaking in her hand which meant she was trembling. Still, I was not about to press over the telephone. "When would you like me to come over?" Politely, I asked.

Mrs Richardson gave an audible sigh of relief. "We are leaving to see the doctor in twenty minutes." More calmly, she said. "I appreciate you coming along."

"Not a problem, Mrs Richardson." Kindly, I said. "I'll see you soon."

Upon ending the call, I turned to Laura who I knew had walked up behind me the moment she detected stress in my voice. "I think Mrs Richardson is in trouble." Worried, I said. "That or something really has her frightened or worried."

Laura was silent for a moment. "Perhaps she had never gone to the doctor in fear of her 'curse' being discovered." Serious, she offered.

"Good guess but no... its deeper than that, I think." Serious, I said. "She has asked me to go with her."

"Then I'm going too." Serious, Laura said. "You know I'd follow you anyway."

I sighed at that. "Okay. I'll leave a note for mom and Aunt Fawn and we'll meet up with Mrs Richardson at her house."

Twelve minutes later, Laura and I arrived at Mrs. Richardson's house. She answered after only the third knock and seemed relieved I had brought Laura with me. "Are you okay, Mrs Richardson?" Worried, Laura asked. "You seem very nervous."

Mrs Richardson winced. "It's really nothing." Softly, she said. "I just feel I need the company when I take Faith to see the doctor."

Laura nodded but said nothing. She and I both knew there was something definitely wrong. Only I was not so sure it was as simple as a fear of seeing a doctor. Still, we all piled into Mrs Richardson's car to see Dr. Hal at her office at the hospital
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: A sense of fear.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
The appointment was mostly uneventful. Dr. Hal said that Faith was about two months along. Her biggest worry was that Faith was underweight, a result of her zoning out when she painted. Faith promised to be a good girl and take better care of herself, especially now that it wasn't just about her anymore.

There was something a little peculiar, though: When Dr. Hal was examining Faith, she never once asked any questions about the baby's father. I didn't know what they would have said, but I would have thought she would at least ask why he didn't come with us.

As we drove back to the Richardsons' house, I could feel Luana tensing up next to me. "What's going on?" I whispered.

"You can't tell?" she whispered back.

"No. My senses don't work through glass."

"Well, there are these vehicles that look like they're boxing us in. I think something's up."

Suddenly, almost as soon as we stopped, all four doors opened, and people reached in to grab us.

We went quietly, but I was thinking, You don't know it yet, but you've just bought yourselves trouble, courtesy of Miss Silhouette and the Invisible Shield.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: After seeing the doctor.

choices: I did not know the boy.
My friends might know the boy.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
The second we were out of the car, I sized up the situation. There were four men, each armed with a pistol. I could smell the gun oil and hear them lightly flapping around in their holsters when they moved. The first man opened a pair of handcuffs and I expertly twisted out of his grasp before locking the cuff onto his wrist instead! I then twisted his arm and locked the other cuff into place on his other wrist behind his back!

The second man took a swing at me but I heard him coming and easily dodged his attack before kicking my leg up high, catching him in the jaw, sending him stumbling backwards. I then dodged the first man who tried to charge me and gave him a push into the second, knocking them both over. That was when the second man drew his pistol. For some reason, I froze. I had never faced the barrel of a gun before so I had no idea what to do.

"Time to take a nap, kid." Forcefully, the man said.

With that, he moved to pull the trigger only to find the weapon knocked out of his hand by an invisible force! I turned to find Mrs Richardson pointing a single finger at the attacker with tears in her yes. "Bang..." Softly, she said.

I smiled but it quickly turned to fear as I saw a fifth man coming up behind Mrs Richardson raising the butt end of his pistol! I wanted to cry out a warning but found it was not needed as an invisible force knocked the man away before Laura appeared beside Mrs Richardson. I was relieved to see that my sister had made short work of the two who came after her as I saw them picking themselves up off the pavement a moment later. "There are more of these jerks coming!" Urgently, Laura warned. "We need to get out of here!"

I did not need any further motivation. We all jumped into the car to find faith shaking as if she had seen a ghost. "What's wrong, Faith?" Worried, her mother demanded.

"One of them tried to grab me but someone pulled him away." Tearfully, Faith said.

"Who was it?" Curious, I asked.

"We can worry about it later." Knotting her jaws, Mrs Richardson said. "We need to go, right now!"

She hit the accelerator and sped through the sparse traffic with two cars with tinted windows following. I could smell the sweat on her brow as cars she could not go around suddenly skidded to one side of the road or the other before skidding back behind her! It was effectively slowing down our pursuers but I could tell it was quickly wearing her down. I turned to look back and saw that we had successfully shaken off all but two of the black cars "What to do... what to do..." Biting my lip, I thought.

My thought was interrupted by Mrs Richardson suddenly crying out, "Everyone hang on, Jesus is taking the wheel!"

She suddenly turned the car a full three hundred and sixty degrees in a high speed spin before driving right at the two pursuing cars! I held my breath wondering if she had suddenly lost her mind. Only, to my surprise and slight horror, her eyes were closed shut! The car raced towards the two cars and the drivers swerved to avoid a collision only to run into other cars, causing a minor pile up that blocked the freeway! Mrs Richardson opened her eyes and sighed seeing that no one was seriously hurt then quickly turned the car around and continued down the freeway.

"Problem Child!" Grinning, Mrs Richardson declared. She giggled. "I kind of always wanted to say that as a kid."

Faith giggled but her mind was still on the mysterious boy who had saved her. He was near her height, muscular, with short dust brown hair and blue eyes. "Who was that...?" Curious, she thought.

She later told me what the boy looked like and I rubbed my chin in thought.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: The great escape

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"He doesn't sound familiar to me," I said. "Do you know him?"

"At first," she said, "I thought it was Jeremy. That's why I was so shaken up at the time. I wondered if Jeremy's spirit had come down to be a guardian angel for us. Thinking back on it, I realize that he wasn't Jeremy, even though he looked a lot like him."

"Well," said Mrs. Richardson, "I shall be eternally grateful for whichever angel came to assist us in our hour of need. That invisible force delivered us from Satan's clutches."

"Ma'am," Luana said, "that wasn't an angel. That was you."

"What?"

"Your powers were what saved us. Your telekinesis doesn't have to be a curse, if you don't treat it like one."

Mrs. Richardson clearly hadn't thought of that. "I... I saved us?" She paused and tilted her head. "Did you hear that?"

"What did you hear, Momma?"

"It sounded like a woman's voice,... telling me I should listen to you."

"That's probably your symbiont," I explained. "Most everybody in town has one."

"What's a s... sym... ?"

"It's a creature of alien origin that lives inside a person. You give it protection from the elements, and it gives you abilities. Mine gives me heightened senses that work better than eyesight in some ways. Yours gives you telekinesis. Faith's gives her the ability to time travel through her artwork."

"Which is what I wanted to know."

I turned at the sound of the voice. It was clear from Faith's reaction that this was the boy who had saved her.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: I did not know the boy.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"And who might you be?" I asked. "All I know about you is that my friend says you look like a boy she knew, Jeremy Sharpe."

The boy flushed at this, and smiled. "He was my big brother. I'm Justin."

"Faith Richardson."

"I'm Faith's mother."

"Luana Davenport. This is my sister, Melissa."

"Now that introductions are out of the way," I said, "we could use some more information from you."

"It started a few days before the accident," Justin said. "Jeremy confided in me that there was this girl who he liked, but he hadn't gotten the nerve to talk to her. Somehow, this girl had fallen into his lap from out of nowhere. She kissed him, she made love to him, then she disappeared as suddenly as she came. I thought he was making it up, but he showed me his back." He turned to Faith. "Remind me not to make you an offer like 'You scratch my back, I'll scratch yours.'"

Faith blushed.

Justin continued. "I had no idea who this girl was, until a year later, when you brought the portrait over. I thought he was exaggerating about your red hair, but he didn't. I think even a blind person could see it."

"I wouldn't go that far," I said.

Now it was Justin's turn to blush. "I... I didn't mean - "

I chuckled. "I'm just funning you, Justin. Go on."

"I've been following you for nearly two months, hoping you'd lead me to however you managed to get into and out of my house. It never occurred to me that you were time travelling, certainly not that you did it through paintings."

Faith nodded. "It's been puzzling you for over a year, but, for me, it started just a few weeks ago. But, wait a minute. How come I didn't notice you when I brought the portrait? I'm sure I would have noticed a near double of Jeremy."

"Well, that's going to come as a shock," Justin said. "Until a week ago, I was Jeremy's little sister."

Mrs. Richardson gasped at this. Faith looked at Luana and me.

"I expected more of a reaction," Justin said.

I shrugged. "We've had some experience with girls who used to be boys."

"Present company included," Luana added, raising her hand.

"So," I continued, "a boy who used to be a girl is only logical."

Justin hugged Luana. "I just wish I could have known you when it happened. It was such a shock."

"I'm afraid the shocks are gonna keep coming," Faith said.

"What do you mean?"

Faith took hold of Justin's hands. "You're going to be an uncle."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: The mystery boy

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
You know the expression "You could have knocked me over with a feather"? I think Justin would've been down for the count if you just whispered the word feather in his ear. "An... an uncle? But... but Jeremy's been... "

"Like I said," Faith explained, "it was more than a year ago for you, but, by my measurement, I was with him eight weeks ago. And the doctor says I'm eight to ten weeks along."

"Wait," Justin said. "You said you can travel through time. Can't you just go back before the accident, and stop it?"

"I already tried. I can't do it."

"It's a cinch those goons back there didn't know that," he said. "I'll bet they had a list of past events that they wanted to change."

"If you don't mind my asking, Justin," I asked, "what was the change like for you? So far, for the ones who went boy-to-girl, it's never been the same way twice."

"It was the surprise of it, more than anything," Justin replied. "I was having a sleepover with some of my friends. There we were, talking about how uncomfortable bras are. Suddenly, I'm growing out of my nightie, and my friends are staring at the front of my panties."

"That must've been rough."

"I don't know which was weirder, finding out my friends had started thinking about me that way, or catching myself thinking of them like that."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Reaction

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
We decided that it was time for us to return home, and we brought Justin along with us.

Mom and Aunt Fawn were waiting for us. "I was beginning to wonder," Mom said. "It seemed like that doctor's appointment was taking awfully long."

"We had some unexpected business to take care of," I explained. "But we made a new friend in the bargain."

Justin offered his hand. "A pleasure, ma'am."

Just then, Kyra came out. "There you guys are," she said. "Who's this?"

"This is Justin Sharpe," I answered, "Jeremy's younger brother."

"Wait a minute, Jeremy had a younger sister, not a brother."

"I've been through some changes."

Kyra's eyes widened. "A Guardian. An actual Guardian."

Justin looked around. "How does she know more about this than I do?"

"She's kinda clairvoyant."

"And what's a Guardian?"

"You're a descendant of Iole the Twice-Named," Kyra explained. "A lot of her descendants are born boys and turn into girls." She reached out for Justin's arm. "For whatever reason, not as many go the other way, but - " As soon as Kyra touched Justin's bicep, she fell silent.

"Kyra?" Aunt Fawn asked. "Are you okay?"

Kyra's only reply was a soft, high-pitched "Hoo."

"Alright, Kyra," Aunt Fawn said, "let's just let go of Justin and come inside."

"Hoo," Kyra replied, as Mom and Aunt Fawn pried her fingers off of Justin's arm.

"What happened to Kyra?" Luana asked me.

"The same thing that happened to you when you met Mike," I answered. "She's discovered boys."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Back at home

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Aunt Fawn shook her head, a bemused look on her face. "My little Kyra is growing up." Teasing, she said. "Barely a girl for two days and already swooning over a boy."

Justin blushed at that but decided it wise not to say anything just yet. only Kyra spoke, blushing more. "You- you really think I- I'm cute...?" Timidly, she asked.

"Kyra can talk to all symbionts within a certain range." Seeing Justin's shocked expression, I said. "I'm guessing you have one too."

"She calls herself Misha." Softly, he replied. "She had moved from mother to son for several generations in my family." He then turned to Kyra blushing. "Yes... I think you are cute though I wish Misha would have let me to tell you myself."

Kyra went wide eyed again. "Hoo..."

Justin shook his head and lead Kyra to a couch and urged her to sit before sitting down next to her. "How about we talk normal like, okay?"

Kyra blushed profusely, just as Justin did but slowly nodded her head. "Okay..."

"What of this unexpected business?" Serious, dad demanded. "Care to explain?"

"There was a kidnapping attempt." Darkly, I said. "We had to fight them off before making a run for it."

Dad's eyes widened then narrowed. "What?!..."

"Mrs. Richardson was amazing, dad!" A smile on her face, Laura said. "She knocked the guns out of the men's hand by pointing at them and threw an attacker off of her with a mere glare!"

"She saved you?" Surprised, mom asked.

"She did most of the work." Honestly, I replied. "She even drove like a professional race driver down the freeway to escape those who chased us."

"It sounds like you had quite the experience." Wincing, aunt Fawn said.

"I want a full report on what happened from the time you left here to the time you returned home." Sternly dad said. "Don't leave anything out!"

I sighed. "Yes, dad." nodding, I replied.

Twenty minutes later, after telling dad and uncle Stan everything that had happened, neither looked very happy. "It's sketch all over again." Sadly, dad said.

"Who...?" Worried, I asked.

Dad turned to me, I could tell there were tears in his eyes. "Stan and I had another brother, a younger brother with a similar power to Faith Richardson." Tears forming, he explained. "He could make any drawing come to life at any size."

"What happened to him?" Fearful to know, I asked.

Uncle Stan gulped. "The Agency feared his power... they murdered him."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Continue

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"Murdered?" I started breathing like I'd just run a marathon, and my legs weren't sure they were up to supporting my weight.

"They made it look like an accident," Dad said. "Even like he'd been responsible. But Sherlock told us it was murder."

"Sherlock?"

"Another kid we grew up with," Uncle Stan said. "He could make accurate deductions based on very little evidence. The Agency had the adults fooled, but, to Sherlock, they might as well have signed their names."

"But why?" I asked. "What could he do that was so bad?"

"His pictures could show what their subjects were doing currently, no matter when they were drawn," Dad explained. "Some people don't want others knowing what they're up to."

"And that's why they were after Faith," I realized. "They weren't planning to change the past, they just didn't want Faith going back and seeing what they did."

"Pretty much."

All at once, a dark suspicion struck me. "Daddy, did the Agency kill Jeremy?"
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Reactions.

choices: Faith and her family with chief Jones.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Dad closed his eyes and slowly nodded. "Jeremy had a power that allowed him to see the future." Almost whispering, he said. "He went to Chief Ted Jones the instant his powers activated."

"What- What could he do?" Softly, I asked.

"He had the ability to see key events in the future." Serious, uncle Stan replied. "He knew Faith would visit him that night months ago and that he was going to later die. That was why he seemed ready for her when she appeared and so willingly made love to her." He sighed, shaking his head. "The Agency knew that if the two of them got together, they would be a force to be reckoned with."

"Faith knowing what the Agency had done and Jeremy knowing what they will do later." Frowning, aunt Fawn said. "I'm guessing that kidnapping attempt was more of an attempted hit on Faith."

"How did my brother die, Mr. Davenport?" Shaken, Justin asked. "Please... I need to know how they killed him."

Mom sighed. "Mrs Richardson is not the only person with telekinetic powers." Surprising me, she said. "Justin's car accident was deliberate and they used Mrs Richardson as the escape goat for the crime as they already knew of her powers."

"Who was this other telekinetic?" Fearful, I asked.

Mom sighed. "Remember what I told you about crazy ex-boyfriends and why girls don't talk about them?" Darkly, she asked. Luana and I nodded. "The other telekinetic was her ex-husband."

"But why go after Jeremy?" Startled, Luana demanded.

Dad sighed. "To cause Mrs Richardson as much grief as possible." Angrily, he replied.

"What's your powers then?" Curious, I asked Justin.

Justin blushed, looking at Kyra. "I seem to always find myself where I am the most needed and ready to help in ways I didn't know I knew how to do."

Kyra smiled. "A Guardian." Softly, she said.

"I better call Faith and make certain they are alright." Reaching for my phone, I said. "She may still be in danger."

"We already have that covered, dear." Calmly, dad said. "You forget who we were when we were your age."

I heard the door open and was surprised to see...
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Deadly Secrets.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Faith walked in, followed by her parents, then Chief Jones. Faith was all at sea, while her parents argued about something or other. Chief Jones called me aside.

In his hands he held a box. "Mrs. D's family paid a visit to my office," he said. "They felt that she would want you to have this."

I took the box, which was heavier than its appearance would indicate. "What is it?"

"Open it and find out."

I opened it. Inside was a porcelain mask, in the shape of a woman's face. "Miss Shadow?"

"That's what it looks like to me," he said.

Feeling through the cloth, which I now recognized as her costume, I found the reasons why the box was so heavy: two forearm-long metal rods, which I recognized as her battle staves. "These are not leaving my side."

"After a day like today, I wouldn't recommend anything else."

I rejoined the others, and Faith needed me more than ever. She hugged the stuffing out of me. "Chief Jones says they killed Jeremy, and they want to kill me and the baby."

"Don't you worry, Faith." I showed her my battle staves. "If they try anything, they'll have Miss Silhouette to deal with."

"And, before they can get to her, they'll have to face the Invisible Shield," Luana added.

"Not to mention the Guardian," Justin offered.

"I'll be back in a sec," I said, then went over to where the Richardsons were still arguing. Apparently, they couldn't agree on whose fault it was that a secret organization had targeted their family. "Excuse me?"

"What?" Mr. Richardson was done pretending to be civil.

"I just thought you should know that your daughter is scared out of her wits. We're telling her that she'll be okay, but I think she'd hear it better if it came from someone she's known for more than five minutes, maybe the people she's thought would protect her all her life." I was done pretending I gave a rat's ass what he thought.

Mrs. Richardson, at least, went to console Faith. "Freaks," Mr. Richardson said.

"If you're a commercial for the alternative," I replied, "I think I'll pass."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Faith and her family with chief Jones.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
I decided to take my leave of Mr. Richardson while I had more options than beating him senseless or vomiting and then beating him senseless. I made a more thorough examination of the battle staves. It appeared that the staves could connect at a certain point. When I tried it, the connected staves elongated into a staff. "If I didn't already have these," I said, "I'd want some of my own." Reversing the process was as simple as twisting the staves apart again.

The doorbell rang. Aunt Fawn answered it, and a couple were there. "Mom! Dad!" Justin said. "What brings you here?"

"We were cleaning Jeremy's room," Mrs . Sharpe said. "We found this." She held up a thumb drive.

"Once we saw what was on it," Mr. Sharpe added, "we thought you all should see it."

We turned on a laptop, plugged in the drive, and gathered around. When the picture came in, Faith gasped. "Jeremy."

"Hi," Jeremy said. "In less than 24 hours, I will be dead. I want you all to know that I'm okay with this. It has to be this way. Not because we can't change the future, because I've done that before, but because this will set things in motion that are certain to bring about the end of the Agency. If all goes according to plan, this video is being watched by a human weapon, a shield, a visionary, the new team's muscle, and the Wild Card."

It wasn't hard to tell who he meant, and the five of us looked at each other.

"Now," Jeremy continued, "it would take more than my death to bring you all together, so you know I've been busy. That's right, not everything that's happened to you was as random as it appeared.

"Convincing Mrs. D was no trouble. When I told her I needed her to pass on her legacy to her protege, she said she'd been planning to do that all along. She's taken a special interest in you, Melissa. You've got her confidence in you. Never forget that.

"Eli Mist was a tougher nut to crack. He didn't like being the Invisible Shield, and he'd hoped that the position would die with him. It wasn't until I told him that Mrs. D had planned all along to give her powers to Melissa that he decided she would need someone, 'to protect her from herself,' as he put it. He tried to make it sound like he had his doubts, but I could tell he saw something in you, Luana. He wouldn't give you the powers of the Invisible Shield if he didn't think you could do it.

"Kyra, your clairvoyance will serve you well. You will know what tactics haven't worked, and you can advise Melissa and Luana on how to avoid them.

"Justin, I had to mislead you a bit. I knew Faith's name all along, and I knew how she got in and out of the house. I didn't tell you because I needed the mystery to keep you interested, and I needed for you not to do anything until the rest was in place. You've always seen yourself as a delicate flower, but now you know your real strength. Do not doubt your ability to protect those who need you.

"Dana, you have powers even you don't yet know. You might think you just soak up other people's powers, but you can do more when you're needed.

"Faith, I'm sorry that I never told you how I feel about you. Maybe I had an excuse in school and just hanging around, but I should have told you that night we shared. I love you, Faith. I want you to know that, as scary as things may be now, you will see a world without the Agency. I'm sorry I won't be there to see it with you, but at least a part of me will grow up knowing no other world."

With that, the video ended.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: A message from Jeremy

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"This is incredible," Mrs. Sharpe said. "What did he mean by 'a part of me will know no other world'?"

"He meant my baby," Faith replied. "I can travel into the past through my paintings. The night I finished Jeremy's portrait, I accidentally entered it, into a time when Jeremy was still alive. We... " She patted her belly.

"Are you people serious?" Mr. Richardson fumed. "Has the Devil deceived you all? These children stink of sulfur."

"You're talking about your own daughter, sir," Chief Jones said.

"I disavow Satan's harlot!" he bellowed. "I cast her out!"

Faith ran to him. "Daddy, you can't mean - "

In response, Mr. Richardson struck her across the face, and she fell to the floor.

Before anyone else could react, Dana reached out and touched Faith.

Immediately, the fallen girl opened her eyes and sat up bolt upright.

Mrs. Richardson turned on her husband. "I cast you out, Todd Richardson! Get out, and stay out!"

"You dare - "

"I said get out! I'll have your things sent to you! Now, are you going to leave voluntarily, or should I ask Chief Jones here to escort you to some city accommodations?"

"I don't get to make many arrests sitting behind a desk," Chief Jones replied. "And committing assault and battery on a pregnant teenager is certainly a criminal offense. You're under arrest, Todd Richardson. You have the right to remain silent." Chief Jones continued reading Mr. Richardson his rights as he led him away.

With that being taken care of, Mrs. Richardson turned her attention back to Faith, who had picked up a pen and a sheet of paper, and was now drawing with considerable speed. "Are you okay, Faith, darling?"

Faith said nothing, only driving away on whatever she was working on.

"I think she's just... drawing to draw something," Luana said.

After a few minutes, Faith's hand wobbled over the paper, and she set down her pen. "What... what happened?"

"Don't you remember, baby?"

She shook her head. "I remember Daddy was yelling, and, the next thing I knew, I was lying on the floor, and my mind was racing. What happened to me?"

"I'm afraid your father hurt you, Faith. But he's gone now, and I promise you, he'll never hurt you again. But how did you get better so quickly?"

"I think I did that," Dana said. "I can absorb other people's soul energy, making their powers my own. I think, when I touched Faith after she was hurt, I gave her her energy back. It healed her, and made her feel the need to draw."

"You found a new aspect of your powers," I said, "just like Jeremy said."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Dana's powers

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
As we recovered from what had just happened, Mrs. Sharpe asked, "You're really having Jeremy's baby?"

"Yes, ma'am," Faith replied. "I know I'm super young to be a mom, but I can't... just... It's the last of Jeremy." She turned to her mother. "Momma, do I have to leave?"

"No, honey," she replied. "In fact, I was thinking: What would you say if we made the bonus room into your studio?"

That got her a big hug. "Thank you so much."

"I could probably use a little help getting it all set up for you."

"You've got it," I answered.

"And, a few months down the road, we can make the guest bedroom into a nursery."

"If it's okay," Mr. Sharpe asked, " do you think you could bring the baby over to see the grandparents?"

"I'd like that, Mr. Sharpe. Besides, I want this baby to know what Jeremy was like."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: The aftermath

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Before I could respond, I heard a phone ringing only it was high pitched. So much so I seemed to be the only one who was hearing it. Looking around, I discovered it was coming from Miss Shadow's costume. Upon closer inspection, I found a cellphone in one of the pockets. I answered on the fourth ring and, for some strange reason, I said, "Talk to me."

"Miss Shadow, we are grateful you are still among us." A feminine voice said. "Enemies of old have returned. They are after the children of the original problem child gang and its allies. Can you assist?"

I sighed. "I am sorry to be the one to bring you this news but the ones you know as Miss Shadow and the Invisible Shield have passed away." Sadly, I reported. "I am Miss Silhouette, the torch had been passed onto my sister and I."

There was a pause. I could hear the woman crying on the other end. "Miss Shadow and the Invisible Shield have passed away." I heard her say to someone on the other line. "They have chosen their successors, a Miss Silhouette and a new Invisible Shield... her sister."

I heard more people crying on the other line. I even heard one slam a fist onto a wooden surface I could only assume was a table. Ms D had touched more lives than I had thought, possibly more than I could imagine. *The one talking to you is known as Creed.* Calmly, Dee said. *She is second in command of The Cloaked Dagger, Europe's version of the problem child gang.*

I felt my heart race. "When Jeremy said he had been busy, he wasn't just being metaphoric." Impressed, I thought. Knotting my jaws in decision, I firmly said, "Enemies of old have returned to us on this end as well, Creed. There is not a moment to lose if we are to stop them once and for all."

Creed seemed surprised. "How did you..." Softly, she began.

*Miss D kept detailed journals of her adventures.* Softly, Dee said. *I have no doubt Chief Jones will give them to you soon.*

"Why didn't he..." Sad, you began...

*Evidence... he owes it to her to be as thorough as possible when investigating her death due to both hers and Eli's house being ransacked.*

"We can discuss that at length after this is all over, Creed." Interrupting her, I firmly said. "What do you know so far?"

Creed took a breath. "We rescued two children from the Agency." Serious, Creed began. "Tommy and Aura Winters. From what we have gathered from them, the Agency and CHILD are in a race to create an army of super powered child soldiers."

I gasped. "The children of the various effected cities..."

"Correct." Darkly, Creed said. "Tommy has told us that they want the children of the original problem child gang as a form of revenge. Aura informed us that they want those with the power to stop them eliminated."

"Does Tommy and Aura know of any weaknesses within the Agency?" Hopeful, I inquired. "Anything we could use against them will be helpful."

I heard a small boy's voice say, "A Dr Hagen is working for them. He was the primary doctor of most of the original members before a Dr. Hal took over their cases. He is not aware of their true identities... yet." He paused. "He is the most vulnerable member of the organization."

"It is a start, at least." Eying Chief Jones, I said. "I will bring the new problem child gang and their allies up to speed. Thank Tommy and Aura for their courage and resolve, we will keep in touch."

I then ended the call and turned to Chief Jones. "Fire your primary doctor, chief." Sternly, I said. "He is a lackey of the Agency."

"Dr Hagen?" Surprised, Chief Jones asked.

I quickly relayed everything that Creed had told me to which Chief Jones turned red and grabbed a cellphone from his pocket. "Puer Quaestio... We have a situation."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: The beginning of the Agency's end.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
I knew that Luana and I would be heading over to Faith's to set up her new studio, but I was surprised when Garth and Grace dropped by just after breakfast. "What brings you guys here?"

"Dad said you would need some help," Garth replied.

Grace added, "He also wanted us to let you know that he's got some old books that Mrs. D used to have."

"He does?" I asked. "Can I look at them?"

"He says they're in the evidence locker," Garth explained, "but he'll see if he can get them."

"If I ask Dad for something for my birthday or Christmas," Luana said with a grin, "and he says 'We'll see,' I usually get it."

"Guess our dads have a lot in common," Grace said.

"With all you guys going," Kyra said, "I think I'll stay behind and talk with our friends from across the pond. We'll need to compare notes if we want a chance of taking down the Agency."

"Sounds like a plan. Alright, let's get a move on, Faith's things aren't gonna move themselves."

With the five of us, neither rearranging the furniture in the bonus room nor transferring the artwork took very long. "A very good job," Mrs. Richardson said. "I think I can let you kids alone while I go downtown for a while."

Once she was gone, Faith turned to me. "She's going to a lawyer's office to start divorce proceedings."

"I'm sorry, Faith."

"It's okay. Dad's hit me a couple times before, just never so hard, and not in front of people. He always said it was because I had done something I shouldn't have."

Dana took Faith's hand. "It was him who did what he shouldn't have, not you. Blaming you is just another example."

"I'm starting to see that." She turned back to me. "Does it bother you that I'm having this baby? I'm not sure how you feel about... what I'm doing."

"I'm pro-choice," I answered. "Which means that, when you decided to have a baby and be a mom, it became my job to support you in any way I could. Besides, if I were in your shoes, I might not have gone right to the same decision, but, if I knew someone was going to murderous lengths to keep it from being born, I just might take it into my head to find out why."

"Thanks, Melissa."

"Anytime. Can I ask you a question?"

"Sure."

"Does your dad's combover fool anybody?"

"Only himself." And we laughed.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: The following day.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Unknown to me until later, Kyra spoke with her symbiont, Rina who gave her the number needed to contact the Cloaked Dagger. A male voice answered after the second ring. "Hello, to whom am I speaking?"

The moment Kyra heard the man's voice, images of what he was planning flooded her mind. Shortly after, several other symbionts voiced their protests. The plan she was seeing was guaranteed to fail. "Puer Quaestio." Serious, she said.

There was a pause before the male voice replied, "The line is secure."

"I am Visionary." Darkly, Kyra said. "I can speak with symbionts far and wide. In my vision, I see the new Cloaked Dagger planning to take the Agency head on." She frowned. "You know that will not work without the right inside information."

"I am Cog, leader of the original Cloaked Dagger." Calmly, the male voice said. "I am guessing Miss Silhouette and her team has a better plan of action in mind..."

"The former leader of the Agency, Carlos is still alive." Softly, Kyra said. "If he is hungry for revenge against his former colleagues, he is our greatest leverage to bring the Agency down. We know where he is." She paused, listening to the symbionts. "Also, a Dr Hagen who is one of the Agency's top agents is in our custody."

"How do you know this Carlos or Hagen will cooperate with us?" Firmly, Cog demanded. "How do we know the information they offer will be accurate?"

"I am talking to the symbionts within Tommy and Aura Winters as we speak, Cog." Fighting fatigue, Kyra replied. "The two of them can confirm everything they tell us plus, we know of a few friends who can be... persuasive during an interrogation."

"Very well." Calmly, Cog said. "I shall have them flown to your location tonight. Who will they be expecting upon their arrival?"

Kyra smiled. "Tex the mighty." Calmly, she said. "Puer Quaestio."

Upon finishing the call, Kyra yawned deeply then called Chief Jones. He answered on the third ring. "Chief Jones speaking."

"Puer Quaestio... We have a situation." Serious, Kyra said. "The creepy man known as J.T. is Carlos, the original leader of the Agency. He may prove..."

Before Kyra could finish...
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Continue

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Garth asked, "So, now that you've got your own studio, what will be your first work?"

"Yesterday," Faith replied, "I did a sketch of my friends. I think I'd like to make that a painting."

"You're not planning to walk into it, are you?" I asked.

"I don't think I could," she replied. "I'm in it, too."

Just then, Grace's phone rang. "It's Dad," she said before answering. "Yeah, Daddy?" She listened for a bit, then said, "Okay, I'll go there and check on her. Thanks, Daddy." Hanging up, she explained, "Daddy was talking to Kyra, and she stopped talking. He wants me to see what's up."

"Overuse of her powers takes a lot out of her," Dana said. "That might be it."

"If it isn't, I'll ask for backup." With that, Grace went back to the house.

A few minutes later, Garth's phone rang. He put it on speaker. "What's the sitch?"

"Kyra's out like a light, but there's no sign of trouble. She must have overextended herself."

"That's a relief. Anything else?"

"Dad says Kyra told him we've got a name to work with. But he doesn't want us acting on it until he's with us."

"Sounds serious."

"Yeah, J.T. serious."

I swallowed. I was so sure of our success, right up until I learned we'd have to deal with a man who had the power to talk anybody into anything.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: she fainted from exhaustion.

choices: J.T. (Carlos) is brought in for questioning.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
It was early morning of the next day when Chief Jones arrived at my house. "It is time to pick up Tommy and Aura Winters." Serious, he said. "From the report I received from Creed, these two are our best bet to get around the unique ability Carlos possesses."

"Why do you need Laura and I to go with you?" Curious, I asked.

"Miss Shadow and the Invisible Shield were legends, as you know." Softly, Chief Jones replied. "The only reason they agreed to come to the States is because of your link to them and we need these kids on our side."

I nodded but said nothing. Chief Jones then lead Laura and I to his family car and we all drove to the airport where we met up with the two children. Tommy was no older than thirteen, well built, with short raven hair and brown eyes. His little sister, Aura, was no older than seven or eight. She was very short and petite with doll like features, waist length auburn hair and gentle green eyes. Both seemed rather jumpy as they stepped off the plane. Chief Jones was holding a large card with their names on it and they cautiously approached.

"Puer Quaestio." Softly, he said. "Welcome to Waterfront city."

Tommy nodded. "Thank you, Chief Jones." Softly, he said. "We were told you needed help with talking to a man who can put ideas into people's heads."

"Something like that." Nodding, Chief Jones replied. He motioned to Laura and I. "Tommy, Aura, I give you Miss Silhouette and the Invisible Shield."

I was dressed in Miss Shadow's alter ego costume that was mentioned several times in the graphic novel, a humble teacher. Though, at my age, I was more of a teacher's aide. Laura wore a pant suit and shades that screamed 'body guard'. Something that was not mentioned in the novel but she wore it well.

"It is a pleasure to meet you both." Politely, I said. "I hope we can be a help to each other in our common goals."

Tommy looked at me and then at Laura, surprise on his face. "I- I can't see through your eyes." Whispering, she said. "You are blind..."

"Sort of." Showing him my cane, I replied.

Tommy then surprised me by giving me a hug. Only before I could respond, Laura spoke up. "I suggest we move on to the car, we are vulnerable here."

Chief Jones nodded and led us all to his car. I could not help notice that Tommy was shyly smiling at me as was Aura. *Your blindness protects you from their strange telepathy.* Kindly, Dee said. *You are likely the first person they met who is a mystery to them.*

I smiled at that, knowing Miss Shadow was just as mysterious.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Chief Jones arrives

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"Now, here's the situation," Chief Jones said, as he began to drive. "Carlos, or J.T., as he is known nowadays, can persuade almost anyone to do whatever he wants. Since he left the Agency, that tends to involve... intimate relations with young girls. When he gets caught, he just talks his way out of the consequences."

Tommy squirmed in his seat. "What do you want us to do?"

"From what Cog told me, the two of you are able to get a read on people immediately. That's absolutely necessary, because the only way to resist him is to know exactly what he's up to. I'm going to throw a good solid scare into him. Then, when he meets you two, he'll be lulled into a false sense of security, thinking he's back in control. Then, you pull the information we need out of his head, and we won't need him anymore."

Tommy turned to me. "Back at the airport, you said you were sort of blind. What did you mean?"

"I am totally blind," I explained, "but my other senses are heightened to an uncanny degree. From them, I can suss out my surroundings. It's a talent Miss Shadow possessed, and she passed it to me."

He caught me by surprise by smiling. "You're the first person we've met who we didn't know everything about before we could say hello. I kinda missed having to get to know someone. Do your senses work just as well as eyes?"

"Not quite. To me, paintings are just canvas rectangles, and windows are as blank as walls. The other day, we were surrounded, and I didn't know about it until Luana told me."

"Speaking of... " Luana said.

"I see them," Chief Jones said. "But they're about to learn it's not wise to challenge my driving."

I heard some buttons being pushed, some switches being thrown, and we were flying. That may sound like hyperbole, but I swear we got airborne at one point.

When we touched ground again, there was only one thing to say, and we all said it, in unison: "Problem Child!"
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Later, briefing Tommy and Aura.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Later that day, Chief Jones escorted Tommy and Aura, wearing visitor badges on their shirts, into an observation room that looked into the interrogation room where a well dressed, muscular man of average height was sitting at a table in handcuffs. He had short light brown hair and blue eyes. To the unsuspecting, he appeared to be quite handsome and gentle. However, Tommy and Aura shuddered at the very sight of him.

"He is cold and ruthless." Softly, Tommy said. "He's raped twelve women in the past twenty four hours."

"He enjoys the power he has over young people, to play with their minds and bodies." Almost whispering, Aura said. She teared, up clearly afraid. "Please tell me we don't have to be in the same room with that monster."

My blood ran cold, hearing that. I made a mental note to thank mom for warning me to avoid him. To think there was such a person in our fair city who raped innocent women and perhaps children and got away with it...

"You won't be alone." Serious, Garth said from behind. "If he makes any sudden moves, he will get the second biggest scare of his life."

"Garth Jones, also known as Goliath, has the ability to become a powerhouse just like his father." Smiling, I said. "That man won't be able to even get close without getting the pounding of his life."

"Let's get this over with then." Serious, Chief Jones said. He turned to Tommy. "Can you get the proof we need for your accusations against Carlos?"

Tommy and Aura nodded. "I can give you a description of all those he attacked and the addresses of those he is targeting now." Serious, he said.

"I can give you a detailed list of all those he had attacked in the past." Also serious, Aura added. "this monster has to be stopped."

Chief Jones nodded. "You are very brave, children." Gently, he said. "Thank you."

With that, he entered the interrogation room where J.T. was impatiently waiting.

"Another accusation of wrong doing against me, Chief Jones?" Calmly, he asked. "What is it now, twelve misunderstandings this week alone?"

Chief Jones did not say a word. He walked to the camera that monitored the interrogation and pulled the wire out before dropping it to the floor. J.T. fell silent, raising a single eyebrow. "I want my attorney..."

Chief Jones placed his badge and gun onto a table under the dark window away from J.T., increasing his nervousness. From the observation room, I gulped wondering what he was planning to do. He then turned away from the window, an ominous look upon his face, one J.T. seemed to recognize as all the color quickly began to drain from his face.

"I have been waiting twenty years for this moment." Darkly, Chief Jones said. "You can't hide from me anymore... Carlos."

J.T.'s eyes went wide and his face turned ghostly pale as Chief Jones unleashed his muscular energy and grew from a six foot muscular man to a ten foot Olympian giant! "Tex the mighty...!" Gasping, he wailed. "I thought you were killed!"

"I thought the same of you... Carlos." His voice booming, Chief Jones countered. "Now we get to finish our business and pay old debts!"

He grabbed the desk between him and J.T. and threw it as if it were cardboard! It literally shattered upon hitting the door, knocking it halfway off its hinges! J.T., or rather, Carlos screamed in complete terror, backing himself into a corner.

"Wait!" Desperately, he pleaded. "Wait... we can still cut a deal!"
