"I should rip your arms and legs off and leave you in a hospital bed for the rest of your natural life..." Gravely, Chief Jones said. "For all those you victimized, all those whose lives you had destroyed..."

Suddenly, the door opened and Garth walked in in the guise of Goliath who stood at seven feet tall. He was not as tall as his father but just as powerful. "That is enough, Chief Jones." Forcefully, he said. "This garbage is not worth throwing away your career or your freedom as a good citizen of Waterfront City."

Inside the observation room, I could not help smile. "That's a bit cheesy." Giggling inside, I thought. "He needs to work on his dialog."

"This is a police matter... Goliath." Growling, Chief Jones hissed. "We do not tolerate vigilantism in this city."

"And yet, you are practicing it now." Calmly, Garth countered. "Take your badge and your gun. Find a place to collect your thoughts then come back." He then eyed Carlos, quivering on the floor. "He's not going anywhere."

Reluctantly, or seemingly reluctantly, Chief Jones collected his badge and gun then left the room, closing what was left of the heavy door. Once alone, Garth turned to Carlos. "Take a seat."

"Why?" Eyes narrowing, Carlos demanded.

"So I don't have to force you to." Coldly, Garth countered. "Or would you prefer I call Chief Jones back before he has a chance to cool off?"

Carlos turned another shade of pale before quickly returning to the chair he was in. "What is it you want from me?" Dropping his innocent act, he asked. "I don't remember locking horns with you in the past."

"Be grateful for that." With equal coldness, Garth countered. "I am here to introduce you to two friends of mine."

Carlos raised a single eyebrow but smiled as Tommy and Aura nervously stepped in. They were both wearing masks to hide their faces but it was obvious to Carlos that they were very young. "Good day, children." Sweetly, he said. "Did you wish to talk to me?"

Tommy frowned and described every woman and teenage girl he had raped in the last twenty four hours. Aura then rambled off all the addresses and names of those he planned to target within the next twenty four hours along with the exact location of where he kept his 'bragging journal' as he called it. Carlos turned from one to the other, his face about as pale as a person's can get as Garth then ushered them out.

"Unless you want all of that and a lot more in the open, I suggest you answer all of my questions without hesitation or deception." Coldly, Garth said. "Be fair warned, they will immediately know when you lie and it will cost you a cracked bone..."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: J.T. and the Chief

choices: Carlos talks truthfully about the Agency.
Carlos is caught in many lies.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Hours later, Garth walked out of the interrogation room with Carlos trembling in his seat, not daring to move from it. I nodded at Garth as he entered the room then became curious as Caitlin Spencer walked in behind him. She was wearing a knee length black pleated skirt, white blouse, and a black blazer. I shuddered upon noticing she was wearing a unique mask that showed no features what so ever. I knew it was her as Dee had helped me identify the subtle differences in people's body temperatures. It was how Miss Shadow knew who was in the room before they even spoke.

"Everyone, this is Mysteria." Serious, Garth said. "She is going to help us tie up a loose end before we finish with Carlos."

I raised a single eyebrow, curious. Caitlin turned to the window and looked at Carlos for a moment before shuddering of a certain chill. "All memory of who Tex the mighty is has been removed from his sick and twisted mind." Softly, she said. "All he knows is that Goliath interrogated him."

Garth again nodded. "Thank you."

After Caitlin had left, Chief Jones walked in, concerned. "Did you get everything you needed from him... Goliath?" In a forced calm, he demanded.

"We got a full written confession of all his crimes from his brag journal and target notes hidden in a wall safe." Serious, Garth replied. "Our shape-shifting friend, Metamorph and his partner, Amazon acquired them for us."

"Once he saw them in Goliath's hands, he immediately asked to make a deal." Calmly, I added. "I have a feeling he knows all too well what danger he would be in from the people of this city should any of that information got out."

"He still knows who I am." Frowning, Chief Jones said.

"Mysteria took care of that little problem." Smiling, Garth said. "She could not get into his head while his defenses were up. The interrogation knocked those walls down and she removed that memory from his mind."

Chief Jones sighed in relief. "Good work, everyone." With a hint of pride, he said. "You make the old gang proud." He paused. "Did you get any information on the Agency?"

"That's the deal we struck." Serious, Garth said. "He gives us everything he has on the Agency and all this evidence against him does not see the light of day."

Tommy then gave a dark grin. "However, one lie and it all falls into the open."

Aura nodded, a look of vindictiveness on her face. "Including him singing about the Agency and its plans."

Chief Jones seemed impressed, also proud. "Then let us see how well he sings now."

With that said, he walked into the interrogation room with a mock look of surprise. "I thought they would have put you into a better room than this..."

"This is fine." Shaken, Carlos said quietly. He looked broken, nothing like the confident charmer he was hours before. "I wave my right to an attorney, I am ready to talk..."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: After the interrogation.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Carlos talked for hours. Whenever Chief Jones had a question, Carlos had a ready answer. The Chief copied down everything he said, occasionally looking at a stack of papers next to him.

When Carlos finished, the Chief said, "I have just one more question before you go on your way."

"Ask away, Chief."

"Exactly how stupid do you think I am?"

I heard his heart flutter at that.

Chief Jones slid the papers he'd been glancing at across to Carlos. "I've had the real information all along. You didn't quit the Agency, you were removed, for using their resources to try to find a cure for your sterility. And the current head goes by the code name Jasmine, not Joachim."

"So... so why did you ask me all those questions?"

"To find out just how overconfident in your ability to lie your way out of a predicament you are." He gathered the papers and Carlos's confession. "I think I can get this to the media in time for the 11:00 news. The paper will have it for the morning." He looked at the panicked expression on J.T.'s face. "Oh. You're free to go. You're done in this town, anyway. Maybe that private island of yours has enough food and liquor to tide you over for a week or so, once the nearby government decides to block all incoming shipments. I can wait."

It was like the air was leaking out of him. J.T. knew the Chief had won. His carefree life was over.

A man in a suit walked into the room. "I'm Joachim Rivera. I'm sorry for the delay. I'd like to have a word with my client."

Chief Jones shrugged. "Have all the words you want. He waived counsel, and gave us a full confession."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Carlos is caught in many lies.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Once the matter of J.T. had been dealt with, Chief Jones decided to take us all home. "It's going to feel good, not having that guy preying on people anymore," he said.

On the way, he said, "Tomorrow, we'll start figuring out the best strategy for taking down the Agency. Carlos made a lot of claims, but we can't trust a word of it."

When we got home, Aunt Fawn opened the door for us. "How'd it go?" she asked.

"Our least favorite neighbor will be on the news tonight," Chief Jones replied. "He's going to be history. Let me introduce you to our new associates. Fawn Davenport, this is Tommy Winters and his little sister, Aura."

"Nice to meet you both."

Aura touched Fawn's belly and gasped. "You're going to have a baby."

Mine was the only jaw in the room that didn't drop.

Aura then went to Mom and touched her. "You're going to have a baby, too."

"I'm sorry about this," Tommy said. "Aura and I can read minds. Aura knows why most people keep secrets, but she doesn't understand people keeping happy secrets."

"I had planned to tell you all," Aunt Fawn said, "I was just going to wait a few weeks."

"Same here," Mom added.

Once congratulations had been given all around, Mom and Aunt Fawn pulled me aside. "We couldn't help noticing," Mom said, "that you were the only one who didn't look surprised when Aura dropped the bombs."

"I overheard you both telling Dad and Uncle Stan," I admitted. "You wanted to keep your pregnancies secret, so I didn't say anything. I planned to act surprised when you made your announcements."

Mom sighed. "It's tough keeping secrets from someone with superhuman hearing."

"And from telepaths," noted Aunt Fawn.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: At home

choices: Don't make us go back there.
We do but it won't be easy.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
After everyone had settled down, I sat down with Tommy and Aura with Kyra and Laura to have a talk. "I would like to know everything you told Chief Jones about the Agency." Calmly, I said. "Kyra can talk to all symbionts within a certain range, they can then talk to others further out. It will save time in the long run."

Tommy took a breath. "The Agency is lead by a woman whose code name is Jasmine but that is just a front." Serious, he said. "Their overall leader is a powerful and ruthless man code named Alpha."

"What do you mean a front?" Curious, Laura asked.

"He means that she in charge of the Agency's legal dealings, those they allow the outside world to see to ward off deeper investigations." Frowning, Kyra said. "That is how they have been able to stay out of the spotlight for so long."

Tommy nodded. "Their second in command is a vicious woman code named Beta." Frowning, he said. "They are after the children of the original problem child gang to add them to their child soldier project as a form of revenge."

"Those they do not believe they can control, they try to kill." Softly, Aura said. "Hence the attempted hits on your friends." She began to cry. "They used us to find you! We are sooo sorry!"

Tommy began to cry as well. "It was the only way we could even get a chance to escape from them!" Wailing, he added. "Please don't hate us!"

"They would have found us eventually anyway as Dr Hagen was the primary doctor of a lot of the original members." Comforting, I said. "That and you are helping us find and shut them down."

"Also, your mental cries for help were heard by another original member." Gently, Kyra said. "That is how the Cloaked Dagger was able to find and rescue you both."

"Our calls for help were heard?" Surprised, Aura asked.

Kyra nodded. "By the mysterious Madam Vague." Smiling, Kyra said. "Well, by her daughter anyway."

Tommy and Aura turned to each other in awe. Madam Vague was a close ally to Miss Shadow and nearly as immortal. She earned her name by giving cryptic clues and warnings to the problem child gang when they found themselves lost on a case or in trouble from some villain.

"Is there anything else you can tell us about the Agency?" Patiently, I asked.

"Their headquarters is underground with a virtual maze of halls and doors that seem to go on forever." Serious, Tommy said. "Unless you really know your way around, you can get lost forever."

"Only a small number of the rooms are actually used." Serious, Aura said. "The rest are death traps and deadly interrogation rooms." She shuddered. "The place was originally an extension to the old catacombs that went under the Tyrrheian sea. They modified it and turned it into their secret base of operations. Very few even know it exists as it was abandoned for decades."

"The entrance is in the city of Rome but there is no easy way in without detection." Softly, Tommy said. "These people are very paranoid about getting invaded."

"Likely due to their last encounter with the problem child gang." Serious, Laura said.

I nodded then turned to Tommy ans Aura. "do either of you know of a secret way in?"

Tommy and Aura became fearful before replying...
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Reader's choice

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"We can't go back there!" Tommy begged. "We'd rather die!"

Maybe preferring death was hyperbole on their part, but their fear of the Agency was definitely real. Their pulses were racing at the mere thought.

I held Aura tight. "Nobody's going to make you go anywhere," I told them. "We'll be taking care of the rough stuff."

Aura cried into my shoulder. I let her.

"Just tell us where it is," I repeated. "Saturday night, I'll do reconnaissance."

"You?" Luana asked. "How about someone else? Like Garth and Grace?"

"They might have security measures outside normal human detection," I explained. "My senses could pick them up."

"She's got a date with someone named Mike," Tommy said.

Luana shot him a look, but said nothing.

"I'm sorry to mess up your social life," I said, "but this is important."

Luana sighed. "Eli was right, somebody has to protect you from yourself. Let me come up with a story, so Mike and I can reschedule."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Don't make us go back there.

choices: a large wolf staring back at us.
nothing but strange tracks in the yard.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
The next morning, While everyone was still asleep, Laura called Mike with me listening at her side in case she needed my help. Mike sleepily answered on the third ring. "Luana?" Yawning, he asked. "What's wrong? It's five in the morning..."

"Sorry to wake you, Mike." Nervous, Luana said. "My father has been called out on a um... business trip this weekend to Europe and invited us to come." She gulped. "Would it be- be alright if we go out next Saturday?"

There was a long pause. I could hear Mike on the other line, pressing the phone tighter against his ear as if trying to pick up some kind of sound. Finally, he sighed. "You worry too much, Luana." With a chuckle, he said. "Next Saturday is fine."

"Thank you, Mike." Grateful, Luana said. "Maybe we can catch that meteor shower they've been talking about on the news."

"Maybe..." Lightly, Mike said. "Enjoy your trip and I'll see you when you get back."

After hanging up, Luana turned to me with a sigh. "That went a lot more smoothly than I feared it would." Relieved, she said.

"Actually, I think you made him worry." Wincing, I said. "You gulped in mid sentence and stammered, that can send all the wrong signals. I heard him pressing the phone tight against his ear, trying to pick up background sounds."

Luana shuddered. "You can be scary at times, sis."

I smiled at that. "Me?" Feigning surprise, I asked. "I am not the one who can turn a coin into a cannon like dad."

*************************************************


Unknown to me, on the opposite side of town, Mike slowly hung up the telephone and turned to a towering figure in the shadows of the hall outside of his bedroom. "Problem...?" Calmly, a deep voice asked.

"I think Luana is in danger, dad." Worried, Mike said. "She cancelled our date for Saturday saying that her dad got called off on a business trip to Europe but her father is a police detective."

Mike's father remained in the shadows. "That is strange." Raising a hand to his chin, he said. "Was there anything else that you found unusual? Did she stammer, gulp, leave any other clues?"

Mike nodded. "I heard her gulp and she did stammer." Wincing, he said. "I could hear someone breathing close to her." He teared up. "She could have been kidnapped and I'm just sitting here!"

Mike threw off his covers only his father stepped into the dim light of his room. He was massively muscular, wearing pajama shorts and a muscle shirt. He was also covered in heavy hair from his head to his toe. "Steady there, pup!" Sternly, he barked. "Don't go running in half cocked!" He then more softly added, "We have more subtle ways of confirming if our friends are in danger..."

***********************************


Moments later, back at aunt Fawn's house, I heard the growling of a large dog or wolf outside. Luana heard it too and we both looked out a window to find...
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Next day

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"Where did these come from?" Luana asked. "They look like dog prints. Big dog prints."

"Doesn't smell like a dog, though," I said. The scent was wild, yet somehow... familiar.

I went downstairs, where Dad was getting ready for work. "Can I ask you to check something out?"

"What is it?"

"Luana and I spotted some funny tracks outside. We were wondering if you could identify them?"

Without another word, Dad holstered his gun and stepped outside. After a few minutes, he came back inside. "They're wolf tracks," he said. "People have seen them in several places in town. Funny thing is, nobody's spotted any wolves or wolf packs anywhere. It's a mystery how this wolf is getting around."

"All the security cameras around, and none of them have picked up this wolf?"

"Not a one. If I didn't know better, I'd think it was deliberately avoiding the cameras. But how would a wolf know what a camera is, let alone how they work?"

"You want to know what else is weird? Something about the scent smells familiar. I can't place it, but I keep thinking I should know this wolf."

"That is weird. Well, we can solve the mystery of the world's smartest wolf some other time. I'll make arrangements for our trip to Italy while I'm at the station. Why don't you let your friends know what's going on, introduce the Winters kids to the people we know?"
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: nothing but strange tracks in the yard.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Just as dad finished his sentence, I caught the scent of an expensive perfume and heard the light tapping of a cane approaching the house. "We have a visitor."

A heavy knock came to the door, I recognized the sound of wood against wood and knew the visitor knocked with her cane. Dad answered and immediately hugged the elderly woman who was at the door. She was near your height with white hair tied into a small bun near the top of her head and deep green eyes. She was professionally dressed and carried a willow wood cane with a small crystal ball on the top. It was clear to me that dad greatly respected her.

"Madame Vague, I am honored to be in your presence." Smiling, dad said. "What brings you to my brother's home?"

"This is not an official visit, Tinker." Smiling back Vague replied. "However, I would warn you that dark forces are at play." She sighed. "I am here to see our new allies."

My heart raced at the mention of the woman's name. Madame Vague was a powerful ally to Miss Shadow. She had given cryptic advice to her and the members of the original problem child gang in times of doubt. She even occasionally fought along side Miss Shadow herself as she was nearly as immortal.

*Madame Vague has a unique power.* Softly, Dee told me. *Some have called it magic but it goes far deeper than just that. Not even Miss Shadow fully understood it.*

"You must be Miss Silhouette." Starling me, Vague said. She giggled at my expression. "You need to learn to keep one ear and one eye open at all times."

"I'm working on it." Blushing, I said.

Vague smiled. "I understand that you have trouble seeing paintings and photographs." Calmly, she said. "Miss Shadow had similar issues but there is a way around that."

"Really?" Surprised, I asked. "How?"

"You have an extra pair of eyes that you have not yet opened." Cryptically, Vague said. "Do not be afraid to let in the light." She then turned to Laura who was standing right next to me, looking concerned. "Eli spoke highly of you, young lady though I doubt he admitted it to you." Smiling, she said. "He saw a lot of himself in you which was why he was reluctant to give you the power you now possess."

Laura gulped. "Got any advice for me?" Nervous, she asked.

Vague smiled kindly. "You can learn a lot from Kyra's mistake." Cryptically, she said. "A cry into the darkness sometimes brings an answer."

With that, she walked over to Tommy and Aura, leaving me confused. "Now I know why they call her Madame Vague." Confused, I thought. "Any idea what she might have meant, Dee?"

Dee giggled. *She was referring to me.* Calmly, she explained. *While you and I do communicate, we need to act as one for you to be able to use my eyes.*

This confused me more. "How can you see?"

*Telepathically.* Simply, Dee replied. *Tommy Winters has the same ability.*

That was when I understood. "You see through the eyes of every creature around you, including people."

*Correct.* Calmly, Dee said. *Just because you do not see the fly or the dove or the rat does not mean they are not there.*

I felt my heart race again as I turned to a photograph hanging on the wall. Though I knew now was not the right time, I could not wait to be able to sense such things. "What of Laura?" Curious, I thought.

*She has a symbiont too, Melissa.* Simply, Dee replied. *Only like Kyra, she does not yet know how to reach her as she was raised to face her battles alone.*

I sighed, knowing I would have to help Laura with that before we left Friday morning for Italy; it was Wednesday morning. Thankfully, the beginning of summer vacation. It would have been harder if we had to deal with school on top of all of this.

"Look upon me with your gifts and make your own judgement." Calmly, Vague said to Tommy and Aura. "If you feel you can trust me, we will continue. If not, I will leave you in peace without protest."

Tommy and Aura turned to each other then looked at Vague for what seemed like an eternity though it was only a minute or two. Finally, they smiled. "We trust you." softly, Tommy said. Aura nodded, indicating the same.

Vague smiled then offered to...
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Enter Madame Vague.

choices: I try seeing through another's eyes
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"You have an uncle here in town," Madame Vague said. "I can take you to him, if you like."

"You would do that for us?" Tommy asked.

"Of course, child," she said with a smile. "I will make arrangements. You will be with family tonight."

Aura ran over and hugged Madame Vague. "Thankyouthankyouthankyou."

"That's really very nice of you," I said. "In the meantime, I'm going to say goodbye to a new friend of mine. Would you like to meet her?"

"Sure!"

So the three of us went to see Faith.

She wasn't her usual chipper self. "I know I'm a mess," she said. "Morning sickness is bad today."

Aura touched Faith's hand. "You're scared."

Faith shook her head. "My mom says it happens to a lot of moms-to-be."

"Not that," Aura countered. "Your daddy was mean to you. He hurt you. And you're scared you're going to hurt your baby."

Faith's jaw dropped. "I... I never heard it put into words before." She patted Aura's head. "I guess I am scared of that, sweetie. I just wish there was someone I could talk to."

"There's a lot of people who can help you, I'm sure of it," I said. "Part of the reason I came to see you, Faith, is because Luana and I will be out of town this weekend. Italy, to be more specific."

"What's in Italy?"

"The Agency. I'm going to scope out their HQ, see what kind of perimeter defenses they have, before we strike."

Faith put her hand on my shoulder. "Stay safe, Melissa."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: reunite them with their uncle.

choices: I had a fear of mice.
I feared for the safety of the mouse.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
After we had returned home to aunt Fawn's house, I gave myself a little alone time so to try to figure out how to see through Dee's eyes. "Okay, how exactly does this work?" Nervous, I thought. "Do we synchronize our minds or something?"

Dee giggled. *It's not quite that complex.* Bemused, she said. *Go to a picture or painting and clear your mind.*

Having no clue what to expect, I walked to a picture hanging in the spare bedroom where Laura and I were sharing and did my best to clear my mind. As I did, the image behind the glass slowly came to view. It would appear then vanish then appear again. Still, I was able to see that it was an image of aunt Fawn and uncle Stan on their wedding night. "I can't seem to focus on the picture enough." Disappointed, I thought.

*While I can see through the eyes of a fly, I cannot make it hold still.* Serious, Dee explained. *You need to learn to be a fast study.*

"I have a lot to learn." Sighing, I thought. "How did Ms D do it?"

*Miss shadow had the advantage of having a pet mouse.* Almost sadly, Dee said. *She called her Oracle. She died shortly after otherwise she would have found her way to you.*

Again, my heart raced. "That's who she was referring to when she called upon Oracle for help in the graphic novel." Surprised, I whispered. "Here I thought it was another human character in the story." I giggled. "It's a simple but brilliant solution but do we have time to buy and train a mouse for the task?"

There was a pause before Dee said, *Madame Vague has already solved that issue for us; look at your nightstand.*

Curious, I turned to find a small cage I had not noticed before. Walking over, I noticed a note written in braille that read:

Her name is Gaia. She was to become Oracle's replacement had Miss Shadow lived on. Treat her well and she will serve you well.

Looking at the cage, I shuddered because...
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: I try seeing through Dee's eyes

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
I thought of all the times Dad had set up mouse traps at home. "How am I supposed to keep her safe?"

*Madame Vague and her associates train these mice well,* Dee told me. *Gaia will stay close to you when she's out of her cage. She won't even soil you.*

I knelt in front of the cage. "Hello, Gaia. I'm Melissa. Shall we be friends?"

In response, her nose twitched, and I was suddenly seeing a giant woman. I smiled, she smiled, and I realized I was seeing myself. "This will take some getting used to."

*That will come in time. Why don't you introduce her to the family?*

I opened the cage door, and Gaia went right to it. I held out my hand, and she ran right up my arm and perched on my shoulder.

I walked downstairs and joined the family. "Where did that come from?" Aunt Fawn asked, a mixture of curiosity and revulsion on her face.

"Madame Vague gave her to me," I replied. "Her name's Gaia. She's going to be my eyes."

"Your what?"

"I can see through Gaia's eyes."

Kyra didn't like mice much more than her mother did, but knowing I could use it to see sparked her curiosity. "What's it like? Aren't mice color-blind?"

"I'm getting no shortage of colors."

"I'll need to break out the Crayolas so you can learn."

She did, and that's how I learned the colors I've mentioned, though we never did figure out how a mouse could see them.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: I feared for the safety of the mouse.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Every day since discovering my new abilities has been an adventure for me. It felt good to learn the names of all the colors now that I could perceive color. "I wonder how Gaia is able to perceive color?" thinking aloud, I mused.

*Gaia is linked with you telepathically.* Serious, Dee replied. *She makes the link between you and I stronger. That said, she can perceive color just as you can and shares in your immortality. Oracle lived more than a hundred years with Miss Shadow.*

"So she will be safe with me." Relieved, I thought. "That makes me feel better."

Deciding it was time to tell Luana about her own symbiont, I called her to our bedroom and told her what I had learned from Dee.

"How come I didn't know about my symbiont before?" Curious, Luana asked.

"When you were Zack, you thought that asking for help was unmanly." Serious, I replied. "You're not worried about how masculine people think you are anymore, but you still act like it's you against the world." I gave a rueful smile. "Reach out, I promise a hand will take yours."

Luana sighed and sat down Indian style to meditate. At first, nothing seemed to happen but then Luana opened her eyes, surprised. "Her name is Dawn." Softly, she said. "Only she seems awfully shy."

*Dawn is young compared to most symbionts.* Calmly, Dee explained. *I have heard her cry out when danger was near but small talk does not seem to be one of her strengths.*

*Your world is a frightening place.* I heard Dawn softly say. *I miss the comfort of the darkness of space.*

"She talks in rhymes..." Raising an eyebrow, Luana whispered. Then she smiled and said, "Fate bring us both hither but we can face the danger together."

I smiled hearing Dawn giggle. *Your name is of the moon and mine is of the sun.* Still shy, she said. *We will face the danger as one.*

*Luana has the ability to sense danger that your heightened senses cannot detect.* Serious, Dee said. *It is an extra sensory perception that acts like an early warning system to her mind.*

This made me curious. "Then why did she not act when Stalker came that night?"

*Luana is still shy about her new body and she was sitting on the toilet at the time.* Serious, Dee replied. *Dawn did however send out a warning cry to Dana's symbiont, waking Dana into action.*

I nodded, understanding then with Gaia on my shoulder, turned to the picture on the wall and cleared my mind. I saw the wedding picture as clear as day in full color. All of the members of the original problem child gang were there with glasses raised to toast aunt Fawn and uncle Stan on their wedding night. It brought a tear to my eye as I could now see the pictures above the mantle at home. "Gaia, Dee, i think this is the beginning of a beautiful relationship." Whispering, I said.

The following morning, after ensuring everything we needed was packed, dad and uncle Stan escorted Luana and I to the airport with Gaia in a carry on pet holder.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Beautiful relationships.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
At the airport, Luana and I received lanyards saying we were unaccompanied minors. The change in cabin pressure was no fun, but it didn't last too long. A few people gave us strange looks when they saw Gaia, but she was a quiet pet, and some of them became more accepting as the flight went on.

The in-flight movie wasn't interesting, so I divided my attention between sharing my meal with Gaia and studying my language discs. Not only was I supposed to be a regular American kid going to Italy, but having some grasp of Italian could only be useful as the mission went forward. Meanwhile, Luana meditated, getting to know her symbiont.

While Gaia enjoyed a pretzel, I caught a familiar scent, and gripped Luana's arm. "What is it?" she asked, more than a hint of annoyance in her voice.

"The wolf is on the plane."

She looked around the cabin. "Can you tell where?"

I shook my head. "It's the same air circulating all over the plane. It could be anywhere."

When we landed, we looked around as inconspicuously as we could, but nobody collected a wolf.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: During the flight to Italy.

choices: Mike follows us to Cloaked Dagger HQ.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Upon stepping off the terminal into Roma Urbe airport, Luana brought my attention to a professionally dressed man and a woman, both in their early thirties, holding up a sign with our names on them. "They must be our European friends." Whispering, she said.

I nodded but paused upon catching the scent of the wolf again. "We better hurry." Whispering, I told her. "I'm smelling that wolf again and he's close."

We approached the woman as she was the closest. She was tall and slender with shoulder length blond hair and hazel eyes. "Miss Silhouette and the Invisible shield, I presume." Flatly, she said. We nodded. "I am Creed and the man with me is Ace."

I nodded to the man, Ace. He was a bald, slender and muscular man of average height with piercing green eyes. "We need to hurry." Whispering, I said. "I caught the scent of a wolf nearby and I fear he is stalking us."

Creed and Ace looked about, their eyes sharp before quickly escorting the two of us out of the airport to an awaiting car. We all piled in and Ace drove off towards Rome. "Does this wolf you sniffed have a name?" Curious, Creed asked.

"That's the strange part of it." Honestly, I said. "I was not being metaphoric. I sniffed out a real wolf and he was on the plane with us."

"How do you know it was a he?" Also curious, Ace asked.

I gave a rueful smile. "Let's just say I know what a male smells like when he is excited and leave it at."

Luana winced at that but only I seemed to notice. Thanks to Gaia, I caught Ace sharing a worried glance with Creed through the rear view mirror. "They know this wolf or at least know of him." Worried, I thought. "But do they know him as a friend or foe?"

***********************************************************


At the airport, Mike walked off the plane into the terminal to see Melissa and Luana walking towards two adults and became concerned. "They are not with their father, as I had suspected." Worried, he muttered. "I better tail them until I have a better idea of what is going on."

Suddenly, Melissa turned his way, looking spooked. He saw her twitching her nose, sniffing the air. "She can smell me?!" Surprised, he thought. "It makes sense as she is blind, he other senses naturally would be more acute." He knotted his jaws in decision. "I will have to be careful."

Sticking to the crowds, Mike followed Melissa and Luana out of the airport where he saw them enter a black sedan with tinted windows and drive off as high speed. Knowing he had seconds before he lost them, he ran along the side of the road after the car. He was more than capable to keep up with the car, having the skills he possessed, his concern was losing sight of it. Worse, he feared the driver or passengers would discover he was following. His father's words rang in his mind...

"The Cloaked Dagger deals with people who do not care who they kill to get what they are after." Serious, he had warned. "That said, they tend to shoot first and ask questions later. Be always on your guard..."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Meeting the Cloaked Dagger

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
We drove into the country. I enjoyed looking at the scenery for the first time in my life. "How far is it to your headquarters?"

"Not far," Ace said.

We turned to approach a rock formation. Before we got too close to it, Ace pushed a button, and the road ahead became a ramp heading downwards.

When we stopped, Creed and Ace opened the doors for us. "Welcome to the Redoubt," Ace said.

"The what?" Luana asked.

"It means 'stronghold,'" Creed explained.

"Why not just call it the Stronghold, then?"

Ace shot her a look.

A pair of kids about our age came up to us. "Where are the Winters children?" the older one said, in accented English.

"Tommy and Aura are back home," I answered. "They've been reunited with an uncle, on their mother's side. They asked not to be sent back, so we'll leave them at home until they say otherwise."

"But you came."

"My heightened senses may detect early warning systems at the Agency that others might miss. And Luana has powers that even the original Invisible Shield didn't have."

"Sound strategy," Creed said.

"Yeah," Luana added, "except we didn't plan on that wolf following us all the way to Italy."

"We'll see about that wolf when we get to it," Ace said.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Mike follows us to Cloaked Dagger HQ.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Uncertain, we followed the group through a heavy metal door into a long hall that lead to another and another. "What's with the maze?" Worried, Laura demanded.

"I understand your concerns." Calmly, Creed said. "These hallways were already here when we took it over. It was to slow down anyone who managed to gain entry."

After taking nearly a dozen turns passed various rooms and other hallways, we entered a large conference room where everyone was urged to take a seat. Waiting for them were a small number of adults in their early to mid thirties with serious expressions on their faces. Creed urged us both to sit down side by side as a boy no older than myself walked up with his hands passively behind his back. Professionally dressed, he was rather muscular with black hair and piercing green eyes.

"Good morning, children." Calmly, he said. "My group name is Cog. As you may or may not have guessed, I have not aged in over fifty years. I have the ability to slow down or even work outside of normal time."

"Incredible..." Stunned, I whispered.

"How is that even possible?" Perplexed, Luana demanded.

"For now, all you need to understand is that there are certain places on our planet where powerful people are born." Serious, Cog replied. "that said, there are powerful people, both good and evil, after the secrets of these places." He sighed. "It is our job to protect those secrets."

"I'm guessing we are a part of that secret." Softly, I said.

"All those born in these places are a part of that secret." Gently, Creed said. "The point is, we cannot allow that power to fall into the wrong hands."

"Hence the birth of the Cloaked Dagger and The Problem Child Gang." Serious, Cog said. "We all knew and understood that the fight would rekindle eventually as it had again and again all around the world for decades."

"An endless waltz..." Softly, I said.

Cog nodded. "Precisely." Firmly, he replied. "All we can do is put out the fires in front of us and pray others after us pick up the fight."

"You've already met Creed and Ace." Calmly, Cog said. "Creed has a twin sister, named Vendetta who is working as a double agent in the Agency with her 'handler' Josh who works for the British secret Service in conjunction with MI5."

Creed smiled. "We both are literally masters in all styles of fighting with gun, knife or bare hand." Calmly, she said. "We are nearly untouchable in combat."

Cog nodded. "Ace has the ability to literally become one with any vehicle, piloting them with incredible skill. He can also possess any person he chooses and 'pilot' them as well within a certain distance."

"That's insane..." Startled, I muttered.

"No more insane than the powers of Miss shadow and the Invisible shield, which I assume they passed on to the two of you." Calmly, a plump man in loose fitting clothing said. "They call me Freak. I have the ability to grow into a literal giant and fire energy blasts from my hands. Originally, I worked for a group called The Guard back in the States but they asked me to give them a hand."

Freak had gentle blue eyes but his wind burned face was covered in scars, making me wince, he reminded me of my uncle Stan without his shirt on. He smiled kindly at my reaction. "I have looked worse after a mission."

"They call me Blacksmith." A towering muscular man said. "I built anything and everything they needed from Assault rifles to Zeno tapes." He smiled. "Also, I'm not half bad when it comes to fighting if I have to."

I nodded but winced as I saw through Gaia that Blacksmith seemed to be made or at least covered in steel from head to toe with just his green eyes showing through a steel mask. Luana, I noticed was crying for the man. "What happened to you?" Shocked, she asked. "Who did this to you?!"

"Blacksmith was badly injured during our last mission twenty years ago." Sadly, Cog replied. "He had shielded us from a massive explosion that would have killed us all." He paused, rubbing one eye. "He may have had a body like steel but he still suffered from third degree burns over more than seventy percent of his body."

"This steel seeped from my own body to protect me while I slowly healed." With a slight smile, Blacksmith explained. "It stayed so I am now literally a 'man of steel'.

I nodded at that as did Luana. "We know from experience that this job is dangerous." Serious, i said. "We are here to help and we are not about to back out."

Luana nodded firmly, signifying that she agreed. Cog nodded in return. "We are glad to hear that, Miss Silhouette and invisible Shield."

"You may call me Gargoyle." Calmly, another muscular man said. "I have the ability to shape shift into any creature I desire, past, present, or mythological. My brother has the same powers but he has moved to the States to help the clean up crew there." He frowned. "I heard that he and his wife produced a child who, after a failed assassination attempt, was born with an advanced form of our powers."

Gargoyle had longish black hair and piercing green eyes with a face, an entire body that looked as if it were carved from stone. All I could do was nod in return.

"You may call me Mirage." Calmly, a slender woman said. "I have the ability to create solid illusions to distract, slow down, or even fight any would be pursuers or enemies." She sighed. "Make no mistake, what you are hearing, The Agency already knows as we have dealt with them on more than a few occasions."

Mirage had long brown hair and brown eyes and wore regular western style clothing which confused me. A bemused smile formed on her face seeing my expression. "The best way to vanish into a crowd is to blend in." Smiling slightly, she said.

"These are the original members of The Cloaked Dagger." Serious, Cog said. "The children who came out to greet you are the next generation of freedom fighters, the new Cloaked Dagger."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: The other Cloaked Dagger members

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
The Italian boy stepped forward first. "I am Umbro," he said. "I have the ability to create and project darkness."

"That ought to come in handy," Luana said.

"The Cloaked Dagger calls me Scholar," said the girl. "I know how to do many things, with no training."

"A real know-it-all, huh?"

"I hardly think so," she replied. "Ask me the simplest question you can about me."

I shrugged. "Okay. What's your name?"

"I have no idea. I know absolutely nothing about myself." She sat down. "My first memory is waking up in the morgue, with the coroner about to begin my autopsy. I can tell you how to do his job, but every detail of my own life is hidden from me. The coroner took to calling me Debbie, because the tag on my toe said 'D. B.,' for dead body. That's as close as I've come to having a real name to call myself."

"I'm sorry to hear that,... Debbie."

Luana looked around. "I half expected the kids of the original Cloaked Dagger to be here."

"Freak has a daughter, but she's in the States," Scholar said. "A bit surprising, since he's gay, but it's true. A few of the others have children, but they don't want them around this place."

"So, naturally, we came straight here from school."

We turned. Four or five kids had joined us.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Meeting the new Cloaked Dagger.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"G'day." In a British accent, the first boy said. "I'm Crikey, son of Cog. I have the ability to make myself look like anyone of any age, gender, or nationality. On top of that, I instantly know everything the person I impersonate knows about him or herself and others."

Crikey was near my age, slender with short honey blond hair and blue eyes. He wore gender neutral clothing which i guessed helped with his ability. "That could be very useful." Impressed, I said.

Crikey shrugged. "It has its ups and downs." Honestly, he said. "As a girl or woman, I have all of their problems including periods and the risk of becoming pregnant if I get raped so I have to be careful. That and, once I change back, I soon forget everything I had gained from the transformation so everything has to be written down which carries its own risks."

A petite young girl with long blond hair and blue eyes approached wearing a Lolita dress, black mary janes and a doll mask. "I'm Puppenmacher, it means doll maker." Her voice was soft and melodious. "You may call me puppet, if you wish. I am Ace's daughter."

"What is your ability?" Curious, Luana asked.

Puppet smiled and wiggled a single finger at Luana and she suddenly found herself dancing around the room. "Hey!" surprised, she protested. "Stop!"

Puppet giggled before wigging her finger again and Luana stopped dancing. "Forgive me but it was easier to show you than to just tell you." Bemused, she said.

"You have the ability to control anyone's physical movements within a certain range whether they are willing or not." Guessing correctly, I said. "How many are you able to control at one time?"

"I can control up to ten grown men but I have to physically see them to control their movements." Serious, Puppet explained. "That and they are in a daze when I control them, almost like lifeless dolls." She motioned to Luana. "I only controlled Luana's feet so her mind remained clear."

A girl and a boy walked up wearing a standard school uniform. They were both an inch shorter than me with shoulder length forest brown hair and forest green eyes. "We are Gemini." In unison, they said. "We have the real power of might and magic."

Cog cleared his throat, catching my attention. "The boy, Gem, despite his young age, has incredible physical attributes that would make an Olympian warrior green with envy." Serious, he explained. "His senses are almost as sharp as your own."

"So Ini is a witch?" Guessing, Luana asked.

"Ini, short for Inina, is one of the last true magic wielders that we are aware of." Serious, Cog said. "They are Creed's adopted children." He sighed. "Like Timmy and Aura, we had rescued them from the Agency."

"We now work to stop them from ruining any more lives." In unison, Gemini said. "We are the members of the new Cloaked Dagger."

"Don't forget about me..." Timidly, a voice said. "I'm part of the team too."

We all turned to a small boy no taller than Kyra sitting in a chair. He had short black hair and blue eyes, wearing the standard school uniform. "Miss silhouette, invisible shield, I give you Scout." smiling slightly, Cog said. "He has the ability to see for miles despite any obstacles, including darkness, and can teleport himself and others up to a mile in any direction."

"I just don't like fighting." Wincing, Scout said.

"Scout can break concrete with his bare hands." Calmly, Creed explained. "He fears his power so he does not like to fight unless there is no choice."

"It is a pleasure to meet you all." Calmly, I said. "The invisible Shield and I are here on a reconnaissance mission to find a secret way into the Agency stronghold so we can take them down once and for all."

Gemini shook their heads. "There is no secret way in but there is a secret way out." Firmly, they said. "The door does not open from the outside."

"Where does this door lead to?" Curious, I asked.

"The exit they are referring to is a delivery point for supplies." Serious, Cog explained. "It is not really an entrance or and exit but Gemini managed to use it to escape where Creed's twin sister, Vendetta helped them to get away."

"We may be able to use that but we will have to first see if security had not been tightened there since the escape." Serious, you said.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Continue

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Luana and I prepared for our reconnaissance mission. We dressed in dark green (which, we'd been told, would blend into the darkness better than black) and applied greasepaint to our faces. My outfit, I was glad to see, was equipped with a pouch for Gaia to curl up in if things got hairy.

"You'll need these," Cog said, handing us smart phones. "In case the Agency has audio monitoring. They're on a secure frequency, so your texts should be safe from prying eyes."I

I nodded, then turned to Ace. "All set?"

"Ready at any moment," he replied.

I turned to Scout. "Keep an eye on us, won't you?"

"Of course."

As Ace drove us, Luana gave me a crash course in textspeak.

Ace let us out near a wooded area. We could see a structure in the distance, which we figured to be Agency headquarters. As we approached, Luana texted me: "W U?"

"TREES R HUMMING," I texted back. "DEF OPEN MIC NIGHT"

We drew a little closer, then I stopped. Luana texted, "?"

I pointed ahead. "ELECTRIC EYES. I DON'T DARE GO CLOSER."

She nodded. "I DO." With that, she turned invisible.

As I waited for word from Luana, I caught an all too familiar scent: The wolf was nearby.

"I know you're here," I whispered. "If you don't bother me, I won't bother you. Okay?"

I don't know what I expected. I think I was just talking to myself. Nevertheless, the wolf seemed to nod, and sat down about 20 feet away.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: I investigate the delivery entrance.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"You there, freeze!" Threatening, a man's voice commanded. I slowly turned to see four men in security uniforms walk up to me with metal batons in hand. I could smell gun oil so I knew that they were armed. I gripped my special walking stick in case a fight was necessary but decided to act blind for the moment. It was dark and the guards did not have any night vision equipment on them.

"This is a restricted area, kid." Firmly, the second guard barked. "Move along!"

I don't know why but a small grin toughed the corners of my mouth. "I don't think so..."

With that, my walking stick came in half with a twist and extended into two fighting staffs. With a quick spin, I knocked out the first two guards with a blow to their jaws. The other two, surprise on their faces, reached for their guns. The first found himself being hit by an invisible force while the other screamed being tackled by a wolf the size of a bear! the force of the tackle knocked the man out but the wolf jumped back with a loud whimper of pain as a shot rang out from the darkness. I turned to the wolf to find it had been shot in the shoulder and was bleeding badly. I then turned to the gunshot to find four other guards approaching.

"Not to worry, love." Came a male British voice. "It's just a small patrol."

Before I could react, a small boy, no older than ten appeared next to me. He was dressed in old western style clothing with a black scarf around his eyes and baton in each hand. "Who..."

"The name is Madcap." Calmly, the boy replied. "I'm blind too but my other senses make up for it nicely." He motioned to the approaching guards. "We can talk after we deal with these blokes and see to your Lycan friend."

I turned to the wolf and gasped as I found that it had become human. Luana gasped as well. "Mike...?!" Surprised, she whispered.

Knowing that introductions and questions would have to wait, I silently nodded and the three of us took on the four approaching guards. Madcap fought as well as I did with moves similar to what Dee had taught me. After they were all dealt with, Ace texted, U O K?

I texted back, AAK 411 @ U 20.

I turned back to see Luana dressing Mike's wound just as he was slowly regaining consciousness. "What are you doing here?!" Worried, Luana demanded. "You could have been killed!" She paused. "And since when were you a werewolf?!"

Mike chuckled. "Since when were you able to turn invisible and fight like that?" Smiling, weakly, he countered. "The mane is Lycan..."

Luana smiled back. "Miss Silhouette and the Invisible shield, at your service."

"Eh, Invisible shield, I could use your muscle, love." Firmly, Madcap said. "We need to cover up our little walk in the park."

Albeit reluctantly, Luana walked away from Mike and helped Madcap drag the eight men onto a pair of nearby benches where Madcap then placed a few small round devices at their feet. Shortly after, they shot out a green mist that smelled strongly of cheap beer. "What is that stuff?" Wrinkling my nose, I demanded.

"These blokes will wake up in a few hours with a hangover, smelling like they had been drinking all night." Smiling, madcap said. "Even if they report their encounter with us, most will shrug it off as a drunken dream, thinking they got into a bar brawl."

"That's clever." Nodding, Mike said. "Thanks for your help."

"My pleasure, Lycan." Bowing, Madcap said. "Once a Knight, always a Knight."

Luana smiled. "Knights of the alliance." Softly, she said. "They are Europe's version of the guard."

Madcap nodded. "Lycans father was the leader of that group." surprising all, he said. "They called him Huntsman." He smiled. "Don't be too surprised if he jumps in when you need the help the most."

"We are trying to see if we can gain access to..." I began to say.

"After the last escape, all possible entrances and exits have been carefully guarded." Interrupting me, Madcap said. "The only way in is to teleport."

After a thought, I smiled as I knew of at least two people who could arrange that. "Let's get out of here, then." Quietly, i said. "We have a lot of planning ahead of us."

After we had all regrouped at Cloaked Dagger HQ....
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Knights of the Alliance.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Mike was ushered into another room, which I understood to be the medical facilities. Creed closed the door behind her, leaving us with nothing to do but wait.

After an hour, she opened the door again. "He heals quickly," she said, "thanks to his lycanthropy. Most of our work was digging the bullet out before the wound closed. It'll be a fair bit before he's up and about, but he should be able to take visitors."

Luana didn't need to be told twice. She was in the room like a shot, and she had her arms around Mike by the time the rest of us could get through the door.

After that embrace, it was down to important matters. "When were you going to tell me you were a werewolf?"

"It's hardly first date material," he replied. "You think my dad told my mom he turned into a creature that every movie says is a mindless killer one second before he was sure he wanted her to spend the rest of her life with him? Besides , it's not like you told me everything about you, did you, Invisible Shield?"

She nodded. "Fair enough. I have kept a lot from you, Mike. I guess I was scared what you would think of me, once you knew."

"And, on that note," I said , " I think it's time we gave you two some privacy." We left them reasonably alone.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Luana and Mike talked.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
I grabbed a secure line and called back home. Kyra answered after three rings. "Hello?"

"It's me, Kyra," I said . "It's time to give you an update."

"What's the situation?"

"There's exactly one way into Agency HQ. We can get in, but it's time for you, Dana, and Justin to come to Italy. And let the Winters kids know. Whether they join us is up to them, but the three of you will be needed, according to Jeremy."

"Wow," Kyra said. "I kind of like the idea of flying with Justin. I just wish I could say more than hoo when he's around."

"When we see each other again, I'll tell you about the first person to make me say hoo. Catch you later, cousin. Oh, and tell Dad that he doesn't need to worry about that mystery wolf."

"How come?"

"Long story. For now, let's just say that it isn't looking for trouble."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Calling back home

choices: Mike found a way to come along.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
As we waited for the rest of the raiding party to arrive, Luana and I worked with the members of the Cloaked Dagger and the Knights to put together a plan to bring about the Ageny's end. "Attacking this organization head on is not going to bring them down." Serious, I said. "It's been tried."

"What we need is a way to expose them to the world at large." Calmly, Luana added. "Jeremy's thumb drive provided exactly what we need to secure."

I nodded. "The Black files." Darkly, I said. "They contain every last dirty deed the organization has ever done from its very beginnings."

"Once those files see the light of day, the Agency will be done for as every law enforcement agency in the world will be gunning for them." Serious, Cog said. "However, no one knows where they are kept within their headquarters, we tried."

I smiled, surprising Cog. "Tommy and Aura Winters know where they are." Calmly, I countered. "Tommy can see through the eyes of anyone around him and Aura knows anyone she encounters better then they know themselves."

"They told you were these files are?" Raising an eyebrow, Creed asked.

"They told Jeremy." Softly, Luana said. "As he told us in his video, he had been busy."

"How did he manage this?" Curious, Cog asked.

"Jeremy's powers were similar to your own, Cog." Serious, I explained. "He was able to work outside of time, to see true and possible futures."

"So, where are we teleporting to?" Nervous, Scout asked.

"Only, Wildcard, Brawn, Visionary, Invisible Shield and myself are going in." Firmly, I replied. "A small raiding party will be necessary for this to work."

"I'm going with you." Entering the room, Mike said. "My animalistic senses and fighting styles will come in handy."

"We will serve better as a back up team in case things go astray." Startling all a booming voice said. "I did say I would return when I was needed."

Everyone turned to find the towering figure of Mike's father who they had called Huntsman. with him was Kyra, Justin, and Dana. "How did you all get here so fast?"

"They had help, of course." Walking into view, Madam Vague replied. "I cannot stay long, but I can tell you all that this mission will change the lives of many." She then whispered, "Come back alive, all of you."

With that said, she flipped a card from a deck in a pouch on her belt and vanished. "Madame Vague has earned her name and reputation in more ways than one." Softly, Huntsman said. "Tommy and aura winters have chosen to remain behind and help Paige and the Problem Child Gang take out CHILD." he sighed. "Apparently, they have some form of plan."

I nodded but said nothing as Huntsman continued. "We will need to teleport you into the old industrial wing of the complex where the security system is full of holes." Serious, he said. "The Black Files are in a storage room just outside of that wing."

"An in and out operation." Smiling, Scout said.

"Nothing is just in and out, young man." Darkly, Huntsman said. "Forever keep your guard up if you wish to live as long as Miss Shadow and the Invisible Shield."

Luana and I nodded then turned to Scout. "It's now or never." Serious, I said. "Let's get this done so we can end their reign of terror once and for all."

"Good luck." Sincerely, Cog said. "We will be waiting in case you need help."

Mike gave Luana a kiss. "Come back to me alive."

Luana kissed him back. "You know I will."

With that, Scout had us all form a circle around him and he closed his eyes in concentration. "Call us if you need to be pulled out but remember to be in a circle when you do." Serious, he said. "Otherwise, I may miss one."

Well all nodded and we suddenly found ourselves inside a dark storeroom somewhere. our mission had begun.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: The gang's all here

choices: Alpha, the head of the Agency.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
There was nothing of interest in the dark room we had appeared in. Mostly office and cleaning supplies. I crept up to the door leading out and knelt down with Gaia in hand. "Let's see what's waiting for us." whispering, I said.

Gaia crawled under the door into the other room and looked about with me seeing through her eyes. The storeroom opened into a long T shaped hall going left, right and straight ahead with several doors on either side of each. Just as Tommy and Aura had said, the complex was an intricate maze. Looking around, Gaia revealed a single camera slowly moving back and forth about half way down each hall with the one that would spot us seemingly fixed upon the door we had to exit through. "Damn!"

Listening, I could hear the tiny motor of the camera struggling to move the camera which meant it was malfunctioning. There was no telling how soon it would be before someone came to service it. Gaia looked around again and I saw the door we were hoping to find, filing room number thirteen. It was card locked with a code key but fortunately or unfortunately, it was open a jar. this could only mean that someone was in there or someone had carelessly left it open. "We need to get passed the camera and into that filing room." Frustrated, I thought. "Any ideas, Gaia?"

As if sensing my thoughts, Gaia scurried across the hall and climbed a wire to the camera and began to stare into the lens as if sniffing around for food. Seeing our opportunity, I turned to the others. "We need to move quickly and quietly." Whispering, I said. "Gaia is keeping the camera busy."

The others nodded and we all hurried out of the storeroom to the filing room where I carefully opened the door before mentally calling for Gaia. The mouse scurried back down the wire and ran onto my hand, up my arm to the safety of my breast pocket. "Why was the door left open?" Worried, Kyra whispered. "It seems all too convenient."

Then, in a surprise move, she pulled me back, out of the room. "What..."

I turned pale when Kyra pointed at the room number. There was the outline of another number on the door window. "This is one-thirteen." Whispering, Kyra said. "I learned to listen to the warnings of the other symbionts."

"A trap." whispering, Dana said. "Good thing you caught that, Visionary."

I nodded, knowing that we would have to use our assumed names while in enemy territory and looked around to find that the numbers were all mixed up with no obvious order to them. "It might take a while before we find the right room."

After a moment of thought, Luana turned to me. "Didn't Tommy and Aura say that the room that held the Black Files had no number but letters?"

I followed Luana's gaze and smiled upon seeing a room marked 'AC storage'. It had a card and number lock and was shut tight. Using my heightened senses and Gaia's eyes, I could see the oil from people's fingerprints on seven of the ten numbers. I was also able to see a key lock which meant that the door could be accessed by either a key and a code or a card and code. i turned to Diana who was already working the key lock with two lock picks from her jacket pocket. "Once I get the key to turn, you will only have a few seconds to hit the right code or an alarm will sound." serious, she said. "Do you think you can do it?"

I gulped but paused as Kyra stepped up. "I can." Whispering, she said. "I'm in touch with Mecha, she can talk to machines. Punch in what I say when Wild Card has the key turned."

I nodded then, when Dana had the key turned, I hit the numbers Kyra whispered. "six...seven...three...six...seven...two...nine...seven...six...three."< br />
The lock beeped and a green light came on before the door opened with a click. I turned to the camera to find it still locked in place before urging everyone into the room before following them, quietly closing the door behind me. We immediately spotted two cameras on either side of the rectangular room, slowly moving back and forth. Fortunately, they were aimed high to spot adults who stood over the tall filing cabinets rather than children who were shorter. Remembering the numbers that corresponded with the numbers on a phone, I could not help smile at the code to enter the room. "Really, 'open says me'." Amused, I whispered. "How droll can you get?"

Kyra smiled back and we carefully moved passed the files to a specific cabinet that, of course, was locked. The seconds ticked by as Diana worked on the lock only Justin took hold of the handle and gave it a jerk, popping the lock and opening the drawer. "We don't have time for kid gloves." Serious, he whispered. "We need to get the files and leave, as quickly as possible."

There was no time to argue. I reached into the drawer and pulled out the objective of our raid. It was a single thick folder book containing many folders and files. On the top, in bold letters was the letters, 'Black Files'. "We need to be certain this is it or our raid will be for nothing." Urgently, i whispered.

The others nodded and I opened the folder book, keeping a keen ear out for trouble with Luana and the rest of the team doing the same. The first thing I found was a note from the previous leader of the Agency, Carlos.

This is my insurance in case I should be betrayed by those who seek to claim my power and wealth within the organization. Fear my wrath if you ever cross me!

Looking through Gaia's eyes, I skimmed through the folders with my eyes widening in fear, anger, and disgust. The agency was truly an evil organization into virtually everything illegal throughout the world. "This is it." Closing the file book, I said. "We have to get out of here."

Just as I said that, the door beeped and clicked before opening. We were no longer alone. I held my breath, watching as I saw a figure enter. As the figure stepped into the light we all saw it was...
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: The mission begins.

choices: We contact the British Secret Service.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
A tall well built man wearing a black business suit entered and spotted us immediately. His brown eyes fell down upon us and narrowed upon seeing the file in Dana's hands. "I see the Cloaked Dagger has sent a new generation of freedom fighters." Darkly, he said. "I take it Tommy and Aura Winters told you what to find here."

I stood up, defiance in my eyes. "I am Miss silhouette of the Problem Child Gang." Retrieving my fighting staffs, I said. "The Agency will fall very soon."

"Not with those dummy books they won't." surprising me, the man said. He turned to another cabinet and retrieved a much larger file book than the one we had found. "This is what you want."

"Why are you helping us?" Distrusting, Luana demanded.

"I am Josh Nomad of the British Secret Service." Softly, the man explained. "I and my team have been undermining the Agency's plans long before your Problem Child Gang or Cloaked Dagger crossed their path."

I introduced my team by their hero names then asked, "You'll forgive me if we don't trust you."

Josh cracked a small grin before handing Luana the heavy file book. "You have what you came for now you have two minutes to get out as I cannot allow my cover to be blown."

With that, he hit a small button near the door, sounding an alarm. "Take both books!" Urgent, I commanded. "We can't take the chance he's lying to us!"

We all ran out of the room with Josh behind us, barking "Intruders in the file room! I need back up, now! Now, damn it! Now!" I silenced his screams with a heavy blow to his scrotum then the head with one of my fighting staffs.

"Move! Move!" Yelling, I ordered.

The camera was dead set upon us now as we ran to the storage room to find it locked! Dana ran forward and kicked it open with incredible strength allowing us to run inside where I hit my earpiece radio. "We got what we came for!" Firmly, i called. "Get us out of here!"

"You need to be in a circle!" Scout replied. "Hurry!"

Remembering the strange condition of scout's teleportation method, we quickly formed a circle and vanished from the storeroom just before a tall and insanely muscular man entered and spotted what we had taken. Spotting him, we all declared in one voice, "Problem Child!"

We reappeared a second later inside Cloaked Dagger headquarters where Creed, Cog, and the others were waiting for us. "Did you retrieve the Black files?"

"There were two sets of Black Files so we took them both." Serious, I replied. "One of them was given to us by a Josh Nomad who..."

"He is a member of the British Secret Service." Serious, Cog interrupted. "He had been helping us keep The Agency at bay for years."

I blushed at that. "I hit him in the scrotum and head because he sounded an alarm on us."

Cog sighed. "Believe it or not, your move may have saved his life." Serious, he said. "In the Agency, failure is nearly always met with death." He then opened the book Josh had given us. "Yes, these are the real Black Files. Every dirty deed they had ever done."

"The question is, what what will the Agency do in retaliation?"

Without hesitation, I knotted my jaws in decision. "Let us act before they can."

Everyone in the room nodded in agreement.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: The Resistance.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
"I need to call Tex the Mighty." Serious, I said. "He has the connections needed for phase two."

Cog motioned to a phone at a nearby table then gave me his number to which I called, counting the rings until he answered on the third one. "Talk to me." Serious, he said.

"Tex, this is Silhouette." Equally serious, I said. "We have the package and are requesting the agreed routing code."

"I require the proper confirmation code." Calmly, dad countered.

I smiled, grateful that I had memorized the code speak from the graphic novels. "Snickersnee in Widdershins bringing collywobbles is a Taradiddle of Gubbins."

Dad snickered on the other line. "I'm surprised you memorized that insane confirmation code." Bemused, he said. "The agreed routing code is drop the chase or lose the case."

"A way to back out?" surprised, I asked.

"I'm not referring to chasing us." Darkly, dad replied. "I am referring to chasing power. Disband or the files see the light of day."

I turned to the members of the Cloaked Dagger, as the phone was on speaker. They all darkly nodded, agreeing to dad's plan of an ultimatum to The Agency. "The agreed routing code is confirmed, Tex." Serious, I said. "The message will be delivered."

With that, we ended the call. "Who will be giving the message?" Curious, I asked.

"We know the perfect problem child for that mission." Serious, Cog said.

Who did Cog have in mind?
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: I call dad.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
To say I was surprised was an understatement and Lauren noticed. "You are not going alone." Sternly, she said. "We stick together."

"You are not going alone either." Serious, Mike said. "I'm part of the team now."

"No one goes alone." Calmly, Huntsman said. "Miss Silhouette will simply be the only one they will see until we spring the trap."

"You have a plan, Huntsman?" Curious, Freak asked.

"We lure them into the open just as they did with us and the Problem Child Gang." Serious, Cog explained. "We have Alpha's private cellphone number through Aura Winters who has adopted the name Prophet. It will be through that which you will make the call." He then sighed. "We also know his love for traps through Tommy who had adopted the name of Argus."

I steeled myself, knowing what was at stake. "Where will we be meeting?"

"Three days from now, at night, at the docks in Po Valley." Serious, Mirage said. "We will have the greatest advantage there as the fog is at its peak this time of year."

I nodded, knowing that fog had no effect upon my vision. "What about the rest of you?"

"Fog is of no bother to me." With a grin, Madcap said.

"Lycan and I can see through the thickest fog with our canine senses." Serious, Huntsman said. "The point of the location is so no one living there will see us or the Agency goons until we want them too."

I gulped at that. "You intend to expose them for the murderers they are..."

"We learned from experience that quietly cutting off the head of the snake does not kill the rest of it, the snake just grows a new head." Darkly, Cog said. "Exposing them to the light will do far more damage than the black files alone."

"So the black files is just the beginning." Softly, I said.

Creed nodded. "Exposing their crimes will only set them back as it did before through destroying their old headquarters... that will not be enough this time."

"The Agency will be preparing a trap of their own." Serious, Blacksmith warned. "We just need to be the first to spring ours."

"Exactly what is the trap?" Raising an eyebrow, I demanded.

Umbro, the leader of the new Cloaked Dagger rose to his feet. "At the time of the exchange, there will be a secret meeting of the world's leaders in counter terrorism." Serious, he explained. "Security will be tight and everywhere... Jeremy did well in planning this trap for them."

"No one knows what Alpha looks like." Calmly, Gen said.

"Only once the noise starts, all the world's leaders in counter terrorism will know his face." Also calm, Ini added. "As will the rest of the world once the security cameras start rolling film."

"Before we went after them directly, as did the Problem Child Gang." Serious, Gargoyle replied. "This time, we make them come to us, on our terms and the black files is the bait."

"The new Cloaked Dagger will be there to spring the trap." Serious, Unbro said. "The adult members will lie in wait in case they try to flee the area."

"This all hinges on the fact the Agency does not know of this meeting." Frowning, I said.

"That's true enough, mate." Calmly, Crikey said. "However, I already looked into that as one of their guards... they don't have a blooming clue."

"It is Alpha we want exposed." Serious, Scholar said. "Once that is done, we give the black files to the leaders of counter terrorism."

"It will be at that time, the Agency will be hunted by every nation on Earth." Vindictively, Puppet said. "Their time in the shadows will be over."

I nodded then asked. "What of the Agency springs their trap first?"

"That is where we come in." Surprising me, a voice replied.

I turned and smiled to find...
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Miss Silhouette.

1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
It was mom and dad with the original members of the problem child gang! Tex the Mighty and his wife, the immortal Hannah Snoope, Sam the Machine and Greg the Ghost! They all walked in wearing their old costumes, custom made to fit them. "We have waited twenty years for a rematch." Serious, Mr. Tanner said. "Our children and wives are with The Guard, ready for any trouble from CHILD should they dare show their hand."

"This is where you will need to bring your A-game... Miss Silhouette." Serious, Mrs. Jones said. "You already know that this is as real and as serious as it gets."

"Know that you are immortal." Serious, mom said. "No one can harm you, no one can touch you... call them for those they had hurt, for those who had been touched by their evil, their lives ended or ruined..."

Cog gave me his cellphone. "It is untraceable as it works outside of time." Calmly, he said. "Make the call..."

I nodded then dialed the number. A deep, strong voice answered after the third ring. "Talk to me..." Forcefully, he demanded.

"You know who I am... Alpha." Darkly, I said. I was surprised by how much I sounded like Mrs. D.

Alpha growled on the other line. "Miss Shadow..." There was hatred in his voice. "You have a lot of nerve calling my private line..."

"You are arrogant to allow me access to it." Equally hateful, I countered.

"What do you want, immortal?" Ice in his voice, Alpha demanded.

"I have your precious Black Files which will set you back another twenty years." Growling, I replied. "However, you have something I want just as bad..."

Alpha gave a dark chuckle. "So you raided my vault just to get your precious town ledger back." Darkly, he said. "What makes you believe those files are so destructive to our plans?"

"CHILD would be very interested in your legal and illegal contacts as would Sykes the immortal thief." Smiling, I replied. "With all of your greatest rivals knowing who and what to strike, you could stand to lose... everything."

Again, Alpha growled. It was clear to me that I had struck a nerve. Still, I did not want to push my luck just yet so I said, "A simple trade is all I am suggesting... Come now, Alpha, we both have many years left in us to cross swords another day."

Alpha was silent for a moment, drumming his fingers onto the table. "When and where do you want to make the trade?"

"Three days from now, at night, at the docks in Po Valley." Serious, I said. "The fog is at its peak this time of year, no one living there will see us."

"No one has seen me and lived." Darkly, Alpha said.

"You boast too easily." Calmly, I countered. "Do we have an agreement or should I take the files to someone else..."

"We have an agreement... Miss Shadow." Growling, Alpha said. "In three days..."

With that, the call ended and my knees buckled. fortunately, Lauren was there to catch me and led me to a chair. "You did great, sis." Serious, she said. "I think you got that Alpha character rattled."

"I'm impressed you managed to lead him to believe you were Miss Shadow." Calmly Mr. Tanner said. "That will increase our element of surprise."

"Let's not go off too cocky too early." Serious, Mr. Jones warned. "This is the end game, we cannot afford to lose this time."

I nodded then turned to the group. "Then I suggest we go over our plans until we all know our parts by heart."
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.title: Our parents.

choices: Faith goes back in the past.
1553322212222221121211112112111211111231.content:
Later that day, I was looking through Eli's notes and found a small section marked:

People to Avoid.

Curious, I began to read the list. It did not surprise me to find J.T. on the list. Eli called him a rapist and a cheat, among other things... This man has the power to talk an Eskimo into buying an ice machine. However, his power does not work on those aware of his ability and are of strong will. Be on your guard while around him.

The next person on the list surprised me. Todd and Olivia Richardson. I read the brief report on them carefully and felt a twinge of panic run down my spine...

These two have been lovers since grade school. Olivia has the power of telekinesis, the ability to move objects with her mind. Todd has the power of teleportation, the ability to move himself, others, or objects from one place to another instantly. They are known pranksters, never taking their powers seriously. However, when they did try to do good, it always lead to disaster as they never seriously trained. They renounced their abilities and turned completely to the Christian faith when their inexperience cost the life of an innocent boy.

I gasped, reading the date of the incident. It was the same date Jeremy Sharpe had died in a car accident. "Could that boy had been Jeremy Sharpe?" Shaken, I thought. "I hope no for Faith's sake. It would destroy her to know her own parents had a hand in his demise."

"The death was an accident." Came a new voice in my head. I recognized it as Olivia Richardson. "I am a telepath as well as a telekinetic."

"Then you know about Faith." Worried, I thought back.
