With that, the portrait became still but mom had a smile on her face as the eyes slowly closed. I decided to talk to dad about the groups protecting Waterfront City but could not find him. "ROSIE, where is dad?" Curious, I asked.

"Your father is building something in his basement workshop." Calmly, ROSIE replied. "He instructed me to inform you not to disturb him until dinner; stating he is working on something rather delicate."

Later that night, just before dinner, dad called me down to his basement workshop to show me a female android. "What do you think, honey?" Smiling, he asked. "It will allow ROSIE to walk among us while keeping the original programing in the house."

"It's interesting." Taken back, I said. "Only how are you suddenly able to build such things?"

Dad chuckled and replied, "That's my little power, sweetie. I have the ability to..."
15533222122222222222222211111111112.title: Reader's choice

155332221222222222222222111111111121.content:
"... build anything. Whatever my mind can conceive, my hands can create." He smiled with more than a touch of pride. "I designed most of this house, including ROSIE's effectors."

I looked again at the android. "You built this in just a few hours?"

Dad chuckled. "I'm good, but not quite that good. I originally built this for a client who was tired of her husband cheating on her with the household staff. She wanted a servant he could look at, but never touch. However, before I could send the android off to be programmed, her husband attracted the interest of the Feds, and my client grabbed an undisclosed amount of money and left the country. I gave the government the half of the expense that I'd been paid in advance, and I hung on to the android, just in case I ever needed it."

"Do you need my help transferring ROSIE's personality into the android?"

"I think I know how to do it," he said, "which usually means I can. But you can help me shop for clothes for her. My client had picked out some rather racy outfits for her, but I think she might want something... simpler."
155332221222222222222222111111111121.title: Build anything.

1553322212222222222222221111111111211.content:
Once we got back from shopping, Dad said, "ROSIE, we've got a bit of a surprise for you."

"A surprise?" she asked. "For me? What is it?"

"Now, now, ROSIE," Dad said, "the point of a surprise is to surprise. I'm afraid we'll need to shut down your higher functions beforehand."

"Is it really necessary, sir?"

"I'm afraid so, ROSIE. But I promise, we'll have you back up and running again immediately after."

Down in the basement, Dad shut ROSIE down, then we dressed the android and wheeled it into the maintenance room. "OK, Robb," Dad said, "let's see if you can wow me."

I took off my gloves, just in case my powers were needed. "Dad, I had a talk with Mom's portrait."

"I'm glad to hear it, honey."

"She said you could tell me about a group called the clean-up crew?"

"Ah, yes, the clean-up crew. Your mom and I were in that group." Dad connected the smart house computer to the android. "Basically, we tried to keep people from outside Waterfront City from finding out what a weirdness magnet we were."

"A 'weirdness magnet'?"

"Strange things seem to happen here. There's magic, and there have been rumors of a spaceship from another planet crashing here once. Let's facethinthing seems to draw such things to our town. We wanted to keep it all secret, because there's no telling what would happen if word got out." He walked over to the control panel. "Time to see if this works."

Dad tapped keys on the keyboard, then watched the display screen. "O.K., let's try this out."

"Are you sure it worked?" I asked. "She's not moving."

"She hasn't been turned on yet." He pressed a spot behind her ear.

The android opened her eyes. "Something is wrong," she said. "I can only see this one room, and the angle is all wrong."

"Nothing is wrong, my dear." He helped the android into a sitting position. "This is the surprise we promised you: You are now an android."

She turned her head back and forth, then lifted her hands. "This body is... mine?"

Dad switched the smart house computer back on. "All yours, ROSIE."

"Working," said the house.

She looked back and forth at each of us. "If ROSIE is the smart house, and I'm not the smart house anymore,... who am I?"

Dad thought for a bit, then asked, "Who do you want to be?"

"I think I want to be... Rose."

Dad smiled. "Very well, then, Rose you shall be."

Rose lifted her arms and hugged Dad. "Thank you, Mr. Frye."

"You're not a servant, anymore, Rose. You can call me Robb."

"Thank you,... Robb."

When she stopped hugging Dad, I stepped up for my turn. As we embraced, I thought, She really is almost human.

I felt energy flow down my arms, but I didn't think much of it.
1553322212222222222222221111111111211.title: Giving ROSIE her new body

choices: I want you to meet my mom.
15533222122222222222222211111111112111.content:
The next morning, I heard Rose scream and ran into the spare bedroom to find her backing away from the metal appendages that were making her bed. "It- It startled me." Apologetically, Rose said. "I am sorry if I woke you."

I giggled at that. "It does take some getting used to." Honestly, I replied. "Are you better now?"

"I feel lost." Timidly, Rose explained. "I am no longer the smart house; I have lost my purpose."

"Then you find a new purpose." Smiling, I said. "Everyone must find their own purpose in life, that includes you." I then smiled and added, "Happy belated birthday, by the way."

Rose turned to me, confused. "Birthday..." She then smiled. "Ah, yes! I was 'born' yesterday evening so it would be my birthday."

"Maybe we can get you a cake." Hugging, Rose, I said. I paused, feeling a rush flow through my arms and into my hands like last night. It felt weird but I did not want to worry Rose so I released her, asking, "You can eat cake, right?"

Rose shrugged. "I am not certain." Honestly, she replied. "I guess there is one way to find out unless it would be harmful to my body."

"She can eat anything she wants within reason." Startling us, dad said. "I built her with a rather complicated digestive system that converts raw organic materials into fuel for her body."

"That- That's incredible!" Stunned, I said.

Dad chuckled. "I wish I could take all the credit." Blushing, he said. "A good number of friends helped me design the android body." He then sighed. "Breakfast will be ready in a few minutes; wash up and be down in five."

"We will, dad." Smiling, I said.

After dad left, Rose asked. "What shall we do after breakfast?"

I smiled and replied...
15533222122222222222222211111111112111.title: A happy birthday.

155332221222222222222222111111111121111.content:
"Meet your mother?" Rose asked. "But isn't your mother dead?"

"She is, and she isn't," I replied. "She left a piece of her behind."

I led Rose to Mom's portrait. "Mom, I'd like you to meet Rose."

Mom smiled. "Pleased to meet you, Rose. You must be most important to Paige."

"I-I'm flattered," she said. "This is quite a new experience for me. Nothing in my programming has prepared me for this."

"'Programming'? I'm not sure what you mean."

"I began as the smart house. Now, I am an android."

Mom chuckled. "I think I detect my husband's touch."

Rose nodded. "Robb has done more for me than I dared to imagine. I owe him everything. Now, I will seek a purpose for myself."

"I wish you well in your self-discovery, Rose."

Rose left the room, and Mom said, "She's quite interesting. Did you have anything to do with her gaining a body?"

"No," I replied. "I just watched."

"Hmmm."
155332221222222222222222111111111121111.title: I want you to meet my mom.

1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.content:
"Why don't you give Rose a peek of what lies outside of the house, Paige." Smiling, mom said. "Take her out into the back yard; I'm certain she is curious."

"I'm not sure if she is ready." Wincing, I said.

Mom smiled. "No one is ready for any new experiences, my dear." Patiently, she said. "Still, would you keep her cooped up in this house now that she has the power to move freely and think for herself?"

"What of you?" Worried, I asked. "Would you want to be..."

Mom giggled. "I have my own ways of getting out of the house, dear." Cryptically, she said. "You will discover this when it is most needed."

I wanted to ask mom what she meant by that but decided not to push it for the moment and thanked her for her advice before seeking out Rose again. I found her in the kitchen, pondering over the various snacks we had for in between meals. "Hey, Rose." Catching her attention, I said. "How would you like to take a stroll through the back yard?"

"I have seen the back yard." Calmly, Rose said. "You and Robb seemed to have much fun there though I never really understood why."

I smiled. "Let me show you."

I lead Rose out through the back door into the yard and took off my sandals before placing my feet into the grass. "Try it."

Albeit reluctantly, Rose took off her own sandals and stepped into the grass. She let out a low gasp of surprise. "It's damp and chilled!"

"No better way to wake up." Smiling, I said. "It won't hurt you, Rose."

I lead Rose, who was clearly uncertain to the swings and had her sit down on one. After instructing her to hold onto the two ropes holding the swing up, I gave her a push. She let out a low yelp of fright then began to giggle. "This feels strange but sort of nice." Smiling, she said. "Is this why humans swing?"

I giggled. "Yup. It almost feels like flying."

"It does." Giggling, Rose said. "Can I go higher?"

"Just a little." Giggling back, I said. "There is more I want to show you."

It took me several minutes to convince Rose to leave the swings which reminded me of myself when I was just a child. Then again, Rose was like a child; seeing the world for the first time. I lead her to the edge of the back yard where I pointed out to the east towards the hills near the ocean. "I wanted to get you out early to see this." Smiling, I said. "Watch the horizon."

Rose watched the horizon as i asked then became wide eyed as the sun began to rise over the hills. She let out an awe filled gasp before smiling, her eyes twinkling with child like delight. "I have never really seen a sunrise before." Almost whispering, she said. "It's quite the sight to see."

"This is just a taste of what lies outside of the house, Rose." Softly, I said. "When you think you are ready, i will show you more."

"Oh, I would love that." Smiling, Rose said.

We shared a hug only I was forced to pause as I felt real skin on Rose's arm. As we parted, I looked but saw nothing unusual. I began to wonder if mom sensed something I didn't.
1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.title: Rose experiences the outside world

1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.content:
After lunch, Rose asked, "What else is outside?"

"A whole world," I replied. "There are other people, and all sorts of things. For instance, would you like to see the park?"

"What's so interesting about watching people park?"

I giggled. "That's not what the word park means in this case. It's an area that's been set aside pretty much as nature made it."

"Ah. I think I would like to go to the park, Paige."



When we arrived at the park, Rose couldn't get enough. "It's all so amazing," she said. "All these trees. All these sounds. What are they?"

"Some of it's the wind blowing through the trees," I explained. "There are also birds chirping." I took her hand. "Come on, you'll like this."

Rose might have been puzzled at what I meant, but that didn't last long. I led her to a vending machine. "We can feed this to the ducks."

I was right. Rose did enjoy feeding the ducks. She laughed as they ate. "They're eating right out of my hand."

When we ran out of duck feed, we started walking around the lake. We greeted others as we passed, but dogs shied away from Rose. "Why don't they like me?"

"I'm afraid you're the first android they've met, Rose."

Halfway around the lake, I stopped at a drinking fountain. After I had drunk enough, Rose asked, "Can I have some?"

I shrugged. "I don't know why not."

Rose drank as much as I did. "It's quite refreshing, isn't it?"

"That's how it works for us."
1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.title: Rose explores more outside.

1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.content:
As we came home from the park, we spotted three people approaching the house. One of them was familiar. "Hi, Lucinda," I said. "Who's this?"

"Hi, Paige," she said. "This is my younger brother, Owen, and my cousin, Stacy. Who's your friend?"

"It takes some explaining," I replied. "Let's go inside."

As we went inside, Lucinda said, "I wanted to introduce Owen and Stacy to your AI. Hi, ROSIE, what's up?"

"Greetings," ROSIE replied. "All systems are operating within normal parameters."

Lucinda was puzzled. "She sounds different. What's going on?"

"We downloaded that personality into an android body," I explained. "Say hello to Rose."

"It's good to see you again, Lucinda," Rose said, hugging her. "Thanks to you, the Fryes have given me a new form. I'm looking forward to exploring what I'm capable of."

"I'm finding out what I can do, too," Owen said. "Check this out."

I don't know what I was expecting, but it wasn't what happened next. One moment, I was talking to a boy. Then, suddenly, he turned into a girl.
1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.title: Visitors

1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.content:
Dad came up from the basement. "I thought I heard more voices than usual," he said. "I guess you two must be friends of Lucinda's."

"Relatives, actually," Stacy replied. "How've you been, Giz?"

Dad took two steps back. "Where did you hear that, young lady?"

"I called you that twenty years ago," she answered. "And I'm much older than I look. You know me as Shaman."

Dad grabbed a chair and sat down before he could fall down. "Will wonders never cease?"

"In this city, they haven't stopped yet, Gizmo. Lucinda told me about your daughter's talents. I think we'd better start rounding up a new clean-up crew."

"This sounds quite exciting," Rose said. "Why don't I get us all some refreshments?"

As Rose went to the kitchen, the girl who was Owen asked, "Is she really an android?"

"I built that body myself. I'm quite sure."
1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.title: Continue

choices: We have a mission do accomplish.
1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.content:
"First, you need to understand that this small city is not the only one with this secret." Serious, Stacy said. "There are a number of small cities all over the world who carry this burden."

"That's insane." Shocked, I said. "What caused it all?"

"A meteor shower way back in the early eighteen hundreds." Calmly Stacy replied. "It brought a huge collection of visitors from all parts of the cosmos." She gave a rueful smile. "The effects were not felt immediately but they were felt and it took several years before anyone truly realized what was happening."

"It gave birth to people with extraordinary powers which inspired stories of super heroes and crime fighters all over the world." Smiling, dad added. "It was that which helped us hide the truth."

"The truth did break out on a few occasions which brought much grief to this city and others around the world." Darkly, Stacy said. "Which was brought the need for groups like the Problem Child Gang here and the Cloaked Dagger in Europe." She sighed. "Still, these groups sometimes made a mess which threatened our secrecy so a clean up crew was needed."

"That is where we came in." Serious, dad said. "We ensured that no one in the city talked about what had happened, the event was down played in the newspapers and on television, and no government officials came snooping around."

"This is our first assignment." Sighing, Stacy said.

She tossed the day's newspaper onto the table. The headline read: Problem Child Gang Returns!

"There was a hit attempt on the original members of the problem child gang." Frowning, dad said. "The media was all over it." He sighed. "Fortunately, thanks to Trisha Davenport of The Guard, it has remained only on the local news."

"The Guard?" Curious, I asked. I shook my head. "I'm going to need a scorecard to keep up with all of this. How many groups are there?"

"The Guard is a standby group to the problem child gang." Serious, Stacy explained. "They help out when the gang finds themselves pulled away from the city or over their heads in trouble. Mrs Davenport had called herself simply 'T'." She smiled slightly. "She was quite skilled in ways that would surprise you."

"Groups come and go, Paige." Serious, dad said. "The problem child gang had not been active in nearly twenty years but there were other smaller groups keeping everyone's unique skill sets secret from the outside world."

"So... what do we do now?" Curious, I asked.

Stacy smiled. "Simple..."
1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.title: Learning about the clean-up crew

1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.content:
"You need to know what you're capable of," Stacy said. "For instance, your mother, when she assisted us as Alchemy, could not only change herself, but the things she touched. You might want to explore that aspect."

My head felt like it could start spinning at any moment. I had never suspected that there was anything unusual about me, my family, or Waterfront City. Now I knew that everything was different, and there were other weird spots all over the world. "Wh-when do we start?"

"Not yet," Stacy said, "at least not with us. We've got someone to meet at the Sunset."

"The Sunset?" Dad cried. "That's no place for three kids!"

"It's not ideal," Stacy replied. "But Dr. Hal told me that there was somebody there we should meet. I don't know yet where they'll be."
1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.title: We start your training.

1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.content:
"Who are the members of the clean up crew?" Curious, I asked.

"Normally, that job goes to the group who took up the mantle the generation before." Serious, Stacy replied. "Ted Jones, who was Tex the mighty is using his powers as the chief of police to help work on the investigation into the attack upon himself and his wife." She sighed. "Only because he is a victim in the case, Steve Davenport, who you knew as Tinker from the graphic novel is running the investigation."

I nodded but didn't say anything. Tinker was a member of the Guard in the graphic novel; he had the ability to make small gadgets and gizmos just as dad could now. That was why dad as called Gizmo or Giz for short. The two of them together were called 'Mech' though I really never understood why.

"Anyone else working on the investigation?" Curious, Owen asked.

"Geo Tanner, who you knew as Greg, is using his powers as a private investigator and CEO of a major tech firm to keep anything the investigation finds only winds up in the local news." Calmly, Stacy replied. "Liv Vance, who you know as Heather, is making more suitable disguises for the new problem child gang." She let out a low giggle. "This new group is not very inventive in that department from what I have been hearing."

"Shouldn't we have names and disguises?" Curious, I asked.

"If needed." Nodding, Stacy replied. "Right now, you will all be working mostly in the shadows."

"What do you mean?" Wincing, I asked.

"I'm not going to throw you into the mix until I know you are ready, young lady." Serious, Stacy said. "For now, you will be helping..."
1553322212222222222222221111111111211111.title: We have a mission to accomplish.

choices: The men who invaded the mansion find you
155332222.content:
I was awoken from my sleep by loud noises in and around the orphanage. Men were shouting as they moved into the building, against the caretaker's protests. I heard bangs as the intruders kicked in doors and screams of startled children as they were woken from their slumber. There were shouts and screams coming increasingly closer to my room. Someone was searching for something or someone. I don't know why but something was screaming at me to escape from whoever it was. I decided it was probably best to listen to that urge and get out quickly. I grabbed a bag and packed my clothes and art pad along with pencils to take with me. To my disappointment, I realized that I would have to leave my portfolio behind as I was out of room in the bag. Not that it mattered, I would have to draw a completely new portfolio of super heroes anyway and had decided to draw my own super heroes, name them and profile their powers with pictures of them using their powers.

"The second interview is going to be magical." smiling, I muttered. "They would have no reason not to hire me."

A heavy knock on my door broke me from my thoughts. I smelled a police raid or a government crack down, nothing I wanted any part in as I knew nothing of my parents. "Its probably best to get out of their way." I whispered.

With that, I hurried out the window, down the fire escape just as the door to my room was kicked open...
155332222.title: Later that night

1553322222.content:
As I descended the fire escape, I heard shouts from above, ordering me to stop. I paused, hearing them call me by my name, but kept moving in fear of what they possibly wanted from me. Only, as i reached the bottom, two strong hands grabbed e from behind and I was wrestled to the ground.

"Let me go!" struggling, I demanded. "What do you want from me!?"

"You are not in trouble, Tim." replied a deep voice. "You are, however, in danger."

Startled by that statement, I eased my struggling. It was enough for the man who had tackled me to gain control and force me to my feet. He held me firm as a tall man in a black business suit approached me with a small girl at his side. The man had a strong frame with short light brown hair and copper green eyes. The girl was very short, wearing a standard girl school uniform. She was about five years old with long red hair with blond highlights and fire hazel eyes. She remained silent but watched me with a rising curiosity.

"What do you mean I am in danger?" trying not to sound frightened, I asked. "Who are you?"

"I am special agent Jon Moore and this is agent Maria Vendetta."

Maria nodded but did not speak as Jon continued. "A madman named Sykes is trying to recruit children and teenagers with extraordinary talent in a bid to create an army." serious, he said. "Its my job to make certain he does not succeed."

"I don't see how that puts me in any danger..." confused, I said.

Jon pulled out what I recognized as the portfolio I had handed the new comic book company. Upon opening it, I let out as gasp as all of the drawings I had made were moving on their own! "It seems that everything you draw comes to life." closing the portfolio, Jon said. "They do not jump from the pages but they can talk and think as if you were talking to them through a videophone."

"No way..." stunned, I whispered. "What- what does than mean for me?"

Jon sighed. "Your gift makes you a great prize for anyone who can control you." making a motion with his hand, he said. "I'm afraid you will have to come with us."

With that said, I felt a sharp prick on the back of your neck. It was then I realized the flick of his hand was a signal to another man to sedate me. I was unconscious before I hit the ground.

Hour later, I found myself...
1553322222.title: The men who invaded the mansion find you

15533222221.content:
I woke up finding myself in a small and bare but clean bedroom. The bed I was lying on was of a simple design; as was the small dresser and mirror, opposite side of the room from the bed. To the right of me was an open door, leading to a small washroom while to the left was was a large window that took up almost half of the wall. There was nothing I could see that gave me a clue as to where I was but the card lock on the door, next to the dresser, made me realize that I was not going anywhere for a while. With a sigh, I threw the sheet and light blanket off of me to discover the clothes I was wearing earlier had been replaced with a fashionable pajama top and pants.

"I've been kidnapped." frowning, I muttered. "Where did this agent Moore character take me?"

I rolled out of bed to find a pair of blue slippers on the floor and hesitantly put them on, as I was barefooted, and began to search the room for clues. Only the door clicked and Jon walked in. He eyed me with a certain coldness before speaking in a firm tone. "Sit down."

Feeling I had no choice in the matter, I obeyed but I gave the man a glare before I did. "I want answers." looking Jon in the eye, I demanded.

"I apologize for the forceful extraction, Tim." after a sigh, Jon said. With that, he walked back down the sidewalk to the parking garage. "Please, wait!" chasing after him, I called. "I don't want to be left alone!"

"You won't be alone." smiling, Ted replied. "Madame Vague has many friends, they rent to use this station, they will help you start your training."

"Blessed be, Tim." came a feminine voice behind me.

I turned to find...
155332222211112111121.title: The tour.

choices: My training begins with some drawings.
You are taken to meet the new members of the Problem Child Gang
1553322222111121111211.content:
"Ah," seeing a woman enter, Ted said, "Madam Vague, This is Tim. I brought him here because he had escaped from the Agency, and he's able to get some insight into happenings there."

"What is it you can do, Tim," looking at me, Madam Vague asked. "I can sense your power, but it seems to be masked by some obscurity, perhaps a secondary power lying beneath it."

"Its probably the personalities of my forms," politely, I replied. "I have the ability to make anything I draw come to life, as well as briefly bring to life drawings other people have made temporarily, but if the characters are based on real people, they mimic what those people are saying at that moment."

"So you can spy on people, like the members of the Agency..." softly, Madam Vague mussed. "That will make you a target for them even if it were not for the rest of your powers."

"I came to the states to warn the Problem Child Gang that the Agency was after their kids." worried, I said. "Those guys are monsters."

Madam Vague pulled out a deck of cards and, to my surprise, they shuffled themselves in the air above her hands! Seeing my expression, she smiled. "You are not the only person who possesses power, young man."

She drew a card from the deck but did not reveal what it was. "You have not revealed everything to Ted or I." giving me a curious look, she said. "What is it you are not disclosing?"

I was startled by how Madam Vague seemed to be able to read me like a book. "I can also become any original character that I draw, gaining all of their abilities." quickly, I replied.

"So you could become any one of the new Problem Child Gang since they were never drawn." smiling, Madam Vague said. "That would certainly have its uses." she then turned serious. "You would have their powers but not their training, be careful who you decide to mimic."

I gulped, sensing a warning in her words. "Yes ma'am."

Madam Vague nodded. "I will help you with your training, Tim." firmly but kindly, she said. "Only I must warn you, I am a strict task master, I will not tolerate any tomfoolery."
1553322222111121111211.title: A young woman.

15533222221111211112112.content:
Madam Vague put me through a rigorous training scheme, which included speed drawing, something she called 'magic resistance', and even a sparring match against her in each of the forms I had previously created.

"You would be wise to keep the characters and tricks you wish to use on small cards." after the sparing session, Madam Vague said. "If they lose your pen and pad, you lose your power." I winced at that but Madam Vague was not finished. "Make yourself your own set of cards, ones you can summon to you."

"I can summon my pen and pad, I discovered that much." confused, I said.

Madam Vague gave me a grave look, causing me to shudder. "You can summon your pen and pad to you, true." softly, she said. "However, you will not always have the time to draw what you need to save yourself or your friends." she sighed. "Make yourself a deck to draw from and your cards will never fail you."

By the end of the day, I was exhausted, so I was relieved when Madam Vague told me my training was done for now.
"Several members of the Problem Child Gang have arrived down here," after listening a moment, she said. "I believe your new brother and sister are among them."

"I've never met them yet." nervous, I said "How should i approach them, what should I say?"

"Don't worry Tim," said Madam Vague "Just be yourself and show them who you are, from getting to know you, I know you'll get along fine."

I smiled. "Is it just my adopted siblings that are down here?"

Madam Vague smiled and replied...
15533222221111211112112.title: You are taken to meet the new members of the Pr...

155332222211112111121121.content:
"Just your siblings." smiling, Madam Vague replied. "Ted brought them down just to meet you, it seems."

"Thanks for the training," smiling, I said. "I think it really helped me."

"So it should have," with a knowing smile, Madam Vague said, "we use the same techniques to train young witches, you would have been considered an adept witch by now." she winked. "That's slightly higher than my daughter, although don't tell her that."

"I won't," I promised. "Where are my brother and sister?"

"I will take you to them," leading you out of the training area, Madam Vague said. "This way..."
155332222211112111121121.title: Yes

choices: meeting the rest of the gang.
1553322222111121111211211.content:
Back onto the main walkway of the S.U.B. station, I saw Ted approaching with Heather. Behind them was a tall and very muscular boy with short sand blond hair and green eyes and a girl of average height but a well-toned body with long brown hair and blue eyes. "Tim, this is our son, Garth and our daughter, Grace." introducing me to them, Ted said. "Kids, this is Tim, your new little brother."

Tears formed in my eyes "Little... brother?" choking, I asked.

Heather knelled down, smiling. "The final adoption papers rushed through only an hour ago." looking at me, she said. "Welcome to the family... Tim Jones."

I jumped into Heather... mom's arms, crying. It felt so good to have a family again, I was completely overwhelmed with emotion. "Mommy!" whimpering, I whispered.

Mom giggled. "Its alright, Tim." stroking my hair, she said. "Let it out."

Once I had managed to compose myself, mom released me and I found myself in the powerful embrace of Ted... dad. "No one can replace your biological father." holding me tight, he said. "Still, I am honored to call you my son."

I lost it again, crying into dad's arms. I had been without a family for eight years, turned down by family after family, until I was finally adopted by no other than my favorite hero, a member of the Problem Child Gang! I had come home.

"So you are Tim." smiling, Garth said. "Good to meet you."

Dad released me from his embrace and I took Gar's hand, his grip was gentle but like a vice. "Sam-Same here." shyly, I replied. "I hope we can be good friends."

"Friends?" smiling, Grace asked. "Tim, you are family now, it goes beyond friendship; you are a part of us."

I blushed brightly at that to which Grace giggled and gave me a warm hug. "You will never be alone, I promise."

"The Agency... they- they..." I was on the verge of crying again before mom pulled me into another hug. "They know all about it, dear." cooing me, she said. "Don't worry."

Gar smiled and, to my surprise, grew to Olympian proportions. "We are far from defenseless, little bro." his voice now booming, he said. "Like dad, we have talents of our own."

I turned to dad, standing behind Gar and I nearly fainted as he did the same only he did not grow in size, just in physique as he smiled at me before returning to his normal form. I gaped at him but a quick finger to his lips caused me to smile as I suspected Gar did not know this about him.

"We inherited abilities from our mom and dad through a symbiont." returning to normal, Gar said. "An alien creature, living inside our bodies which give us our power in exchange for 'room and board'."

"This is epic." whispering, I said. I then smiled. "I have a power of my own, want to see?"

Gar and Grace eagerly nodded and I pulled out my pen and pad before quickly drawing an image of a tall female warrior with large breasts and powerful muscles in a tight body suit. I wanted to really impress them so I thought bigger was always better with everything.

Once the drawing was finished, I dragged it off of the paper, onto myself and transformed into the woman warrior. "I am Amazona, Princess of Power!" I said in a strong female voice.

Garth and Grace looked at my new form with their jaws dropped as mom and dad merely shook their heads. Once the initial shock wore off, Grace giggled. "Um... your character is a bit much." clearly amused, Grace said.

"Yeah, you need to tone that character down a little." smiling, Gar agreed. "For one, err, Amazona is proportioned all wrong, she'll have a hard time standing straight, let alone fight anyone."

The costume I was now wearing began to rip and Grace quickly covered Gar's eyes. "Please put the drawing back before we all get a show." firmly, she said.

I touched my paper pad and the woman returned to it, leaving me slightly drained. "I just wanted to impress you." pouting, I said. "Please don't be mad..."

Again, Grace giggled. "We're not mad." roughing up my hair, she said. "It's just that Amazona character needs work."

"If you don't believe me, ask the others." smiling, Gar said. "You'll meet them later."
1553322222111121111211211.title: Meeting Garth and Grace Jones.

15533222221111211112112111.content:
A few days later, I met up with Garth and Grace again in the substation who filled me in on what had been happening since we last met. "So you guys are going to become the new Problem Child Gang?" after hearing them out, I asked. "That's so cool!"

"You can join us, Tim," serious, Grace said. "I can certainly see the advantages of having your power around, I'm not even sure of the true extent of your powers."

"To be honest, Grace," wincing, I said. "Neither am I, I know I can draw really fast, I know I can make drawings come to life, even things I haven't drawn, and if the pictures are based on real people, they mimic what those people are saying."

"What do you suspect you can do?" curious, Grace asked "If you don't believe that is the full extent of your powers, you must have an idea of what else you can do."

I nodded "I've never tried drawing real people with powers and becoming them," I said "I'd like to experiment now that I know other people who have powers to test it on."

"Anything else you'd like to test?" asked Grace, interested now.

"I don't know how long I can maintain another form, if it takes any energy from me or anything, to be honest, I don't know that much about my powers at all," I said "That's why I'm asking if I can become one of you, then perhaps I can see how long I can maintain it."

"Sure," said Grace "Who do you want to become?"
15533222221111211112112111.title: spending time with the family.

155332222211112111121121112.content:
I speed drew Grace and held it up for inspection to Grace. I didn't want to make a mistake as if I drew her wrongly, I guessed I would not gain her powers.
"Looks good," said Grace "Go ahead."
I dragged Grace's picture off the paper and dropped it onto myself.
Immediately, I started to change, shrinking slightly, my hair growing longer, my body changing into a female. It wasn't long before I was a copy of Grace Jones, my new sister.
"Great," said Garth "I'm the youngest again."
Grace rolled her eyes and I imitated her. We both laughed.
"We don't know yet if you have my powers," said Grace "We'll have to try a test to find that out."
What sort of test?" I asked, suspiciously
Grace smiled "I've always wondered what it would be like to fight myself," she said "I guess now i'm going to find out."
155332222211112111121121112.title: Become Grace

1553322222111121111211211121.content:
The moment I faced the real Grace, I knew it was not going to be an easy match. Even if I had her exact powers, which I doubted, she had more experience than I. It was then I decided not to try to copy her but to trip her up by using my own skills. I was not a bad fighter as I had basically grown up in the streets.

"You may make the first move." as we circled each other, Grace said. "Let's see what you can do."

I made the first move by throwing a high kick but Grace avoided it all too easily. It did not help that I was not used to fighting as a girl. When I was a girl before, her persona had taken over and fought for me or was it all my imagination? There was really no time to ponder over it as Grace took a swing at me, which I too easily dodged and swung back. "You're pretty good, sis." struggling to make a hit, I said.

"Back at you... sis." as if toying with me, Grace replied. "Only, I think we should raise the bar a little."

"With that said, she went at me with a barrage of kicks and swings, hitting me with most of them. I could not believe it, I was losing. Then, I remembered that Grace told me that she can learn any skill, art, or trade in minutes and that had to include fighting styles. She had all of my moves figured out and had found ways around them in no time at all! "That is an impressive power." impressed, I thought. "I need to find a way to level the field."

Then, a desperate idea came to me and I grabbed my notebook only Grace seemed to be onto me as she charged me. "You won't get the chance to draw anything else." almost teasing, she said. "I'm too fast."

"Then heads up!" throwing the paper at her, I yelled.

The paper flew from my notebook and, as if following my thoughts, wrapped themselves tightly around Grace until she looked like a paper wrapped mummy! Dad called the sparing match over, seeing Grace was unable to move and hurried to her only to see her tear herself free. "It seems as if Tim has a telekinetic power over paper, dad." blushing, she said. "We should look deeper into this."

"I agree." eying me, dad said.

"Am- Am I in trouble?" worried, I asked.

Dad smiled. "No but we should work on that new part of your power."
1553322222111121111211211121.title: Grace vs Grace

15533222221111211112112111211.content:
"What were you thinking at the time you threw that paper at Grace?" looking at me, dad asked.

"I just wanted to distract her so I could end the fight quickly." thinking I was in trouble, I replied.

"Well, it was certainly a distraction." ruefully, Grace said. "Suddenly finding myself mummified by paper scared the crap out of me!"

"Sorry." blushing, I said.

"No, No, it didn't hurt me." reassuring me, Grace said. "It just scared me and I was able to get out quickly once dad called the match over." she paused. "You're back to normal, did that take a lot out of you?"

"Not really." confused by the question, I said. "Why?"

Dad grunted. "Let's look at the tapes."

Curious, I followed dad as he led Grace, Garth and myself into a room further into the makeshift base. It had a lot of old electronic equipment but they all still worked. "Let's take a look at the sparring match a little more closely." queuing up a recording of the fight on a screen, dad said. "There seems to be more to your power than meets the eye, Tim."

With that, he played the video of my transformation into Grace at a much slower pace where I witnessed something that surprised us all. As I dragged the image off the paper, the paper quickly followed, attaching itself to my body! It surrounded and encased my body in an instant, forming a paper body over my own! Then, in a flash, various colors of ink colored everything in, creating a perfect likeness of Grace!

"Incredible!" whispering, dad said. "Here I thought it was some type of magical ability but it seems to be more of a psychic ability."

"How does it explain the drawings I make being able to talk?" stunned, I asked.

Grace thought for a moment then asked me, "Have you ever worked on a character for so long, that it seemed to have a life of its own?"

"What do you mean?" confused, I asked.

"You made those characters so you know how they would react to certain situations." jumping in, dad said. "When you are not certain of what to do, you ask yourself, what would this character or that character do?"

"And the character answers..." astounded, I said.

"You have a truly unique ability, Tim." smiling, Gar said. "Only becoming someone else only seems to work when it is a character you know well."

"I agree." nodding, dad said. "I would focus on summoning only what you know you can control."

After a thought, I asked, "Do you think I can control this without drawing?"

"So you can react more quickly?" asked Grace. I nodded. "Maybe, give it a try."

I turned to my large notebook, about the size of a small satchel, and thought, "Let's try a suit of armor."

With that mental 'command', I felt something wrapping itself around my body, like before and, with the same quickness, I was wearing a suit of armor, like in the medieval times! "I did it!" looking at myself, I declared.

"This is only the tip of the iceberg, son." serious, dad said. "Its time for some serious training."

Without another word, dad led me out of the room, back to the main track and motioned me to stay as he continued on for a few steps. Suddenly, his muscles grew in size and he charged me! I yelled out in surprise, seeing him let a fist fly and rose my arms as if to shield myself. In an instant, papers flew from a nearby table and a shield was formed in an instant, meeting dad's fist.

Unknown to me, dad was holding way back and he smiled at the result of his scarring me. "It's just as I thought, the paper reacts to your mind's need to defend yourself and others."

I was surprised to find myself now holding a shield but even more surprised to find that a sword had been added, resting in a sheath at my side. "Did I do that?" almost whispering, I asked.

"You did." smiling, dad replied. "Though most of it was through reflex, you made that happen."
15533222221111211112112111211.title: Learning to control paper.

155332222211112111121121112112.content:
Before I could continue with the training, I felt as if something was not right. I always had a strong danger sense but I was not psychic, I could never tell what the danger was, just that something bad was brewing. "Have you got any copies of the graphic novels here?" trying to sound nonchalant, I asked.

"I think Garth brought one down with us." running out of the room, Grace said. she began calling for him.

"What is it, Tim?" curious, dad asked. "Anything we should know?"

"I don't know," wincing, I said. "I always get this feeling when there is trouble near and, lately, that trouble has been showing itself in the pictures of the graphic novels."

Grace came back with Garth who handed me one of the graphic novels. Immediately, I started flicking through the pages. Unknown to me, my eyes had glazed over as I opened the book. The book stopped on a page with Sykes pictured on it. He was young, fair skinned, with short brown hair and what looked like cat's eyes. I hoped it was just my imagination. He wore what looked like antique leather armor from the middle ages. It was a strange look but I had no time to dwell on it as, like before, the picture moved as if I were watching the man through a window.

"Our attack force is prepped and ready, sir!" out of the picture one voice said. I suspected he was one of Sykes' higher ranking followers, a captain of the men, perhaps.

"Good," in a sinister voice, Sykes said. "We fly for Waterfront City at first light. I am trusting you to commence the attack, bring me the heads of this 'new' Problem Child Gang. I will deal with the original group myself."

I looked up at my new family. "Sykes has found you," my lips trembling, I said. "At least, he has a rough idea where you are, he's flying to Waterfront City at first light to attack the city."

"How much time do we have?" looking at me, dad asked.

I teared up as the picture had stopped moving. "I- I don't know." crying, I said. "I'm sorry."

"I'll call Alyssa," grabbing his cellphone, Garth said. "Grace, you call Cait, see if she has sensed this. Maybe she can give us more details as what Sykes has planned."

"Right." grabbing her own cellphone, Grace replied. "We'll have to coordinate this, Cait's communication with all of us by telepathy and Alyssa's speed will save us a lot of time." she turned to dad. "You might want to..."

"I'm already on it, sweetie." dialing a number on his cellphone, dad said. "We need to get the civilians off the streets for when this dirt bag makes his move." he paused. "This is the real deal, kids. Sykes is as dangerous as they come, pray what little training you got was enough."

"We will need disguises." suddenly, Grace said. "We already decided that, but we never got around to it."

"Don't worry about that." serious, dad said. "All of us had made costumes for you, similar to what we wore when we fought crime. It may not be your style but there are lives on the line, there is no time to pick and choose."

Just then, the pages in the graphic novel turned on their own until they reached the back of the book, showing a picture of the author, Aaron Flynn. "Hello, lad." in a heavy Irish accent, he said. "You look like you could use some help and a bit of luck."

My eyes went wide. "How are you able to talk to me?" stunned, I asked.

"There will be plenty of time to answer that later, lad." firmly but kindly, Flynn replied. "For now, tell your new pop to answer his phone."

The picture stopped moving and I turned to dad as he ended his call with the police station. "You might want to answer that." my voice quivering, I said.

Dad gave me a questionable look but jumped as his cellphone rang...
155332222211112111121121112112.title: something interrupts.

choices: Dad tells me about my grandfather
I get another message from the graphic novel next to me
1553322222111121111211211121121.content:
"Hello," said Dad, putting the phone to his ear "Detective Flynn, I'm surprised to hear from you again, you'll excuse me for hurrying you, but Sykes is back, he's about to attack the city."
I did not hear the reply, but saw a shocked expression on Dad's face.
"What do you mean you already know?" asked Dad "How could you know?"
Dad turned to me, his eyes widening as he spoke, but then he spoke again "Get yourself and your family down to the SUB station," he said, serious "We've got everyone who needs to be protected down here, and if Sykes knows about you, your family might be a target."

Dad hung up the phone.
"How did you know my phone was about to ring?" he asked, curious
I held up the picture of Detective Flynn. "Apparently, your old police contact has similar powers to me, he contacted me through the graphic novel picture."
"It's more than that, Tim," said Dad "Detective Flynn is your grandfather."
1553322222111121111211211121121.title: Dad answers.

15533222221111211112112111211212.content:
Before I could take in what had just been said, the pages of the graphic novel next to me started to blow, as if caught in the wind until they stopped on a page with a familiar woman. I recognised her as Madam Vague, my mentor.
"Sisters, I call you in this hour of greatest need, please, if I ever needed help from the coven, now is the time, old enemies have resurfaced, I fear for the life of my daughter. If there I'd anyone of the old coven still out there, please heed my call, help me," she paused, then, in a panicked voice said "They're here."
The message ended.
"I think Madam Vague is in trouble," I said "I just got a message from the graphic novels saying she was about to be attacked by the Agency."

Suddenly...
15533222221111211112112111211212.title: I get another message from the graphic novel ne...

155332222211112111121121112112121.content:
Dad jumped a second time as the telephone rang but he was quick to answer it. "Alyssa, we've been trying to get a hold of you." scolding, he said. "Are you alright?" a muffled response caused dad's face to turn red, I knew it was not good. "Is anyone injured?" another response and he sighed, looking relieved. "Stay where you are, I am on my way!"

"What happened!?" after dad ended the call, Gar asked.

"The Agency has struck again." running to the parking area, dad replied. "Don't worry, I'll bring them all here!"

Before another word could be said, dad was in his squad car, speeding down underground road towards town, leaving us all wonder. I turned to Gar worried as he whispered, "Lyssa..."

"That must be his girlfriend." wincing, I thought. "I hope she's okay."

Twenty tense minutes later, dad returned in the squad car with another car following. I had seen most of the people piling out before but I was still afraid and kept myself hidden. Seeing my concern, Grace smiled. "You have nothing to afraid of, Tim." gently, she said. "Those are friends, they will not hurt you."

Reluctantly, I nodded and followed her and Gar over to them. Mom came out from another hall and joined us as we approached the group. All of them looked shaken, making me worry but a gentle squeeze of my hand from Grace told me I was in good hands.

"It took me by surprise as well." urging a girl out of one car, Lilith said. "Welcome to the Subterranean Urban Base station."

"It really existed!?" startled, the girl asked. "Does that mean..."

"Chief Jones was Tex the mighty." serious, Lilith replied. "All of it was real, including the Agency, who attacked you today."

The girl gulped. "How did your mom know my mother?" still rattled, she asked. "Is there anything else I should know about?"

"Actually, there is." speaking up, mom said.

Everyone turned to find her walking towards them with Grace and Gar following, keeping me between them. I looked at them, feeling very shy and, by the looks on their faces, it showed.

"Blessed be, Mrs Jones and family." kindly, Lilith said. "Who is your new friend?"

Mom smiled. "Everyone, I'd like you to meet the newest member of our family." motioning to the small boy, she said. "This is Tim Jones, he was an orphan from Europe."

"I sense you were in the hands of the Agency." serious, Lilith said.

"He was but he was not brainwashed." cutting in, Cait said. "His mind is free."

"That and I have already met him." smiling, Vague said. "He has the strange power to make anything he draws come to life."

"Why didn't we meet him earlier?" confused, Lilith asked.

I gave a sheepish smile, not knowing what to say.

"Because, child," patiently, Vague replied, "he was too scared to come out."

"We convinced him you were all cool." placing a firm hand onto his shoulder, Gar chimed in. "These are my friends, little bro, you couldn't be in safer hands."

"Welcome to the S.U.B. Station, Tim," Lilith said, holding out a hand. "My name's Lilith."

"Hi," shaking her hand, I said. "If dad had said there were pretty girls like you here, I might have made my presence known sooner."

"Cool your jets, bro," Grace told me. "Lilith isn't into guys."

I blushed at that, hearing Gar chuckle a little. "You can't blame me for trying." almost pouting, I thought.

"So, you can bring your drawings to life?" Lilith asked, brushing off the attempted flirting. "I can call up the figures from my Tarot cards. That sounds similar."

"Not exactly," smiling, I replied. "My drawings actually move on the page. And I can actually become them." "Here is my chance to impress them." "Want a demonstration?"

Everyone nodded eagerly.

I opened my sketchbook and stopped on one page. "Say hello to... "

Giving the mental command to become a character, I allowed the papers to quickly surround me, creating my revised character, a new body with me in the center, becoming a part of it, a completely different person. I decided to keep 'Amazona' six feet tall with great muscles but, in my haste to impress everyone, I forgot to be less dramatic with her proportions as Garth and Grace had suggested earlier. In the blink of an eye, a tall woman appeared where I once stood.

"... Amazona, Princess of Power!" finishing my line, the woman said.

Lilith snorted. "Yeah, you came up with that one."

"What do you mean?" confused, the 'woman' asked.

"If you try moving around off the printed page," Lilith explained, "those bazongas are going to be more of a hindrance than a help. They block your field of vision, they'll restrict your arm movement, and they'll make you fall over the second your back isn't straight."

"Told ya, Tim," Grace added.

I tried moving around and found that they were right. "I see your point, younglings," Amazona said. "I am sure the artist sees it, too."

"Huh?"

"Tim doesn't just change physically," calmly, Gar explained. "The characters he creates come alive as he envisions them. So you're really talking to a character in a comic book."

Amazona touched the paper again, and the papers returned to the satchel in an instant, leaving me standing sheepishly in front of everyone. "Thanks for the advice," near tears, I said. "I'll definitely redesign her before I call on her again."

"You do that," firmly but kindly, Grace said. "And, please, stop making her costume rip in strategic places in battle."
155332222211112111121121112112121.title: Ted's phone rings again

1553322222111121111211211121121211.content:
My lips trembled slightly. It took all of my effort not to burst into tears right there. However Lyssa put a comforting arm on my shoulder.

"There there, Tim," she cooed, as if she was talking to a baby and in this group, being the youngest, I supposed they saw me as the baby of the group. However, I did not see this as a bad thing. Her comforting tone actually did help to calm me down.
"Nobody is mad at you," she continued

"Not at all," said Grace, roughing Tim's hair slightly "Just give the female characters you make some dignity, Okay?"
I sniffed a little, then smiled "O-Okay."

"Good boy," said Madam Vague, smiling. Then, turning to the others, she said: "Lilith and I need to have a talk with Amber before her mother arrives with her husband."

As Lilith, Madam Vague and Amber went off to one another room, Cait rose a hand to her head, as if she had just been hit with a ball (I can tell this from experience, having grown up in an orphanage where small balls were always being thrown around)

Lyssa seemed to notice. "What's wrong?"

"It's my uncle Cretacous," she said, sounding worried "Dad's brother."

"What about him?" asked Lyssa "Is he okay?"

Cait began to cry. "They attacked his house," she said tearfully "The Agency, they invaded his house, his kids are on the run." Cait got a faraway look in her eyes, then said: "I have to go."

I turned to Lyssa to see if she knew what that was about, but was just in time to see her run down one of the tunnels leading out of the station.

Garth sighed. "Some leader I am," he pouted "I can't even keep a team together."

"Don't be so hard on yourself," said a voice with a heavy Irish accent. I recognised the voice immediately as detective Aaron Flynn, who had spoken to me through the graphic novel.
1553322222111121111211211121121211.title: continue

15533222221111211112112111211212111.content:
It was hard to process what was happening right now. Imagine you'd lived your whole life in an orphanage, never being adopted. Then an evil organisation tries to kidnap you, you escape and leave the country to warn a group of superheroes that the same evil organisation is going to go after their children. In case that wasn't enough for me, I was then adopted by the former leader of the group of heroes. And now, standing right in front of me, were two members of the biological family I thought I had lost.

"Grandma," I whispered, running into her open arms. It seemed that during my inner monologue, Garth and Detective Flynn had had some sort of discussion that I hadn't listened to.

"I hear your father adopted Tim," said Detective Flynn (Or should I start calling him Granddad now?), taking Garth's hand "I'm glad to see he's in good hands."

"Forgive me, but how did you get here so fast?" asked Garth, confusedly.

"Let's just say I've had a lot more experience than Tim," Detective Flynn replied, then paused and turned to see Ted beckoning to Garth "You'd better go see what your dad wants. Take Tim with you."

I broke the hug with Zenia Flynn, and followed Garth. "We're getting a distress call from the Vance residence," said Ted indicating a blinking red light on the console.

One girl groaned and turned into a boy "Just what I needed."

"On the contrary," said Madam Vague "The strength of a Guardian will be needed."

"We'll probably need this too," I said, pulling out a male character I had recently finished working on named Nightside. Although he had no super powers, Nightside was a master of all fighting styles known to man. I had created him not long after my fight with Grace as herself, thinking that becoming him might help her to train. "His names Nightside."

"Alright everyone," said Vague "Focus on the Vance household."

As the SUB station faded from existence, I dragged Nightside from the page and onto myself. A blink of an eye later, and we were in a well furnished living room that would have looked nice had it not become a battleground. Nightside immediately engaged the men around him using street style moves mixed in with Martial Arts. I watched as the boy who was formerly a girl did the same. A bullet, unnoticed by her flew towards her shoulder. Nightside pulled her out of the way, causing the bullet to bury itself in the wall instead.

"Thanks for that," she (he?) said, then looked around at the black suited men that surrounded us "Back to back?" she suggested. Nightside nodded. Both of them started fighting, dodging attacks and pushing back and slowly but surely, we were pushing the enemy back.

So intent were we in fighting off the Agency goons, we didn't hear anything of the battle around us until one of the Agency members shouted "Pick up brass." and they all vanished, leaving nothing but a few destroyed guns on the ground.

"Everybody OK? asked Lyssa, the girl who had run off earlier.

"Looks that way," said Ted. As he continued to speak, I felt something running off me, like liquid, but I ft physically drained. I missed the rest of the discussion as I tried to catch my breath until Garth turned to me. "You did great, Tim,"

"Thanks," I said, blushing slightly "I think I overdid it a little with the multiple changes today, I'm exhausted."

"Go and sit down over there for a bit then," said Garth, pointing to a largely intact chair in the corner. I walked over to it and sat down. I sat in the chair and closed my eyes, meaning g to rest them for a minute, I didn't realise I had fallen asleep until I felt a someone shaking me awake.

It was Madam Vague. "You need rest Tim," said Vague "Your endurance for so many changes is commendable, but you can't just rest whenever you feel like it, wait till we get back to the station."

Vague led you to where the others were gathered in the circle and drew a card from her Tarot deck. The card had a cartoon impression of the moon on it.
15533222221111211112112111211212111.title: Continue

155332222211112111121121112112121111.content:
We had arrived back at the SUB station. The Vances walked deeper into the station as I staggered slightly. Garth caught me.
"Everything Okay?" He asked, softly as he supported me.
"I'm just tired," I replied "I used far too many characters today, it's taken a lot out of me."
"Then I suggest you stick with one character," said Garth, seriously "Pick one you know the best and can work with easily."
I smiled. "That's good advice, thanks." I knew all of my characters well. In was their creator, who would know them better than I would. Perhaps I would choose a hero based on what was needed in any situation we found ourselves in, whichever hero would work best for the team strategy.
"You're a good leader because you care," said Grace to Garth. I couldn't agree with her more.
Garth left in the same direction the Vances had gone.
"Is there anywhere I could take a nap?" I asked, yawning.
"Dad's chosen a home for us over here," said Grace, leading me over to one side "Go ahead and choose a bedroom."
I walked into the small house, chose a room, went in and lay down on the bed, falling asleep almost instantly."
155332222211112111121121112112121111.title: Continue

1553322222111121111211211121121211111.content:
I was standing in a desert of blackness, extending in every direction, it was not close, but it did not seem to be thick either.
"Where am I?" I wondered, turning around as I said it, squinting through the darkness. When I had turned back to my original spot, four people stood where once there was nothing. Even in the pitch blackness surrounding me, I could see the four people clearly. They were my characters, created during my experiences.

"You are dreaming, Tim," said Sun Warrior. She wore her extremely bright yellow costume with her blonde hair shining brighter than anything else.
"Your journey is not yet done, Tim," said Nightside "Sykes is coming, as Is the Agency, and the Problem Child Gang alone, as powerful as they are, will be unable to take on both of their organisations at the same time."
"What other option is there?" You asked "I don't think the Agency and Sykes would work together against the PCG, they hate each other as much as they hate the PCG, if not more."
"In the centre of the Amazon rainforest," said Amazona "There is a place, a source of psychic energy that will be able to temporarily give us bodies out with your body, meaning we can fight alongside you in battle."
"How do you know of this place?" You asked, curiously. You had never been to the Amazon yourself, so how had your characters know about it?
"Your powers are even more powerful than you know," said the hero you had created on the plane but never named, a manipulater of both fire and water "When you created us, you gave us minds of our own as well as being able to see out of any piece of paper anywhere in the world, and as paper comes from trees, we were able to travel to the Amazon."
"This can't happen anyway," I protested "We've not got enough time to get to the Amazon before Sykes and the Agency attack, I need to be here to help them."
"What of your grandfather's power?" asked Sun Warrior "His is merely a more advanced version of your power, perhaps he can teach you how to get to the Amazon."
"We'll give you a few days to think on it," said Nightside "Then, we will return to you in your dreams."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111.title: Continue

choices: Not awake yet, he probably won't be until after training"
15533222221111211112112111211212111111.content:
I woke to find that I had a visitor. A girl with long, raven coloured hair was standing in the room you had fallen asleep in.
"Ah," she smiled at me "You're awake."
It took my still sleep fogged brain a few moments to remember her name: Alyssa Vance, Garth's girlfriend.
"People have been worried about you," she continued "You must have been tired to just stumble into a house and fall asleep."
I sat up on the bed. "I need to go speak to my grandfather," I said, yawning slightly "Do you know where he is?"
Lyssa looked confused "Your grandfather?"
"Detective Flynn," I said "He arrived right after you ran off, I've known he was my grandfather for a while now, he talked to me through one of the graphic novels."
"Well, I'm happy you found your family, Tim," she replied, smiling again. She was really pretty, Garth was really lucky to have a girlfriend like her "I've not seen Flynn around, but why don't you come with me, Garth sent me to find you as we're going to do some training as a team."
"I don't know," I said "I have to talk to Grandpa at some point today though, it might be important."
"Well," said Lyssa with a smile "Detective Flynn is..."
15533222221111211112112111211212111111.title: I wake up

choices: I draw what Vendetta really looks like
I draw who Vendetta is impersonating at this moment
155332222211112111121121112112121111112.content:
I followed Lyssa out to the training area. It looked like a horse racing track. A wide track went round the outside of a wide, open area in the centre of it. Detective Flynn and the other members of the PCG were standing in the centre of the open area. When myself and Lyssa drew level with the others, Detective Flynn began to speak.
"One of the most powerful weapons in the hands of the Agency is Agent Maria Vendetta. Vendetta has the ability to become anyone or anything, we know that Vendetta is in Waterfront City, we don't know where, we don't even know what she really looks like, she could be impersonating one of you right now, and we wouldn't even know."
The other members looked at each other nervously. Suddenly, something stirred in my memory.
"Hang on," I said, raising my hand slightly "I know that name from somewhere, she was with the team that captured me from the orphanage."
"What did she look like?" Asked Detective Flynn, earnestly "She was in her territory, she had no reason to hide then."
My pad and pen appeared in my hand, I opened it and started to draw.
155332222211112111121121112112121111112.title: is leading the training session

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
Hearing the name, Vendetta, I remembered a man at the Agency calling someone by that name. It was very brief as I was in the middle of trying to escape but I was sure I had seen her face. I began to draw her, hoping it would help. I did not realize, until I was done, that Vendetta was a small girl. My mind went back to where I had seen her and remembered seeing her in a school uniform; the same school uniform used in the Waterfront City schools! "Vendetta is going to infiltrate the middle school?" confused, I asked myself. "That's strange; why would she be ordered to do that? The only person in our group who goes there is..." I gasped. "Rhea Rodgers!"

"Tim!" came Flynn's voice. "Tim! Wake up, lad!"

My eyes darted open and I looked around, confused. "Weird dream." rubbing my head, I muttered.

"Not just a dream, lad." pointing to my lap, Flynn said. "You had a vision."

I looked down at my lap and found that I had been drawing in my sleep. Page after page of images I do not remember making, including one of a massive ship that looked like two aircraft carriers linked in a V shape, flying in the sky. "How could I have had a vision?" confused, I asked. "I'm not psychic."

"No, you are not." pausing, Flynn said. "However, you have a unique form of extra sensory perception. One that I had found very useful in my day."

"What do you mean?" curious, I asked.

"Anywhere there is a picture of you, anywhere in the world, you can see though its eyes." serious, Flynn said. "Anytime you see a picture of someone you had encountered, you can see what they are doing at the moment you stare at the image." he smiled then whispered, "Why do you think I took pictures of the original members when they were fighting crime in my city?"

"I had a dream that you were telling us about Maria Vendetta!" quickly, I said. "She's a little girl and I think she is going to try to kidnap Rhea Rodgers!"

"That attempt was already made." calmly, Flynn said. "I had the same vision and warned Mrs Rodgers to home school her children for their own safety."

I sighed in relief then showed Flynn the image of the massive ship I had drawn. "Do you have any idea what this is, grandpa?"

Flynn turned pale. "The Singularity." whispering, he said. he then eyed me with a cold eye that made me shiver. "Have you encountered a man named Blitzkrieg?"

"I- I met a teenager of that name." thinking I had made Flynn mad, I replied. "He helped me escape the Agency before I fled to the States."

Flynn sighed, his face softening. "That man is someone you would be better off avoiding." he said.

"Why, is he with the Agency?" curious, i asked.

"It's a long story, lad." shaking his head, Flynn said. "He technically works for the 'good guys' but he has a nasty habit of ignoring the rules. He will do unspeakable things to get the job done." he shed a tear, adding, "Including taking you from your father."

My face turned pale then turned red. "What!?!"
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: I draw what Vendetta really looks like

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"Not long after the Problem Child Gang left to go to Europe," Flynn began "I did some research on the group calling themselves the Agency, and found that they were not Sykes employers, but his enemies, however, my research was interrupted before I could get a message to the Problem Child Gang about who they were really facing."
"So how do I get into this?" I asked, a little confused
"I'll get to that," said Flynn "CHILD sent a team to capture me, although unaware they were coming, I was not unprepared and they fell into one of the traps I had set up for just such a purpose. Believing they were with the Agency, come to capture me, I interrogated them, but found them to be working against the Agency as I was. They asked me to come back to their headquarters, so I did. Their leader, a young man named Blitzkrieg, only about ten years older than the oldest member of the Problem Child Gang at the time, told me he had some information that might be of use to me, but I would have to agree to something first, he wished that I join his organisation and fight against the Agency with them."
"And what did you say in response?" asked Tim.
"Naturally I refused," said Flynn "Although their intel would help the Problem Child Gang a great deal, I disagreed with the tactics he had been planning to use to capture me, kidnap, I thought that they're morals were not much better than the Agency. They attacked me, apparently thinking I would join them willingly or unwillingly, but they were no match for me."
Flynn took out his own pad and drew what looked like the inside of an aircraft carrier, along with himself at a younger age and several men attacking him. They watched as Flynn transformed into a superhero with the letters 'HS' on his top.
"Blitzkrieg thought he had me beat, his men overwhelmed me, but I had figured out his weakness," said Flynn "Hit the real one, and the rest would disappear."
"How?" asked Tim "There must be hundreds of him, how would you tell which was real?"
"I think I know," said Grace "Only one of them gives off heat, right?"
"Very good," said Flynn "The HS on my character's costume stands for Heat Seeker, his power is simple, he can tell if an object or person is emitting heat and the hotter someone is, the stronger his blows on them, so in essence, the more his opponents try to kill him, the more they get worked up, the easier it is to kill them, and in this case, Blitzkrieg is the only one building up heat, the effort of controlling the clones is putting up his body temperature even more."
The Flynn on the page punched just one of the clones surrounding him, throwing him backwards into the wall of the carrier. The other clones vanished.
"You're pretty good," said Blitzkrieg, getting up slowly "Very well, I shall let you go, but rest assured, if I ever find anyone with the same power or similar, I will do whatever it takes to get them on my side."
"As a gesture of 'good faith', Blitzkrieg gave me everything they had on the Agency," said Flynn "He was true to his word, and let me head back to my station, but by the time I got there, the Problem Chid Gang had already left, going after Sykes."
"I think I see what you mean about this affecting me now," said Tim "But if all of this is true, then why did the Blitzkrieg clone in the Agency tell me to go find the Problem Child Gang?"
"I don't know," said Flynn "What I do know, is that years later, after my son and daughter had been born, I lived in constant fear that one of them would develop my powers and CHILD would return, it wasn't until you were born, that CHILD kidnapped you, putting you in an orphanage in Europe. Then Blitzkrieg returned to me, he told me that if I wanted my grandson back, I would come and work for CHILD, again, I refused, but I was oh so tempted."
"What of my father?" asked Tim
"He fell into a depression for a few years," said Flynn "Then without warning he disappeared. I tried to track him down through my police connections, but he had vanished completely. I tried tracking you too, but CHILD had been very thorough, I guessed that in a few years, you would become a CHILD agent, and we would never see you again."
"It's all right, Granddad," said Tim, crying slightly "You got me back, I'm fine."
"That's why I'll never trust CHILD," said Detective Flynn "No matter what they offer me, they're blackmailers, backstabbers and kidnappers, all done in pursuit of the greater good."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Your choice.

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
Flynn sighed. "Enough about that, for now." he said. "We should get back to the others." he turned to his own sketchbook and added, "It seems Gar is trying to gather everyone for a meeting, let's see what he has on his mind."

I nodded and followed Flynn through a number of hallways to what had become known as the main hall where Gar had gathered a few of the new members. "Where is everyone else." curious, I thought.

"We should get everyone together." serious, Gar said. "We need to put everything we know on the table and try to get a better picture of what we are dealing with."

"Not now, tonight." firmly, dad said. "When we are able to gather freely."

"Why?" curious, Gar asked. "Where is everyone?"

"Susan Tanner is in another part of the station, finishing her training with her parents." serious, dad said. "They tell me they will be finished by tonight."

"I saw her practice when I drew a picture of her." smiling slightly, I thought. "She and her father are good fighters."

"Marisol is almost done unpacking." chiming in, Caitlin said. "Trish and Brad are helping her." she smiled, adding, "I have a feeling they are going to get back together."

Mom sighed. "Alyssa is watching over her brother, Sam while her parents consult Beth." softly, she said. "Her ability to communicate with spirits had increased in power, it has her a bit shaken."

"My mom and I might be able to help her with that." serious, Lilith said. "We'll talk to her later."

Dad nodded then turned to Alex. "Mr Rodgers needs to be brought up to speed so he understands what he may be facing in the near future." calmly, he said. "Sarah Barns will arrive after sunset, Madam Vague has agreed to escort her here."

"Don't forget about me." piping in, I said.

"Relax, lad." roughing up my hair, Flynn said. "No one is forgetting about you."

"We'll discuss what you saw in your sketch book with Madam Vague when she returns with Mrs Barns and her husband." firmly but kindly, dad said. he then turned to the others. "Damien, Anette, and Amadeus Johnson are getting themselves settled. We will be talking to them later."

"What of Travis and Megan?" worried, Gar asked.

"Who and who?" curious, I thought.

"Travis Greenway and Megan Connors have gone missing." to everyone's concern, dad replied. "I have my best men looking into it but, from what we have so far, it looks like some government agency got wind of their abilities."

Hearing this, Lilith drew a card from her deck. Only, upon seeing what she had drawn, she turned pale before turning to her mother who sighed. "Heaven help them." she whispered.

"What is it?" turning to Lilith, I asked. "What card did you draw?"

"It's the Devil card." softly, Lilith said. "Travis and Megan are with some bad company."

"Caitlin, can you find them?" turning to her, I asked.

Caitlin placed a light hand onto her head while Madam Vague drew a card of her own. "They are safe, for the moment." after a pause, Caitlin replied. "Though I sense they feel threatened."

"They are with a new player." not revealing her drawn card, Madam Vague said. "Someone who follows a different set of rules."

We all turned to each other, concerned before dad sighed and said...
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: continue

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"You do?" hopeful, Gar asked. "Where?"

"CHILD has them." ice in his voice, dad said.

"Who?" curious, Lilith asked.

"Central Headquarters of Intelligence, Logistics, and Defense." darkly, Flynn said. "They were originally founded to thwart a terrorist group known as the Hard Line who was hell bent upon stopping the United Europe movement before it gained real momentum."

"They approached us shortly after returning from Europe, still recovering from Sykes' trap and our battle with the Agency." serious, dad explained. "They wanted to recruit us and offered us a level of training we would never be able to achieve on our own."

"The same thing they offered grandpa." slightly pale, I thought.

"They gave me the same offer but I refused." sighing, Flynn added. "They kidnapped my grandson to try to persuade me but I fought back and he ended up in an orphanage."

"Until fate brought him back to you." sighing herself, Grace said. "What of his parents?"

Madam Vague drew a card and sadly shook her head. "Sorry, I do not know."

Lilith turned to her mother curious but Vague slowly shook her head, a tear forming, and Lilith sadly nodded before turning back to my father. "Do you think this CHILD is after to recruit them?"

"It's very possible." shaking his head, dad replied. "Unfortunately, this is a group who does not like to be turned down when they make an offer."

"What did they do when you refused them?" curious, Gar asked.

Dad drew a breath then slowly released it. "They let us go." simply, he said. "Only they vowed to be in touch with us and they have, for twenty years."

"What!?" alarmed, Gar asked.

"Just like grandpa, they didn't really let them go." gulping, I thought.

"The van outside of the Rodgers' residence, the van Travis and Megan reported seeing outside of the hospital, the car following us on the freeway... all of them were from CHILD." annoyance in his voice, dad said. "They have been watching us for a very long time."

"Are they on our side or another villain we have to worry about?" concerned, Cait asked.

"They consider themselves the good guys but they will do whatever it takes to get the job done." serious, Flynn said. "They are dangerous but they are the enemy of our enemy."

"The enemy of my enemy is my friend." softly, Grace said. "Only with friends like that..."

"So far, they have only approached Travis and Megan." thoughtful, Gar said. "However, that does not mean they will stop there. If they are after the Agency, they will need someone who had experience dealing with them."

"Our parents..." turning pale, Grace said.

"Yeah, but they will also need able bodied people to do their fighting for them." serious, Gar said. "That's why they need us."

"What's your plan, Gar?" turning to me, dad asked.

I sighed then replied, "We will need to have a talk with these people..."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: I know where they are.

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
