"It'll need to be a trade," Gar continued "They have something we want, we have something they want, although I'm afraid to say, it won't be easy to get Travis and Megan back, CHILD will want to keep them as leverage in case they ever need us again."

"So what do you suggest?" worried, I asked. "We don't even know how to find these people."

Gar thought for a moment. Looking at him, I could tell what he was thinking, 'How could we get into contact with CHILD on our terms?' "We let them find us." finally, Gar replied. "We will go out, just a small team in an 'ordinary' car."

"You are hoping, with this CHILD watching, they will go to you?" curious, dad asked.

"That's right only we will be waiting for them." firmly, Gar replied. he turned to Flynn. "Detective Flynn, you said that you had dealings with them before, so I'll need you to stay here on the camera feed and guide the away team as needed."

Flynn nodded. "I'll do my best." he said.

"What about me?" curious, I asked.

"Tim, you said you'd met their leader before and claimed you had nearly defeated him in combat." turning to him, Gar said. "If it comes to it, do you think you can do it again?"

"Maybe." wincing, I replied. "The character I used then was sort of out of control."

"A last resort then." sighing, Gar said. "We may need to count on you."

"I- I'll try." uncertain, I said.

Gar nodded at him then turned to Cait. "Cait, we'll need you on the away team; if we end up walking into a trap, you should be able to sense it in time for us to avoid any serious trouble."

"And you'll lead the away team?" raising an eyebrow, Grace asked. "Is that a good idea, if you think the Beast is too important to risk, why should you think that you would be any different?"

"If I am to be the leader of this team, I must be a part of any risky plan I put on the table." serious, Gar said. "From what dad and Detective Flynn are telling us, this CHILD is as dangerous as the Agency." he shook my head, "I will not ask anyone to go on a mission I am not willing to take on myself."

"You're becoming a better leader everyday, lad," said Flynn "Your dad made a wise choice making you team leader and I will follow you."

"This plan is only a suggestion." firmly, Gar said "I'm pitching what I think the best course if action is, if anyone has an issue with any of this plan, or has a better way to approach this, I want you to speak up now and be heard. There are a lot of places this plan could go wrong, I'm covering them as best I can, but I would welcome any advice about how I could cover it better."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: on our terms.

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
As if on cue, Mrs Vance rolled into the room with her husband pushing her along. "Delay whatever you are planning, all of you!" sharply, Sarah said. "My daughter, Beth has discovered new evidence that changes the game!"

"What did Beth find?" curious,Gar asked.

"An alien ship." panting, Beth replied. "It must have crashed here centuries ago."

"I always found it strange that, when we recovered something Sykes had stolen, he never went after it again, he targeted something else." serious, Sarah said. "What was also strange was that he repeatedly said he was after something out of this world."

"He's after the technology the ship offers." turning pale, Gar said.

"He probably always was." turning pale myself, I thought. "The robberies were just a front!"

Lilith threw her cards into the air, waited for them to shuffle, then drew a card. "The tower." muttering, she said. she drew a second card. "The Earth." she drew a third and gulped. "Death..."

"Every decision we make from here on in will be critical." serious, Madam Vague said. "From what my daughter has read in the cards, this will change the world but not all will see its conclusion."

"I do not believe in fate." appearing in the room with his daughter, Susan, Geo said. "We forge our own destiny through the choices we make." he sighed. "However, yes, I agree every move will be critical and thus must be carefully planned."

"Where is Steve?" worried, Sarah asked. "He needs to know this too."

"He's with our daughter at CHILD headquarters." stepping up, Mrs Connors said. "He called me a few hours ago, tell me they had an interest in our daughter."

"Have you heard from him since then?" serious, Gar asked.

Mrs Connors teared up, shaking her head. "No and I'm worried." softly, she said.

Gar bit down onto his lip, thinking. "We'll have to change our strategy." finally, he said. "Beth, can you take us back to the spaceship you found?"

"I fell through the floor in the unfinished tunnel." shaken, Beth replied. "I was teleported back by Zen."

"Zen? Who is Zen?" curious, Geo asked.

"The ship's artificial intelligent computer." serious, Beth replied. "It led me to a teleportation unit that brought me back to the tunnel with mom and dad."

"A teleporter that could take us straight to CHILD." serious, Gar said.

"That might be like placing your hand into a hornets nest, Gar." warning him, dad said. "Those people do not like uninvited guests and they do not play games."

"One of us has to make the first move." serious, Gar countered. "I suggest a small away team go to CHILD and see what they want with us."

"He's either very brave or is trying to be." wincing, I whispered.

"His father was the same way when he was that age." whispering in my ear, grandpa said. "That is why he is trying to talk him out of that plan."

"How much information would you share with them?" raising an eyebrow, Geo asked. "Would you or those you select for this away team be able to hold their own under an interrogation?"

"I trust this CHILD about as far as I can kick them." ice in his tone, dad said. "They will use any means necessary to obtain their goals and, so long as the greater good is done, they do not care who gets hurt or killed in the process."

"I will go alone." darkly, Gar said. "Those who wish to join me may but understand the dangers involved." he turned to dad and frowned. "Its not my first choice to deal with them either but if Sykes has alien tech at his disposal, we are going to need some outside help to deal with him."

"Its happening all over again." sighing, dad said. he turned to Geo. "We may have to come out of retirement, old friend."

Geo nodded. "Indeed." serious, he said.

We heard voices and turned to find two boys and a girl entering the room. "Who are they?" quietly, I wondered. "More members?" I then turned as grandpa Flynn spoke.

"I will go with you, Gar." calmly, he said. "I cleaned Blitzkrieg's clock before, I can certainly do it again." he then nodded at me, showing I had nothing to fear, though I still worried.

"I will go as well." firmly but kindly, Madam Vague said. "I have a lot of clout in many places, not to mention a few tricks up my sleeve, they will listen to me."

"I'll go with you." offering, I said. "They kidnapped me..."

"We are not going to them to start a pissing match." firmly but kindly, Gar said. "You stay here."

Then, Annette politely cleared her throat and we turned to her. "Ah, Annette, Damien." motioning us closer, Cait said. "Meet the rest of the gang."

"These are two of the three you told us about?" calmly, Gar asked.

"Garth, these are my cousins, Annette, Damien, and Amadeus." introducing them, Cait said. "Annette and Damien both have the ability to grow and shrink but the trigger is a bit unusual." she then turned to Amadeus. "Their bother, Amadeus has the power to do anything as if he were trained to do so all his life, though he's a bit reckless."

"So I heard." nodding at them, Gar said. "I have super strength and endurance." I motioned to the others... "My sister, Grace, total recall; my brother, Tim, paper manipulation; Alyssa Vance, super speed; Bethany Vance, psychic spiritual guide... "

"I can sort of talk to ghosts." shrugging, Beth said. "Its complicated." she then giggled seeing a toddler boy walking passed above them. "Come down, you rascal!" the boy giggled as Beth pulled him down by his arms. "This is my brother, Sam. He has the power to fly but being only two..."

"I can imagine." giggling, Annette said.

Gar nodded then continued. "Clem Rodgers, shape shifting; Susan Tanner, ghost powers and ninja training; Lilith Nightshade, magical powers and mystic wisdom." motioning to the others, he said. "We have two other members but they are in the hands of CHILD.

"Travis Greenway, who is an Animancer and Megan Connors who is a Technomancer." turning to Annette, Cait said. "We suspect CHILD took them after the first day of school."

"Animancer... Technomancer?" confused, Damien asked.

"Who is this CHILD?" serious, Amadeus asked.

"An Animancer is a person who can shift shape into any form of animal, including Anthros like Minotaurs or Centaurs." serious, Cait replied. "A Technomancer has the psychic power over machines, making them work on their own within the limits of their design."

"Can she change into machines?" curious, Damien asked.

"Not without seriously injuring herself." wincing, Beth replied. "Even without that, her power is impressive, hence why we think CHILD wants them."

"I don't doubt it." stunned, Annette said. "We have quite an arsenal of power here." she winced, asking, "Are you planning a rescue mission?"

"Well, new evidence has us thinking that even our power may not be enough." softly, Ted Jones said. "The Agency has people under their control who have powers like our own, they are a greater threat now than when we faced then twenty years ago."

"What of Sykes?" curious, Amadeus asked. "Was he not the greatest adversary of the Problem Child Gang when they were active?"

Before anyone could answer, a number of alarms sounded, startling everyone in the room. "What was that?" startled, Beth asked.

Dad turned to a table and hit a button, causing a large screen television to rise from the floor. It came on, showing camera images all over the city. One showed a number of strange hovering platforms, moving into the center of the city. He hit another button, filling the screen with that image. What they saw was Sykes and a number of his followers on five strange floating platforms, firing what looked like sci-fi laser rifles at random buildings. Dad focused the camera image on a man on the lead platform before a low growl echoed from his throat. The man was tall with longish brown hair and piercing green eyes. He was wearing oddly ancient leather armor as he held a laser rifle of his own while holding the hilt of a sword at his side.

"Sykes!" anger in his voice, he said. "He's returned and he is attacking the city!"

"But why!?" angry as well, Gar asked. "What could he possibly gain by..."

"Bait." flatly, Geo said. "He's trying to draw us into the open."

"What- What are we going to do?" worried, Lyssa asked.

"We'll handle this." serious, dad said. "Its us he wants."

"Not alone, you're not!" firmly, Gar said. "We are the new Problem Child Gang."

"You are a bunch of kids with no real experience in taking down criminals!" snapping, dad countered. "All of you will stay here!" he then turned to me. "I need you, however, to come with me."

I gulped. "Me?" surprised, I asked.

Dad nodded. "I'll explain on the way to the surface." serious, he said. he then turned to the other parents and nodded before leaving the room with them following.

I could only wonder what my new brother Gar was thinking as I was lead out with the adults. Still, I was more worried about what they needed from me....
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: someone speaks up.

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
Dad and the others led me to the parking garage where I saw 'The Beast', the problem child gang's armored van. I gasped and ran up to it, just wanting to touch it. "I read all about this van!" excited, I said. "It's virtually indestructible!"

"She's a tough one, that's for sure." smiling, dad said. "However, we need to create a distraction in order to catch Sykes off guard."

"Is that what you need me for?" gulping, I asked. "To give you that distraction?"

Dad nodded. "Do you think you can make a copy of the beast with your paper manipulation powers?" he asked, pointing to a number of tall stacks of paper. "It will help us get the jump on him."

I looked at the van then turned to dad, uncertain. "I- I'll try." wincing, I said.

"Take a deep breath and close your eyes." softly but firmly, Geo instructed. "Picture the van in your mind in every possible detail from what you had read in the graphic novels."

I did as I was told and visualized the van in my mind. I tried to think of every detail from the battering ram front bumper to armored tail lights. Once I had the van pictured in my mind, I said, "I think I got it."

"Good." softly, Geo said. "Now, imagine the stacks of paper coming together to build it. Keep thinking of every detail as you do this."

I clenched my fists, giving the effort all of my mental strength. At first, nothing seemed to happen and I sighed, frustrated. "I- I..." tearing up, I said. "I'm sorry."

"Relax, son." touching my shoulder, dad said. "You are trying to hard, ease into it."

I took a breath and tried again, trying to stay relaxed and, to my surprise, I saw paper moving about in my mind, surrounding the van, covering every inch. In the parking garage, dad smiled as papers flew about in a frenzy, quickly forming the van in every last detail. Within a minute, there was an exact duplicate of the van standing next to the original. Then, to everyone's surprise, it came to life with a roar, the paper van was running idol!

Hearing the engine come to life, I opened my eyes. "I did it!" surprised, I exclaimed. then I felt an overpowering weakness and found myself falling into dad's powerful arms.

"You did great, son." smiling, dad said.

"Eat this, Tim." handing me what looked like a candy bar, Geo said. "It will help you regain your strength, we need you to keep the paper van intact."

I chomped onto the 'candy bar' and nearly gagged. "It tastes like tree bark." making a face, I said.

"It's an energy bar." smiling slightly, Geo said. "I'll admit the taste leaves much to be desired but it will restore your strength quickly."

Albeit reluctantly, I ate the horrid tasting bar and was surprised to find that I was feeling better within minutes of swallowing the last bite. "Wow, what was in that?" curious, I asked.

"I don't know." simply, Geo replied.

I rolled my eyes and turned to dad. "What's next?"

"Next we, give Sykes what he wants." serious, Geo said. "We give him us. Tim, you will be in the paper van with Madame Vague, who will be driving."

"I can make inanimate objects move with the flip of a card." mysteriously, Vague said. "Don't worry, we will be safely away before Sykes fires his first shot at us."

"We will be coming in from another direction." nodding to Geo, dad said. "With luck, we all still have it and Sykes will not know what hit him."

With that, Vague led me to the paper van where she sat in the driver's seat while I jumped up into the passenger seat. "You did not miss a single detail, Tim." smiling she said. "You even remembered the seat belts." she touched my shoulder. "You have a great power; use it wisely."

I nodded. "I will try, ma'am."

Vague winked at me. "Let's go get them."

I paused, seeing a certain sadness in Vague's eyes. It was as if she knew something she was not sharing with everyone. Then I remembered the card she did not reveal and began to worry...
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: continue.

choices: Madam Vague attacks me mid transformation
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
As we got closer to Sykes location, we saw the destruction he had wrought. Fire and smoke surrounded us and hover platforms flew overhead, taking pot shots at random parked vehicles. I saw Sykes standing on a hover platform idling at the end of the road we were speeding up. On his platform, was a huge, sci fi cannon, and it was pointed directly at us.

"When he shoots," said Vague "Get ready to change into a character, I thought we might have bought enough time, but the others aren't here yet, we'll need a longer distraction."

"Understood," I said.

I then looked through my sketchbook at all the characters I had created. My most powerful one was still Sun Warrior, but with the tweaks I had made to her personality, would she have enough restraint to stop her from unnecessarily killing Sykes, but enough initiative to do what needed to be done? It wasn't Sykes I was worried about, he was practically immortal anyway, and wouldn't really be affected by Sun Warrior's powers to the same extent as a normal person, it was the safety of the buildings and people of Waterfront City that I worried for. I had no time to choose another character, though, it was time for action. The fake Beast exploded just as Madam Vague grabbed me and barreled out the back, barely getting away before it violently exploded.

"I thought you said you could get us out by moving the van," I said "Not us."

"Something is blocking my power." she said "We still need to keep up the distraction, we need to buy more time."

I nodded, putting my hand to the picture I'd already selected.
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Battle with Sykes.

choices: We get there just as Sykes men attack
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
Madam Vague threw herself at me, as the transformation began, she tackled me to the ground. As the papers continued to fly around me, forming the clothes and body of my character, Sun Warrior, we landed on the ground, just in time, as a massive, green beam missed us by inches. Sykes stood off to the side, the gun he had just fired in one hand, and a sword in the other.

"What do we have here?" his voice even and cold, Sykes asked. "Madame Vague, its been a long time."

"Not long enough, Sykes." rising to her feet, Vague replied. "I had thought you were dead."

"In a way, I was." serious, Sykes said. "Only, like the Phoenix, I rose from the ashes of my defeat."

As Sykes boasted, my pad and pen appeared in my hand and I drew a sword, pulling it off the page and handing it to Madam Vague. The pad and paper vanished, and I allowed Sun Warrior to take over for the time being. "Villains talk too much." in an almost melodious tone, I heard her whisper.

She immediately flew into the air, glowing brightly as sunlight entered her skin. This feeling was better than anything I had ever felt. It wasn't her controlling my body, nor me controlling hers. We were working together, as one, our thoughts, our actions, they were all unified. I felt energy being absorbed by Sun Warrior's body as she flew around, dodging Sykes' blasts. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw Vague circling Sykes as if trying to find a position to attack him.

"I see you found yourself a new prodigy, Vague." calmly, Sykes said. "I wonder why 'she' hesitates."

"Are you ready?" I asked, in my head. Sun Warrior replied, *Let's do this.*

We dived, so fast, we seemed to turn temporarily invisible. We slammed into Sykes so hard, that he was buried in the ground up to his knees. We brought our hands together and shot a beam of energy at the ground around Sykes, sealing the ground around him, so he couldn't get out, or so we hoped.

"Looks like you've beaten me." sarcastically, Sykes said. "I don't know you, what's your connection to the Problem Child Gang?"

I waved my hands in a dramatic way to hide the fact that they were returning Sun Warrior to my sketch book where she had come from. Once the papers were gone, I was left with my super hero outfit, which was a skin tight outfit that was made to look like a number of blank canvases stitched together. As for hiding my face, it was a clever design of my own. It was a paper mask that made me look as if I had no face at all, just the outline of one.

"I'm Sketch," papers flying off me, I replied. "That is all you are getting from me besides a one way trip to prison for your crimes."

"Perhaps when I am done." said Sykes "Only I am confident that the world will be thanking me for my service to them."

As he spoke the real Beast drove up behind, and the original PCG stepped out.

"Perfect timing." with a sadistic smile, Sykes said. "The whole gang's here, have you come to surrender?"

I almost laughed "Surrender? We've won, your beaten, you won't be getting what you want."

"I already have what I want." calmly, Sykes replied. "Only I want more." he gave a low sadistic laugh that sent a shiver down my spine. "The Agency is after this as well as revenge. You've defeated us both but you won't be that lucky twice, Problem Child Gang."

"All right, shut up," annoyed, Ted said. "Your coming down to the police station with us."

"There was one thing I learned from the Agency," said Sykes "Always have an escape plan."
Sykes glowed with green light, then vanished with his sadistic laughter echoing as the platforms sped away from the city center.

"Dammit!" shouted Ted "We had him!"

Madam Vague paled then drew a card. "No, he had us." trembling slightly, she said. "This was a distraction, we've been conned!"

Geo paused then turned pale himself. "He needed to bait us into the open so he could see where we exit our headquarters from the sky." softly, he said. "He needed us, the more experienced members out of the way from the base."

"The kids!" turning white, Ted yelled. "He got us away from the substation so his men could attack it!"

"I thought no one knew about the substation, that it was safe." confused, I said.

"Nothing is completely safe." quickly, Ted replied. "Get in," said Ted "We have to get back, and quickly!"
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Madam Vague attacks me mid transformation

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
Dad was cursing himself out the entire drive out of town, ignoring the police radio, screaming for back up to pursue the terrorists who had attacked the city and fled. "I should have seen this coming!" angry with himself, he said. "Sykes has been duping us all this time and he did it again!"

"I- I'm sure they'll be fine, dad." trying to be of comfort, I said. "Garth is a good leader."

"I hope you're right." sighing, dad replied. "I really do."

As we came upon the road that lead to the secret entrance, dad stopped the car and looked out the windshield in surprise. "I'll be damned...."

Curious, I looked out and smiled. Garth, Grace, Lyssa, and everyone else were kicking the tar out of a small army of men in strange military style uniforms and ski masks. A large number of them were retreating to a floating platform, trying to make an escape only Daniel and Annette grew to giant size and crushed the platform before they could reach it.

Garth had dad's old 'unbreakable' bar in hand and he was using it to fight off three, four, five men at a time while taking a cleansing breath every now and then. Seeing this, I remembered that Garth had told me he needed to keep himself from growing angry to keep his strength.

"It looks like we missed the 'fun'." with an impressed look, Geo said.

"We can still clean up." opening the driver's side door, dad said. "Let's go."

Within minutes, the fifty men who had attempted to find and attack the substation had been captured and handcuffed, sitting in a row on the sidewalk. "I'll call for back up to pick up these scumbags and put them into custody." serious, dad said. "You kids did good but try to leave the police work to us."

"That has a familiar ring to it." softly, Detective Flynn said.

Dad gave grandpa a discrete smile and I could see Garth trying to hide a smile of his own. Only we did not have time to celebrate as a helicopter came in from nowhere and landed several feet away in an open clearing. "Who the hell are they?" curious, I muttered.

Dad and Flynn growled slightly as they replied in unison, "CHILD agents."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Missed the 'fun'.

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
Five men left the helicopter. While four of them went to inspect the unconscious men on the ground, a single man approached us. He was older, looked more battle worn, and tired, but there was no mistaking Blitzkrieg.
"What do we do?" I asked, already pumped for a fight. However, I felt a hand on my shoulder.
"Not now, lad," said Detective Flynn "Let's see what he wants."
The rest of the Problem Child Gang approached us, and turned to face Blitzkrieg as he approached.

"You can lower your guard," said Blitzkrieg "We didn't come to fight you."
"What do you want?" asked Detective Flynn, in a cold voice "Didn't we make it clear, CHILD is not welcome, but apparently, you decided to go after my grandson when I refused to work for you. You know that makes you as bad as the Agency you fight against?"
"I'll admit my organisation has made mistakes in the past," said Blitzkrieg "But right now, we need to put that behind us, both Sykes and the Agency are coming here, we have no idea what they want, from their movements, we think they're looking for something, as much as you might distrust us, our only chance is to work together."
"As much as it pains me to admit it," I said "Blitzkrieg may have a point, the original Problem Child Gang was barely able to take down Sykes or the Agency on their own, now their both attacking us, Sykes' organisation has grown, and we don't even know what power the Agency has behind it. CHILD has the intel, but not the means to fight the Agency and Sykes, we have the means, but not the intel for fighting against them, I think the only way we're going to get through this, is together."

How do the rest of the team respond?
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Enter Blitzkrieg.

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"What happens if we join forces with you?" skeptical, Garth asked. "Who would be in charge?"

"I give the orders when it comes to my crew." serious, Blitzkrieg replied. "If you join forces with my team, you and I will have to work as one if we are to get anything accomplished."

"Garth is still underage, Blitzkrieg." sternly, dad said. "I am also the chief of police; you can't take him or any of the other kids without our approval."

"If you were going to expose us, you would have done so before this." coldly, Blitzkrieg said. "I am not the one who threw them into this mix, they were a part of it the day they were born."

"Sykes attacked the city then fled, why?" chiming in, Lyssa asked. "I doubt it was just to distract our parents so his goons could say 'hello' to us."

"It wasn't all a distraction." serious, Blitzkrieg replied. "Sykes destroyed the wall that held the 'blind post office' at the school, the abandoned tower at the park that was used to boost and carry the signal to your homes, and the few 'non-working' telephone booths at the center of the city." he shook his head. "The random firing was to cover up that move. Sykes was destroying all of your known lines of communication so to cripple your ability to organize."

"This is just a prelude of what is yet to come." mussing, Amadeus said.

"The attack on us was likely to study our moves, search for weaknesses." mussing as well, Grace added. "It's rather brilliant, really."

"We need to organize before the real strikes begin." serious, Blitzkrieg said. "Sykes and the Agency are making moves all around the globe, we need to act, now!"

"Exactly what are you suggesting?" folding his arms, dad asked.

"I am suggesting that we utilize all we have in the best way possible." patiently, Blitzkrieg said. he turned to Beth. "There is a girl in Scotland who has developed the ability to use ghosts as guides, protectors, and weapons. We need to reach her before Sykes or the Agency does."

"Hold on now!" stepping in, Mr Vance shouted. "I gave you no permission to recruit my daughter!"

"Daddy, if these people get a hold of this girl, they will do all they can to control her." softly, Beth said. she turned to Blitzkrieg. "If I go, you must provide me with everything I say I will need. Also, if this is a trick or a trap, you will learn that I can do more than just talk to ghosts. Is that clear, Blitzkrieg?"

"Crystal." flatly, Blitzkrieg replied. "Prepare a list and I will get it together for you, the plane leaves tomorrow morning."

"I won't let her go alone." serious, Mr. Vance said.

"Then go with her." calmly, Blitzkrieg said. "This is bigger than any of us alone, there is no time for bickering amongst ourselves." he then turned to the rest of our team. "The rest of you, if you are in, either join me at CHILD headquarters or take me below so we can discuss some strategy."

Where do we take Blitzkrieg and his men?
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Agree

choices: Picking the team for Europe. You are in it.
Picking the team to go to Europe. You're not in it.
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"Come downstairs," said Flynn "And leave your men up here, you come down alone."

"As you wish," said Blitzkrieg, signalling to his men to stay put.

Flynn lead the way, as the original Problem Child Gang fell in around Blitzkrieg.

"Still don't trust me?" asked Blitzkrieg "I don't suppose I blame you, I would guess your base has automated defences, if I double cross you, you'll activate them."

Nobody spoke to Blitzkrieg as we descended the ramp, and closed it behind them. Flynn led us to a conference room big enough for all of us and Blitzkrieg, but just barely. We took our seats.

"All right," said Ted "What sort of power does the Agency have behind it? We have no idea what we're up against, with Sykes or the Agency, if CHILD knows anything about the movements and power behind the Agency, we need to put all we know about the Agency and Sykes on the table."

"As Tim has probably told you," said Blitzkrieg "I have one of my clones working within the Agency; they know that CHILD exists, but not that I am running it. As far as I can make out, they have three operatives that are not under their control, aside from myself."

"Who?" curious, I asked.

"A girl called Owl, she's psychic and a telepath." serious, Blitzkrieg replied. "She's not one of us; she's a mercenary, a bounty hunter, if you will. The Agency pays her to carry out certain jobs, but she has no allegiance to them." he paused then added, "We talked to her, and she's agreed to help us free of charge."

"What exactly are you asking her to do?" raising an eyebrow, dad asked.

"We asked her to retrieve the other two people who aren't brainwashed, Tommy and Aura Winters, they've both got some level of psychic ability." patiently, Blitzkrieg said. "Being young, we aren't sure how strong those abilities are or exactly what they can do; psychic ability is extremely varied, from talking to ghosts to reading minds."

"Why can't your clone within the Agency get Tommy and Aura out?" asked Garth "Surely it's a risk, asking a mercenary to do it, what's Owl's agenda?"

"We don't know," said Blitzkrieg "But my clone within the Agency is well placed at the moment, as Alpha's top assassin, to gather information, breaking two prisoners out of a top security Agency prison would blow his cover, so we we're prepared to pay Owl to do it, but she has refused payment, assuring us she'd do the job for free."

"When is this rescue to take place?" I asked.

"A few days from now," said Blitzkrieg "We've given her a rendezvous point, but we think the Agency might be onto our plan, or at least part of it."

"They will most likely send some of their child soldiers after them." mussed Grace. "Does CHILD have super powered agents?"

"We have a few." nodding, Blitzkrieg admitted. "However, we need people who have dealt with the Agency and Sykes before. We need the Problem Child Gang to send a team to Europe to link up with our men at the rendezvous point." he sighed. "The Agency will send people after Tommy, Aura and Owl. Without some experienced backup behind them, my team will most likely be taken out."

Ted sighed, folding his arms. He remained silent for a while before turning to Geo who sighed as well. "Garth, piece a team together." serious, Geo said. "We'll work with CHILD to help coordinate your efforts."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: The substation.

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"We'll need someone who can lead a team in the team going to Europe," said Ted "That means either Garth or Amadeus."
"I'll go," said Garth "Blitzkrieg, who do you suggest we bring?"
"Bring Tim," said Blitzkrieg "His fight with my clone in the Agency has made him into a legend among them, I helped spread rumours of him being extremely dangerous, it'll give them pause when fighting him."
"Then we'll also need a scout, preferably one who can also get us out fast if needed," Garth continued "Either Lyssa or Cait would do here, i'd probably say Cait if her teleportation powers were more predictable, but she would still be able to read the minds of the enemy and figure out what they're up to, Lyssa would be able to scout the enemy position and get back to us in record time, perhaps giving us numbers and their organisation."
"I'll go," said Cait "There are too many variables we don't know, we need to know the powers of the Agency kids that will be sent to attack us, I can read them, see what we're up against."
"All that's left are a couple of close-combat fighters," said Garth "People who are good at fighting at close quarters."
"I could do that," I said "Nightside would be perfect for that."
"Yes," said Garth "But I was thinking Sun Warrior would be better, it was Sun Warrior who beat Blitzkrieg in the Agency, seeing her might give the Agency pause."
"I see your point," I said "So, what about Grace, if you want someone who's good at close combat fighting, what would be better than someone who can copy your moves even as you use them?"
"Good idea," said Ted, then jokingly "I should have made you team leader."
You turned red. "No, I've only known everyone a few weeks, I might know their powers, but Garth knows them as people better than I do."
"One more," said Garth, thinking deeply "Where is Travis and Megan?"
"Still on the Singularity," said Blitzkrieg "We kept them as insurance in case you refused to help us, but now that we're cooperating, they're free to go, why?"
"I'd like Travis on my team," said Garth "That's it though, if you wish, you may add one or two CHILD agents onto the team, but make sure they know that I am in command, they follow my orders, or I will send them home."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Picking the team for Europe. You are in it.

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
Garth waited until Travis, Megan and two CHILD soldiers joined them. The soldiers didn't say anything, other than that their codenames were Barrier and Sonic. I guessed that these codenames would give some indication of the powers they had. Travis and Megan separated, Travis going to sit with the away team, while Megan sat with the team playing behind. It was obvious they had been briefed on at least the part of the plan that had been decided already.
"I'm naming Tim and Grace as my joint second in command," said Garth "If I am captured, or knocked unconscious, they act together as leaders of the group."
"What's the status of Tommy, Aura and Owl?" asked Grace, of Blitzkrieg "Are we to expect them to be injured, or fighting back as they run?"
"Tommy and Aura are traumatised," said Blitzkrieg "All they'll be trying to do, is get as far away from that place as possible, Owl will fight back, but only enough to delay pursuers long enough so they can get to the safe house we told her about."
"What's the security in the safehouse?" I asked
"We maintain a watch on it twenty four hours a day, even when it's unoccupied," said Blitzkrieg "Anyone unauthorised gets within a mile, our men get alerted, they'll be to the house faster than you can blink."
"Are the Agency aware of the safe house?" asked Travis
"Not that we know of," said Blitzkrieg "And we know a lot."
"We'll have to take that chance," said Garth "Owl, Tommy and Aura are already heading for that safe house, we won't be able to get a message to them to tell them to change course, Blitzkrieg trusts this information, and as much as I hate having to work with him, we are working towards the same goal, he would not lead us astray."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: More plans

choices: I sleep for the rest of the plane journey
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
We flew out on a commercial flight. The last time I had flown as Sun Warrior's alterego, Sandra Sierra, I had used a fake passport I had drawn to look exactly like a real one. This time, the CHILD agents provided me with two passports, one for me, with a different name, and one for Sandra Sierra. I was confident that Sun Warrior's human form was very different from her costumed form, so I did not have to make any changes to her civilian form. I flew as Sun Warrior for two reasons- the first, was that it gave me anonymity when I got there, the second, was that her powers were based on the absorption of solar radiation. Therefore, the longer I stayed in Sun Warrior's form, the more radiation I would absorb, the more powerful I would be when I eventually faced the Agency. The Agency, knowing the great wealth of our family, would be expecting us to come in on a private plane or jet, so that would be what they would be watching. If they also knew of our alliance with CHILD, they would be even more sure of the fact that we would come in on a private plane. So our best course of action, to avoid detection, was to come in on a public plane, and hope the Agency wasn't watching them. I sat with Garth and Grace, talking with them about the mission.
"I don't think I'm the best choice for your second in command," I said "Why was it that you chose me, Garth?"
"You've shown a brilliant grasp of tactical thinking during your time with the Problem Child Gang," said Garth "Your horrified at the idea of killing someone, your kind of tactical thinking isn't something that can be taught to just about anyone, Grace's accelerated learning abilities would allow her to learn it in the time we have, and her analysis of the enemy movements would make her as good a tactical thinker as you."
"Why did you choose a second in command at all?" asked Grace "It's not like we're going to let any member of the team get captured or killed."
"We don't know what sort of technology the Agency has behind it," said Garth "Dr Hagen has had time to tell them everything they know about our symbiotes, he's an expert, he could probably create a device that targets symbiotes, not us, and as Dr Hagen already has a piece of my symbiote, I would have to guess that I am the likely target."
"That's why you chose me and Travis," I said "Our powers don't rely on symbiotes, so we wouldn't be affected by an attack like that."
"Yeah," said Garth "I also thought that Travis's unpredictability in combat paired with Grace's ability to predict and counter the moves of her opponents would be a good combination."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Time to leave

choices: You sleep for the rest of the plane journey
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"I want as many people to survive this as possible," said Garth "This strategy seems like the best way to do this, but if there's anything I've missed, anything I haven't thought of, I'd be happy to hear it."
"What about the recruit from Scotland?" asked Grace "Abigail, I believe."
"I'm not sure yet," said Garth "We don't know the full extent of her powers, but I was thinking she could pair with you, Tim."
"Me?" I asked "Why me?"
"Both of you have extremely variable fighting styles, I think you could both adapt to each other's styles easier than any other group, I've seen how you adapt to fight with a larger group, you, like Abigail, are near infinitely adaptable," said Garth "What you could accomplish together will be more than the Agency can stand."
"I suppose that makes sense," said Grace "What of the ones we're going to rescue, Tommy and Aura?"
"We know nothing of their powers," said Garth "Once we do, we can work out where to put them, but personally, I think they're too young and inexperienced. I am allowing Rhea Rogers against my better judgement, I won't stop anyone who wishes to join us, but I will try to protect them as best I can by placing them with two older and more experienced pairs."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: We continue to discuss tactics

choices: We land in Europe, and a CHILD officer
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
I awoke as the plane started to descend. Still in Sandra Sierra's form, it took me a few minutes to get my bearings. Grace was asleep against the window, while Garth is writing something on a piece of paper. You find some paper of your own and begin to draw, not using your powers, enjoying the challenge of drawing every detail slowly and working hard on every detail. I was drawing the most recent battle I had been witness to- the new PCG fighting against Sykes' agents as I watched from afar. When I was finished, I waited, the pictures did not move.

"What do you think?" I asked Garth, passing him the drawing.
"Very good, Tim," said Garth "You know, you'll have to show me some more of your drawings at a better time, you're really talented."
I put the drawing away, and waited for the landing.
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: You sleep for the rest of the plane journey

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
I walk into the arrivals area, to see the most cliche secret agent I've ever seen, holding up a card with the name 'Sierra'.
"Car for Sierra," said the man as the six of us walked up. I nodded, and the man led us out to an inconspicuous black people carrier.
Barrier sat in the front seat, while Sonic sat within reach of the double doors at the back.
"We heard about your fight with the Agency, Miss Sierra," said the driver "I have no idea where you came from, where you went afterwards, but we've got nothing on you."
I looked confusedly at Sonic, who mouthed 'go with it'

"I had to get out of the public eye for a while," I said "After I escaped, I needed to lay low."
I wasn't exactly lying. That was exactly the sequence of events that had happened, but it had happened to Tim, not Sandra.
"Where'd you hide?" said the driver
"America," I replied "I know a guy that can forge really good papers, the US is big enough that I can hide, keep moving, make sure nobody has enough time to put surveillance on me."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: We land in Europe, and a CHILD officer

choices: Garth sends you ahead to delay the Agency
Garth sends Cait into the mansion to prepare to extract Tommy and Aura
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
The safehouse loomed over them, and it was immediately recognisable. The safehouse had been built within the grounds of the original PCG's base. The defences that had been destroyed in the previous attack had been rebuilt and updated for the modern day.
"When the PCG were presumed dead ten years ago, we took possession of this base," said Barrier "We didn't want to let a good thing go to waste, the PCG were presumed dead when we started construction on this safehouse."
"It is good that the destruction of the Problem Child Gang can still be the salvation for your agents," I said, still playing the role of Sun Warrior. Garth and Grace said nothing, looking at the ruins of what once was the headquarters of the PCG.

As they got out of the car, two other cars, holding the rest of the gang, pulled up next to them.
"Where would you like me positioned, Garth?" I said, trying to bring Garth out of his stupor.
"What direction will Owl be coming from?" asked Garth of the three CHILD agents. The driver pointed to the east, through the ruins of the mansion. Garth turned to the others.
"Travis, Grace, you two hide in the ruins with Sonic, you three will be the first line of defence, Cait..." Garth trailed off Caitlyn was muttering under her breath, her eyes unfocused and her hand on her head. Garth walked over to her as she blinked and looked at him.
"I've received a message from Owl," said Caitlyn "They're a few miles out, but they're being pursued by a lot of agents, only two or three with powers as far as she knows, but there could be more."
"Did she know the nature of the ones with powers?" asked Garth
"She fought one who could multiply himself, as well as teleport, during their escape, but she does not know the others," said Caitlyn
"Alpha sent his top assassin to recover these two?" asked Sonic "He must really want them."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Skip to arrival at safehouse

choices: Sun Warrior's overconfidence gets the better of her (he beats me)
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"We're not ready," said Garth "We need time to set up and come up with a plan, Miss Sierra, can you delay them?"
"Of course," I said
"We'll contact you if we learn more about the Agency's super powered agents," said Garth "Try not to engage unless absolutely necessary, I'm hoping just the sight of you will send them into a panic. If you have to engage, aim for their weapons, too many people have died on their account, we shouldn't kill them unless absolutely necessary."
"Disable or delay, don't kill, got it," I replied, and began glowing as my clothes transformed into Sun Warrior's costume, with a mask to cover my eyes. I turned, and began flying towards the direction both Cait and CHILD had indicated. It didn't take me long to find what I was looking for. From above, I saw three children running, and what looked like an army chasing them. One of the three children was throwing what looked like purple bolts at the Agency, and many of them fell down, clutching their heads. They returned fire with their alien-looking guns. I flew along the front row, firing a burst of solar energy which immediately burned through the metal, causing the men holding them to drop them, then dive for cover as they exploded, one after the other. I landed on the ground, executing a series of martial arts moves I had never used with Sun Warrior before, but seemed to complement her abilities. The men in the second row turned their guns on me, but were unable to shoot without hitting one of their own. Once I had rendered many of them unconscious, I picked one up, and threw him into two of the people on the second row. He knocked them both to the ground, as I shot a beam at two of the guns, the solar radiation, once again, setting off the explosive as the men holding them threw them aside.
"Let me through," shouted a big, booming voice,as someone pushed their way from the back of the throng "It's obvious you can't do your job, you need Berzerker to finish it for you."
Then, I located the person coming towards me. He was at least six and a half feet tall, towering over the men he was pushing aside as he came to the front, pulling an axe taller than me from his back. The axe glowed with red energy, as he swung it straight for me.
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Garth sends you ahead to delay the Agency

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"Let's retreat," I said to the Sun Warrior persona that had been controlling my actions thus far "We've distracted them long enough."
"Oh, come on," said Sun Warrior, as I felt my body bend backwards as the axe missed by inches "This guy? We can take him."
"We don't even know his powers," I replied "We need to regroup and come up with a better plan of attack."
"I have a plan," said Sun Warrior "Attack."
She jumped backwards out of the giant's reach, and shot a beam of solar energy straight for him. He brought his axe up to block the beam, and the red energy around the edges increased dramatically. There was now also a red glow in his eyes.
"Thanks for the boost, Sun Warrior," he said, then bellowed as he charged towards me, his axe once again coming down, and once again, Sun Warrior dodged, but I felt the axe slightly graze my chest, and it felt like an electric charge went through my body, and I was thrown , spinning, into the circle of agents that had stopped to watch the fight. They pushed me back into the centre, as Berzerker brought his axe down again, this time connecting with Sun Warrior's form. The pain was more than I had ever experienced, and as it happened, I felt Sun Warrior's form leave me as it went back into my sketch book in my pocket. I was weak, mentally and physically drained from both the expended energy, and being separated from Sun Warrior so forcefully. Still, I slowly forced my way to my feet. No hero should die on their knees. I needed to survive to tell the story of the new Problem Child Gang, they needed me, and I needed them. Sun Warrior thought she needed nobody, and that was a mistake. I had tried to change her, to make her more restrained so she wouldn't kill again, but perhaps she was just too powerful. Her overconfidence ended up being her downfall. With the last reserves of my strength, I once again transformed into Sun Warrior, and took off, taking to the sky in less than a quarter of a second. Once above the clouds, I stopped, relaxing as the sun's rays rejuvenated me.
"Why did you save me?" asked Sun Warrior "I deserved to die, I failed, I overestimated my own abilities, there's nothing for me now."
"Every hero has a fatal flaw, Sun Warrior," I said "Without it, we would be gods. The fatal flaw is your greatest weakness, but by being aware of it, you can turn it into a strength."
"How do I do that?" said Sun Warrior, this time aloud.
"That, you'll have to discover for yourself," I replied "But right now, Garth needs our help, the Problem Child Gang needs our help."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Sun Warrior's overconfidence gets the bette...

1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
You flew back to the house and briefed Garth on what you had seen, and what had happened.
"I need you to rest, Sandra," said Garth "Be ready for when they get here."
"I shall, Garth," said Sun Warrior, her costume fading back into her civilian clothing as she walked into the reinforced building that had been built as CHILD's safe-house.

Using the time to meditate, soaking in the solar radiation as you did, and conversing with Sun Warrior's consciousness, reassuring her of her ability in the coming battle, and discussing tactics. Every few hours, you would get up and talk with Garth, giving him all the details you could remember about the army that was coming towards you. It was almost noon the following day, when they saw the three figures on the horizon.
"It's them," said Garth "Sandra, can you get above the clouds and attack from that angle? It's an angle they'll be expecting, don't attack until we've attacked. Attack them from behind, see if you can call out tactics from what you see from above."
Sun Warrior's costume reappeared on you as you flew into the air, you saw the large mass of Agency goons split into smaller squads of eleven men apiece. One squad had the giant Berzerker in it.
"Garth, they're splitting off, five squads of ten men, they're fanning out, I believe there's a single powered person per squad,"
"We've got a plan, attack on my signal," said Garth "You'll know what to do."
You watched as the three runners crossed the borders of the safehouse and reached the house itself. As soon as the Agency squads crossed the threshold, you could vaguely make out several hundred turrets come out of the ground and begin firing at the Agency, cutting through most of the goons, leaving very few remaining, but one of the remaining started multiplying itself, and another began firing energy blasts.

"Now would be a good time, Sun Warrior," said Garth as you heard him yell. You flew down towards the five apparently superpowered agents, the rest of the Agency having either vanished, or were unconscious. You recognised the teenage version of Blitzkrieg. You went towards one of the guys that were staring down Travis, in a wolf anthro form. You felt a presence enter your mind, and a voice, but you can't make out the words, as you felt your hand slowly move towards Travis.
"Tim, snap out of it!" Sun Warrior's voice pulled you out of the stupor. You realised that another mind was attempting to control your mind. You moved your hand back to focus on the black-suited agent and fired. He jumped out of the way as you landed in-front of the agent. I immediately recognised the man named Jon, the one that had tried to take me into the agency at the beginning of all this.
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Returning to the safe house

choices: Tell them what Amazona had told you
Say you need to get back to the SUB station
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"Your powers have grown, Sun Warrior," said Jon "Or should I say, Tim."
I was shocked to see a pad and pen appear in his hand, and papers fly onto him, he became the hero I had not yet named, the master of both fire and ice.
"You already know who I am," I said "And I don't need to hide behind my characters to defeat you."
I returned Sun Warrior to my own sketchbook, becoming not the costumed form I had shown to Sykes, but my own form.
"Are you going to hide behind other's powers, Jon?" I asked. Jon didn't seem to be listening. A dagger of ice forming in his hand, he charged directly at me, throwing fire from his other hand. I dodged the fireballs coming at me, and then caught the ice dagger by the blade in my right hand, wrenching it from Jon. With the dagger, came the rest of the form, coalescing around me instead.
"What other tricks have you got?" I asked, my voice overlapping with the unnamed hero I was now.
"Your powers are formidable, Tim," said Jon "But it will be your overconfidence that will be your downfall. Pick up brass!"

The five combatants from the Agency vanished. My form faded back into Sun Warrior's alter-ego.
The Problem Child Gang, the CHILD agents and the psychic mercenary, Owl converged.
"Where's Tommy and Aura Winters?" asked Garth
"I'm sorry," said Owl "They're gone. When the Agency teleported away, they just vanished."
Garth angrily punched the ground in frustration, then winced slightly, as his punch did very little damage, and a nasty bruise was starting to appear on his hand.
I dropped Sun Warrior's form, and ran over to Garth: "You cannot blame yourself," I said "None of us saw this coming, not even Cait."
"Something was shielding the minds of the five we were fighting," said Cait "A presence I was unfamiliar with."
"That was most likely Jon," said Owl "His powers are psychic in nature, he is able to copy the powers of whoever he fights against, as well as read minds."
"They played us," said Grace "This whole thing was to figure out our strengths and weaknesses. We need an edge, something The Agency isn't expecting."
I looked around at the others "How about an army of super-powered soldiers of our own?"
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: You beat Jon

choices: Split up and cover both ideas
Garth chooses one or the other
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"What do you mean, Tim?" asked Grace, curiously "We've got CHILD and the Problem Child Gang, who else is there?"
"My way into the Agency may still be open to us," said Owl "I may be able to get back in. If you guys have a teleporters, we could get them out once we get in."
"I talked with one of my characters, Amazona," you said "She claims there is a font of power in the Amazonian lands, which could allow me to bring my characters to life without having to use me as a vessel. If it's true, we could have some trained people to help us out."
"You want us to go to the Amazon, based on something a fictional character told you?" asked Owl "You do know how insane that sounds, don't you?"
"More insane than breaking into the Agency when they know we're coming?" you sniped at Owl, a little hurt at her dismissal of your idea.
"Watch your tone, kid," Owl warned "I've got three years as an assassin under my belt, and twenty three successful missions. You'd just be a number to me."
"That's enough!" said Garth. You stopped immediately, while Owl glared at Garth "We can't squander either of these opportunities. We're seriously outnumbered in this, it's essentially become a war at this point, and we need soldiers. At the same time, we can't abandon Tommy and Aura, which leaves one option:"
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Tell them what Amazona had told you

choices: We get back. Beth has returned with Abigail.
We get back. Beth hasn’t returned with Abigail.
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
“We’ll have to split up,” said Garth “Tim, take Cait and Travis and head back to the SUB station and update Amadeus. If Beth has returned with Abigail, take them along with you to the Amazon. If not, just update Amadeus on the situation, then head on to the Amazon.”
I nodded, and Cait and Travis walked with me to the car, along with the CHILD agent that has been driving. As I left, Garth, Barrier and Sonic began questioning Owl about the facility they had come from.

This time, we took a private plane back to Waterfront City, to save time. I spent the short flight conversing with Amazona about the place we would be going after returning to the home team.

As it turned out, this place was not in the Amazonian Rainforest, but on a small island on the edge of the Bermuda Triangle. Amazona explained that the large amount of tropical storms in the area were, in-fact, a test of bravery. Those that were worthy to pass through the storms would not be hampered by them. I linked my mind with Caitlyn to fill her in, who in-turn passed on the information to Travis. By unspoken agreement, we knew we would not be bringing any CHILD agents with us on this mission. The power Amazona described in the wrong hands could be devastating.
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Split up and cover both ideas

choices: Fly on towards where the Agency came from
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.content:
"We can still delay them more," said Sun Warrior, her tone determined "We just need to stay away from that guy."
"I almost died last time," you said "If we do this, you have to control yourself, no matter what he says. I'm agreeing to this because I want to see if we can draw out some of the other powered Agency members. We need to gather as much intel as possible. How fast can you fly?"
"Let's find out," said Sun Warrior aloud, immediately realising what you wanted to do. You flew below the clouds, your thoughts once again becoming one with Sun Warrior. You flew around the Agency goons, too fast for them to shoot at you, moving faster and faster, until you were a yellow blur. Suddenly, you heard a commanding voice ring out in your head. "Stop!" And for a moment, you almost did. You almost stopped, to hover in the air, and remain there forever, but then, the compulsion was driven out of you by Sun Warrior and some of the other characters in your head. You heard a shot ring out, and rose up a few feet to avoid it, only then realising that the command had gotten you to slow down enough that someone could take a shot at you.
"They have a psychic," said Sun Warrior "His compulsions were powerful. We would have been sitting ducks if that had worked."
"Can you work out where it came from?" I asked "If we can take him out, he won't be able to compel the Problem Child Gang later. But I'm sure I've heard his voice before..."
"You have heard my voice before, Tim," said the same voice, but this time you felt no compulsion "Don't you remember?"
"He's trying to distract you, TIm," said Sun Warrior "Don't let him, shut him out."
You resisted the oncoming flashback, that had shown the window of the orphanage you had grown up in, and focused back into your bond with Sun Warrior. You both continued attacking the Agency's guns, although you were so distracted, you kept missing, merely singeing the clothes of the Agency members and causing minor burns.
"Your heads not in this, Tim," said Sun Warrior "We should head back."
1553322222111121111211211121121211111121.title: Keep harrying the Agency

choices: "What are you doing in my room?"
"Who is that? She looks familiar." as the person looks over your shoulder
1553322222111121111212.content:
The girl was strikingly beautiful, wearing strange clothing that didn't seem like it belonged in any time period. She wore what appeared to be armour over her clothing, and had a belt with various weapons that seemed as if they were straight out of a sci-fi movie. The strangest thing about her, though, was that Ted's eyes completely passed over where she stood, as if she wasn't there at-all.
"If everything else wasn't strange enough," you said, as soon as Ted was out of earshot "Now I'm seeing ghosts."
"I'm not a ghost," said the girl, her voice barely more than a whisper, as if coming from far away "Or at least, not in the conventional sense. Ghosts form from the soul echoes of those long passed, which linger for a time after, I am more like an omen of what is to come. The enemies of the Problem Child Gang come to the Waterfront. They must be prepared."
I was about to ask what she meant by that, when the girl dissolved into nothingness, and I questioned if she had even been there at-all. I shook my head, and opened the fridge, grabbing a bottle of water, I went off to look at the offices that Ted had told me had been set up for the Problem Child Gang to use when they needed to go underground. Finding one with a bed in it, I entered, sat down and took out my pad, beginning to draw what I had seen. So focused was I on what I was doing, I didn't realise someone was standing in the doorway, until I heard a voice say:
1553322222111121111212.title: A girl my age.

choices: Tell her the truth about what you saw
Accept her offer to help you train
15533222221111211112122.content:
As an artist, you were good at spotting details in things. While the girl that was standing in the doorway looked similar to the future echo you had just met, you noticed her hair was a slightly different shade, and her eyes were green, while the other girl had had blue eyes. You turned the pad to the girl
"I don't know who this is," you said, electing not to tell her what you had seen "Was just sketching out some ideas for a comic I'm planning on writing."
"You write comics?" asked the girl, sitting down on the bed next to you "Oh wait, I know who you are. Madame Vague told me about you. Tim, right?"
"Chief Jones told me about Madame Vague, you said "He said she was going to be training me."
"Wait, are you a witch too?" asked the girl, looking you up and down as if sizing you up.
"Not quite," you replied "Wait, witches? Magic is real?"
"Of course," said the girl "Wait, didn't you know? There's a whole coven of witches living here right now."
"I didn't know," you said "But in all honesty, not the strangest thing that's happened to me in the past week."
"Tell me more," said the girl.
You turned to another page, and began drawing quickly, your hand moving over the page in a blur. Once you were done, a small bird had been drawn on the page. You carefully dragged it off the page and let it sit in the palm of your hand. The bird began singing.
The girl stared in amazement, and reached out her hand: "May I?"
You held the bird out to her, and she gently took it. She muttered a string of latin words, and her look of amazement turned to puzzlement.
"I don't understand," she said "This thing is alive, but it can't be. It didn't exist a few seconds ago."
"I don't understand this power much, either," you said "That's why I'm here. To train it and understand it."
"My name is Alice, by the way," said the girl "If you're here to train, why don't you let me help you?"
15533222221111211112122.title: "Who is that? She looks familiar." as t...

choices: You wake up to see Alice sitting next to you
You wake up on your bed, alone.
155332222211112111121222.content:
You followed her to an open area, where any attacks you might make won't destroy anything important. Still, Alice began drawing in the sand that this area had become, drawing various unfamiliar symbols and muttering more latin words. The glyphs began glowing.
"These glyphs should keep powers contained so we don't damage anything," said Alice "Show me what you can do."
You once again opened your pad, this time turning to the new hero you had been working on on the plane. He was a master of energy, able to absorb, redirect or deflect any energy that may come at him. You dragged it off the page, and onto you, and walked into the circle. Alice began to speak in latin, her hands lighting up as she flung balls of light at you. You instinctively dodged alot of the balls, and they dissipated harmlessly against the walls of the magic circle. You charged at Alice, the next volley hitting you head on and being absorbed. You brought up your own hand, and opened it, forming an identical ball and throwing it back at Alice. She dodged to the side, and began running to the side,throwing more balls as she did. You simply batted these balls aside, as she stopped, changing the words she was speaking. This time, her eyes glowed purple, and you felt a sudden wave of drowsiness come over you. You dropped to one knee, before shaking it off, and standing back up. You charged towards where you thought Alice was, but moved right through what you had thought was her, and hit the wall of force keeping you in. Looking around, you saw that the circle was empty. Standing there, you felt something barrel into your side, knocking you flat on your back. The weight on top of you manifested itself into Alice, her eyes now glowing with a pink light, and suddenly, there were two more of her, each of them holding down a different part of him, but they all felt real. Their weight holding him down all felt real. He yelled out incoherently, and energy was expelled from every point of his body, throwing all three Alice's off of him, just as he fell, unconscious.
155332222211112111121222.title: Accept her offer to help you train

choices: As the sun hits you, Sun Warriors healing factor kicks in
You collapse before you can get out
1553322222111121111212221.content:
"Don't try to get up," said Alice "I think you may have burned yourself out there."
You opened your eyes, seeing nothing but a blur of colour, and feeling a sharp pain in your head, you closed them again.
"I wondered why my blows had such little effect," Alice said "The energy you absorbed had to go somewhere. It went into your normal form."
You tried to speak, but could barely manage a whisper.
"Don't worry, I'm going to look after you. This is partially my fault," she said.
You reached beside you for your pad.
"Hey, what are you doing?! You know what that did to you last time!" Said Alice, moving her hand as if to stop you. You made eye contact with her, and she stopped. You picked up the pad, the pages flipping to Sun Warrior. Pulling her image onto yourself, you pulled yourself up.
"Help me outside," you said in Sub Warriors voice. Not knowing what you were trying to do, Alice supported you to the door to the outside. Opening it for you, she helped you outside.
1553322222111121111212221.title: You wake up to see Alice sitting next to you

choices: Alice jumped up to give me a kiss on the cheek, and thanks me for my kindness
The two of us go back inside
15533222221111211112122211.content:
I sighed as the solar energy soaked into Sun Warrior's form. I felt the energy being converted into healing energy. After a few moments, I wasable to stand on my own without Alice's help.

"I think I'm ok now," I said
"I'm sorry I hurt you," said Alice, not meeting Sun Warrior's eyes "Maybe I shouldn't be training you."
I turned her head to face me.
"This isn't your fault," I said, kindly "Neither of us knew that was going to happen. Better to find it out now instead of in battle."
As before, I tried to drag Sun Warrior's form off of me, but it wouldn't budge.
"What's going on, this usually works?" I said, a little confused.
As I asked, I heard Sun Warrior's voice in my head.
"You are still healing, Tim," she said "I apologize if this hampers you and your girlfriend, but I must ensure you are healed properly."
I nodded, blushing heavily. I liked Sun Warrior's new personality, but she tended to like teasing me.
"I could go and ask Madame Vague," said Alice, unaware of what Sun Warrior's voice had said.
"It's alright," I said "According to Sun Warrior, her powers are still healing me."
"I'm sorry that's necessary," said Alice, looking down
I put my arms around Alice in a hug. I was taller than her now, and hugging someone as a female was very different than as a male.
"Please don't blame yourself for something that wasn't your fault," I said
15533222221111211112122211.title: As the sun hits you, Sun Warriors healing facto...

1553322222112.content:
A woman in her thirties, dressed conservatively and with her hair in a bun, opened the door to my room and stepped in. "Kiss kiss, my dear," she said.

"Huh?" That seemed like an odd thing for a grown woman to say to a teenaged boy.

She paused, as if puzzled by my puzzlement, then said, "The sun is shining through the southern windows."

I shook my head. "What are you talking about?"

"Haven't you been... ?" She checked her clipboard. "Excuse me. Don't mind me." With that, she left the room, leaving me to figure out what had just happened.

It didn't take me long. The EMARI had missed it, but I had another power all my own, a power I called intuitive reasoning. What that meant was that I could make accurate deductions based on insufficient data. Call me a good guesser, if you like.

At any rate, it was obvious to me that the woman thought that I'd been brainwashed, and one of those peculiar phrases was supposed to be my trigger. "I'll bet Jon is bringing whatever they need to brainwash me."

As if on cue, Jon came back into the room. "Your EMARI went well," he said, producing a cup of liquid. "I'll just need you to-"

I didn't let him finish, instead kicking him square in the jaw. I ran to the window, thinking I could make my escape that way, but it was locked from outside. "Guess I'll have to make my escape the hard way."

I got out of the room and down the hall okay. Once I got downstairs, though, I ran into...
1553322222112.title: You are warned about the brainwashing.

15533222221121.content:
I got out of the room and down the hall okay. Once I got downstairs, though, I ran into guards with stun guns. I did not know how I knew they were stun guns but I had no time to dwell upon it as the first man fired his weapon in my direction. There was no time to think, I jumped out of the way and saw the small dart embed itself into the wall near my ear.

"How am I going to get out of this one?" trying not to panic, I asked myself.

*Let me help.* came a whispered response. the voice came from my pocket sketch book. I pulled it out and the pages turned themselves to reveal a man in his late teens with black hair, hazel eyes, and a stone chiseled face. He wearing a black suit and a long black jacket, all the markings of a dark hero. "No time to explain, just trust me."

Not having any ideas at the time, I took my pen and dragged the image off of the page and placed it against myself. In an instant, I had become the man I had dubbed Da-unus, Latin for 'the one.' He had one simple but powerful ability, he had the power to defy the laws of physics. "Lets make one thing clear," hearing the men cautiously approach, I whispered, "I am in charge."

*You act, I will guide your movements.* came Da-unus' voice in my head.

With a nod, I drew two stun laser guns on a clean sheet of paper with incredible speed then dragged it off the paper, causing it to become real in my hands. I then placed the pad of paper into my pocket and ran out with the weapons at the ready. I was amazed by how quickly I was able to move, dodging every last dart that was fired in my direction as I fired one laser shot after another, hitting each men in turn. Of course, it took more than one shot for each person, I would have considered myself a fool to think it was going to be easy.

Still, I could see every dart move as it they were in slow motion, making it easy to dodge them as I fired back against my attackers. I could hear an alarm sounding, Jon or one of the guards must have triggered it to announce that a prisoner was trying to escape. *We have to finish this now, Tim.* warning me, Da-unus said. *We will be overrun in seconds unless we can reach the elevators.*

"Then let's finish this." knotting my jaws, I whispered.

Moving with speed and skill I would not have without Da-unus, I almost literally danced between the flying darts and took out the last of the guards before running for the elevators on the far side of the large room. I saw other guards approaching but I had no time to engage them. I instead found myself grabbing two of the guards. Da-unus was guiding my movements but I did not see how I could lift one man, let alone two. Only, to my surprise, the two men seemed weightless as I easily lifted them by the belts and used them as shields from the flying darts.

"Of course, Da-unus can defy the laws of physics." amazed, I thought. "He made the men weightless the second I grabbed them... weightless to me but not to anyone else."

Upon reaching the elevators, I threw the two men at the advancing guards and hit the surface button on the elevator, hoping I will reach the surface before they can cut the power, halting my escape...
15533222221121.title: Enter Da-unus. (The one)

155332222211211.content:
Just before reaching the surface, I felt as if water was running down off of me and looked down to find that the character, Da-unus had returned to its original ink form and was returning to the page in my sketch book. At the same time, I felt my strength quickly leaving me. My knees shook then buckled and I slumped down onto them, barely able to move! This was not good as I knew that my captors were certain to give chase at any moment.

"What's happening to me?" frightened and confused, I whispered. "Why do I feel so weak?"

Then it occurred to me that using Da-unus must have sapped my strength as his life force, his powers, had to be fueled by something and that had to have been my own reserves. I began to feel desperate as the elevator came stop and the doors opened. Fortunately, there was no one to be seen... yet. I weakly forced myself to stand before stumbling out of the elevator to find myself in what looked like a low office building with people walking back and forth. Some had children with them, making me feel sorry for them as I had a good idea what might become of them.

"I have to get out of here, tell someone what is going on here." staggering forward, I thought. "Only who would believe me, how deep does this Agency go?"

I began to sweat, seeing a number of guards walking in my direction and gave a desperate glace at the main entrance. Even though I was near the point of complete exhaustion, I had to get out of the building and find a place to hide until I could at least catch my breath. I could feel my knees, my whole body shaking from sheer exhaustion as I began to walk unsteadily towards freedom. The guards, I noticed, were fingering their stun guns as they came closer and I felt myself beginning to cry. My chances of escaping seemed very slim. Then, just as I was certain I was about to be grabbed by the first guard, someone grabbed me from another angle and I found myself in an alley somewhere outside.

"What the hell!?!" hoarsely, I asked.

I was quickly turned to face a tall boy, around the age of fifteen, with short blond hair and blue eyes, wearing a black business suit and gloves. There was something about the boy's glare that made me feel very much afraid. "I have just given you a chance, kid." in a grave serious tone, he hissed. "I suggest you get as far away from here as you can and try to lead a normal life."

"What about you?" weakly, I asked. "Aren't you a prisoner of those... people too?"

"It's too late for me, kid." almost sadly, the boy replied. "All I can do is fight them the best I can from the inside until I am caught... and killed."

The boy began to walk away but paused as I called out, "Can you at least tell me your name?"

"I don't have a birth name, not anymore." softly, the boy replied. "They call me Blitzkrieg, its German for 'lightning warfare' so I guess you can call me Blitz for short." after a thought, he added, "I suggest you keep better track of your reserves in the future. You won't stay free or alive for long if you push yourself into exhaustion."

With that, he vanished completely, leaving me wondering what to do.
155332222211211.title: Power at a price.

info.brief_description: I start to develop a strange power, what will I do?
info.description:
In the original version of Problem Child Gang, I created a team of four kids, trying to find their missing parents. It did not work out so I am trying a new angle. Here it is.

Please note: Changes have been made.

THE RULES...

1. Do not kill the main character.

2. All chapters are to be written in first person. (I, me, myself, I'm, etc.) This makes you the main character.

3. New characters are welcome but I ask you to keep this an original story, avoid using already made up characters (unless if being used in reference ie: he's as strong as Superman(c).

4. Love scenes are allowed but only in general terms... remember the rating +13.

5. The power of the main character you choose must start out weak then grow with new powers surfacing if needed. (No instant super heroes, the character you choose must work up to that over time and practice.)

6. The character you choose must keep their power a secret or be very careful who he or she shares the secret with. In this story, super powered people (super heroes or villains) do not exist. The main character is the first to surface.

7. The power(s) you chose for your character must be tasteful and believable.

If you have any questions, feel free to email me and ask, I am a reasonable person.

HERE ARE A FEW CHARACTERS YOU MAY CHOOSE FROM...

You are either...

1. Clem Rodgers.

2. Garth Jones.

3. Megan Connors.

4. Susan Tanner.

5. Caitlin Spencer.

6. Alyssa Vance.

Other characters are available; look through to see who you would like to follow. You may add new characters if you wish.


Important note:

In one thread of several of these characters, we are following one single plot. Twenty years ago, a small group of teenagers, each with unique skills or gifts, formed what they called the Problem Child Gang. This group, with other members adding to their numbers, worked to fight crime in Waterfront City like many a super team in the comic books they had read. Sadly, the entire group was nearly killed on their last mission, forcing them to give up crime fighting. Now, twenty years later, the original members of the group have kids of their own and they are developing powerful gifts of his own, making them fear a repeat of history. The parents reveal their past and try to detour their children from repeating their mistakes but fate forces them to allow the Problem Child Gang to rise again.

This story was inspired by Stan Lee whose characters are legends in the super hero universe.
Rest in peace, Stan Lee. Know that your legacy carries on. Excelsior!
